Hi! I'm a California letterpress printer who has made the letterpress printed zine Ker-bloom! every other month since 1996, as well as the driving force behind the Letterpress Print of the Month Club.Due to a gluttony of listening to Sigur Rí_s, I have become a tiny bit obsessed with Iceland and its only native mammal, the arctic fox. As part of my Print of the Month Club, I recently made a three-color print of the arctic fox with its Icelandic name "melrakki" beside it from handset metal type.When Kickstarter announced the revival of its Make 100 campaign, I accepted the challenge to do a larger edition of the melrakki print with a slightly different color combination. The layout and illustration will be the same, but I would like to substitute a pewter color ink for the black, and use blue for the name and horizon line instead of gold.I am offering the global Kickstarter community the opportunity to get one of these limited edition letterpress prints, along with some other add-on rewards, such as letterpress zines and business cards.

We believe that opportunities are everywhere, and that new discoveries are endless. We want to inspire a love of learning through this artbook, and that is reflected in our theme: Exploration and Discovery. Infinite is a collective effort by amazing artists who brought to life the most memorable breakthroughs in human history!At Infinite, we have decided to dream big, and get back to the belief that anything is possible. We want to help as many students as possible reach their full potential, and we believe that a library offers an irreplaceable opportunity for youth to learn, study, and become inspired. All proceeds of the campaign will go towardsŒæsupporting a library in rural China and individual students in financial need through the help of the Overseas China Education Foundation (OCEF).ŒæHelp us fuel the potential of future generations through artwork and community!ŒæLife is full of infinite possibilities. Letäó»s make this one a reality. Infinite is an 8.5äó x 11äó, full color, softcover book. Itäó»s jam-packed with over 70 pages of illustrations and progress shots from 28 artists, each surrounding the themes of exploration and discovery. The physical artbook contains walk-throughs on the creation process and philosophy behind each artwork.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæFeatured artworks:Œæ _»_« (Escente)Œæ|Œæchibionpu | ameriya | sugarmints | Ein Lee | _ì±Œæ(retrozero) | Erisiar | Caitlin Ono | eireisa | Faelicia |ŒæGeneva B | Naomame | Guava-Pie | rainyoo | ederilyThis project is brought to you by all of the amazing artists that contributed towards this artbook. A huge thank-you to Kyte Spence, who put in their time and effortŒæ in editing our video for us. Also, a special shout-out to Nyanfood and Weiwei Xu for their tremendous support during the preparation of this artbook! <3How else can you help?ŒæŒæ

"West African black rhinoceros is a subspecies of the black rhinoceros, declared extinct by the IUCN in 2011. It was once widespread in the savanna of sub-Saharan Africa, but its numbers declined due to poaching. The western black rhinoceros resided primarily in Cameroon, but surveys since 2006 have failed to locate any individuals.Œæ" WIKIPEDIA"Steller's sea cowŒæis an extinct sirenian discovered by Europeans in 1741. At that time, it was found only around the Commander Islands in the Bering Sea between Alaska and Russia; its range was more extensive during the Pleistocene epoch, and it is possible that the animal and humans previously interacted. Eighteenth century adults would reach weights of 8äóñ10 metric tons (8.8äóñ11.0 short tons) and lengths up to 9 meters (30 ft).Œæ" WIKIPEDIAŒæ"The imperial woodpeckerŒæis a species of bird, a member of the woodpecker family Picidae. If it is not extinct, it is the world's largest woodpecker species, at 56äóñ60 cm (22äóñ23.5 in) long. The large and conspicuous bird has long been known to the native inhabitants of Mexico."WIKIPEDIA"The baijiŒæis a functionally extinct species of freshwater dolphin formerly found only in the Yangtze River in China. Nicknamed "Goddess of the Yangtze" in China, the dolphin is also called Chinese river dolphin. It was regarded as the goddess of protection by local fishermen and boatmen in China." WIKIPEDIAQuagga (/škwÄïxÄï/ or /škwí_ÄçÄ»/) is an extinct subspecies of plains zebra that lived in South Africa until the 19th century. It was long thought to be a distinct species, but genetic studies have shown it to be the southernmost subspecies of plains zebra. Its name was derived from its call, which sounded like "kwa-ha-ha". WIKIPIDEAŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæupdate Jan.08.2018"The Carolina parakeetŒæor Carolina conure was a small green neotropical parrot with a yellow head, reddish orange face and pale beak native to the eastern, midwest and plains states of the United States and was the only indigenous parrot within its range, as well as one of only two parrots native to the United States (the other being the thick-billed parrot). It was found from southern New York and Wisconsin to Kentucky, Tennessee and the Gulf of Mexico, from the Atlantic seaboard to as far west as eastern Colorado. The last known specimen perished in captivity at the Cincinnati Zoo in 1918[4] and the species was declared extinct in 1939." WEKIPEDIAŒæBy making watercolor painting of extinct animal, I aim to remind people of what have been lost and possibly to rescues currently endanger wildlife. So far, I have made five watercolor paintings. I would love to do more artworks of extinct/endanger animals from backersäó» recommendation. Each artwork is limited to 100 copies of postcard/print.ŒæRewards & DeliveryŒæ1, Two/Four/Six Postcard: Staring from $6 for two postcards. Included free shipping ŒæSize 4äó x 6äó postcard of your chosen animalŒæTradition shipping method using special US animal stamps and protective bubble envelopeŒæ ŒæŒæŒæŒæ2, One/two/three Prints: Staring from $12 for one print. Included free shippingŒæ ŒæSize 8 x 10äó high quality print of your chosen animal(USING HIGH RESOLUTION SCAN VERSION)Tradition shipping method using special US animal stamps and protective bubble envelopeŒæŒæŒæSaving endanger wildlifeŒæA minor action can have a major impact when we all work together. Please help us to spread the words if you like our concept. Click the icon buttons on the upper right side to share this project on the social media. ŒæMajority of raised fund will go toward to printing/shipping/supplies. Extra profits (if any) will be used to rescues the endanger wildlife. Thank you!Œæ ŒæŒæŒæŒæ

#Make100ŒæŒæŒæŒæ Birds YOU will Never SeeTheŒæ project is simple... I guess.ŒæŒæ These are paintings of birds you and your family..and future family will never get a chance to see again.... Œæ A lot of reasons can attribute to their extinction.Œæ This project is more to remind folks of these lost feather friends as well as to honor them.Œæ Also to remind use humans how fragile the environment really is... I hope you will enjoy each of these little guys and girls...and yes they have hats!6 DAYS LEFT!!Œæ If we reachŒæ theŒæ $10K mark I will be sending you Birds you Will Never See AgainŒæ Note Cards (check the project updates for details)YES!!Œæ I reached 50.. 1/2 there.Œæ So a NEW REWARD!!ŒæPlease READ MY 2/6/2018 UPDATED to see how each on of these are made and painted!!Œæ Thanks you for the support and all the kinds words!! ŒæŒæJUST ADDED..We reached 25 of 100 Birds You Will Never See Again! Œæ Thank you to everyone for their kind words and support of 100 Birds.Œæ 2 NEW Rewards for the MARTHA and NED set.ŒæOriginal PaintingsŒæThese little mini paintings will be 2.5" x 3.5"Œæ.Œæ All are drawing with ink and painted with watercolor on 140lb paper.Œæ PrintsPrintsŒæ are also 2.5" x 3.5" printed on a heavy matte finish smooth photo paper with archival inks.Thanks for visiting!!ŒæTake a scroll down to see the progress!Œæ Or check my updates for the latest paintings.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

Hello.Œæ My name is David Aronson and I am a professional illustrator, painter and graphic artist.Œæ My inspiration for the Bible of the Sacred Clowns came from an interview with Robert Crumb about his version of the Old Testament.Œæ (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Crumb) He claimed that he didn't want to bring any of his own perverse idiosyncrasies to the work, preferring to make it a straight illustration job.Œæ I thought to myself, how sad.Œæ I would love to see a Crumb Bible interpreted with all his weird psycho-sexual obsessions.Œæ I decided I would do my own version of the Old Testament and make it as strange and subversive and sexual and magickal as I wanted to.Œæ The project will not be a true to the text illustration job, but rather a jumping off point for powerful and surreal images based on the elements of the Old Testament. If you want to see my work, go to my website:Œæ www.alchemicalwedding.com . I'm here on kickstarter because I need money to live on while I work on the project.Œæ I'm offering signed prints as rewards for contributors.Œæ ŒæI hope you can help me out.ThanksDavid Aronson

Hi! I'm a fantasy artist and illustrator who loves dragons, nature, the stars and fantastical magical things!I've been creating art since I was very young, and dragons have always held a special place in my heart. I grew up in Montana under the "Big Sky" as it's called, and I vividly remember going outside on dark nights where the stars could be seen so clearly. I always felt a special connection to the stars and moon, so what better way to combine three of the things I hold dear than to create this beautiful enamel pin!~ I am excited to bring this project to Kickstarter with the help of the Make 100 event ~ŒæI chose a high-quality style of pin called cloisonní©. The creation process uses glass resins that give the pin a hard, glossy and impressive surface finish. The moon will be filled using a white-yellowish resin that will glow in the dark once charged in light. This makes a lovely statement and collectors piece.ŒæŒæŒæ~~ Check out the official online shop for other merch @ Kamakru Art~~ Follow me on Social Media ~~ŒæTwitter | Instagram | FacebookInternational backers, please note: I'm sorry that international shipping is higher, but unfortunately these are the rates set by USPS. I am not responsible for any customs, duties or other fees that may be added to the package (these are set by the countries they are shipped in to).

Hi Kickstarter, my name's Kayhan. I'm an origami artist and I'm the designer of the Origami Roast Turkey you see above. I designed this model in 2012 and nowŒæI'm making prints of the Origami Roast Turkey instructions on traditional handmade Japanese paper (11x17"),Œæso that you can get a beautiful poster and fold your very own Origami Roast Turkey.There are two types of prints that will be available as rewards: Digital prints and Screen Prints.Digital PrintsThe digital prints will be laser printed on a sublime Kuzuki Kozo White paper. It's handmade in Japan. If you look closely you can see every imperfection and fibre.ŒæScreen PrintsŒæScreen Printing is a process where you transfer ink through a stencil-like mesh. It's incredibly versatile and can be used to create sharp and bold images.ŒæThe screen prints are part of a limited edition set, of which only 100 will be produced. They will be signed and numbered. I'm currently looking for the best paper to print on and will probably settle on a thick fibrous Kozo paper. The screen print will be similar to the digital print, except that the colours will pop a bit more and the paper will feel heavier.Once the campaign is over I'll finalize the paper, make the prints and send them to you! Both the digital and screen prints make great posters or wall hangings.ŒæThey'll be 11x17" in size. If you've never interacted with traditional handmade paper before you're in for a treat. It's in a class of its own.You can if you want to! The prints are instructions as well as artwork. Both printsŒæcome with two sheets ofŒæhigh quality 10x10" origami paper and an instructional video, where I walk you through all the steps as well as give you tips on folding.ŒæIt doesn't matter if you've never made any origami before. I've had a lot of success teaching this model to people of all ages and skill levels. You are going to be able to fold this, and you'll be extremely satisfied when you're holding your very own Origami Roast Turkey! Here's what the whole process looks like (don't be intimidated):Thanks for reading this far! I hope you back the project and start your journey towards folding your very own Origami Roast Turkey!Œæ

ŒæŒæ Œæ ŒæHello There! I'm Heather R. Hitchman, a fantasy and fairy tale illustrator, writer, and world builder. My passion is building my paranormal fairy tale world of "Terratoff", and all of the characters within it.Œæ Œæ ŒæI am known for creating small character illustrations of the fantasy creatures that live in Terratoff, and writing little short stories that go along with them! This is my first Kickstarter to bring my project to a larger scale and audience.This time I went BIG with my laegest painting, ever! A 10x14 inch watercolor, goauche, and ink painting on cold press Arches watercolor paper.ŒæI am kickstarting both Limited Edition and First Edition prints &Story Scrolls ofŒæ "The Dreaming Kitsune".You can view more of my work on my Website, follow me on Instagram, and learn more about Terratoff on Patreon.ŒæPledge $5ŒæPledge $25ŒæPledge $30ŒæPledge $150ŒæPledge $250ŒæPledge $800ŒæAdd OnsŒæSimply add $5 more to your pledge to add on the downloadable pack!ŒæNow that the initial funding goal has been reached, it's time for stretch goals! As funding goes up, new rewards unlock. These will be added to every mail in order for free as they unlock! Spread the word so more people will see and back "The Dreaming Kitsune", each pledge brings us one step closer to unlocking stretch goals!ŒæŒæŒæA Note on Shipping: While I try to keep shipping costs as low as possible, I have no control over the postal rates. International prices have gone up considerably each year for the last few years. International customers should consider the customs fees and mail holding costs set by their individual countries. It will not be possible to mark packages as anything other than merchandise.

Kickstarting a limited edition /make100 golden version of the "don't complain, suggest what's better" sticker which has been super popular in local communities. Additionally, three Belgian artists will create an illustration based on the quote - which will be produced as artprints and digital wallpapers. We're also offering the possibility to order a stack of 'original' stickers.It all started when I read a tweet by @moleitau, which stated "don't complain, suggest what's better". As time went by, I kept on revisiting this quote as it is so relevant in our current society. People are super good at complaining and nagging and do not automatically make the switch to suggesting, exploring or contributing to a possible solution.In 2017 I finally turned this quote into a sticker. I spread the sticker through a Belgian makerspace, and my friend Anthony has been promoting it heavily in the local community.The popularity of this first print run got me into launching it as a crowdfunding campaign. At its core, this campaign gets you a pack of 15 'original' stickers - I've seen a lot of them on laptops or smartphones. Both ideal devices to bring into company meetings and silently spread the message.We could have run a crowdfunding campaign to just get some more prints done of the existing design. But the Kickstarter /Make100 seemed like a nice opportunity to go further!This is huge! We're doing a super limited run of screenprinted stickers with black ink on shiny gold vinyl. There will only be 100 packs of 5 gold stickers made available ... ever. The design will be an iteration of the original sticker design, which will be made public as soon as possible!As part of this campaign, I want to take the chance to give back to the local community as much as possible. Therefore I invited 3 local (Antwerp based) artists to create something special based on the original quote. The artworks will be printed in A5 size on high quality 300g focuscard paper. They will also be made available as mobile and desktop wallpapers in various sizes.The examples below are to illustrate the diverse style of each artist. They do not reflect the final design. The custom artwork will only happen (and start) in case this project is fully funded.Invited artist #1 : Geertrui Storms (stormscreative.be)Geertrui is a lettering wizard. When this campaign gets funded - she'll make a supercustom version of the 'don't complain' quote.Invited artist #2 : Willem Pirquin (willempirquin.be, instagram)Willem is great at capturing a whole story in one image. He'll create a custom illustration, in his own vibrant style.Invited artist #3 : Bert Jacobs (instagram, behance)Bert is an industrial designer who eats marker pens for breakfast. He's not a 'genuine' illustrator, but he's totally up for this challenge.Note: All reward levels also include 'the digital' reward, containing a selection of wallpapers for tablet, phone and desktop use.Thanks to this campaign awesome backer crowd, we managed to reach 3 stretch goals already! I'm exploring other ways to keep expanding this campaign, and hope to land something feasible soon. Final stretch goal : ä‰å3200 ¥Ë_After getting several requests for doing a large size print, I'll be tossing in a risograph printed A3 sized poster of the quote for every backer who's backing at ä‰å20 and above.A riso print has a very special aesthetic to it, which makes it stand out. Larger prints would be ideal to pin in meeting rooms or on office walls.Stretch goal #3 : ä‰å3000 äìƒSticker sheet! I'm adding an A5 sticker sheet into the mix as an additional reward at all backer tiers! On this sheet there will be one sticker of each illustrator, and if there's space left I'll squeeze in a couple of 'localised versions' of the original quote!Stretch goal #2 : ä‰å2600 äìƒWe'll be adding one additional illustrator into the mix when reaching ä‰å2600! : Caroline of Studio Caro. She's totally into 3D type, and I think her style will add nicely to Willem, Geertrui and Bert's. Caroline also operates from Antwerp, so we're staying very local.The art created by Caro will be added to the tiers which already contain artprints. That means that you'll get 4 instead of 3 different prints if you backed either the ä‰å20 or ä‰å25 tier ('the art' or 'gold limited edition & art').Example work of Studio CaroExample work of Studio CaroStretch goal #1 : ä‰å2000 äìƒWhen the campaign reaches ä‰å2000 I'm committing to providing a nicely bundled package of design files in various formats. Documenting the fonts and listing a couple of printing resources. This should give anyone who backed at any tier level the opportunity to create her or his own version of the sticker, or re-use the digital version where ever you'd like.I want to go full transparent here. This is what I've based my calculations on, it's hard to estimate print quantities - but I tried to go with a realistic estimate. Printing of the gold stickers (tbd) and the art printsŒæ(Impressa) is done in Belgium, the regular stickers are ordered through Stickermule.Œæ

Hello, My name is Austin.I am working to raise funds in order to purchase the equipment (computer, printer/scanner, formatting software, advertising etc.) needed to print the adult coloring book that I would like to publish. I have done some research into book publishing companies as well as simply paying to use a computer/printer. The most cost effective way to publish my book is to purchase the equipment myself to reduce costs.Once the equipment is purchased and the coloring books are available. My main goal is this to put my book into the hands of as many people that I can, while keeping prices reasonable. So that everyone can enjoy it.Farther in the future I would like to try and get my book into retailers, and keep sharing this book.
ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

My name is Chris Piascik, Iäó»m an illustrator.Œæ10 years ago I started a daily drawing project with no goal in mind aside from drawing more. I committed to posting them online as a way of tricking myself into keeping up with it. I figured if I told the internet I was doing it Iäó»d have no choice!Over the past decade these drawings have transformed and directed my career and life. Theyäó»ve helped me transition from a designer with a day job to an independent illustrator. I still canäó»t believe thatäó»s real! To celebrate these past 10 yearäó»s worth of daily drawings I am going to make a book featuring my favorites.The book will be about 100 pages and include drawings ranging from 2007 through 2017. Iäó»ve remastered a bunch of the old ones, and there will be a few other surprises including illustrations by some awesome friends. This book wouldnäó»t be a good fit for a regular publisher so Iäó»m using Kickstarter to help produce it. This book is deeply personal and I want full control over it. So thatäó»s where you come in! By preordering a copy of my book, or backing the project via a whole slew of reward options you can make this happen (THIS BEING ALL MY HOPES AND DREAMS).The money will go towards the production of this book, as you can imagine itäó»s expensive and very time consuming. That said, Iäó»ve set the goal low, just to cover the costs associated with an initial batch of books. If we go over that goal, boy howdy would that be nice. As a self-employed illustrator itäó»s hard to fit everything in. Bypassing the goal will provide a cushion to allow me to cut back on some client work and focus on this bookäóîand thus finish faster!Letäó»s talk about rewards! You can back this campaign in a number of ways from tiny baby dollars to big boy dollars and thereäó»s rewards to match! The main event is the book, so thereäó»s a number of ways to get that. Rewards range from; stickers, patches, and pins, to copies of my previous books, other books, prints, custom drawings, and other stuff I may add through the campaign.IF I DONäó»T REACH MY GOAL, NOBODY (INCLUDING ME) GETS ANYTHING. IT WILL BE AS IF THIS NEVER HAPPENED AND I WILL LIKELY GO INTO HIDING.ŒæTHANK YOU!{more sample spreads from the book}ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæThese are the patches and enamel pins included in the "Flair" reward option! These are the coloring books included in the "Coloring Books" reward option!This is a page from my previous book, "Another 1000 Days of Drawing" listing all of the Kickstarter backers that opted for the hand-lettered name reward tier!Did I mention the book will include some bonus illustrations by some of the raddest designers and illustrators I know? Let me name drop for a second: Danny Pelavin, Jen Mussari, Josh LaFayette, Lee Crutchley, Kate Bingaman-Burt, Andy J Miller... AND THAT'S JUST THE TIP OF THE ICEBERG. I'll share more as the campaign progresses.ŒæOh, hi, are you still reading this? Thanks! Speaking of thanks, thank you Josh Lafayette for the song!ŒæHere's an image of the limited edition print listed in the Rewards. This will be 11"x14" and will be a 4-color Risograph print, printed by the fine folks at Risolve Studio! UPDATE: 01/27/2018I just added these mini-print packs to the rewards options! You can choose any 5 dailies to be included with each pack.ŒæŒæŒæŒæ

What are some of your favorite pop culture quotes? äóìNo, Iäó»m Your Father.äó, äóìSpace:The Final Frontieräó, äóìSnakes! Why'd it Have to Be Snakes?!äó. We all have our favorite quotes from our favorite pop culture characters. The quotes that remind us of our favorite movies, comics, and tv shows. They've been used in action figure phrases, and now turned into lames memes on the internet. But memes and crapy toy speakers can only go so far. Until NOW!Get your own POP Culture Mini Character Standee, including 6 interchangeable quotes for you to choose from. You can get a small portrait size, or a larger full body cut out, featuring a light wire attachment to secure the quote text bubble in an adjustable and durable position.Each standee is printed on premium art paper and adhered to quarter inch thick form board. They are all equipped with a foam board wedge stand that can be collapsed down for easy storage and shipping. All quote bubbles are also printed on premium art paper, and then laminated for extra protection.Now you can decorate your desk at work, your mantle at home, or even get one as a gift for that fellow pop culture fan in your life! You can even collect multiple characters like, the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the Ghostbusters, the Star Trek Crew, or even the Avengers!You tell me which character you want and I can make it! I will select 6 of the most popular quotes for that character, or you can choose the quotes yourself if youäó»d prefer.You can also tell me a style in which you want your character done in, and I will replicate it to the best of my ability. If you want something specific we can discuss your vision. I'm sure I'll be able to do it!Iäó»ve made several Example Standees for this campaign including:You can choose from 2 sizes. AŒæ6in. half figure size from the waist up for $10, or you can go for it and get a 10in. full body size, showing everything from head to toe for $20. If you want more than just one, you can also choose 1 or each, a set of 3, or even a set of 4!Each Mini Standee comes with 6 Interchangeable quotes printed on premium paper and then laminated for extra durability! I will select the most poplar quotes for your character, but if you'd like to make some suggestions you're more than welcome to let me know what quotes you want.If 6 isn't enough to fully capture all the best your character has to offer, you will have the ability to add more at only $.50 per additional quote.Here are some examples of quotes I've selected for the example standees:Batman (TV series)Iron Man (MCU)Catwoman (Batman Returns)ŒæDarth VaderŒæ(Movie)ŒæIndiana Jones (Movie)ŒæCaptain Kirk (TV Series)ŒæHarry Potter (Movie)ŒæPrincess Leia (Movie)ŒæEach Mini Standee is printed on premium matte photo paper and then glued to a piece of quarter inch foam board. Then each one is meticulously cut out by hand and fixed with a small foam board stand that is attached with small pieces of velcro for easy removal when storing.ŒæThen another small square of foam board is hot glued to a thin piece of 28 gauge galvanized steel wire, for a strong yet posable fixture to attach the quote bubbles.Each quote bubble is printed on the same high quality matte photo paper, and then laminated for extra durability.Make 100 is a creative initiative focused on editions of 100. Kickstarter is running this campaign to help creators reach more supporters. The rules are simple - Create a project with a limited-edition reward capped at 100 backers. That means once we hit 100 backs the campaign is over!ŒæClick Here to find out more about the Make 100 campaign.

I wanted chess enamel pins so I decided to go ahead and design them. The campaign will start with the following pinsPin SpecificationsEach stretch goal is to unlock the black and white version of said chess piece except the last one which is the Red Queen which I thought it would be pretty snazzy.Œæ

***IMPORTANT UPDATE!!***I have done some calculations, and since there is only a few days left, I've decided to change a few things to benefit all backers!I have decided to produce a smaller amount of each pin design so that I can make ALL THREE PINS AVAILABLE FOR BACKERS, as long as the project is fully funded.This means that I have removed the stretch goals and will be producing all three pins if this project is sucessfully funded (read more in my latest update)! ä_About a year ago I made my very first enamel pin. I really loved the experience of designing it and the pin itself turned out fantastically! Having a design of mine made in metal was so cool! It had a weight to it when I held it in my hand. It was durable, in hard enamel, very detailed and precious. I loved it, and I knew I had to make more!ŒæThis Kickstarter is to help make more of my very FIRST pin, the Skeleton Sphynx Cat, since it was so popular that Iäó»ve long since sold out of my very small first batch.ŒæThe Skeleton pin is 35 mm tall, hard enamel, in gold plated metal with a butterfly clutch and a makers stamp on the back.This is also to help make my SECOND pin, the Octopus Sphynx Cat, a reality. The Octopus pin will be a remarkable 50 mmŒætall, hard enamel, in silver plated metal with two butterfly clutches and a makers stamp on the back.The THIRD pin in this Kickstarter is a sparklyŒæGhost Sphynx with three ghost friends and its favorite toy mouse!!This design will be hard enamel,silver plated metal with butterfly clutch and a makers stamp on the back.I'm waiting to hear back from my manufacturers, but I'm hoping to make it the same size as the Ocopus pin above, 5 cm tall (about 2 inches)!Every pin I make will be pinned to its own special backing card with its own special artwork. The cards will measureŒæ85mm x 55mm.Please, check carefully which pledge you choose so that you get the exact rewards that you want!You can edit your pledge at any time if more stretch goals get unlocked and you want to add more pins! And you wonäó»t get charged for your pledge until the Kickstarter campaign finishes!*ALL GONE!* Early Bird Special - Limited to five backers!Be quick and get three pins for 200 SEK instead of 300 SEK!Sphynx Cat Pins!ŒæPledge to receive the number of sphynx cat pins you want. You can select which available designs you wish to receive in the backer survey when the campaign ends.ŒæMix and match between all available pins, duplicates are fine!Original Pet Portrait SPECIAL! - Limited to one backer!ŒæI will draw you a personalized portrait of your pet, be it a sphynx cat or any other animal! This pledge also includes three sphynx cat pins that you can choose from the available designs when the campaign ends.Requirements and rules for the Original Pet Portrait Pledge:Note that the artwork itself is a digital reward that will be e-mailed to you upon completion. The pins, however, will be shipped to you.ŒæFor more examples of my artwork and style, please take a look at my Instagram or Facebook page, links below!Iäó»m located in Sweden and the shipping costs are based on weight (and how many pins can fit in a bubble mailer).That means that you will be paying the same amount for shipping for 1-4 pins, and the same amount for shipping 5-12 pins.ŒæSo if you order with a friend (or multiple pins for yourself), you can save on shipping!The shipping fees are as follows:Shipping to Sweden:International shipping*:(If you want to order more than 12 pins at the same time, send me a message and I'll add another reward pledge level for you!)*International backers are responsible for paying any eventual customs fees.ŒæŒæThe Skeleton Sphynx pin and the Octopus Sphynx pin designs are ready to send to production!The mold for the Skeleton pin already exists (since I've had it made once before) and it will be made from the same one. The design for the Octopus has been edited and approved by the manufacturer and is ready to be made when I place the order.There are still some minor tweaks to be made on the design for the Ghost pin, but it will be ready to send to production before the campaign ends!Production should take between 4-6 weeks after this campaign ends and I've recieved the funds from Kickstarter.As soon as I have the pins with me Iäó»ll start sending them out to you. Hi!Œæ My name is Diana and I love drawing!ŒæŒæEveryone has their favorite places äóñ world famous attractions, parks, restaurants äóñ but the places that are closest to our hearts, are the ones we create ourselvesäó_Everyone's Home is unique as the people living there. I believe that a Home's character lives in the details, the effort and thought, people put into making this place their own - the way the curtains are moving when the windows are open, the color you chose to paint the walls, the bed sheets you got from Ikea for your shared apartment room and of course, all the memories created there...The combination of all of those things is what makes this place not only a place to live, but Your place to love, to share, to remember and to tell stories about.ŒæäóìHome portraits | 100 Places Iäó»ve lived (and loved)äó is a way to keep a memory, to make an awesome present to someone you love or something to celebrate and honor the story of your own favorite place! I want to tell your unique story and to illustrate your one of a kind space!ŒæäóìHome portraits | 100 Places Iäó»ve lived (and loved)äó is not only a crowdfunding project but also a participatory project äóñ the final result of will be an e-book, which my backers will be part of with their 100 favorite personal places. All my backers will get the e-book along with their illustrations.ŒæŒæIf you choose to take part in this project with your dearest place on earth, this is how we are going to do it: Œæ1. You choose a nice picture (or pictures) of the place you want me to portray.ŒæIf you don't have a picture - that's okay, we can also use Google Maps, but make sure that you have checked before if the images are up to date. You can also give me detailed description without a picture and Iäó»ll do my best to visualize it.ŒæRemember - any personal information I will receive during your commission is confidential, no names or addresses will be shared! Also - I would love to share my process with my backers and keep everyone excited for their illustration, but if someone asks me to keep their drawing in private, I will fully respect their wish!ŒæŒæ2. After you have chosen the place - we talk about it! What story has this place to tell, who are we making happy with this illustration, do we add colors, is there any specific things you want to include in the drawing - any bits and bobs that might be relevant. Each illustration will be accompanied by a few descriptive sentences or a short story in the book.Œæ3. Then I will do a sketch and show it to you, so you can make small changes if you don't like something, before I start inking it or adding colors. It is extremely important to me that we communicate our wishes to get the best Home portraits ever!Œæ4. Your illustration is ready!ŒæIt will be part of the book äóì100 Places Iäó»ve lived (and loved)". I will send you your original drawing per post as well as a high resolution scan of it.Œæ5. You tell everyone about it and I continue drawing, because that's what I do! <3ŒæYou can follow my process at:www.facebook.com/dianashterevaart/www.instagram.com/diaart/ŒæEmail: dia.shtereva@gmail.comŒæFirst Kickstarter project "Home portraits" :Œæwww.kickstarter.com/projects/1491633089/home-portraitsNote: If my project reaches its goal and I get to start drawing, I will do it in chronological order - meaning that the people who backed me first will get their drawings first and the estimated delivery will be in April, May, June and latest July!ŒæStretch goals: If the project reaches 1000 Euros more than the funding goal, I will print 100 limited edition copies of äóì100 Places Iäó»ve lived (and loved)äó.ŒæŒæŒæ

We did it!! We hit $5,000 and unlocked the last stretch goal!ŒæI can't thank everyone enough for all the support! It has been incredibly motivating to see how well received my project is! Thank you so much, everyone, for making this such a wonderful experience!Œæ**I'm offering a special reward - available only to those who back both my Kickstarter and my Patreon page - of a small originalŒæsketch and handwritten thank you note. I don't often offer original work, because of how long I tend to spend on each piece, but I wanted to offer something extra special to those amazing backers! Check out my Patreon page for more details!ŒæWhere the shadows coalesce, Anubis takes form; the sleek muscle of fanged hound; the sleek eyed knowing of the man.ŒæWith cold stars for eyes, with cold stars for thoughts, he exists ever as a fulcrum between the scales; measuring, discerning.ŒæLike fleeting shadows across the sand, the lives of mortal man brushŒæpast his gaze and are gone. He measures each shadow in exacting perfection.Œæ He knows the bones of their lives, the immutable nature of all things.The sand hisses; dry whispers of secrets the living cannot discern. The sand gnaws at stones, at bones forgotten in the sand; at mortals who fade slowly from memory. He cloaks himself in the recursive impossibility of endings: all things end but endings.This portrait of Anubis, Discerning Gaze, is one of the first paintings Iäó»ve created towards an illustrated book of stories, themed around Egyptian Mythology.ŒæSince I was a child, Iäó»ve been fascinated and inspired by mythology, particularly, Egyptian Mythology. Mythology is full of old, old themes that are common to all of us, lessons of morality and questions of existential meaning, archetypes that re-appear across history and likey into future histories.Iäó»m thrilled to be working on creating a book and series of paintings that explore these themes! Offering these prints of Anubis is a way to kick off the project and create a chance to share this painting. Kickstarter's 'Make/100' event is the perfect opportunity! Iäó»m offering open-edition 12x18 prints as well as high-quality, limited edition giclees. You can also choose to have yours hand-embellished by me, making it a one-of-a-kind pieceŒæof art!The funding from this campaign will go to the production of these prints, as well as the creation of future paintings for the book. With your support, I will be able to, not only create these beautiful prints but also work towards creating a whole series and book to accompany them.ŒæŒæŒæŒæIf you would like your print or giclee to be hand embellished, just add $25 to your pledge. I will be using archival, metallic paints to add fineŒædetails that will make yourŒæprintŒæone-of-a-kind.If you would like to add more prints or rewards to your pledge, just add the amount listed below for that reward to your pledge. I will contact you when the Kickstarter ends to make sure I send the items you chose!NOTE: These discounted prices are exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign. My regular Etsy and exhibit pricing will apply after all the rewards are fulfilled.ŒæWould you like to see more art themed around Egyptian Mythology? Subscribe and follow me on Patreon! As of the first day of this Kickstarter, I am also launching my Patreon to share my progress as I work towards creating a book full of paintings and creative writing themed around Egyptian Mythology. The more support I receive on this Kickstarter and Patreon page, the more time I can spend focused on creating the book! My hope is to have the book finished and ready for release sometime next year.Œæ ŒæMy Patreon page will feature exclusive works-in-progress I don't share anywhereŒæelse, process videos, discounts on prints and monthly packages of new art created for the book! So if you would like access to all the art and writing as the book is being created, please join me there!ŒæYou can also see more of my work on my website, including more high-res images of the art than I can post on Kickstarter and a few of the other Anubis paintings I have created so far.And you can follow my social media to see all sorts of art updates!Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæFacebook and InstagramAnd lastly, I wanted to say thank you! I have received so much support, advice, and encouragement this last year for my work and it has meant so much! I am still learning and growing as an artist, and seeing people respond so kindly to my art and endeavors has been incredibly motivating and fulfilling.ŒæIt means so much to me to be able to focus on what I love - creating more art to share with you! For everyone backing and sharing this project, you have my warmest heartfelt gratitude!Œæ

If you are new to Kickstarter, this is important to know. When you pledge (choose a monetary quantity to support us), you are not charged.ŒæSo when will your credit/debit card be charged then? If this campaign is successfully funded, then you will be charged the amount you decided to contribute.You will be charged by March 4th, but only if this campaign is fully funded.We want to create äóìThe Rogue Mangakaäó, a training course that will teach you in workshop-style how to draw Manga, using practical exercises and examples to make each step as easy as possible. We will avoid the lame tutorial style where not enough steps are covered and will go in-depth into the process to really transform you into a talented manga artist.ŒæBy the end of this training, you will have created your first original Manga.2DAnimation101Œæis an online school that has been helping beginners to create animations, with more than 50,000+ students over 186 countries. We believe in learning by involving the student in relevant projects that will spike their interest and keep them motivated.äóìTell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learnäó -Benjamin Franklin.We truly believe that being part of a project convinces your mind that you are doing something important and relevant and motivates you to take the next step.We are a couple of dreamers who love to help and who believe that anyone can develop talent. YES. ANYONE. Even if you were not born with the talent, we help you develop it.We have invested a ton of time in researching scientific proof that if you have a brain and a functional body, then you can learn to draw amazing things and turn them into animation.äóìAll our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue themäó -Walt Disney.I donäó»t believe in just having an idea and transform it into a product. No. I believe that ideas should be tested before bringing them into the market, and that is why we will be testing, making mistakes, improving the idea and testing again until we have the perfect formula to transform any beginner into a professional Manga Artist.As mentioned in the video, we are investing time and money in the research required.This research consists of learning the most about skill-acquisition and quick learning, so we can add all that science and knowledge into the course. All focused on developing the talent of drawing manga, for people who are not good at drawing.Part of this involves putting our ideas into practice and helping people who donäó»t have drawing skills to improve and draw decently, and then, scale the skill up to become amazing.We have found that people get results in the first 20 hours of our techniques because we are applying the concepts from Josh Kaufman, best selling author of äóìThe First 20 hoursäó.And I have personally found, after countless hours of 1-on-1 coaching, that students who learn to control emotions and self-awareness, improve and really become great artists, while students who don't know how to deal with frustration give up easily.That is why part of our research also involves applying the latest research and findings for positive psychology, happiness, and creativity, to accelerate the learning curve. Authors like: Csikszentmihalyi, Ed Catmull, Richard Williams, Frank Thomas, Ollie Johnston, Charles Duhigg, Daniel Kahneman, Mo Gawdat, Daniel Goleman, among many others.If you have no confidence and live in an environment that does not support creativity and artistic growth, you wonäó»t get very far, and you will blame your genes, your family, lack of resources, the economy or something else; but, in reality, when you learn how to manage your environment and your emotions, you can become unstoppable and learn anything you want.All of this emotional management, self-confidence, and esteem development will be included in this training, so you can listen to the audio lessons while you are practicing your drawing exercises daily.The goal is to have results in any student after the first 20 hours, and then, pump up the motivation until their reach the peak level of becoming a Mangaka (Manga Artist).Most of it will go into equipment, research, and legal fees. Here is a detailed distribution of all the budget:It all depends on when we will have discovered the process that guarantees results for any beginner with absolutely no drawing skills.We plan to have it on May or June 2018, after we have the budget ready, but it could take less or more than that.Any supporter will get news on our progress and discoveries. Those who pledge for the äóìEarly Beta Accessäó will be able to check the lessons we have released, before opening enrollment the course. (First lessons will be released on May, but not 100% of the course).No. Not at all.The purpose of this training is to help any dreamer out there, who always wanted to draw amazingly great anime characters, to become a manga artist even if they have NO SKILL at all.But in order to achieve that, we need to work on your mindset, because the biggest thing holding you back is your thoughts and emotions, the belief that you cannot achieve this. We will help you change that, with scientific proof and you will start getting the courage and motivation to become amazing in drawing manga.What are the requirements or equipment needed?At the very least, you need to invest in 4 things:If you can afford it, we recommend:

My name is Eugene Vinitski and I am the Swiss artist and creator of The Venetian Tarot deck. Now I'm seeking your support to print a new edition of The Venetian Tarot deck in Mini version.The Venetian Tarot cards deck is the result of two years hard and exciting work of creation. Each card is hand painted here in my studio!ŒæThe deck has been created following Rider Waite traditions. Iconographic materials of the life in Venice in 16th-18th centuries were used when working at the Venetian Tarot. The main idea involves famous Venetian masks worn by all the arcanum characters in the deck. This allows appreciating the epoch and provides freedom for imagination promoting multilayer perception.ŒæThe deck has a conventional structure of 22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor Arcana. Minor Arcana classification by suits is also traditional and is represented by Wands, Cups, Swords and Pentacles.You can have a look at the making-process:The first edition of Venetian Tarot was already printed in October 2017! And it is very successful!You can see a lot of amazing reviews on the Venetian Tarot Facebook page:Œæhttps://www.facebook.com/venetiantarot/The deck is ordered a lot, but its price is high enough. The reason is a very long and hard technique of creation, complex pre-press process and very long printing with a large number of corrections due to the search of suitable colors of the cards.But NOW I would like to make the Venetian Tarot more attractive and available to all! With your help I would like to offer this beautiful deck for amazing price!I have the honor to present you:The Mini Venetian Tarot is a 78 cards deck gold gilded in the luxury book-shape magnetic closure box.Dimension of the mini cards: 1.9 x 3.5äó (52x92mm).The quality of the deck is exactly the same as the quality of the previous one!The differences are:Funding will cover the part of printing of 500 decks of the Mini Venetian Tarot, shipping, Kickstarter fees, etc.ŒæIf our funding goal is reached, I will place the order for the deck right after the campaign ends. I already have manufacturers lined up and all of the artwork is ready to print.ŒæOther ways you can help:ŒæThis project will only become a reality when more people become involved.ŒæPlease share this campaign with your friends! Tweet, post to Facebook, your blog or any other media you have access to! Any help is appreciated!What people are saying:"...If I may, with the fortune tellingäó_ I predict that in the future, your First Edition copy of the Venetian Tarot is going to be worth tenfold if not more what youäó»ve paid for it..."ŒæBenebell Wenhttps://benebellwen.com/2018/01/09/the-venetian-tarot-by-eugene-vinitski/"...I have to say: Iäó»m hella impressed and have been enjoying working with The Venetian Tarot..."The Tarot Ladyhttps://www.thetarotlady.com/behind-the-scenes-with-the-venetian-tarot/You can check out the rest of my work atŒæhttps://www.facebook.com/tar0tmania/Follow me!Youtube:Œæhttps://www.youtube.com/user/vinitskiInstagram:Œæhttps://www.instagram.com/tarotcreator/My campaign goal represents the minimum amount I have to raise in order to meet the part of printer requirements.The stretch goals represents the funds required to fulfil the full print quantity goals, marketing, shipping, Kickstarter fees, etc. CHFŒæ10,000 Stretch Goal ŒæThe goal does include a three extra cards of Major Arcana: the Faith, the Hope, the Charity and White card that will be included in everybody's Mini Venetian Tarot deck. They can add significant insight into your readings if you choose to include them, and you are free to interpret as you wish.CHFŒæ15,000 Stretch GoalŒæ If I reach this stretch goal, Iäó»ll give the funds from my personal account equal to 10% of extra rewards (over than the original funding amount CHF 5,000) to a charity organisation Save Venice.If there is something you'd like to see included in the project, feedback is always welcome.Other questions?I'm eager to answer them. A B O U T .What is Bokkel magazine, the first project of what we would love to be many more, and you may wonder What is it about? Well, it is a run of 100 magazines, each of its 40 pages includes games of the mind, stories and illustrations with a luxurious amount of detail. Bokkel Magazine is a return to the past, to those brochures and magazines that were sold in the old streets of England. Made with 100% recycled materials, we look for an eco-friendly and ecologic formula to share our art and above all to create fun and unusual games and stories that are entertaining. We were looking for an adequate size (A5) to be able to show off the great amount of detail in the ilustrations and to make it easier to interact with. Why is this version so special? There will only be 100 magazines signed, numbered and with a special secret, each magazine will contain a unique and special stamp. Take a look below.ŒæŒæŒæW H YŒæ ŒæK I C K S T A R T E R ?.It is difficult for a project of these characteristics to be possible without external support, and our desire is to obtain full funding so that it can come to light. Also in order to be able to do more projects. Our greatest dream would be, to be able to live from our work but for now we are more than happy that our work reaches the people who love what we do. That is why each contribution will be essential for us, a way to ensure that there are more projects of this magnitude and illusion. Thank you in advance for helping us with our project that has consumed us a lot of time and effort but that we present with great enthusiasm.ŒæW H A TŒæ ŒæI SŒæ ŒæE I Y I AŒæ ŒæE X A C T L Y ?.Eiyia is an artistic group born in 2017, formed by two artists, Emily Anne England (Enna Ylime) and Alvaro Lope Morales Quevedo (Alfher Lupus). Creatures with minds far from this world, lovers of Nordic literature, nature and the passage of time of objects. They seek with each project to get closer to what for them is ŒÂthe golden ageŒÂ, you could say the Victorian age with a medieval mixture. Their style is indefinable because they devote all their time and effort to create very different ideas, like this magazine, based on games, or figures, handmade toys or books and more. If you want to know a bit more about these artists, go to their website, there you will find great secrets to which may explain a litttle more of where eiyia comes from...Œæhttps://www.eiyia.com/Œæand our facebook pageŒæhttps://www.facebook.com/EIYIA/ŒæW H A TŒæ D O E SŒæ T H EŒæ R E W A R DŒæ C O N T A I N ?You could help in several ways, the magazine consists of 40 pages including front and back covers, it will be A5 size and full of different games where you can test your brain. It is fully illustrated from front to back, always looking to represent our own old style aesthetics. So if you like the idea and feel that you can support us, thank you very much for making this dream possible.F I N A L L Y , W H E NŒæ ŒæW O U L DŒæ ŒæI TŒæ ŒæA R R I V E ?.ŒæWell once the kickstarter is finished it will be sent to each person, so it shouldnŒÇt take too long. We understand the desire you will have to draw between the pages and we will make sure that it does not take too long for you to arrive. We do wish that our project gets funded completely, so then these little magazines can fly away all over the place. We can estimate that you will recive your pledge now later than the end of march more or less.ŒæThank you again for your time and attention.Œæ

Thank you to everyone who has supported this project so far! Here are a few small stretch goals to give you something more to look forward to! *$750 (reached!) äóñ Funded! Yay, thank you!! *$800 (reached!) äóñ 2 Bonus Art Prints! Iäó»ll be choosing two bonus illustrations that will be sent to all $10+ backers along with any other rewards.*$900 (reached!) äóñ Greeting Cards! All $30+ backers will receive a special edition set of six assorted greeting cards featuring my artwork (Happy Birthday, Get Well Soon, Thinking of You, etc). Hi! Iäó»m Jenna. Iäó»m 11 years old and I like to draw almost all kinds of creatures, real or magical, (except humans). Iäó»ve been drawing custom themed cards and art prints for friends and family for many years featuring their pets and I really like that my art can make people smile. Hereäó»s a sample of some of my art from the last year. This year, I want to draw 100 custom dog portraits for dog owners and make a calendar featuring these portraits for the year 2019. I hope your dog will be one of them! Pup Prints are custom drawings of your dog that show off their unique personality. I love the way each dog is different and I like to draw these awesome animals to show off their inner character. ŒæI love to meet dogs and their owners around my neighborhood and over the past year, I started keeping an äóìencyclopediaäó of all the dogs I meet around town. Iäó»ve drawn over 50 dogs so far, but sadly, most of the time I donäó»t get a chance to show these drawings to the dog owners after theyäó»re done. That is how I got the idea for Pup Prints.  I thought other people might like to own a custom drawing of their best furry friend that shows off their dog with a little personality. Œæ Iäó»m going to take all the dogs I draw for this Kickstarter and include them on the front and back covers of the Pup Prints Calendar. On each month of the calendar, two dogs will be featured, the 24 "pin up pups" (see rewards for more details), along with their name and the city where they live.ŒæFor all personalized Pup Prints and Pin-Up Pup rewards, you'll send me one or two pictures of your dog along with a little biography about them such as their name, breed, and any special details you'd like to include (äóìchases her tailäó äóìLikes to bark at the vacuumäó etc) and I will create a hand drawn portrait of your dog inspired by your photo and description and send you a fine art print of your pupäó»s portrait along with your very own Pup Prints 2019 Desk Calendar. I will send you a special survey so it will be easy for you to give me all of this information once the campaign is over. ŒæThere are just three rewards to choose from: ŒæThe Pup Prints Calendar is an 8.5 x 5.5äó desk calendar with two dog illustrations featured per month, and all the dogs I draw for this project featured on front and back covers in full color. Custom Pup Print + Calendar: I will draw a custom picture of your dog based off of your photo and description. Youäó»ll get a 5x7äó high quality print of your dogäó»s picture along with your Pup Prints 2019 Calendar. You'll also receive a digital scan of your dog's drawing to you as soon as I finish it (before the other rewards are shipped). A smaller picture of your dog will also be included on the front or back of the calendar. Pin-Up Pup: If your dog is extra special to you and you want to have him or her featured on one of the month pages of the calendar, you can choose this reward and youäó»ll get your 5x7 art print, plus the calendar with your dog and their name and city in a starring role on one of the month pages. You'll also receive a digital scan of your dog's drawing as soon as I finish it (before the other rewards are shipped). Add-ons: If you'd like an additional calendar to share with a fellow dog lover, you can add $10/per calendar to any pledge. (Add-ons are only available to U.S. backers due to international shipping costs).ŒæIäó»ve been drawing since I was two years old. My parents have always encouraged me to keep practicing and to try new art styles. I started out with craft paints and crayons and then moved to colored pencils. After awhile I started trying pen and ink and watercolor. Right now I like to draw using pencil and my Micron pens and then add color using my favorite Prismacolor pencils. ŒæThe funds I raise through this Kickstarter will go to pay for making the calendar, shipping rewards and some new art supplies for me to use to make these Pup Prints. I can't wait to äóìmeetäó your dog and create these custom drawings!

Hi, I'm Ellis and I'm the illustrator behindŒæPastel ElixirŒæwhich I run with my husband James.Our ultimate dream has always been to have tote bags and *one day* t-shirts in our online shop and to start off we'd really like to go for the tote bags with our animal watercolour painting design on.The money raised will go towards the manufacturing of the bags, shipping, packaging and the Kickstarter fees.Our animal painting design is our very first tote bag we plan on producing, however if we smash our goal and go above this, we will definitely be releasing another design or two!Our design(s) will be sent to our manufacturer within one week of the campaign finishing and will then be shipped within 2-3 weeks from then, possibly even sooner!Bag dimensions will be 380mm x 410mm and will be printed with a high quality transfer vinyl material. Three years ago, I had an idea to make a book. That idea grew from a few illustrations that followed a Japanese folk song full narrative and the idea of printing the whole thing with letterpress. Because of Kickstarter, I made that book a reality.ŒæShortly after the campaign ended, I had an idea for another book. I've been working on that for the past two years.ŒæTamaThe idea of the story was simply about a little pebble, and how he wanted to be something he wasn't, like his friend Boulder. As I wrote, I did some research. Turns out in Japanese the word TamaishiŒæ(tah-mah-eee-she) is a word that means literally "jewel stone" and metaphorically, a hidden gem or "diamond in the rough".ŒæThat discovery helped me write the story about a little pebble and his path of finding out it's okay to be yourself äóî a journey from the heights of the valley where all the little things live to the depth of the Great Sea. Read the first chapter!So what are you making?Like before, I want to make three editions:This time around, the offset edition will include a second spot color. It's a small addition that will help add depth. The letterpress will be still be only one-color, but I'm going to create special limited edition will have handmade watercolor end sheets and a watercolor painting attached to the cover.ŒæŒæŒæFor now, I don't have a sample of this book, but to get an idea of what it will be, please listen to an excerpt from the Zsan audiobook.Wait, why not digital printing?ŒæDigital has its advantages. There are even options to print offset for cheaper than I've ever seen. But I have two motivations: 1) I've always preferred the look and feel uncoated stock, ink in the paper and printing with plates and things that are made by hand. 2) My printing, be it offset or letterpress, is done by artisans of their craft, in the US. It's archival, beautiful, and made by hand.Letterpress isŒætactile, subtle, and elegant, with the plates making a noticeable impression in the paper. You can see and feel the difference. Each letterpress impression is hand pulled by an artisan. Then the signatures are hand bound and glued and sewn together. The whole work is a piece of art.That's really what I want to make again.What about MAKE/100?I've added a special hand draw sketch of the characters to those that purchase the audiobook or the twofer - up to 100. This will be drawn on paper using colored pencils as the base and a micron to ink it.So how's this going to work?If successfully funded, I'll start making final steps towards production. The writing is done, and the artwork is nearly ready for plates. I'll probably make revisions to both for a few weeks as I start recording the audiobook (reading everything out loud always makes you change things slightly). I've been in communication with the same printers as before and they're both excited to begin.ŒæI'll begin more focused work on the audiobook äóî I've got some voice talent lined up, and lots of disparate musical ideas. I can begin recording all the narrator parts and the various characters.ŒæPlates will made for both printers and I'll begin acquiring all the necessary materials for production: bookcloth, end sheets, headbands, cover stock, etc. Those are all shipped directly to the bookbinders and printers for their use.Zsan was such a joy to behold in its final forms. I hope you'll join me in making this next book a reality as well.äóîŒçä‹¢Œæ

For the past few years, I have taken to drawing friendly monsters in my sketchbooks as a productive non-computer hobby. In 2018, I made a resolution to make these monsters wall-worthy äóñ the Make 100 project on Kickstarter seemed like the perfect opportunity to get these monsters out of my sketchbooks on onto walls!ŒæThe funds I raise will go towards art supplies, frames, packaging costs, sticker printing, and something for me to sip on while I work.ŒæI generally don't plan out how each monster will look before I start creating it. Some of them have more human characteristics, like teeth, two eyes, and human noses, while others have strange, hose-like noses and a non-human number of eyes.ŒæThe monsters are always a non-skin color like red, blue, green, or orange. Most of the portraits are just the monster's head on a white background, but occasionally they appear in a meadow-like, blue-sky landscape.Traditionally, the monsters' medium has been colored pencil, but I would like to explore acrylic paints in this undertaking. Here is a monster painted in acrylic:Unlike colored pencil monsters, the acrylic monsters generally start as sketches. Here is an in-progress acrylic monster that began with a pencil sketch:ŒæThe 100 monsters will be 8x10 monster portraits, some on acrylic paint on board and some colored pencil on paper. I also have a digitized monster or two that will be available as stickers, and can also create some hand-drawn, adorable monster greeting cards for a lesser cost!These monsters are perfect artwork for your bathroom, your kid's room, or really any room!Œæ

As a personal challenge to myself, I want to draw 100 unique characters. However, I also want to involve the gaming and art community in that!ŒæAll characters designs will be SFW ( safe for work) and be completed in the style of pictures shown.I will be doing the sketches with pen, pencil, and white gel pens on toned paper. I already have most of these supplies, but this project will require a good amount of time to complete.ŒæFunds raised will pay for time, materials, and future education.ŒæThis will be for the Make 100 challenge!

Hi! My name is Jess and I am an artist and sculptor based in Surrey. I have loved art since a very young age but left it behind to pursue a career in ecology after graduating with a degree in Environmental Geography. However, working as an ecologist and volunteering with wildlife inspired me to start making wildlife related art and in 2013 'Silverpasta Crafts' was born.ŒæWith my craft business about to turn 5 years old, I have decided to go back to my roots and launch an illustration project. Last year I bought myself a drawing tablet which allows me to create digital illustrations which can be printed on a variety of different objects! For this project I am focusing on getting 100 tea towels printed, showcasing three different designs I have been working on.ŒæŒæŒæŒæAs British wildlife is my biggest inspiration, I have decided to create a 'British birds', 'British mammals' and 'British insects' design.ŒæMy tea towels are made from high quality 8oz 100% cotton with Half Panama weave, measure 74 x 47cm and are hemmed on four sides. They are manufactured in the UK. I have now received all three sample tea towels and have made some small adjustments, you can see the final designs in the image above.To help fund my campaign I have created some rewards which will be sent out to anyone who pledges! Obviously the most important reward is the tea towels themselves, which you have the choice of pledging for one, or a set of all three designs!I will also be having some A6 notebooks printed, which can also be chosen as single notebooks or a pack of all three designs. They will be printed on 300gsm white recycled card and will have 48 plain pages inside.As well as these awesome rewards, I will also send three postcards (one of each design) and a sheet of A6 vinyl stickers with my favourite illustrations featured.If these are not exciting enough, I will also be offering custom illustrations of any wildlife in the world (excluding domestic pets!) which will be delivered as unframed A5 prints.Since I have reached my original target, I am in the process of adding several stretch goals!Œ£1,100 (REACHED!)Œæ- 100 coasters! These are now available to add to your existing pledge - check the update section for details! Below are the confirmed designs for the coasters, which you can choose from when I send out the surveys at the end of the project. The puffin one has been made up as a sample and has a wooden backing and a shiny mirror front with the design.ŒæŒæŒ£1,600Œæ(REACHED!)Œæ- 100 extra tea towelsŒ£1,700 (REACHED!)Œæ- Sleeve packaging for the tea towels (to be included in all tea towel pledges)Œ£2,100 - I am currently looking into options to get some canvas bags printed with the designs - watch this space!

ŒæHi!Œæ I'm Sarah Mason.Œæ I am a watercolour, ink and pencil artist residing in the UK.Œæ My passion lies within nature and animals and my art likes to reflect the delicate, whimsical and organic themes that wildlife flourishes and blooms with.ŒæI am most known for my delicate art that blends strong traditional techniques with contemporary themes.Œæ My subjects are often animals and floral themes, incorporating the two together to create beautiful ink and colour illustrations.ŒæYou can find me here:Originals and PrintsŒæPortfolioPatreonFacebookTwitterThis small project brings together those two themes in a very personal and beautiful way.ŒæLast year, a piece became very close to my heart and also became the face of my website and social media.  Flora and Fauna is a special design that was brought to life by a combination of my love of skulls, animals and floral themes - in due time, this half face design was born.  It features the colourful, vibrancy of a fox, the raw, beautiful skull is revealed underneath, laying on a bed of delicate flowers.  The design is everything I stand for, delicate, colourful and raw.The pin will be approximately 38mm (though it could be larger, this is currently under review), with an antique gold plating and a rubber clutch.  The pin will be part of the #Make100 Kickstarter campaign that runs throughout January.The pin will be provided with it's very own backer card, detailed with floral themes and will be hand signed and numbered - this pin is a limited run of 100 only.NEW OPEN EDITION PIN AVAILABLEAs over half of the limited edition pins have sold out in less than 24 hours - I have decided to add an open edition pin badge as well.Œæ The size and clutch remain the same however this is not a limited edition version and the colouring, plating and backing card will be slightly different as well as it not being signed and numbered.ŒæThese pins are available at a discounted rate, and will be available on Etsy after the campaign for a higher amount.ŒæThis is not my first rodeo of a Kickstarter.  Last year I released a small Kickstarter which featured special postcards and greetings cards.  The goals were simple and production ran smoothly.  The total of backers and pledged amount hit over 300% of my listed goal and was extremely successful. ABOUT THE TIERSäó†ŒæThere will be a number of simple tiers available for the #Make100 Flora and Fauna pin badge Kickstarter.  This will include the following:äó†Œæ-Downloadable colouring pages.Œæ-The Pin Badge (Limited to 100).-4 Black and White A5 print set.-Original inked artwork tiers.äó†ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ ŒæŒæŒæI plan to run some stretch goals which will include: Œæ-Additional gold foiled finished mini print of one of my Beast in Blossom designs  -8x8cm Black and White sew on patch (Kickstarter Exclusive)Once these two goals have been hit, I will consider other rewards, maybe an additional pin? *hint hint*ŒæFor full transparency on the final goal number for this project, I have broken it down into four categories.  The first being the most obvious part of the funds - the product. Both the pins and the prints will be made my Awesome Merchandise in the UK.Œæ Their quality is outstanding and if you were a part of my previous project, you will know that my previous pin "Coil" was a high standard and was very beautiful!The largest part of the funding goal is actually shipping.  Which is the most difficult part to calculate and predict.  I have spent a lot of my time weighing the pins I currently have and using the Royal Mail price finder tool to give me a quote.Œæ The shipping altogether comes to about 40% of the funding goal. Œæ10% of the funding accounts for Kickstarter and Credit Card fees which usually equate to that number (5% for Kickstarter fees and 3-5% for Credit Card fees.)ŒæThe last 15% is a cushion for any emergencies or issues that may happen, such as products and items becoming damaged or lost in transit that will need replacing.I would like to personally thank all those who follow me, support me on Patreon and who backed my previous Kickstarter as well as this project - you have all given me the boost I need to keep going with my art projects, including this pin!Please note that I am not responsible for any customs fees or charges that may be encountered in your Country once the product has been shipped.  EU, US and Aus customers will pay no customs charges.

Since I had my daughter last year I have had a tough transition into motherhood. Even as I fall more in love with my daughter each day, my ability to travel, dive, and make art changed drastically as I battled postpartum depression and insomnia while caring for my daughter. One of the brightest times of my life was at the same time one of my darkest periods.When I was able to start drawing again I felt my struggles working themselves out on my paper in new ways as I experienced release, healing and a reconnection to that part of myself I'd been missing for so long.ŒæMy piece Release is my most personally invested work of art. I recently received an award in a wonderful art annual called Infected By Art because of this piece, and that honor was the final bit of encouragement I needed to face my fears and create prints.In this Kickstarter campaign I'll be offering Open-Edition prints & Limited Edition Archival Giclee Prints on paper and canvas.ŒæThe top reward tiers each feature an Original Ink Drawing of four sea creatures with an 8.5 x 11" Open-Edition print of Release.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæWow you guys!
