Are you a fan of classic spacecraft like Voyager, Hubble, Space Shuttles, the International Space Station, or even the new James Webb Space Telescope? "Positive Space" presents breathtaking images of space with illustrated spacecraft and positive thoughts, elegantly printed on silver photography paper. Get a print for your office decor or send a unique gift to a space fan.Hang them, gift them, donate them - let them inspire you and others. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Each print in the series features an encouraging saying, a spacecraft, and a custom contrast-balanced black and white image of space, to be elegantly printed on silver photo paper.*Backers who purchase the full series will receive a signed and numbered inspirational story card with each print (limit 100 backers.) Hang them all, hang one at a time, or gift individual prints to family and friends. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"COME TOGETHER"International Space StationSometimes you have to put aside your differences and make something even better, together.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"KEEP EXPLORING"VoyagerVoyager is in interstellar space - still exploring after 40 years, an inspiration to not leave any rocks unturned.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"STAY FOCUSED"Hubble Space TelescopeIf Hubble can do it (even after a faulty mirror!) so can you.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"LOOK FARTHER"James Webb Space TelescopeLaunching next year, the James Webb promises to show us images inside dust clouds far away that we never have seen before. Haven't found the answer you're looking for? Use the James Webb as your inspiration.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"RISE ABOVE"Space ShuttleWhat if you looked at all of your problems like the space shuttle looked at earth? From up here, those problems are lookin' pretty small.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The goal has been reached, so please help me get to the next level:You can help me reach my stretch goal by sharing this project! Please use these links:TWEET ABOUT ITSHARE ON FACEBOOKCOPY THE PROJECT LINK--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So far:ŒæI thoughtfully wrote the encouraging sentiments and paired each of them with a spacecraft that reflects their meaning. Then,ŒæI carefully selecting images that were beautiful, captured the concept of the sentiment, and would be able to be printed elegantly in black and white.ŒæNow what?: Now that the content is finalized, I need your help to put this into production. The bulk of the work will be fine-tuning the levels of contrast / lights and darks to make the photographs print on the metallic paper in the most elegant way. This process will take a lot of trial and error, so I will be doing lots of test prints and tweaking the results until I get it just right.ŒæAll prints and mats will be archival quality, so this will be a piece that will last a lifetime.Œæ--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Each print =ŒæŒæŒæ--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ŒæŒæ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As fans of lore and beasties, we knew it would only be a matter of time before we created our own monster field guide! Spanning myths, legends, and tales from around the world, this bestiary is a labor of love that follows The Panagakos family.ŒæŒæAs direct descendants of Pandora and Epimetheus, the Panagakosäó» task of putting monsters back in Pandoraäó»s box is one that spans generations (see below). From hydras to chupacabras, theyäó»ve seen it all. And now you can too can get in on the action with this world building guide!ŒæThis book will be 100 pages of content and 6x9 in size, the perfect travel size! Part professional field guide/part running commentary on the wonderfully weird (and often times dangerous) mission of the Panagakos family, inside you can expect to find:ŒæWith your help we'd love to bring this family field guide to life with lore, notes comparing different creatures and of course amazing art!Thank you so much!Œæ-Kara, Kelly and Nichole!ŒæŒæOur Version of The MythBefore mankind was created Titans resided on the earth with the animals. One Titan, Prometheus, loved playing with clay and one day he made a lot of small humans from the wet earth. Zeus was taken with the figures so much so he breathed life into them.  At first, the humans worshipped Zeus. But Prometheus was a mischievous soul and he convinced the humans to play a prank on Zeus. The prank was a success. Yet Zeusäó»s pride was hurt and in his anger he took fire away from the earth. ŒæCold and hungry, the humans complained to Prometheus. Feeling responsible, Prometheus snuck up to the sky and stole a piece of the sun. Prometheusäó» gift brought fire back to the earth, and the humans rejoiced.ŒæZeus, however, punished Prometheus harshly. Chaining Prometheus to a big rock, Zeus left him to have his liver eaten every day by a big eagle. Yet Prometheusäó» immortality meant he could never die. Each night his liver regrew and each day he was forced to relive his torment as the bird returned.ŒæPrometheus was eventually freed by Herakles but before that, determined to punish his cousin further. Zeus ordered Hephaestus and Athena to create a woman, Pandora, äó†and had all the other gods give her gifts of both blessings and curses. Then, Zeus offered Pandora to Prometheusäó» younger brother, Epimetheus.ŒæYoung and in love, Epimetheus took Pandora as a bride despite his brotheräó»s warnings. On their wedding day, Zeus gave Pandora a sealed jar as a present. Unable to stop her curiosity, Pandora opened the jar released a swarm of evil spirits that would forever plague and curse mankind. Only Elpis (hope) remained inside, a single blessing to ease humanityäó»s suffering.ŒæŒæThe evil spirits slowly took the forms of monsters and bad energy thatäó† äó†causedäó† äó†the humanäó»s to suffer. Pandora, feeling responsible for the misery she unwittingly caused, made a deal with Elpis. She and Epimetheus would sacrifice their long lives and immortality to give Elpis strength to help the humans. Elpis agreed on the condition that she would gift their descendants with the ability to trap the evil spirits back into the jar and she would stay with them until their mission was accomplished.ŒæThus, the Pangakos family came to be, and to this day they seek to seal Pandoraäó»s box once and for all....ŒæWhat do you get?Œæ$1 - Access to our blog and updates about the Kickstarter!Œæ$10 - An adorable sticker sheet with 6 baby monsters!ŒæŒæ15$ - A digital pdf of the book!Œæ20$ - A physical copy of the book35$ - A physical copy of the book and One mini print (6x9)40$ - 2 physical copies of the book and 2 sticker sheets!Œæ50$ - A physical copy of the book and All the mini prints (6x9)ŒæWho are We?ŒæThe Writer and DesignerKara Leopard is the creator of the webcomic Mr.Hare & Mr.Bear as well as the writer of Brooke St. with artist Alex Wang. They are aŒæ professional comic book designer for BOOM! studios. Kara was also the artist for the successful kickstarter [super]natural Attraction with writer Kel McDonald. When they aren't working on comics, annoying their twin sister or playing with their cat they are currently taking classes to learn Korean! (to read more webcomics of course!) Twitter link. Portfolio.ŒæThe ArtistsŒæKelly and Nichole Matthews are a twin art team specializing in comic art and illustration. They have illustrated such works as Mairghread Scottäó»s Toil and Trouble, The Jim Henson Companyäó»s The Power of the Dark Crystal, and Hiveworkäó»s SYMBOL, by Audrey Redpath. Twitter link.ŒæPortfolio.Mini Print ArtistsŒæMonarobot is an independent artist from Chiapas (Mexico) who draws monsters inspired in Maya culture, aesthetic and mythology, she loves film and animation. We want to help our local artist community while at the same time getting you a ridiculously awesome limited offset print.ŒæAbout the Project:This project is called: Category 4 and we are making limited art prints because we want to help Puerto Rico's creative scene after hurricane Marí_a. It's been months since the hurricane passed and art spaces, artists and creative projects now face the threat of disappearing. After two hurricanes and economic struggles we are still here and will keep on fighting.By getting these unique prints, you will help artists in Puerto Rico get back on track with their creative and cultural projects.ŒæAbout the prints:ŒæThe print will be 18 x 24 inches. The proceeds will be divided between the artist and two funds for Puerto Rico relief efforts.ŒæŒæAbout the artists:ŒæLorraine Rodrí_guezŒæLives and work in San Juan, Puerto Rico. My name is Julia Spiri. I work as a freelance artist, and painting is my full-time job.I have a bacheloräó»s degree in Fine Arts. For many years I have painted portraits, and illustrations, I illustrated a range of coloring books and childrenäó»s story books. I have been painting for all my life.ŒæI live near Barcelona in Spain. My style is influenced by Pop surrealism and Whimsical, Fantasy Art.In this coloring book you will find lots of whimsical, magical characters from a gentle world of fantasy. There are 50 images to color, and images are printed on a single side of each page. Creating so many characters for this book was a very long process, but so much fun. I drew the images using a combination of traditional and digital pencil. Each of my characters is unique, different from the other and I have drawn them with a lot of love. I received my first offset copies of book! I'm soooo happy with results! The books have come out as I wanted!! Woho! It's so exciting to have a books in my hands!Œæ I have created these 3 images purely for The Whimsical Wonders book. I will not sell these images in my other shops. And as a token of gratitude my backers will also receive these 3 exclusive images in PDF file for digital downloand.When I was preparing this book, I wanted to to offer you the best of me: not only my best drawings, but also to create for you a high quality book with heavy weight paper, so that you can have an enjoyable, unforgettable coloring experience. I have tried different types of papers from several publishing companies, until finally I found premium quality paper that surpasses my expectations. It's the best paper in the market for coloring books.ŒæŒæThis high quality heavy weight paper is 118 Ib (170g) is a light cream color, and it is a delight to color in. I will strengthen the book with smyth sewing, and will add perforated pages. I already have my proof copy of the book and I have passed the pre-press approval and now the book is ready to be printed. Offset printing is the highest quality book printing available.If you page through a Smyth-sewn book, you can see the thread stitches in the center fold of each signature. Smyth-sewn binding is associated with durability and quality, and is able to stand up to years of wear and tear. This binding method is ideal for books since the pages lay flat.For that reason your book will not be broken when you use it, and The Sheets Will Not Come Off in Your Book!Whimsical Wonders: The Artistäó»s Edition will be print in the United States of America, in a factory that has a lot of experience in printing coloring books. That's why the books will be printed quickly and will not be long in arriving.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæStretch Goals are a great way to say thank you! If we go over our funding costs, I'll add some extra goodies!3,500ä‰å -ŒæYou will receive "Lulu Cat Girl" color image (8.5"x11") in PDF file for digital download.ŒæACHIEVED!5,000ä‰åŒæ -ŒæI will draw new black&white image in exclusive for backers only and I will add it in PDF file for digital download.Why Kickstarter?ŒæI'm really excited to be directly involved in getting my books out to folks!ŒæWhen will you receive your book? Production can start as soon as I have enough pledges.I have hired an efficient company  specialized in fulfillment, and that is why the shipments will be fast and almost all will be sent at the same time. I plan to start sending first books in March, but in some countries further away it may take longer to arrive (possibly last books will arrive in April).  International shipping. Books can ship anywhere in the world. ŒæSponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds. Artwork:Œæ MoreŒæArtwork in my web: juliaspiri.comŒæInstagram: @juliaspiriartŒæŒæYou can also receive a news about new projects, new painting/drawing, and more all interesting things by liking the Julia SpiriŒæFacebook page: JuliaSpiriArtSo we have lovely coloring community, share your coloring with us in our FB Group here:Œæ facebook.com/stampsbyjuliaspiri/ŒæŒæIäó»m sure youäó»ll create magnificent masterpieces!And a final thanks to all our backers for your support!ŒæMusic: www.bensound.com

For this project I want to make 100 watercolor illustrations of mythological creatures. They will be divided by cultures: Japanese, Egyptian, Nordic and pre-Hispanic. They will be scanned, printed and presented as 4 decks of cards with 25 cards each. I'm just starting, but my idea is to make two creatures per day to be on time with the schedule.ŒæI am very excited about this project because I think it is important to keep alive the curiosity that mythology awakens, feeding the imagination and teaching the world in a different way.ŒæThe original paintings:- Size: A5 (15 x 10 cm)- Watercolor + ink- Watercolor paper 300 gr.Printed:- Size: A6 (7.5 x 10 cm)- Both faces- High quality paper of 250 gr.Card decks:- 25 cards- Container boxŒæŒæŒæŒæ

Finally a patch has been created to help identify those of us who lose sleep, hair, and our vision in order to put food on the table and work towards our dreams.The patches will measure to be 2 in. x 3 in.The production cost for the patches are going to be $300 to make 100 patches. Let's create 100 limited edition signed and numbered books featuring my illustrated Sad Fish.ŒæKickstarter's Make 100 incentive inspired me to draw 100 Sad Fish and compile them into a book showcasing all the depressed, hopeless, and tragic water friends I've been dreaming of. These books are limited to an edition of 100 and will never be reprinted.I've been drawing Sad Fish in my sketchbooks for many years now and people enjoy their bittersweet pain at the comic conventions I exhibit at. Now is the time to finally produce the Sad FishŒæmenagerie that makes people happy!This is a simple Kickstarter -- we only have two reward levels.With your $12 pledge of support, you receive one limited edition signed and numbered book with one original Sad Fish art piece in a clear toploader protective sleeve.Surprise! Which fish will you get? It will be a mystery, but we can verify that your fish will be sad! Don't miss this opportunity to acquire a rare, one-of-a-kind ink drawing on paper.At the $30 level I will draw you, your friend, or family member as a Sad Fish based on a photograph you supply. You will receive the original line art on paper and a color digital avatar.Here's what to do if you need the $12 and $30 level: Click or tap to pledge at the $12 level. Then type $42 (or more if you feel inclined) in the pledge amount. That way we know you are also asking for an original commission. The $12 level is limited at 100 pledges, so that guarantees you receive a book and original Sad Fish art.ŒæHere's what to do if you want two or more custom commission Sad Fish: Click or tap to pledge at the $30 level. Then type $60 in the pledge amount. That way we know you are requesting two original commissions. Add $30 for each face you want Carolyn to turn into a Sad Fish.Thank you for considering the Sad Fish Make 100 project. I hope we can work together to make it happen!CreditsART: Carolyn BelefskiFILM: Astray ProductionsMUSIC: Waylon Thornton "Favorite Secrets"

ABOUT THE ARTISTAs a non-native, my passion for textures was born out of a desire to look at the world in my own unique way; a way that would fill my photo album with typical tourist snaps that had already been taken a thousand times before meäó_So I started taking charcoal rubbings, or as I like to call them 'touches'.ŒæI believe these simple reliefs are fingerprints of actual tactile surfaces around us, and whilst, at first they might seem quite abstract, they offer a sense of scale and allow you to focus on the intricate details that are often overlooked. My toolkit consists of a variety of soft black charcoals and Chinese Mulberry PI paper.ŒæMy commissions have taken me from the United Kingdom to Barbados and throughout the United States.ŒæKICKSTARTER 100So this is where my Kickstarter 100 project starts. I would like to create 100 touches,Œæpersonalized with your first initial a charcoal relief rubbing from New York City and surrounding boroughs.Each touch will be createdŒæusing a single, bespoke charcoal letter, made to order. The accompanying rubbing will depict one of New York's lesser-known sites (like the ones you see above). Simply let me know your choice of letter and I will find it. With your donation, you will receive a bespoke, signed 9.5" x 7.5" charcoal rubbing, (unframed). Included withinŒæyour packet will be a 4" x 4" photo (on Mohawk Superfine Eggshell, 120lb card) of the work in progress.ŒæType ExperimentsHere are a couple of experiments I took from Williamsburg, Brooklyn. I will be looking to explore touristŒæspots and stunning monuments of New York with more elaborateŒætype.ŒæŒæIf you would like to see more of my work please have a look at my Website and Instagram:Website: www.touchuponstudios.comInstagram:Œæ@touchupon

Hi! I am Catalina, a visual artist who LOVES abstracting people and sees colors everywhere. My most recent solo show, LUDO (lat. äóìplayäó), is now on view in STURM UND DRANG GALERIE, in Austria.ŒæŒæŒæŒæI have received such a positive feedback on this colorful ludic series from so many people and because I am fascinated with faces and I analyze facial features since I can remember, I have created äóìLudo Profileäó.For me, painting is playing. I have discovered this through my son and his evolution from a nursing baby to a toddler. He inspired LUDO project and he continues to inspire me in life in everything I do. He does it on two aspects: physically, by having my house full of colorful toys and seeing colors wherever I step, and emotionally, by being filled with such love and joy that I receive from him, which somehow, on an emotional level, translates into colors too. I just cannot look at the world the same way as before his arrival. Therefore, for this new project, I decided to stick with the name äóìLudoäó, that means äóìplayäó in Latin, because it is authentic, represents my reality as it is, and is something that totally defines my work.This new projectäó»s purpose is to abstract as many profile portraits as possible in order to show and emphasize the uniqueness and individuality of each and every one of us.ŒæLooking at somebody in a perfect profile angle you will notice an outline made of unique angles, distances and proportions, parameters who makes somebody recognizible out of a million other identities. This is much easier to see when you let the details go and focus on the overall shape.Œæ In äóìLudo Profileäó I am using the flat form to emphasize this uniqueness inside all of us and the color to show emotions, to depict the spirit and the personality of the individual.ŒæŒæIf you decide to be part of äóìLudo Profileäó, these are the steps we take together:1. It all starts with your photograph. You chose a profile picture (or pictures) that you would like me to paint. We should establish from the start if you prefer a digital painting or a hand-made acrylic on canvas painting.The picture should be (ideally) a perfect profile-angle portrait, like below:Note: I am open to talk to you about other portrait angles and other types of composition too.2. After this, I will ask you short questions about the person(s) in the photograph, questions that will help me create a painting with a personal impact. Now you can tell me any particularities you want me to include in the painting: favorite colors, favorite accessoires, etc. You may also include text: a personal quote, a date, something personal or something general, simple words or full sentences.3. Now your painting is in process and you will receive the high resolution file as soon as I finish the work. If you opted for a pshysical work (print or hand-made painting), this will follow by post immediately. I will deliver the works chronologically, starting with May and ending around October, depending on the number of comissions.That's it! Your profile picture is now part of the äóìLudo Profileäó and added to the e-book too!ŒæPlease spread the news and this way you'll help me continuing doing what I love! Share my work with your friends and have fun following me here:Œæwww.catalinacodreanu.comŒæor here: https://www.instagram.com/catalina__codreanu/Œæor here: https://www.facebook.com/catalinacodreanuportfolio/or directly get in touch at: catalina.codreanu@gmail.com.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

I've forever loved lacrosse--as a player, a ball boy, a ref, a coach, and always, always a fan. ŒæAnd lacrosse is constantly finding its way into my art. ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæReggie Williams aka "Macmoons" is a homeless artist in Phoenix Arizona. He has a talent that surprises everyone that passes him on the street. Macmoons just wants to be able to get his artwork out into the world and spread the joy that comes with great art. He has never taken more than simple school art classes and has been doing art his whole life but never turned it into a career. With your help Macmoons could become a household name. The funds you and others donate will directly help Reggie Williams/Macmoons pay for whatever he needs to get off the streets and into safe environment in which to create his art. The goal is to set up an online store and perhaps a physical store as well once he is safely off of the streets and has a warm bed.

Hi, my name is Alexandra but you can call me Ali. I have been drawing since before I can remember. The earliest memory I have of drawing is when I tried to draw a person for a good hour. I didn't realize there was an eraser at the end of the pencil so every time I screwed up I threw away a piece of paper. I've learned a bit since then. :)Drawing and art in general are what I live for. I love sketching with all my heart and I want to share my drawings with the world. I've watched and read about many Kickstarter success stories and naturally wanted to try one myself. I was inspired, however my fears of failure kept me from starting a project. After years of watching, I figured I needed to face my fear and take a risk. Sure, the project may not get funded but if I never try I'll never know!Speaking of funding, all money made through this project will go towards building awareness for me as an artist. The bulk of any proceeds will be used for entrance fees to art fairs or shows. This will allow me to participate in larger shows and help bring my art to new areas that I wouldn't be able to afford otherwise.ŒæAnother portion will go towards purchasing small ads with Etsy and Facebook. These ads have the ability to reach farther than I could on my own, and will hopefully catch the interest of potential clients. Any remaining proceeds will be used to purchase art supplies to continue my work.The lower tiers will receive a random drawing done with pencil. Middle tiers have perks added such as a splash of color, personalized drawing, or the use of a different medium (colored pencil, water colors, pencil, ink/marker). In the higher tiers you will have a combination of those items available. Every drawing no matter what tier it's in will be sprayed with a protective finish to avoid any smudging.I enjoy working with various mediums and styles. Below you will see some drawings that I have done in watercolor pencils, color pencils, ink/marker, and pencil.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæIf you'd like to see more of my work you can find me on Instagram (@alexandra_art_design) as well as Facebook (Alexandra Art+Design). I look forward to creating some art for you!

Essentially, a compendium of philosophies on human existence, short stories and illustrations straight from my neurosis, as much as I can fit into a short novel, without being overwhelming. I want to explore human angst, the question of how an why we are here, and provide a lucid argument for the intellectuality of christianity without preaching. My goal is to make it interesting and readable, and to revive conversationalism on a common level. I am almost finished the book, this money will help me on the last leg which I cannot fund myself. I'm asking only what I absolutely need because I would feel fraudulent otherwise. Thank you to anyone who donates! I hope to have a wonderful product for you! And to be clear, I do NOT have a college degree! I am self educated. I hope that doesn't discount me as an knowledgable person in your eyes. And yes I should have shaved for the video I apologize! And I hope to be finished by the end of march! I cant give any gaurantees that it will be picked up by a publisher, but if not I will find out how to publish it myself and make it available to everyone!

This is your chance to get a custom art portrait made of yourself, someone you love, a mentor, or an inspiration. This is not screen printing, but painting using stencils and pressurized paint. Send me an image you'd like me to immortalize and you'll get a print, or get a t-shirt that has been painted by me, or a canvas that has been painted by me.This project started when I was in high school, running for class president, needing to make campaign materials. My first ever stencil was a picture of my face with the text "Vote Bush." I won the election, and every year since I've been making bespoke stencils and t-shirts. That was 12 years ago.This is the first time I'm opening to everyone. This project is an opportunity to get a personal portrait to memorialize any moment or memory. Own something that no one else will have, and wear it or present it proudly.I enjoy the stencil as an art form because of the crisp lines. With a stencil I can make complex and intricate shapes that have extremely fine features and lines. Combine that with the ability to multiply the design over and over again on a variety of canvas, and the art form itself builds a realm for itself.ŒæThe history of graffiti and street art also brings a lot to the table when you use a stencil. In terms of democratized art and disruption are fundamental to the media.The last run of shirts I made was 50 shirts for an exhibit at the Stanford d.school called "The Aesthetics of Fame." These shirts were a conversation about what fame is and means and is reflected. If the 100 designs are created for this Make100 project it will be my biggest run ever.

DISCLAIMER: There's no swearing.This is a project based in the passion that I have for real and made up toys and all of the characters that you can think of when you limit yourself to things that could be toys.ŒæYou'd think that after how many years of toys existing and the fact that there are so many people in the world that we'd have reached complete saturation of toys and there would nothing new to think of, this of course isn't the case and luckily for all of us there's always something new whether it be something as amazing as a skateboarding Velociraptor or as mundane as a bus driver.ŒæŒæThe Idea to make this into a Zine made perfect sense to me as it allows for multiple drawings to be compiled into a relatively small and easy to share medium which means I can share as many drawing as possible without having to produce expensive prints which I'd have to sell at a higher price. I want everyone to feel the same childlike joy I feel when drawing these toys and so want to keep it as cheap as possible.ŒæThe Zine itself will be 30 pages minimum (with more pages if there's time) with the inner pages being black and white and the front cover being colour. The front cover will be made as the same paper as the inner pages which will be a minimum of 160gsm but I am aiming for thicker paper if I can get it printed double sided and still keep a good finish without it being to thick.If you've read this far then you may be wondering why I keep calling them "Toys" when they'reŒæclearly "Figures" and in all honesty its no other reason than the fact that I prefer the word toys....Thanks for taking to time to look over this project.Kind RegardsVHS REX

äóìSalier Sketchbookäó es un proyecto en conjunto con una de las artistas mexicanas que por aí±os hemos admirado, su trabajo ha inspirado la creacií_n de diversas historias, sus cí_mics y personajes son í_nicos y eso es lo que hemos querido compartir con ustedes al crear este proyecto.ŒæEl Sketchbook estíç pensado para emular la sensacií_n de las libretas reales de Abi.ŒæEn este Sketchbook encontraríçs gí©neros de: fantasí_a í©pica, fanarts e ilustraciones originales de la misma autora, todo con contenido PG15.ŒæŒæŒæCon una trayectoria de míçs de dos dí©cadas, sus libretas de dibujo han recabado miles de historias y hoy queremos traer parte de estas a la vida. Ilustradora mexicana, artista independiente, Abi ha trabajado en diversos proyectos y apoyado diversas causas, su talento la ha llevado a compartir enseí±ando a nií±os y jí_venes tanto en reconocidas escuelas de arte como en proyectos sociales.La idea de esta editorial siempre ha sido hacer las cosas que nos gustan, apoyar los proyectos y los artistas que tanto nos llenaban. Llevamos casi tres aí±os trabajando en diversos proyectos del sector privado y, ahora, hemos al fin decidido dar paso a nuestros propios proyectos y a los artistas en que creemos.Œæ ŒæCon este Sketchbook de Abi damos inicio a esta nueva etapa llena de grandes proyectos y apoyando distintos talentos.Gracias por el apoyo y por creer en todos nosotros.ŒæŒæŒæLos Originales (5)ŒæŒæSi esta meta se logra, extenderemos el tiraje inicial para poder ofrecer el libro en convenciones y por pedido.Esta meta esta pensada para el prí_ximo Artbook de Abigail; si llegamos a esta meta, comenzaremos a trabajar inmediatamente el prí_ximo libro con el arte erí_tico que tanto la caracteriza, esto cubrirí_a los primeros gastos de diseí±o y pruebas.ŒæSi llegamos a alcanzar esta meta, por parte de Minaya Editorial y Abigail Salier, abrirí_amos un Taller especial de 3 sesiones para creacií_n de personajes, historia y dibujo para patrocinadores locales y tutoriales digitales para quienes no puedan asistir.Mil gracias por apoyarnos, por creer en nosotros.Y gracias a Abi por tener fe y confiarnos esta labor.ŒæMinaya EditorialŒæŒæ

Hi, I'm Heather, and I've been a mixed media artist, costumer and crafter my entire adult life. I've also been a Tarot deck lover and collector for decades. As an artist, it has long been a dream of mine to design a deck. And I've now decided to bring that idea to life!At the 2017 Burning Man event, I was gifted a Tarot card by one of my camp-mates. The card I randomly pulled from the deck was The Tower, symbolizing something overthrown to begin anew. My twin sister, who was camping with me, casually asked if I ever did anything with the tarot  drawings I had once started. The card and the question became seeds, my experience at Burning Man was the catalyst. Like lightning, inspiration struck. Back from Burning Man, I began to draw the Playa Flame Tarot.ŒæThe deck is based on traditional tarot themes and images, but also reflects my experiences with the people, art and culture of Burning Man.ŒæI sketched like a madwoman for three months and completed all the preliminary drawings for the 78 card tarot deck.  Then I started painting, transferring the line work to watercolor paper, and hand-painting the images. I will soon complete all the final artwork, within a month, and be ready to have the cards printed.ŒæIn alignment with the Burning Man principle of Gifting, I plan to print at least 40 decksŒæ of the Playa Flame Tarot to give away at Burning Man 2018. Gifting is a vital part of Burning Man culture, and a key objective to this project.The deck will not be offered for sale (supporting the BM principle of Decommodification); the only way to get a deck will be by being gifted one or by contributing to the project here on Kickstarter so that you get one as a reward. ŒæIn backing the Playa Flame Tarot, you gift yourself and others.ŒæAll the monies pledged will go toward printing gifting decks, plus printing and shipping for any additional decks and cards needed to fulfill backers' rewards, and to cover fees here at Kickstarter. I have pre-invested art materials, paper and paints, time and creative effort it, and I'll continue until the Playa Flame Tarot is a reality.To reflect more of the Burning Man theme, I have made some changes from the traditional cards. The tarot suits have been changed from Pentacles, Wands, Swords, and Cups to Dust, Flames, Aerials and Waters. I've also altered a few of the titles of cards in the Major Arcana. For instance, the Chariot becomes "Art Car",Œæ the Hierophant becomes "Ranger", and the Tower becomes "Burn".Here are a few samples of the preliminary sketches and finished paintings for this project.  More of the project artwork may be viewed on my blog.Œæhttp://e-phemerart.blogspot.comŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæSample cards are printed tarot size, 2.75 x 4.75 on 300 gsm smooth card stock. This Kickstarter will fund a project that will create the cover and illustrations for a new fully illustrated book about early cinematography, How ToFilm MovingPicturesin the1910s, as well as the logotype for the upcoming Moving Picture Reprint Series series of books.The cover and illustrations will be designed by Marlene Weisman.Œæ The proposed front cover is shown in this campaign's page banner.How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910s centers around How to Take And Make Moving Pictures, an extremely rare instruction book published in 1914 by the Ford Optical Company of Denver, Colorado.It will be about 240 pages and full of carefully Photoshopped booklets, instructions, notes, and supplementary materials that will explain the basics of how to operate a professional hand cranked moving picture camera and how the film was processed.Œæ All from a mid-1910s perspective.This includes extremely rare sales booklets for Eberhard Schneider film and cinema equipment, price lists, photos, and pamphlets from the 1910s.This campaign is also the start of the new book series called the Moving Picture Reprint Series that publishes technical books about the early days of cinema and even pre-cinema.Œæ  How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910s will be number two in this series and number three is nearly completed.Œæ My first book 1907 Chicago Projecting Co.'s Entertainer's Supplies Catalog No. 122: Deluxe Reprint is unofficially #1.It will be printed by Blurb and will eventually be made available for sale on Amazon.com.This Kickstarter covers all production costs for the artwork, book proofs,ŒæKickstarteräó»s 5% fee, and payment processing fees (between 3% and 5%), and shipping boxes and materials. Any extra funding above these will cover the difference in the cost for shipping world wide, which can be over $30 for many places overseas. $25 for Canada.As of right now How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910s is 99% finished.Œæ The text and interior layout is completed and I have all of the packing material here ready to ship. (All books will be shipped in new boxes.)

With the help of Kickstarter, and some very lovely backers, I was recently able to realise the dream of creating my very first enamel pin. So, fresh from the success of my first project I've been inspired to have another crack at it.2018 marks 100 years since the first women in the UK won the right to vote. As a passionate voter myself, I wanted to create a new pin to mark the occasion. Where better to draw inspiration than from the powerful legacy of The Suffragettes, after all I wouldn't be able to make a single mark on any ballot paper without their courageous campaigning.The PinFor my design, I've particularly drawn on the iconic purple, green and white Suffragette colour palette, which was often also reflected in the jewellery they wore at the time. Throughout history weäó»ve seen how important it is to speak up to effect change. So when you may be feeling frustrated and overwhelmed with the state of things, I hope this pin can help pick you back up and encourage you to keep making your mark. Just a small X in a box can be a powerful tool!If I exceed all my expectations and reach an amazing Œ£400 I will unlock another pin design for my fab backers to choose from. ŒæŒæThe Pin (if unlocked)If I manage to go and completely smash all my goals, after picking my jaw up off the floor, I will look at adding even more exciting stretch goals.NEW STRETCH GOAL!ŒæThe Patch (if unlocked)I've put my thinking cap on to come up with a brand new stretch goal for the campaign. Variety's the spice of life, as they say, so I've ventured into a whole new medium for this one äóñ patches. My concept design above is for an iron-on embroidered patch, using my 'Deeds Not Words' design as inspiration. The merrowed edge and embroidered text are in a nice dark purple, so they really stand out.New patch and pin combo reward tiers have now been added.For those super backers out there, you will be able to pick one of my hand embroidered Suffragette necklaces from those available in my Etsy shop at the end date of this project. A few examples of which you can see below.Extra Treat! As a thank you for helping me fund my campaign all backers will now get a free 'Deeds Not Words' cross stitch design with their rewards. An example of which you can see below that I turned in to a necklace.ŒæFundingThe money raised for this project will go towards the production costs, postage and packing and Kickstarter fees.

Hey everyone, my name is Michelle (also known as LabradoriteWolf on Facebook, Instagram and Deviantart) and I recently graduated as a biologist. I've always wanted to see my designs come to life in a physical form, something you can hold, or wear.ŒæEnter the enamel pin! They are small, easy to fly across the ocean and relatively inexpensive to make. The only trouble is you have to manufacture them in large batches, which is quite tough when you have no budget to take risks. Therefore, I decided to give the project a shot here on kickstarter, and that's where you come in.ŒæMy first pin design features a timber wolf, a creature that's linked to many myths and stories. For centuries, the wolf has been seen as evil, a bad omen, while in more recent years, it has been put in a more positive light. With these pins I hope to emphasize that the wolf is not an animal to fear, but to admire.ŒæThe pin design comes in different color variations, which I matched to the Sun, the Moon and the Stars. I chose this specific celestial theme, as wolves are often tied to celestial bodies in myths.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæWith this money I will be able to manufacture the Sun and the Stars variation of the timber wolf enamel pin, as the same mold can be reused for different colors when the same plating is used (gold in this case).ŒæOnce this goal is reached, I will be able to manufacture the Moon variation of the pin as well!ŒæA fourth design will be unlocked!ŒæA fifth design will be unlocked!A sixth design will be unlocked!Once the project is successfully funded, you get the chance to choose from the available, unlocked designs. Which designs are available will depend on whether additional stretch goals have been reached or not. You can also choose to get multiple pins of the same design.ŒæIf you choose the Fan Backer Package, you will get an additional reward, an illustrated digital portrait of a pet or other animal of your choice, made by me, the artist! Examples of my animal portraits can be found below and on Instagram/Deviantart at LabradoriteWolf:ŒæŒæThe project will raise money to pay for:Œæ

I want to start by saying I am very excited about this project and I appreciate you coming by to check it out!ŒæI have spent my entire life working as both a cartoonist and a writer, yet rarely have had the opportunity to combine these things into one massive collaboration.Œæ I've written and self published the all words/no pictures novel MEMOIRS OF AN ANTIHERO and also the Kickstarter funded children's book ALDO TANNERS! WHERE ARE YOUR MANNERS?! (arted and writed by me)My next endeavor cleverly and sadistically combines a few of my all time passions; writing (specifically alliteration), cartooning and horror movies! The new children's style book NURSERY CRIMES : THE ABCs OF HORROR is a collected work inspired by some of pop culture's most influential horror icons.ŒæŒæEach letter will be represented by two different characters with both a unique and fun cartoon rendering done by me as well as an alliterative caption to fully utilize the chosen letter.ŒæI have spent the past year working on this project, with almost 40 characters already completed. With this book I plan on filling the entire second alphabet, as well as tinkering with the already existing characters. I want this book to bursting forth with the best of the best!Œæ These are the characters that have inspired me throughout my life and I want to do each and every one of them justice! With your help I can finally make it happen!ŒæŒæŒæI really want to get people involved with this new project. I will be updating regularly and keeping everyone in the loop with my progress and even some of the creative process.Œæ Along with the book, you also have an opportunity to snatch up some amazing rewards!There will be prints, flashcards, stickers, t-shirts and this will also be my first foray into enamel pins!ŒæOn top of all this, you will even have a chance to immortalize yourself in my fun and haunting NURSERY CRIMES style, along with your very own alliterative caption that I will write just for you!!ŒæWith this campaign I will be personally thanking EVERY backer in my book, but certain levels will enable you to have your image printed on the thank you pages as well! Two lucky backers will even be able to pick a pop culture horror icon to be represented in the book!Thank you so much for stopping by! I look forward to working with all of you!Œæ

Two years ago, I challenged myself in creating a short video every day. It started as an opportunity to deepen my knowledge of video making and to explore what creativity means when applied with such an intensity and continuity over time.Last year I kept the challenge but moved it to a different media: illustration. Once again, I wanted to practice something I don't do enough and do it, again, every day. What came out of it, is a journey of my year 2017: places I visited, people I met, travels I did, details I noticed, feelings transferred into drawings. Now we are in 2018 and I would love to print a book reproducing my sketchbook in its original format, paper and details to make it available to everybody as a piece of fine art and inspiration. ŒæŒæThe final product will be as close to the original as possible, printed in high quality and with handmade interventions to reproduce the flaws and wear of the original one. Each will come with an individual handwritten note from myself.ŒæŒæMy main goal is to make a product that people can enjoy just by looking at it and, above all, something that will hopefully help them in finding their daily motivation and inspiration to create. ŒæYou will find other extracts from the pages below...Please help me make this dream come true, pre-buy your copy and choose your level of reward. Thank you!ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

In 1892, we wore carnations.ŒæIn 1930, we wore monocles.ŒæIn 1973, we wore leather.ŒæIn 1995, we wore flannel.Queer people have been sending messages to each other through clothes and accessories for ages, and weäó»ve always had ways to find each other in a crowd. Queer Looks celebrates a selection of iconic aesthetics and symbols used by queer folks in the west from the last 150 years, through both a gorgeous fashion illustration zine and two emblematic enamel pins!About the zine:Queer Looks brings together seven amazing illustrators to create a survey of queer aesthetics and worn symbols from the 1800s to the near-present. The looks span from carnation codes in the 1890s, to the queer blues divas of the 1920s and 30s, and even to the denim and pins trends of the present day. The zine contains 12 gorgeous fashion-plate-style illustrations and is 16 pages in total.ŒæEDIT:ŒæThe zine will now be 20 pages long, with 13 illustrations and 3 extra pages of information about the zine's looks!About the pins:ŒæOne, a sleek, elegant peacock feather. In the 1800s, as with now, style of dress was a whole visual language and a peacock feather worn on the lapel was just one of many possible indicators that the wearer might not fit the heteronormative mold.Another, a good oläó» carabiner and ring of keys. A key ring clipped to a belt loop has been an understated, recognizable sign of queerness (specifically and most commonly a lesbian symbol) for decades, but it also represents a strength and comfort of identity that departs from sexuality. One more, a double-bladed axeäóîthe Minoan labrys. It was an essential symboläóîand agricultural tooläóîin the ancient matriarchal society of Knossos, and found a resurgence as a lesbian symbol and a symbol of women's rights in the 1970s and '80s. This pin was unlocked as the $3000 stretch goal!  The last, a simple black ring. Popularized on AVEN in the mid-2000s, the black ring has become a symbol of solidarity and a means of self identification for asexual folks. Harkening back to roman symbolism, the black represents both internal and external protection. This pin was unlocked as the $6500 stretch goal!Each pin is hard enamel, about 1äó at its longest point, and comes with a rubber clutch. Wildfeather is set in gold metal, Ring of Keys is set in gunmetal, and Labrynth and Caldera are set in silver. Wildfeather, Ring of Keys, and Labrynth were designed by Zora Gilbert; Caldera was designed by Cat Parra!Seven incredible illustrators (and editor Zora Gilbert) have come together to bring these queer looks to life! If you loved the work in Dates, youäó»re definitely a fan of these folks. Our illustrators are:ŒæWe've curated reward tiers just for you! Below is a sampling of the ones we thought you'd like most. If you can't find the precise collection you want in our reward tiers, we've still got you coveredäóîjust scroll on down to the Add Ons section to see how much you should add to your pledge.$4: LITTLE LOOK.ŒæGet the DRM-free PDF!$6: LOOK BOOK. Get a physical copy of the zine and the DRM-free PDF!$10: ESSENTIAL ACCENT.A single Wildfeather pinäóî1", gold metal, hard enamel, rubber clutch.$10: KEY PIECES.ŒæA single Ring of Keys pinäóî1", gunmetal, hard enamel, rubber clutch.$10: ABSOLUTELY SLAYING.ŒæA single Labrynth pinäóî1", silver metal, hard enamel, rubber clutch.$10: BIT OF FLARE.ŒæA single Caldera pinäóî1", silver metal, hard enamel, rubber clutch.$15: ENSEMBLE (Wildfeather).The zine, the DRM-free PDF, and a single Wildfeather pin!$15: ENSEMBLE (Ring of Keys).ŒæThe zine, the DRM-free PDF, and a single Ring of Keys pin!$15: ENSEMBLE (Labrynth).ŒæThe zine, the DRM-free PDF, and a single Labrynth pin!$15: ENSEMBLE (Caldera).ŒæThe zine, the DRM-free PDF, and a single Caldera pin!$25: CATWALK.ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, and two enamel pins!$35: FASHION WEEK. Get the zine, the DRM-free PDF, and three enamel pins!ŒæŒæ$45: COMPLETE COLLECTION.ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, and four enamel pins!$100: SILHOUETTE (Dante Luiz)ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, the full set of pins AND a commission by Dante Luiz! Dante will draw you a full body portrait with simple background features and black-and-white linework. Just one slot left!$100: SILHOUETTE (Erica Chan)ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, the full set of pins AND a commission by Erica Chan! Erica will draw you a half-body portrait with simple background features, black-and-white linework, and simple tones. Just one slot left!$100: SILHOUETTE (Lauren Dombrowski)ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, the full set of pins AND a commission by Lauren Dombrowski! Lauren will draw you a full body portrait with simple props, black-and-white linework, and color accents. Just two slots left!$100: SILHOUETTE (TelíÈnia Albuquerque)ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, the full set of pins AND a commission by TelíÈnia Albuquerque! TelíÈnia will draw you a half-body portrait with simple background features and full color. Just five slots left!$100: SILHOUETTE (Val Wise)ŒæGet the zine, the DRM-free PDF, the full set of pins AND a commission by Val Wise! Val will draw you a full body portrait with simple props and full color. Just four slots left!Want an extra pin, an extra zine, or an item from a previous campaign? Now's your chance! This is your chance to get Dates 1, Dates 2, or the Dates 2Œæenamel pin with free or deeply discounted shipping (please note, though, that the prices for the paperback copies ofŒæDates 1Œæand 2 are a little higher for international buyers to incorporate some shipping cost)!To summarize, in searchable text:For this project, we have just oneŒæmajor stretch goal: a third pin!EDIT: We introducedäóîand unlockedäóîa second stretch goal: CALDERA, our fourth enamel pin!Unlocked: LABRYNTH, the double-headed axe pin! 2/17///// UPDATE! We've hit the goal!! Stretch goals have been added below the deck descriptions! I'll be adding new ones as we move along ^___^2/28///// UPDATE! We've officially cleared all stretch goals! Check them out below the deck descriptions!The Neon Moon Tarot is a fully illustrated, 78-card tarot deck set in a retro-futuristic cyberpunk world using the archetypes and themes of a RWS tarot deck. Backers can expect a gritty urban hi-tech setting with a limited neon palette and heavy black inks.ŒæI've been able to work with different production sources to bring two different versions to this Kickstarter. The deck is available in both standard and pocket editions(details below).Using the unique flexibility and depth of symbolism in the tarot, the Neon Moon deck emphasizes atmosphere and world-building. The RWS archetypes are alive and well here, merged with cyberpunk themes.ŒæThe Neon Moon Tarot lives in its own unique world and does its best to bring you along. It asks you to use your gut to read meaning from the cards with intuition. But you aren't left out in the cold. Each card has associated keywords and quotes to get you started. If you'd like, you canŒæ check them out right now at www.neonmoontarot.comŒæŒæŒæŒæThe standard edition of The Neon Moon Tarot Deck measuresŒæ2.75 by 4.75 inches, and is printed on 300 GSM coated card stock. It comes complete with a custom rigid box and booklet.ŒæŒæŒæŒæThe pocket edition of The Neon Moon Tarot measures 57 by 97 millimeters on 14 pt C2S coated card stock, and comes with a custom tuck box.ŒæThanks to all of your support, we've hit the goal as of 2/17! Here are some extra goodies to look forward to as funding continues!ŒæThe Neon Moon setting is my original take on a cyberpunk world. You'll see the usual themes of hi-tech low-life, A.I., cyborgs, corporations run amok, and more. For my version of the world, there is a divisive plate separating the rich and powerful from the masses underneath.ŒæThe suit names have changed, along with the court cards, to better reflect the cyberpunk interpretation of this deck. They are as follows:ŒæAbove the plate, people can live essentially forever through a mixture of memory backups, clones, and "gene-therapy", which has resulted in a very strict society under constant surveillance by the most powerful members who have been alive for hundreds of years and in that time have accumulated power and wealth. The court cards effectively play the roles of those most powerful members of this society living on top of the world.ŒæFor the minor pips, they depict life beneath the plate. I've strayed a bit from convention and things are more of a neon-lit, urban mad max than they are Neo-Tokyo. People are mostly too poor to advertise to, so most of the advertisements are aimed at pure necessities. Gangs roam what's left of the streets, sponsored militias run through on orders from above the plate, poverty is rampant and conflict is everywhere. People live short and violent lives of desperate struggle, and find hope and strength through banding together with friends.ŒæOutdated robots, discarded from above, hack into each others' firmware with updates giving their A.I. freedom. Gene-therapy is largely experimental and therefore much less stable than above the plate.ŒæPeople have started giving themselves vanity alterations in addition to performance enhancing ones. The internet is patched from a local mesh of wires that are strung from building to building, from the underside of the plate down to the ground. This accounts for the imagery of the minor pips. Previous ideas of what it means to be human, imposed by the ruling class, struggle against the people who remake themselves into a thousand different versions of humanity.And yet something new arrives with a strange, neon pink full moon. Magic begins to surface in the city, along with strange occurrences and impossibilities. Somehow, it seems to be relative in power to the waxing and waning of the moon.ŒæEach card is meant to evoke a particular piece of this world, using the archetypes available from the Rider-Waite-Smith tarot. I chose tarot specifically to bring this setting to life as it allowed me to emphasize the ambiance and themes of the world while letting a larger cast of characters be depicted than other mediums would comfortably allow. As with any tarot deck, every card has a piece of story behind it, and every combination of cards tells a different story.ŒæŒæŒæŒæOut of the goal of $5500, funds are estimated to be allocated accordingly:The estimated timeline, and product status is as follows:ŒæŒæI'm James Brothwell, and this is both my second Kickstarter campaign, and my second complete tarot deck. My first campaign for The Sinking Wasteland TarotŒæwas fortunate enough to not just fund, but to hit all of its stretch goals as well! I've previously been involved with comics, computer games, movies, and the odd commission work that's landed me in strange and exciting places.ŒæThanks to the success of the last campaign, I was able to put my nose to the grindstone and finish up The Neon Moon Tarot, and I'm very pleased to be able to offer it for you all now. I started work on this in the last couple of months of 2016 and only recently finished artwork for the last of the cards at the end of January 2018.ŒæI'm hoping that this deck will speak to those who, like me, are sometimes left wanting for a tarot deck that depicts a more urban environment, and incorporates technology throughout.Introduction videoŒæMusic by Gavin Luke.Explanation video music by TeknoAXE.Images represent prototypes. Final product may differ slightly.I do offer worldwide shipping but I'm sorry to say that I have little control over shipping costs or customs fees. If you order from outside of the US, please be aware that I've done my best to keep weights down, prices affordable, and shipping tracked. Still, some things are simply beyond my control.ŒæFinally, thank you to all of the backers, friends, strangers, and fellow internet oddities whose enthusiasm and support allows projects like this to exist and thrive. Much love. <3

MAKE/100-KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE115 PAGES OF BLACK AND WHITE ART EXPANDED ART BOOKŒæBIO: I started my career in comics in 1990 with Midnight Screams #2 from Scream Queen Comics published by Jack Slattery. The 8 page story called Neverwhere was the beginning of what will be a 25 year ride into the depths of self-publishing Hell! My creations went on to gather cult followings such as RAZOR, CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY (currently on Netflix), STRYKE, MORBID ANGEL, HEXANNE, HELL RIOT, TOMMI GUNN and many many more. By the mid 1990's the term "badgirl comics" was a common phrase in stores all over the world with my name as the "godfather" of the phrase, due to the success of my top female flagship titles. I was able to write my own rules as I created most of the 5 million books I self-published. I illustrated only a handful of books in the 90's, but since my rebirth back into the graphic novel world via Kickstarter (RAZOR:SCARS currently in production) I am drawing and writing everything I produce from now on.KICKSTART THE INDIE MOVEMENT, EVERY BIT HELPSŒæI plan to tour the convention circuit with my wife and fellow creator and wife Michele in hopes to shake all the hands of the fans that have helped my career along the way. This is 100% how we make our living and some months are thinner than other months, but the love for creating keeps us going through the good times and the bad.INK and BLOOD EXPANDEDFollow snapshot sample of my career and spreads it over 120 pages of raw pencil and ink illustrations from conventions, fan art commissions as well as samples from upcoming graphic novel plus a few stories of what got me into drawing, my inspirations, my driving force. Pictures and even old fan letters that I kept dear to my heart as a reminder of why I'm doing what I'm doing and no matter how dim things get, it's worth it to keep going.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

Hello, I'm Katherine C. Perry, also known as Thimsy, and I'm a freelance artist and illustrator. I am a mostly self-taught artist, with 15 years of sketchbooks weighing down my shelves, and multiple academic degrees in art sitting in a box somewhere. I am mostly inspired by video games, comics, natural history and mythology. As an artistically shy hermit, I've only been a part of one art show and this is what I feel to be my first real artistic foray out into the world. You can find me on Facebook, Etsy, Instagram and Patreon.My artistic style is usually described as whimsical and a little macabre with a lot of fine detail. UNFATHOMABLEŒæis a coloring book for grown ups that follows my artistic focus whichŒæis primarily on women and creatures from myth and legend. Why? Because, I am a woman, and I've had an interest in mythology since I was old enough to look at a book cover and go "Ooh pretty!". As I worked on this project my focus and style shifted a bit so I hope you enjoy seeing the transition.Coloring books are a great way for people of all ages to unplug and unwind while creating something beautiful with your creative spirit. UNFATHOMABLEŒæis a coloring book geared towards adults because some of the imagery may not be appropriate for young-uns and, really, adults need to unwind too.I've created 26 ink drawings for you to color, glue sequins and glitter on, or even use macaroni. You could even have a wine and chocolate night with friends and use your spilled Cabernet and a melted Dove chocolate bar to finger paint, if you so desire. The possibilities are as endless as your imagination! Unlike a lot of coloring books, each page is one-sided. So you won't have to ever choose between two drawings you like when you want to tear out your masterpiece and post it on your fridge.ŒæThe UNFATHOMABLEŒæcoloring book will be softcover, 8"x10", with a total of 26 ink drawings and 56 pages. It will be printed by an online printer with the initial copies being printed with the funds raised through this Kickstarter campaign.Why Kickstarter?Kickstarter is a great platform for creators to share their projects and places the growth of a project back in the hands of creators and backers. As with all Kickstarter projects, if the $3,500.00 goal is not met, the project will end and no funds will be withdrawn from the backers. If the project does meet the goal, the funds will be withdrawn from the backers and the project will proceed and be completed by me.How will your money be allocated?ŒæGood question:Most of the money will go towards printing costs, some will go towards packaging and bonus stuff, and the rest will go towards processing and Kickstarter fees.Because you should see the awesome coloring adventures that await you.That means, if the proof copy looks as good as it should, I'll be able to place an order for the coloring books once the project is funded. You won't have to wait around for me to finish the illustrations.ŒæI'm also currently working on additional illustrations as a preemptive measure in case the stretch goals are met. I'm doing this so that there is as little time as possible between when the project is backed and when you get the coloring book and swag in the mail!If the $3,500 goal is met, I will be including a Kickstarter Exclusive 5"x7" mini print and sticker of the illustration Desert Rose to any backer who backed a physical reward! Desert Rose WILL NEVER be produced again!This is my first Kickstarter so I've tried to keep my goal relatively modest. Consequently, if the goal of $3,500.00 is met, there are a number of stretch goals you can unlock! So share this project with your friends and earn goodies! Stretch goal goodies are applied to every pledge with a physical reward.GOAL 1 of $4,000.00Œæ UNLOCKS:- 1 Bookmark! It will be of one of the illustrations from the coloring book and will be uncoated and double sided so you can actually color it and then proudly use it!GOAL 2 of $5,000.00 UNLOCKS:- 3 Mini Prints! They will be 5"x7" uncoated mini prints that you can color! You can choose which 3 mini prints you'd like from the 26 illustrations in the book!GOAL 3 of $7,500.00 UNLOCKS:- 8 Additional Illustrations! That means you'll have an extra 8 drawings to make pretty! Why 8? Because the pages are one sided and the printing process likes page counts divisible by 4. I may be artsy fartsy but I try to be practical and not waste paper.GOAL 4 of $10,000.00 UNLOCKS:- 12 Additional Illustrations! Wow, my hand is going to hurt after this! So if you unlock Goal 4 that means you get a total of 20 extra illustrations in your coloring book, for a total of 46. That's a lot of coloring!The fun part! All the pledge tiers and the goodies you can acquire!Pledge $1 or More: Crisp High Five! - Thank you for your pledge to help this dream come true!Pledge $5 or More: Mini Print!Œæ- Receive 1 5"x7" uncoated Mini Print to color and keep!Pledge $10 or More: Early Bird Special! (Limit 25) - Receive 1 copy of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!Pledge $15 or More: Coloring Book! - Receive 1 copy of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!Pledge $20 or More: Coloring Book + Mini Print! - Receive 1 copy of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book andŒæ1 5"x7" uncoated Mini Print to color and keep!Pledge $25 or More: Signed Coloring Book + Doodle! - Receive 1 signed copy of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book with an ink doodle on the title page!Pledge $28 or More: TWO Coloring Books! -ŒæReceive 2 copies of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!Pledge $40 or More: THREE Coloring Books! -ŒæReceive 3 copies of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!Pledge $62 or More: FIVE Coloring Books! -ŒæReceive 5 copies of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!Pledge $100 or More: Ink Drawing Commission Pack! (Limit 5)Œæ- FULLY BACKED! - Receive 1 signed copy of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book with an ink doodle on the title page,Œæ1 5"x7" uncoated Mini Print to color and keep, and a single 9"x12" ink drawing commission in my art style on Bristol paper. No explicit content.Pledge $120 or More: TEN Coloring Books! -ŒæReceive 10 copies of the UNFATHOMABLE coloring book!To help make this Kickstarter successful post-funding, please keep in mind the following:Valid Email & Physical AddressesPlease make sure that the email you have listed on Kickstarter is one that is valid and you check often. After the end of the campaign, I will be sending out surveys and the longer it takes you to complete the survey, the longer it will take for you to receive your reward.Please also make sure that you correctly spell and lay out your physical address in the survey. I will be copying and pasting your address exactly as you write it, so accuracy is key. If your rewards are returned to me due to an incorrect address, I will reach out to you and you will need to repay for shipping. In the case of an address change after you complete the survey, please update your address in your backer survey and message me as soon as you can!Updated Credit Card Information:Please check that your credit card information is up to date before the end of the funding period. If it is not up to date, when funding is over, your pledge will be declined and you will be dropped as a backer. (If this happens accidentally, you can contact me and I can provide alternate payment options to make sure you receive your reward!)Thank you so much for taking the time to read all of this and consider backing my project. I really hope that you do! Please share!

Prior to lives of piety and miraculous events they were often just regular folk like you and me, getting into trouble and doing silly things like living in a hollow chestnut tree or smashing a priest's nose with a rock or even corralling the enemies of their tribe into a hut and burning it all down into aŒæsmoldering ruin of ash and spite.While he wasn't known for immolating his enemies, Honore (or Honoratus in the Latin tongue) was evidently enough of a rascal as a child that when his former nursemaid heard that he had been appointed Bishop of Amiens, she struck her baker's peel to the ground and announced that she would believe it when her peel grew into a tree. Legend has it that her peel took root and grew into a mulberry tree that bore both flower and fruit.Honore was attributed with a variety of miracles. On one occasion during Mass, as Honore was holding the Host at the consecration, he experienced a vision of the hand of Christ holding the Host at that very same moment. This particular miracle is recorded within this illustration.Œæ A chapel was built in his honor, and it was at this chapel that local bakers formed their guild.Eventually canonized, Honore was appointed patron saint of bakers (as well as confectioners, bakers of altar bread, candle-makers, florists, flour merchants, corn chandlers, oil refiners, and pastry chefs). All religious aspects aside, he was a humble man who did good things and is now eternally associated with bread. You go, Honore!Inspired in equal parts by the tale of Honore and threats from my friend the pastry chef to cut off my weekly supply of freshly baked sweets, I have produced what I think is a lovely print honoring St. Honore and I am releasing it here on Kickstarter.The St. Honore print is being released in the following formats:ŒæŒæŒæPLUS! There are also the following one-of-a-kind rewards for the collector:Portfolio bundle:ŒæArtist's proofs and original pencil sketch, plus 1 each mini-card, small print, 24k signed & numbered full-size print.Original artwork bundle:ŒæOriginal 14" x 17" black & white ink artwork w/ 24k gold leaf, personalized letter from the artist, plus 1 each mini-card, small print, and #1 in the 24k signed & numbered full-size print edition. The original artwork will be gilded prior to shipping (and I'll post a photo of the gilded work as an update so you know what you're getting).As a final note, every print is produced in my own workshop using pigmented inks on Epson Cold Press Bright Signature Worthy archival papers (100% cotton fiber, acid-free, lignin-free, 340gsm). Although prints are rated for 200+ years, no guarantees are made as to their longevity (but don't hang them in direct sunlight and they should outlast you).Need an extra one of these and two of those? Once you make a pledge, you can adjust your pledge and simply increase it by however much you need to for a given reward. Once the funding period is over, I'll send out a backer survey where there will be a space for you to tell me exactly what the extra money is for.Add $2.00 per additional mini-cardAdd $10.00 per additional small printAdd $30.00 per additional bespoke printAdd $95.00 per additional 24k signed & numbered printStretch goals can get really confusing really quickly and I may yet be tipsy from carnival season in New Orleans so I'd like to keep it simple:Œæ$1,500 GOAL: If funding reaches $1,500.00 then every backer will also receive 1 mini-card as a thank you!$6,000 GOAL: If funding reaches $6,000.00 then every backer pledgingŒæ$35.00 or more will receive a laser-etched acrylic 'coin' depicting St. Honore as a special bonus!The artwork is done and I only need a few backers to purchase the inks and paper to begin producing the prints. I expect that I'll begin shipping mid-April 2018. The production of promised stretch goals could impact the production schedule, but not significantly (see Risks and Challenges below).Boring, but important.US backers: Shipping is covered in the cost of the pledge. Whee!International backers: Please add the indicated amount to help defray the additional cost of shipping. Please consider the small extra charge meeting half-way.In some countries, customs duties may be applied to to your reward and I have no way of predicting if theyäó»ll apply to yours. Customs inspections seem to be very arbitrary and while most rewards scoot through without any extra duties, a few of you may find that a fee has been slapped on. I canäó»t predict it or avoid it, and I will not fudge the value of the reward in an effort to evade them.PLUSŒæif you are an international backer and receive a tracking number for your reward, please track your package daily! Sometimes rewards will get hung up in the system and returned to me and then things may get awkward. Monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptlyäóîbefore the authorities send the package back to me.
ŒæŒæ

I'm asking you to give me money so that I can hold an online design competition. I will create a website that has a call for submissions. I want all kinds of designers: theme park designers, architects, artists, chefs, little kids, furniture makers, sculptors and any and all creative types to submit their ideas for a one mile stretch of wall along the border of the United States and Mexico.ŒæSure they'll pay for the wall but not my contest. I won't charge an entry fee to enter the contest because it's about building bridges not walls. All the money I raise in this campaign up to $5525 will go for prize money. I chose that amount because there are 5525 miles of border between the US and Mexico. So the winner will receive $3000. Then there'll be second and third place prizes. Second place is $1000 and third is $500. That leaves a little money to build the website and administer the contest. My math is pretty bad - probably after fees that doesn't leave anything.You won't believe it, wait til you see. We're going to have tremendous designers submit really terrific designs. It'll really be the best design competition ever. Bigly! One thing that will help get interesting designers to submit is the prize money but once I have that I want to approach judges who can help evaluate the submissions. Established designers in a variety of different fields will add credibility and interest. But first, I need money.How will I get these judges? Good question. ŒæI'm Steve Tatham and I run the Creative Group at Universal Studios Japan. I've been in the theme park business for many years and know lots of creative people. So once I have some prize money and can guarantee this is a going concern then I'll approach well known designers to be judges. Then we'll make a website and then people can begin to submit their awesome designs!
