ŒæŒæŒæŒæHi guys! We are group of students from Kazakhstan, who has got the education abroad. After coming back we have noticed how poor life of children is today. And after long discussing we decided to launch the educational project. Firstly, it is innovative! We wanted to modernize the summer camps. The camps that are now functioning are very old. The infrastructure need a serious reforms, if we want to attract children. We wanted to make it more interesting! THREEHOUSE SUMMER CAMP! Secondly, as we have foreign experience and some of us also have worked in summer camps abroad. We wanted to share our experience with children and attract also foreign language teachers to give the children to opportunity to learn languages. LANGUAGE COURSES INCLUDED! Thirdly, the program will be aimed at children from low-income and fatherless families. A lot of families in Asia have not enough resources for childrenäó»s education abroad. We hope, our project will help to develop the talents! EDUCATE FUTURE GENIUSES! The price for one child and 1 season will be approximately 180 Euro. We think, it will be fair price to cover all costs (teachers, courses, entertainments) and the middle level comparing to other summer camps.

Over the years, I have been exploring the idea of the cities in India ( inparticular to the one I live in - New Delhi ), its continuous transformation and its impact on its residents/creators and vice versa. My work is to explorethe beauty of chaos we live in, how the clutter and tangles of the structures resembles the life of people who occupy it.This particular project titled- Conversations talks about the existence and differences of the Mughal era New Delhi to the current cluster of streets and close buildings of New Delhi through using the architectural patterns of both times. In this work, there is a play between the background and foreground in-terms of architectural forms from the majestic past and the cluttered present. The background is created digitally to mimic the intricate jali patterns of mughal era windows while the foreground uses intricate handout archival paper works to show the organic growth of the city and its elements.ŒæŒæŒæŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ      ------------------------------------------------------------------------Below are some of the Large scale works on paper I have done on paper over the past few years.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ------------------------------------------------------------------------Below are some examples of how the rewards would look like. As each work is intricately hand cut on 300gsm Archival Paper, , the details and layering will vary as per the dimensions. All works will be accompanied with its signed authentication certificate.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Œæ Œæ ------------------------------------------------------------------------All the works for rewards would be box framed with clear acrylic sheet to protect it from any wear and tear so that once the work is made, its always safe for any transport or display. below are some of my works to show the final display and framing of my works.ŒæŒæŒæ

Our principle of breaking down boundaries between art, science and technology, leads us to conducting artistic projects that link those three disciplines. Here is how Quanta arises, a curatorial project that explores different appropriations of quantum physics theory from personal experience and study field by each one of artists and scientists that make up four work pairs. The project splits into three phases: In the first one (February 1 to March 31, 2017), artists and scientists will share their knowledge to start a creation process; In the second one (April 1 to May 31, 2017), each collaborative pair will develop a research and creation work along four months based on the five properties of quantum physics: wave particle duality, quantum entanglement, superimposition of states, quantum tunneling and the uncertainty principle, to develop an artistic project. In the third phase (June 8 to July 7, 2017) will be a public exhibition of the processes generated during the second phase in the Colombian art space Estudio 74.Different Colombian Artists and collectives participate in Quanta: Angí©lica Piedrahita (lapiedrahita.com), El Desguazadero Colectivo - Marí_a Fernanda Mora del Rí_o and Juan Josí© Lí_pez (bit.ly/2k8SXrE) and Colectivo Reset - Nikolai Rubio and Ginna Velíçsquez. As an a special guest the project counts with the participation of the Mexican artist Arcíçngelo Constantini, pionner in the production of art with technology and Net.Art, whose research and development is integrally activated by the link between artistic and technological processes. www.arc-data.net.Jose Jairo Giraldo, quantum physicist of the Universidad Nacional de Colombia (bit.ly/2k8QUnA), Santiago Vargas, astrophysicist of the National Astronomical Observatory (bit.ly/2k8Mi0I), and Verí_nica Arias, astrophysicist of the Universidad de Los Andes are part of the Colombian scientists work group. In the international context, the project will count with a scientific representative of the Universidad Nacional Autí_noma de Mí©xico. With the support of different collaborators we will be able to carry out the creation processes of each work pairs, which will materialize in artistic pieces, installations and other art works of art for their exhibition. Support these creations leads to promote different perspectives and actions that detonate a possibility of innovation in different artistic - scientific processes and national collective thinking (Colombia) for its visibility in an international stage. With the impact generated, Quanta would fulfill its objective of integrating science with art for its application as a social fabric.FundingPhysical resources (Art work production, museography, communications, assembly, dismantling): 17.334 USDHuman resources (Airplane tickets Mexico - Colombia - Mexico, travel expenses, fees): 2.176 USDContingencies: 1.904 USDTotal: 21.414 USD The economic support we expect to raise through Kickstarter is 10.059 CA, and although it is not the entire projected budget, it will be exclusively destinated for the art work production. We believe that without art work the project would not exist, so the artistic-scientific development will always be the economic priority. Exclusive perksAs a gratefulness for the financial support, we will offer to our collaborators some exclusive perks:Inmersive tourWe will keep the collaborators abreast of the development of the work pairs (artist - scientist) research and creation processes through videos that record the generated experiences. We will send the videos to the collaborators, also, they will have access to them through our YouTube channel.Digital project catalogueWe will design a digital catalogue with the photographic records of the work pairs creation processes and artistic pieces, descriptive texts and the Quantaäó»s curatorial text, including special thanks to the collaborators. The catalogue will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.Quantum videoWe will make a video compilation of the three phases of the project, in which we will present unpublished contents, unique details of the evolution of work pairs research and creation processes, testimonies by artists, scientists and Reactanteäó»s members and exclusive scenes from the exhibition and guided tours. The video will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.Customized postcardsWe will design personalized digital postcards for collaborators (including their name) with unique photographs of the project or the created art works or their process, accompanied by a representative phrase of a work pair or the quantum physics theory. The postcards will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.In addition to receiving these exclusive perks, the collaborators will be mentioned in all graphic pieces of the project, museographic texts, press releases and Reactanteäó»s digital media (web page and social media).ŒçWe invite you to promote Colombiaäó»s ART and SCIENCE supporting Quanta!--------------------Quanta es un proyecto curatorial que explora diferentes apropiaciones de la teorí_a de la fí_sica cuíçntica, desde la experiencia personal y campo de estudio de cada uno de los artistas y cientí_ficos que conforman cinco duplas de trabajo. El proyecto se divide en tres fases: en la primera (1 de febrero al 31 de marzo de 2017), los artistas y cientí_ficos compartiríçn sus conocimientos para iniciar un proceso de creacií_n; en la segunda (1 de abril al 31 de mayo de 2017), cada par colaborativo desarrollaríç un trabajo de investigacií_n y creacií_n de cuatro meses partiendo de las cinco propiedades de la fí_sica cuíçntica: La dualidad onda - partí_cula, el entrelazamiento cuíçntico, la superposicií_n de estados, el tunelamiento cuíçntico y el principio de incertidumbre, para la realizacií_n de un proyecto artí_stico. En la tercera (8 de junio al 7 de julio de 2017) se presentaríç una muestra pí_blica - exposicií_n de los procesos generados durante la segunda fase de trabajo en el espacio de arte colombiano Estudio 74.Quanta cuenta con la participacií_n de los artistas y colectivos colombianos: Angí©lica Piedrahita (lapiedrahita.com), El Desguazadero Colectivo - Marí_a Fernanda Mora del Rí_o y Juan Josí© Lí_pez (bit.ly/2k8SXrE) y el Colectivo Reset (Nikolai Rubio y Ginna Velíçsquez), y como invitado especial el artista mexicano Arcíçngelo Constantini, pionero en la produccií_n de arte con tecnologí_a y Net.Art, cuya investigacií_n y desarrollo estíç integralmente activada por la vinculacií_n entre los procesos artí_sticos y tecnolí_gicos.Œæwww.arc-data.netEl grupo de cientí_ficos colombianos estíç integrando por el fí_sico cuíçntico de la Universidad Nacional Jose Jairo Girado (bit.ly/2k8QUnA), el astrofí_sico del Observatorio Astroní_mico Nacional Santiago Vargas (bit.ly/2k8Mi0I) y la astrofí_sica de la Universidad de los Andes Verí_nica Arias. En el marco internacional, se contaríç con un representante cientí_fico de la Universidad Nacional Autí_noma de Mí©xico.Con el apoyo de distintos colaboradores lograremos llevar a cabo los procesos de creacií_n de cada una de las duplas de trabajo, los cuales se materializaríçn en piezas artí_sticas, instalaciones y demíçs obras de arte para su exposicií_n. Apoyar dichas creaciones conlleva a su vez, a la promocií_n de distintas miradas y acciones que detonan una posibilidad de innovacií_n en distintos procesos de ejecucií_n artí_stica - cientí_fica y pensamiento colectivo a nivel nacional (Colombia) para su visibilizacií_n en un íçmbito internacional. Con el impacto generado, Quanta cumplirí_a su objetivo de integrar la ciencia con el arte para su aplicacií_n como tejido social.FinanciamientoContemplamos el siguiente presupuesto, en pesos colombianos, para el desarrollo del proyecto:Recursos fí_sicos (Produccií_n de obra, museografí_a, comunicaciones, montaje, desmontaje): $49.477.500Recursos humanos (Tiquetes de avií_n Mí©xico - Colombia - Mí©xico, viíçticos, honorarios): $6.210.000Imprevistos: $5.433.750Total: $61.121.250El apoyo econí_mico que esperamos recaudar a traví©s de Kickstarter es de $22.103.120 (10.059 CA), y aunque no es la totalidad del presupuesto proyectado, estaríç destinado exclusivamente a la produccií_n de obra. Consideramos que sin obra realizada el proyecto no existirí_a, por lo que la prioridad econí_mica siempre seríç para el desarrollo artí_stico-cientí_fico.Recompensas exclusivasA modo de agradecimiento por el apoyo econí_mico obtenido ofreceremos a los colaboradores una serie de recompensas exclusivas:Recorrido inmersivoMantendremos a los colaboradores al tanto del desarrollo de los procesos de investigacií_n y creacií_n de las duplas de trabajo (artista - cientí_fico) a traví©s de videos que registren las experiencias generadas. Enviaremos los videos a los colaboradores o í©stos tendríçn acceso a los mismos mediante nuestro canal de YouTube.Catíçlogo digital del proyectoŒæ ŒæSe diseí±aríç un catíçlogo digital con los registros fotogríçficos de los procesos de creacií_n y las piezas artí_sticas de las duplas de trabajo, textos descriptivos y el texto curatorial de Quanta, incluyendo agradecimientos especiales a los colaboradores. The Magic Mandap team would like to gift to the Playa this year with a magical facility to contribute the most radical of rituals - the unions of loving individuals. ŒæOur gift will be The Magic Mandap, a place where Burners can execute their own radical ritual of human unions. ŒæWikipedia describes the Mandap as:A mandap (ö_µö_Ëö_µö__ö__ ö_¬ö_‰ö_çö_È, ö__ö_„ö«ö_Âö_¬ö_£ö«ö_çö_È) (covered structure with pillars) temporarily erected for the purpose of a Hindu or Jain wedding. The main wedding ceremonies take place under the mandap.ŒæUse of a mandap is an ancient custom and is described in texts like Ramacharitamanas and various Sanskrit texts.Though it's origins are Hindu, we want build this structure as a magestic setting for people to engage whatever ritualistic joining their hearts desire. Be it a marriage, engagement, pinning, or BFFFFFF eternal bonding for all people regardless of their "label."ŒæThe idea was inspired by Hooman Moayyed after his 2016 burn. This is his first Burning Man art project."I was inspired to build this because I Playa proposed to a dear friend last year. I had rings and all! I had no idea when I would give the ring, or who I would give it to. I just wanted to manifest my life partner. One night at the food line inside The Kazbah's camp, along comes my fabulous friend adorned in her 8 pointed antler headdress. I just knew it was right so I got on one knee and proposed enternal Burnal BFFship to her. She was shaking. She said yes! Our improvised ritual was very real to us both. We still share this unique bond today. There's nothing I would love more than to allow others to experience their own personal bonding ritual under the Mandap. When BM HQ announced this year's theme, I just knew I had to do this."ŒæThe design will be roughly based on a traditional mandap (above) but with some additional playafications. The entire structure will be illuminated with multicolor LEDs that are interactive (well ya!). ŒæThe lights will change patterns through changeable programs or it can react to vocal and music patterns (of course they will!).Help us acquire the supplies necessary to build this place of public assembly built to perpetuate love through strengthened human connections. We need to hit our goal as soon as possible in order to begin building with our lovely volunteers.ŒæThe Universal Life Church has ordained many of The Magic Mandap's members so if you really want to make it official, we would be honored to officiate! All funds generated here will be used to build the Mandap structure and its components.ŒæThe 10 Playa Union Principles:Œæ1. It's Forever. Even after death.äóÂ2. It's Polygamous and polyamorous. Bond with as many people as you love. Everyone you and your partner bonds with adds to your own Playa family.äóÂŒæ3. It must be rooted in love. Not to be taken frivolously. äóÂŒæ4. It's unconventional. Your default-world spouse doesn't necessarily have to be your Playa spouse but it's amazing if you can be both. äóÂ5. You also may Playa marry or bond with anyone even if you're already conventionally married. Bond with your BFF or anyone who's close to you.Œæ6. Once you're joined at the hip, just add a "P" to your relationship status such as P.Wifey, P.Hubby, P.Bestie, P.Master, or P.Slave. äóÂŒæ7. You may become playa "engaged" in the default world but cannot be playa joined there. You must be on the Playa to transition to a Playa union. äóÂ8. Your officient can be anyone you choose. No need for ordainment as you can be anyone you like on the Playa. The ceremony can be anything you choose.äóÂ9. Playa unions don't have to be sexual (but it's when when they are!). You can marry your BFF if you like. Consummation optional. äóÂŒæ10. These are not rules. Do whatever the F you want. See you under the Mandap!

The Human Union team would like to gift the Playa this year with an interactive art installation to contribute the most radical of rituals - the unions of loving individuals.  Our gift will be The Human Union installation, a place where Burners can execute their own radical union rituals.   Be it a marriage, engagement, pinning, or eternal BFF bonding for all people monogamous, polygamous and solygamous (regardless of whatever -ous you choose, you are still a part of US).  äóìUnbeknownst to ourselves, we humans often harbor internal pain that isolates us from other loving individuals. Though our our goal is to offer a safe space for people to bond directly with one another on the Playa through marriage or other bonding rituals, the struggle is to motivate all to create compassionate, loving, supportive and inclusive human unions. The ultimate union is between ourself and the world, with supportive friends, immersed, present and included within our heart.äóThe design will resemble three beings clasping hands in a 20'x20' circle.  Within the circle is where the bonding rituals will take place. Of course there will be some additional playafications. The entire structure will be illuminated with colored LEDs so that you can bond day or night.  The lights will change patterns through changeable programs or it can react to vocal and music patterns. Please help us acquire the supplies necessary to build this place of public assembly built to perpetuate love through strengthened human connections. We need to hit our goal as soon as possible in order to continue building with our lovely volunteers.  The Universal Life Church has ordained many of our HU members so if you really want to make it official, we would be honored to officiate! All funds generated here will be used to build the structure and its components.The 10 Playa Union Principles:1. It's Forever. Even after death.2. It's Polygamous and polyamorous. Bond with as many people as you love. Everyone you and your partner bonds with adds to your own Playa family.3. It must be rooted in love. Not to be taken frivolously. 4. It's unconventional. Your default-world spouse doesn't necessarily have to be your Playa spouse but it's amazing if you can be both.5. You also may Playa marry or bond with anyone even if you're already conventionally married. Bond with your BFF or anyone who's close to you. 6. Once you're joined at the hip, just add a "P" to your relationship status such as P.Wifey, P.Hubby, P.Bestie, P.Master, or P.Slave.7. You may become playa "engaged" in the default world but cannot be playa joined there. You must be on the Playa to transition to a Playa union. 8. Your officiant can be anyone you choose. No need for ordainment as you can be anyone you like on the Playa. The ceremony can be anything you choose.9. Playa unions don't have to be sexual (but it's when when they are!). You can marry your BFF if you like. Consummation optional.10. These are not rules. Do this any way you like!See you back home!

For over 75 years astronomers have been sending messages via radio transmissions into space in an attempt to contact advanced alien civilizations, but so far no reply.Many messages have been sent,Œæ from series of prime numbers to Beatles songs, but maybe not the most important message äóñ love.Artist/inventor, Stefan Verstappen has designed a public art installation that will literally beam love into space.Greetings From PLANET EARTH is an interactive light, sound and mind installation to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the Voyager Spacecraft with a spectacular twist, your brain interacts with the installation and the universe!How It WorksHoused inside a geodesic dome are 8 äóÖMind Podsäó» arranged in a circle around a central processing hub. Each pod is equipped with a neurofeedback headset that will record each personäó»s unique brainwave pattern and, using a computer graphics interface, project those patterns onto the inside of the dome in a 3D immersive experience.ŒæŒæEach person is encouraged to remember someone they love, like a spouse, family member, friend, or pet. Imagine 8 people from different walks of life, whose brains are linked together through a central computer, sharing thoughts of love, and having those thoughts projected onto the interior of the dome.ŒæA digital recording of the brainwave frequencies is then up-loaded to a 500 watt 60 foot dish transmitter and beamed directly into the center of our milky way galaxy!But Thereäó»s Moreäó_What if you could send your personal message into space, and include a return address?Before leaving the exhibit, each attendee can record a 30 second audio message to include in the transmission with their personal brain scan. There are dozens of scientific studies that prove that electro magnetic waves can directly influence and communicate with our brains.It is theoretically possible, if you sent a message into space paired with your unique brain frequency, advanced civilizations receiving your message could reply by transmitting a signal tuned to your specific frequency. Aliens could, theoretically, talk directly to your consciousness.Greetings From Planet Earth will tour art festivals and fairs across the US in the summer of 2018."Every living being is an engine geared to the wheelwork of the universe. Though seemingly affected only by its immediate surrounding, the sphere of external influence extends to infinite distance."Nikola TeslaŒæŒæAbout NeurofeedbackNeurofeedback is a type ofŒæbiofeedbackŒæthat measures brain waves to produce a signal that can be used as feedback to teach self-regulation of brain function.ŒæNeurofeedback is commonly provided using video or sound, with positive feedback for desired brain activity and negative feedback for brain activity that is undesirable.For this installation we will use a neurofeedback headset that will record each person's EEGŒæand send that signal through a computer graphics program that will transform the signal into a changing color graphic that is projected using 3D projection technology, onto the inside of the dome.Each person will see their own real-time brain activity in 3D on the screen in front of them.ŒæAbout 3D Dome ProjectionThe term äóìfulldomeäó is used to describe immersive dome-based video projection environments that create 360 degree and virtual reality experiences. Pre-rendered digital video and animation, real-time, interactive and live captured images can be displayed on the inside of a domed projection surface to create an immersive viewing experienceŒæAlthough the current technology emerged in the early-to-mid 1990s, fulldome environments have evolved from numerous influences, including immersive art and storytelling, with technological roots in domed architecture, planetariums, multi-projector film environments, flight simulation, and virtual reality. Contemporary configurations employ raster video projectors, either singly or grouped together to cover the dome surface with full-color images and animations.How Do We Plan to Send Radio Signals into Space?ŒæWe will rent broadcasting time on theŒæJamesburg Earth Station, in central California, a 500 watt, 98 ft radio dish built in 1968.It has been suggested that the frequency range known as the äóìwater holeäó (between 1.42 and 1.66 GHz, the hydrogen (H) and hydroxyl (OH) frequencies), which is a particularly quiet band of frequencies, would be the best place to attempt interstellar communications, and so has been a popular range for listening in SETI experiments.This is the frequency at which hydrogen vibrates. Not every society is going to have a base ten number system. Not every civilization is going to use certain frequencies for cell phones, and not every song will sound the same through a different atmosphere. But it's unlikely that whatever corner of the universe the signal ends up in will have a more basic atom than hydrogen. This is the way to get a civilization to notice you.ŒæWhy Am I Doing This?ŒæI began experimenting with biofeedback and brainwave entrainment more than 40 years ago. I bought my first EEG machine when I was 19 and while monitoring my brain waves I subjected myself to binaural beats that ŒæI created on a synthesizer and split the channels to stereo headphones, strobe lights tuned to various frequencies, and innumerable recordings of sacred music, chants and tones to see for myself the effects these would have on my consciousness.Way back then I already had the idea to create a machine that resembled the device called "Cerebro" as seen in the recent X-Men movies, but 40 years ago the technology didn't exist to do what I wanted to do.With a lifelong passion for science and technology, I have kept abreast of the tech needed to finally create the ultimate interactive mind experience.About 15 years ago the technology was finally able to do what I needed, but now the problem was funding. All that tech and equipment is expensive where could I go to find funding for such a project?But along with advancement in technology there came an advancement in financing - crowdfunding. Kickstarter is the greatest opportunity to fund such a weird, but wonderful idea. The kickstarter community is probably the only community of people in the world that would 'get' what I'm trying to do because, well, you're all probably as 'non-ordinary' as me.Am I Capable of Completing This Project?ŒæFor my installation Tubular Zen, which used harmonic sounds and light frequencies to induce meditative states among those that interacted with it, I not only built and installed the actual structure, I also personally soldered together 15 circuit boards and wired the whole, thing myself.For my installation, Tri-Monic, which combined a half dozen instruments all programmed to play in harmony no matter who played them, I rented $300,000. worth of computers, mixers, auto tuners and harmonizers and wired the whole thing up myself.Greetings From Planet Earth will be a lot easier to build than my previous projects since all the components are self contained and need only be put together in this unique configuration and I won't have to solder or wire anything.In addition, I will hire the services of my partners Pacific Domes, Obscura Digital, andŒæInteraXonŒæto calibrate the projectors, and integrate the computers and software.The DomeFor this installation we will be working with multi-award winning Pacific Domes,ŒæŒæthe original manufacturer of geodesic domes worldwide. Expanding on the both the architectural and philosophical concepts of the legendary engineer and futurist R. Buckminster Fuller, Pacific Domes has helped pave the way for the global eco-living revolution while shaping the event dome industry for over 35 years.The Pacific Domes Projection Dome is a 360ŒÁ fully immersive viewing environment. Their patented negative air pressure projection system is the perfect platform for state of the art 360ŒÁ surround projection. Their partner companies,ŒæObscura Digital, Vortex Immersion and Immersive Experiential are experts in creating multimedia surround projection technology. Together, they create multi-sensory, interactive learning and entertainment experiences for large scale group immersive environments.Brain Sensing TechnologyFor this installation we plan to use headsets produced byŒæInteraXonŒæa Toronto-based innovator in the field of brain-sensing technology, with a history of designing memorable experiences from a levitating chair to a brain powered beer tap. Over 50,000 people have experienced InteraXonäó»s brain-sensing technology, and this continues to grow.BudgetŒæ$35,000?! What's all that for?This may sound like a lot of money (because it is), but after Kickstarter fees and reward fulfillment, this will leave the minimum required to cover the cost of bringing Greetings From Planet Earth to life.Here's a breakdown of where the costs go:Fees and reward fulfillment: $10,500Greetings From Planet Earth project costs: $24,500:Past Experiments in Art, Sound, Lights and FrequenciesŒæArtwalk, Ventura, California, 2008Tubular ZenŒæis a multi-media, multi-sensory interactive installation artwork that combines the concepts of Zen and Synesthesia.The five pillars represent, and play, the five notes of the Pentatonic scale. A pentatonic scale is an ancient musical structure found all over the world that consists of five tones or notes.As you enter the circle of pillars you notice that each one has a lighted button on its side.Touching the button will cause the pillar to come to life. First you will hear a single lonely musical note from aŒæShakuhatchiŒæflute playing one of the five notes of the pentatonic scale.Then the pillar will light up with light flickering in the same frequency as the musical note.A few seconds later and the pillar returns to its former repose.By walking around the circle of pillars and pressing the buttons you will discover that each pillar has a different sound, color, and vibration. Activate the pillars in any random order will produce 16 different harmonious sounds.When all pillars are activated you will hear the eerie but soothing äóÖCäó» diminished 7th cord.Nuit Blanche, Toronto, 2015Tri-MonicŒæis a multi-sensory interactive installation that requires viewers to interact musically with the installation.Three 12 foot tall triangular shaped pieces create a classical equilateral triangle both vertically and horizontally.All the microphones and instruments were run through a series of harmonizers and auto tuners so that even if one couldn't sing on key or play an instrument, not matter what you did the sound would always come out in harmony.This is installation brought strangers together to create music and harmony, and a spiritual experience.ŒæCyberpunk, Strobe Light Wearable Art, Dragons' Den, Toronto, 2014Handmade brass pendants with internal hand soldered circuit board with battery, 555 microchip, and LED lights. Lights pulsate with the Schumann frequency creating a meditative state in anyone looking at the pendant.ToroŒæMí¢chí©. Strobe Light Sculpture, 2016Inspired by traditional JapaneseŒælanterns (Toro äóñŒælight basket, light tower) made of stone, wood, or metal.ŒæToroŒæMí¢chí©Œæcombines traditional design with modern ascetics. Since they are made from paper, instead of a candle flame, these pieces are illuminated from within with LED lightsŒæthat pulsate with the Schumann frequency creating a meditative state in anyone looking at the sculpture.ŒæRewards$1.-ŒæInstant Gratification!A free download of any one of Stefan's books!ŒæAnd you get it right away even if we don't meet our funding goal!We appreciate the effort to read about this project and go to your account and donate a dollar and we want to thank you for the effort.Œæ$5.- Instant Gratification 2.0!A free download of any TWO of Stefan's books!ŒæAnd you get it right away even if we don't meet our funding goal!We appreciate the effort to read about this project and go to your account and donate 5 bucks and we want to thank you for the effort.Œæ$10.- We'll send you an Autographed Postcard!These postcards were designed by S.H. Verstappen and he will personally autograph and mail you this keepsake and memento of your participation in this project to put in your family scrapbook.ŒæŒæ$15.- 2 Free Books and a PostcardGet the books right away and when we meet our funding goal we'll send you the postcard.$ 25 or moreSigned Print - Pen & Ink CollectionŒæChoose from 16 Pen & Ink illustrations that I drew for my first book, The Thirty Six Strategies.I will autograph each print and mail out flat suitable for framing.Plus a signed postcard!And a free book download!See selection here: http://www.chinastrategies.com/art-shop/ŒæSize: 8" X 11.5"Free Shipping.Frame not included.Œæ$50.00 The Official Mug!ŒæWe don't really want to offer swag, after all, you're contributing because you believe in what we're doing, not because you want a mug or a T-shirt, but this design just looks so cool on a mug, so, well there you have it.$50.- The Official T-Shirt!And so here's the T-shirt just because this design Œælooks cool on a T-Shirt too!ŒæŒæSketchbookŒæŒæŒæŒæVariationsŒæŒæ

Imagine what Galileo faced when he claimed in his publishing to the scientific community, that the Earth revolved around the heavens. The theory proven only then by the great Issac Newton. When the church was still a dominant force, for Galileo, nothing good came of it.ŒæWe are living post 500 years into the future and scientists have discovered the answers to more modern day theories that ultimately are the standard for questions that pertained to unknown and unverifiable facts in the heart of mysterious forces of what more, the universe. Philosophical thinkers and scientists posed questions that served as beacons of light and were in no way afraid to challenge nature and the universe leading to scientific discovery. If we are to keep surviving it seems inevitable that the future of humanity rests on the thinkers and innovators that know the world doesn't give up its answers without a fight for survival or ultimately be doomed into a catastrophic apocalypse. I believe that life doesn't come with guarantees, but it's ultimately up to you to make the choices that will shape your life. I've had a share of bad experiences and growing up was no easy undertaking, I rarely complained about going to school though. I never once planned for college. When I finally graduated there was no internet boom Kickstarter and YouTube didn't exist. Smart phones, couldn't get your hands on one. So from a technologist point of view, life was pretty much primitive in decision making.One thing is definitely true, our experiences in this world shape who we are and the people we meet will decide our fate. As humans we are told to use discretion and learn to make choices to better our reality and the current situation we may find ourselves in from day to day. Sometimes life doesn't provide you with a way out, a way to get back your happiness, your sanity, everything that made you full of life.ŒæSo it's with my KickstarterŒæcampaign that I want to share with my fan community and anyone who is a true die-hard Zelda fan, or maybe just love to solve puzzles, well wrap your mind's live action adventure crime solving skills around this one! So if you have been there from the start and for those who walk behind them thinking to themselves, "Gee you know, I think i like this game." This is the sum of all existential crisis's to have happen and live to tell about it 10 years later. To me, this game is rooted in my mind with a deeper subconscious meaning. One that either tried to spare my life or have me buried before my 23rd birthday. The story which I present to you has a classical, theme to it in that the character in which my life was played out was flawed in nature. His self awareness was lacking, his attention span was that of a teen with ADHD, and his self conscious fear is what kept him on the run, afraid to give his life and change his ways or one day meet his unforeseen fateful future.The exhibit is to show that my Kickstarter campaign has potential to make people, fans, restore their faith in life. That there is a connection with the physical world and the spiritual as well as the technological one in the cities that make up this story.Nothing in this story was based on some inclination of what if! I was just a teen living out my days doing crazy stupid things that were all kind of familiar already. So I had no easy way to put stupid acts aside, I guess I always stayed in character while the rest of the world has plotted on their futures. In the end I'm 100 percent positive that there will never ever be another story like this or as fun in solving a past life action adventure crime drama. I guarantee this is the melting pot of all classical action adventure true life crime dramas that blends, the virtual world of video games, art, the internet and the book by Dan Brown, "The DaVinci Code".the story has many types of themes which connects with just about everyone not just Zelda Fans, because most Zelda fans are not DaVInci Code Fanatics. By then end of this book I'm sure I will get you to believe in the power of your actions to find meaning in your life and restore your faith. Bringing this Kickstarter campaign is like giving you a piece of my mind to take you back to the days I never foreseen fate coming to get me and give you a chance to solve the crime the way I was meant to but never did. There is nothing in this story that never happened or that I didn't live through. In the end meant it was Game Over!Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæI'm raising funds to put together an exhibit here in Los Angeles where all the characters in the story I've written about in my experiences as a teen, doing drugs, chasing after affection and my only way to connect with my self through art and video games was a way of life before the Internet boomed into the mainstream world. The characters in the stories have also been through life altering spiritual struggles and are still lucky to be alive and living in Los Angeles today who I'm still in contact with. They don't however know of my hermetic past and although they were all part of my teen years, I didn't fully understand what I was living through until I took a step back from that fateful night that shifted everything into perspective. I went to college to decipher my own complex social world I was thrust into. What you only thought was imaginary gibberish, in my past and present life did actually exist. You'll also get a glimpse of my other lesser known creations that I have been working on years after I regained composure and worked to try and revive my soul.ŒæMy wonderful "Zelda" painting, tying the story of my life together.ŒæOil  11"x 14"ŒæŒæca. 2004My other current ideas and how I perceive they can help the world.Gigstreamer-Social event website built to ease the complexity of a artist/promoter booking system to create events.ŒæStrike Out Game-Lottery number generator that I invented which is based on an algorithm I also made that may be a primitive form of the most basic A.I to win the lotto defeating the odds by 98 percent.ŒæChildren's Story Book Literature Series- This is a series of children's stories written by me that guide children from ages 3-17 learn to follow their visual thought process and ask questions about their every day experiences when it's time to use their imagination but don't know where to start creating thoughts in the right order. It's brain power for the soul.ŒæBurgers On Us Game- This is a teen to adult card game that gets them into a real life scenario of what it's like to work at a fast-food burger restaurant. they calculate cost, incorrect orders, and tally up results in a game of probability to determine a winner all by using a deck, pad and a pencil.The Event will have a bar so if you decide to come drinks will be served.

ŒæI'd like to achieve something great!I can not stand the fact that people in the world die of hunger and war.ŒæŒæI'd like to make this art installation, full of contrasts and provocations, for some association that fight hunger in the world. Okay! Hello everyone!I never thought i would actually be making a kickstarter, but i realized i dont think there is any way i would be able to afford everything i need for my senior show project, by the time i have to start working on it, therefore i have talked to a number of people about it, and they have all directed me here! So, here i am!Basically, over this summer i have spent a lot of time figuring out what i want to do for my senior show project, I am in Illustration Major at Otis college of Art and Design, for those of you who didn't know that. I came up with a really interesting idea for how to put a twist onto the typical illustration senior projects. I have started working with dolls over summer, and i have fallen in love. I began by taking Monster High Dolls, and stripping the makeup off their faces, and redrawing their faces on using watercolor pencils. I love this method, and its super fun, however, its still not entirely my work, since the bodies and the proportions are not completely to my liking. One of the main reasons i have created this kickstarter page, is to ask all you beautiful souls for help with affording real BJD dolls. BJD dolls, or Ball Jointed Dolls, are usually custom made, very flexible, very realistic dolls. They have balls in each of their joints so they move like a real person and can be posted in almost every way that a real human could move. Everything from the skin, to the hands, to the eyes, to each freckle on the dolls body is customizable.Œæ These dolls can range anywhere from $300-$1000 .... which is A LOT. I will be buying doll parts, and arranging them myself, which should bring the cost down by a couple hundred per doll. My goal is to have at least 4 dolls, an elder, an adult, a teen, and a child. If i could get more, that would be phenomenal. however i think making four dolls is going to be quite the load of work as it is. What i am planning on building is a giant fish tank type of container, and inside will be the fairies den. It will be a miniature forest, with everything from mushrooms, to small bug creatures, to the little huts the fairies live inside of. I want to create a scene, of just a moment in time in the every day life of fairies. A photograph of their world, so to speak, but one that you can see from all angles.ŒæI will design each fairy as a character, with a full backstory, and name and all that good stuff. They will have their own biographies nearby the instillation, along with a story as to why i have chosen this, and the meaning behind my work, and especially behind why fairies have so much meaning in our society today, without anyone even realizing or noticing it.ŒæI am writing my senior Capstone paper on the topic of fairies as well, specifically their history and the role they used to play, and continue to play in society. Going back from when people thought they were real, to when people would paint them all the time, to peter pan and neverland. I am beyond excited for this project, and i am really really asking you all to jump on board and get excited about this with me! The more support and help i receive, the more pumped i will be about this, and the cooler it would look, im sure! If you want to offer a helping hand, please dont be afraid to message me, i am going to need some help setting it all up when the time comes around, however for now, its all about getting my materials together!I will be giving those who donate $25 or more a handmade card, unique to them, attached with fairy dust from my very own fairies that have come to life with your help. To those who donate more than $100 i will draw you an image, just for you, and send that to you, along with your handmade personalized card, and fairy dust.Thank you all so so so so so much, i am BEYOND excited to get this project started!!!Ps- it's still in the design phase so things might and probably will change over time, I am considering building the entire thing myself using paper mache and other materials.... I'll keep you all posted, it's gonna be AMAZING!!!!!!!

A project by Caspar Noyons and the Tolhuistuin for the Amsterdam LightfestivalŒæDecember 17th 2015 till January 17th 2016.ŒæSpeed Of Light is a scale model of the solar system (1:270.000.000) where the visitor can walk the distance between the earth and the sun at relative light-speed.ŒæWe are removed 150.000.000 km from our sun and light travels at 300.000 km/s. This means the light of the sun takes exactly 8 minutes and 20 seconds to reach us. These simple facts are known already for centuries but how well do we understand them? And even more importantly: How much is this modern cosmology part of our popular culture? It seems in every mythology this cosmology, or the place humans inhabit in the universe, is of tremendous importance. A place where separate individuals can gather, meet and celebrate this great cosmos we are all a part of.Location and LED path: All we really need for this installation is a long line of 555m in order for the visitor to be able to follow a LED path (3 LED per meter, 1665 LED's in total) showing the exact speed of 4km/h which is slow walking pace. This journey will then take the amount of time required: 8.3 minutes. A perfect place for this is the IJpromenade in the North of Amsterdam. Next to the IJ Canal it offers a great open space next to the water along a long straight line of just the right size.Host: Another thing we need is a festival this project is a part of so people come and experience this light installation and we can gather sponsors and partners to make this project happen. What about the Amsterdam Lightfestival ?ŒæNow we can really start making it happen.How do we build the earth and the moon?ŒæThey will only be respectively 4,7cm and 1.4 cm in diameter. They will light up on the side facing the sun so visitors can see them well. Also the big circle functioning as a fence surrounding the earth shows the path of the moon around the earth. (the moon is placed on top of this steel structure).ŒæImagine the moon takes a whole month to complete one full circle. This is just 90 degrees per week and its traveling as fast as the fastest airplanes on earth...ŒæAnd of course the sun !ŒæThis part is more complicated. The sun proportionately is about 100 times bigger than the earth. Not 4,7 cm but 5.16 meters in diameter... Standing next to earth it will look exactly as big in the skyline as the sun really looks to us from earth in the sky. The IJpromenade will look for 4 weeks like a star wars movie with two suns..ŒæFor it to really stand out we will put it on a 7 meter metal pillar so it is standing 2 meters high in the air. People will be able to sit and walk around it and make pictures so it looks they are lifting the sun up with their arms.And finally we need a space gate so the visitor can really make the transformation from common mortal to giant light being walking at light-speed and holding the earth in the palm of his hand.ŒæWe have been busy the past year finding other sponsors and partners that are now making the project possible: Stadsdeel Noord (City of Amsterdam) Shell, who have their research center near the project and the UNESCO international year of Light 2015 who are using the project as a platform for closing their year of events. Other foundations public and private have made generous contributions to making this project a reality.Being so much centered around the visitor, and receiving such encouraging reactions from people around us we chose to make a crowd-funding for the Sun. It will develop a community around the project and the guided tours offered as rewards including costumes music and stories will really make the project come alive. Also we saw a lot of potential for education, so anŒæeducational program is being developed by students of the UPVA as part of a 2 week internship to invite 10 classes in 5 schools in the surrounding area to come and learn about space and the power of science.For the production we chose 3ŒæspecializedŒæcompanies, one in inflatable advertisingŒæ(for the SUN) one in LED Lighting for the LED path and one in stage design for the earth, the moon and the space gate. The technical team of Lightfestval will keep an eye on theŒæfeasibilityŒæof the project and theŒæTolhuistuin Foundation is managing the budget together with the artist. Working together we have aŒæcompetentŒæteam of experiences people that canŒælive up to the task of executing this exciting but also challenging project.Guided tours: 25, 50 Eur. and up. ŒæAs a tourguide in the most beautiful museums of amsterdam Caspar Noyons will be welcoming you in his cosmic costume guiding you like virgil through your epic journey towards the sun. Filled with stories about mythologies, creation myths and facts of science and space you will be able to become a full inhabitant of this solar system. To use Carl Sagan's words: We are a way for the cosmos to know itself. The exploration of the cosmos is a voyage of self discovery. We are made of stardust.If you can't make it to the guided tour: Tell us if you are not able to come to amsterdam this winter and we will send you a postcard instead ! Signed by the artist plus a print of a A4 drawing.Video:100 Eur. and up. As you might have noticed we have major video skills at our disposal (thanks to Oculus film) to create an incredible after-movie of the whole process and especially the performances of music dance and costumes around the different stages.Drawings: Apart from people other invitations have been sent: Spirit gods of mythologies from all over the world are joining the celebration. In the drawings are some of the visitors you can expect.In total 9 A4 drawings have been made. If needed, more could be made with a limit of 20 total.2 more drawings are made on another format: 25x35 and thicker glossier paper. Backers of 500 and up can choose between one of those or 2 smaller A4 drawings. Limit: 15ŒæŒæThe larger drawings: 35 x 50 cm, limited to 5. (3 already made)ŒæHopefully once this project is produced we will have most of the elements at our disposal to produce this installation on other festivals, and at much smaller costs.ŒæBy contributing to this project we can make this first and crutial step in a series of productions each time welcoming other performances and content around the different stages. We will then be curating our own cosmic shows !

My plan is to post 3 pics per day creating a story that takes place in the #talesbypappasparlor's universe. There will be love, tears, fights, cheesy setups and someone will probably die.Œæ

In the summer of 2015, the Magic Room was born.. Tucked away behind an otherwise unassuming door was an immersive conceptual art experience created by artist Liz Avalon within her booth at the annual Sawdust Art Festival in Laguna Beach, California. Visitors stepping inside the room found themselves unexpectedly transported out of the traditional art and craft festival experience and into a separate world of infinity mirrors, music, and lights. This Kickstarter is going to bring the magic room to others to enjoy.Over 5000 people visited the Magic Room in 2015, but it's time at the Sawdust Festival is over. Sawdust Festival tradition has all artists dismantle their booths in January allowing the festival artists to rebuild and transform the grounds with new booths in new locations the following spring. Next year, the Magic Room will be gone and Liz''s Sawdust Festival booth will have a new location and a new innovative art installation.HOWEVER....so many people have asked for the Magic Room to returnŒæthat Liz has decided to take the show on the road! This Kickstarter Campaign was started to recreate the Magic Room in a new innovative mobile format!!!!With $8,000, we can build a great MOBILE MAGIC ROOM!!!!The form it will take depends on a few things, but mostly on the funds that are raised.Œæ$8,000 will cover design and building costs to make a Magic Room that contains all the fun of the Sawdust Magic Room,in a format that is self-contained and can be easily transported from place to place.Any funds generated beyond $8,000 will allow for greater flexibility in design, more exciting and refined features, and a budget to expose more people to the magic room. This includes stuff like a more interesting and better quality trailer or vehicle for it to be placed on/within, improved sound systems, solar power, and artistic expression on the outside as well as the inside.ŒæOnce it is built, any extra money will be dedicated to sharing the fun.The more money we raise, the more interesting the adventures the Magic Room can have and the more people will be able to visit. Everywhere the Magic Room will go has yet to be seen, but the plan is to make it a travelling art experience that can go to events, festivals, schools, fairs, and even pop up in truly unexpected places. The MOBILE MAGIC ROOM can visit anywhere. Let's share the experience!ŒæŒæIt's BIGGER ON THE INSIDE!!!!

My art career started in earnest in Washington, DC, when I first used my multiple exposure technique on the Space Window, a spectacular piece of stained glass in the National Cathedral. Now, 7 years later, I want to return to DC to create the next dimension of my artwork... a 3-dimensional installation which offers a new way of looking at Pop Art iconography and its place in American culture.My visit will take place during the 2016 College Art Association conference where I'm volunteering, giving me a chance to network with new art school graduates and professors and get inspired by their art stories. I'll also be attending numerous museums as well as taking a private tour of 5 artists' studios, offered by CAA.I've always been interested in the physical, material qualities of artworks and I enjoy pushing the boundaries with my own installations, such as the 24 canvases hanging from the ceiling in my museum show in Poland, The Magic City at Stara Kopalnia. The piece created from Pop(2) will also be unique, utilizing a never-before-seen art display technique. The piece consists of a large number of my Magic Blox, thick, imaged acrylic crystals, arranged in a 3-dimensional matrix which can be hung and experienced from all sides. Project backers get access to my exclusive updates and photos of the process of making the work.There's a physical presence to it... You have to involve your body in partaking in the artwork -- and that's unusual for photography. To me, this second level of participation beyond just the visual aspect goes a long way toward expressing what I want to say in these pieces... which is that there are other dimensions and ways of viewing everything. Check out this video of my museum installation at Stara Kopalania in Poland and you'll see what I mean. The presentation is part of the art:Magic Blox are 4x6" acrylic blocks that are 1" thick. A metalized print of my artwork is visible not only from the front but also from sides, giving Magic Blox a dimensionality and physicality that makes them ideal for taking photographs off the wall and into 3D space.My art consists of multiple exposure photographyŒæwhich is made in a camera. Multiple exposures are a classic, film based technique which require me to previsualize the scene before I shoot it. There is no way to see the two images combined until after they are taken, so the art comes in composing the shots -- as it does with any other kind of photograph. My goal with this technique is to push the boundaries of what can be done with the camera as a tool.The completed piece will be offered for museum display and also for sale. Project backers will have the first chance to purchase the completed installation.

So...I was cleaning out my laundry room today and found 108,000 toothpicks. These are vestiges of a former life, it seems. A life when my son was in grade school, I was a young, creative single mother, and the idea of aggregating a million of anything seemed so logical and possible.ŒæI managed to move this haul of toothpicks to a new house many years ago and curse their presence often for taking up a lot of space in my laundry room, but I never got rid of them. My son grew up, and a year ago, on January 26, 2015, he died from the complications of a bone marrow transplant at the unfair age of 15.ŒæFinding the toothpicks today during an earnest attempt to cure my laundry room of the scourge of looking like a scene from "Hoarders," I couldn't bring myself to throw them out, and could only see one end for these 108,000 toothpicks. They should see their fate as a part of a million. I should see this idea through.ŒæAs an investor, your first question should be why you would fund the acquisition of a million of something just for the heck of it, and for some sad lady who doesn't clean her laundry room often enough. I have given this a lot of thought, and here is why.ŒæSince my son died, I have begun volunteering at Transitions Life Care (formerly Hospice of Wake County) and at the Duke Pediatric Bone Marrow Transplant Unit (where my son spent the last 5 months of his life). I quit my fairly lucrative job as an editor and have returned to graduate school to study Clinical Mental Health Counseling, with the intent of being a bereavement and end-of-life counselor. I learned a lot from my son's life, and his death.ŒæI want to help people and teach people and hold people up when they are facing what will always be the biggest fear and sorrow of humankind. When the worst has happened and they are faced with that deafening silence of loss, I want to say something that will keep them holding on a little while longer, until it hurts just a little bit less. And then I want to keep being there to share the road. For those who are leaving, I want to be someone who has watched it happen, almost as if in slow motion, and let them know that it's not so scary after all. It's a little shift we all have to make, we all do it, and I am honored to be there for that shift.ŒæHaving a million toothpicks in a somewhat portable medium is meaningful. It was to me so many years ago when I just had a vague desire to see it, but now I understand how this can be transformational and helpful to so many people. The neurons we have in our brains number in the millions, and each of these has created a neural pathway to another neuron to create a thought, an idea, a memory. Our very consciousness, as bewildering as it remains, is somewhere in the lightning between these millions of neurons. In fact, we have millions of memories of our lives from beginning to end, of those we have loved, and thoughts of everything we had always meant to say or do. One million is a small number to estimate these things, but can you imagine seeing it? Saying to a dying patient or a bereaved relative, "This is one million toothpicks. That is the number of memories and loves you have. Look at that one million and see everything."The average person only lives 27,500 days, which seems so small compared to a million! And it is. People amass a million dollars, but no one can amass a million days here. To actually SEE a million is to get closer to understanding the intricacies of our skin cells, grains of sand, or stars in the universe. It's just one small visual aid, but I think it could be a great feast for the eyes and the brain in the attempt to understand what this is all about.I can get about 62,500 toothpicks for about $50. If you know of a better toothpick deal, feel free to just send me the toothpicks and no money. You can ship them to:Colleen Lennon1209 N King Charles RdRaleigh, NC Œæ27610Thank you all!

Have you ever experienced heartbreak? Heartbreak can be a life changing experience and one which we must share in order to get past our pain and move forward.ŒæIn November 2015 I experienced heartbreak, the agonising pain of losing the person you thought was the one, the person you thought you would spend the rest of your life with.ŒæAs a result of this experience I realised that I needed a lot of support and love if I was going to be able to get through this hard time. So I thought I would try and raise money to set up a heartbreak support lodge for others in a similar situation.A place that anyone could access for support whenever they needed it, to help get them through the hard times. Meet other people going through the same situation and share the love through this difficult time.ŒæHave a few laughs, share a few tears, through activities and events.ŒæTogether we can get through this!The support centre will work with continued contributions for members that come to the lodge, people can donate as much as they can afford.Œæ

The 14th Factory on Wall Street is the first of a series of socially-engaged art installations, created by The 14th Factory Foundation, a nonprofit organization founded by Hong Kong based British artist Simon Birch.ŒæThe Foundationäó»s mission is to create large-scale public art and cultural experiences, that are meaningfully accessible to people across all ages, backgrounds, and demographics.In New York, for this inaugural project, a series of free educational programs, developed in partnership with the Center for Arts Education, will be employed in addition to onsite donation boxes benefitting childrenäó»s charities.The 14th Factory is a large scale, multiple-media, social engaged, contemporary art odyssey.ŒæIn addition to being one of the New York City's largest independent art experiences slated for 2016, the exhibition will be offering free (pay-as-you-wish) admission to the public throughout its six-week run. The exhibition will open on April 29th at the former historic J.P. Morgan headquarter at 23 Wall Street, in New York.The exhibition is a procession of interlinked, collaborative works, produced by a global community of interdisciplinary artists from Greater China, Canada, the United Kingdom and the United States.'The 14th Factory' alludes to its historical roots in the äóìThirteen Factoriesäó of the Canton region in eighteenth-century China, during which designated Western trading quarters formed a culturally and heterogeneous establishment for European and Chinese traders.ŒæOur imagined Fourteenth Factory aims to retrace the origin of a factory äóî a repository of goods at its crossroads of production äóî and its molding of the future, which prompts the question; what happens next?This artistic endeavor will ultimately introduce audiences to 14 organically linked sections, taking viewers on a journey through large scale sculptures, video environments, otherworldly landscapes and live performance art.The 14th Factory is an ever evolving collective whose mission is to create large-scale public art and cultural experiences, that are meaningfully accessible to people across all ages, backgrounds, and demographics. It is a collaboration of artists from China, Hong Kong, the UK and the USA, driven by a passion to create art and to engage the community in the process.Collaborators include the Beijing-based visual and performance artists Cang Xin and Li Wei; Hong Kong artist and designer Stanley Wong; photographer Wing Shya; New York composer Gary Gunn; Irish film director Scott Carthy; and urban planner and landscape designer Lily Kwong, among many other artists.The full list of collaborators can be viewed on our website.äóì14th Factory Education is grounded in aesthetic inquiry. Through conversations, workshops and performances, participating visitors will actively engage in the installation art at 23 Wall Street. To ensure that gallery experiences are an open-ended dialogue between art and audience, [these interactive experiences] invite visitors to find their own voices, connecting their lives to the objects installed and the concepts encountered äó_to act rather than to be acted upon.äó - The Center For Arts EducationOver the course of the past year, The 14th Factory has been working closely with the Center For Arts Education and New York City schools to develop an accessible contemporary art curriculum to support students with various interests and backgrounds.Œæ"Although many people may agree that arts (music, theatre, dance, visual, media, literary and more) are an important part of education, they may not realize the powerful trickle-up effect of arts education on a modern, innovative workforce. Indeed, arts education has the power to transform societies for the better." - Huffington PostŒæŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæ Floor Plan for Interactive Art SpaceŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæŒæ         Sample Lesson PlansŒæThe 14th Factory invites exhibiting artists and educators to an on-going dialogue that enhances studentsäó» artistic experiences beyond the exhibition.For more information on our program, please visit our website. All education programs and activities are given for FREE.Our goal is to raise at least $25,000 to greatly enhance our education program.ŒæPartnering with New York City schools and organizations such as Center For Arts Education, the 14th Factory has developed an accessible contemporary art curriculum to support students with various interests and backgrounds.ŒæReaching our minimum goal, we will be able to afford essential materials, equipment and learning resources to enrich our range of educational workshops and lectures. But with your additional help, not only will we be able to increase our capacity to reach more students, but we will also be able to maximize the potentials of our learning environments.Every contribution will help towards a richer experience for all who participate.ŒæIn short, the more you give, the more we can share!Anything beyond our needs for the project will go to charity - not a dollar will be wasted.We are asking the community to collaborate with us during this period so that the exhibition not only reflects the artists, but all our supporters. Art, and creativity is an important part of a student's education and we aim to provide a space for students to experiment with art. We have amazing awards for your time and generosity, and we will keep you updated on the production every step of the way!The 14th Factory Foundation's mission is to create large-scale public art and cultural experiences, that are meaningfully accessible to people across all ages, backgrounds, and demographics With your help, we aim to create the first in a series of projects, with ever-evolving plans for community engagement.

Each year at Burning Man, countless unique, unrepeatable, community-driven things happen, things that, once you experience them, often stay in your heart or mind forever. And every year is different. New things happen, or old things happen in new ways. Itäó»s why so many of us go year after year, and itäó»s one of the things that make each burn so magical and unique.ŒæFor many burners, nothing is more magical and unique than the Temple. At the Temple, the people of the playa collaborate with a dedicated physical space in authentic human spirit and love, in pain and sorrow at times, and ultimately in healing, hope and release.ŒæBy virtue of this mystic interaction of spirit and space, the Temple is the only large-scale structure that is authentically co-created by the artists and the people of the playa, as they interact with the Temple throughout the burn. To put it another way, no other artifact of the annual event so thoroughly absorbs, synthesizes, transmutes and expresses the hearts and souls of the particular spiritual beings at that particular yearäó»s burn.ŒæWhen the Temple burns on Sunday, itäó»s a release and closure. As it should be.ŒæEach year, though we let the Temple and everything it means to us rise smoky into the vastness of the night, thereäó»s value in remembering, in memorializing Temples past, for the architectural wonders that they were, for the artistry and effort that brilliant, inspired people put into creating each one, and also for the spiritual spaces that the people of the playa created within and around them.ŒæRemembering Temples past is the objective of The Temple Memory Project.ŒæThe Temple Memory Project 2016: What It is and What Itäó»s NotŒæThe Temple Memory Project 2016 is a relatively small exhibit to be placed at the Temple Guardian Camp during the burn. Itäó»s being designed and built by a volunteer team of people from the Temple Guardian Camp. The project grows organically out of past efforts at the Temple Guardian Camp to display images of the past Temples, including the large banners that were printed and hung on our training structure in 2015. We believe that a standalone structure for The Temple Memory Project will provide a better display and will better engage the community in the exhibit content.ŒæThe Temple Memory Project 2016 exhibit consists of walls that display printed images of the 15 past Temples, along with images of people interacting with past Temples. In the center of the exhibit will be a small theatre where there will be displayed slideshows and video from Temples past. If we can arrange it, there may also be a few artifacts from past Temples on display in cases around the exhibit.ŒæThe entire structure will fit in a footprint of 24 feet by 24 feet and stands 8 feet tall. It will be sturdy enough to withstand playa weather conditions and will generate no moop. It is powered by a solar generator system.ŒæŒæHere is a sketch diagram of the exhibit structure:ŒæThatäó»s what it is. Itäó»s also important to note that The Temple Memory Project is not officially affiliated with or funded by the official Burning Man organization, any official Temple builders camp or organization (past or present), or the official Temple Guardians organization.ŒæThis project is simply a Temple Guardian Camp effort, in terms of its official management. We will not be representing it as anything else. However, weäó»d be happy to receive assistance from any or all of the above-mentioned organizations, including any of the items listed below in the äóìHow You Can Helpäó section below.ŒæAbove all, weäó»re trying to keep our effort manageable in 2016. äóìKeep it doable,äó is our motto.ŒæHow You Can HelpŒæThis project currently needs funding to help us make it a reality. Ideally, we will need to raise about $8,000.00 to cover materials and equipment, but we can do a minimal setup with a minimum of $2,000. It won't be as cool, so we're hoping we get closer to the $8,000. The bulk of this cost will be for high-resolution output and mounting of the photographic panels. Solar power system, video projector and lighting are also significant costs.ŒæWe also will need volunteers to help set up and maintain the exhibit during the burn; we expect that Temple Guardian Camp members will help here too.ŒæThe project also needs material assistance in the form of the following:Œæäó¢	High-resolution images of Temples past, at all stages (pristine, during the burn, burning)Œæäó¢	High-quality video footage of Temples past at all stages, including any documentaries, builder interviews, raw footage, personal expressions, etc.Œæäó¢	Any material artifacts (or images thereof) from past Temple builders, including sketches, notebooks, scale models, etc.ŒæIf youäó»re a past Temple creator, we would love to hear from you, especially if you would be willing to come to the exhibit during the burn and give a talk on your experience designing and building your Temple.ŒæWe would also welcome any assistance in promoting the project, so that people who are interested can contribute and/or simply visit the exhibit during the burn. This may include social media sharing, telling friends or whatever helps get the word out.ŒæContact UsŒæCurrently, there are two people leading this effort.ŒæEek Maus will be coordinating the physical construction of the exhibit and its generally production and maintenance. He is also the treasurer. Email eek at ekingsbury@cox.net.ŒæEden will be collecting and coordinating the imagery and artifacts associated with the exhibit, as well as scheduling any events or talks associated with it during the burn. If you have any photos, videos, or footage to contribute, or have been associated with building or designing Temples past (David Best, thatäó»s you), email Eden at eden@azurewings.net.ŒæFor more information on the Temple Guardian Camp, visit http://templeguardians.net/camp/
