The idea to create this mural popped into my head this morning when I woke up to more of the same ludicrous, asinine headlines that this excuse-of-a-president creates one after another after another after another after another.ŒæThe piece will be a series of large screen prints arranged like a mural. Like Warhol's soup cans, the individual images of trumf will be similar but also slightly different from one another. Each image will be selected based upon the emotional experience it invokes from the viewer. The mural as a whole is an image for our time, designed to appeal to those who have a desire to express the full range of their subtle emotions surrounding the events of today.Also, the mural is a physical, tangible item that can't be dismissed as "fake".

Este proyecto estíç enfocado a todas aquellas madres que quieran salir a divertirse un fin de semana, tener un respiro, y dormir tranquilas sabiendo que pueden ir a recoger a su hijo al dia siguiente. El personal capacitado y certificado con el que contaremos en la guarderí_a, así_ como nuestro servicio a domicilio e instalaciones del lugar, le haríçn sentir una gran tranquilidad y armoní_a de que su hijo estíç en buenas manos.En lo personal, sí© que un Buen establecimiento se sustenta en su gente, ademíçs que el poder tener la oportunidad de poder realizar este proyecto es un gran honor y una responsabilidad. Creo en nuestras nuevas generaciones y se que se puede crear un juíçrez mejor, con mejores ciudadanos, basíçndonos en los valores, en esa esencia humana que nos caracteriza como buenas personas, porque queremos que nuestros hijos aprendan y sean el mejor futuro para nuestras familias.Att.Jose luis perez de la rosa Se aceptaran 2 nií±os por persona, estaríç ubicado en la calle cacamatzin, por la av jilotepec, se contaríç con servicio de transporte para recoger y llevar a los infantes a sus hogares, el costo por 3 dias de guarderia es de 300 pesos por nií±o, de alimentos se les daran sopas frutas y platillos con carne y verduras, las edades van desde 2 meses a 9 aí±os, la hora de dormir de los nií±os seríç a partir de las 9 de la noche, el edificio era antes una bodega, se tienen 500 m2 de construccií_n, contara con su respectivo filtro, las salas de juegos, cocina etc. se aceptaríçn 50 nií±os.

Somos un grupo de artistas de Chile, cuyo interí©s de realizar esta muestra de artes integradas PAISAJES TELí_RICOS en el ExConvento de Tepoztlíçn, radica en la similitud de ambos territorios, los cuales se encuentran demarcados por titíçnicas montaí±as, surgidas  de movimientos telí_ricos, de explosiones volcíçnicas, desplazamientos de placas, deslaves. Las montaí±as del Tepozteco en Mí©xico y la Cordillera de los Andes en Chile, tienen en comí_n ser lugares del cobre y  fueron considerados lugares sagrados y ceremoniales por nuestras culturas ancestrales y donde se concentra la sabidurí_a. Hasta la actualidad transmiten poderosas energí_as, sensaciones y emociones  para sus habitantes, constituyendo un fuerte referente del lugar. Así_ mismo, remitií©ndonos a las mitologí_as locales encontramos que las montaí±as tambií©n  estíçn relacionadas a los movimientos telí_ricos. Nos interesa retomar esta relacií_n en tanto paí_ses telí_ricos, pues el fení_meno nos sití_a en la incertidumbre reconstituyendo cada vez,  los trozos rotos, tanto fí_sicos, psicolí_gicos y culturales. Reconstruccií_n a partir de los fragmentos.Estas majestuosas masas montaí±osas, nos inspiran a la interpretacií_n artí_stica, desde las artes bidimensionales (plíçstica y video), las tridimensionales (esculturas e instalaciones), al movimiento (danza y performance).PAISAJES TELí_RICOS es una puesta en escena donde los artistas reinterpretamossimbí_licamente un terremoto, maremoto o erupcií_n volcíçnica como un signo de nuestratierra mater, desde donde surge la reflexií_n ancestral frente a la naturaleza, formando unespí_ritu de asociacií_n y colectividad creadora que en un juego de equilibrios y de fuerzasexpresan la manera de ver y habitar nuestro territorio.Como paí_ses telí_ricos el fení_meno nos plantea la reconstruccií_n una y otra vez de lostrozos rotos, fragmentos tanto fí_sicos como culturales y humanos.El objetivo es difundir nuestra obra personal, así_ como generar una nueva propuestacolectiva. Cada uno expondríç y trabajaríç con elementos propios de la naturaleza, recreandodesde lo histí_rico, geogríçfico y sensorial con interí©s en los mitos, ritos y danzasrepresentíçndolos en manifestaciones interdisciplinarias plíçsticas y audiovisuales,entrelazando un tejido desde lo particular, asociado con la comunidad, en torno a un temacomí_n y lenguajes disimiles reflejados en distintas disciplinas de las artes visuales:instalacií_n, dibujo, grabado, pintura, escultura, performance, video.Plíçsticamente incorporaremos conceptos relacionados con el tema, tales como:cambios, movimientos, fragmentos, estratos, capas, soplos, grietas y costras entre otros.Trabajaremos con materialidades como tierra, cuerpo, fibras naturales, minerales y sonidos.Usaremos sí_mbolos como la serpiente: Treng-Treng y KayäóñKay de la mitologí_a mapuche,creadores de la tierra y el Camahueto, creador de los temblores.En tí©rminos espirituales emerge a la superficie la divisií_n cuaternaria de nuestro pueblooriginario mapuche: la naturaleza, el ser humano, la lengua y lo divino.Mi obra en general parte de la escultura como una investigacií_npoí©tica, primero desde la anatomí_a con distintas maderasencajadas y ahora desde un tema antropolí_gico en fibrasvegetales y otros elementos de la naturaleza como materialidad.Esta materialidad me entregí_ el mensaje del íçrbol en todo suciclo y amplií_ mi mirada hacia la performance con sentido ritual,mis esculturas son livianas y adaptables al cuerpo, para serinterpretadas, idealmente en colectividad para potenciar mensajedesde distintas disciplinas.Mi trabajo se caracteriza por la creacií_n de esculturas de fibrasvegetales adaptables al cuerpo que representan seresmitolí_gicos que se repiten en las diferentes culturas de Amí©ricaprecolombina, reinterpretíçndolos como la conexií_n entre loselementos y la espiritualidad. Este trabajo le ha permitidoincursionar en la realizacií_n de ritos y acciones performíçticas, lasque le permiten dar curso a su inquietud por interpretar lasabidurí_a ancestral.Mi objetivo es generar conciencia de volver al rito, expresarmensaje en colectividad y sacar al arte de las galerí_as y susentido solo comercial.La motivacií_n es dar a conocer de manera creativa, la granriqueza de la sabidurí_a de nuestros pueblos originarios, fomentarel conocimiento de lo simple y mirar nuestras raí_ces, para crecercon identidad.ŒæMi obra emerge en la indescriptible ligereza de unlevantamiento natural, un brote, una eclosií_n desde lasombra hí_meda emerge arrastrando desde el inconsciente,los sonidos profundos de un Mantra, un Purrun Mapuche,como una estructura compleja que arbitra la fusií_n entreconceptos, arte indescifrable por el procedimiento de laspracticas puramente racionales.En Mí©xico trabajarí© con la obra MANDALA KITRAL, palabrasanscrita Mapuche que significa cí_rculo que en su interior,simbolizaríç el fuego con su movimiento telí_rico, conformadocon luces en su interior. El MANDALA funciona como unmapa de la realidad interior, que guí_a y apoya el desarrollo alcual estamos predispuestos a responder, la figura circular vacon la historia humana, y todo lo que hace el poder del mundolo hace el cí_rculo, siendo una ayuda visual y míçgica que noshace alcanzar ciertos estados mentales al entrar dentro delCirculo, y al actuar en í©l, creíçndolo, se convierte en un actosagrado y curativo, conectíçndonos con los ritmos cí_smicosdel Universo, expandiendo nuestra conciencia como sereshumanos, naturales y cí_smicos.ŒæUno de los principales objetivos artí_sticos en mi obra es rescatarelementos de nuestra historia y territorio sur, en un replanteamientoestí©tico y conceptual de í©stos. Incentivar al espectador a lacontemplacií_n y cuestionamiento acerca de su paisaje y el imaginariodel mundo precolombino mediante las artes visuales y multimediales.Por medio de la pintura recreo paisajes de volcanes del sur de Chile endiíçlogo con la flora y fauna local. Esto paisajes son complementadoscon versos en mapudungun y castellano escritos por el poeta huillichede la ciudad de la isla de Calbuco, Juan Paulo Huirimilla.Utilizo imíçgenes de video y fotografí_a captadas durante la erupcií_n delvolcíçn Calbuco, X regií_n, Chile, en abril 2015. Integro a la obra cantosen mapudungun (lengua del pueblo mapuche) mezclados con sonidospropios de la naturaleza (agua, viento, fuego, píçjaros).Materialidades de fibra natural, hojas de íçrboles, musgo y algas seponen en escena en un espacio que invita al espectador a desplazarseen una experiencia que exacerba los sentidos sumergií©ndonos en una atmí_sfera que transita desde lo visual, lo sonoro, lo tíçctil y olfativo.Desde hace 26 aí±os aproximadamente, los vidrios llegaron amí_ para convertirse en arte. De la tí©cnica del vitreaux al vidriofundido y a la combinacií_n del vidrio con otros materiales. Lanecesidad de incursionar en el color, las transparencias, lassuperposiciones, los juegos de luces me llevaron aexperimentar con la materia del vidrio como soporte.La bí_squeda de lo bidimensional a lo tridimensional, culminí_en la creacií_n de una serie de äóìvitroesculturasäó, que implicí_un acercamiento a nuestras raí_ces ancestrales, a sus mitosy leyendas. Mi trabajo se convirtií_ en un hacer, recoger, ycombinar piezas de vidrios cortados, pegados, fundidos,texturizados, en algunos casos con inclusií_n de pedazos decobre, fierro, alambres, vegetales y otros.Actualmente mi obra habla de espacios agrietados, abiertos,fisurados, convulsionados, obstruidos. Recortes de loterrenal, del universo, del infinito. Intensidades volcíçnicas,erupciones que arrasan lo viejo y crean lo nuevo desde lascenizas. Son pedacerí_as y fragmentos de nuestra moradacomí_n: la tierra y el universo. Es por lo tanto, una obrasiempre en proceso. Son series abiertas que pueden serintervenidas y continuadas.ŒæBusco indagar por medio de mis grabados, los cruces y lafragmentacií_n de la mirada que transforman la realidad, lugares que heindagado con recursos formales propios del grabado, la pintura, elcollage, letras, fragmentos de textos, fotografí_as tanto propias comorecuperadas de los medios gríçficos, retrato el paisaje neurí_tico de lasociedad actual desde una mirada rebelde, a lo que integra uncromatismo minimalista que evoca la estí©tica japonesa, la manchasobre la gríçfica como recurso expresivo configurando planossuperpuestos en los que alterna lo sensitivo sobre lo mecíçnico pormedio de la tí©cnica que míçs he desarrollado: la serigrafí_a.Las obras gríçficas se caracterizan por la yuxtaposicií_n de diferentesmatrices que van siendo impresas dentro del sentido de la repeticií_nque asemejan fragmentaciones de ciudades en ruinas, destruidas o deun territorio recorrido por la autora. El estilo de los grabados, pueden irdesde la abstraccií_n estí©tica a la figuracií_n, siempre interviniendo lasimíçgenes, trasladando de un a otro a modo un movimiento constante,Telí_rico metíçfora de un Territorio empí_rico a su propio territoriointerior.Mi trabajo es con tres elementos: acuarela, tinta china y polvo depiedra.Los trabajos en acuarela y tinta china son en gran formato yrepresentan el agrietamiento de la tierra, seríçn trabajados conpocos colores para realzar mayor dramatismo.El polvo de piedra, aplicado sobre una tela, es una tí©cnica quesugiere mucho la tierra, permite unos escurrimientos cuando seestíç realizando que sugiere la corrosií_n de esta.En un origen todo era una piedra volcíçnica, la arena misma ya estíçreducida a una desintegracií_n de la piedra. Las rocas con el tiempose van desmenuzando.En Chile se ha trabajado dos aspectos, la madera en el sur y en elnorte la piedra, material casi eterno.Es un producto natural de una tremenda resistencia y en el caso deChile existe por todo el paí_s por la cordillera y por la costa lo que leda una dignidad permanente.Del 7 AL 31 de OctubreŒæExhibicií_n de obra en el Museo ExConvento de TepoztlíçnTalleres: Ecograbado para nií±os por Antonella Rojas AudaTaller de Tejido en fibras por escultor Francisco RiosPresentacií_n de video "IMAGINARIO PRECOLOMBINO" de Verí_nica Astudillo.Charla "El arte en vidrio en el siglo XXI". por Cecilia Martner.Esta es una iniciativa independiente, que depende solamente de nuestros esfuerzos.ŒæNo contamos con patrocinio algunoŒæNo tenemos ningí_n a apoyo institucional. Llevamos trabajando en este sueí±o durante mas de 2 aí±os.ŒæŒæŒæŒæEsta exposicií_n es muy importante porque contamos con la oportunidad del espacio para exponer en MíÂxico, paí_s míçgico, rico en cultura ancestral, que enriquece nuestra visií_n artí_stica y la posibilidad de la retroalimentacií_n cultural. Esta exposicií_n acerca dos culturas latinoamericanas y expresividades propias de artistas contemporíçneos.Y GRACIAS A TU APOYO LOGRAREMOS REALIZARLA!!!

We are creating an interactive exhibit that allows us to combine our design backgrounds with emerging technology. Fusing marker illustrations, animations and cut&sew with the likes of wearable tech, augmented reality and gamification. Ultimately creating an experience that will help to transcend and push the limits of art with in our  community and the world.ŒæWe need your help to make sure we fully execute this before the grand opening on Dec.15th.ŒæTHE EXPERIENCEŒæGLYPHS is an interactive art exhibit featuring custom made masks by Petie Parker alongside marker illustrations by Jodee Markers. The masks and illustrations are displayed with in installations that turn each marker illustration into animations and activate augmented reality experiences for each mask.THE STORYThis experience is based around the story of two characters that go on an intriguing  journey of enlightenment.. Filled with intense obstacles, great battles, mythical characters and beautiful landscapes, this story shapes up to be just as intriguing as the art pieces that go along with it.The collection of masks, illustrations and the title of this exhibit are inspired by the recurring glyph symbols and the powers they give the characters the in story. In short, each mask has their own unique power and sub-story told through the marker illustrations.OUR PROCESS1st. We Design the masks2nd. We CreateŒæ18x24 Marker Illustrations based on the masks and scenes from the story.ŒæŒæ3rd. We animate the illustration.ŒæŒæ4th. Each mask, originil marker illustration and animation will be on display during the exhibit.Œæ5th.Œæ Augmented Reality Activated on masks when viewed through GLYPHS APP.Œæ6th.  Augmented Reality animation activated on illustration when viewed through GLYPHS APP.ŒæŒæ

Dia de Los Casi Muertos or Day of the Almost Dead is an ongoing multimedia project that explores the cultural differences between Mexican and American experiences with death and aging.ŒæThe aim of the project is for contemporary American society to examine their values by confronting the taboo of death äóñ ultimately pushing us to  appreciate the gift of life. ŒæThrough video, sculpture, and photography, the 2017 iteration of the Dí_a de Los Casi Muertos project will profile community members of diverse backgrounds. Video interviews give participants the opportunity to talk openly and candidly about their experiences with death.Œæ This project would not be possible without the many individuals that have come together and given of their time and craft.ŒæThe funds donated to this KickStarter will go to pay local artists, performers, video editors, purchase materials, and everything else goes into creating this unique experience.ŒæAny funds received beyond the Kickstarter goal would go toward the future installations of the project.ŒæPlease donate and help bring this project to lifeThank youJulio GonzalezŒæŒæ$25 RewardA remembrance candle with the name of a loved one will be added to the Dia de Los Casi Muertos exhibition. Provide the name of the loved one you wish to honorŒæ$35 RewardDia de Los Casi Muertos Tshirt.ŒæPlease indicate desired size$50 RewardDia de Los Casi Muertos photo book. Limited edition book of the last three years of this project. The dinner can serve up to 6. The dinner will be held in Charlotte NCŒæ

What has fascinated me the most during my 17 years in the Berlin clubbing-scene, is the type of environment that is created in the various venues. Itäó»s not by accident that the last 13 of those years have been at what is now known as Berghain (formally OstGut). I find that when I try to describe what the äóÖBerghain experienceäó» is like, words like family, community and safe space come to mind. But they don't truly sufficeäó_Iäó»ve witnessed many forms of self-identification expressed by Berghainäó»s guests. From graphic interpretations of the building as prominently featured coverphotos on Facebook, to tattoos of the logo etched on the nape of necks. Rather than to attempt to describe the ever unique and therefore countless experiences one can have during a äóìKlubnachtäó, I chose instead to investigate the consistent relationship between myself and the buildingäó»s very structure. Iäó»ve focused on the spaces which felt like the warm, reassuring embrace of a friend, while in actuality being just a cold, concrete corner. It is in these spaces I could retreat into cognitive seclusion and see myself anew, time and time again.ŒæI am Rommelo Yu, an artist who has drawn inspiration from living endless days and nights in the heart of Techno. Hallenglas is a reflection (in the form of an installation) of my personal experience being part of the Berlin Club culture for over the past 17 years.Roughly 2 years ago, after creating Klubkronenleuchte, I found what became the inspiration to start working on Hallenglas.Two Japanese artists, Hokusai and Hiroshige created artistic homages to the same mountain, Mount Fuji, even creating their own ukiyo-e series similarly entitled "Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji". Erika Eiffel was the founder of OS Internationale; an organization for those who develop significant relationships with inanimate objects. To succeed in her Archery career, she drew inspiration from the Eiffel Tower. She later went on to mary the tower after having ended her 20-year relationship with the Berlin Wall.I like to describe these two examples as inspiration derived from resonance found between oneäó»s self and a structure. With Hallenglass, I took these ideas further.ŒæThe result: the use of modern technology to put on display and communicate the sensation provoked by the immersive experience that is Berghain.Stained glass windows. Each view is imbued with memories through the use of colors, but devoid of any other structures. Just me and the building äóñ one and the vibe.I need your help to make this a reality.Supporters of this project receive special gifts; namely, custom designed necklaces, entry to the exhibition, art prints, and even pieces of the artwork are all to be had, relative to the size of the contribution made.Download GIF to share with your friends!Want to know more about my work? You can view selections here. (Unfortunately, this information is only available in German)Œæ

Face Value was conceptualised through research which analyzed the socio-cultural context of both historical self-portraits and selfies, in order to show evidence that these two forms of self-representation have similar cultural value. Investigations into the creation of identity in the age of social media, the social context of historical self-portraiture, and the effect of the popularisation of celebrity culture on cultural worth, led to the identification of common elements between the two forms of identity representation.ŒæIn order to give this equality of worth more exposure, Face Value aims to make the intangible currency of selfies tangible.ŒæFace Value plays on the social currency of digital identity by subverting the traditional process of minting coins. Previously, only those in royalty or immense power and fame had their portraits on coinage.  Now that anyone can create a globally recognised Self on the internet, the separation between 'general public' and those with fame and power is slight. By taking selfies from the public, passing them through a digital process, and casting the portraits onto individual and personalised 'coins' made from the metal from real currency, Face Value merges monetary and social currency into selfie-coinage.ŒæThis project will use a novel and innovative approach in its production by combining digital technologies of photography, social media, and computer-controlled machining with the traditional and physical processes of smelting, casting and minting.ŒæFace Value has been selected to appear in the 2018 Performance Arcade in Wellington on the 19th of February.Œæhttps://www.theperformancearcade.com/If funded, it will engage thousands of members of the public and encourage participation with the creation of a personalised token coin for each person. The work is reliant upon this participation, and the ability to create and keep a part of the performance will be an incentive for the community to get involved.Œæ

William Ferdinand creates and uses art to express his emotion on canvas, having struggled with mental health issues, namely major depressive episodes spanning over a decade he regularly expresses himself with acrylic paint in abstract, contemporary & minimalist form. Often Pollock-esque, he however also finds his own style in times of great distress. For his upcoming project he has come to the conclusion that he would like to recreate current artworks and create new artworks in a more dramatic and bold statement using larger canvases and thus more paint. Then upon completion of the series 'Madness & Me' he desires to exhibit these works locally before attempting to gain momentum within certain circles to one day exhibit nationally and or internationally. His artwork is a visit into his mind, a discussion without works and a glimpse of true emotion captured in times of great struggle. Working in a supportive environment to help spur him on with his works he hopes to use this project to get through the winter and to represent the many whom suffer from mental health conditions that quietly suffer alone. Awareness is key with mental health and this project shall encapsulate dramatic works that will no doubt cause great discussion with regards to mental health.

Your contribution will go towards scholarships for students enrolled in the CSU Summer Arts 2017 course "Printmaking & Installation: Out of the Matrix."The two week course is an amazing opportunity for undergraduate and graduate students to work with three highly skilled contemporary printmakers: Dennis McNett, Mazatl and Kill Joy. Students will have the chance to learn printmaking techniques from these masters while also earning college credit.ŒæFor more information on the Guest Artists, please visit the links:Dennis McNett:Œæhttp://www.wolfbat.com/Mazatl:Œæhttp://www.graficamazatl.com/Kill Joy:Œæhttp://estudiomitl.bigcartel.com/CSU Summer Arts is a California State University systemwide program. As such, we focus on supporting the artistic and academic needs of our students, faculty, and arts administrators. However, we are pleased to offer admission and select scholarships to California community college students planning to transfer to a CSU campus, to adult learners, and community artists beyond the CSU and California.CSU Summer Arts in-residence program is transformative education at its best. The immersive summer school builds the studentäó»s professional skill set and increases capacity for future work while escalating the student artistsäó» and teachersäó» abilities to reflect, gain new insights, self-challenge, foster passion, and make life-changing shifts in perspective.Whether participating as an artist, performer, or audience member, we believe the arts nurture the human spirit and foster citizenry. It is through diversity in the arts that we develop aesthetic sensibility and discover other ways of knowing the unique worlds around us. Through the arts, we are able to gain new perspectives on what it means to be human.We strive to develop life-long behaviors, principles, and values that sustain creative character:Œæäó¢ Courage and passion to createŒæäó¢ Resilience demonstrated by the ability to try, fail, and persistäó¢ Work balanced with play; the roles of process and productäó¢ Drive to curiosity, problem finding, and problem solvingäó¢ Respect and ethical behavior; individuation balanced with socializationäó¢ Diversity in expressionWe are teaming up with Print & GloryŒæwho supports, enriches, and expands the experience of Printmaking for students at CSU Fresno. Through community activities and education, this organization promotes awareness about this medium and the local artists involved. These ambitions are made possible through fund raising, guest artist lectures, and interaction with local and other academic organizations.Button and Stickers (available in packs as well!):ŒæŒæŒæPrint & Glory logo T-Shirts (choose one design):ŒæŒæPlease note that the Guest Artist Prints, Guest Artist T-Shirts, Out of the Matrix Poster, Guest Artist Print Pack, and workshop buttons will all be created during or after the workshop from prints created during the workshop, no images available!All these items are limited to this single event and cannot be purchased outside of this offer!

We are raising funds to exhibit artist Jason Peters' work and vision, Sky Diamond. This piece will be installed at the SPRING/BREAK Art Show in Brooklyn, NY May 6-14th and we need your help! We believe great art deserves to be seen, especially during times like these when devises leave little room for varying experiences. This piece will be a vast and thrilling experience to witness and we really hope you'll be a part of bringing it to life.Funds raised will go toward materials and labor in order to make this incredibly ambitious piece a reality. Please help us accomplish this vision that we feel will push art in an imperative direction.ŒæSky Diamond uses fluorescent tubes to occupy the space, allowing the viewer to experience the object as "a line drawn with light in space."Peters constructs twenty-three prisms stacked upon each other in order to make two equilateral triangels combining to create a diamond shape. The diamond pulsates with colored lumens challenging the structure of the surrounding room.This delicate-looking structure will float in the center of the room, allowing the viewers to experience light as three-dimensional drawing tool.The diamond shape alludes to the refraction of light achieved by the optical prism, which relies on perfection of angle and line in order to achieve differing wavelengths of light. Œæ ŒæŒæIn 2012, SPRING/BREAK Art Show launched to critical acclaim. Consistently heralded as "NY's Hippest Art Fair' the annual fair presents over 600 emerging to established artists' works in NYC's Landmarked The James A. Farley Post Office Building for a week long fair that brings tens of thousands of guests and generates tens of millions of online impressions. SPRING/BREAK is a unique opportunity for partners to interact directly with New York City's creative class. The eyes and ears of this city's movers and shakers are here.http://www.springbreakartshow.com/Jason Peters (b.1977, USA) lives and works in Brooklyn, NY. BFA Maryland Institute, College of Art, Baltimore. Select exhibitions: Pulitzer Arts Foundation, Oklahoma City Museum of Art, Katonah Museum, Center for Contemporary Arts Santa Fe, Mattress Factory (Pittsburgh), Project Space (Washington D.C.), Waterways (Venice, Italy), Supreme Trading (Brooklyn), Visionary Art Museum (Baltimore), Architecture Museum, Augsburg, Germany among others. His work is represented in public and private collections worldwide.ŒæJason Peters is known for his site-specific large-scale installations, which examine the limits of human perception, sensory reaction and the biological effects of light. Stemming from a fascination with environment and spatiality, Peters attempts to evoke emotional and intellectual reactions to these objects. Within his practice, he utilizes patterns derived from mass-produced materials and unique found objects to construct sculptural pieces, which reflect upon or make reference to their surroundings. Peters has formed an interest in experimenting with light as a structural tool, exploring its ability to alternate from intensity to subtly, and our use o flight as utilitarian object.Œæwww.jasonpeters.comWe would be so grateful for you help. We believe Jason's work is incredible and deserves visibility and because of this we have dedicated ourselves to bringing his work to life. Please consider helping us! Thank you so much for your time!Œæ

Hello Everyone, and thanks for reading!ŒæLiterally all I want to do for the rest of my life is paint and plant trees. My goal is to create living installation artworks comprised of regionally native coniferous and deciduous trees, grasses, flowers, and a small amounts of food producing species in order to combat climate change, preserve and increase wild spaces, restore migration corridors, increase genetic diversity and resilience in both wild stock and food stock, while using using seed collected from my first small location in Two Harbors, Minnesota, from ditches, city sidewalks, storm drains, from trees downed by storms, from seed falling in-season, from my parent's gutters, and even from fruit I bought at my local co-op.The project is simple: for every $1 raised, either one tree seedling or four tree seeds will be directly planted to combat climate change.ŒæClimate change presents a range of challenges, varying projections, uncertainty, and dangers, and I want to dedicate the (hopefully) next 30+ years of my life to not only slowing the process of climate change but also mitigating the already significant effects in regards to wildlife and the stability of our food system. Among other challenges presented by climate change, we are seeing USDA plant hardiness zones moving by the year, which will have a profound impact, especially on trees; plants have their own specific tolerance ranges, and the climate is changing far more quickly than trees are able to spread through natural processes. We must give Nature a helping hand by planting trees and other plants at the edges of their tolerance ranges in anticipation of changing hardiness zones. I also believe we must plant food-producing tree species, especially those with more narrow tolerances and that are at-risk, inside of greenhouses in order to ensure their continued survival as well as our own. Additionally, wildlife species are starting to migrate into areas they previously had not existed, and we must support these species, who have just as much right to be here as we do, by ensuring migration corridors and safe passage.I don't have the time or the energy to convince the unconvinced, but have and will continue to share such information on social media, contact legislators, have personal discussions, and otherwise advocate action and education.ŒæAs a proof of concept, I purchased land in Two Harbors using personal funds and got to work. In the past 18 months, I have collected at least 500,000 tree seeds, of which I spread 350,000 in the field on the land I purchased. I also planted a token handful of seedlings that I had prepared previously. Another 100,000 I spread in trays, pots, and soil beds as test plots, and the last 50,000 I took special care and cold stratified (treated with freezing temperatures) in a variety of soil mixes to ensure some would be successful.ŒæI literally have no hope of counting the number of trees that came up. The tests surpassed my every expectation, with almost every method having some range of success, and germination rates of those that have had sufficient time to germinate and those I have been able to track and check have ranged from 15-90%, with a handful of strategies having near-perfect germination and 1-2 month survival. The first large scale planting last spring was comprised of two varieties of maple, approximately 60,000-70,000 seeds, had germination rates of about 18%, and nearly all were still alive last fall, though it is too early to determine winter survival. I also began collecting and spreading various wildflower and pollinator/insect friendly flowers and plants including yarrow, bergamot, sunflowers, lupine, and a token amount of a few others, but I do not yet have much data yet aside from a few seed trays (about 5,000 seeds total) of Lupine, which have sprouted but are tiny.My initial goal is $50,000, which would allow me to purchase and plant a second plot much further south, likely along the I-35 corridor as that is a popular migration route for migratory birds and insects.ŒæFor every $50,000 raised, I will be able to purchase another property to add to the diversity of ecosystems available for seed collection and propagation, and each will feature a work of art planted in wild species. Regardless of amount raised here or elsewhere, I will place a portion of land purchased and planted over the course of my life into irrevocable trusts to be set aside upon my death as natural spaces, to be managed by existing non-profits upon completion, and partially open to the public as free food forests, though I cannot foresee the exact timeline or amount of land that would qualify for that process and I am open to suggestions.I am currently determining the range of certifications required for Minnesota and some other states as well as various counties and localities in order to ensure legality, though I have verified legality of actions taken thus far, and am working towards Minnesota nursery certification and will start the process of organic farm/food production certification after either a nursery or arborist certification is completed.I purposely waited until after Earth Day to Launch this project publicly because I believe we need years or decades to repair the damage already caused, and I intend to spend my life both physically enacting this plan regardless of scale and advocating for Climate Change Action on every scale. Please note, I am not a non-profit, though I do not wish to be seen with a high profit motive. I will plant food species, sell plants, vegetables, and seek other revenue streams by which to remain sustainable after this fundraising push, including commissioned installation pieces (starting price is $100,000), though I will insist on creative control and reserve to right to refuse if the subject matter conflicts with the aims of this project. I don't need to be rich, but financially comfortable would be great, and most future proceeds from this project (and literally everything else I do for the next ~30 years or so, knock on wood,) will simply be reinvested to plant more installation pieces. I would like this project to become the largest set of installation artwork in the world, and by the time I die I hope it spans the world.The first painting I intend to enact as plantings is that of the map of Earth, with the oceans and waters being warm colors representing both grass and flower plantings as well as rising sea temperatures and levels, and the greens representing the land masses being tree seeds and seedlings yet to be sown. The map is artistic and not to scale, and I intend to select a more accurate representation on which to base my final painting; map experts and enthusiasts, please contact me to discuss the most optimal projection for this purpose.ŒæThe $1/seedling or $0.25/seed cost is the bare minimum that I would commit to planting, and funds would be divided at a ratio of 80% planted in seed and 20% planted in seedlings, with a +/- margin of error of 5%; in practice, the planting goals will likely be exceeded many times over. The fine print is that I have no idea how successful this will (or won't) be, so I am giving a time frame of a decade to plant up to 10,000,000, seeds and seedlings through this program, and though I don't expect it to reach anywhere near that much, 20 years if it exceeds that amount.While I have already started working with a few local organizations in Minneapolis and Two harbors to further this plan, I am open to working with any group, organization, non-profit, city, county, state, or federal agency, farmer, school district, or other entity, and more will be announced via the Seeds For Climate Change Facebook Page and soon-to-come website. I intended to be somewhat better prepared prior to launch, but my time is being spent with the trees and plants, rather than presentation and marketing. I'm more concerned about the outcome than I am appearances or polish, because methods and outcomes are the most important aspect of this project. I am using the following hashtags:#SeedsForClimateChange#Seeds4ClimateChangeThank you again for reading, and if you can't contribute financially, I am open to volunteer coordination and would be overjoyed if you shared this on social media and with your friends to help me gain traction.Œæ

Ese espacio va a ser cambiado, re-deformado segí_n transcurren esos momentos.Va a ser una supresií_n de pareces segí_n se desarrolla el happening, por que vais a estar dentro de ese cambio experimentando esos nuevos mundos.ŒæFinalmente se llega a un momento donde se desarrollaríç la accií_n final, que seríç conocernos , pero ese momento es míçs secreto, pues tiene una emocií_n y un sentimiento total.La coleccií_n de MARCO TEXTIL para ENCUENTRO DE LA SENSIBILIDAD ESPACIAL seríç mostrado de forma fugaz y simultíçnea con el espacio, descubriendo figuras plíçsticas y humanas de forma escultí_rica y arquitectí_nicamente.ŒæHay 200 camisas para hombre y mujer, se mostraríçn 100 en la instalacií_n. Tambií©n laŒæŒæfotografí_a y video, ya que nosotras nos dedicamos a la escenografí_a y textil, pero necesitamos vuestra ayuda.La construccií_n de los espacios estíçn a nuestra responsabilidad y libertad para mostrar.ŒæEn las donaciones damos la posibilidad de adquirir una CARTA DE INVITACIíñN al Encuentro, solo 300 disponibles, ya que es un proyecto ciertamente privado, pues no podemos mostrar esto a todo el mundo, necesitamos concretar para poder acercarnos a vosotros.Tambií©n podí©is conseguir la CAMISA MARCO, solo hay 200 ejemplares, de los cuales solo ponemos disponibles 100 en la web, ya que los otros seríçn parte del espacio. Totalmente diseí±ados y elaborados por nosotras, son una belleza que esculpe la figura humana de forma arquitectí_nica.ŒæPINTURA Y íñLEO MARCO, aparte de nuestra accií_n espacial tambií©n nos centramos en la pintura abstracta, utilizando los colores como apertura a espacios y formas tridimensionales que juegan juntas en el lienzo. Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæLos encontrarí©is en la Webmarcoperspective.tumblr.com/ ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæhttps://marcoperspective.tumblr.com/ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæhttps://marcoperspective.tumblr.com/

Thank you so much for your interest in ŒæShrouds of the Somme äóñ we are hugely grateful for your support.ŒæDespite an overwhelmingly positive response, we are not going to meet our crowdfunding target. It was an äóÖall or nothing campaignäó» which means no money will be taken from your account. ŒæAlthough we are very disappointed, Rob is continuing to stitch shrouds and one way or another, 72,396 shrouded figures will be laid out to remember those whose bodies were never recovered from the Somme battlefields. We are determined to see this through.ŒæThere have been some real success stories along the way including: gaining the wonderful British actor Jim Carter as patron; support from the Lord Lieutenant of London; a fabulous introduction from Show of Hands at their sold out Albert Hall concert; a hugely well-received launch at the Honourable Artillery Company and wide press coverage including BBC, ITV, Sunday Express and Soldier Magazine. There is more to comeäó_ŒæWe would like to ask two things of youäó_Œæ1.       Please consider honouring your pledge either by:Œæ- Œædonating to the Shrouds of the Somme HERE äóñ it will mean re-entering your details, but we hope that you will take the few minutes required to complete the process äóñ we can now also collect Gift Aid which will add at least 20% to your donationŒæŒæ- Œæpre-ordering one of the shrouds or photo books at our website HEREŒæ2.       Please send an email to info@shroudsofthesomme.com with the subject äóÖsubscribeäó» so that we can keep you up to date with progress as kickstarter does not share your contact details with us.ŒæThank you again for believing in this incredible project äóñ we will get there and honour those who gave their all.ŒæVery best wishesŒæRob, Jake, Mel and the Shrouds of the Somme teamHelpline: If you get stuck at any point feel free to call us onŒæ07940 950396 or email: friends@shroudsofthesomme.comTo mark 100 years since the end of the First World War, artist Rob Heard will stitch 72,396 shrouded figures to physically represent each of the British servicemen (+ 829 South African infantrymen) killed at the Battle of the Somme, whose bodies were never recovered from the battlefield.Planned for London in November 2018, the display is set to rival the Poppies at the Tower in impact and recognition of those who gave their lives. The Battle of the Somme was one of the bloodiest battles of the First World War, over a million men were killed or seriously wounded.  It is hard to comprehend the scale of this individual and collective sacrifice.ŒæRob's aim in creating this installation is to give a better understanding of the scale of the losses; what those vast numbers mean, and to individually honour each man who gave his life, but who to this day has no known grave. He wants in a small way to 'bring the boys home'.Jim Carter, star of Downton Abbey, recently became patron of the shrouds, and described the installation as äóìthe most moving and graphic depiction of the senseless death in the First World War that you can imagine.äó You can see him talking about it HEREEach body to a nameDuring the creation process Rob refers to a list of names of the British servicemen (and 829 South African infantrymen) whose bodies were never recovered and who are listed on the Thiepval Memorial in France, with data sourced from the Commonwealth War Graves Commission.  Each figure he creates is associated with a name; each soldier individually acknowledged and remembered.Rob cuts and hand-stitches their calico shrouds, then covers and binds the figures in the shrouds in a ritual of creation, remembrance and personal introspection.  The figures have been specially made so that they are flexible enough to move into an individual shape as they are bound. Rob allows each one to take on their own form, twisting and bending into their own unique shape. The minimum we need to raise is Œ£150k.  This pays for basic materials, some money for Robäó»s time and some project costs.Once the project is funded and the exhibition takes place we will then be raising money for SSAFA the Armed Forces charity who have supported servicemen, veterans and their families in times of need for over 100 years.   At the exhibitions in Bristol and Exeter we raised over Œ£52,000 for SSAFA and Exeter Foundation.Your contribution is vital and this project cannot take place without you. Help make this vision a reality and be part of an extraordinary and internationally important piece of remembrance.ŒæThank you.Œæ

ŒæMISSION STATEMENT- PROJECT SUMMARY ŒæThe installation seeks to promote Empathy by teaching people how to understand what others are feeling without bias or confusion. We want to help shape a world where people can appreciate each otheräó»s differences while celebrating the similarities that make us all Human.ŒæHOW IT WORKS ŒæOur philosophy is: "Shared pain is lessened and shared joy is increased," -Spider Robinson. We feel that you can achieve a greater understanding of yourself and respect for your neighbor through shared experience and analysis.ŒæWe ask participants to examine their relationship with strangers through a series of eight social experiments. The last experiment provides them with the ability to watch others in that same situation for comparison through the use of CCTV.ŒæAlthough the stations can be visited in any order, participants completing them in sequence will experience a gradual increase in social interaction and bonding.INSTALLATION OVERVIEWThe main feature of this installation is a 40äó»x40äó» octagonal tent encompassed on seven sides by individual 15äó»x11äó» pop-up tents. Each of the 8 stations is a live social experiment designed to reinforce the similarities shared between individuals and society as a whole. Each of the social experiments focuses on the everyday interactions, customs, and rituals that we sometimes take for granted. Like, why do so many people talk about the weather in an elevator?ŒæGOAL -Œæto answer the question: äóìCan you create empathy by increasing one personäó»s ability to recognize and share the emotions of another?äóIMPORTANCE ŒæThere is an inherent and growing, äóìUS vs. THEMäó mentality (in the world) that is not only harmful for personal development it is dangerous for the development of society as a whole. Knowing what someone else is feeling plays a fundamental role in our daily interactions, but we often work from very bias information. The assumption being that, äóìMy strong emotional response to this situation stems from the same experience as your strong emotional response.äó This however is rarely the case.ŒæŒæ INTERACTIVITYŒæPassport Books - At Station 1, äóìThe Hawthorne Effectäó Visitors will receive an individually numbered, äóìPassportäó book containing 80 blank pages and an insert outlining important information regarding each of the stations including: The locations of all experiments on a sitemap; experiment details and experience; approximate completion time; (as well as) the relationship of each experiment to the Burning Man 2017 theme of äóìRituals.äó ŒæAfter participants complete an experiment they collect a stamp in their Passport Book from the corresponding "Goal Pole" (stamping stations) and make a few notes about their experience on the following pages. ŒæŒæAt Station 7, any participant who completes all of the social experiments will have the opportunity to get their picture taken and be apart of our live mosaic photo wallŒæshowing an aerial view of the installation made of tiny photos of every other visitor who completed all 8 of the social experiments or donated $100 to our Kickstarter fund.After the event we will make the photo available for download for people on our website and aŒæprofessionally printed and framed image will also be mailed to individuals who donated more than $150 to the Stations of Humanity Kickstarter fund.Œæ

Hello and thank you for coming to our Kickstarter page! As the video showed we are going to create a communal space in which artists and the community can come together to share in a beautiful space that they create collaboratively. Our hopes is to have this event to grow and become either a bi-monthly (twice a month) or monthly event. We are asking for fundraising so we can both cover our costs and hopefully raise enough funds to make this into a bigger and better event. Our hopes and dreams are to pay partners for their works and time, to grow and build the space to include more collaborations, to give back to the community through donations and onsite programs, and to just generally improve the level of professionalism we are able to manifest. We would love for this to become something that the whole community can enjoy in, from families, to artists, to neighbors, pretty much anyone, and the limits are only as far as our imaginations and funding will allow. As of now we are covering the costs of the first event, but the sustainability of the event is going to rely on fundraising and donations at the time of the event, that's where you come in.Anything you can contribute would be much appreciated, we will have ongoing coverage of the event through our instagram page and facebook pages promoting both artists and the event as well as wrap up videos to show what your funding created. You can follow us on instagram at livingroombungalow and on facebook atŒæhttps://www.facebook.com/livingroombungalow/We thank you for your support and appreciate everything you have to offer. All the best to you and spread the love!

Sweetgrass and Sage Burn is a donation-based transformational festival of workshops, art, and music. We are focused on addressing and truly facing the way modern society functions at its root, and sharing ways we can ground and educate ourselves as a human family to live more mindfully, healthily, and symbiotically with life.ŒæThis is a project being organized by the grassroots collective, The Grand Rapids Autonomous Support System.Last year we traveled to various festivals around the region creating safe spaces, performing music and poetry, and offering workshops. While we were traveling we met a lot of diverse humans and organizations and got a taste of how many sincere hearts around the nation are dedicating themselves to creating change in our society. So, around a camp fire, we decided we wanted to create a common ground where people can share knowledge on things like community organizing, wellness, and the many challeges affecting our society, and compliment this with a celebration of art, music, and the connections we forge as community.ŒæEveryone from the artists, to production, to performers are offering their energy to make this gathering all it can. We are asking a donation of $42 to help us cover our costs but we don't want money to be a barrier between anyone and this space we are craft, so if you can't meet the minimum donation, please, please, please reach out to us so we can craft some kind of exchange!We can be reached at SGSBFestival@gmail.com

I am Sean Barber, a Detroit Ceramic mixed media artist, currently working on a large scale Ocean Installation for Artprize 2017... I hope you will support me in making my dream a reality. I am offering personal rewards including hand made ceramic shells, beach sand and photographs of the Detroit Art Scene.By the way,ŒæI am a Pisces, a water sign very much connected to this Ocean Front Installation.As a child growing up in Michigan during the 70's, I spent most of my time playing in the woods or at the beach. I love creating unique pieces by combining wood with ceramics. My childhood was driven by exploring the wonders of nature. My artwork is a reflection of those memories.The past 5 years have been life changing for me, my late return to Art school after 20 years and the rebirth of Detroit have created a new life for me in a world of possibilities.I am very active in the  Detroit Art Scene and have been working as a professional artist since 2009.ŒæThe birth of this installation comes from life, memory and the passing of my Grandparents at a place so familiar I like to call it home (The Ocean). My Grandpa was a preacher and a scuba diving teacher, and my Grandma always gave it to me straight. They spent much of their retirement living between Florida and the Grand Cayman Islands. This installation is a symbol of my admiration for their souls, and the memories which remain.ŒæThis project is also about me and my life as a struggling artist trying to make an identity in a big beautiful world by creating through experience and memory. It's a representation of the living, and those whose memories remain.I am in the process of creating a large scale Ocean Front installation consisting of a 32ft encaustic painting with hand made ceramic shells and mixed media pieces for Artprize 2017 in Grand Rapids, Michigan.ŒæBecause of the scale, I had to move to a large studio and find ways to cut costs in order to make this dream a reality. I built 4x8ft panels with construction materials and made my own water color paints using pigments, gum arabic, and honey.ŒæYour support will go directly towards operating my large studio, continuing the encaustic painting and producing additional ceramic shells. Given the scale of my Installation, the materials budget is quite high, so through your help, I'll be able to purchase the rest of the needed supplies and equipment.Let's share our experiences down by the ocean... collecting sea shells by the sea shore... together with loved ones... with our toes in the sand.I really hope you will share in my experience, memories and artistic vision. Come and meet me at the Beach!#1. $5 Beach Sand (from the Installation)A sample from the installation, I will sign it#2. $10 "Exploring Detroit" 8x10 PrintŒæŒæLet's celebrate the rebirth of Detroit!#3. $25 Hand size Ceramic ShellŒæ(from the Installation)ŒæThis one is for you!#4. $50 Hand size Ceramic Shell (from the Installation) and Studio visitPart of the installation, you will get a Hand size Ceramic Shell, like the one on the pic above... and you will be invited to come by the studio to paint a line!Draw a line on the mural#5. $100 Medium size One of a kind Ceramic Vessel-Œæapproximately 7x7ŒæHave you ever thought of having a Ceramic Vessel to enhance your home interior? This piece is one of a kind and offers an example of a proportionate size#6. $250 Large size One of a kind Ceramic Vessel- approximately 12x10I'd love to create a Large special Ceramic vessel just for you and your home!Œæ

ŒæOur snuffle garden will have several experience places for dogs and humans:1.A soundhouse: different poles form a maze between which all kinds of sounding cables hang. At wind you get another experience.2.Tree bark hill: Safe tree bark or hedge wood in which we hide certain fragrances. (Ever changing)3. Sandbox: For the graves, or to hide treasures.4.Hill + tunnel: planted with grass and tunnel in PVC (also for large dogs). The hill is also a viewing point for the dog.5.Aromagarden: different types of herbs that we regularly change.6.Grass garden: grasses in which we let the wind make her thing + adventurous to continue7.Water party: shallow, but many dogs find such a water party amazing.8.Mini Forest: Provides sufficient privacy with the immediate environment. Falling leaves in autumn, including lumber mountain (all branches on a mini hill) to stimulate odors and sounds.

Burning Man is basically the worlds largest art gallery.Anybody can bring whatever they like - and call it art.We really want to help illuminate the way we look at borders, barriers and differences amongst obstacles in general.We plan to build a tremendous lineal fence with a lattice extension in the middle of the playa at Black Rock City - then, we're going to burn it down.Burning Man aren't funding this, we are.We're not getting paid for this either!Black Rock Offensive is a statement about Equality - Since it's such a big statement, we've decided we need to build a huge piece of art to help us make it. Fences, offenses, borders, barriers, differences, exclusivity... Rules and regulations - If any you find any or all of these things to be offensive, then get on board this campaign.Talk to people, Tell people about the Black Rock Offensive.Be Offensive! Share our campaign video!You're certainly in the right place if you want to contribute to our campaign via donation.Who was it that said... 'Fences make the best neighbors'??Sometimes the best defense is a good offense.Œæ

Brief Conceptual Overview:The MEDEA is an artistic interpretation of what the future holds for mankind in the hyperrreal. Our aim is to materialise a number of theories surrounding the hyperreal and virtual reality and to create a thought-provoking piece on how we consume and conduct our lives at present.The piece will take shape as a capsule, in which a user is able to actively enter. The MEDEA will house one person at a time and the user will be able to explore and interact with the space as well as a number of visual and physical stimulus.The enclosed nature of the capsule will be used to create an immersive and as real-to-life situation as possible. This setup will create a virtual feast for the senses, leaving users open to a number of the creations within The MEDEA and the messages they convey.Funding:Your funding will go towards a variety of elements which will ultimately facilitate the completion of The MEDEA Project. The pie chart below depicts the areas your investment will reach:Œæ

Art is a powerful tool of expression and it is a reminder to what once was. Posters always send a powerful message that cannot be unspoken. While fascism is rapidly growing, a positive way to respond to this trend is by posting large pieces of classic posters across the city as reminder and as an art installation.We will use any means necessary to print as many large classic posters as possible and have them seen by the city. We will also create our own original messages too such as educational posters teaching what fascism is. It will be a clear reminder for those who are for democracy, for art, and for anyone who loves expression that together we stand strong and that together we will send a clear message against hate. Art is about beauty and sending a clear message. Our message through this project is that fascism, no matter what it is called will not be tolerated and there will be resistance. We have a duty to respond in kind with peaceful means of expression.ŒæCurrently the greatest cost is printing. For 50 posters of "24 x 26" it will cost an estimated $1500. However we may use different and cheaper means if it means more than 50 posters can be printed and we will print in various sizes to overcome cost per poster. The only barrier right now is the cost to print. The average cost per medium sized poster is $35. The larger the poster, the more it costs. But bigger posters means a bigger message against hate and fear. Œæ14 Traits of Fascism:Œæ1. Powerful and Continuing NationalismŒæ2. Disdain for the Recognition of Human RightsŒæ3. Identification of Enemies/Scapegoats as a Unifying CauseŒæ4. Supremacy of the MilitaryŒæ5. Rampant SexismŒæ6. Controlled Mass MediaŒæ7. Obsession with National SecurityŒæ8. Religion and Government are IntertwinedŒæ9. Corporate Power is Protected10. Labor Power is SuppressedŒæ11. Disdain for Intellectuals and the ArtsŒæ12. Obsession with Crime and PunishmentŒæ13. Rampant Cronyism and Corruption14. Fraudulent ElectionsIf you see or hear these trends, then please help support us. We need your help!"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak outäóî Because I was not a Socialist. Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak outäóî Because I was not a Trade Unionist. Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak outäóî Because I was not a Jew. Then they came for meäóîand there was no one left to speak for me." -ŒæMartin Niemí_ller ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

Das Thema meiner Diplomarbeit istŒæ"Prijedor 1992" der verschwiegene Genozid. ŒæŒæDas Bundesland Prijedor befindet sich im Nordwesten von Bosnien und Herzegowina, auf dem Ufer der Flí_sse Sana und Gomjenica. Nach den Ergebnissen der Volkszí_hlung von 1992 hatte die Gemeinde 112 543 Einwohner, davon waren 43,9% Bosniaken, 42,3% Serben, 5,7% Jugoslawen, 5,6% Kroaten und 2,5 % andere.Damit will ich deutlich machen, dass im Jahr 1992 anhand der offiziellen Definition in der Gemeinde Prijedor wí_hrend des Krieges Ví_lkermord begangen wurde. Fí_r jeden Punkt der Genozid-Definierung nehme ich je eine Aussage der Zeugen, die vor dem Internationalen Strafgerichtshof in Den Haag (NL) ausgesagt haben. Dies untermauert meine Stellungnahme und beweist das bewusst begangene Verbrechen gegen die Menschlichkeit in Prijedor 1992. Bezugnehmend auf das grí_íôte Massengrab nach dem zweiten Weltkrieg, Tomasica,Œæhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toma%C5%A1ica,_Bosnia_and_HerzegovinaŒæwird der kí_nstlerische Teil dieses Projekts eine Denkmalinstallation sein. Wie bereits erwí_hnt, ist es der nicht-serbischen Beví_lkerung weder erlaubt, Denkmí_ler aufzustellen, noch kí_nnen sie Plaketten an den Orten der ehemaligen Konzentrationslager (Keraterm, Trnopolje und Omarska) aufhí_ngen. Sogar den 102 unschuldig getí_teten Kindern wird bis auf weiteres, seitens der Gemeinde Prijedor, ein Denkmal unterschlagen.Meine luftgeformte halbkugelfí_rmige Installation aus weiíôem Textil hat einen Radius von 3 Metern. Sie ist í_ber zwei einander gegení_berliegende schmale Eingangsí_ffnungen betretbar. Zweck dieser Anlage ist die Vermittlung des Angstgefí_hls bei geschlossenen Rí_umen und des Gefí_hls der Unfí_higkeit, entfliehen zu kí_nnen, also zu spí_ren, wie es ist, gefangen und eingesperrt zu sein. Dies ist nur ein Bruchteil von Gefí_hlen, die Gefangene der Konzentrationslager erleben mussten. Das Denkmal ist in weiíôer Farbe und fast durchsichtig, um den Effekt zu erzeugen, Silhouetten von innen zu erkennen, jedoch nicht zu wissen, wie die Umgebung einen wahrnimmt, und dass man in Wahrheit in der Falle steckt.  In der Installation ist mann gezwungen den Opfern ins Gesicht zu sehen und die Zeugenaussagen zu hí_ren.ŒæMein Projekt steht fí_r alle zivilen Kriegsopfer von Prijedor. Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Es reprí_sentiert den ersten Baustein fí_r ein dauerhaftes Denkmal in dieser Gemeinde. ŒæDieses so wichtige Projekt soll als Installation durch Europa reisen. Die Reise beginnt in Sarajevo am 30. April 2017, genau 25 Jahre nach dem Beginn des Krieges in Prijedor.ŒæDarauf folgen die Stationen Wien, Brí_ssel, Berlin, Stockholm, Zagreb, Belgrad, Prijedor und Den Haag, wo es vor dem Internationalen Strafgerichtshof aufgestellt wird. Die genannten Stí_dte sind nur einige von vielen, wo das Kunstwerk platziert und prí_sentiert werden wird.In der gesamten Zeit des Projekt wird ein Filmteam das Projekt begleiten um ein Dokumentar Film darí_ber zu drehen. Wie bei den Ní_harbeiten.Œæhttps://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9k1NUlwZdGu-u8Spc6IJALC1a4qhB0oUPrijedor | Wichtige Fakten í_ber Entstehung und Umsetzung des Genozids 1992 :  ŒæPrijedor ist eine Stadt im Nordwesten von Bosnien und Herzegowina  an den Ufern der Flí_sse Sana und Gomjenica. Nach der Volkszí_hlung von 1992 hatte die Stadt 112 543 Einwohner, davon 43,9% Bosniaken, 42,3% Serben, 5,7% Jugoslawen, 5,6% Kroaten und 2,5 % andere.  09.Januar 1992  Die Republika Srpska (RS) wird an diesem Tag, also noch vor dem Krieg, gegrí_ndet.  (1995 wird der bosnische Landesteil, in dem wí_hrend des Kriegs Nichtserben systematisch vertrieben oder ermordet wurden, im Friedensabkommen von Dayton anerkannt.)Œæ 21.Mí_rz 1992 Die Serbisch Demokratische Partei SDS ergreift im ganzen Land die Kontrolle í_ber die Medien fí_r Propagandazwecke. Die Satellitenempfí_nger werden manipuliert. Es kommen nur noch Nachrichten aus Belgrad durch.   30. April 1992 Die offiziell gewí_hlte Regierung der Stadt Prijedor wird í_ber Nacht von der SDS gestí_rzt.Œæ  22.Mai 1992 Serbische Streitkrí_fte greifen das Dorf Hambarine an, zwei Tage spí_ter wird auch Kozarac angegriffen.   31.05.1992 Die Behí_rden der bosnischen Serben in Prijedor erlassen per Radio ein Dekret, in dem es heiíôt, dass alle Nichtserben (Bosniaken, bosnische Kroaten etc.) ein weiíôes Tuch an ihr Fenster hí_ngen und beim Verlassen ihres Hauses ein weiíôes Armband tragen sollten. Vorbild ist offenkundig die Brandmarkung von Juden und anderen ethnischen, religií_sen oder sozialen Gruppen durch das Naziregime im Jahr 1939.  Mit diesem Aufruf fí_llt die Entscheidung zur ethnischen Sí_uberung von Prijedor mit der Umsetzung folgender Fakten:ŒæIn den aufgezí_hlten Lagern werden aber auch bosnische Serben gefangen, weil sie ihren Nachbarn, Freunden und Familienangehí_rigen geholfen oder einfach ein anderes Glaubensbekenntnis hatten.  Tausende von Menschen werden gefoltert, vergewaltigt, deportiert oder ermordet. Weder das Geschlecht noch das Alter spielen bei diesen grauenvollen Taten eine Rolle. In Prijedor werden 3.173 Zivilisten ermordet, davon 256 Frauen und 102 Kinder. In weniger als 3 Monaten werden 94% der nicht serbischen Beví_lkerung liquidiert oder vertrieben.   Den Opfern des Genozids in Prijedor wird bis heute von den lokalen Behí_rden jede Aufmerksamkeit fí_r ihr Leid verweigert. Der Bí_rgermeister Marko Pavic und die Behí_rden lehnen es ab, die in Prijedor begangenen Verbrechen í_ffentlich anzuerkennen.  Gedenktage wie der 31.Mai 1992 sind auíôerordentlich wichtig, da Prijedor und der gesamte Balkan die Geschehnisse auch nach 23 Jahren nicht verarbeitet haben.  Kriegsverbrechen, Massenmord, Konzentrationslager und Massengrí_ber mí_ssen anerkannt und verurteilt werden und wichtige Plí_tze verdeutlicht werden. Das ist ein wichtiger Schritt, um nachhaltig Frieden schlieíôen und gemeinsam weiterleben zu kí_nnen.ŒæHeute ist Prijedor auf einer Seite ein Beispiel von Rí_ckkehr, Wiederaufbau und das gemeinsame Leben in Frieden. Jedoch ist dieses sogenannte friedliche Miteinander Leben nur oberflí_chlich, weil man í_ber die Ereignisse der Vergangenheit nicht sprechen darf. Oft wird den íìberlebenden der Zutritt zu den ehemaligen Konzentrationslagern verweigert, die bis dato nicht als Konzentrationslager gekennzeichnet sind. Die Regierung von Prijedor ignoriert die Schreiben der zahlreichen Vereine, Denkmí_ler an die gefallenen Opfer zu errichten oder andere Aktivití_ten zum Gedenken zu setzen.ŒæOpis projekta ŒæTema mog diplomskog rada je äó_Prijedor 92-prikriveni genocidäóì.ŒæOvim zelim jasno pokazat, da je po zvanicnoj definiciji 1992 u toku agresije na Bosnu i Hercegovinu u Opcini Prijedoru pocinjen genocid. Za svaku tacku definicije pojma Genocid, uzet cu po jednu izjavu svjedoka koji su svoje iskaze dali pred medjunarodnim  sudom pravde u Den Haag-u. Na taj nacin podupirem svoju tezu i dokazujem da je u Prijedoru 1992 pocinjen zlocin protiv covjecnosti. Osvrcuci se na Tomasicu, kao najvecu masovnu grobnicu poslije Drugog svjetskog rata, umjetnicki dio mog projekta cu biti instalacija spomenika. Kao sto sam vec spomenula, nesrpskom stanovnistu nije dozvoljeno da postavi bilo kakvu vrstu spomenika niti da objesi plakete na mjesta bivsih koncentracionih logora (Keraterm, Trnopolje, Omarska). Cak ni  102 neduzno ubijenoj djeci do danas od strane vlasti u Prijedoru nije dozvoljeno podizanje  spomenobiljezja. ŒæMoja zrakom formirana, polukruzna instalacija ima radijus od 3m.ŒæU njenu unutrasnjost se moze uc kroz dva oprecno postavljena ulaza. Svrha ove postavke je simulacija panike od zatvorenog prostora i osjecaja nemoci za bjegstvo, osjecaja kako je to biti uhvacen i zatvoren. Ovo je samo mali dio osjecanja koja su zatvorenici logora prolazili. Spomenik je bijele boje i skoro providan. Cilj je bio da se mogu nazirat siluete a efekat toga je da vidimo iznutra da se nesto desava vani, ali da ne znamo jasno kako nas okolina dozivljava i da smo zapravo zatoceni.  Unutar instalacije dolazi do suocavanja sa licima zrtava i paralelno ce se slusat njihove izjave u pozadini. ŒæMoj projekat posvecujem svim civilnim zrtvama rata u Prijedoru. On predstavlja kamen temeljac prvom stalnom spomeniku u Opcini Prijedor. Ovaj bitni rad treba kao instalacija da putuje Evropom.ŒæPutovanje ce poceti 30.04.2017 u Sarajevu, tacno na 25.godisnjicu pocetka rata u Prijedru. Potom slijede Bec, Brisel, Berlin, Stokholm, Zagreb, Beograd, Prijedor i Den Haag, gdje ce bit postavljen pred medjunarodnim sudom pravde. Spomenuti gradovi su samo neki od mnogih, u kojima ce instalacija biti pokazana.ŒæCijelokupni dogadjaj ce sve vrijeme pratit snimateljska ekipa, koja ce poslije napravit dokumentarac o tome, kao I za vrijeme izrade spomenika.

"Love Kiss" works is the size of my work so far the largest piece of work plans inspired by the famous photo of the World War II, "Kiss of Victory", love is the eternal topic of human expression of human emotions I created this The theme of the work, the skeleton of the work is from the reality of the skull data collected from friends, she is a symbol of life and symbolism, I have created skull series of works for many years, accumulated a wealth of creative experience and technology to complete this Pieces of work is facing enormous human and material difficulties, but also let me excited, in the burning man show to the participants to enjoy, will be a very shocking event.At present, from the material to the technology has done several careful calculation and analysis, from a screw, to the size and structure of each timber, have done a detailed design and planning, all the details and partial drawings are also completed, and In November 2016 completed the sample works, will convene a number of volunteers to participate in the team to complete the work, this work from the pre-production sites, art assistants, materials, tools, transportation, custom materials to the post-installation and production of a Series of cost components, I hope to get the world a dream and support the creativity of people to help make this work perfectly smooth presentation in Black Rock.The size of the work is 19.8 feet, 15 feet wide and 10.5 feet deep. The main frame material is pine. The skull image is a series of 30 thousand transparent plastic balls with fish line (or Bubble ball) composed of 50 lines of graphic graphics set into a three-dimensional space modeling, each fishing line are free flowing in the wind, the two kissing skull will shaking, like a flexible soft sculpture, but not Will lead to the line between the fishing line and messy messy, the frame is divided into top, center column and the framework of the keel frame composed of three parts, the base to install lighting, can enjoy the night, the top of the installation of acrylic plate punching incoming fishline, The bottom ball of the fish line is fixed with the positioning beads in the corresponding position.This project will help me to participate in the formation of the future of the Miami Art Basel Art Exhibition and other art activities.ŒæWhen I receive enough money to finish the art installation kiss of love ,I will give back my backers prizes. If that is not possible, then all the support will be returned to the backers. The estimatedŒæ delivery will be in July 2017.In the works until the end of this burning man, the fire burning is completed.ŒæŒæŒæŒæ
