API e Maestri Vetrai di Murano, COSI 'SIMILI, SPIRITI AFFINI, SIMBOLI DI DUE REALTA' IN VIA DI estinzione.Una serie di Fattori Quali pesticidi, Riscaldamento globale, siccitíæ e Distruzione dell'habitat naturale Stanno provocando la progressiva morte delle api, Cosi Come ingordigia, Concorrenza sleale, superficialitíæ, mancanza di rispetto rischiano di distruggere l'arte vetraria.In QUESTI Tempi, dove Il degrado ambientale Mette a Rischio la Sopravvivenza Umana e la Situazione Economica e politica del paese compromette il lavoro, Soprattutto Quello artigianale, ABBIAMO Pensato un un Progetto Che metta in Relazione Natura e Arte al bene di salvaguardare e preservarne l'Esistenza. Sebbene Possa risultare di poca Importanza, ha un significato Molto Pií_ Ampio: Mettere in Relazione I Maestri vetrai e le api Rivela MOLTI Aspetti Formali e numerosi Significati di valore Quali l'urgente e angosciante interrogativo circa il ruolo e dai ricercatori e il destino dell'arte e della Natura in this epoca. Il Nostro Progetto essenzialmente Consiste Nella Ristrutturazione, risanamento e ampliamento delle Strutture al bene di Creare un habitat Pií_ adeguato e consono a mantenere e garantire la permanenza in loco delle Due Realtíæ Che Giíæ VI Vivono, API e maestri vetrai. InOLTRE Attraverso Eventi e visite guidate, di gran lunga Conoscere al Pubblico Il Ruolo vitale delle api per il mantenimento di un ecosistema equilibrato e, non per ultimo, Il Ruolo dell'artigianato muranese, testimonianza di storia, arte e tradizioni. Per Poter concretizzare tutto cio ABBIAMO bisogno di Aiuto, POSSIAMO farcela Non Solo con Le nostre Forze.

Art Gathering stages the world's premier art show for street-tattoo and contemporary works in Long Beach, CA aboard the Queen Mary. The projects featured are part of an initiative to generate support for select visual art projects worldwide. Projects are proposed by independent artists and selected by our jury.The raised funds will be utilized to cover the costs of buying and building the necessary scaffolding and panel infrastructure needed to build the very large 24ftT X 16ftW freestanding wall surfaces for our hosted Muralists, their transportation, supplies and fees. The additional funds will also be utilized for the transportation fees it takes to get the large installations that make up the RANGE sector onsite, and crews to build them. Once the mural paintings are completed, they will be photographed and turned into limited edition screen printed poster packs for our RewardsŒæ #3 - #6 Supporters.Upon completion of the event, the murals will be available free of charge for other art initiatives to host for the remaining portion of 2016. They then will be white washed and utilized for the future muralists that take part in Art Gathering.Our Mission: Art Gathering will launch the first of its kind; a curated multi-media art festival offering multi-media artists, tattooist, collectors and visitors and a one-of-a-kind art experience. It is our mission to advance the public awareness of and involvement in the art of tattoo alongside the visual arts; to provide an extensive program of exhibits which promotes new work and diversity; to foster a place in the art community for the exchange of challenging ideas and the nurturing of new work; to support artists of all mediums; and to encourage collaboration and cross-fertilization between artists in multiple disciplines with the goal of producing the "New" Contemporary mixed media art. To accomplish this goal, we have incorporated independent artists from multiple mediums and galleries representing diverse art genres, broadening its audiences to include enthusiasts of: tattoo, modern contemporary, street, graffiti, low brow and traditional works, as well as works on paper, sculpture and installations all in one art fair.

Anima cava e’ó progetto che cerca di ritrovare läó»essenza di Venezia. La ricerca prenderíæ forma in una mostra che racconta le esperienze di alcuni cittadini, creando un percorso condiviso fatto di parole e oggetti che narrano unäó»ipotesi di futuro.	Il progetto parte dal dialogo con alcuni cittadini veneziani: Roberto Tramontin, ultimo di una stirpe di squerarioli, e il gruppo di amici di Hugo Pratt, famoso fumettista.Attraverso le storie, i progetti e le vite di queste persone, dei loro collaboratori e amici abbiamo potuto vedere una Venezia diversa, semplice e autentica allo stesso tempo, legata alla laguna, al lavoro, ai viaggi e alläó»immaginazione. Crediamo che la Venezia che ci e’ó stata raccontata non sia fatta per essere solo dei turisti, che sia costituita da molte anime diverse, le anime dei suoi cittadini che possono ancora riempirla di valore. Œ‚Se mai Venezia dovesse morire, non saríæ per la crudeltíæ di un nemico ní© per läó»irruzione di un conquistatore. Saríæ soprattutto per oblio di se stessaŒé (Salvatore Settis)Venezia sta diventando una cittíæ fantasma, popolata dallo sciame di turisti che la attraversano ogni giorno e che la lasciano sempre pií_ spoglia di valori. Invecchiamento ed esodo dei residenti disegnano il quadro di una cittíæ in fuga da se stessa. In questo panorama íÂ necessario ricordare che il patrimonio e il paesaggio della cittíæ sono prima di tutto dei cittadini che la abitano che sono non solo ereditíæ del passato, ma soprattutto serbatoio di energie morali per costruire il futuro. Venezia íÂ paradigma della cittíæ storica, ma anche della cittíæ moderna. íš una possibilitíæ per riflettere sulläó»idea di cittíæ e di cittadinanza. Come un malato particolarmente grave, Venezia esibisce pií_ di altre cittíæ le piaghe di un morbo assai diffuso. Non solo a Venezia ma anche altrove la comunitíæ dei cittadini íÂ straniera in casa propria. íš proprio per questo che pensare a Venezia vuol dire pensare la cittíæ storica, anzi qualsiasi cittíæ.ŒæŒæíš un progetto di Manon Fraysse, Camilla Pintonato e Francesca Santi elaborato alläó»ISIA di Urbino per riattivare la pratica della cittadinanza e il diritto alla citta’ó.

Welcome to The Oracle Project Œ© äóîŒæTwelve Poems on Eight Interactive Cubes!Completely interactive: interchangeable:ŒæMOVE the cubes! ŒæRotate & read in any directionŒæto create new meaning, new design.ŒæYOU become the artist/poet! ŒæThis is original, evocative phrasing designed overŒæeight Cubes to READ IN ALL DIRECTIONSŒæacross, around, and onto any other facet of any other cube. ŒæThis is the miracle: thatŒæno matter which cube you turn next to any other cube it will still be a readable sentence/poem. ŒæIt's the whole array of human hopes, fears and experience flowing together just as our minds juggle everything at once. ŒæHere are a few examples, out of billions of possibilities:äóìThe world is born to us divided: Œægood or bad. ŒæWeäó»re in a pickle or weäó»re in / the pink. ŒæWeäó»re thinking . . .Or:  äóìWeäó»re in a pickle or weäó»re in / a slender lifeline, 		infant to infinity . . . ŒæOr:  äóìWeäó»re in a pickle or weäó»re in / firm cot or bed.Or:  äóìWeäó»re in a pickle or weäó»re in / the dryer! ŒæElectro- and 				magnetic, we are plagued by static cling!äóìIn the beginning was / the Big Idea, Light . . . Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæŒæOr:  äóìIn the beginning was / worry, my own fight or flee! äóîI leave it to the beads and I become / the prayer. . .Or:  äóì. . . I become / the egg or the chicken . . .Or: äóì. . . I become / the precious colors, 			canvas watching as I dress. . ." Œæ ŒæŒæ( / indicates a new and different cube)Results can be mind-boggling, quirky, profound. ŒæPUZZLE OUT 12 ORIGINAL POEMS, the beginnings & endings lightly marked. ŒæEach composite side is a poem: ŒæäóìImperfect,äó äóìThe Lavender of Love,äó äóìYin & Yangäó (below), plus Tapestry, Riddles, Veterans, Bandaids & Creativity, Prayer for Peace . . .ŒæŒæREAD AROUND any cube: ŒæäóìArm in arm we form a fine embroidery in /  		a good riddle: / Identity: ŒæAm I the sum of numbered genes? ŒæAm I unfolding consciousness? ŒæI ask / the beads of common prayer.äó Œæäóîfrom Cube Two"Truth is elusive as I write--so vast as white light modifies / 		each segment of / sweet flight.  We fold, we hold / 			a paper airplane adequate as our weak will 				and wounded wings to fly! . . .äó Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ äóîfrom Cube FourŒæPeople are reminded of the Rubikäó»s Cube, but the Oracle Cubes move freely, with phrasing and designsäóîbut YES! the same dynamic, hands-on addictive focus and fun!I love presenting the Oracle Project to large or small groups. ŒæPeople are blown away by all the poignant, juicy possibilities and connections, and itäó»s fascinating to see folks discover they control one possibility after another. Itäó»s a meaningful, involving puzzle with no wrong answers. ŒæItäó»s a game, a contemplative piece; a book of lessons from a long life. . . Œæa great gift for a friend. ŒæOne woman, wide-eyed, told me, äóìItäó»s a roadmap of my soul!äóYou can play solo, as a kind of meditation, or with a buddy or whole group.  Itäó»s addictive; YOU choose the path, the pace; youäó»re creating neural pathways!ŒæI say the world NEEDS this project: ŒæPeople need to match and move these Cubes with their own hands and hearts and to realize the world is like this; weäó»re like this: tangible, divergent, unlimited possibilities! ŒæThat with all this wild diversity of needs and colors on the planet, all things are connected.   Science proves it, and I want us to feel it, to heal the nation, heal ourselves:"Despite divided faiths, misguided energies, we share coherent frequencies of heart; we are one race, one raucous symphony! Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæäóîFrom äóìPrayer for PeaceäóThatäó»s a big gift to the world, and I want the Oracle out there giving it! ŒæI want to have  	    the Oracle Cubes printed small:   in sets of 4-inch cubes, hand-held, accessible, affordable,                  so everyone can have a set to play andŒæponder. ŒæI want to launch the printing of this small version of the Oracle Cubesäóîwith inside liners for stability, all printed flat for easy mailing, easy assembly . . .And (this is a big idea, big concepts): ŒæI envision The ORACLE INSTALLATION!Œæwith its own appointed space in a Fine Art Museum or Galleryäóîwith large, light, movable Cubes circled by curved benches and backlit images of the 12 poems & 12 designs; hushed soundtrack of my reading of the poems 		with musical interludes; 	and hundreds of 4-inch and one-foot cubes 	in work stations for hundreds of children and adults:I NEED YOUR HELP!Iäó»m seeking a minimum of $30,000 to launch the printing of the 4-inch Oracle Cubes AND to locate, build & install the large Oracle Project in a major gallery or museum, where it will beavailable to hundreds of people.THANK YOU!Iäó»m asking for your supportäóîhowever you can help, AND I want to thank and reward you as richly as I can for your generous donations and help.HOW THE MONEY WILL BE USED:10% goes to KickStarter off the top, with our thanks;Approximately $2,000 will be used to launch production of the 4-inch Oracle Cubes, together with stability liners and directions, printed and packaged flat for easy assembly and easy mailing;Between $3,000 and $4,000 will be needed to create, package and send all reward items;An estimated $22,000 will be needed to locate, build, transport and oversee the large Oracle Installation in appropriate Museum(s) or Gallery(s).ŒæŒæNote: Do I know all the particulars of this venue? ŒæNo! äóîI donäó»t have all the answers on this oneäóîYET! ŒæBUT SOMEONE OUT THERE DOES!äóîand can help fill in the blanks!ŒæŒæAnd I am hoping for a small amount to reimburse the artistäóîme! for expenses to date and in recognition of years of design, writing, editing, calligraphy, building and final production of this masterwork (which my daughter calls äóìOur Third Sibling!äó)äóîwith my only compensation this ongoing sense of Serious Joy!           CREDITS & THANKS TO:		Stevie Williams, videography; Craig Riss, production advice; Leo Brody, music accompaniment for Poem Readings. ŒæBig thanks to Ted Bryan, Suzanne West,Gail Nelson, Lynn Brevig, Allison Chatman & to Elkie, Dhanam, Patty and Shawn. And special thanks to Robin Crabb and Cynthia Stimpson & the SAGES of Center for Spiritual Living, Seattle.ŒæAnd thanks to all of YOU!  for YOUR support & help in bringing the Oracle Project to the wider world!

// german version below //Fences are present everywhere. They create separation, boundaries and borders. Often fences imply to keep distance and are being built to not be crossed. However they don't necessarily need to be repelling. Couldn't they just be a colorful partition along which people walk joyfully?In summer 2014, we, 10 architecture students from the Technical University Munich, Germany, realized a colorful installation to embellish the arrival situation at the S-Bahn station Munich-Neuaubing. Using various colored plastic bags which we then weaved into a fence, the beautiful reflections, the translucent appearance and the no longer visible storage area behind the fence resulted in many positive responses from the public.As this was only a 2 weeksäó» installation, we now have been invited to participate in the arts project äóìTandemäó in which we will be repeating this installation with more permanent materials.Initiated by the Chair of Visual Arts at the Technical University Munich in cooperation with the äóìLandeshauptstadt Mí_nchenäó and the äóìAktive Zentren Neuaubingäó students embellish various sites around the neighborhood Neuaubing-Westkreuz. We will reinstall a similar installation using more sustainable colored acrylic glass elements. Attached to a fence along a S-Bahn station we will visually improve the until now rather not welcoming arrival situation.http://eingangsfenster.wix.com/tandemIn order to be able to realize the project we need your help! As the material expenses are high and the processing costs are not cheap we are depending on the kickstarter funding in order to realize the project. Every Euro is helpful in order to get closer.The amount of funding received will determine the size of the project. The more money we are able to raise, the bigger the project will become.So fare we have calculated:  60ä‰å are worth 1sqm colored acrylic glass, cut in the fitting size including holes for the attachments. We would like to cover at least 25 sqm of fence which determines our funding goal. Any additional sponsoring will enlarge the project. We hope that with this installation and especially with the publicity about it we are able to raise awareness that not every non-appealing public place needs to stay like that. Sometimes we lack the ability to see the beauty or the absence of it just because we are already used to our surroundings.This fence could be realized anywhere and we hope that maybe people will follow our initiative and create more beautiful fences.Spread the word! Anyone can help by just sharing our project and showing it to the world.  Visit out website http://eingangsfenster.wix.com/tandem & our Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/eingangsfensterŒæIf you are living in Munich you are of course warmly invited to participate in the building phase at the end of June / beginning of July 2016. Please visit our website for more information and pictures of the previous project.The website is in German, but don't pictures say more than 1000 words? :)http://eingangsfenster.wix.com/tandem If you have any questions feel free to contact us!// german version //ŒæIm Sommer 2014 haben wir, Architekturstudenten der Technischen Universití_t Mí_nchen, im Rahmen des Projekts                            den Zaun zwischen der Rí_ckseite des Edekamarktes und der S-Bahn Station Mí_nchen-Neuaubing mit Hilfe von farbenfrohen Plastiktí_ten aufgewertet und somit einen einladenden Ortseingang geschaffen.ŒæŒæErst ein genaues Hinschauen í_ffnet vielen Menschen die Augen, das Schí_ne oder eben seine Absenz an diesem Ort wahrzunehmen, da das Gesehene bereits zur Gewohnheit geworden ist.Sollte man mí_glicherweise solche Plí_tze der Stadt, die im Alltag vieler Menschen eine Rolle spielen gezielt neu gestalten?ŒæUnser Ziel war es, eine reprí_sentative und attraktive Schwelle zu Neuaubing zu schaffen. Der freundliche und vielfí_ltige Charakter des Ortes sollte dadurch besser widergespiegelt werden.Gleichzeitig wurde eine Trennung zwischen Ankommen und Edekamarkt geschaffen. Durch die Transluzenz der verschiedenfarbigen Mí_lltí_ten entstand besonders bei abendlichen Sonnenstrahlen ein interessantes Farbspiel.ŒæWir erhielten viele Anregungen, die Arbeit bzw. eine mí_gliche Alternative an diesem Zaun zu erhalten, was in Absprache mit dem Geschí_ftsfí_hrer des Supermarktes nun mí_glich werden kí_nnte.ŒæAuf Grund der positiven Resonanzen vorbeigehender Anwohner, mí_chten wir die Installation nun darauf aufbauend permanent mit langlebigeren Materialien gestalten. Durch die Verschí_nerung des Zaunes auf der rí_ckwí_rtigen Seite des Edekamarktes wird die Eingangssituation beim S-bahnhof Mí_nchen-Neuaubing aufgewertet.Um dieses Projekt fí_r die Einwohner Neuaubings verwirklichen zu kí_nnen, sind wir auf Ihre                 angewiesen.

My name is Amanda Topaz.Œæ I am an aerial artist and creator. Œæwww.rockitaerials.com For over twenty years I have hung from beautiful ceilings around the world as part of my work.Œæ It has instilled in me a deep appreciation for architecture.ŒæI was instantly inspired when I saw Gaudiäó»s hanging models at La Pedrera in Barcelona.ŒæEquilibrium is a living aerial sculpture: a representation of the lines of the human body in relation to the curves of catenary arches used in architecture from the 17th century to the present day.ŒæŒæYou can enjoy the sculpture for 30 seconds or for the entire 30 minutes as the bodies form kaleidoscopic patterns in the ropes.This is the second time I have exhibited Equilibrium and I am thrilled to be collaborating with the exceptionally talented acrobats of The Hybrid Movement Company out of Brooklyn, NY. ŒæŒæEquilibrium plays on the notion of Gaudiäó»s architectural models and presents it as a relationship to Human balance, form and senses.As an artist I was drawn to the idea of Gaudi using hanging models in considerations of equilibrium due to my experience as a professional aerialist, (Gaudiäó»s hanging models closely resemble a traditional circus apparatus).Œæ ŒæIn addition, challenges in regaining balance and equilibrium after losing %75 of my hearing also compelled me toward Gaudiäó»s investigation into the physics of arch equilibrium.ŒæŒæI lost my hearing over the course of 5 years when I was 30.ŒæŒæDuring this time I had to take repeated hearing tests. ŒæThe music I use in Equilibrium was composed by Aaron Taylor Kuffner aka Gamelatron and includes an actual hearing test mixed in.ŒæCUNY Graduate Center of Speech-Hearing Sciences is recording what is left of my OAE's (Otoacoustic Emissions) and matching the tones of my tinnitus to play in the entrance of the piece. ŒæThe frame of Equilibrium is 15 foot diameter steel wheel pieced together with over 800 nuts and boltsŒæwith 410 feet of rope hanging off of it off of 36 carabiners.ŒæWe need money to pay for the shipment of the installation, safe rigging, money for the artists hanging and money to cover insurance.ŒæŒæYour support is very appreciated. ŒæThis edition of Equilibrium will be exhibited at the Garner Art Center Art Festival on May 21-22nd, 2016. Œæhttp://garnerartscenter.org/events-2/arts-festival/ŒæGARNER Arts Center brings together artists and diverse audiences to present art and cultural exhibitions and programs to the regional community by fostering artistic expression within a unique, historic environment where creativity and new ideas can flourish. Their educational programs open the world of art to students through hands-on exploration, utilizing the vast wealth of artistic knowledge available at GARNER from their resident artists.They are still trying to rebuild, four years after the devastation of Hurricane Irene.Œæ ŒæŒæIn 2015 GARNER resumed its first full season of programming since its main gallery was destroyed by Hurricane Irene in August 2011.ŒæIf EQUILIBRIUM P2 doesn't raise the entire amount, we won't be able to share this beautiful piece with the Garner Art CenterŒæArtŒæFestival. ŒæIf 100 people can donate $12, we can make this happen! ŒæPlease spread the word and support the arts of New York Œæ-- ŒæThank you!

We feel the intense need to go to Burning Man and build this installation there in the desert. This installation is a portal to other dimensions or gate to other worlds, while you can experience day at night and night at day to make them all connected and one, to blend dualism and see both of them overlapping each other at the same time. It creates the feeling of oneness with the universe, oneness with the earth and everyone all around you. This is how we learn compassion and love.The size of the installation will be about 28' in diameter and 12' tall. It is forming a a hexagonal shape with dark fabric dividing each sections. The experience can be individual or communal. At daytime, you will experience the sun beams playing with it and at night you will experience it's glow. It will be a magical moment to step on the infinity knot in the middle to enter the portal to leave this world. Or if you just spend more time around it, it will give you its beauty and calm nature.This is a project that wanted to be made, the inspiration came from a higher realm and it has been already started, but to be able to finish and make it happen, this is what we need:Buy more materials, including wood, fabric and miscellaneous supplies that still needed.BuyŒæa trailer to bring it down from New York to Nevada.Buy a solar generator and pay for Internet subscription to create live feed videos.Please help us make this happen! Participating in the Burning Man is all we need right now to start surviving meaningfully.

About this Project:It is important for us humans to appreciate and recognize our ability and utilize it. This is how we evolve as a race. We know that we can make sounds with our voice. From that, we created more than 6,000 languages to communicate with each other. We know that we see and recognize different shapes. From that, we created words, symbols, buildings and paintings that we all can appreciate. We know the human nose can distinguish up to 1 trillion different odors. From that, we have schools that train people to make food that not only taste good but smells good. We have people that specializes in designing perfumes, cologne, deodorant, body wash and shampoo that we enjoy smelling. We know that we can hear. From that we created music. However, I realized that in this current day and age. With the overwhelming amount of visuals and sound that the media feeds to us, we have forgotten how entertaining and useful our sense of touch is. Therefore, in this project I hope to remind people of this sense of touch. I hope that people will remember once again how powerful it is and how powerless we are without it.ŒæProject Treatment:Aims äóñ The aim of this project is to raise peopleäó»s awareness of the importance of touch.Methods äóñ The audience will walk through six room that are connected by a tunnel wearing a pair of earmuffs/headphones that is controlled by my radio signal. If I were to play out any sound , they would be able to hear it through the headphones. However, if I were to not play anything, the earmuffs/headphones would be powerful enough to block out all exterior sound. The audience will experience the loss of vision and sight to experiencing the importance of touch in our everyday life through the journey of room 1 to 6.ŒæRoom number 1 äóñ In this room, the earmuffs will play out overwhelming noise and sound of the city. Projection of colorful imagery of the city on one side of the wall while the other side is a big mirror allowing the audience to see themselves in the city.Room number 2 äóñ Transition from being able to see and hear to a loss of vision and sight. The sound of the city will slowly die down along with the vision until the room is pitch black.Room number 3 - This room is the first room the participant will feel the deprivation of sight and hearing. They will not be able to see anything or hear anything and there will be nothing in the room.Room number 4 - In this room, the participant will learn how to get around obstacles using touch. Obstacles will be between the entrance and the exit.Room number 5 äóñ After learning how they can orient themselves using touch. They will need to learn to adapt to different atmosphere. Plants, humidifier and mini fans will be placed in the room. Soil will be covering the ground. The change of humidity and temperature and texture of the ground will be significantly enhanced without sight and hearing. When the participant walk pass the plants, they will experience passive touch as opposed to the active touch in the previous room.Room number 6 äóñ In this final room, the exit will be significantly smaller with obstacles such as cling wrap or foam blocking the majority of it. They will understand the importance of touch for survival.Outcomes- The audience should be leaving the installation realizing how important touch is. They should be able to understand that without sight and hearing we can still survive. However without touch, independent survival would be impossible. Budget:Gallery Space - I will be exhibiting in Hong Kong. An exhibition space named The White Loft located in Aberdeen. I will be renting the space for a day and a half, half a day for setting up and one day for the exhibition. The rent for one day is $1710.64 AUD and half day is $1026.59. Therefore, it equals to a total of $2690 for a day and half.ŒæRisk Management :Due to the nature of the installation, a lot of potential danger can happen. I have enquired the Director of Claims from Prudential Hong Kong Limited. The premium for a one day of the third party liability insurance would cost around $170.50 AUD. Therefore it would bring the total estimated budget to:	Rent $2690 + Construction $7941.31 + Insurance $170.50 = $10801.81 AUDMap ofŒæInstallation:

There is a beautiful natural hot spring pool in the mountains on the south side of Mt. Baker. I plan to fill the pool with herbal flowers, covering the entire surface area of the pool. Then make a still photograph of the flowers floating on top of the water. Possibly there will be snow on the ground depending of course on mother nature. ŒæŒæI will bring a few different models and subjects and place them in the photograph as well as shooting just the landscape itself. In the end it will be a short series of photos.Lavender and Chamomile have soothing qualities that compliment the serine mountain scene, and will create the most amazing herbal hot mountain bath that has ever been! Your contribution will go directly to the purchase of a large quantity of flowers, gas to reach the destination, and printing of the photograph itself. I plan to use medium format film as well as a Canon 5D DSLR.Œæ

Ghost/Grove is one of my first forays into the professional art world- and the first requiring me to travel.After taking the plunge and going back to school to work toward my MFA, I created a proposal for True/False as a professional practice exercise. ŒæIt was a huge surprise to be accepted! ŒæThen the reality of creating and transporting the project and myself half way across the country to participate set in. ŒæAs a student, I do not have much cash.I don't need much! My project itself is made of many recycled, re-purposed, and found objects. ŒæMajor expenses include the telecine film-to-video transfer, airfare, and lodging.I will be traveling to Missouri from Portland twice: first in January 2016 to begin the project, collect needed supplies, meet my volunteer team, and other preliminary steps. ŒæThen I will return a few days before the festival begins for the final set-up, installation, and of course the festival itself.

After having been to Burning Man 3 times and driven a rickety art car that fell apart on me every evening, I decided ... IT'S TIME. I am creating an art car ... with YOU!The theme was easy, I wanted a flat platform to lounge with lots of pillows. For the politically correct, it's called the CUDDLE PILE. Then again being part of the "Saints & Sinners Camp", it really is a place to do whatever you'd like ;-)Then while in Truckee wondering thru cute shops, I saw this really comfy, round LOVE SOFA and knew right there and then, we needed this on top of our art car, integrated into the SHADE STRUCTURE.With all these parts set, we first called it a "Flying Carpet" but decided it would be more appropriately called the "SINNERS LOFT".Other ideas, plans & dreams ...So who is in?

We want to do something for real, with our own hands - do you?We have toy-store in Sweden and want to contribute to education, science and development to a better world for us and our children to live in. Our first step is to build an utopia with small buildingblocks.People who donate get an apartment in the city where they can choose their own decor and also set custom minifigures in place. The city should serve as a way to get people to donate to charity.

WHAT IS TRANSMOGRAPHY:Transmography is a sacred space, designed as a small temple/shrine. It is intended to be a thoughtful space, where users are invited to interact with several things within the space to change patterns they resonate with about themselves from negative to positive.PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION OF TRANSMOGRAPHY:This space is designed as a house-shaped temple. 8' x 8' footprint. We will be using jigsaws to cut mandalas into the plywood walls (sides). The outside rear wall will have the flower of life, waves, and fire painted onto it. The front wall (door wall) will have panels on each side of it that will be cut with seaweed/fire-type shapes.There will be several ways to interact with the space, including sitting down and interacting with one another in the space. The space is meant to dig up feelings of unworthiness and cleanse them, resetting them with positive intentions, actions, scents, sounds, and by talking it out with one another.It will be painted, and decorated outside with wind chimes, inside with crystals, buddhas, and singing bowls, as well as creature comforts (pillows, rug, carpet), and metal platter and urn in the center for burning one's negative statement. The two front corners will have fabric draped from the ceiling to floor; the two rear corners will have swaths of fake ivy running the length.Behind both of the lattice door panels, there will be bowls of small quartz crystals, and an offering for people to take one.The outside will have LED lights lighting up the rim of the mandalas, and the archway. The inside will be lit with a lamp, and multiple strings of LED christmas lights from the roof beams.HOW ONE INTERACTS WITH TRANSMOGRAPHY:When you walk in, on the wall facing you, you see a list of phrases, as well as drawers that coordinate with these phrases. Phrase examples: "I am not pretty enough," "I am not very smart," "I am not worthy." The user will chose the phrase they resonate the most strongly with, and pull the coordinating drawer.Inside the drawer is two things - a paper copy of the negative statement, and a laminated copy of the opposite, positive, affirming statement. The negative statement is taken to the center of the shrine where there will be an urn, and it is burned. The positive statement is a keepsake, a reminder.The wall to the right as you walk in will have a mirror, and the statement "See yourself five years from now. What would he/she say to you?"There will be notebooks, pens, and a place to write. You are intended to both write as well as read. This is an exercise in seeing one's potential future, changing it, and also seeing that the human experience is quite collective - as we might read some other words/advice in the books that resonate with us, left by others.The wall to the left will have jars with aromatherapy scents in them, to create associations of smell that lock the change in vibration/resonance into memory. They will be coordinated to the drawers, and also to the seven chakras. This wall will also house several positive statements, a crystal cluster, and buddha hand tea light holder. Above will read "I Am Enough."WHY WE'RE CREATING THIS:Burning Man 2015 left me feeling spiritually empty, for the first time in my 6 years going. The most satisfaction I got was participating in creating a tiny sacred space - one of the five "Shiva Huts" at Camp Conception. Feeling what people were experiencing as they interacted with it was exactly the feeling I was seeking on the playa, but never found. There was a lot of positivity and healing created in that hut.My partner and I want to bring this sacred space to Burning Man to share this quietude, contemplative thought, and introspection. It can be so much go, go, party. Which is wonderful, but contrast is so important to appreciating the full range of experiences at Burning Man. We want to give people the chance to connect to their spirit, and to their higher purpose. We want to give them the opportunity to slow down, breathe, and heal wounds, old and new.We hope to give them a refreshed and positive way of thinking of themselves, and others. We hope to give them insight into the lives and thoughts of others, and in knowing that others are experiencing similar things, give them the realization that we are all connected to each other, and that they are not alone. We want people to leave feeling supported, loved, and assured of self.Being able to give back to the playa what it has given to me is the greatest gift I can think of. Experiences like these have changed the course of my life, my passions, my life goals. My everything. I am ever grateful, and wish to deliver this to others. MORE PHOTOS / ABOUT US:ŒæWho are we? Two crazy burners from Seattle. My partner Justin has been to the playa 3 times. I'm at year #6. We are avid community builders and lovers of art, house music, beauty, and community. The last two years we've come with Camp Conception, and last year inspired me to do something much bigger than anything I had imagined prior. We decided to build this thing together, to share it's positivity with others.Us! Œæhttps://imgur.com/a/GtbiKŒæBack in the real world, we do our best to follow our hearts. We dance, we live, we sing, we love. We work, doing massage, selling crystals, and putting on music events and community-building, sustainable events (Seattle Clothing Exchange is my brainchild: https://www.facebook.com/groups/seattleclothingexchange/). It doesn't bring in a lot of dough, but we're following our highest excitement, and sharing our gifts and positivity with the world (our last jobs as marketer and electrician did not bring us happiness, nor promote what we loved in the world). We're doing our best to spread what we believe in, and helping others heal in the process.COST BREAKDOWN:wind chimes 72 crystals large 320 buddhas 120 singing bowl large 60 singing bowls sm 40 drawers 60 fabric for corners 20 metal plate for center 30 jars 15 laminating / copying 20 ivy 15 plywood 280 carpet 20 rug 60 lights 300 battery 120 solar 200 notebooks 50 pillows 160 fire extinguishers 60 inverter 250 battery tea lights 50 lamp 15 photo cell 50 uhaul, mileage, gas 1225 brackets 40 assorted 2x4s 120 paint 40 brushes 10 fabric roof 50 jigsaw bits 40 hardware 80Total: $4302

äóìFunctional artäó refers to aesthetic objects that serve utilitarian purposesäóîin other words, beautiful things that are also useful. We would expand that definition by adding to it things that are made to be useful but are also beautifuläóîwhat we term äóìFunctional Artways.äó  Decorated implements such as pottery and tools from archaeological sites show that people from the earliest days of human society have valued beauty in their everyday objects, and this delight in artistic expression carries through every era of human history to the present day.The original people of Appalachia were Native Americans of various tribes, largely Cherokee, who subsisted entirely off the land. From the 17th century on, they included hardy pioneers of mainly European stock who also relied on themselves and the land to provide the basic necessities of life. Today these frontier traditions are fading out, but the memory of them is kept alive in part through the arts and crafts their makers devised. Basket-weaving, pottery, wood-carving, textile weaving and fiber art, leather and beadwork, flint-knapping, quilt-making, blacksmithing, furniture makingäóîall of these functional artways are showcased here and there, but usually in isolation from each other and often in static museum exhibits. Our project, Functional Artways of Appalachia Throughout History, will connect the different functional arts and bring them to life by presenting a series of live, interactive displays and demonstrations over a two-year period, following an historical timeline chronologically from the Native Americans through today. These events will be held monthly and will feature an expert speaker/presenter who will demonstrate the skill and show examples. Many demonstrations will be hands-on, allowing active audience participation. The events will be filmed, edited, and posted on YouTube. They will be widely publicized, using social media and traditional print and TV media, throughout the Tanasi region including schools. The aim will be to build an audience, both äóìliveäó and online, who have a greater understanding of the arts and heritage of this unique place and the resourceful, creative people who made it their home. A parallel objective will be to make progress toward the ultimate goal of building a permanent home for the Tanasi Arts & Heritage Center by increasing public awareness of Tanasi. The individual event videos will be compiled into a documentary that will be offered to educational institutions throughout the region and shown in the Tanasi Gallery and eventually in the theater of the full-scale Center. They can also be used in further fundraising toward that goal. The costs of the project include an honorarium for presenters to cover their time and travel as well as materials used; the cost of filming and editing each demonstration; and a portion of the salary of the Gallery director who will organize and manage each event in coordination with the Tanasi Board of Directors. That's why we need your help with this Kickstarter project!

We go to music concerts, then watch through our phones, stay in touch with relatives via a timeline and move gradually, more and more away from a tactile reality. Not so long along we used to take pictures and turn that memory into an object, the printed photograph, to treasure and pass on. My aim with The Tangible Pixel is to rediscover this process and literally build the picture, brick by brick.ŒæBUT... I NEED YOUR HELPŒæTo create the pieces in the series I need Lego/Duplo, and a lot of it.My aim with the series is to recreate the feelings of nostalgia people used to have for photographs, but updating it for the 21st century.I hope that by presenting specific images using Lego I can recreate the feeling of touching a photograph and connecting with the image on a more intimate level like we used to. The Lego also represents a time in childhood that was more active and present. When we used to play outside and build amazing worlds with the bricks and not be obsessed with phones and computers like this generation can be. I believe it will invoke a sense of movement back to something more tangible.People will be invited to touch the pieces and experience them much more presently that just looking at them.Iäó»m going to give myself at least a year to complete an initial series of 10 pieces.Each piece can range from 2000 äóñ 40000 individual bricks, so I believe it will take me at least this time to amass enough Lego to finish the series ready for exhibition. This campaign is to fund the completion of painting ONE.As all the pieces will be drawing inspiration from local landscapes and the community then I hope to approach local galleries to source adequate space.

Three Birds find a safe LandingAs the three owners of Paper Birch Landing we were brought together by the search for a safe haven to do our work in a setting where we could build community with other creatives. We are thankful to have landed in such a wonderful new home that is Paper Birch Landing. We work as a unit, helping each other achieve our dreams and as it turned out-- We all desire to to help other artists & writers  in our community. We believe a little compassion, faith and hard work goes a long way. Our goal is to show local and emerging artists' work, and provide a community space for creative people to meet for classes, art parties, shows, writing workshops, book launches, retreats, and more. Our new space has a roof top terrace for live music and plein air painting in the summer. Our classroom is open all year. Our fireside gallery and study serve as a writing space for writers who need to get away while showing four juried shows per year with wall rental space available for artists to show. We want to promote the artist over art. And bring community to artists of all kinds, right here in the Œæheart of Kansas City.Œæ

äó¢ In January 1976, the first issue of PUNK Magazine #1 was published. It changed the world. That first issue created the anti-disco movement, transformed Lou Reed from glam-rock burnout into äóìThe Godfather of Punk,äó and heralded The Ramones as the most important punk-rock band in the world. Its hand-lettered graphics also inspired a fanzine movement that featured many more crude and badly-produced fanzines, such as Englandäó»s äóìSniffinäó» Glueäó (by Mark P.), äóìRipped and Tornäó (by Tony P.) and Scotlandäó»s äóìNext Big Thingäó (by Lindsay Hutton), as well as äóìSlash,äó äóìFlipsideäó and äóìSearch And Destroyäó in the USA, among many, many other äóÖzines across the universe.  äó¢ The first issue of PUNK Magazine was developed, created written, drawn and printed in a very short time: Mid-November 1975 to New Yearäó»s Eve 1976. It appeared three months before the Ramones first album and a year before the first Sex Pistols record were released. It didnäó»t cash in on a popular movement; PUNK Magazine created it.  äó¢ The radical look of PUNK magazineäóîhand-lettered editorials and page layouts, feature articles presented in photo-comic formats, and a cover that caricatured Lou Reed as a horror comic iconäóîcreated an authentic visual "punch-in-the-mouth" for what we insisted was a genuine social movement, and it became a knockout. äóìPunk Rockäó before PUNK magazine appeared was a vaguely-defined term that described the New York Dolls, the Bay City Rollers, AC/DC, The Standells, the pub-rock bands popular in England at the time (Eddie and The Hot Rods, The Stranglers, etc.), and many mediocre rock bands who appeared atat CBGB. After PUNK Magazine appeared, punk rock was about the Ramones, The Dictators and the Dead Boys in the USA and the Damned, the Sex Pistols and The Clash in the UK. Thousands of great bands have emerged since then. äó¢ PUNK was the first media outlet that viewed the downtown scene at CBGB as more than just a new music scene: It was a social schism separating the previous late äóÖ60s-based rock culture that was dominating the East Village at the time and replacing it with a new aesthetic, based on the original bohemian and beatnik elements that preceded the hippie movement. In other words, PUNK foresaw a "New 'Hood Order." Within a few years, most of the hippie shops in the East Village had disappeared and a few dozen punk rock shops were doing good business. äó¢ŒæPUNK Magazine was often descibed as a äóìfanzineäó in the 1970s, suggesting a small circulation and a limited editoiral viewpoint. In fact PUNK was a legitimate newsstand publication, publishing 25,000 copies that went to newsstands and subscribers before its demise a few months later. Although it sometimes utilized the elements of fanzines for parody, PUNK would be more properly described as an äóìartzine.äó It was definitely the first äóìpunk äóÖzine.äó inspiring many other magazines and fanzines in its wake, notably äóìSniffinäó» Glueäó and äóìSearch And Destroyäó in England, and äóìSlashäó in the USA.äó¢ On January 14th, 2016, PUNK magazineäó»s artists, cartoonists and illustrators will mark the publication of the first issue with a group gallery show at äóìHowl! Happening: An Arturo Vega Project,äó located in the heart of the East Village, a stoneäó»s throw away from where the CBGB club and Arturo Vegaäó»s loft (where Joey and Dee Dee Ramone lived with him in the 1970s) were located until a few years ago. äó¢ This kickstarter campaign will enable fans of PUNK (and non-fans who think this is a good investment), to purchase stuff from the Howl! Happening gallery space, as well as PUNK Magazine stuff. For instance, PUNK #19, which featured The Bullys on the cover, will be a more interesting item now that the bandäó»s music can be heard on the PUNK kickstarter video. Theyäó»re great, right? äó¢ The exhibition catalog will include writing from James Wolcott, Steve Heller and Carlo McCormick, as well as an article about Ged Dunn, Jr., PUNK Magazineäó»s founding publisher (by John Holmstrom), as well as lots of graphics and stuff from the original PUNK Magazine and details about the artists in the show: Each of them contributed to cover images for PUNK. I think this catalog will become the next PUNK Magazine collectible. As everyone knows, our back issues sell for too much money on eBay, well, this is an effort to reprint them and make them more accessible. So if we make enough money from this kickstarter, we can plan reprinting other issues. But we will need a huge response to do that, reproducing PUNK #1 and putting together this kickstarter campaign? UGH! Too much work! Okay, thatäó»s our pitch.

Skye Lin is a thriving international artist who is currently pursuing a BFA in Sculpture at Savannah College of Art and Design. Born in China, raised in Vietnam, she moved to Atlanta for college. Skyeäó»s multicultural background strongly influences her perspective in her life and work. The function of a bikini wax literally breaks from tradition at the hands of artist Skye Lin. Her works challenge the audience to reevaluate todayäó»s social landscape; recognizing the distorted definition of self and oneäó»s real worth. She embraces alternative media in many of her conceptual installations. When not pursuing fine art, Skye works as a visual merchandiser and graphic designer to challenge her flexibility as an artist.Œæ| ARTIST STATEMENT |" I allow the viewers to take an intimate look into my artistic process and personal experiences that have shaped my perspective on gender, culture, beauty and identity. The journey of my childhood and womanhood unfold as I create a body of work that embraces alternative media. My take on feminine products such as bikini wax, pantyhose, nail polish, yarn and other nontraditional materials challenge the distorted definition of the self and oneäó»s true worth in todayäó»s society."

We purchased Donald Trumpäó»s actual Iowa campaign bus when it was put up for sale on Craigslist in Des Moines. ŒæHe used this bus at the Iowa State Fair and throughout Iowa. ŒæWe have recast it as the 'T.RUMP Bus' and it is now an anti-Trump rolling art project. ŒæWith your help the bus will travel the country fighting back against The Donald's outrageous behavior.ŒæThe T.RUMP Bus uses the bizarre realities of Donald Trumpäó»s bullying presidential campaign to explore important questions about American society today. ŒæThe bus is a great platform for responding to Trump's daily belligerence, whether it be racial, religious, sexist, or his teasing of a handicapped reporter.We love working with the bus. ŒæIt's a real classic. ŒæIronically, the bus falls far short of what you'd expect the gaudy casino mogul's campaign bus to look like. ŒæThe bus has over a million miles. It's on its third engine and third transmission. ŒæAnd it doesnäó»t go faster than 60 mph so driving it around the US is quite an experience. ŒæBuying, moving, and operating the bus has been expensive. ŒæAs a large mobile art project, the T.RUMP Bus provokes Mr. Trump'sŒæaccountability. ŒæIt also helps the public vent frustration about the damage he is inflicting upon the America civicŒælandscape.With the help of this Kickstarter campaign, the T.RUMP Bus will travel to numerous primary states including; New Hampshire, Iowa, South Carolina, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia, and others. ŒæYour contributions will help pay for gas, maintenance, and documenting its artistic journey through the primary states.

Art Space Project is an interactive portable gallery where the community can interact with art, and artists can showcase their work where the people are. It will truly one of a kind exhibit to connect communities and expand the culture in Charlotte, NC and other areas.We are taking our DIY 32sqft portable art wall to the next level and creating a 256sqft portable interactive art space that can be easily setup anywhere to connect communities to creative initiatives. To accomplish this, we are going to need your help to bring our project alive and to your area.For over two years, we have traveled around Charlotte and surrounding areas to bring art to people with our portable interactive art wall. We have partnered with festivals such as Oktoberfest, galleries, the Charlotte Art League and venues like Strike City to expand the creative culture.It's been a joy watching people of all ages get excited about art and we want to continue the movement by building a portable interactive space for all to enjoy. Thanks for supporting and contributing to the campaignThe initial wall was built for a festival to help showcase some of our creative initiatives.Œæ We built it with random parts from the Lowes store.Œæ The wall has been great, but it's time to make the wall more flexible and even easier to transport to different communities.I have researched different options and have found resources that will allow us to create a pop-up art gallery and interactive creative space that is flexible, portable, durable and safe.Œæ The parts are high quality and will be long lasting and able to withstand the process of being reused over and over.The pop-up space will be flexible so it can be designed into different layouts to fit the activity and space given.Œæ It will allow me to work with artists to create pop-up exhibitions at malls, festivals, sporting events, parks and high traffic parking lots or sidewalks.Œæ The space will expose people to local artists and creative initiatives.Œæ The space will also be used for community involvement where individuals of all skill levels can contribute to community art walls.For your contribution, we have included some cool rewards. Please allow me to introduce ourselves, we are Manny and Melanie (Husband and Wife)M&M Cycles PHX is an idea that came up between my wife and I. We love riding our motorcycle and one night we had a scare when a driver did not see us and almost ran us off the road. That sparked a conversation on how many riders had the same problem. We decided to use this idea as the basis of our business. Keeping the rider safe. We decided to follow this idea by using LED lights to make ourselves more visible. After the installation was complete, we had various compliments as well as interests from fellow riders on the idea. We decided to make it our Goal to make this work and be able to save lives and keep drivers and riders visible to each other. M&M Cycles PHX was Born.Our goal is to create and Maintain a Business in which customers can have the piece of mind that they will be seen at night. We stand behind our business so well that we will offer LIFETIME WARRANTYon our lights yet affordable enough that anyone can have this great feature. We have converted our home garage into our shop with intentions of keeping a low overhead in order to keep costs down. We eventually plan on getting a actual shop and grow as a business.Phoenix Arizona has a high motorcycle population so we plan to make our name known and bring our product to the riders at motorcycle events and by advertising accordingly. Our customers Safety is above all our biggest priority.With our efforts we would like M&M Cycles PHX to become a known name in the motorcycle world.

The project is a 9m x9m light up naughts and crosses game. When the game is not running the structure doubles as a stage for Fire dancers who will perform in stints when the naughts and crosses game is 'having a break'. The structure may have to be reduced to 7.5m x 7.5 m for structural purposes. Our project is entered into Artweek Auckland 2015 and is going to be a visual spectacle along Devonport's waterfront. We have plans, models and renders of the project produced and ready to be submitted. Our installation will be interactive and great fun for all. The game will be in the heart of Devonport and is sure to entertain anyone wanting to come down. We currently estimate that the structure will cost around $2-3000. The main cost involved is scaffolding. Our pledge of $250 will be a great start! All donations help and we would love to hear any feedback or queries on the project!XOX artweek team

I have made mazes and puzzles for fifteen years, at the rate of about one a year. They are complicated mazes that include doors and locks, with changing aspects.They have been in different materials owing to the fact that I just seek out and find something that there was a lot of and could work with a raw design. They have been made from cardboard, sheets, plastic, string, pvc pipe, ceiling tiles, wood, metal, paintings, and a few others. Most of these have been full size mazes, some have just been models.The newest iteration relies on a modular platform design. This will make it expandable, portable, adaptable, and mostly, will allow for various different activities and features for the maze. It also makes it a bit more of a spectacle. By having its own elevated stage, it lends itself to having spectators with a vantage point. I have begun writing a play that takes place in this iteration. While the play has a definite plot, it serves a dual purpose of demonstrating how it works, so at the end of the play, the audience is invited to try it for themselves. ŒæFor the rewards:The first tier reward is a soul-felt thank you, and an invitation to watch regularly scheduled posts either in video or picture format of the project.The second tier rewards are handmade stickers with simple designs,Œæand an invitation to watch regularly scheduled posts either in video or picture format of the project.The third tier rewards are handmade t-shirts andŒæan invitation to watch regularly scheduled posts either in video or picture format of the project.ŒæThe t-shirt design is not finalized, but would have a lot in common with the sketch. I call them rock n roll t-shirts since this is my skill level and experience with t-shirt printing, few are perfect, but all are rock n roll.ŒæThe fourth tier reward is a token to the maze and an invitation to watch regularly scheduled posts either in video or picture format of the project.ŒæThe token is an invitation to the finished life size maze puzzle and will have a practical use in the maze. This is its basic preliminary design:The fifth tier reward is all the above, plus a homecooked dinner and discussion.ŒæThe total I am asking for is to rent a larger studio space to build for this purpose, base materials, and production costs. I am estimating approximately 3 months to get this done.ŒæAnd if you made it this far, heres a laugh for ya:

Today hundreds of authors all over the world work with black lighting and many of these do so with artistic purposes. We can call this the black light art.This movement is in exponential growth, in the nineties the authors had a few dozen in the years octants the artists could be counted on the fingers of one hand.The official world of art, academia, the institutional linked to museums, auction houses most important, the most influential galleries knows little or nothing of this movement.Yet the Art black light has a precursor such as Lucio Fontana, who with an exhibition at the gallery of canals in '49 proposed his first location linked to its spatial concept.The purpose of this exhibition is to make
