With all of the turmoil and suffering focused on by the media nowadays, I think it's important to take a step back and think about things we are grateful for. The goal of this project is to do just that. I will be traveling the globe, starting in Jerusalem, creating art installations that represent a type of love and community that we as humans need to all be thankful for. I will make sculptures, street art, produce impromptu street performances, and make working mechanical models of scientific concepts which have a direct impact on our lives. I will focus the meaning of these pieces on the development of humanity as a species and will incorporate wisdom and tradition from all religions, ancient and modern, in order to produce pieces of art that will force dogma aside and create an understanding that we are not so different after all. An example of a piece that I would like to create from the get-go, is a life sized statue of the compassionate Buddha meditating that will be installed in the mount of olives in Jerusalem. On the base of the sculpture it will say "Nor will people say 'Here it is' or 'there it is' for the kingdom of God is in your midst." Luke 17:21. The goal is to create understand that the teachings of Buddha which state that Nirvana is a journey inward and Jesus who says that the Kingdom of God is within, are not so different, and in reality all of the dogmatic reasons for which we fight are out of fear, not understanding. At the same time, while I have all of these ideas, I would appreciate ideas from supporters so I can better create installations that encapsulate the ideals and beliefs of people from all over the world. I will add that if anyone who sees this would rather travel and volunteer their time and services then please email me. I would appreciate spirited and brave volunteers to help me in this venture. The goal is to create 50 installations by July 2016.

The Buffalo and Western New York area is a truly unique cultural center. The boards of the Buffalo Music Hall of Fame, the Greater Buffalo Sports Hall of Fame and the Buffalo Broadcasters Association have recognized this uniqueness and joined forces to form the Buffalo Niagara Hall of Fame (BNHF). The BNHF has announced its plan to embark on creating an exciting, culturally diverse center that would showcase the history of music, sports and broadcast entertainment under one roof. The center would be dedicated to educating current and future generations through artifacts, seminars and workshops, interactive exhibits and a live studio and performance arena äóñand that is just the tip of the iceberg. The BNHF is in the preliminary stages of planning and executing its dream. ŒæWe will use the money raised with this Kickstarter campaign to hire a director and knowledgeable grant writer so we can develop plans and forge a path to the future. Just imagine a diverse interactive cultural center that would be open to all, at a reasonable cost, that would educate about the past, the present and future musicians, athletes and broadcasters and entertainers.Our goal is to do as much as possible with private funding and grants to develop a world-class destination.ŒæäóìWe have the collections for the music, sports and entertainment fields.  We have the people in our collaborating organizations who are experts.  Our organizations have made the commitment to make this happen and we are ready to enter the next phase, so let's build it!äó said Therese Forton-Barnes.For more information visit www.bnhf.orgŒæŒæEmail info@bnhf.orgŒæ

Jungle House est un projet culturel de tí©moignage et de solidarití© envers les migrants de Calais.La situation des rí©fugií©s syriens, afghans, í©rithrí©ens, soudanais... devient chaque jour plus dramatique. Elle commande certes une prise de conscience internationale, et plus particuliíÂrement europí©enne, mais elle appelle aussi une mobilisation citoyenne et associative.C'est dans cet esprit qu'un collectif de sept personnes a coní_u le projet Œæ"Jungle House" , une structure en acier galvanisí© de 15 míÂtres par 9 sur une hauteur de 3 míÂtres qui sera implantí© au coeur de la "jungle".Cette maison ajourí©e entiíÂrement dí©dií©e aux habitants de la jungle et construite avec eux aura comme vocation d'accueillir une exposition de photographies prí©sentant les portraits d'une centaine d'entre eux.La structure sera montí©e sur un planchí© de 150 míÂtres carrí©s et sera couverte de polycarbonate alví©olaire (plexi). Nous installerons í©galement un systíÂme d'í©clairage autonome (solaire).ApríÂs le 18 Dí©cembre, (journí©e mondiale des migrants de l'ONU), la structure restera en place, au profit des associations et des habitants afin qu'ils se l'approprient. Un film documentaire tí©moignant de la rí©alisation du projet sera rí©alisí© in situ.Le parti pris du financement de ce projet est collaboratif.C'est ainsi que nous sollicitons vos dons.ŒæDadaveŒæartiste plasticien,ŒæElliott Causse artiste plasticien (í©tudiant aux Beaux-Arts de Paris), Stí©phane WeisselbergŒæcommissaire d'exposition, Maire adjoint íæ la Culture de Romainville, Stí©phane SartoriusŒæphotographe, ŒæKLR ClaireŒæartiste plasticienne,ŒæSso AltiumŒæsculpteur, Rafaí‚l GubitschŒærí©alisateur.Planchí© bois : 1300Structure en acier : 1500Couverture plexi : 2500íŠclairage solaire : 2000Outils, quincaillerie : 500Tirages photo : 2000Rí©tributions donateurs : 500Commission Kickstarter + ou - 1000Ce projet est ní© d'une collaboration entre Elliott Causse et Dadave, rí©alisí©e aux Beaux-arts de Paris en Juin 2015ŒæLien vers le projet original: https://vimeo.com/141110439Sur ce projet, läó»empií©tement au sol est de 9 m2. Nous souhaitons rí©aliser une installation 15 fois plus grande.Œ‚La mobilití© des personnes de part le monde, les conduit-elle inexorablement íæ vivre une citoyennetí© de seconde zone, une intí©gration inclusive ou une assimilation exclusive ?ŒéDes migrants dans la jungle de Calais, nous n'avons que des images dí©gradí©es de milliers d'hommes et de femmes entassí©s, attendant de rejoindre l'Angleterre. En se cachant dans les cargaisons de camions, en se terrant sous leurs essieux ou bien en empruntant le tunnel sous la manche afin d'imaginer une autre vie.De ces hommes et de ces femmes qui fuient la misíÂre, l'oppression, l'obsurantisme, les persí©cutions et la guerre, parcourant un exode í©prouvant, affrontant la haine ou l'indifference, nous n'avons que des images de dí©tresse et de mort.Nous n'avons que des images de misí©reux survivant "au voyage au bout de la nuit ".Et pourtant chacune de ces femmes, chacun de ces hommes possíÂde une histoire propre. Faí_onní©e de croyances, d'amour, de blessures, de convictions, d'í©ducation, d'aspiration poí©tique ou encore de revendication philosophique.Et pourtant nombreux sont les í©tudiants, ingí©nieurs, employí©s de banque ou enseignants dont la famille a payí© - par des í©conomies considí©rables et son corrolaire de privations - ce qu'elle ríÈvait íÈtre le voyage vers la libertí©." Jungle House " est un projet de tí©moignage." Jungle House est un " mí©morial " entiíÂrement dí©dií© aux habitant(e)s de la jungle, qui exposera la mí©moire photographique de leurs initní©raires, de leurs projets, de leurs doutes et de leurs espoirs. En un mot : de leur humanití© !" Jungle House " est l'expression d'une urgence : celle pour des artistes citoyens de secouer leur conscience et de construire íæ leur í©chelle un rempart contre l'oubli. Car comme le disait Tocqueville " quand le passí© n'í©claire plus l'avenir, l'esprit marche dans les tí©níÂbres "."Jungle House " souhaite associer Art et Politique dans une confrontation indispensable pour läó»í©laboration däó»une prise de conscience des enjeux et poser une question essentielle sur läó»í©tat de nos socií©tí©s humaines.Cette proposition qui säó»inscrit dans le champ des questions rí©currentes et actuelles, säó»í©toffera dans son installation en säó»adaptant au lieu däó»accueil, tant par la constitution des rí©ponses que par la fabrication des propositions artistiques.Il säó»agira, íæ cet endroit, de faire prí©valoir läó»idí©e de läó»altí©rití© dans la crí©ation comme on promeut le principe de läó»altí©rití© humaine.Il säó»agira enfin de proposer Œ‚ des outils de lecture nouveaux Œé qui dí©cryptent les fantasmes collectifs sur läó»immigration, dí©passent les idí©es reí_ues ou fabriquí©es sur läó»intí©gration des immigrí©s et favorisent une libertí© de jugement individuel.Finalement, la sensibilití© des rí©ponses dí©veloppí©es par les ñuvres sont autant däó»espaces pour y loger un bout de notre conscience. Rien näó»est simple : les langages se multiplient, les paroles se cryptent ou se murmurent; les sentiers empruntí©s sont parfois des impasses, parfois des ponts entre les rives íæ läó»image de nos avancí©s intimes et de nos espaces politiques.ŒæStí©phane Weisselberg.Le collectif rí©alise en parallíÂle un documentaire.Ce film a pour but de rendre compte du montage däó»une ñuvre artistique au sein du camp de rí©fugií©s de Calais et de la relation qui se tissera entre les artistes et les rí©fugií©s eux míÈme puisquäó»ils seront sollicití©s.Par ce film, et par extension la structure artistique qui en est le sujet, il est question de donner une visibilití© essentielle íæ la question de läó»immigration et aux conditions de vie quäó»elle impose aux migrants.  Durant une semaine, le film suivra donc läó»í©volution de läó»oeuvre en elle míÈme ainsi que la relation des artistes avec les habitants du camp. Il sera aussi question de capturer le contexte : le lieu, la situation politique.Pour crí©er le lien avec läó»oeuvre physique, certains des portraits qui y seront prí©sentí©s serviront de Œ‚ portails Œé vers le film. Les images fixes et silencieuses deviendront mouvantes et sonores, crí©ant ainsi un espace däó»expression pour les migrants. Quelques mots, un message, un poíÂme, un cri, un silence.Œæ-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The Jungle House Collective is made up of 7 people. Our project is to buid a  galvanised steel  structure, 15 meters by 9 meters with a height of 3 metres. Inside the structure, about 100 photos will be exhibited (40/60cm  on Dibond), photos  shot during  the weeks  prior to the 18th december, representing  the inhabitants of The Jungle. The structure will be put up with the help of inhabitants. After the 18th, the structure will be left behind and will be at the disposal of the associations and the inhabitants. It is a  solid structure , approx 150 square meters which only needs to be covered./tarpaulined. The idea behind this project is to build a memorial dedicated to the the inhabitants of the Jungle. Symbolically, we will be building an open-sky house which will bear witness of the passage of the people who have transited through the Jungle.This project was born from a collaboration between Elliott Causse and Dadave, at the Fines art school of Paris.Link to the original project :Œæ https://vimeo.com/141110439The surface of  it is 9m2, our installation will be 15 times  that surface... In practical terms , it will take about one week to build  with the help of 15 people, 5 from the Collective  and 10 more from The Jungle.Œæ'' Should people's mobility throughout the world be synonym of  life as second class citizens, or inclusion or  assimilation? ''. ŒæMigrants  in calais are shown as a huddled mass of thousands of men and women waiting to cross the Channel to reach Great Britain. Hiding in the backs of lorries, holding on the axles, walking in the Tunnel, trying to imagine a new life. Of these men and these women who  have fled from poverty, oppression, ignorance (obscurantism), persecutions, warfare, who have faced  hatred  or indifference  during their exhausting journeys (exodus), we are only shown photos of distress and death. Pictures of survivors from hell.ŒæAnd yet  each one of these women, each one of these men  have an individual destiny, moulded by beliefs, love, wounds, educational principles, poetic aspirations or philosophical  convictions. Many are students, engineers, bank employees or teachers, whose families  have saved and gone without  so that their loved ones could undertake  their journey to a better future.ŒæJungle House is a testimonial.ŒæJungle House is a memorial dedicated to the inhabitants of the place , using photography as a medium to exhibit their itinearies, their hopes, their projects and  their doubts, their humanity !ŒæJungle House  as the expression of an emergency  :  emergency  for  an artistic response  to awaken conscienceness, fight  against numbness of consciences and  build a  rempart against oblivion. For as Tocqueville once said ' when the past does not shed a light on the future , then the soul walks in darkness''.ŒæŒæJungle House wants to confront  Art and Politics  so as to promote  an awareness of the isuues  and  question the state of our  human societies.  The proposition, enscribed as it is in the recurring current issues , will develop and expand according to the artistic responses (and productions ) to the place. The purpose is to promote the idea of otherness (alterity) in creation as a reflection of  human alterity. The purpose is to offer new reading tools  which will help decypher the collective  misconceptions on immigration, which  will help go beyond  set ideas  on the integretion of immigrants and which will promote individual ideas..  Finally , the sensitive responsiveness of the  artists' works  creates the space necessary for our conscienceness to develop. Nothing is easy and simple: multiplicity of languages, words are encryptioned or whispered, ;the new paths sometimes lead nowhere, sometimes become bridges between the shores, reflections of our most intimate feelings and political spheres.Stephane Weisselberg

Each submitted thought, prayer or dream will be written onto a leaf with permanent ink, read out loud and then visualized  for the original wisher before being fixed to the branches of The Wishing Tree. ŒæThe tree will be made from a high quality vinyl with a matte finish and applied so that the completed piece will look like it was painted on my wall. Approximate measurements are estimated to be 112'' wide x 83'' tall but may be vary depending on the number of final leaves to be added to the tree.ŒæWhen the project is successful, a survey will be sent out based on the final pledges and rewards to request your wishes. Each wish can only be a positive thought. Wishes that involve causing someone else harm or are negative in any way will not be included in The Wishing Tree.ŒæWishes that are too long to be written on a leaf will be summarized and the essence of the wish will be written on the leaf instead of the actual wish.The Wishing tree will be installed on my dining room or living room wall in open view of anyone who passes it. Each time someone sees the tree, they will be encouraged to read the wishes and visualize them coming true for you. The tree will be displayed for at least 1 year.AŒæpicture of the final work of art after installation will be shared through an update with all those who pledged. It may also be shared via email or a link to a Facebook page.$2000 Stretch Goal: Pictures of the tree's growth will be documented on a website, Facebook page or blog and original wishers will be encouraged to share any updates regarding the status of their wishes.Allocation of funds:Œæ$550 will be used towards the commission of an artist to design and cut the vinyl and my time to write the wishes and install the trunk,Œæbranches and leaves on my wall. Any additional funds received will be used towards expanding the tree with additional leaves, my time for the installation and maintaining the Wishing Tree website/blog if the Stretch Goal is reached.

ŒæThe concept behind this installation is that its the mans tutu for tutu Tuesday at burning man.ŒæMade up of 2000 individual tutus and in true burning man styles the individual tutus are to be gifted out to citizens of black rock city.

column1: It will be a 15ft tutu placed on the playa upon a 20ft classic wooden windmill tower.Œæ At sunrise on tutu Tuesday during Burning man A carnival style gifting party will take place to gift out the tutus to be enjoyed by tutu-less burners and fill black rock city with the colors of the Mans tutu.

column2: #theselfproject  is a fine art sculpture installation that uses the viewer and social media as a medium like no one has ever done before. Based off selfies, #theselfproject exists to delve into the thought of why people take, what we are thinking and how the behavior of taking selfies has done to our humanity. Is it an action that has made us more sharing of a society or has it made us more self absorbed and narcissistic? I wish to treat this question as a psychological study similar to those conducted in the 1950-60's. The day and age of smartphones our behavior and interaction with others has changed forever. I wanted to ask the questions how has this changed us, what do people take these images, what do we share them with not only friends and family but also with perfect strangers as well as what about these images do people relate to making them share and like these images. The phrases in these 10 mirror sculptures are meant to be self reflective pseudo questions that the viewer can relate to at that particular time. These phrases are omitted from the reflective surface of the mirror to make parts of the person seem to disappear. This lends to the thought that the phrase and the person are codependant. Placed in public setting traffic , people and other elements of the setting can also be seen in the mirror implying that all of this is part of a larger equation. Being that the genisis of taking selfies was done in a mirror, the viewer is encouraged to take a selfie, use the has tag #theselfproject and upload it to social media such as Instagram and Twitter where I can now have a library of those that participate in the project. By doing so I can couple these images together under each phrase and show the commonalities of people regardless of sex, race, age, orientation or economic background. We live in a world where we find many ways and many issues to create a wedge between our fellow man. I want this project to be one that, even in a small way, shows that we all go through the same core emotions and are a lot more alike than we perceive.The project will debut in Grand Rapids Michigan for the 2015 Art Prize however it is designed to travel to at least 10 cities nationally and internationally. In doing such I wish to shoot a documentary asking these questions, getting opinions from regular people, social psychiatrists and sociologists and show the progress of the project. I intend on publishing a book about the project as well.This is a very unique project for a number of reasons. 1, everytime someone takes a selfie they create a new piece of art. This piece/picture would not exist if it were not for that particular person. 2, to the best of my knowledge no one in fine art has deliberately used social media as a medium for fine art in this way. This has the potential to have 10's of thousands of individual works of art/images generated from these 10 sculptures as well as millions of impressions. For me, I  am excited to see various people get involved and build this community of sorts.I have a strong belief that what I create isn't necessarily the art. The art, the beauty comes from the emotions, interest, conversations, debates and interactions the work evokes. My work is simply a catalyst.  Please help me make this vision a reality. Get involved. Donate. Follow me on Instagram  and Twitter where you can find me @clevelanddean. Also follow the project via my website www.imadeyoureadthis.com. Thank you for your time, appreciation, participation and donations.

Update 8/6/2015ŒæHello Burners and Friends of Burners! ŒæSad to say, our Kickstarter failed to meet the funding goal, so we will not get any support from this venue. ŒæI guess there's too many other great projects going on, and I am more focused on getting things done than running around promoting like crazy. ŒæNot to worry, we are still going, everything will still be beautiful and amazing, and the only downside is a big hole in my personal finances, but heck - its Burning Man - it always costs more than you think it will.But...if you still would like to help out and also still get one of the amazing rewards offered, you can do directly to my website where we still have everything available, but just without the Kickstarter framework. ŒæAny and all support is greatly appreciated, and we will see you on the Playa!!! ŒæHere is the support link, which will become active 8/7/15:Œæhttp://truemirror.com/bm2015fundraiser/ŒæJohn Walter, lead artist...and now back to our story:The theme at Burning Man this year is the Carnival of Mirrors, so we are going all out with the redesigned and upgraded True Reflections Palace. ŒæThis isŒæa wonderful space that showcases amazing true reflection mirrors thatŒæshow you without reversing left and right. ŒæA truly tinkered view of you and completely mind blowing! We discovered that these mirrors allow you to See Yourself - Œænot just what you look like, but who you are and how you are. ŒæThis will be our 10 year anniversary at Burning Man, and we are ready to rock the Playa with some amazing art and beautiful interactivity!Traditional mirrors take all of our vitality away and present a flat and distorted version of ourselves. We are used to this version since childhood, but it is so wrong - we are much more than what is in backwards mirror reflections.In contrast, looking into your own eyes, in real time, without that reversal does something surprising - our eyes and faces keep "working". ŒæWhatever we are saying looks right, so we can keep saying it. ŒæThe net effect - you get to See Yourself. The real you, the one that we see. ŒæIt can be stunning to realize how much more alive we are than what we have seen in traditional mirrors our entire lives. ŒæIt's a function of right brain/left brain theory, facial communication and feedback loops. ŒæThere is both science and magic here, and on Playa it gets both explained and experienced to a degree unlike any other place on earth.This year we have been selected as one of theŒæBurning ManŒæHonorarium Art Projects, which has not only helped get us there, but given us amazing visibility for the full 8 days...placement on Inner Playa!This presented both a challenge and opportunity - the Palace clearly had to be made bigger, plus the Œæ4x4 and 2x4 construction was getting old. ŒæFive years back and forth to Playa definitely takes its toll, plus the creative itch was was crying out for something new. ŒæSo what else can one use to build a 20x30x8 foot cube? ŒæJohn Walter, aka Exactly, the lead artist, came up with the perfect solution...what about using life size versions of those wooden building toys from childhood? They should be able to work (aside from the fact that they always fall apart - basic engineering additions could fix that).ŒæAnd so the planning and testing began, first in trying to make the wood rounds with a tree trunk, then by doing it right with a woodworker who makes wood columns by trade. Œæ Then joining with 10 foot long poles covered in colored spandex, then colored curtains on the outside, and finally "cross-beams" for strength, and voilíæ - a brand new design that will be pretty kickin out there! ŒæForm, Function and Art all rolled into one. ŒæAs a bonus, the colors will make it truly look like a Carnival Tent!In the spirit of of the 10 principles of Burning Man, we are Gifting an amazing, wonderful and completely unique experience to thousands of people. ŒæRadical self-expression is often the result as people look deeper and interact with themselves as never before. ŒæAnd Immediacy? ŒæWe are Œæall about removing a barrier to recognizing your inner self and how you truly are to the rest of us - you can turn around and be yourself so much better from this experience.ŒæPrepare to be surprised if you have never seen this before...you as a real, vibrant, truly alive and happy human being. ŒæOr a deep and genuine Burner with wisdom in your eyes.  Or whatever - your true image actually reflects all your expressive information correctly, so you can continue to be true to yourself. ŒæThe experience is wonderful - as one burner said: Œæ"When did I become the bright capable soul that this mirror shows?". ŒæOr another: "I find myself liking what I see...and I find myself loving that concept". ŒæOr even better, from a 5 year old: äóìWhy are my eyes shiny in this mirror but not in that mirror?äó ŒæSays it all! ŒæEven more comments below really tell the story and why this actually is super important work we are doing. We thank you in advance for your support of our vision.We are looking for Kickstarter funding to supplement our other funding sources, especially since the project has grown quite a bit since our initial budget. ŒæFor instance, in addition to the main Palace installation, we are going to to put True Reflection Mirrors at the Purel stations on 15 radial streets at Avenue D. (aka Daily Mirrors with Affirmation Tabs). ŒæBecause mirrors will be everywhere this year, might as well put true reflection mirrors where they can be easily used, just like any other mirror, just so much better!ŒæThe entire project has already topped $20,000, and we are only partially funded from Burning Man and some wonderful donors so far, including from the lead artist. ŒæBasically here is a cost breakdown:The rewards are coming directly from the hands of the lead artist and photographers connected to the project. ŒæAs part of John's lifelong mission to bring these mirrors to the world, he does make them commercially as True Mirrors. ŒæWhat makes them so special is that the distracting line in the center of two ordinary mirrors at right angles is virtually invisible, and it can be mounted on the wall just like any other mirror, just so much better.Œæ Note: this is the only place in the world to get this kind of mirror...its actually quite difficult to make them perfect, but we think it matters that we do.The production 12x12" model is offered here at a discount from the regular price, and the beautifully decorated one from Michele Palmer will be an amazing addition to any household, and the handcrafted wood 18x18" models will be gorgeous. ŒæOn Playa, our $50 reward is to have your portrait taken inside the True Reflection mirror. ŒæWe have been blessed to see so many incredibly magical people with real sparkles in their eyes - something that is rarely seen in even regular portraits. ŒæCapturing the essence of who you are can be a lifelong treasureFinally, the Liquid Nitrogen Fractured First Surface Bas-Reliefs are the result of a failed experiment that became beautiful art instead. ŒæTrying to get better cuts, John experimented with making the glass very cold...as in Liquid Nitrogen cold. ŒæDidn't work - the glass fractured into many pieces. ŒæBut they were perfectly fractured - you could put them back together like a jigsaw puzzle. ŒæSo he mounted them on a black background and framed them for Œæcompletely unique wall artŒæBonus - VIP Entrance: All contributions over $25 get VIP entrance to the Palace if there is a line, and we expect one almost all the time. ŒæNote: this reward only works if there is someone at the "velvet rope" to take your VIP pass - since this is a 24x7 installation, there will be plenty of times there will be no one at the gate...so sorry, for those times you will have to wait with others.ŒæHonor Roll - all contributors will have their names on a large poster inside the palace as another thanks and recognition of your support - even the smallest amounts mean a lot to us, it goes a long way to showing how you value this experience, both at Burning Man and elsewhere.The True Reflectors Crew consists of amazing people who have been part of previous year's installations and/or those who are so moved by the experience that they are completely ready and willing to bust it both here and on Playa. ŒæSuper grateful to everyone!

Katie Beall and I were selected to exhibit our art work at the Governors Island Art Fair in New York this September. This is a wonderful opportunity for us, but there's only one problem. We're a couple of broke art students, and it's expensive to stay in New York for a month. That's why we need all the help we can get from wonderful people like you! ŒæWe're hoping to raise enough money to help cover our travel and lodging expenses as we will need to be in New York for the month of September. ŒæOtherwise, it's no New York exhibition for Katie and Evan : (
The

$10,000 is a start as I will continuously need to pay for the land as it will require a mortgage but its a start. Eventually it will be an Eco-CampgroundIt seems that the world is developing at a fast rate these days; open land is becoming more and more difficult to find. We have been warned by environmentalist that global warming in on the rise, but are we doing anything to slow down the process or protect what is left of our land?I would like to help to try and help reverse some of the damage that we as a human race have done. I would like as many people as possible to help me do this as it is too much for one person to do alone. I would like to acquire a large piece of land up north where trees can be planted, or replanted. I also hope to be able to purchase the mineral rights of this land as well, to ensure its protection. This land will be used as a camping ground which will run solely off of solar energy. If the land has any buildings on it, I would like to use some of the money to convert them to run on renewable energy as well. ŒæI have contacted the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada in order to gain a Dark-Sky designation talks are still on going. With the urban life we live, we need more places where we can look up and be able to see the stars; a place where we can escape the chaos of our daily lives. More can be learned about this at https://www.rasc.ca/content/torrance-barrens-dark-sky-preserve.I hope that we can work together to get this project going, and so that we can start planting trees rather than digging them up. ŒæThis project won't happen over night as I need to gain the proper plot of land plus the mortgage but with your donations its a start.

Many of us grew up playing with LEGO bricks, but eventually we are forced to leave behind our childhood and set off in search of meaning, success, wealth, love. But the journey of adulthood is often difficult and harsh, and sometimes you really just want to play with some LEGO bricks.Inspired by Legoizer after I saw it on Reddit, I set out to create my own LEGO mosaic generator with more customizable options (e.g. dimension, color, brick types) in order to recreate one of my all time favorite paintings, TheŒæGreat Wave off Kanagawa («_Î«šÎ‡____µÈ£), in LEGO bricks.After a combined total of few days of intermittent hacking during which I incidentally received my college degree, I built  Image to Brick,Œæa functional JavaScript tool that produced the build instructions more organized and configurable than the ones produced by Legoizer.There were a few reasons why I felt necessary to build my own tool instead of using Legoizer. If you are curious, I talk about them in greater details in this blog post: http://soraven.com/2015/07/20/why-i-made-image-to-brick/Having completed Image to Brick, I have taken the first concrete step I needed to realize my life-long (2-month-old really) dream of being an adult practitioner of the LEGO arts. Huzzah. But the hard part is yet to come.At this point in this story, I came to the realization that LEGO bricks are hella expensive -- I would need around 9,000 bricks just to build a 5äó_ 3äó_ x 3äó_ 3äó_Œæ(160cm x 100cm) sized mosaic and I was hoping for something a little bigger than that. At $0.10 to $0.40 a brick depending on type and color plus shipping, this can add up fast. I will probably also need to build/purchase a flat supporting surface for the base plates.I realized that I don't quite have the disposable income to do this, but by this point I am already in too deep. Having done the research and spent countless hours on this endeavor, the vision of a LEGO Great Wave was rapidly becoming an obsession. I want to see this thing in the real world. I want to touch it. And possibly lick it.I need money to make my vision a reality. I asked myself, "Where can I find people with excess liquid assets who would give it to complete strangers on the Internet to do silly things like making potato salad?" And here we are.Help me recreate this awesome painting in LEGO! The base goal will allow me to build a mosaic at least 3 feet high. I plan to adjust the build size upwards if the raised amount exceeds the goal or if more detailed cost calculations allow for it. These are the rough estimates:I plan to adjust the height of the mosaic in increments of 16 bricks because I will use 16x16 and 32x32 base plates to construct the canvas.I will be using a mixture of 1x16, 1x12, 1x10, 1x6, 1x4, 1x3, 1x2 and 1x1 plate pieces placed in horizontal rows on the base plate canvas to construct the image itself. I prefer this method over stacking LEGO bricks because each unit of LEGO is square and not rectangular and the result has a more interesting texture because of the exposed studs.If it proves feasible given the funding level achieved, I would like to explore the possibilities of building the mosaic in different layers. This would require more bricks and cost more, but the result might look more interesting.The tool I created does not directly support layering in generating the build instructions, so some manual tweaking and image editing will be needed to figure out how to produce the brick counts I need to create the effect. In the above example, I would probably use regular bricks for the blue layer, double plates for the purple layer and single plate for the red layer.The final deliverables for this project are:I hope to complete the entire project by December with most of the building work being done over weekends.Help me live the dream!

Hello. My name is Marc Rees and I am a the curator of a small butbeautifully crafted,Œæentirely free, arts festival called LLAWN, located in the Queen of Welsh resorts ,Llandudno , North Wales .Œæ2015 will be its third manifestation and itäó»s growingfrom strength to strength. Our aim is to animate the whole of the town and toget everyone to embrace the arts: the local residents, the shop keepers and shoppers andthe seaside day trippers .ŒæFor the last two festivals we have utilised a central areain town called North Western Gardens, more fondly known locally as Bog island (either because Œæit used to be a natural bog or, possibly,Œæbecause it now houses the maintown toilets).ŒæThe siteŒælies opposite the derelict Tudno Castle Hotel, a venue thatwe also take over and open up for the festival .ŒæThere was a beautiful old oak tree in the centre of thegardens which became a focus for many of the festival's events butunfortunately it was severely damaged in a storm and had to be cut down and asyou can see in the video, kindly the only thing left is a sorry looking stump, apitiful reminder of a lost, majestic totem.The underpinning theme of LLAWN is the presence of absencewith the addition this year of the tag line Revist / Reveal. Therefore myintention is to Revisit the site , Resurrect the tree Œæand Reveal itstemporary replacement during LLAWN03.I want its construction to be a participatory action /contribution therefore we would hold a scrap wood amnesty and encourage peoplefrom Llandudno and further afield to search their sheds for discardedŒæneglected or forgotten about bits of wood. These could be the handle of alost hammer, a table leg, a piece of drift wood, a broken broom or left overpieces from domestic DIY job. Basically a resurrection tree made from recycledmaterials; its size will depend on the donated stockpile. To ensure that thetree is indeed a beautiful thing (and of course safe) I'm going to commissionthe sculptor Alan Goulbourne to build it in collaboration with the community.Alan'sŒæsculptural works utilise sawn wood with which he constructs boldand often physically overwhelming structures. Both representational andabstract, his works are influenced by science and nature and the relationshipbetween them. He often employs a process of order and chaos, starting from asingle gesture or mark, rising to a äóÖcrescendoäó» of marks and movements thatcollectively embody simplicity and complexity, as might a pattern innature.Œæ Therefore a reimagined and reconfigured tree is the perfectsubject for Alan.Once built it will once again become the focal point of thefestival and indeed the town. Many events will take place around it, includingstory telling sessions , dance performances by Family Dance Project and a newcommission calledŒæDROS DROŒæfor a dance artist to collaborate with thecommunityŒæ.TheartistŒæwill work with a group of sons and their fathers to construct aportable Œæstructure ( made from further scraps of wood) that is erected atseveral locations around town where the they will perform a choreographicaction in and around the makeshift den , the last site will be adjacent to ournewly Re-formed tree, TOTEM.

In the world there are thousands of museums , but no museum of the imagination . Our project is to create a permanent collection of all the objects that give rise to dreams . A fragment of the shuttle of NASA , a drawing by Leonardo da Vinci , a flower , a scultua , a music , a color , a song ... everything that causes imagination and dreams will have to find space for a museum to be interactive , in every room in every corner , you will find the seed of a new dream ...The sum of 275,000 Euros is required for the construction of exhibition facilities that will host then the objects , which will be recovered in every corner of the world , thanks to the reports of all subscribers , which will be full members of the Scientific Committee.--------Nel mondo esistono migliaia di musei, ma nessun museo della fantasia. Il nostro progetto íÂ creare una raccolta permanente di tutti gli oggetti che fanno nascere i sogni. Un frammento dello Shuttle della Nasa, un disegno di Leonardo da Vinci, un fiore, una scultua, una musica, un colore, una canzoneäó_tutto quello che genera fantasia e sogni dovríæ trovare spazio in un museo che dovríæ essere interattivo, in ogni stanza, in ogni angolo, si dovríæ trovare il seme di un nuovo sognoäó_La somma di 275 mila euro íÂ necessaria per la realizzazione delle strutture espositive che ospiteranno poi gli oggetti, che saranno recuperati in ogni angolo del mondo, anche grazie alle segnalazioni di tutti i sottoscrittori, che saranno membri di diritto del Comitato scientifico.

Vogliamo realizzare una grande mostra, che partendo dalläó»Italia possa essere presentata anche in altri Paesi. La mostra saríæ composta da 40 abiti fatti di cibo, progettati dai maggiori artisti internazionali. Gli artisti, i progettisti e i designer selezionati provengono da ogni parte del mondo e tutti hanno un'esperienza specifica nel rapporto con il vegetale, vero protagonista di questa imprevedibile mostra.Tra gli altri, saranno presenti abiti di Andrea Branzi, Alessandro Mendini, Guda Koster, Diana Kovacheva, Samantha Murray, Antony Trinidad, Alexandra Sorto e James Ostrer.La mostra saríæ articolata in 3 ambiti.Primo ambito: äóìLa stanza delle performanceäóDurante läó»inaugurazione, il pubblico (solo su invito e saranno invitati tutti coloro che avranno contribuito alla raccolta fondi) verríæ coinvolto in una vera e propria performance, durante la quali gli attori vestiti con abiti realizzati con cibi freschi daranno vita ad alcune rappresentazioni, relazionandosi con gli oggetti, con i suoni del paesaggio casalingo. Saríæ una sorpresa tutta da vivere insieme.Secondo ambito äóìLe performance in un video / Il cibo e la musicaäóPer ovvie ragioni di deterioramento delle materie utilizzate, gli abiti indossati durante la performance inaugurale della mostra non saranno disponibili nei giorni seguenti. Saríæ perí_ possibile prenderne visione attraverso una installazione video. Sulle 4 pareti di una stanza ci saranno 4 schermi a grandezza naturale, sui quali verranno riprodotti gli abiti presentati nelläó»inaugurazione. Läó»esposizione verríæ arricchita dalläó»installazione dei suoni della äóìVegetable Orchestraäó.Terzo ambito äóìCibo VestitivoäóQui ci saranno 40 manichini, realizzati appositamente per la mostra, che celebrano il connubio tra cibo, culture, techne e läó»essere umano. I manichini indossano abiti con vegetali inusuali: alghe, muschi, foglie, frutti etc., tutti realizzati con materiali non deteriorabili.I fondi di cui siamo in cerca ci serviranno per realizzare gli abiti, le performance, i video del secondo ambito e per stampare il catalogo della mostraI presupposti teorici della mostraDenaro per comprare cibo. Guerre per conquistare terre da coltivare. Da sempre sono questi gli strumenti con cui läó»uomo ha soddisfatto il gesto primordiale di cibarsi.Oggi si cerca di combattere läó»enorme problema della fame nel mondo attraverso la ricerca di un cibo dallo standard geografico e qualitativo sempre pií_ omogeneo, un genere di alimentazione äóìindustriale e di massaäó: una auspicata tendenza che avríæ perí_ un risvolto negativo: faríæ perdere la tensione culturale verso il cibo.Mobili, oggetti e cibi saranno sempre pií_ anonimi e funzionali, sempre meno comunicativi e rituali: per läó»uomo comune il cibo sta diventando pop. Sino a diventare app.Unäó»immagine tempo fa mi ha colpito. Per la mia mostra äóìDressing ourselvesäó, Andrea Branzi aveva progettato un abito di feltro, su cui era seminata delläó»erba: regolarmente annaffiata e curata, una volta cresciuta si poteva tagliare. E quindi anche mangiare.Läó»immagine della mostra äóìCibo vestitivoäó íÂ quella di un abito-cibo che si porta con sí©.Il che significa che se si cambia abito si puí_ cambiare cibo. Il che significa che si possono scoprire, trovare, inventare tanti diversi abiti-cibo per una sopravvivenza globale, per una ritualitíæ singolare ma condivisa. Forse esistono archetipi di tutto cií_ in culture primitive. Forse la nostra capacitíæ progettuale ne puí_ inventare di diversi, pií_ semplici o pií_ complessi. La ricerca íÂ partita da qui. Il punto däó»arrivo íÂ il progetto di un futuro in cui abiti-orto avvolgono la persona con un cibo quasi infinito, un cibo ricco di ogni ben di Dio. Abiti che diventano strumenti per una agricoltura diversa, in cui il rito convive con il bisogno, in cui il cibo riacquista il suo valore di nutrimento e di speranza. Due passi precedenti: oltre alla mostra äóìDressing ourselvesäó, in cui designer e artisti erano chiamati a progettare un abito che li definisse, recentemente íÂ stata realizzata la mostra äóìAbiti da Lavoroäó, che si íÂ svolta in Triennale, a Milano, dal giugno a settembre 2014. Líå il tema íÂ stato quello di indagare äóñ attraverso abiti progettati da artisti internazionali äóñ una diversa dimensione delläó»abito da lavoro, che potesse diventare la via per inventare nuovi lavori fantastici.

I recently came to the conclusion that it is ok for me to identify as an artist, but then I realized that the only art I have done revolves around theatre, and I wanna explore my artistic abilities in a medium that allows me to push myself creatively, and make a statement about something I care a lot about. 14 Brave women have agreed to share their stories with me about living with depression. When I was first diagnosed with depression, I was scared of its ability to be such a powerful label. I often asked myself, äóìIs this what defines me now?äó And no, it isnäó»t. And that is mainly because I feel like very few people actually KNOW me. We have to be so careful about who we choose to let in, and that is so completely exhausting. What if they let us down? Wouldnäó»t it be so much easier if we could just openly and candidly speak about our demons in a way that doesnäó»t cast a shadow on who we are?ŒæHere is the gist of what I want to do:I want to create an äóìexhibitäó titled, I Am Woman, Hear me Cry. Over the next couple of months, I want to sit down with each of my participants and spend some time with them. I will conduct a casual interview with them that includes the same questions, but I may throw in some extra questions when we are together and I want to know more about something in particular.During our time together, I will give them a disposable camera that they will take around with them. Iäó»ll ask them to capture things that strike them in some way. Things that make them happy, sadäó_ whatever. I wanna see the world through their eyes.ŒæI will also ask them to make a playlist of songs that are important to them.ŒæLastly, I will ask them to write a letter to someone that you would never send to them.ŒæŒæAll of these things will be combined to make a multimedia äóìshrineäó to their existence, struggle, and spirit. The shrine will be designed based on the vibes I get on the beautiful aspects of who they are. They will each feature personalized decorations that I find/create. At the äóìshrineäó will be 2 walkmans, one with a CD of their playlist, one with a CD of their interview that will be available for people to come in and listen to/experience. I just want people to kinda wander and get to know them. Also at your äóìshrineäó will be the photos from the cameras and the letter (if you so choose).After I have collected all of my material, I will begin building an installation that will transform an acting studio on Western Washington University's campus into how I see the feminine heart with depression. The room will include the use of various materials, projections, and lighting effects.ŒæHere are the things I need your help with funding!Œæ-14 disposable cameras and their developmentŒæ- 28 portable CD Players (This will be a challenge. Let me know if you have Œæ Œæsome old ones you would like to donate!)- Building materials- fabrics, paint, canvases... miscellaneous art materials.Œæ

ŒæEnvironmental disasters are occurring around the world with increasing regularity and severity, and they are affecting larger portions of our Earth and devastating ever-greater segments of the population. Disasters are becoming a more frightening reality no matter where we live. Most of us watch televised images of these disasters, separated from their wrath by the relative safety of distance, as if we are watching a movie and not a real event.ŒæA previous work of mine, äóìWar: Ongoing Project,äó stirred viewers and brought them to a new realization of the costs of war. This environment  project will alert them to the emotional costs for humans as a result of global warming and climate changes.This project aims to immerse viewers into the aftermath of a natural disaster, allowing them to experience the personal trauma and loss so many suffer.ŒæThe äóìENVIRONMENT/MAZEäó, created with Hugh Levick, will consist of several large areas, each with a distinctive environmental disaster-related theme. Maze passages will connect each area, but false leads, police barriers; artistic structures and a variety of storm debris will present obstacles to the participants. The idea is to disorient the viewer, causing confusion and frustration similar to what would be felt in a real disaster where one would not find clear paths to relief or safety.The themes of each area will vary, representing fire, storm, flood, wind, rain, etc. Within these areas will be constructed sculptural debris, abstract figures of distressed people or animal bodies, sometimes hung from the ceiling. Fans may be used to generate winds, and mirrors may be installed to create illusions of space and to further the sense of disorientation. The viewer will be exposed to these elements from all angles, increasing the sense of complete immersion into the experience. A very loud and intense sound will emanate from one area. This sound, a combination of music and the actual cries of distressed people, will be an audio theme throughout the exhibit.ŒæŒæIn another area, overhead projectors will cover the floor with an image of rippling water. Against one wall there will be an oversized, blackened canopy bed in ruins. It will be covered with debris, the moldy canopy intertwining with lathe and plaster. Over the bed and cascading, like a waterfall or broken levy, from the wall to the floor will be a flow of crumpled paper. As it seeps from the wall, it is mostly white, but as it falls down over the bed, it gradually turns from white to black. Projected images reflected on that cascade will create the impression of falling water. A room that was once someoneäó»s sanctuary of sleep and comfort has been destroyed. The sound in this room is that of a beating heart.ŒæŒæThese rooms and passages will be generally dark enough to cause the viewer some anxiety or disorientation but with just enough light for safe navigation.  I welcome other participating artists and set designers to design and build some of the areas. They will be recognized as creative participants in the project. Companies will be encouraged to participate through donations of money and materials. Grants from the state or local government could help fund this project.ŒæŒæInstallations of this project are being planned for Buffalo, NY, San Miguel de Allende, Mexico and California. I hope to bring this traveling exhibit to as many locations around the world as will welcome it.ŒæŒæRewardsThe reward for supporting this project will be a signed original piece of art from the collection of Ben Perrone. The art reward will take into account the amount donated. Also the names of major donors will be inscribed on the walls of the project.Œæ

We're the only company in the world that makes high-resolution photographic sequin mosaics by hand. We put a modern spin on a vintage technology, bringing imagery to life in a whole new way. Our mosaics look like illuminated LEDs, but are actually just reflecting light - making images glitter and shine without any electricity.All of our mosaics are 100% handmade in Los Angeles, which as you can see in the video, is a significant undertaking (FYI, it takes 4 hours to produce one square foot of sequin mosaic!) So we're looking to automate the process, to cut down on production time and make our art more accessible. And for the very first time, we're making our creations available to folks everywhere. Our new production system is designed and ready to go; all we need is the capital to purchase the new machinery. Production will remain 100% in Los Angeles and you, dear backer, will be helping build the foundation for a developing cottage industry right here in your home country. You're probably thinking, "Oh they've already got some big clients, they don't need help." Well, the truth is, time is our biggest overhead. We're barely breaking even because production is so costly. We need to invest in a hydraulic press, custom tooling, dies and new molds. Other costs involved include paying engineers for design and development of our new system. Your contribution would help make these a reality!

Cool&Tot,Œæthe Berlin art-production collective, is taking part in this yearäó»s Berlin 48 Stunden Neukí_lln Festival (June 26th - 28th, 2015) with project Salvation-Island-Art. Project Salvation-Island-Art is made possible through Neukí_lln's Cultural development budget.  With your additional support of 1000 Euros our float/island will be further designed and staged (focus on LED lights and basic acoustics) so as to enhance the idea of salvation that art seeks to offer. For the Festival, our float/island will be mounted at Berlin's Hermann Platz. ŒæThe real goal is to later get it on water. ŒæBerlin has an enormous, for the most part not very used, waterway network. The challenge will be to sway current waterway authorities to such possibility.Œæ Your support will increase our project's chances to shortly after re-appear again in August, this time in its solo edition on Berlinäó»s Kreuzberg Canal.ŒæWhat is Cool&Tot?Cool&TotŒæis an on-going project, a creative collaboration initiated by Œæ Œæ Ivan Jovanovic&Martin Kurpiers Œæwww.youtube.com/watch?v=_C7EXe77M_oŒæwith foresight for guests and greater participation: an osmosis of visual, audial & performative. ŒæWith project Salvation-Island-Art, Cool&Tot is collaborating with Alfredo Sciuto. Project Salvation-Island-Art  will be reflecting on this yearäó»s Festival theme, äóÖS.O.S. Can Art save the World?äó»Œæ Salvation-Island-Art  is a fictive float/island installation in year 2029. ŒæAmong the topics, it is looking at the co-existence of Muslims and Christians in Berlinäó»s  year 2029 Neukí_lln neighbourhood.What does the project consist of?Salvation-Island-Art  is technically  a float/installation composed of three different parts. Themain float is a hard geometrical hexagon base with an inflatable ring-shaped gallery made of  recycled plastic. The ring will be lit from the inside in order to create a bright äóÖspace station-effectäó» able to dramatize the idea of salvation for art and through art. ŒæOur float/island is being built exactly as if it was going straight to water. ŒæAt HermannPlatz, we look to stimulating the theatrical effect as if being on water. ŒæCool&Tot project crew will live on the float for the duration of the Festival.  This will be accompanied by performative and acoustical happenings.ŒæWhat is 48 Stunden Neukí_lln?48 Stunden Neukí_lln is more than a festival, it is a forum for artistic projects from the manifold art scenes in Berlin today.  The focus is sometimes on presenting art dealing with current social issues.  Since the festival was established in 1999, 48 Stunden Neukí_lln has become the largest festival of contemporary arts in Berlin.  The Festival aims every year to incorporate all participating projects as an integral part of Berlinäó»s Neukí_lln neighbourhood and open it up to visitation from locals and numerous visitors alike.ŒæWhat is the theme of this yearäó»s Festival?This year the Festival will delve into the theme of "S.O.S. äóñ Can Art save the World?"  In co-operation with both Berlin-based and international artists, the Festival will focus on the question of what the role of art in society today really is as well as dealing with the expectations and challenges that society confronts the artists with.  In this stimulating context, project  Salvation-Island-Art  will be presented to an ever-growingaudience from Germany and the world alike.  Last year during the Festival weekend around60,000 thousand people visited northern Neukí_lln experiencing new art creationsfirst hand.

I started posing the action figures in environments around Toronto, Ontario that spoke to that character, taking pics and posting online, the kicker, I'd leaveŒætheŒæaction figure for kids (or kids at heart) to find and home to enjoy. My friends applauded the 'charitable' aspect and they got a kick out of the pics and encouraged me to take it further.#ToyArtToronto was created on Instagram just two weeks ago and I've caught the attention of the CBC, The Toronto Star, Kiss 92.5fm andŒæŒæIndie88. AMAZING & more requests are coming in.#ToyArtToronto is still brand new and has already evolved several times. Art installation, Nuit Blanche 2015, Paris, France, 50 sqmFlood was selected by the city of paris to integrate the Nuit Blanche OFF 2015, but i need your help for support the project equipment costs necessary to build this installation.Flood a í©tí© choisi par la ville de Paris pour intí©grer le parcours OFF de la Nuit Blanche 2015, mais je besoin de votre aide pour financer le coíét des matí©riaux ní©cessaire íæ la rí©alisation ce projet.ŒæCONCEPTThe theme of this new session of Nuit Blanche is the climate echoing the COP 21 to be held in Paris in december 2015.In recent years many extreme natural phenomena took place in the world with a frequency that is accelerating. The history of Paris has also experienced remarkable weather events including in 1910 with an exceptional flood that inundated much of the town and paralyzed public transport. This phenomenon of heavy precipitation remained extraordinary there are still 100 years should become more frequent because of the current climate change. Therefore to address this theme of Nuit Blanche, I chose to develop the subject of the Flood.La thí©matique de cette nouvelle session de la Nuit Blanche est le climat faisant í©cho íæ la COP 21 qui aura lieu íæ Paris fin 2015.Depuis quelques anní©es de nombreux phí©nomíÂnes naturelles extríÈmes ont eu lieu dans le monde avec une frí©quence qui säó»accí©líÂre. Läó»histoire de Paris a connu aussi des í©ví©nements mí©tí©orologiques remarquables et notamment en 1910 avec une crue exceptionnelle qui a inondí© une grande partie de la ville et paralysí© les transports en communs. Ce phí©nomíÂne de forte prí©cipitation qui restait extraordinaire il y a encore 100 ans devrait devenir plus frí©quents íæ cause de ces changements climatiques actuels. Cäó»est pourquoi pour rí©pondre íæ ce thíÂme de la Nuit Blanche, jäó»ai choisi de dí©velopper le sujet du Dí©luge / Flood.Deluge myths are the most numerous, and almost universally known. Obviously, this end of the world is not represented as radical, but as the end of humanity, followed by the appearance of a new humanity. In many myths, the Flood is attached to a fault that caused the anger of the Supreme Being. But if we examine the myths that announce the impending Flood, we find, among the major causes, not only the sins of men, but also the decay of the world. We can say then that the Flood opened the way to both a re-creation of the world and a regeneration of humanity.Climate change is also an opportunity for everyone to change their lifestyle and become more aware of the fragility of our planet.Flood echoed these universal stories and history of Paris. Feel, feel, what will be the world without awareness of man is the challenge of Flood. The audience wanders, observes, weaves through these filaments slowly trickles or a viscous liquid, which seems to take its time like the present climate changes. Flood surprised by this black and challenges here symbol of the extreme degradation of the natural elements. An uneasy feeling settled. Flood we asked about our future. And if the seas and rains become so?Les mythes du Dí©luge sont les plus nombreux, et presque universellement connus. íŠvidemment, cette fin du monde näó»est pas reprí©sentí©e comme radicale,mais plutíÇt comme la fin däó»une humanití©, suivie de läó»apparition däó»une humanití© nouvelle. Dans un grand nombre de mythes, le Dí©luge est rattachí© íæ une faute qui a provoquí© la colíÂre de läó»í_tre supríÈme. Mais, si läó»on examine les mythes qui annoncent läó»imminence du Dí©luge, on retrouve, parmi les causes principales, non seulement les pí©chí©s des hommes, mais aussi la dí©crí©pitude du monde. On peut dire alors que le Dí©luge a ouvert la voie íæ la fois íæ une re-crí©ation du monde et íæ une rí©gí©ní©ration de läó»humanití©.Les changements climatiques sont aussi une occasion pour chacun de modifier son mode de vie et prendre davantage conscience de la fragilití© de notre planíÂte.Flood fait í©cho íæ ces rí©cits universels et íæ läó»histoire de Paris. Ressentir, sentir, ce que sera la planíÂte sans prise de conscience de läó»homme tel est läó»enjeu de Flood. Le public se balade, observe, se faufile íæ travers ces filaments ou ruisselle lentement un liquide visqueux, qui semble prendre son temps íæ läó»image des í©volutions climatiques actuels. Flood í©tonne et interpelle par ce noir, ici symbole de la dí©gradation extríÈme des í©lí©ments naturels. Un sentiment de malaise säó»installe. Flood nous interroge sur notre avenir. Et si les mers et les pluies devenaient ainsi ?COMPOSITIONThe installation is formed of two superimposed structures, one on the ceiling and the other to the ground. These two structures are connected by wires in black pvc sections. On the ground, a wooden container 5 meters by 10 meters on which are attached metal hooks hosts a black liquid (oil or black paint) to the device hidden. For sealing, a black membrane is disposed on the container wall. On the ceiling, a suspended metallic grating hang the black fi ls. The project takes place in an interior space afi n to suspend the device. A drip system is installed on the tallest structure supplying each of the filamentsL'installation est formí©e de 2 structures superposí©es, l'une au plafond et läó»autre au sol. Ces 2 structures sont relií©es par des fi ls en pvc noir de diffí©rentes sections. Au sol, un rí©cipient en bois de 5 míÂtres par 10 míÂtres sur lequel sont fi xí©s des crochets mí©talliques accueille un liquide noir (huile ou peinture noire) permettant de cachí©s le dispositif. Pour assurer läó»í©tanchí©ití© , une membrane noire est disposí©e sur les paroi du rí©cipient. Au plafond, un caillebottis mí©tallique suspendu sont accrochí©s les fi ls noirs. Le projet prend place dans un espace intí©rieur afi n de pouvoir suspendre le dispositif. Un systíÂme de goutte íæ goutte est installí© sur cette structure haute alimentant chacun des filaments.PREVIOUS WORK

Urban HistoriesŒæThe project is a collaboration between Studio Aki and Appro-pri8 Theatre, inspired by a renovation which Studio Aki are currently undertaking in Stoke Newington. Ultimately we envisage this a site specific project based within a house. This first incarnation will be an installation which collages together several houses and will be based at Rara Studios.The InstallationIn the process of renovating a house, as walls are stripped back, old coverings removed, holes knocked through stud and brick walls,  the layers uncovered hint at a houseäó»s past; a fragment of 1970äó»s wallpaper, a victorian tile. These are clues give rise to the question, what lives have existed within these walls? Urban Histories seeks to explore these musings through series of vignettes.Visitors will be invited into the 'House' to meet past occupants and witness fragments of their lives. Urban Histories will be a work in progress in June and will feature rehearsed readings of our script in development.Why a Kickstarter?We are asking you to help us make this first stage of our project really great by helping us raise final funds or by sending an object from your home, which you may be about to get rid of. Funds will go towards materials and people's time. Objects will form part of theŒæinstallation, we'd like you to send an object, if possible,Œæwith a little history. ŒæSent ObjectsWe'll send in situ photos of all objects used inŒætheŒæinstallation. Please note we are not able to return objects, unless send with package and postage for return. They can however be collected on Saturday afternoon, from 5pm.Please send all objects to:Urban Histories, ŒæRARA,ŒæUnit 2, Grovesnor Way, London e5 9NDMany Thanks

Beloved Disciple: An exploration in unexplored (or controversial) themes; to confront, to expound, to proffer and to create a renewed understanding of faith.Friday 31st of July, 2015. LOT 23, Eden Terrace, Auckland, NZI am finally putting on a show/exhibit/installation/event, and I am needing your help to see it come to fruition. The venue has been booked and the date set. I am over the moon excited and cannot wait to have this finally happen. This project has been a few years in the making for me. It deals with the many dilemmas I faced growing up in a religious household, knowing (though not necessarily accepting) who I was... and then coming to terms with this whilst redefining my personal faith.The Beloved DiscipleŒæis a visual (fine arts painting, installation, and live performance art) exploration of the controversial theme of sexuality and Christianity. Controversial in the sense that I offer a suggestion, one that is shocking, but ultimately enriching. It begs the questions "What if?" and "Would it have changed much?" and also "How different would the world be if...?" The questions you are confronted with are yours to deal with, and only you can rationalize, process and conclude your own response; the dialogue whether spoken or internalized serves to create a deeper understanding for yourself and why you choose to believe what you do.I am not challenging faith... merely suggesting that we question what it is we believe so that we understand how we came to know it.What I need the money for:There are a few costs involved in the producing of this event/exhibition. Firstly, costs and fees for the hiring of the gallery space and opening night Drinks and nibbles. This alone comes to about $1200.00 NZD ($600 gallery hiring fee and $600 opening night costs and Printed PR &Advertising)ŒæFurthermore, there are the costs for the framing, freighting, assemblage and hanging of the works. Luckily there aren't too many works to be hung so the cost for manpower comes to about $440 NZD.I will need a final $1000 NZD to acquire the last and final touches for some of the installation artworks themselves.The rest of the costs will be used to pay for the Kickstarter fees and professional scanning and limited print reproductions of the works.

Why Kickstarter?I'm hereŒæto raise funds tohelp stage an art exhibition on the theme of love and loss.ŒæMuch of the work is alreadyŒæcompleted but I desperately need financial support to assistin the professional framing of work, the production of the exhibition catalogueand of course, the production of rewards to send to my generous supporters!What is Love and Loss?The exhibition äóÖLove and Lossäó», will aimto examine those connections within our lives that have helped to shape our understandingof love. Exploring the complex emotions arising from my past experiences, Iwant to create an art exhibition that articulates the power of passion, thedestructive influence of control and the shared intimacy of tenderness. To dothis, I will use artefacts, images and artworks taken from former friendships,relationships and family connections to act as totemic testaments to firstlove,Œæcontrolled love and unconditional love. How will Love and LossŒærelate toŒæthe viewer?Throughout the Love and Lossexhibition, the viewer will be invited to evaluate artworks such as; fragmentsof destroyed paintings, items of clothing and delicate ephemeral portraits toconsider events around love and loss in their own lives and to understand themas shared elements of the human condition. It is hoped that those visiting the show will gain a sense ofŒæwhatŒæit is to experience love and loss.Where didthe idea for love and loss come from?The ideafor Love and Loss came about recently as a result of losing my mum to cancer.When trying to understand and handle the range of complex emotions that camewith losing a loved one, I realised that throughout my life, I have had many friendshipsand relationships where I have loved and lost people that have been very dear tome, not necessarily in death, but sometimes as a result of moving away orsimply moving on. When this has happened, I have kept mementoes and artefactsto remind me of the time they were in my life. These are the objects andartworks that form the content of Love and Loss. Why showLove and Loss in Redcar?Redcar isa seaside town in the North East of England where I grew up as a small child. Iremember fishing off the South Gare with mum as a child and her always makingsureŒæwe bothŒæthrew our catches back in to the sea so they could live for anotherday. It made sense to launch Love and Loss in a town with such fond memories.The gallery, Palace Arts, is also a superb venue for this show. . Your generosity and support willhelp to make this happen.

I am raising the funds for the building or establishment to house and exhibit the Toy Museum/Bazaar for it's nothing like it out there in the world. I go to toy shows and wish that these shows could be accessed or attended everyday or at least every weekend. I have spent the last 15 years of my life collecting and building my G1 Transformer collection for the world. My collection is special for it only has the TFs that were present and sold in the US during 1984 - 1988. My collection will also display doubles of every TF from the era, so the viewer can be taking back in time to when they looked at the catalog pamphlet as a kid. Now TFs wont be the only toys on exhibit in the museum. We will have G.I Joe. Voltron, Robotech, Jem, Masters of the Universe and Gobots. These will be on display in a separate exhibit all together.ŒæThe bazaar will be an area where vendors and traders can set up booths and sale there toys and gifts.  This will be for certain times of the day for each day may have a different vendor. Now what makes this museum unique is that one can actually order the exhibits. Every exhibit will have a pouch of tags in front. The tag will state IN STOCK, PREORDER, BACKORDER or OUT OF STOCK. The viewer then will take this to the Toy/Gift shop and the toy clerk will then find that toy or set an order for you so you can come pick it up or we can have it mailed to you as well. Now if a toy is OUT OF STOCK and the viewer must have it. A 30% finders fee will be attached to the purchase fee for finding the item for you. The displays will also be well lit and protected behind flexi glass like a work of art as well as a piece of history. They will also have detail info about every TF that is on display such as origin, allegiance, stats, powers, personality traits, rivals as well as original origin such as Diaclone or Microman.There will also be a food court where one can eat and quench ones thirst. We also serve Beer/Wine with hot grilled food from the bar as well as an old school retro arcade with classic arcades from the 80s, 90s and 2000s. Also the atmosphere and music is from those decades as well to give you that retro feel.

A cross-pollination of art, music and science -- this model project will heighten awareness about the plight of the honeybees in our community and globally.My concern for the plight of honeybees has inspired me to dream up an artistic process that would create awareness about the importance of bees and bee pollination. The bee species is crucial for the environment because of the role it plays in pollinating a third of the plants in the United States and over fifty different crops, resulting in the reproduction of offspring that are genetically diverse. Through collaboration with environmental scientists, artists and musicians, I would like to create a model for and conduct honeybee educational workshops featuring the process and creation of three large bee sculptures to be installed in key locations in San Diego.  The research and workshops would culminate with a grand finale performance as a statement of bee awareness and consciousness.ŒæThis kickstarter will help with all of the different cost of the project from booking the venue to the materials that the artist will need to compete these bee sculptures all around San Diego. Please donate to our project to help spread the awareness of these little helpers before it's too late.Œæ

When you look at the bottom of a plastic container before recycling it, do you ever wonder who created that ubiquitous system of triangles and numbers?  Milly Zantow, a little known woman from south central Wisconsin had a vision, set out to make a difference in the world, and did.Although many have never even heard of her, she is one of the most important people in the recycling community.  Milly is responsible for creating that system of numbered triangle symbols on the bottom of plastic containers. Raised to reuse and recycle, Milly was always sensitive to waste.  Back in the 1970s she was surprised to hear that a rural Sauk County, Wisconsin garbage dump was to be closed early because it was filling up so fast.  Milly went to the dump and sat and watched as people dropped off their garbage. One thing she noted was that a majority of what she saw was made of plastic.  She believed that something had to be done.  She contacted a local milk jug manufacturer and came to an exciting conclusion äóñ that the plastic could be ground down and reused. According to the Wall Street Journal, "Zantow pushed to introduce plastics recycling to the area.  After laying groundwork with lawmakers, communities and industry, in 1979, Zantow co-founded the first complete recycling service in Sauk County, E-Z Recycling, which handled more than 200,000 pounds of materials in its first full year." Milly died in 2014 at the age of 91.  She never saw a monument in her name, but a group of Sauk County Institute of Leadership program participants wish to raise funds to place at least one memorial for this inspirational woman who did so much with so little.  Our goal is to place a personalized bench with a custom-made art piece in the newly constructed Harvest Park located in Reedsburg, Wisconsin.  The art piece is to be made of recycled metal materials; the bench will be made of recycled plastic and feature a memorial in Milly's honor.  We would also like to place an informational sign describing her contribution to the world of recycling.  We have contacted a local bench company that will assist in providing the bench and have been in discussions with local artists that will create a one-of-a-kind sign befitting such an icon. Harvest Park, in Reedsburg, Wisconsin is the home of The Ruminant, a must see as a part of the countyäó»s up and coming Fermentation Fest.  Having a memorial for Milly in a place where a combine was recycled into a beautiful art piece feels right.  Follow the link below to learn more about The Ruminant:http://www.karlunnasch.com/project-pages/2013.10-ruminant-stained-glass-harvesting-combine.htm Harvest Park is a highlight of the yearly Fermentation Fest and will be seen by thousands of people: http://fermentationfest.com/Related Linkswww.facebook.com/MillyZantowhttp://millyzantow.blogspot.com/
