ABOUT THE RV PURSE MUSEUMHi. Iäó»m professional freelance writer, columnist, novelistand vintage clothing aficionado Wendy Dager. That good-looking guy over thereis Mike, my extremely tolerant husband of thirty years.We need your help with our project, which we have dubbed theRVäóîor äóìRolling VintageäóäóîPurse Museum.ŒæThe Rolling Vintage Purse Museum will bea unique way to educate and entertain people who are interested in the art andhistory of vintage handbags.For this project, Mike and I recently purchased a 1961Aristocrat Land Commander, which is in need of a complete restoration. Mike, ageneral contractor, and I, not so great with a hammer, but with a good eye forart, will provide the labor.WITH YOUR HELPThe money we raise from this Kickstarter will go to:Materials needed to strip, refinish and refurbish walls,floors and furniture of the Land Commander.Paint and replacement parts for the exterior of the LandCommander.Interior additions such as Plexigas enclosures, lighting,curtains, signage, printed materials, and other items for the purse exhibits.Additional cost of insurance for our tow vehicle, a 1966Ford F-100.Cost of rewards for this project.THE BACKSTORYIäó»m in the process of receiving my certificate in Art Museumand Gallery Studies from California State University, East Bay. Iäó»m a studentmember of the American Alliance of Museums, and Iäó»m a member of the AntiquePurse Collectoräó»s Society.I also own vintage purses. Lots and lots of wonderful vintage purses,collected over nearly three decades. So many purses that my husband built ahuge room in our house, just for my vintage collection. And for Faith theMannequin.Uhäó_ welläó_ Southern Californiaäó_After consulting with business executives and other professionals, I realizedit would be way too costly. If my dream of having a purse museum were to come to fruition, it'd have to be unique. And cheap. Really, really cheap.Which is why we got the Land Commander, which cost $1,300and included possessions from the previous owner, most of which were veryyucky.We've already started the process of cleaning it up and tearing it down. (Thank you, inventorof rubber gloves.) Weäó»re now considering several design options, includingcreating large side doors that swing out to allow complete viewing of the exhibit withoutstepping inside the RV.But first, it needs to be stripped, refinished and putback together. After thatäó_WHERE THE HANDBAG MEETS THE HIGHWAYIf our goal is met, we plan to take the purses on the roadto events such as vintage fashion expos, RV äóìglampingäó rallies, andto businesses, museums and residences that will allow us to temporarily park ontheir lots so visitors can have a unique, entertaining and educational vintage fashion experience. Due to the RVäó»sspace constraints and the enormity of the full collection, the exhibits will berotated on a regular basis.The Rolling Vintage Purse Museum will be FREE. Thatäó»s rightäóîweare NOT going to charge admission.If our goal is exceeded, we will use the funds to pay forcontinued expenses for the RV Purse Museum, as well as update The Vintage PurseGalleryäó»s website to make it a much more comprehensive, interactive, yet stillŒæFREEŒæonline experience for visitors the world over.To check out our progress, you can visit RVPurseMuseum.com.For more about The Vintage Purse Gallery, visitVintagePurseGallery.com, and for the blog that started it all, Vintage Purse aDay, go to VintagePurse.blogspot.com.On Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/vintagepursegalleryTwitter: @VintagePurseGalEmail: info@vintagepursegallery.comThank you for your support!

The crew is THRILLED that Wheel of Fortune was described as being "undoubtedly...some of the most influential works of Burning Man 2014" andŒælisted as #4 of only 15 featured installations by the Huffington Post! Check it out!!The project has been refined and has become more sophisticated. We've almost completed the beautiful mini-decks of the Major Arcana, including a booklet with guidance by our oracle, Ceci Castelblanco and hand-stitched carrying bags. And we are implementing green solar technology. ŒæSo this means we are building an SUPER COOL outpost to house the panels that will be trenched 100ft away. This area can also be used as a mini hangout night or day! This outpost houses six used 130-watt solar panels, four used 200 amp-hour 6-volt batteries creating a 24-volt system, and a fancy-pants charge controller. The batteries provide 24-volt power. A remote meter allows  us to check our power generation and battery condition from a panel inside the Wheel of Fortune!! OOoooohh!!!This outpost provides the energy needed to illuminate the 22 doors inside and out! Thats 44 custom LED lights fed from a custom power harness and housed by hand-crafted can lanterns and the spinning, bullet-hole ridden barrel found at the center. Itäó»s all controlled by 11 driver circuit boardsäó_.. Are you excited yet????Because of the ingenuity of Alistair and Glenn we were able to build this solar array at limited costs, but this amazing structure and energy source has come at an added expenseäó_.We are calling on the community to support this green and sustainable portion of Wheel of Fortune!! Your investment will survive beyond Burning Man 2014, bringing light to projects to come! BRILLIANT!!!About Wheel of FortuneWe are all traversing this desert of wonders, wandering a life that has delivered each of us to this very point in the dust. Our paths have led us here, to a magnificent circle of 22 doors äóñ each having their own unique character.How curiousäó_ What IS this? What do I do now? What IS now?A glow from within and the sounds of music and laughter beckon to you. These wonders intrigue this weary traveler, whose Silk Road journey has thus far been an elusive quest for meaningäó_. Until now.Which door will have me? Instinctually, you know. The right door draws you in. You have finally found it äóñ or has it found you? It bears a unique life-sized image with a likeness of a figure äóñ ancient yet familiar beauty with starlit eyes, knowing wisdom in her waxing smile. In choosing a door, you have chosen your own fortune, your destiny.Or has it chosen you?HOW WOF CAME TO BE:Wheel of Fortune was born from researching the history, symbolism, and deep meaning of the tarot. We decided to create our own deck, made up of black and white multiple exposure photographs of women and a new interpretation of the meanings of each card. Each of the 22 doors symbolizes the universal aspect of the human experience.Consulted with oracles and card readers and dove into the mystery and meaning of the Heroäó»s Journey. This led us to the inspiration of creating this structure, and starting on a journey of our own!THE STRUCTURE:26 foot circular structure made of 22 salvaged doors. Each door will display a large-scale photo mural representing each Major Arcana card. Fully solar-powered installation! Made of salvaged and reclaimed materials! Custom central seating area with a salvaged spinning light! Glorious gazebo and a hand-made metal fire chandelier! Beautifully custom tailored & fire proofed shade! Transporting elements from California, New Mexico and Washington to the Black Rock Desert of Burning Man! We look forward to offering this intentional space to the Hero's Journey for personal reflection, card readings, high teas, and insight!We welcome all travelers to come in and enjoy the space! Take reflective refuge in the Wheel of Fortune, night or day..

Pennsylvania lawmakers recently refused to vote on a cigarette tax to help fund the School District of Philadelphia for the 2014-2015 school year. This made me angry and a little irrational so I decided to start a Kickstarter whereby I would recreate all the arts and crafts projects I did in grade-school for people who want to help me with my relational-aesthetics installation project, which is to facilitate the opening of the School District of Philadelphia.ŒæThis is not a charity. This is an installation piece in the tradition of artists like ŒæRikrit Tiravanija and Liam Gillick. I am committing the next three years of my life to fingerprinting and popsicle statues and science fair volcanos if the goal is met.All of the funds will be put towards the installation project, which is the opening School District of Philadelphia. The rewards will be self-funded and self-generated and hand delivered.

It's about community. It's about bliss. It's about bringing people together to make something BIG and Beautiful. It's COLOR COLLABORATION!Your pledge of support is needed now to make this project a success!On Fridays September 19th and October 17th we will create COLOR COLLABORATION. Blank white shade canopies over public benches will be transformed into colorful public art as the artist Brooke Nuckles Gentekos collaborates with local children, families and adults to make a sculptural art installation from colorful yarn. We will play catch with balls of yarn, wrapping and weaving a three dimensional work of art- Œæyarn bombing an abstract and colorful public art sculpture!The action and installation starts this Friday so please pledge your support Today!! We need to meet or exceed the goal by 9/20 at noon or this project won't get funded- your contribution will make Color Collaboration an awesome public art experience and support a thriving artist community.Bring public art to the Commons in Medford- COLOR COLLABORATION is in partnership with the City of Medford, Dept. of Parks and Recreation, Metro Medford's Third Fridays, the DOWNTOWN ART+ SOUND FESTIVAL and will be on display during the month-long art celebration EDGY IN OCTOBER.SUPPORT THE ARTS = PLEASE DONATE TO THIS KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN NOW!Artist Statement:I create site-specific webs, fiber art installations inspired by human connection, maps, and constellations in the sky. I love weaving patterns into 3 dimensional spaces. The results are colorful, soft, and unique. My material of choice is yarn. As a child, I was taught to knit scarves, to crochet hats, and to weave wall-hangings by my mother, aunt, and other women. I honor these lessons from my maternal lineage in these antique craft methods while making them mine. I let go of the knitting needles and the clumsy crochet hooks, expand the scale, and turn my hands into the tools. The soft texture, lightweight nature, and infinite possibilities of yarn, ribbon and string inspire me to draw by hand crocheting.  I begin each piece with one strand of yarn. As the fiber emerges from the wound-up ball, a line is formed and a drawing in space begins. The yarn spirals, folds, and creates pattern. I feel like I am tracing constellations or weaving a huge spider web. As the pattern emerges from empty space, the air becomes thick with soft layers of yarn. Loops and lines form the web, creating a network of colorful lines and shapes. Each fiber installation is a maze, a net, a dream catcher and a burst of color. The spaces between the lines create shapes and allow each piece to remain lightweight. I have been weaving these webs since 2001. Each web is inspired by a unique space, season, and life experience. I choose colors and yarn textures to reflect my experiences, to express my inner self. As I create these tactile pieces, I am surrounded by the yarn, often becoming entangled. Each web is created over a period of weeks or months and is a meditation. When people see my work, my wish is that they see something they have never seen before and find inspiration.  Have a creative day- build inspiration- bring vision to realityŒæLOVE & GRATITUDE!!!

I live in a rural area of Virginia. ŒæI am a transplant from Seattle and I have always enjoyed being surrounded by arts of every medium. ŒæHere, in "The Moonshine Capital of the World" (google it), I am surrounded by farmers of every type.ŒæMost are German Baptist. ŒæThey are a very private people and forbidden to own televisions and computers. ŒæThe farmer's family behind us is always interested in the art that I do.ŒæŒæI soon realized that their religion keeps them out of touch with the goings on in the world beyond the fence posts and barbwire. ŒæI am looking to bring a little art into their lives and onto their farms. ŒæI want my art to touch their lives, even though they will not know who it came from. ŒæThey talk within their circles and I like the idea that my art will one day be a topic of their conversation. ŒæNo one should be without art in their life.

I'm building an 8ft by 12 ft Dungeon Family Pyramid on the Atlanta's beltline. Why? Well I want to create a semi permanent monument that pays homage to the creative achievement of the Dungeon Family.ŒæTo me, pyramids are a symbol to the viewer that something significant has occurred here. It's a reference to mastery of one's self. In this the capstone is not the all seeing eye but the soul. It will be illuminated by solar powered LED lights but at night, we would like those lights to be lasers. Lasers that will light up as a symbol of the DF creative endeavors and investment in funk.The pyramid structures that have been left behind from ancient civilizations rival or even surpass modern construction in just about every continent. The Pyramid is a remnant of a society that celebrates the mastery of its architecture, culture and wisdom. The concept of this design was crafted from inspiration of these processes and honestly, Ancient Aliens, a show I watch religiously on H2. Although the original, functional, purpose of this type of structure is unknown, the visceral effect of the architectural mastery is not lost on the viewer. Similar to seeing a sculpture by Michelangelo or the colossal heads on Easter Island, not having access to the back story on the creation of the piece does not take away from the feeling that what you are seeing is indeed lasting.The Dungeon Family Pyramid will be an artistic homage to their iconic achievements. As nomadic travelers view it, even if they are unaware of the cultural influence of the artists who will be depicted on the structure, it will be evident by the style and representation of the figures that they hold great significance.In the future, I would like to create monuments like these combining ancient ruins with prominent hip hop artists. I want these structures to be made of materials that would last thousands of years. So when archaeologist find these installations they will know of the hip hop culture that preceded them and it was a mighty thing.

I am super excited of being invited to take part in the (e)merge Art Fair in Washington, DC (October 2 - 5, 2014). ŒæParticipating in this show will be fantastic exposure for me and I can't miss it! "The (e)merge art fair returns for a fourth year with the 2014 edition. Last year, the fair featured an international roster of over 80 exhibitors presenting works by 150 artists from 30 countries. Exhibitors will show new works in painting, sculpture, video, performance, installation, and other media. For four days, the public is welcome to view a carefully curated selection of emerging art at the Capitol Skyline Hotel, exhibited on three levels inside the hotel and throughout the hotel's grounds and public spaces.The (e)merge Artist Platform presents a vetted selection of works by independent artists displayed throughout the hoteläó»s public areas. (e)merge is the only art fair that gives free exhibition space to artists without gallery representation. The 2014 (e)merge Vetting Committee members are: AI WEIWEI, artist, Beijing; MIKA YOSHITAKE, assistant curator, Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden, Washington, DC; and JEFFREEN M. HAYES, director, Rebuild Foundation, Chicago, St. Louis & Omaha."My project will be a site specific installation:Medium: Drafting film, ink, acrylic, LED tape lightThree large pieces of drafting film are floating vertically from the ceiling, in the middle of the exhibition space, away from a wall. The dimensions will be 36 x 85 inches. The pieces will consist out of two layers of drafting film in front of each other. It is an experiment of layers of material and colors, superpositions and exposures. Ink colors condensate and vanish, sheer areas appear. Delicate, fragmental drawings grow out of colorfields. Fragments and segements of our daily environment become visible. ŒæDrawn elements of plastic wrapping materials capture the plastic material of the artwork itself and create artificial nature illusions. Seven inches behind the floating artwork two more sheets of drafting film will be hanging from the ceiling. An LED tape light is installed in between them. The light sheets will be white and clear, showing the routing of the LED tape light.In this concept everything circles around the gearing of color, fragmental drawings, light and space. Generally, the materials originate from technical and industrial coherencies (LED light, plastic materials) which enactment breathes a poetic buoyancy and softness. It is a constructive skeleton, that encounters translucent and transparent materials, and which joins together in an overall context. It is the context of countless plastic usage, such as of plastic wrapping and bags in our daily lives.Thank you for your support.Joana

My little family resides at St. Joe Lofts and have done so since the spring of 2011. I've had this idea of a large installation festering for well over a year and it came simply from slight jealousy. St Joe Lofts is an Artist Community in the Warehouse Arts District and there are gorgeous paintings (some sculpture too) temporarily provided by the residents of our community and displayed inside the main building where it is, essentially, a "live in" gallery. Now, here's the rub: The part of the building where I and others dwell...well, our apartment doors open to the outside and THERE IS NO ART!!!!!! Such a shame, don't you think? To amend this, I'm reaching out to you to fulfill this huge vision, along with smaller pieces to help round out 3 stories worth of outdoor space.The complete installation will be ready for the Art 4 Art's Sake event on October 4th, 2014 from 6-9PM. The installation will be up for the rest of October and pieces will be available for purchase or sent off as rewards. One large piece from the installation will be donated to St. Joe Lofts. ŒæAlso, a few smaller pieces (3 ft X 5 ft) Œæwill be donated to my son's middle school with the potential to extend to other schools in the Greater New Orleans Area!ŒæProjected Supplies needed: cement board, Zinssser Bulls Eye Primer, Thompson's Water Seal, Behr Exterior Satin, Ram Board, Deep Well Tray Liners, Drop Cloths, Rollers, Paint Brushes, 5 gal bucket. The estimate for framing the larger pieces has been estimated at 450 (at minimum) for supplies and labor. Additional lighting will be needed as well. Excess funds will cover the Artist's fee to go towards rent, childcare expenses, and snacks (my 13 year old son suggested this). If you have any questions, please ask!Please note: the painting behind my little family is my neighbor's! You can check out Alan Minor on FBŒæhttps://www.facebook.com/skizmart?fref=ts&ref=br_tfŒæor run into him at Jackson Square! Thanks for permission, Alan!

The VisionThe group of artists have been going to Burning Man for the last 10 years, as time goes by, the 10 principles are imprinted deeper with each trip home.They have made friends all over the world, appreciated the art installations on the playa. This year, through the collaboration of artists from Chicago, Philadelphia, San Francisco, South Bay, China, they are building "Hua Biao" on the playa."Hua Biao" goes back 4000 years in Chinese history, it used to be erected along the major arterial roadside for people to leave messages to the emperors anonymously. Later Huabiao are made of granite stones for durability and serve the same purpose. Our "Hua Biao" will be a place for people to leave messages for their beloved ones, we will also have meditation, Yoga around the base.ŒæAt night "Hua Biao" is illuminated and will serve as bus stop. It's a beautiful place for gather, meditate and send the messages to you loved ones.GoalOur goal is to raise enough money to construct Hua Biao for many tens of thousands of Burners to enjoy it on the playa.The amount we are looking to raise just covers the material costs and transportation service. The following is a main list of breakdowns of the costs:$2300: lumbers, 8ft 2x4 60 pieces, 4x8 plywoods 24 pieces, 8ft 4x4Œæ 9 pieces, rebar, fasteners, screws, nails, tie downs. $1200: tools, workspace shop, extra length ladders$1000: Penske Truck Rentals to San Francisco CA to Black Rock City, NV, gasoline, $500: exterior lights, interior lights, batteries, control set up.$300: paints, fabrics, clothes, for decorating the huabiao$600: fuels, lanterns, solar panelsOur $6000 goal is conservative and cover the materials, we would be very honored and graceful to receive your kind contribution, also you are welcome to visit us on the playa. Please show your support and help us to make this project live. A big THANK YOU !

Unfortunately I only have a card holder.The project will highlight the spectacle of capitalism, where worth is only perceived, and not taken at humanitarian value. I have obtained a wallet, but I need varying tokens of wealth with which to fill it.As the wallet grows, the piece becomes more relevant, and the constant evolution of this piece with varying arrangements and net worth will detail the virile nature of capitalism.

I'm building cardboard models of 10 different ships, 4 large grids and 200 pegs. I'm calling the project "Small Craft Invasion." The concept is similar to the popular game "'Battleship," but with hand built, one of a kind boats on a larger scale. The finished game can be played outdoors or indoors, installed in a gallery or at a neighborhood block party to be enjoyed by children and adults. The funds raised will mostly cover time by the artist to make the models. The materials are mostly recycled.

EVENT AND HOSTING ORGANIZATION ISA Universidad De La Arts Havana, Cuba Professor Luis Gomez -videoŒæProfessor Ivan R. Basulto -printmakingThe significance of this travel activity is to immerse myself in tradition while exploring a culture that is freshly involved in new media. To have the opportunity to share concepts and techniques while doing my own research to create a future installation. Phase 1-The initial project begins with a lecture and workshop co-taught with myself and the Professors from ISA involving video, lithography, photo etching and screen printing. Students will be paired, one video artist and one traditional printmaker.Œæ Students will be asked to work collaborativelyŒæto create portions for a final installation involving video and traditional printmaking. Œæ Phase 2- Works and portions of works will be taken back to Calgary, Canada where students and invited artists will be asked to pair up and further develop the work. The goal is to establish relationships, share knowledge, develop a collaborative project for exhibition in the two countries.ŒæThere are very limited materials available for the students, it is my goal to raise funds to buy materials for video editing and printmaking that will be donated to the University for student use. I feel it is a worth while project to support the Visual Arts and to create a cross cultural exchange with Cuba and Canada.ŒæBest Wishes, Debra

Hello, welcome to my project briefing, my video was sent to me by my girlfriend of our memories together and the video will show you what my work is really about.Me and my girlfriend try and see each other at least once a year Whilst I am studying my degree and I am now coming up to my final year hoping to put together a very exciting degree project that anyone will ever see!My degree project will be all about taking something from china and something from England and putting them two together in an installation where I will project myself and my girlfriend on either side of the wall in a dark room and will look like we are in this virtual world eating together.The bad news is that I need roughly Œ£850 Œæto help toward buying the materials for making a Chinese roof porch to hang outside above the door on my girlfriends side so it looks like your in china!!! and then having my English style roof porch on my side so its like your in England.ŒæThe English porch won't cost much but it is just the Chinese roof I am more concerned with and I can assure anyone in the world will be able to see my making of this installation and the final outcome.Once I have this funding I will be able to order the Chinese tiles from China and then they will be manufactured and shipped within 50 days after-which I can start my construction process and will look very stunning once it is finished.Please see below the information of the cost of tiles plus shipment and a rough guide to what the roof will look like, Thank you for your time and support.

Œæ Œæ ŒæA Completed 15ft tall (4 ft. wide and 35 ft. long) stationary sculpture of two ants made of riveted sheets of metal working together to lift a flaming heart in the shape of an archway. People may walk under and around the arch that is created by the ants that will also be rgb lit, wants to visit Element 11 and needs some assistance.Œæ Œæ ŒæLast year was my first year at Element 11 the Utah Regional Burning man Festival, and we experienced something that was truly unique. We had a burn-cation, a burn where we just came to play! Very rare event for the WelDid crew, and we grew to love the uniqueness that the Utah regional had to offer. The jelly fish, the fishies, the CRAZY BURN ANYTHING VIBE!!!  We are coming back again this year (YAY!), but we want to PARTICIPATE this time! Unfortunately we do not have the personal funds to transport this sculpture and supply it with propane out to Utah and back. So the WelDid Crew is graciously asking for help so that we can rent a trailer, pay for gas hauling it, and get a 100lb propane tank to supply MAXIMUM FIRE!  We built this sculpture with the hopes that the image of ants holding a flaming heart, made by a group of neophyte äóìartistsäó (a pharmacy tech, stagehands, and tire technician) would travel around as far and wide as possible so that people may be inspired  too find what puts fire in their heart, and if they cannot do it themselves work together!!  Below is a description of the original inspiration for the project and a description of the completed sculptureŒæ Œæ Œæ The inspiration behind this piece arrived when my brother was explaining the idea of emergence as a theme to me, and his analogy of a single ant vs. a colony of ants and what they can accomplish. I was struck at that moment immediately with what type of piece I would like to attempt this year and with help this idea evolved into two ants working together holding a flaming heart as an arch way. I look at the ants working together as a natural progression of what I learned working on Prima Materia,  a project that was influenced by Carl Jungäó»s explanation of individuation, as becoming äóìaware of oneself, of oneäó»s make-up, and the way to discover oneäó»s true, inner selfäó. Creating with a large group of people on that project I developed the utmost respect and appreciation for people working together to create more advanced projects and mentalities. A good team can accomplish anything, if one can recognize and push their own skills and abilities. Thus Prima allowed me to develop my sense of community and teamwork into a heartfelt passion that I would love to express through this sculpture. Œæ Œæ ŒæThe sculpture consists of two ants that are reared up on their hind legs, holding a heart between them in a type of archway that is tall enough for people to walk under. They are made out of buffed and riveted together steel sheets, so that they will reflect the flames from the heart in a playful and interesting manner. The structure is made of high gauge steel welded together and designed to support the weight of the sculpture, and come apart at the head, thorax, and abdomen using bolts for transportation.ŒæŒæ Œæ ŒæI hope to place the sculpture in an area where people may walk under it to enter something of significance (depends on where itäó»s placed). I will also place benches around it so that people may sit and act as if they are one of the fellow ants, or ponder the community around them, while appreciating and encouraging future involvement! During the night the sculpture has flames that dance inside of the heart with the propane line running out to a box that contains the propane tank, and rgb flood lights placed inside of the sculpture that will adjust speed and color manually depending on the energy of the crowd (battery inside thorax, or easily adaptable to normal plug in wiring if available). I like very much to see pieces in multiple aspects thought out the event, lights on no flame, lights on with flame, flame only, and during the daytime so people can see the piece multiple times and not have it be the same. This will allow the piece to interact with them visually and possibly mirror how their feelings are evolving during the event, making each experience unique.  Œæ Œæ ŒæThe flame effects on this sculpture are not a poofer type effect but the playfulness and the simplicity of flame. I also think this will be a swell thing for people to take pictures under, and one of my favorite things to see after event is the continued inspiration in the community through our digital lives. I anticipate allowing many people to ponder the fire in their hearts and continue pursuing what puts it there!

"The Tao that can be spoken is not the eternal Tao The name that can be named is not the eternal name The nameless is the origin of Heaven and Earth The named is the mother of myriad things Thus, constantly without desire, one observes its essence Constantly with desire, one observes its manifestations These two emerge together but differ in name The unity is said to be the mystery Mystery of mysteries, the door to all wonder"ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Lao TzuIn the Taoist philosophy of  ancient China, Yin and Yang symbolizeŒæ the duality of the essence and manifestation from which the myriad things (i.e. everything you can name) come äóñ light/dark, masculine/feminine, sun/moon, good/evil, active/passiveäó_  yin is the side of the valley that is in shadow and yang is the side of the valley in sunlight.Œæ The Yin and Yang symbol represents the unification of the complimentary aspects (as opposed to the opposites) found within everything in the universe.Œæ For us as individuals, sometimes our yin is rising and yang setting, but then, in turn, our yang will rise and our yin will set... it is all one big cycle of rising and setting, rising and setting that goes on forever.Œæ  So, how are things going for you just now?Œæ Don't worry, it will change.The Supreme Ultimate is be a circular disk, a wall, that stands 20' H, 24' W and 7äó D. It will be constructed of 5/8" CDX Plywood screwed onto a 4x6 frame.  It will be secured with ground stakes and guy wires and stand on a platform of disintegrated granite that will allow us to burn it in place.At dawn (6 am) on Saturday, August 30th, the Supreme Ultimate will be burned in a celebration of the creation and destruction (yin and yang) of the universe and all that is, ever was and ever will be.Œæ A procession to the site will leave from Center Camp and a ceremony will be performed before the piece is ignited.The attached budget illustrates where your money needs to go.Œæ The total that I will need to make this soar is a little over $4,800 (and I still haven't figured in transportation).Œæ I am only asking $3,000 because asking for money is one of those things that is really hard for me to do and $4,800 seems like a lot... so, if we go over $3,000, Great! Let's roll!Œæ If not, I guess we will have to cut a few corners (but not to worry, it will stand, it will be beautiful and it will burn like the devil on August 29th!)Update:Dang, that is just too small to read.  Sorry. I will be happy to send you an electronic copy if you would provide me an email address.  Here are the highlights:Lumber for framing 	= $248 Plywood sheeting	= $650 Materials & Supplies		= $570 Electronics & Burn. = $3,133Total W/ Tax 		= $4,860The framing, plywood and materials are pretty straight forward, but the Electronics & Burn. sections have a few big items that you should know about.Lighting (LEDs) w/ associated electronics = $850And for the Burn:Decomposed Granite	= $1,500 This is an estimate.BM supplies this, but has not given me a price on it yet. It is used to provide the burn platform to protect the playa.Along with miscellaneous fire extinguishers, steel trash cans, scoop shovels, t-shirts = $571I have not included transportation (which should mostly be gas)Œæ = +/- $1000.I intend to haul it down in an old trailer that I have.  It will be tight, but it should do.  I still need to find a truck to pull it thoughäó_ any volunteers?And of course there will be several contingency expenses that will certainly come into play.There is much to do, and with your support, it will get done...Œæ Namaste.Rock

Trendy stores come and go . They look great when occupied with a business or tenant , but awfully meek and ugly when empty and not taking care off. Our goal is to turn this transition from not rented to rented  into a community ART project.  We choose empty store fronts and create window installations  that will enhance the overall look of the community and promote creativity . This project  will add  vibrant , colorful ARTŒæto the neighborhood by local artists like Carla Koulajian , Andre Miripolsky, Raton, Todd Williamson, Christine Zion, Joe Schmelzer, Matt Borkowski  and Jonathan D Schulte.The artists will be assigned to empty stores available, of which the front windows will be transformed into a public ART installation within 5 days .  Once completed , each store front is going to be photographed and highlighted in an exhibition this fall.WHERE:Trendy shopping areas in Los Angeles are NOT losing its cachet, they are simply in transition to become even more beautiful. Even though a lot of the stores are vacant, despite drastic rent reductions, it sometimes does look a little meek around town , realizing that all the glamorous stores have either closed or moved and have left behind a rather "ugly" promenade of empty store fronts .ŒæIn order to make this transition a bit more exciting , ARTSHOP has teamed up with local commercial real estate agents and landlords , and is starting to to use empty store fronts for ART displays until a new renters have signed a new lease .ŒæEveryone benefits from it :- Provides an exciting new way to market vacant properties to potential tenants- Increases pedestrian traffic to surrounding busainess- Showcases vacant retail spaces in new ways, inspiring new users- allows artists to showcase their work to exhibit their work- Offers emerging artists the oppurtunity to exhibit their work- Increases the presence of ART in the communityVery soon more ART will come to your neighborhood .ŒæP.S.:ŒæBudget:City Permit Fees ( based on 5 stores @ $820 per store/TBD): $4,100Installation + Transportation : $1,275ŒæCampaign Boost + Promotion:$150ŒæMaterial for Installations:$500ŒæMisc Expenses ( lights etc):$150Kickstarter/Amazon Service charge / 5%: $325TOTAL: $6,500Thank you for your time and we hope that you will be able to support this project .ŒæUlrik Neumann

Imagine yourself for a moment, discovering the followingäó_You struggle to comprehend exactly what you're seeing from a distance. Curiosity beckons and you approach, but the architecture is complex and hard to decipher. It's big, that much you know. It seems to be a geodesic dome, of which you've seen many. Nay, it seems to be several domes, one towering above the others, which surround their greater counterpart at it's outer edge, their circumferences touching. The struts of the domes are black, and the whole thing reminds you of a gothic spiderweb, mildly sinister in appearance. There is no skin on the structure, and you can see people inside. They're congregated in the center, sitting on couches and benches, or reclined around low tables at the periphery. While it isn't quite apparent what exactly you're seeing, there seems to be a flat plane of flame swirling and morphing about towards the peak of the dome, and a mysterious orange glow illuminates the interior space. Suddenly and without warning, bursts of fire erupt from the peaks of several of the smaller hemispheres. Flame shoots upwards forcefully and at random, like an erratic heartbeat. These spurts are soon dwarfed by the central dome's respective display, a towering burst of fury illuminating the landscape around for quite some distance. You can feel the heat on your face. Enraptured now, you quickly approach, a rare sense of wonder welling up inside you.Incendia, an overhead sign reads, the Arabesque characters glowing an ominous shade of red as it keeps watch over the doorway below. Svelte burgundy ropes reminiscent of an old opera house funnel you inwards and you step inside, and are promptly greeted by a smiling woman standing at a short podium. She smiles at you, her smoky eyes lighting up at the sight of the awe on your face. 30 seconds ago, you would've considered her minimal attire quite unprotected against the crisp fall air, but now that youäó»ve crossed the threshold into Incendia, you too feel and are illuminated by the radiant glow emanating from above, and her coordinated, yet informal uniform does not seem so unreasonable. 'Welcome to Incendia', she chimes, sweeping her arm in an arc as if to present the scene. 'Feel free to roam as you wish, there's plenty to discover. If I see that you've settled in at a table, I'll bring you a menu. We serve a fine selection of ambrosial, non-alcoholic beverages, both hot and cold, and also offer some exquisite and unique light hor d'oeuvres. Let me or know if you need anything!'It's a struggle to take another step forward however, as you've not yet fully processed what you see before you. In the center of the room sits a pentagonal bar, it's five vertices oriented in line with the peripheral domes surrounding this main room. The elegance of the geometry is apparent now; each smaller dome connects to this central chamber via an arched doorway, and you can see people in each room. Some sit at tables, others stand admiring central sculptures, still others lounge amongst pillows, lazily smoking hookahs.It's then that you notice the source of the airy, yet rhythmic music that permeates Incendia. Across from the main entrance hovers an elevated perch, from which a DJ deftly intertwines exotic, smoky melodies whilst the crowds mingle below, and you give a silent nod in thanks; the music complements the mood of Incendia perfectly.You approach the bar.The bartender greets you with a smile as he strains a colorful mixture into a short glass, and tops it with a sprig of mint. His attire also seems to be carefully coordinated with the motif of Incendia. You immediately notice the bar top; it's mirrored finish reflects light perfectly, and as you hover over it you look beyond your own reflection into what may be the most unique fire effect you have ever seen. Turning now above and arching your back, you gaze at the full majesty of Incendia. 15 feet above your head swirls a ceiling of undulating, pulsing flame. You've never seen anything quite like it before, and it is absolutely spellbinding. Almost directly under center now, you experience the full force of it's radiant capability, not dissimilar to that of the equatorial sun. You've never seen flame move in this way, undulating slowly, wafting against the amorphous ceiling, which blends seamlessly into the night sky above. Further analyzing, it seems that the bulk of the flame emanates from a central point. It spurts downward sporadically, like some twisted inverse cousin of a courtyard water fountain, before dispersing in every direction in a chaotic, meandering path. You look back down to see the bartender grinning at you. He slides a box across the bar, in your direction. On it's top is a dizzying bank of switches, illuminated buttons and symbols. The bartender leans in and extending an index finger, presses a centrally-positioned red button, . Above you, the ceiling roars, and immediately you feel a wave of heat blast your face. He releases the button, and as quickly as it came, the flame dissipates. He presses more buttons, and blasts of flame shoot upwards from the peaks of the peripheral domes around you. You realize now the root of his sly grin, and eagerly begin to push buttons yourself, unleashing a cacophony of radiant bursts in and around Incendia. The bartender quickly cuts you off before you become drunk with power, and slides a colorful cocktail over in place of the omnipotent box. Turning back around to find your friends, you begin to notice the finer details of the space, which had gone unnoticed previously. Ornate lamps jut out from the arching struts of the dome, dim light flickering through their frosted panes. You count five; a number that seems to be a recurring motif in Incendia. Beneath, atop pentagonal tables, sit silver candelabras adorned with tall candles, wax dripping down languidly to meet the tablecloth below. The burgundy fabric's shimmer seems to adopt an otherworldly depth beneath the rolling glow of the fire. Silver tassel festoons the edges of the tablecloth, contrasting elegantly with the matte black floor. The benches surrounding these tables are tailored similarly, and people idle all around, propped up on tasseled cushions, sipping their respective cocktails.Your friends call to you from the entranceway of an adjoining room, beckoning you to follow. Weaving your way between the tables and benches, you make your way to the arched portal and stare in amazementäó_.Weäó»re not going to give away ALL the secrets of Incendia. You'll have to see it with your own eyes to uncover the rest. The result of countless hours spent simmering, brooding, and scheming, we are ready to make this concept a reality. No detail will be spared, and nary an eventuality has gone unconsidered._____________________________________________________________Incendia arose from humble beginnings. Its progression tells the story of a concept ever-expanding in breadth and scope.The essence of Incendia lies in a unique flame effect near it's zenith. By piping propane gas along the aluminum trusses of it's geodesic frame, and releasing it below the steel ceiling, a mesmerizing, undulating plane of fire is unleashed. It casts a warm, illuminating glow upon the inhabitants below, and provides an unparalleled ambience for gatherings large and small.ŒæThis exquisite and hypnotic effect was discovered whilst toying around one day with small gas-fed pedestals created from the bases of salvaged propane tanks. When inverted, the parabolic bowl cupped the flame and prevented it from rising into the sky; and so the concept was born. We attached one of these bowls to the peak of a geodesic dome in early 2013, and soon thereafter, the show hit the road. Featured at myriad small events and art festivals in the summer and fall of 2013, the installation evolved with each deployment. It took on a life of it's own, yet eventually no more could be added to the humble, 12' wide dome.Over the past winter, we creators brainstormed and schemed a way to go bigger. Logistical hurdles arose with an increase in scale, but we have overcome. The project also adopted a fundamental motif when lead designer Cory Glenn visited Morocco for several weeks in February. This trip directly resulted in many of the architectural elements and interior design features visible in today's most recent permutation of Incendia.The last four months have been spent tirelessly researching, designing, planning, and hammering to bring you the 20' diameter, 10' tall geodesic dome installation you see in the video above. We're nowhere near stopping in our ascension of scale, but now we need your help.ŒæOur goal is to build a total of five 20' diameter domes, and orient them radially around one mammoth, 50' diameter geodesic hemisphere, to be connected via shared archways as depicted in the model shown in the video. Each 20' diameter dome will feature a different art piece in it's center, or be available to host tables and chairs for catered events. We seek to make this comprehensive configurationŒædeployable for a wide range of events, from music festivals, art shows, and street fares, to wedding receptions, private soirees, and corporate conventions. We'll be able to host a stage, or a raised DJ booth. The bar can be relocated to a peripheral dome when hosting concerts in the center space. This August, we'll utilize the domes as shade structures replete with misting jets, at an outdoor music festival in downtown Atlanta, Georgia. Incendia can truly be a dynamic, adaptive platform suitable for use in myriad different scenarios.We seek funding for Incendia in the amount of $10,000. Please help us accomplish this incredible, passion-fueled endeavor! We believe it's an installation without limit, and with your help, we can realize this incredible installation.Feel free to contact us if you'd like to see other installations designed and constructed by the creators. We've built some cool stuff. If you're interested in booking Incendia for an event outside our geographically-constrained reward area, we're very flexible and willing to go the distance!Œæ

No Land, No CultureŒæA Vision of America as a Holy PlaceI am an artist, part Native American and part Scottish.  My great grandmother was full blood Cherokee.  She was Lucy Guntharp.  For the last 20 years I have painted murals.  I wasnäó»t aware of my Native heritage until I was an adult.  I was always, never the less, always interested in Native Culture.ŒæŒæAs an artist I want to create a cultural bridge between the first indigenous peoples of this land we walk on and all the rest of us who walk on it, not realizing the sacredness of this land, particular sites and the earth energy that radiates through to us.  We all stand on the same sacred earth and are manifestations of the spirit it emanates.ŒæNative peoples on this land made monuments to the sacredness of the land or landscape.  Sacred forts, rock art, circular embankments often facing a river bend or a sacred site.  A place of Spiritual practice.The Native model offers what constitutes a spiritual relationship to the Land. Seeing this model may encourage us to reflect on our own traditions and äóìcultivateäó a sense of the Scared Land or a least a sense of respect. This seems most important at a time when our earth is ecologically threatened and might also serve as a common thread to unify our diverse cultures.	In regards to these concepts: ŒæI have created the idea of an art educational collaboration or äóìCultural Bridgeäó between Non-Natives and the Native American Communities to help in the creation of äóìMural Spirit Dwellings.äó This involves the mentoring of Native and non-Native youth, as well as with the advice and help of Native elders, Artists, Museum Curators, Art collectors and others, to come up with designs, stories, history etc., to aid in a joint community effort to memorialize indigenous culture of the localappropriate land areas with various art installations. 	These äóìSpirit Dwellingsäó are sculptural and architectural, externally. On the inside there are plastered clay walls and fiber on which are painted murals and various other art works with a more traditional and earthy flavor. The design of the structures incorporate Native concepts and style put in a contemporary vein. The murals depict the history or story of the land where the äóìdwellingäó is placed. These dwellings can be both permanent for a specific location to memorialize an area and history or can be temporary and portable for display at various locations or events. The installations are large enough to walk through or sit and contemplate the art inside, but occupy a minimum of space. The dwellings are specific to that part of America and to Tribe.ŒæMy goal is to establish a formal relationship with various museums, art and education centers, corporations and organizations, to help fund this educational art project. To help in service to the community by involving young people interested in Native History and Culture as well as teaching them how to create Public Art of this magnitude and legitimacy. The various trades and art skills necessary to accomplish the project would involve: concept, design, drawing, painting, airbrushing, plastering, ceramics, fabrication and installation.This project of course would be done with the approval, involvement, respect and consultation of the Native Community.	As a final result of this awareness of our spiritual attachment to the Land it would not be to far a stretch to imagine a Green Haven, particularly on the Reservations, were Technology could meet with Tradition with Œæa respect for the land to create: clean energy, housing, medicine, farming, food resources and even economy, with an emphasis on what would be best for Mother Earth.

My plan is to create an artwork installation. My vision is to transform the perception of space, by filling the space occupied by the air between my mattress and my duvet, with me, asleep.The artwork itself will be represented in a black and white digital photo for all to see. In order for this artwork to be possible, I have calculated a small initial outlay will be required. This will likely be spent on a relaxing meal out for my wife and I to "destress". If I go over my target, additional money will be invested into additional relaxing experiences, as well as entertainment for my baby in the hope that he will sleep for long enough for me to successfully complete my composition of this installation.

Revolution in Ukraine has changed our lives forever and artists and civil activists are telling the story of what happened in Kyiv from November 2013-present.We are rebuilding the Free Mikrofon Building and Museum inside a Museum in Kyiv.We have been given free a space by the Museum of Books at the Lavra Heritage Site for the exhibition 'Freedom Mikrofon' until August 8th 2014. after this time we are looking for a place to put the Museum and Free Mikrofon Stage.In this exhibition we are showing new artworks by artist activists filmmakers and documenters whose work was is inspired by this revolution in Ukraine. Also on display will be genuine artifacts that were used by Ukrainian protestors during battles in Kyiv.  This is a great opportunity to showcase the installation, protect the artifacts and display the beautiful photographs and films. This exhibition will tell the stories of the real people of Maidan. Please take this opportunity to be a part of Ukrainian history, to touch the famous barricades and be part of Ukraine's efforts to be a better country and to help the people to live a normal life free of fear from police, government and corrupt systems.Save a small piece of the Maidan protest camp forever and help Ukraine's Path to freedom and democracyThis project is dedicated to those that died on the barricades and for our future generation of lovers of freedom and democracy.

Œæ'The Journey' is a BIG BLUE QUESTION MARK which will appear in the Grassmarket, Edinburgh for the Fringe Festival. Everyone who wants to join in writes on a small wooden house the answer to the questions 'Where do you come from? What do you think of as home? Where are your roots? Then you can walk, dance, run along the question mark until you get to the end of your journey. Then you write something about your life which you can share with others. Over 5,000 people took part in my last project: 'The Big Book' and sharing ideas with so many people is amazing. What answers will this project bring? We want it to be free for everyone, so I just need a little support to take it to the Festival. The costs are simple - transport, materials, equipment & publicity. All contributions however small are welcome.

As you walk up to the project a since of what awaits is clear, the fence that surrounds the installation has been made out of riffles, guns, and grenades.The Single gate that leads into the installation is itself made out of metal salvaged from weapons that were melted down.The wordsŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ "Why do we kill in the name of..."Within awaits a grave yard of guns and Bomb, and what start to become clear is that the decommissioned bombs are covered and filled with the pictures and names, and are laid out in the shape of a large question mark.There are 196 empty bombs, one for every country and territory in the world, and everyone of them has been filled and covered by having people from around the world send in names and photos of loved ones that have been lost to violence.My goal for this project is to hopefully help to end violence, by showing not just the faces and names of those that have be lost because of it, but also the number of people that have been lost to violence, this is a memorial to Humanity, rather then a war monument. I want to people see that violence hurts everyone equally, and that we do not have a chance to create a better world unless we unite and stop trying to solve our differences through violence and aggression, but rather to embrace those differences with acceptance, and to celebrate the beauty of life, celebrate that we are different, and to live in a world where those difference are used to grow and not to destroy.It is my hope that this will be one of the most successful if not the first international art project, with people from around the world contributing their photos, names, and stories for us all to see and share, something that we can all call ours.The reason that I have chosen Berlin, Germany as the first location of the installation is that I feel that it is a great example of a place that has been shaped by war, violence, and the efforts to overcome the difference that once separated not only a country but neighbors, friends, and even family.I want the installation to be in a place where the message will is back lit with historical significance, to help emphasis the importance of the meaning behind it.I thank everyone that takes interest in my project, and who helps me to be able to make this dream of mine a reality.

We are living in the most pivotal moment in human history as our world is in deep decline on so many critical levels äóñ humanely, socially, environmentally, politically and financially. If humanity is to survive and thrive, we must burn down the old destructive belief systems within, and give birth to a new global mindset and awaken on a mass scale. Let's unify to kickstart humanity into a new way of being by first kickstarting this symbolic and meaningful sculpture.ŒæäóìOur mission here is to develop the courage to change the worldäó_Œæthe crisis is coming..." Œæäóñ Larry HarveyThe Rise of Humanity is a 20äó»x 20äó» mirror-polished stainless steel sculpture of a Phoenix, symbolizing a unifying call to individual and collective awakening.ŒæShe represents the courage, unity and shared vision required to go through the overwhelming transformational death and rebirth process humanity is experiencing äóñ burning down an archaic, fear-based consciousness and rising into a love-based consciousness of oneness.ŒæäóìHuman salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted.äó Œæäóñ Martin Luther King, Jr.More than a work of art, sheŒæinspires an awakening where we are free from the trappings of the material world, enabling us to remember what it means to be human and a part of something bigger than ourselves while empowering us to have a positive impact in, and on our world äóñ Awaken Inside, Reclaim the Outside.äóìDonäó»t just set the desert on fire, set the world on fire.äó Œæäóñ The Rise of HumanityWe love you.ŒæWe thank you. Weäó»re inspired by you.As the Man Burns, Together We Rise...REWARDS //ŒæORIGINAL DESIGNS...AS GOLDEN AS A PLAYA SUNRISE, these special versions are screened with a stunning gold foil heat transfer process // Shine your light wherever you go // Same premium fabrics and cuts // Go big and go gold // Made in Los Angeles

I would like to open my own salon, but life has taught me to take baby steps & to attend to every detail when it comes to things that really matter to me. ŒæSince I can remember, art and painting in particular have been passions of mine. I've done nails for fun for over a decade, and for the last two years I've worked from home as my own apprentice, taking customers in the hopes of saving up for nail tech certification classes. As a young woman and recent college graduate, I understand the power of a nice manicure, because the nice humyn who compliments your claws can sometimes be the one who recommends you for the job, or who gives you the extra boost of confidence you need to land it yourself. I serve everyone without judgement - kings, queens, ladies, gents, little ones, and even grandma and grandpa. ŒæI love what I do, and I'm good at it. ŒæThis project is centered around showing off what I have to offer artistically, so all I'm asking for is: funding for supplies (I'm starting with nothing but my talent and 2 hands here), and shipping. ŒæThrough these custom press-ons I hope to show - rather than simply tell - those who believe in me that they are investing in something bigger. All proceeds from initial sales will go first towards backer rewards, and then towards my certification and salon. The nail business is booming, and so are my designs. ŒæDon't miss out!

They look great when occupied with a business or tenant , but awfullyŒæmeek and ugly when empty and not taking care off.ŒæFor three month we will turn this transition from not rented to rented Œæinto a community ART project. Note: The controller in this video was only for test purposes and is not the final product. Final look of the controller is smaller, easier to setup, and better contained. It's also weather proof.As the thousands of people who attend music festivals like Bass Coast and Shambhala will tell you, there's something magical about the festival experience. There's this really interesting culture and an atmosphere that just seems to appear out of thing air. This art project was, in part, my way of wanting to give back and add to that incredible experience.I wanted this installation to be immersive - something you want to pause for a moment to really take in. Each mushroom independently runs it's own function to determine the fade effect every time it lights up. This causes the mushroom field to dance and flicker with life. You think you start to see a pattern, order in the chaos, but it's just a trick of the mind.The installation was designed to be modular. This is for two reasons. A modular installation allows versatility - it can be installed spread out along a pathway, or bunched together in one large field. But the modular design was also one though about with YOU in mind! We wanted to give Kickstarter backers the chance to keep a piece of the installation for your very own. We think it's a pretty cool idea and we hope you'd like to take home a patch of your own.Each patch consists of 32 mushrooms, connecting wire, and a controller that runs off a 6V lantern battery, or a wall plug power adapter. How you power your patch is ultimately up to you. We recommend planting them somewhere earthy - somewhere you won't have to mow over. Lawn-mowing your mushrooms is not generally recommended...If you don't want to keep a patch and you just want to donate we greatly appreciate your support. We hope to see you at Tall Tree, Bass Coast, and any other festivals we happen to line up last-minute this season.ŒæStay safe and happy festivaling.

In Boulder, Colorado a group of visionary spirits have come together with a collective mission: The Temple Project, artful space for all to enjoy. Our current expression, The Lotus Temple, is a sacred geometric structure, a gentle sanctuary made of sticks, silks and string. Six white silk Lotus domes surround a crowning shade structure, featuring a 70' handwoven dream catcher. Portable, lightweight andŒæballistic, theŒæLotus Temple is designed to be a safe retreat from any storm. ŒæThe Lotus Temple is a space to find the peaceful place inside yourself. A place to play, to dance, to learn, and to dream. A place to share your gifts and experience the gifts of others. A place to grow, a place to love, and a place to be.ŒæWe've been hard at work sowing the seeds for The Temple Project, and now we're asking for your help. We intend to bring our Lotus Temple on the road to share our creation with the world. We seek to build temples at festivals, farmer's markets, schools, and in public parks. We hope to provide opportunities for all to share inŒætheŒæjoy that The Temple Project hasŒæbrought to us.ŒæWhat we need:First, we need a trailer for transportation. We wantŒætoŒæmake The Temple Project mobile and universal. We're thinking a 12' by 6' trailer will be sufficient. We anticipate this cost at around $2,500.Next, we need some new material to improve our structure and make it weather proof. The Lotus Temple, as it stands today, uses aerial silk as its shell and is built right on the earth. While the silk is beautiful, it is not protective during inclement weather, and while we love getting down in the dirt, we want to be able to host outdoor yoga on any terrain. We'll need about $2,000 for waterproof fabric for our architect Sai to sew into bright white temple shells, and another $2000 to build a portable and solid bamboo flooring system to keep things light and comfortable, anywhere we go.ŒæWe'd like to illuminate the temple at night. We're looking for solar powered LED lights. We hope to keep this cost under $2,000.ŒæWe're looking forward to a season of sharing the temple at local and international transformational festivals, so we're going to need some new shocks for our vanimal, gas money, and organic veggies for our crew. We'd like to be able to share this space with as many hearts as possible. That means building The Lotus Temple at Sonic Bloom in Southpark, Co. Then we'll be traveling to British Columbia to build sacred space at Luminosity Gathering and Bass Coast Festival, where our temple will be used for meditation, movement, workshop space and renegade sound healing. After that we'll be high tailing it back to Colorado to build with our family and friends at Arise Festival at Sunrise Ranch Retreat Center in Loveland, CO. After Arise we'll head west toward Black Rock City, with ambitions of creating the ultimate oasis at Burning Man: The Water Temple; a steam shower for meditation, hygiene and relaxation, a place to recognize the principles behind our resources and to pay homage to the Earth's most precious gift to us, water. We plan to allot around $3,000 to travel expenses for our team.ŒæWe'd like to build a custom sound system. We will utilize the remainder ofŒæfunding to create a 360 degree sound seal within the temple. Sound therapy is a tool for meditation as well as movement. We host workshop presenters, musicians, and healers as a venue for healing transformation through sound. We will incorporate evolving technology with our architect Sai's mandalic designs, for an all original top-tier Templar sound experience. We anticipate a cost of around $5,000 for our custom sound system.ŒæEvery little bit helps, offer a gift for everyone to share. We dedicate this temple for the benefit of all beings.ŒæWhat do you get?no two are the same.ŒæArtifacts of the future, transcending the game.ŒæA token of chance, and meant to be shared, in universal ascension not one will be spared.ŒæAcknowledge potential of your unique hue, unlock your own temple, the magic is true.ŒæThe equation is simple, a connection to source, here to remind you of your infinite force.Primordial patterns carved into wood, conducting knowledge and power in all that is good.ŒæGeometric in nature, as wearable art, a figurative bridge from solar plexus to heart.ŒæLet fate lead your way, may the stars be a sign that in love and with gratitude,Œæit is time to align.ŒæAn original Galactic Key, laser cut from repurposed mandala wood. My work as a practice examines the privileged myths and images of our Australian society and their treatment in contemporary society. In this particular installation, I discuss the implications of Virtual Reality as a means to commodify public spaces for mass consumption for the almost religious space of the Australian Beach that has so far resisted Capitalist assimilation. With Virtual Reality, there is a potential to create idealistically superior beaches that subsume their natural counter-parts that I suggest by juxtaposing this film of water with the physical sand it is projected onto.Your pledged money will go towards the purchase of two high quality projectors (about $5,000 each), their mounts, and renting an exhibition space for two or three weeks.Œæ Ideally, I am looking to hire a space at the Brand X space at Central Park (about $1,200 a week) so that the installation can not only be a provocative socio-political polemic but also an enjoyable place to bring the creative community of Sydney together for a good time! Oh, and none of your pledges will be going towards the opening night refreshments.. drinks are on me!

Nuestro video en espaí±ol (our video in spanish)Notre video en franí_aisŒæ(our video in french):Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæøÇø_™ˆø¿ ø_™‹™€™‹™_øÂ øÂø_™‹ø_ø±øÂ™_ø© (our video in arabic)We aim to share our passion in audio production with music and audio enthusiasts everywhere! We are from the Australia, Lebanon, Jordan and the US!We come from various parts of the world, with diverse cultures and backgrounds which include Sound engineering, Music production, 3D Animation, Design, and Visual effects.ŒæWith beyC's project, we have come together with one goal in mind: make audio and music production training simple, practical, accessible, and affordable to everyone.We believe that anyone who is interested in audio or music production should have access to easy and simple hands-on training regardless of previous knowledge or background.We don't want our training materials to be like any of the ones that are currently available on the market.No monthly, yearly, daily, weekly or fortnightly membership fees.We want to create training video materials that are accessible via Smart Phones and Tablets as well as desktop computers.If you have more than one device, no need to worry. You will be able to access and watch your purchased video packages from any device you own without having to buy the packages again.At this point, only one thing is missing: your support!ŒæWe want to create a unique iPhone|iPad App followed by an Android version that will give you access to video training packages that are tailored for novice hobbyists, semi-pro, and pro people.The beauty and uniqueness about these training packages is that you will learn how to make practical projects with professional audio software while enjoying the process!ŒæWe promise not to take you into boring or outdated concepts that aren't directly relevant to what you want to achieve.With every training package, you will be doing real world practical projects.You will be able to choose from a wide variety of projects.Here is an idea about the type of projects that we are preparing:You will be using Audio and Music production software to complete these projects like: Pro Tools, Ableton Live, Logic Pro, Melodyne and Reason.ŒæPlus, iPad Applications like: Figure, GarageBand and iMaschine ...We know what you're thinking!"Oh God! Pro Tools and all that stuff? aren't these programs for professional sound engineers only?"ŒæNo, don't freak out! :)ŒæIt's really all about the way we teach you how to do things.Remember? that's what this project is all about after all!We want to teach you how to make your music and create your sounds in a simple and fun way.In no time, you will be able to understand what all these knobs, faders, buttons, figures and shapes are all about.Just bring your passion and creativity to the mix and let us deal with the rest!Besides developing the main video training packages App, we are going to release as well our own "beyC design" three handy music utility Apps that will accompany you during your music journey:)Phase one: We will need till December 2012 for the first phase of the project to go live.ŒæThe first release of the App will support both iPhone and iPad with three video training packages (in English) and of course the additional three utility Apps:Phase two: We will be releasing another three packages (in English) by May 2013.The process of developing a world class App involves numerous steps that are expensive. Our project needs in fact a budget of $44.000.ŒæBecause we really want this project to happen, we are investing $20.000Œæourselves, and are looking to raise the remaining $24.000 to make the project possible.Your financial backing is essential for the launching and success of this project. By backing the beyC project, you will become part of this exciting and unique opportunity to bring audio and music production to you and to everyone!We will first be ecstatically happy:))) and of course will have more surprises for you!More platforms,Œæmore languages, and of course more packages:

The adventure begins while working the Rangoon run on a tramp steamer we picked a castaway up from the water.Œæ Heäó»d been drifting for weeks.Œæ A thousand miles outside the shipping lanes his ship had run aground on an uncharted island hidden in deep fog.Œæ Before he died he gave me a mapäó_the sole surviving record of a primitive world. A place thought to exist only in myth.ŒæUntil nowäó_.ŒæThe Shipwreck Tiki Lounge has been a staple at Burning Man since 2007, the last 3 years, located on the highly visible, prime real estate of the Esplanade.Shipwreck Tiki Lounge takes pride in bringing to the Burn an old school Tiki experience straight out of the fiftyäó»s and sixtyäó»s.Œæ Our theme camps have been notable for their shady palm trees, flaming Tiki totems and the infamous Shipwreck bar. The Shipwrecked Tiki Lounge is an island oasis in theŒæ Black rock city desert in Nevada. The ship and its captain & crew of volunteers bring together imagination & creativity.Œæ Rallying a community of artists, designers, storytellers, actors, dancers, project managers, to work togetherŒæ to create & share a unique art experience at Burning Man.Œæ But we need your help to keep it going. For 2012 we've started building the Shipwrecked Tiki Lounge on a large 45' shipping container. This container is the most functional and economical way to execute our project. It will beŒæ delivered and returned after the event to our Black Rock City site with all of our supplies, materials at a cost of $2,000 round trip. Other costs are our building materials. As we are all volunteers, and have utilized donated or 2nd use supplies as much as possible, but some supplies we must purchase such as the shipping container & its delivery, air conditioner, a/v needs, generators, lumber, tiki decor, lighting for lounge and the islands shipwrecked area for which the lounge centered.The idea or vision,Œæ is forŒæ you- our guests, to feel as if you have stumbled ( hot and thirsty ) upon a mirage of aŒæ lush Tiki  Island paradise lost in time. Each group of 20 guests gets a 30 min Tiki Show Experience inside the Lounge and all guests are free to Explore the island &Œæ relax under shady palms trees, in a hammock, mingle with our beautiful island natives, or swap goods with our rum runners,Œæ but yer warned.... look out for pirates & sirens searching for booty. You're our guests on each 30 min voyage to explore the Shipwrecked Tiki Lounge and all the magic it has to offer you. Because space is limited and we will be running the lounge all day and night, we need to have all hand on deck and in order to do this......we need help from you.Who are you? You are a open minded adventurer, a person who seeks excitement, and the thrill of the unknown. You are also a visionary, a giver, a friend and a patron orŒæ contributor of the Burning man 2012 festival- or a friend of someone who is going. You are looking to help a community art project whether from afar or hands on with your support or contribution. Whether its $10 for your name on the plank or $1,000 for a private group Tiki Lounge event,Œæ it all helps & goes straight toŒæ the costs of the project, its success and completion. We will have all contributors -which we appreciate so much, thank you! Immortalized by displaying their playa names or camp on the planks of driftwood which the bar is decorated with from. From there you can go up, or get a group together and have a private Tiki event.Œæ  Thank you so much for visiting our Kickstarter, and for any help you can give us, we appreciate you reading about our project and look forward to coming back with more stories to tell and more adventures to come.....The Crew of the Shipwreck Tiki LoungeŒæ more info and you can Like us on Facebook at Shipwreck Tiki Lounge :)
