Based on a true story about a man in mental health recovery looking back on his life of abuse & neglect while finding his place in life, the film is told in poetry, music and narration and not only looks at the life of Mike Corey but will also look on topics such as (Stigma on all sides, The fear and joy of recovery, The Judgments people have of mental illness and the Judgments those with MI have of others and much more)Five years ago Mike Corey began writing his album "Darkness & Light " based on the events of his own life. From abandonment by his family as a young boy, Living on the streets as a teen slipping through the cracks of the system, while living with mental illness and using street drugs as a way to escape his reality but then finding his way off the drugs & streets and finding people along the way to take him in and show him the love,compassion and beauty and the escape that is music.... but then in his 20's he suffered a mental breakdown and became a total recluse for 9 straight years but was finally forced to come out and to look at his past, finding a love within all the madness that had always been there and finally reaching out for professional help to begin the process of healing from the past and learning of his and his family's mental differences......ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ ^:Mike Corey's - Mind So Broken^As Mike continued his journey toward healing and living a life he loved and always wanted a few things came about and people started to really enjoy his writing and voice,as he was promoting his album via Facebook as can be seen in his official greeting ......Thanks for the friendship I'm a singer song writer. My songs are about my struggles before recovery. I have also written songs for  Heidi Carabine's titled "Hear their voices" also forPatricia Hardinn "Walk For Their Freedom" both for their son's and "Simply Poetry" for Robert Sobota-Tulip's online radio show which features many of my other songs as well as my songs that I perform in the stars of light theater troupe an Illinois united way award winning group for volunteer group of the year 2011 if you have any questions feel free to ask again thanks Stay Safehttp://www.reverbnation.com/mikecorey Or check me out on your mobile device athttp://www.reverbnation.com/mobile-app/23359/mikecorey And videos at:http://www.youtube.com/user/MikeCoreyRecovaryAlso during these five years Mike and his long time fellow Tech engineer /musician and friend Lenny Cowart were hired to do some local commercials and even a song for a local slasher film "Ramond did it" the song was shot down but one of Mike's songs he made under a previous name was picked up for the film instead. After the experience in the B-film industry Mike and Lenny decided they wanted to make a film themselves...but what were they going to make? ideas were being talked about for a year or so while Mike was recording his solo album.Just him,his guitar and his own words from the heart,during that time it came to Mike to make a film based on his life and his album told in poetry and song showing the healing process and coming to terms with his own mental issues.... Mike then called up Lenny and they began to work on a video Mike asked his son Dakota Corey to play his teenage self and his step daughter Amethyst Love "who has worked at the local independent film company Plastic Age Productions since the age of 5" if she would like to play off screen parts, she humbly agreed (provided she got an on screen part at some time as well). Mike and Lenny began to record and edit the film but soon realized that they did not have the equipment to do what they were striving for and did not have the funds to finish the project. So they did what they could with what they had. MIke asked Lenny to overlay some guitar work on the poetry making the short film a bit smoother and after working for about 60 hours they had the promo video to help raise money. Mike then asked me Angela Lingelbach "who has helped support his projects for the last 5 years" if i would help him raise the money for this project. so here we are :)"At this point most everyone listed below are doing multiple tasks in the film and most are doing it for food, the love of the story and the love of independent art"Mike CoreyAngela LingelbachSam McpeakDakota Corey Lenny CowartTracey Schock Cody DuSavageJim Wooldridge And one of the State lines finest Stephen F. Vrtol IIIInterview With Mr. Vrtol...And I am Proud to announce that the local rock band 4PLAYŒæ Chicago lands Stacie CrawfordDonna PittsNeva DeforgeRon Holm

WHAT AM I DOING - The goal here on KickStarter is to raise the money necessary to reproduce my black and white illustrations on regulatory speed limit signs just like those speed limit signs found along U.S. city streets. The äóìSpeed Limit Collection - 001äó signs produced will be a limited edition run, where each sign manufactured will be signed, and numbered by myself the artist.WHAT THIS MEANS TO YOU  - By supporting me and pledging to my project I am opening up the first signs of the limited edition run, to be purchased through this KickStarter campaign. This means you will receive a unique speed limit sign, or signs depending upon your pledge level, allowing the KickStarter supporter to have received their sign/signs at a lower pre-order price before the remaining signs are officially released. I have also created lower pledge levels where KickStarter supporters can get the cool illustrations either as a postcard or 18äóx24äó print. Finally for those that want something completely original I will hand paintŒæan original black enamel painting of the vehicle of your choice, on a 18"x24" U.S. regulatory speed limit sign.ABOUT THE SIGNS - All of the signs produced in this limited edition run, will be screen printed on .080 aluminum, with an engineer grade reflective surface. The signs will be cut, rounded, and drilled to U.S. 18äóx24äó regulatory speed limits sign specifications, and will be produced by a shop experienced in producing DOT approved regulatory street signs. Each sign will be inspected by myself and will be signed and numbered. The first 175 Signs are reserved exclusively for this KickStarter campaignPLEDGE LEVELSThanks for taking the time to check-out my project.With Regards,Ryan Curtis For press inquiries, please contact us. Follow Ryan/SIN Customs on Twitter and on Facebook.Œæ And check more of Ryan's art at HotRodCarArt.com

Hi.  My name is OJ Dawoodi (not to be confused with the other OJ äóñ I get that a lot).  I have been a DJ since 1983.  Iäó»ve also have been drawing, painting or coloring since I remember.  For the last 3 decades, Iäó»ve been playing music on vinyl records to entertain the masses.  As time has passed and technology has changed the DJ game, I have been fortunate enough to be able to continue using vinyl to play my music by way of software and hardware from Serato Scratch LIVE.  This system allows me (and thousands of other DJs) to store all the music on a laptop and still use records that have a digital timecode to control those songs via the hardware.  Hereäó»s what it looks like:What this has done is turned the once warm, wonderful medium into a cold, calculating mistress.  This saddens a lot of us music lovers.  My projectäó»s goal is to rescue some of these pieces of vinyl from the fate of playing a digital tone for the rest of their lives and turn them into something that has love and warmth imbibed back into them.Œæ To accomplish this, I'm asking for your help.Œæ In return, you can get some of my work sent to you.Œæ Also, the pledge amounts will go towards funding future projects along the same lines.Œæ I thank you VERY much for reading.Œæ For your viewing pleasure, my humble dining room... err... I mean, studio!Œæ  Here is where the magic happens:The projectsäó_IT'S MUSIC TIMEBy taking a record and turning it into a clock, I would like to give a home and purpose to a rescued piece of vinyl.  All clocks will be hand-cut, shaped and assembled from a black Scratch LIVE control record. They will come beautifully mounted on a desktop stand and will have an optional wall-mount hook on the back.Œæ The clock face measures 6" x 8" and it runs on one AA battery.WILD ABOUT MUSICFor this part of the project, I take a clear (translucent) control record and hand-paint one of four animal print designs on the back side in reverse order.  The result: the front side will show a really neat design that can be either played on a Scratch LIVE compatible DJ setup or hung up and displayed.  Places like Michaeläó»s craft supply or Aaron Brothers sell shadow box frames for displaying 12äó LPs that these look amazing in.  Use your own creativity to display these rescued records.  There are 4 designs that I have settled on to choose from.  Keep in mind that the following pictures include mockups and each of the hand-painted designs will look slightly different.OK.Œæ That's pretty much it.Œæ If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask me.Œæ You can reach me on my facebook page http://facebook.com/djoj1, on twitter at http://twitter.com/djoj or by email at djojone@gmail.com.Thank you for looking and thank you VERY MUCH in advance for your support.Œæ I look forward to thanking you all personally.

My project is about woodburning.Œæ Pyrography.Œæ It can be done on any number of objects, but I am particularly interested in doing it on acoustic guitars.Œæ The ones I have been able to do in the past, while not unplayable, have been more decorative than functional.Œæ I want to change that.Œæ I want to put my work on guitars that even serious players would be glad to play.Œæ I'm tired of skimping on the quality of my canvas.Œæ That's where you come in.Œæ I hope you dig what I'm doing, and I appreciate any help you'd like to lend.Œæ Thanks!For examples of guitars/skateboards/other work I've done, you can visit my website: http://kimmybessart.weebly.com/

The primary mission of the Tsunami Bass Experience is to promote and facilitate proper Bass Culture appreciation by and for the creators, producers, performers and wobble rousing lovers of low end frequency music while also introducing the uninitiated to an innovative experience in bass culture via our interactive sound installation called the TBE ~WaVe~ 2.0.ŒæHelp us build The Wave, a dance floor that vibrates! People dancing on the Wave literally feel music from head to toe as they hear it on our high-end 20,000+ watt sound system. The bass-heavy dance music performed by our international roster of DJ producers and musicians is specially chosen to maximize the effects of the entire system. The audio system and dance floor are complemented by a light and video show projected on a screen shaped like a crashing tidal wave, providing a one-of-kind immersive audio, visual andŒækinestheticŒæexperience.ŒæFirst conceived in 2008 at Burning Man, TBE co-founders and co-producers ShiZaru.zoe and Andrew Morphous have been collaborating ever since and at last debuted the first ~WaVe~ prototype at the Funhause Technology Fair in Dumbo BK in early 2011.ŒæNext, after several underground event applications to further our research and development, the 2011 ~WaVe~1.0 continued to grow and appeared at a number of freeBASSin' events throughout 2011. Our gift to all, showcasing multiple, ever so gifted line-ups of the finest local, national and international bass culture talent available to us, at many free events such as Figment NYC 2011 where we hosted a 3 day line up...Œæ... under taking a mobile version of the ~WaVe~ inside a rental truck at the Lost Horizon Night Market in Brooklyn NY in May, 2011...Œæ... and even holding freeBASSin' events in public spaces such as at McCarren Park for all to wobble out in Tsunami Bass Experience style!Our debut year culminated the year with a determined large scale Burning Man 2011 debut (at the BRC CAMPus of the TBE Multiversity of Bass Culture Appreciation at 10&Graduation), providing an entire week of proper bass culture appreciation by and for the denizens of Black Rock City.ŒæThe previous budgets for the first four years of the TBE~WaVe~ project, as well as the Tsunami Bass Sound System (usage donated for free via MorphSaru Corp) used in conjunction with the ~WaVe~ has beenŒæcompletelyŒæself-funded by its creators, co-founders ShiZaru.zoe and Andrew Morphous.ŒæThe TBE ~WaVe~ is our gift to the various groups in which we actively participate in collaboration with many like-minded colleges and fellow artists from the local, national and international Bass communities, as well as the international Burner community, we have showcased and featured many artists from both worlds at every TBE ~WaVe~ event whether we are freeBASSin' or fundBASSin'.ŒæThe Tsunami Bass Experience consistently sought to provide an inclusionary and interactive experience that has the potential to change both internal and external perceptions of an oft misaligned, misunderstood genre of music we know as Bass Culture. While our few attempts at fundraising in the summer of 2011 fell short of yielding more than great vibes, good times and lots of R&D opportunities to perfect our design, everyŒæappearanceŒæof the ~WaVe~ in 2011 was extremely well received and we have been consistently encouraged by so many to continue and expand our efforts. Well into our forth year of this legacy that we have built ourselves, proven we have learned and experienced what it takes to execute, in several locations and we are now reaching out to our various communities for a little support to enable the 2012 TBE ~WaVe~ 2.0 to be more fiscally viable for the Tsunami Bass Experience collective.ŒæHOW WILL THE MONEY RAISED BE USED by TBE?All funds raised by this 2012 Kickstarter campaign will goŒæsolelyŒæto pay for the materials required to build, equipment needed to run, transportation to deliver, this campaign (fees), and power generation costs associated with executing multipleŒæappearancesŒæof the ~WaVe~ 2.0 during 2012 and beyond including, but not limited to; Figment NYC (June 9th) , Transformus, Burning Man, and various local area free and fundBASSin' events. It does not pay for any personal expenses, producer, performer or artist fees, or any other such costs.ŒæA breakdown of expenses this fund will cover include the following:ŒæMaterial costs include high qualityŒæecologically obtainedŒælumber, proper treatment/sealant, and fittings for production of eight new dance platforms constructed to enable a long lasting mobile installation for indoor/outdoor day/night usage for the year.ŒæExperimentingŒæwith various materials we have developed and designed upgraded platforms that will replace the worn prototypes from 2011. The new platforms constructed for use in the 2012 ~WaVe~2.0 will be used throughout 2012 are designed to transition into our next generation framing planned for 2013, and as such, consecutively utilized. Sculpture material costs, although reduced by recycling of the 2011 ~WaVe~ PVC piping, fabric, reinforcements, rebar and lights from the 2011 ~WaVe~1.0 are recycled, so the 2.0 upgrade only requires half the additional materials be acquired. Equipment costs include a few new transducers and amps and the remaining budget will be used to cover the ~WaVe~ 2.0 transportation (truck, gas) and generator rentals/fuel costs.ŒæWhile we are "burners," the ~WaVe~2.0 for 2012 is not a project that will be burned. As in previous years, materials and equipment obtained and used in festivals during 2012 will be reused and recycled for multiple future appearances of the ~WaVe~ in coming years, thereby reducing future costs and leaving less trace. The only trace our installation leaves is the afterglow of fine low frequency vibes and an enhanced perception of bass culture and resulting edutainment and how it can be appreciated. ŒæWe hope you will back us by pledging any amount or purchasing either a small or large reward. And do come enjoy the fruits of our labor at any event we have!! Support & be supported by the Tsunami Bass Experience ~WaVe~ 2.0 and we hope to see you wobbling out with us at one of our manyŒæappearancesŒæin 2012 and beyond. For more information, please check out our website at: www.tsunamibassexperience.comor follow us on Facebook:Œæhttps://www.facebook.com/TsunamiBassExperienceŒæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ"Feel the vibe from here to Asia, DuBtRiP fLiPfAnTaSiA~!!"The Tsunami Bass Experience ~WaVe~2.0 for Burning Man 2012 project consists of a visual installation in the shape of a crashing tsunami wave with a series of modular platforms that transduce the low end frequencies the music produced thereby affording a participant a 'BodySonic' style kinesthetic means of interacting with the audio experience, bass culture, being presented. In some events, this is further enhanced by visuals yielding a a multi-sensory, perception changing conditions under which the designated '~WaVe~ worthy" bass culture music the bass masters wield can best be appreciated. The installation sculpture is designed in the shape of a large tsunami wave to represent our dual wave particle and wave themed concept which permeates all aspecst of the multi-sensory experience we provide. Won't you help us by supporting our mission to provide proper bass culture appreciation to oh so thirsty nation? Come feel what we yapping about....wobble the TBE ~WaVe~2.0!!

As a ten-year-old boy playing cowboys with friends at school in England, I was never allowed to be a cowboy; I could only be a Native American Indian.ŒæI was told: "Black boys were never cowboys" or "Have you ever seen a black cowboy?" I had to admit that I had never seen a single black cowboy.ŒæThe only cowboys we ever saw were your white archetypal squared-jawed, American gun-slinging heroes.Œæ Think of our screen legends; The Lone Ranger, John Wayne, Gary Cooper, Roy Rogers, Clint Eastwood, right up to The Marlboro Man, the list is endless.Œæ Not one black cowboy amongst them.ŒæIndeed Hollywood played a big part in keeping the cowboy myth alive.Œæ In fact where American history and identity has been projected by Hollywood and the mass media, the non-white settlers have largely been left out of the story.ŒæThirty years later and enjoying watching those same legends with my own children, I have only just learnt the truth; many of the first cowboys were black.ŒæI have now made it my metier to discover these forgotten cowboys. And I have been both surprised and excited to find a thriving African American cowboy community.The original term 'cowboy' was a derogatory slight against the black man often born into slavery. The terms house boy, field boy, kitchen boy and 'cow boy' were commonly used. Ironically, because of the abilities of these early stock handlers, the term became associated with strength, skill and tough, manly ruggedness.After the American civil war many black cowboys and former plantation slaves enlisted in the army cavalry and were known as Buffalo Soldiers.Once they left the military they stayed in the Western territories and became ranch hands orŒæcowboys.ŒæNon-military black men simply went West, seeking a better life, signed on with ranches and learned on the job.Œæ TheyŒæwere often brilliant horseman orŒæsharp shooters,Œæand many went on to become ranch foremen and managers, while others were hired asŒæguides orŒæfederal peace officers in the Indian territories. It is estimated that as many a a third of all cowboys contracted to drive cattle to markets across America were either black,ŒæIndianŒæor Mexican. ŒæAs well as the physically hard lifestyle, African American cowboys, often had to endure discrimination, bigotry, and prejudice. To counter this they learnt to excel at their work. They were most often the best at roping, bronco busting, taming mustangs, calling the brands, controlling the herd, or topping off horses.ŒæI hope to document the lives of the men women and children who compete in the hundreds of rodeo events across the country. Shockingly many black cowboys from communities across the US were banned from competing at the main rodeos right until the late 1980's.ŒæEven with that hardship I have found that black cowboys were fundamental to the evolution of the western narrative, which has been so central to the identity of mainstream or "White America". Œæ Œæ ŒæWhen I came across this community of black cowboys recently in TexasŒæ it surprised me how little I knew and also how little was known about these true pioneers of the Wild West.ŒæFor too long now, the contributions of the African-American cowboy has been overlooked and almost forgotten in the great history of the American West.ŒæI would like to recognize these unsung heroes.My aim is to produce a multimedia exhibition, which will consist of one full length documentary feature film, three short video stories, a photographic portrait series and a photographic book, all under the title of 'The Forgotten Cowboy'.My responsibility as a documentarian photographer/filmmaker is to translate what I see and to produce an objective project, which enlightens, entertains, stirs emotion, educates, and hopefully leaves an indelible impression.ŒæŒæAnd as a visual artist I have a keen curiosity in every new story that comes my way.Crew, equipment rental, travel/transportation, & post production make up a majority of the costs. We are now trying to reach our desired goal of $50,000 endeavoring to make the best multimedia exhibition possible.This is a creavtie project, and the current funding goal reflects the estimated cost of putting together an independent multi-media project.I would like to thank Kickstarter and everyone who has expressed an interest in this project.

The Art of Flatlining is a 48" long by 4" tall accordion artist book letterpress printed on black Canson heavyweight paper hand-made by Bay Area / Berlin-based book artist Mirabelle Jones. Front and back cover are board covered in silver artist paper featuring title and colophon. When the book is opened, with pages turned individually in codex format or opened simultaneously as an accordion, sub and super-audible frequencies recorded onto MP3 sound chips resound at both the lows and highs of human hearing. The paper is accented by a pressure print of translucent crisscrossing lines, a visualization of disembodied cacophony. A slender broken line is printed in silver ink across the length of the book made of leads hand set and hand cut by the artist. These breaks in the line map the peaks and valleys of pitfalls and triumphs in the life of the artist over a 6 month period of time, offering an imaginary EKG for the reader to complete. Across the top and bottom of each page is a short, quizzical, at times comical, at times jarring description of the artist's polar experiences, with a dark absence marking an unnameable event. Your contribution to the project will allow this edition of 50 books to be completed through the purchase of 200 sound cards, 50 sheets of paper, and 4 pieces of board. Thank you for promoting emerging artists.Œæ Mirabelle Jones is the founder of Art Against Assault: An artist's collective seeking to grant voice to survivors of rape and sexual assault as well as raise public awareness and encourage discourse through artistic means. 10% of all proceeds gained through the sales of "The Art of Flatlining" will go to charitable organizations RAINN.org and BAWAR.org. This includes unused portions of the funds donated through this campaign Kickstarter.com. For more about Mirabelle Jones, please visit the artist's website at www.mirabellejones.com. For more about Art Against Assault please visit: http://artagainstassault.blogspot.com/.

We are Heather and Chris, artist and publisher. We're ready to produce very high quality reproduction giclee's on actual scratchboard! It's been a very difficult task to find the right combination ofŒætechnical equipment and expertise to capture the original detail on the reproduction. We wanted to give the reproductions the 3-dimensional feel of the originals. With several years of trial and error and several very expensive pieces of equipment, we have finally mastered duplication of the detailed scratchboard. Now we are ready to produce master quality limited edition scratchboard art!Scratchboard is a very uncommon media to create fine art with. Scratchboard is artist board that is coated with a fine museum quality white clay, then coated with blackŒæIndia ink. You must be precise as it is very easy to scratch through the thin layer of clay rendering the entire piece ruined! Heather spends painstaking amounts of time to scratch each tiny detail into the scratchboard by hand. After she creates the lifelike 3Œædimensional image into the scratchboard, she masterfully colors the piece with ink to give it that warmth and depth!Heather is a master of her craft. She has wonŒænumerousŒæawards including best in show and division awards. She is currently contracting to hang in several high level galleries and is becoming a huge success. We need to cover our initial production costs and want to share Heather Lara's work with everyone at Kickstarter before her hugeŒædebut!

This is why I am asking you to fund the first project to take awesome photos of "Beauty in Blue" The reason for destroying this art(that has cost a great deal of money and time to make) is to show that lettinggo is ultimately the toughest and sometimes the most rewarding thing of all.Please do not get me wrong; this was not a simple decision or some way just toget famous. Having tried hundreds of ideas to get famous as an artist I am nowcontent just making better art. When taking the picture of "Beauty in BlueSunset" with Photographer Manny Vargas gave me theŒærealizationthat many pictures all over the world in different settings can make the artbetter and the destruction will make it the epitome of performance art.Thank you Penn Jillette from Penns sunday school podcast (a brilliantshow by the way) for giving me the seed to make Destroy Beauty a wonderfulthing. Here are 11 new ideas or areas for the new photos that will be takenover the next year.Ice caveWaterStoneFireStarsAurora borealisFall treesGreen forestField of wheatLightning stormSnow

The Artists Alliance of East Hampton was formed in 1984 as the Jimmy Ernst Artists Alliance by close friends of Jimmy Ernst, the internationally acclaimed abstract painter. It was formed in memory of Jimmy Ernst to carry on his vision of an artistsäó» community.Our mission is to strengthen and support the interests of the creative community living and working on the East End of Long Island. We are trying to raise $5,100 to cover the cost of promotion for the 27th annual Summer Studio Tour. Each year we try to preserve a time-honored tradition of opening our member artists' studios to the public. This event is under constant assault form the outside commercialization that pervades the East End of Long Island during the Summer.Traditionally, the cost of this event is borne entirely by the artists themselves and a few local supporters. This year, we are reaching out to the art-loving public to make this event bigger and better than ever!

I am honored that I have been offered an artist residency atthe Imagine Gallery in Beijing, China for March 2013.Œæ I am lookingforward to this wonderful opportunity.Œæ Unfortunately, there is no funding attached to thisresidency.Œæ I truly appreciate your taking the time to visit my kickstarterpage to see what my artist residency is all about.Œæ It would mean so much to me if you couldpledge your support of my residency. My plan is to continue to develop my current body of work using China and mytravels as inspiration and a source for found objects.Œæ The body of work isentitled "Archeological Remnants" and it combines traditional andmodern quilting techniques, found objects, and rust dyed fabrics that cometogether to represent what we as a society have left behind, forgotten, butwill again discover through excavation. The pieces will consist of large and small scale mixed-media quilted wallpieces, three-dimensional mixed-media sculptures, and altered books. ŒæThepieces will reflect an interest in three types of materials: found objects thathave been discarded, photographs (altered and raw), and various types of dyedmaterials.Œæ My interest in this concept began several years ago after our house wasbuilt.Œæ As I would walk around the property I discovered bits and piecesof the former life of the land (farm land) and the remnants of the build.ŒæIt was as if the earth was revealing these artifacts so they may be discoveredand reused.Œæ Rusted barbed wire embedded deep within the bark of trees,bits of metal from discarded farm equipment, fragments of ceramics, and anassortment of interesting construction debris.Please visit my website: www.rebeccaaranyi.comto see some of my current as archived works. I also have a personal blog at www.onebluntneedle.com.

Acouple years ago, I made a set of jewelry based upon the Grimmäó»s FairyTales. This Kickstarter project will enable me to complete a similar set ofwork based on the Panchatantra, a collection of Indian folk tales.a case displaying some of my pins based on Grimm's Fairy TalesAlthough Iäó»ve read the Panchatantra, I need tocarefully reread it. And as I read each story, Iäó»ll be waiting for a visualrepresentation to spring into my mind. As soon as this happens, Iäó»ll make arough sketch on my iPad. It will look something like this:Œæthis is a rough sketch I made while reading Grimm's Rose RedSome time after making the sketch, I will transfer it to my laptop and render the image into very tight design like this:mockup for Rose RedIn order to translate my design into a real-world object, I have to create a schematic for how it will be built. Because I work with sheets of anodized aluminum, I need to create plans for how to build up layers to achieve the final image. Therefore, I render templates like this:templates I made for assembling the Rose Red design into a pin or tinAfter creating the templates, I'm ready to begin the process of creating the final pieces of art. You can see all these steps documented here. For the example above, I wound up with a pin/brooch, a keepsake tin, and a pair of earrings:Rose Red PinRose Red TinRose Red EarringsI'm afraid I got a bit ahead of myself in the previous section. While I fully intend to turn the stories of the Panchatantra into the type of art described above, it is this Kickstarter project that will enable me to embark upon that process.So here is what I intend to do: It will costŒæ $2,834.79 to complete the work described above. Please see this budget which details how I intend to spend the money you provide to support this project. I am truly grateful for your contributions, but I also want you to feel that the money you give is being used appropriately. And, if I am so lucky to be funded over my budget amount, I will use the excess for updates to my workshop, thus allowing me to purchase new equipment to better complete the project (I sure would like a laser cutter...).I believe I have created some great rewards for this Kickstarter project. I tried to include a little of something for everyone and I do hope you find one that's just right for you (or someone you love).Please note, all rewards include free shipping to anywhere in the United States. I will charge actual shipping costs for international supporters. The dates given for the delivery of the rewards are based upon the assumption that I receive my goal for support of this project. Because the rewards are all hand-made, if I receive support above my goal, it will take me additional time to complete production of the rewards. I will, however, provide regular updates on the progress I make on the project.Also, as an extra-special bonus, I'd love for someone to have my Grimm Pins series that started this whole adventure. It is a set of sixty pins stored in three attractive glass-topped wooden cases. Three of the pins are actually miniature books I made by hand. You can learn more about this work here. And I'd be absolutely thrilled to send this work to a supporter for a pledge of $1,000 or more.

WWW.BITBY.TV is partnering with Little Berlin, Philadelphia on an exciting, unique, multi-faceted project to raise environmental awareness and convert an empty East Kensington lot into a community-accessible, outdoor visual art, garden, and performance space.In April, 2012 Little Berlin won a prestigious $10,000 grant from the Knight Foundation to transform an unused, empty East Kensington lot into a community-accessible, outdoor, visual art and performance space. While the grant brings a much-needed boost to this project, Little Berlin needs to raise matching funds in order to secure the grant and complete this exciting space.This project combines BITBYäó»s and Little Berlinäó»s commitment to local music and the environment by funding two main projects:First, the creation of a 12äó vinyl record compiling one performance from each of the 12 monthly BITBY episodes. The record features live, outdoor performances by Faux Slang, Streetwalkers, Arc in Round, Oh! Pears, Break It Up, Ports of Call, Summer Fiction, Pet Milk, Blayer Pointdujor, Heyward Howkins, Wigwams, and Psychic Teens. Plus 3 bonus tracks from Gemini Wolf, Echo Orbiter and Shorty Boy Boy. The proceeds from the sale of the 12äó will be split evenly between the Little Berlin Fairgrounds Project and BITBY.Second, any money raised over and above the amount needed to print, assemble, and ship the LP records will go to the Little Berlin Fairgrounds Project (50%), BITBY (25%), and the bands (25%).HOW DOES MY DONATION HELP?Hereäó»s how we plan to allocate the funds for this project:1) Approx. $2,500 will go to pressing and shipping the vinyl records (Plating, Test Pressing, Labels, Sleeves, Jackets, Shipping, etc.)2) Approx. $1,250 will go immediately to the Little Berlin Fairground Project (We donäó»t want to wait!)3) Approx. $1,250 will be split between the bands and BITBY (to help recover production costs, site hosting, and other expenses)ABOUT LITTLE BERLIN & BITBYThe Little Berlin Fairgrounds project will include a sculpture garden with art installations made by local artists.  In addition Little Berlin will organize cultural events such as film screenings, artistäó»s fairs, performances, and childrenäó»s workshops.  The project will also collaborate with other local organizations and entities to provide diverse programming that caters to the desires and needs of the community, and seeks to create a sense of ownership and pride among the local residents. A strong emphasis will be placed on sustainable green energy, recycling resources and re-use of materials. Learn more at: WWW.LITTLEBERLIN.ORGBITBY.tv is a project that showcases music around the Philadelphia area. The origin, soul, and primary feature of BITBY is a monthly episode showcasing a different band in the same backyard in Southern New Jersey. As the months pass and the bands change, so do the seasons, giving the viewer a unique window into seasonal change and the incorporation of natural elements in the sound and appearance of each episode. Visit us at WWW.BITBY.TV

"What if you could commune with the rhythm of a rose, taste the melody within a cherry, and hear the words of a distant star?"The Vision: Radiance369* is a live, inter-disciplinary journey that explores sensory elements to animate Marie Teilhard's manuscript "Creation & Temptation: Through Her Eyes," a resonant interpretation of the Bible's Genesis chapters 1-3. As an integrated media production, ultimately, Radiance369: A Sacred Experience seeks toilluminate the hidden connections within nature as a means ofproclaiming the majesty and truth of Godäó»s creative power.The Dream: Conceived and produced by literary artist, Marie Teilhard,Radiance369 weaves together the talents of 12 artistic adventurers including avideographer, music composer, body artist, vocalist, two photographers, taste provocateur, set designer, body movement artist, and a productionassistant. Each of us has had an artistic dream and, through thisproject, our dreams explosively collide. The result: an integrated-media production that this universehas never seen before!The Experience: Radiance369 is designed to lead guests into the mystery of nature, and enlarge each soul's awareness of deeper dimensional realities. While immersed in mystery and awareness, guests are invited to envision the enjoyment of Eden -- and also engage with the lure of desire. This juxtaposition of contented bliss with primal yearning encourages a personal exploration that extends beyond the veneer of everyday ritual, right to the frontier of the private spiritual sphere. The Production: In an intimate setting, limited to 50 guests per showing, Marie, in Eve persona, guides participants through a Sacred Experience with an orated, riveting narrative of beauty and desire.Œæ The narrative is complemented by an exploration of: sight-sound synergies through electrifying time-lapse videography and scintillating interior designs; the taste-sense spectrum through an edible elements offering; and corporeal form illuminations through stunning body art and captured dance movement.Œæ For each 90-minute experience date, ambiance and costumes will showcase one of the nine Genesis Creation-Temptation phases: from The Beginning through The Fall.ŒæŒæ Highlighting the Radiance369 "looks" for Eve are custom-made halos that symbolize each period of creation."In heaven, how do you envision your HALO?Œæ I plan to have 9.Œæ Here's one of them, representingŒæ Creation Day-Age 6:Œæ Eve's wedding :)!"The $$$: The project has a budgeted base need of $35,000 to execute seven to nine glorious performances this year.Œæ Since January 2012, $10,000 has been invested by its producer, with incomparable investments of TIME and TALENT by the stellar Radiance369 Artists.Œæ The remaining $25,000 raised via your help will be used to offset current equipment and supplies investments; and to purchase projection equipment, additional set materials, graphic design, website development, performance staffing, venue rental, general marketing, and limited production/distribution of a Radiance369 DVD and color catalog that includes the full literary novella of Creation and Temptation through the eyes of Eve.Œæ All $$ raised above the target amount will be faithfully used for additional performances and artist development.The Status: The project is 50% complete and will launch with private VIP screenings in early August.Œæ The general public will be invited to engage in A Sacred Experience in Fall 2012.Œæ Visit our Facebook page for more behind-the-scenes detail, photos, updates, and to meet the team. Thank you for considering support of the Radiance369 vision!Marie Teilhard & Radiance369 ArtistsMicah Wood - Video VisionaryAlicia Wood - Luminous Composer Ceason Farnsworth - Brilliant Body Artist Todd and Lisa Lambert - Radiating Design and Sensory ProvocateursMisten Marie Photography - Photographic Sun BeamHolly Davis Photography - Photographic Star ShineKelly Carranza - Incandescent Dancer  Carolyn Berry - Vocalesse DazzleKim Davis - Lightbearing Production AssistantSteve Schlauch - Special Voice-over Talent (starring as "God")Marie Teilhard - Producer, Director, Literary Artist, Costumes & Make-Up Sparkler!* "In your light, we see light." -- Psalm 36:9Content copyright 2012 by Marie Teilhard. All rights reserved.

Life buzzes, beats, flows, and arranges itself in endless patterns, often on scales too small for us to see. Inside the BioBus -- a converted, carbon-neutral 1974 city bus -- anyone can use some of the world's most powerful microscopes to search out the beauty, mystery, and horror of an unfamiliar world.The BioBus has been accepted to FIGMENT Arts Festival in NYC, but needs your help to get there. The BioBus will set up for FIGMENT on Governors Island on Saturday, June 9th and Sunday, June 10th, inviting thousands aboard for a chance to find artistic inspiration in the unfamiliar aesthetic of the microscopic world. Visitors will work hand-in-hand with a staff of five professional scientists who will help people explore the spiky hairs on the wing of a fly, or pollen grains that look like metallic soccer balls from outer space, or the fluorescent glowing insides of a plant cell. You can even bring your own samples to magnify, and we'll digitally record your discoverers to share on our website,Œæwww.biobus.orgABOUT THE BIOBUSŒæThe BioBus is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit project based in the Bronx.ŒæThe BioBus is a state-of-the-art mobile science lab housed on a carbon-neutral, converted 1974 San Francisco city bus. We travel to schools and communities across the country, where people of all ages board the BioBus for a chance to use research-grade microscopes under the guidance of professional scientists, and get to discover the amazing patterns and designs of nature impossible to see with just the naked eye.Since 2008, over 50,000 people have been on board the BioBus, over 60% of whom are students from low-income communities. They inevitably leave awed and inspired after observing that there is much, much more going on -- right in front of their eyes -- than they can see.The bus's engine has been converted to run on recycled vegetable oil. To power the lab, we have four solar panels on the roof and a wind turbine mounted on front. We have a green roof of native grasses and wildflowers that we can study inside in the lab.HOW CAN YOU HELP MAKE MICROSCOPIC MAGIC HAPPEN?We need donations to cover the cost of transporting the bus to and from Governor's Island as well as operating, insuring, and staffing the bus with five professional scientists for two full days. Your contribution is tax-deductible to the fullest extent allowed by law.We play with microscopes every day -- and there is always more to find. We want you to come and play, too. Please?

Hello, we're Chris Lomont and Gene Foulk, creators of Hypnocube (a 3D electronic art light, http://www.hypnocube.com/).ŒæThis time we're printing high-resolution computer art images onto gallery wrapped canvases at 36"x24" and 24"x24" sizes to hang on your walls, with over 30Œæimages to choose from.For a creativebreak from longer term projects, we often do shorter projects (orexperiments involving high voltage, fire, or explosions). This time experimenting with coloralgorithms we accidentally createdŒænovel images that would make beautiful gallery art for your walls. When printed, they look similar to these two.Œæ-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-The images are generated from custom software wedeveloped (technical details for the curious at the end). The resulting interactive toolcan make a large range of high-resolution images; we tried many combinationsand styles to obtain the images we're offering to print. To select an image you want as a gallery wrapped canvas prints, the name(s) you need to order one (or more) of the images is the caption below the desired image. All non-square images come as 36"x24" gallery prints, andŒæall square imagesŒæcome as 24"x24" gallery prints.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæHere is a video of the images so you canŒæsee slightly higher quality images than those above.These images are very high resolution, averaging 18megapixels, suitable for printing at the canvas sizes we selected. All the images on this page arelow quality compared to the versions we use for printing. For example, the next two pictures illustrate zooming in on the red rectangle:Œæ-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-We're offering several levels of prints, with an early bird limited special to get them slight cheaper. Prices include shipping to anywhere in the US. Foreign orders add the requested shipping.Once we reach our funding goals, we will tally and order theprints (and appropriate extras to cover shipping gremlins and international arttheft). Based on past experience with our printer, we expect that it will takea month for the canvases to reach us, at which point we will ship US based onesvia FedEx and international ones via the post office. US based deliveries usuallytake 1 week, but weäó»re scheduling 1-3 weeks of give us plenty of cushion.Foreign orders should take a few weeks to a month, depending on customs offices.We have years of experience shipping goods all over the world from sellingHypnocubes and other gadgets. So hopefully this part will be error free!Thanks for taking the time to browse our project. Feel free to contact us with any questions, and we'll answer you as quickly as possible.-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-These images are generated using a pair of custom software tools wedeveloped. The first tool lets us interactively edit parameters that generate the images, so we can try thousands of combinations and ideas quickly. The tools lets us try ideas, and when we want more features to explore other parameter spaces, we add more features to the tool. When the images in this Kickstarter were created the tool looked like this:The second tool is a manual cleanup tool that let's us take an image, and visually inspect the entire surface for things we don't like, and then we remove and polish up the image to get it perfect for a print, resulting in the coveted Hypnocube Seal of Artistic Quality.To make the images you see, we generated ~250 images of many styles, color palettes, symmetries, etc., and then we whittled down that list to the ones we decided look best.Hopefully this satisfies some of the terminally curious among you. -=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

This project aims to celebrate the characters from the transformers universe, depicting them in a simplistic pixel art form. This hopes to cover all the characters from G1 to ones from the IDW comicsThe goal is to create the characters in this pixel art style and create individual 20x20 prints of each of them, showcasing each design. A personal aim is to be able to have all these prints as a set and be able to host a mini exhibition  showcasing them all once they are all made. The pixel art style itself aims to keep the characters simple whilst also having enough details to know who is who. They are also, to the most part, within scale with each other. As well as creating these individual character prints, there aims to be a set of different sized posters that will focus on different groups such as the  Autobots, Deceptions and teams like the Constructions. Also posters that will be unique to certain backers of the project.ŒæThe final aim is to be able to create one long poster that will contain all of the created pixel transformers as a one off print. the poster will probably be sold through my website once its done.Stretch goals:After making the characters and printing off the prints, a personal aim is to ultimately animate each one to transform into their vehicles. I havenäó»t got a plan for what I want to do with them as of yet but at the moment their just going to be design for personal use unless there is an interest in them. already got one or two animated as of the start of this kickstarter run.Œæ

I (David Morales) am currently an inmate in the Colorado Department of Corrections and would like to create an online Gallery to share my artwork with the outside world.Œæ Over the course of my incarceration I discovered a talent and passion for creating artwork. This started as a way to pass the time and evolved into something more.Œæ It's therapeutic values assisted in my rehabilitation and taught me many valuable life skills, including discovering when not being self destructive I could be creative and productive.Through studying artists of past and present, my interests began to lean towards realism, to include Nature, Southwestern, Portraits and concept artwork. It also created a progressive shift in my behavior.Œæ It has helped me become more patient, focused and social-able.

Last Christmas I was given a set of sharpies as a gift. I began drawing basic images as an outline and then filling them with my doodles. This has always been a form of relaxation for me. In school, I always had the fun notes with doodles in the margins, and I had the full set of gel pens that I kept tucked away and never shared. Come to think of it, I still do that. I really only share my markers with my six-year-old daughter who also shares my passion.ŒæI have started an Etsy store and attended a few craft shows with my matted art. This has given me enough success to continue my hobby, but I really want to share my art on a larger scale. I color with my daughter often, but nothing has ever been "cool" enough for me to be proud of and actually keep.I want to share some of my images with others, and hopefully they will be "cool" enough to tear out and frame. Coloring is such a wonderful, relaxing pastime. I hope that adults and children alike will fall in love with this coloring book and enjoying filling in the pages together.I am so excited for this venture, and I have began the process of getting a proof created through our local printing press. I hope that this wonderful site will get me started, and I can, in the process, share my art with you! Please enjoy visiting my website: dailydoodler.etsy.comŒæto view more of my art.ŒæŒæHave a beautiful day!ŒæThank you,ŒæBrandi LightŒæ

Hello! My name is Patricia, and I'm an illustrator and a graphic designer from Barcelona, Spain. I've been traveling around the world for the last two years. In every place I go I illustrate and document everything that's around me.ŒæAt one point I realized I was creating an artistic bucket list, where everything that was drawn meant that it was done. If you don't know what's a bucket list is a list of all the experiences you want to have or goals you want to achieve before you die.I thought "this could be a great project, an art collection of all the experiences I want to do in my travels for the next few months"That's howŒæ"The Bucket List Art project" began. An art collection of all the experiences I would like to have before I die.But of course I couldn't do this all by myself. I needed help. I talked to my husband, Christopher, because he has worked several times with online networks, website development and that was an important part of the project.ŒæThat's how we createdŒæPatricia Otero studio, a studio where art, creativity and travel unites. We both needed more help soŒæI decided to talk with my sister, Anabel, because she is an excellent photographer and videographer and we really need that for a project of this size.ŒæTogether, as a team, we could do this. I made a list of all the things we all wanted to do in our travels and I chose 100 travel experiences I wanted to paint with my own style. Experiences such as:There is many experiences in the bucket list, but after a few months, I will have done and drawn 100 of them, and I will be able to have a big art collection of travel experiences.ŒæThese are not only artistic pieces but my memories and I want to unite them all in an online store. A store where every time someones buys a print of my illustrated bucket list they are buying a memory from a place or an experience, so they can make that memory totally their own.This prints are giclee  art prints, that means they are high quality printed in a watercolour paper of 300g. You could not tell the difference between an original and the print.ŒæShipping is included in the price!The diagram below represents where all the funds will be allocated to. Part of the funds are dedicated to our next trip, basically to my material along the 8 months and the remaining funds will be directed to printing, packaging, and taxes.ŒæŒæ*Examples of my artAfter the Kickstarter campaign finishes, in June, Patricia Otero studio will start traveling. The destination it's not clear yet, because we don't know if the project is going to succeed. But our options are starting with Canada or SouthAmerica. From June until January we will travel, document, and I will be drawing as we go in our adventures. Some artistic pieces of the bucket list will be drawn as we make them happen, others will be drawn because we want them to happen.ŒæI will be posting all the updates on the website www.patriciaoterostudio.comŒæand on instagramŒæhttps://instagram.com/patricia.otero/Œæ. You can either wait until the end of the project for choosing your print or choose yours as I post them in the project website.A big thankyou to all the ones that has supported me in my project.To my lovely mother, that has always supported all my dreams and ideas. To my sister, who always accepts any crazy idea or project I propose to her, and ends up beautifully well done. And a huge thankyou to my dear husbandŒæChristopher, who, besides my web developer, is my psychologist, my therapist, my masseuse, my coffee guy and just a big important part of my life.

We need art in our homes: live, contemporary art. Art inspires our creativity and soothes us with beauty, stimulating our minds and raising our thoughts. We humans have been surrounding ourselves with contemporary art since we decorated our cave dwellings, recording, teaching, and fulfilling our natural love for ornamentation. What will contemporary art do for you?The ProblemContemporary art is almost always unaffordable. Many galleries take as much as 50%-70% commission on a piece of art. Artists need to create. They can't afford the time or the cash outlay to babysit a storefront. Crafters are turning to eCommerce site such as Etsy to sell their wares. A few fine art sites sell very high end, established painters' or sculptors' work. But they work on the same punishing cost margins as the brick and mortar galleries they represent. It's no wonder most of us don't own original art.Let's Solve This!I want to make art affordable.  I make art for gamers, sci-fi and fantasy fans, tattoo aficionados, niche genre fans of all stripes. Are you a Brown Coat? A 501st storm trooper? A Hoovian? Trekkie? My art will fill your soul!Art drips off my walls, both my own and from other artists. This year I will be taking months to make art for people without charging gallery prices. From $1 drawings to custom wall sized canvases, I will create art for you. Whether you are just discovering art beyond the old masters and kitsch of modern overproduction or you've have found a true fondness for a less than blank wall, I'll create art that will improve the places where you live, work and play.Below I have posted some of the art I've completed in the last month. As this Kickstarter continues, I will post an image of every piece that gets sent out to you, my contributors. Special Requests Custom orders may take longer to deliver. Please let me know the details of your request. I I will do my best to accommodate you and give you a clear expectation of your delivery date.

Initially Ping Pongäó»s diary started just with a simple thought. What if a dog could suddenly be aware that some people actually eat dogs? How he would react right after that? This is when Ping Pong came into the spotlight, a stray dog living in Beijing who one day found out that some people in China actually eat dogs.From that moment his life turned completely upside down and Ping Pong started to react weird for 72 consecutive days. Sometimes, Ping Pongäó»s behavior is silly or crazy but sometimes he shows sings of high intellect and great compassion.The story starts with a terrible news but it ends in a positive way: Ping Pong is adopted by some animal rightäó»s foundation in Berlin and the torture days are finally over. Luckily, not all human beings are evil.Why Ping Pong? Well, if it's not that obvious, Ping Pong is exactly like a table tennis ball: relatively small, white and constantly agitated.At this stage Ping Pongäó»s diary was intended to be more like a personal project but then it turned out that this diary could indeed have a purpose.Ping Pong decided to publish his story and share his chaotic experience. In this way he can raise some awareness about the dog meat consumption. He was recently adopted but he will never ever forget his dramatic period in Beijing. Being very loyal, like any other dog, Ping Pong wants to achieve more than just publishing his diary.Œæ Many of his fellow friends are still living in agony so, if the diary gets funded, his desire is to also help and save other dogs from being slaughtered. Ping Pong needs 150.000 swedish kronas for this project, which is approximately 18.000$, 16.000ä‰å or 12.000Œ£.The ultimate goal for Ping Pong is to get in touch with several dogäó»s rights foundations and give something in return, to close the circle. Well, the diary will be printed on A5 format (14.8cm x 21cm), soft cover most likely and it will include the entire 72 days of Ping Pong's chaotic experience, on 72 pages. Like in the examples below, everything will be printed on yellow, black and white.Ping Pong's rewards are straight forward and very personal. You can receive the Ping Pongäó»s diary in a digital or print version. When things get a little personal, you can receive the printed version of the diary carefully signed by Ping Pong. You can also officially become Ping Pongäó»s friend by having your name mentioned in the diaryäó»s friends list. If you want to be one of Ping Pongäó»s best friend...well, then you will also receive a personal handwritten letter from Ping Pong. When Ping Pong wants to communicate something he just barks. He doesn't really understand why humans have such a sophisticated and useless communication system: Facebook, Twitter, Skype...and oh God, how many more.Sometimes he's a bit capricious but still very friendly. You can get in touch with Ping Pong on Facebook, Gmail and rarely on Twitter, as he doesn't have the necessary skills to catch a bird.Facebookstraydogstory@gmail.com@ThisPingPong

I have always had the desire to capture nature at its best and bring it to the wide world. Not many of us have time to sit back and enjoy nature. Not even me, but I see the chance to make a difference. It's YOU! You people can help me find time to appreciate nature and bring it to your door step, so that you have the privilege to sit back on your couches and experience the glorious sunset at Grand Canyon or the vicious play of shadows on the sands of Sahara or swim with the great whales as they migrate to warm waters of Australian coast.I have the VISION to make it my life's MISSION, and the time is NOW! Photography has become the second hobby of every person I meet. So whats so special about my idea? I am taking it a step ahead to produce beautiful paintings from the pictures. Having spent lot of time painting and sketching from childhood, I am well equipped to take on this challenge.To give those pictures a human touch, a stroke of brush and a swish of paint. To bring them back to life with vivid colors and shades. But, getting back to the point, everyone has to start somewhere, I have decided to start here, standing on the backs of you "backers" and bringing my dream to the reality of your living room.Support me in my venture to make people turn their heads from their busy lives and to strike back the lost link with our mother nature.I wholeheartedly thank you for your support and your belief in me, I promise to make it count!ARISE, AWAKE AND STOP NOT TILL THE GOAL IS REACHED!

*Awaiting badly made video, will arrive in 48 hours!*Our project is called The Fabulous Females of Video Games and here's everything you need to know about it!ŒæŒæOur aim to create a full-colour illustrated book that celebrate the achievements, attitudes and pure badass-ness of our top 20 female video games characters from both mainstream and indie titles that we all know and love!It will include double-page spreads dedicated to each character, with a full colour image on one page and a fact file dedicated to them on the other. The book will be perfect bound and will have a durable softcover (If we reach our stretch goals, it goes hardcover!).ŒæBUT WHY?! Why are we doing this? It's a pretty simply answer; As an average, there are far less female characters in video games that have strong personalities or deep back-stories and motives when compared with the amount of male characters. However, a large portion of video game players happen to be female! This project is not aimed to create anger or to denounce one gender from another, it is simply to celebrate the characters we DO have in the gaming world who are female, and as a result we hope it simply continues discussions and talks within the community and industry to continue creating female characters that all players can relate to.ŒæŒæIt's important to note that we will be re-drawing every character, these illustrations are simply to show our work! These will not be in the final cut!REWARDS!! We love community, and if you decide to support our Kickstarter then we will reward you for joining our community! A large portion of our finances (see below) actually goes towards rewarding our backers because it means a huge amount to us that you share our vision.ŒæPlease view all of our rewards on the right! These all range from PDFs, a copy of the book, a comic, badges, stickers, A4 prints, custom portraits, and for those who want to reach the highest tier, you can even get a canvas mailed to you! EVERY BACKER WHO DONATES Œ£5 OR MORE IS ACKNOWLEDGED AND THANKED IN THE BOOK ITSELF. We will have a page dedicated to naming all our backers!We have so many rewards lined up for you guys so we hope you can support us so we can give all of this back to you as a thank you!ŒæŒæHere is a small breakdown what you're donation is going towards:- To have the book professionally printed and bound.- To have the book and the rewards packaged and safely shipped to your homes, it seems like a lot but it's not when broken down to each individuals parcels.- Rewards, this covers the time taken to design and have them created by professionals (badges, stickers, comics, art book, etc) and to create the higher tier custom rewards such as portraits and have them printed and safely mailed to you.- A small (and we mean small) portion will cover us for the time it takes to create everything, we call this "Labour".- Kickstarter fees.Just in case you guys are incredibly enthusiastic about our project and this all goes sky high, we've created a few stretch goals, and if this really does go above and beyond our expectations we'll probably faint. But once we're back on our feet we'll be offering you all these stretch goals:Œæ-Œ£5000 - 4 MORE A4 PRINT FOR ALL REWARDS THAT INCLUDE THE A4 PRINTS ALREADY!-Œ£5600 - WE PRINT THE BOOK IN HARDBACK! SO ALL REWARDS THAT HAVE A COPY OF THE BOOK WILL INSTEAD RECEIVE THEIR COPY IN HARDBACK INSTEAD OF SOFTBACK.-Œ£7000 - WE PRINT ANOTHER 100 COPIES! WOO HOO!We will add more stretch goals if we feel its getting close to the target, don't worry!ŒæJust in case you wanted to know a little bit about who we are! Our names are Kayleigh and Siobhan and we've been working together to create comics and illustrations since 2013 upon completing our illustration degrees.ŒæWe attend various UK based comic conventions and you view our work atŒæwww.kavonillustration.tumblr.comŒæto get an idea of what we're about.ŒæIf you've made it this far, thank you so much for taking an interest in our project!ŒæIf the project resonates with you and you wish to support us, please choose whichever reward tier suits you! All donations are welcome and we cannot thank you enough! If successful, we'll endeavour to update our status on the project very regularly so our community is kept in the loop!ŒæTHANK YOU ALL ONCE AGAIN!!!

Was Jesus a Raging Douchebag?We all know that Jesus freaking loves everybody and is awesome!But others have been misinformed or hurt.This is a graphic novel that fights against the constant hatred that churches (religious hypocrites) & street preachers pour out on the public. in a satirical way this book explains why we should ignore religious jerks and appreciate Jesus for what he has done. It's written in a way that will grab the attention of skeptics and draw them into amazing art and hilarious content.ŒæIt explains who Jesus really is, how he feels about religious jerks, how to deal with them the way Jesus did, and why there have been so many people in history who followed his example.Jesus People are those of us who love Jesus, love others, and live rather than beligerantly scream at others.None is shamed, threatened, humiliated, or guilted into God's love.ŒæIt's his kindness that leads us to repentance.The book finishes by explaining what salvation is in a non threatening way that makes sense and helps the person know how to connect next.Religious tracks are a outdated thing of the past, let's change the world together.This book will change the way ministry is done and all the proceeds will go into printing and distribution. Mostly printing.Printing is expensive and can vary depending on paper, ink, binding, and so much more. I want to make this the best it can be and lay the foundation for more in the future.

I started drawing unusual and abstract images during my fragile college years, and began exploring modes of alternative consciousness using plant medicines. As a result, my art rapidly evolved into a psychedelic smorgsabord of intricate, undulating, swirling images that are inspired and influenced by plant medicines, mushroom dimensions, spirits, underworld iconography, shamanism, magic, ancient ancestors, cosmic beings, tarot, ascension, DNA and genetics, evo and involution, and more.This colouring book is a variety package of my favorite pieces of artwork, reprinted for your colouring pleasure. These images will encourage different perspectives of consciousness and tease your brain for hours on end. Each book is the accumulation of over 100+ plus hours of drawing and is a labor of love.ŒæI am self-publishing using local printers with paper I have purchased myself. Each book costs roughly $5.00 to print and ship; your generous funds are used to offset printing costs and support higher-quality printings in the future.ŒæThank you! Please contact me if you have any questions!

Œæ - I've Always Loved Poetry, AndŒæThose Who Read My Poems Frequently Tell Me That I Should Have Them Published. Yet Not Until Now Have I Ever Thought About Getting Any Of My Work Published. Not Sure About The Cost, But If I Am To Publish My Work I Would Like(And Prefer) To Hold No Expense.Œæ -ŒæIn Total I Have Around (180) Completed Poems, Which Should Be More Than Enough To Make A Book Out Of. I've Listed Two Of My Poem's Below For All And Anyone's Viewing Purposes.1.) Œæ- Œæ* ŒæŒæThe Puppet King - A Man On Death RowŒæ Œæ*Once A Prospect, I Always Knew I'd End Up Dead Or In Jail. Brought Up To Rise, (And)Yet Set-Up To Fail. For Those Who Will Listen, This Is My Tale ...Like Most Great Things, This Story Begins Humbly. In Fact No Exageration,It Literally Starts In A Well,A Deep Hole In The Ground, Tht I Dug Myself Into. And Deep, Deep Dwn ...I Had Enuff Of The World Rejecting Me,These Surroundings Tht Are Encasing Me.They Make The Statement;  " Tht They Are Hating Me "And In Response ...I'm Left To Either Wonder Why, Or (Simply) Go Off And Die. Given The Choices Why Even BotherAn Orphaned Father, Culdn't Bother.So Who Am I, To Even Try ?Although Now ...As I Lay, Soon Lifeless I Wonder.Was Living Life Lacking Plunder,What Tore (Thy) Asunder ?And When Ever Thy End Me,I Pray Thy Befriend. For I Am Scared Shitless, To Go In ... All Alone.Although ...The Life I Lived Was Good.Haunting Memories Still Stuck With Me.And What I Learned Troubled Me.But It Taught Me Well ...How To Survive.But Despite Tht ...I Want Only To Live, And Not Be Alive.But Instead To Be Giving,And Not Count Off The Days. Til Pention Is Paid. No I Dnt I Want To Die, And I Dnt Want To Go ...Some Time Before Death, When Living, I Planned Far Ahead. Truly, Bcuz Were Nvr Alive Til Were Dead. And No I'm Not Crazy, Although I'm Not Sane, But None Of Us Are. Yet Still We Maintain ..... I Digress.So Then What Choice Do I Have ?Aren't You Happy I'm Glad ?Well Dnt Be I'm Mad, Bcuz I'm Happy And Sad, To Be Seeing You Go. Your Prints Fresh In The Snow, Are All I Remember,Thts Why It's December, I Always Remember. Tht And Loving The Snow. For Although It Is Cold,Some Warm Type Of Glow Is What It Emits.Now Whether I Imagined, Or This Actually Exists ...Is A Trivial Pursuit Tht Will Nvr Be Quenched.I Spent My Last Moments Here, TryingTo Build A Shell Penetrating Hatred, Clashing Vigorously The So-Called Sacred.And All, In All Not Wanting Jus Another Place To Fit In.But To Make A Statement ... Tht I, Was On The Verge To Greatness.But Oh Woe It Be, For The Man ...To Blind To See, Whats Right In Front Of Him.Now, Years Later, Look Whats Been Done To Him.And I Realize Now Tht I Should Of Spent More Time, Focusing On You.But Being Blinded By Betrayal, Unvieled In Me, A Will To Be Tht Was Slowly Shriveling.For My Will At The Time, Although Not At Its Prime,But Just Infancy, Gave Tendency, To Show It Exists.And So Now As They Take Me Away.They Take Me Astray, Not Far From Grave.And On Our Way There. They Calm.And They Stare As They Judge Me, And (Just Then, One Of Them) Wonders .....  - " What Is Utter Madness ?Is It Sumthn To Fear ?Is It Him ... Is It Already Here ?This Man Tht Were Taking,Is He Truly, As Evil As They Say. Does He Deserve This Death. I Mean Really ? ... To Go Out InŒæThis Way.Maybe ... Jus Maybe We Are The Monsters.But Then Again ... I Shuld Watch What I Say.For If The Others Hear Me, I Too Shall Be Lead Dwn This Way ".And With Tht ... Another Secret, Gets Taken ...Straight ... To The Grave.And There It " Lies ", Bounded Like Slaves.2.) - * Œæ So... When's Tommorrow?Œæ Œæ*Before She Left, She Wrote A Line, A Single Quote ...A Murder Note, Upon Which Read, Said ...   " The End Will Be So Bloody ".And .....As The Years Went By, I Watched The Sky.As It Turned Shades, From Blue To Black.And Just Then, The Natives Screamed, At What They Deemed, They Dare Not Speak, Yet They Know Of Who Is That.Ironic Dreams, Simply In The Dark, Til Trouble Sparks To Light A Match.A Thunderous Boom, As Light Resumes,And The Deaf As If Inact. With Addition Of Sight We Gather Round, And Learn Of One Another, And Through Due Time, I May Learn To Call Another, As He Be My Brothers Keeper. The One Who Shields Me From Some Other.Although Now I'm Wiser, I'm Also Older.And Not As Nimble, As Those I Shoulder.Yet Funny, How Only Now I See, How ...  " The End Will Be So Bloody " ... Your Getting Old, My Buddy. Maybe Cuz I Spent Too Much Time Up In The Clouds. Day Dreamers, Those Who Dream Of Better Days ThenMake It Happen. Only That Is Freedom, For Life You Truly Captain, To Lead And Captivate. But What Has That Gotten Me ? The So-Called Captain .....Truly Even Now I Still Dream Of Better Days, Seeing Future Ways, To Make Tommorow.Yet Thats A Dream ..... How Pleasant It Must Seem. But Back In Reality, Theres A Need To Borrow. And As I Wake, And See Those Around Me. Although They Dnt, There Not Me, There Different, They Surround Me, And So They Drown Me!So ... I Grip My Shoulder Tight, And Shoulder Right, Right Down The Alley. Ahhhh ... The Love In Drinking DwnMy Pain. Its Insane That ... When I Start Up, I'm Never Done. Yet Have The Bar Call Me A Cab. And When I'm Home, Add One More Tally To Score, For If I'm Lucky ....." I'd Do It All Tommorow Once More ".

Do you like sci-fi, dream creatures, and original illustration?ŒæDo you want to be part of a select group to get The Mutation Tarot deck before anyone else?Do you want your choice of either a regular size tarot deck, or a special edition 2.5" x 6" deck (or both)?We need YOU to make this deck a reality!Œæ"I grew up with a Rider-Waite deck in my room. Even before I knew what the pictures meant, or how to do a reading for that matter, the images always fascinated me.They are a timeless collection of the human experience covering everything from love, life, death, spirituality, etc.. I now have many decks, ranging from anime pin up girls to Egyptian Book of the Dead symbols. As amusing and diverse as these iterations are, they can be very hard to use in a reading. Some are far too artistic to be practical. My goal in drawing 'The Mutation Tarot' was to keep it practical. In that respect, most of the images are steeped in the Rider-Waite tradition. I wanted to see if I could capture the same human aspects depicted in the cards by using non-human subject matter, in this case, mutated creatures from my dreams."Mario Rosa, creator of The Mutation TarotThe Mutation Tarot deck is the result of a year and a half long project, by illustrator Mario Rosa, to re-imagine the spirit, symbols, and imagery of the Tarot cards without using human beings. It is a practical, readable deck with sci-fi, fantastical, and original creatures. This is the Tarot deck of another planet or another dimension, where plants, insects, and sea creatures mutated and evolved."We are all constantly changing, every second of every day. We might not even recognize ourselves in the future."ŒæGet a closer look at the art at: http://mutationtarot.com/tarot-deck.htmlNow available in a second size: 2.5" x 6"!You have feedback and we listened! While many people love the original deck design, some wanted more of a focus on the unique art. So we've squared away printing and pricing for this new deck size and have added new rewards!See all of the card art on our Facebook album as well.In addition to offering folks their choice of high quality prints, we also have coffee mugs and t-shirts. We're letting backers choose which original card artwork they'd like to have on these items.There are also 4 special pledge packages available where you'll receive a deck but Mario will also create a custom 11"x14" illustration for you.

There is beauty in the unexpected and sometimes trauma can be a great motivator. I recently and suddenly lost someone I profoundly loved and the loss made me realize that life is short but it is also deeply beautiful. Although art has always been my passion, I did not "own" it. Instead I hid it away, afraid to be criticized or seen as "unworthy". But, as my Love would remind me, you must take risks, be vulnerable and step out into that leap of faith. And so, I offer my art to the world in a bold color. The SilverThorn Story coloring book is what kept me focused, sane and creative when I wanted to fold and give up. Creating something colorful and unexpected let my mind go to the places in dreams where beauty still thrives. Painting mandalas has long been used as an effective meditation technique and these drawings can be used in the same way. Let your mind wander and wonder where The SilverThorn Story will lead. Follow the breadcrumb trail and explore your own hidden depths of creativity and beauty. Many of my drawings are based on the idea of iconic goddesses. Many of them have one eye hidden as a symbol that we never really see the full picture and we all have a hidden inner self. The SilverThorn Story coloring book is filled with 22 original drawings, each with a unique, poetic name to stimulate your imagination. Use whatever means you like to bring the drawings to life with beautiful, magical color - paint, marker, pen, colored pencils....even finger paints if you want to let your fearless inner child-self shine.

My name is Sarah Werkheiser. I am an experienced illustrator who has been reveling in the joy of painting and drawing for as long as I can remember. Writing however is a love that I have only recently begun to embrace. Amazingly Made of Amazing Things is the product of combining these two passions old and new.ŒæEven though writing is new to my hands I have always possessed a deep love for mythology and storytelling. I believe that mythology acts as the collective dream-state of a culture, and have often felt hungry for a modern creation myth.ŒæAmazingly Made of Amazing Things is the product of my desire to create a new creation story that was rooted in science while still capturing the wonder and magic that permeates throughout all things.Many have described this tale to fall somewhere in the realm of Dr Seuse meets Neil DeGrasse Tyson.ŒæI am extremely proud of this book, and hope that you will enjoy what it has to offer as much as I have enjoyed creating it.ŒæREWARDS:ŒæFor those generous enough to contribute to the $125-$250 range I want to create something special. As a result I will be creating one of a kind nature inspired watercolor paintings.ŒæThose contributing $125 to the project will receive a one of a kind 10x10 Mandala.Those contributing $250 to the project will receive a 9x12 framed watercolor painting.ŒæIf you have any content requests (ex: favorite animal or theme) please let me know.http://kickingitforward.org

Pann's Guide will be a series of stat sheets and artworks I create. Honestly, I have over 50 planned species but I'm also brainstorming as I create them. There will be tons when I'm actually done, but for now I'm still developing names and the master list.The title, Pann's Guide, is a pun-ish type thing off of my last name, and the whole concept of it is almost like a travel guide. I'd also like to work on the fun of terrain and world design later on. The funds are not only to show my art and give it to those kind enough to donate, but also to help me get more supplies. I really enjoy my markers and paint, so I always end up running low at some point!The main materials are my markers and inking tools, (Faber Castell, Copic Sketch, Finecolour, and Spectrum Noir), my paint (watercolor, usually Artist's Loft) and my cardstock (Joann Fabric's and Michael's paper on sale, honestly).

When I was asked to produce this year's Atlanta Veg Fest poster design I immediately became obsessed with the idea of producing a vintage style Art Nouveau piece that I could offer as a high quality print. To me, this meant a large scale, full color, limited print complete with Gold Leafing. Unfortunately, in today's market of print-on-demand sites, the idea of a high quality print has been lost to the concept of low cost, fast turnaround printing usually produced on a large laser printer. In this world of laser printing it is impossible to produce a true "Gold Leafing" effect consisting of actual gold ink (that beautiful effect of the gold changing as the viewer interacts with the piece is completely lost). It is my intension with this Kickstarter to produce a true high quality 5 color 18" x 24" print that will include this "Gold Leafing" effect. I feel this is the best way to reproduce the original illustration giving you something that you will truly be happy with!To me the real attraction for this Kickstarter is the final printed poster. Therefore, rather than loading up this campaign with numerous rewards (which to me just get confusing after the first 10 or so) I have decided to limit the rewards to just a few key levels. All shipping and handling is included within the price - SOŒæFREE SHIPPING...YEAH!!

I currently just enrolled in barber school, and the only way I'll really be making any money this long year is by doing tattoos. School is going to consume the majority of my week, seeing as I'll be going fulltime, and I'll be at the shop any hours I'm not in class.
