Good evening, are you sitting comfortably?ŒæThe basic premise behind these prints is that they are runts, outcast and forgotten about I've never seemed to get them to print. Some I underrated and so ignored. Others I doubted whether I'd got it 100% how I'd like and so squirrelled them away. Abused, forgotten, mistaken, betrayed and mistimed all these prints have gotten to the cusp of production and then fallen short. And so now sometimes years after they're production I've decided to force the issue and give these miscreants a chance at life, a crap series of Frankenstein's monsters if you will. Each print has a little story which I'll include under each image below. Enjoy this police lineup and see it as it can only be... A mess.Is over 5 years old and was one of my first endeavours into street art and screen printing. It just seemed at the time that revolutionary Yorkshire gardener Alan Titchmarsh just wasn't that 'street', plus lacking confidence it could stand up against other graffiti artists in the lost file it went. The veg patch edition below is a variant I made especially for kickstarter. The only thing red Alan Titchmarsh would support is his tomatoes come springtime. Everything about this piece gives me the creeps which is weird as I produced it. The crosses on the eyes are some kind of malevolent taunt to the boatman on the river Styx. He's looking at you but he's not, the crosses obscure his eyes but you don't want to meet his stare. When I made this I think I thought that the implied reference to child abuse and the church were a bit too strong and I couldn't stomach it. In retrospect it's a burning effigy and one that can now haunt you. Don't like looking at it for too long though...Continuing on the murderous child theme are three different versions of the piece 'Baby KILLA'. The colours are of the infant palate named after things loving parents would be interested in 'mothercare' and 'custard'. This saw a lot of action on the streets as it was a paste up poster I personally used all over the place but was also a freebie I gave out to people. I genuinely can't remember making this piece, all I remember was that it would be too awkward to produce just a few so I'd have to make a few different versions to make it possible. Thereafter it stalled. Originally I wanted the blocks to read 'Killer' as if proper spelling matters to a 2 year old murderer. Instead I went for the Wu Tang version 'KILLA' thus the child goes from a deranged serial killer in the making to a 90s gang banging infant.For this Kickstarter venture I resurrected an old 'drips' style I used to use where I'd splurge paint on a wall then paste over it. You can the variant style screen print. The baked beans variant is just cause I really wanted a print with baked beans in it. Seemed appropriate. ŒæThe idea with the 'Ravans' came to me whilst watching Ravens raiding rubbish bins next to McDonalds. Beside the pillaging were a group of Womies (white homies devoid of the slightest trace of gangsta) wearing cheap knock off Ray bans. I couldn't see the difference between the two groups. If anything the ravens would have stolen the glasses off the faces of the wude boys (white rude boys; it works in patterns) and were thus more credible than Wanilla Ice and the boys (Vanilla Ice but white...wait...). I blasted out the design for these guys quickly but then lost faith in myself as the imagery started to look more and more like an actual Raybans advert. As I pondered and pondered about what to do, my mind quickly drifted off into thinking up cheap ridicules of the white middle class...ŒæOriginally I was going to stick this image over British 'give way' signs and a subversion of the road signs original meaning. Instead of give way to oncoming traffic, it was a distant plea and silent plea hidden in plain view as an ominous prediction of future doom.Not too bad an idea. Problem was I was too ambitious. I wanted this stuck up on a motorway give way sign pasted over it.  And I managed it. But within two hours it was taken down. I tried again. Again down within a few hours. I tried a few more times but lost interest. The spot was prize but if no one saw it was it worth it? Maybe I could put them up on less policed but thus less exposed give way signs? But how could I forsake the highly viewed motorway for boring suburbia? Nobody tootalling along at 30mph in a 20mph zone gives a monkeys about the crumbling of mankinds future, let alone looks at road signs. Overconfidence vs incredulity. Neither won. The piece never saw light again.  ŒæThis 8 bit skull design was my fourier into retro 80s style icons. I used to DJ and this skull head was part of my logo. I never made it as a DJ (or an artist) and so I forgot about it.Skullface was of course never made/born in the 80s and neither is the 90s variant. I wanted it to be as close to a shell suit as possible. ŒæNazis and North Korea. Easy pickings for totalitarian mockery. The nazi slag fest is done. They're such a simple target my refined tastes (ahem) wouldn't allow such an easy satire. So Kim Jong UN it is then. The problem is somewhere down the line I lost my way and ended up mixing Ziggy Stardust with the Korean fat boy. But that wasn't my original purpose, I can't mix something infinitely cool with the infinite stomach of communisms poster boy. But I did and so I lost confidence (again) with my own ideas. I think the finished piece is good but as I lost the sense of what I made Ziggy Jong UN for I never published it. So here it is for you. Kim Jong Un bathed in the eternal glory of the North Korean flag.The handfinished version I'm making for kickstarter is my attempt to get back to the fortress of juxtaposition. The gay pride flag painted over his face. Aren't I clever. R

Hello,I am Tadas from Lithuania. I am 24 years old and I am interested in art. When I was a small boy I was amazed by undiscovered things. I was looking at them with a different eyes. From very early days my father was telling me: "Son, never be destroyer, always be creator". I grow up creating and I am creating today. Not long time ago I got interested in postcards. Old, no more interesting postcards in my hands gets a new life. I like to improve and get better at what I do, every new project is a challenge for me. I have a vision and I want to ask you for your help, so I can make my vision come true. That vision is an art store / workshop, in where new ideas would emerge and in the very same place they would become reality.To make ideas a live I would like to ask you financial help. Financial help is needed for workshop to be established and some equipment to be bought. Equipment which I need is scanner, laminating machine and laser printer. I am full of ideas and I am prepared to use these tools to reach my goals. My goals are to restore old postcards, make layouts for calendars with pictures people will provide and print pictures on things.ŒæThe beginning and first step will be internet website creation, in which people will be able to upload their old postcards or pictures. When we get their postcards or pictures, we will restore them or make something that client will ask. Second step will be workshop establishment, where people could bring their old postcards, pictures or things on which they would like to print something.

Hello!  This is a fundraiser for Matt and Lauren Sparks to reprint their promotional bookmarks, business cards, and get some logo stamps made (something weäó»ve been wanting to do for a year). Weäó»ve printed all these things out-of-pocket previously, but not all at the same time. When put together, the total cost is formidable to the paltry sum currently in our business savings account.This Kickstarter is partially a necessity and partially an experiment- weäó»re both considering using Kickstarter in the future to raise funds for printing our independent comics, and so thought weäó»d dive in with a smaller project first! Weäó»ll see what happens! :DRewardsBasically, we want to trade bookmarks and original art for printing costs! Or, just bookmarks! Whatever you like. :)  As you can see in the original art reward tiers at right, you can have either Matt or Lauren draw you an artist trading card or a 9x12äó piece of character art - both in color.  These two sizes of artwork have proven very popular at comic book conventions, so we hope you enjoy them too!  Reward fulfilment will be in July (for bookmarks) and August (for original art).  This delay is so we can concentrate fully on producing all requested artwork, after finishing our biggest convention of the year  (HeroesCon in Charlotte, NC).Below you can see examples of Matt and Laurenäó»s work - they obviously have very disparate styles, but it can usually be boiled down to äóìMatt draws the cool stuff, Lauren draws the cute stuff.äóExamples of work by Matt and Lauren SparksMatt Sparks illustrated the last two issues of Hardcase by Scott Bachmann for Scott Comics and is currently penciling issue #1 of the comic book Viride, written by himself and Brenna Mudge. He colors his traditional work primarily in marker, and enjoys drawing heroic characters like Spiderman and Batman.Lauren Sparks has most recently illustrated issue #2 of Open Tree, Linus and the Fluke of Love by Chris Charlton for Assailant Comics.  She also writes and draws the silly webcomic Cats Talking Words, and wrote and illustrated a short story to the Kickstarter-funded Transitions Anthology. She colors her traditional work primarily in watercolor and enjoys drawing humans, cats and Pokemon.

I plan to do a series of drawings based on the book: "Alice's Adventures In Wonderland" I'm  re-imagining the imagery and the characters of the book. I'm using a live model to be my "Alice" and will be using African sculpture as a visual basis to re-design the various characters. My cat, Clifford will be the model for the Cheshire cat. I'm employing the drawing technique of cross-hatching that I've always loved since I learned it in Art school. It's a drawing technique which actually was popular in illustration during the time that Lewis Carroll wrote the books and was used by John Tenniel who was the original illustrator of the books in 1865.If my campaign is successful, I plan to publish an Art volume in book form of my illustrations  with a re-imagined, poetic interpretation of the part of Carroll's text that is illustrated by the drawings. The illustration will be on one page with the re-imagined/poetic text on the opposite page.The total project, which is to be an 8 1/2" X 11" Art volume, will be a collection of approximately 40-50 drawings of various sizes. I've already started and am currently working on the drawings and I've completed six drawings so far in the series, parts ofŒæ which are shown here in the video. I hope to complete the drawings in six to eight months given my current schedule. Subsequently the books will be designed and published within 2 months after that.The funds will pay for all supplies needed to complete the drawings, the publishing cost to print 250 books and all rewards promised.

The little paper boat dreamt of reaching the ocean, even if he didnäó»t know what it looked like. In a fantastic journey, the paper boat meets many friends and not so friendly creatures along the way, but he never gives up! Will he make it out to sea? Join along to find out!The sea is a dream. We grew up on books about the sea; about ŒæcourageousŒæseafarers, and the thrill of discovery. It is very rare that new books like that are written now. Maybe because everybody flies in a tin can anywhere in the world within a few hours nowadays - there's no adventure in it. We want to bring back the excitement.A good story CAN bring it back. And we actually love technology and new possibilities it brings. We are going to tell this story in a way only modern phones and computers will allow. This medium allows a perfect fusion of Œæold and new. Gorgeous artwork, meticulously crafted by hand on paper, is brought into the digital realm and transformed with sound, animation, and playful interaction. A whole world which parents and kids can step into and experience together.Well, it is really exciting! The storyboard, graphics and animations concept are done. The core elements of the programming side are mostly thought through. The team is in the midst of working on animation, turning the book into an interactive and fun App.ŒæWe've gone as far as we could up to the point where we see the project is definitely on the right track. We did it without funding. We still have approximately 60% of the development to go before the App is ready to sail out. We've contacted investors, but we got the response, that what we do is too beautiful, too "handmade" and that Apps users don't need anything like this anymore.Nevertheless, we believe that in the digital world there is even more place for magic and beauty, for the newly revealed good old hand painting, for reading and for a real sense of sharing an adventure.Now is the time to ask for some help. That is why we call out to you via Kickstarter.We work hard, with full dedication and much love. We'd appreciate your support of our project - we truly believe it is unique, entertaining and significant as a kid-parent experience.ŒæYour help will make it possible for us to complete our work and bring The Real Boat story to the big wide world and of course to you and your kids.We are an international team of artists sharing the love of art of storytelling and illustrating. We came to the idea of this interactive book fascinated by the opportunity opened up by technology: to introduce what we are passionate about in innovative ways.Special Thanks to: Denis Paduchev,ŒæJonathan and Pamela Lubell, Mich'ael Zupraner, Roni Levin, Eli Pitcovski and Dula Yavne.It will be used to create the mostŒæbeautiful andŒæinspiring interactive story. The funds will cover animation, sound effects andŒæprogramming production. They will also cover Œæthe creation of rewardsŒæand some of the inevitable taxes along the way.Your support will allow us toŒæcomplete the Real Boat app within six months.

Beauty Behind BarsI started drawing up this idea in my head when I decided to become penpals with non-violent, Native American, offenders in the US prison system.ŒæGrowing up half Blackfoot but being blonde haired, fair and blue eyed presented it's own challenges. I could've easily let my anger and resentment lead me down the wrong path. Luckily, I didnt. But, others werent as lucky.It's become my mission to help. I want them to see the good in the world and for people to appreciate the many talents and gifts they have to offer. Some of the things they spend hours and weeks sometimes working on are so stunning I find it hard to describe them in words.ŒæThe problem is most get out with absolutely nothing to start fresh with, which is why there is such a high rate of return. My goal is to reduce those numbers by allowing them a way to put away a little money to give them a better chance for success upon release. ŒæThey're not bad people, they just got lost along the way when they were young and paid for it for many years.ŒæI want to build and awesome website to showcase their designs and then deposit the money into accounts for them for use when they get out. I think this would be a great help to them and also a way to give the gift of beauty to the public.Œæ

I've been doing continuous line drawings in my own unique style since I was a kid.Œæ I called them squiggles, but I have always considered them something special and thought of them as a form of art.Œæ I've imagined that perhaps other people might also appreciate them for the unique beauty that I see in the swirling twisting thread.You can get one of my continuous line drawings, which I will do at my kitchen table while my little girls color for only 1$.Œæ You can put it on your fridge, in a photo album or even fame it and hang it in your bathroom!ŒæMy desire was partially granted when in highschool art class I was allowed to direct my own art project. So I did a painting using my squiggles to represent the form of one of my classmates.Œæ I still have the painting in my home.Œæ Recently I was discussing my continuous line art with my mother saying, "I'd still like to see if anyone would like them."Œæ She of course said she'd like to have one, mothers you know. My little daughter of course wanted one too, a princess.Œæ So the goals of this kickstarter campaign are to put my unique art out for people to enjoy and if funded to frame my mother and daughter's drawings.

League of Faith Heroesä‹¢ are epic collectable trading cards which portray a heroic spin on biblical characters with strong faith. These lively cards emphasize certain powers and skills these heroes possessed as told from the Bible. The goal is to make learning about these League Of Faith Heroesä‹¢ fun for all ages! The cards will be packed in a printed foil wrapper and sorted by rarity tiers, that way opening each pack will be a cool, suspense-filled experience. After we've distributed the rewards to our backers, any remaining trading card packs will be available for purchase in an online store. If we exceed our $12,000 goal, the funds will go towards producing League Of Faith Heroes trading cards series 2.C.E.O/ FOUNDER:Œæ Edward ErnestŒæCO-FOUNDER:ŒæŒæ Edgar ErnestAfter completing our degree in media arts and animation, my brother and I left Atlanta, GA and moved to Los Angeles, CA to pursue our dream of becoming animators. We now have seven years of combined professional experience. While working at Sony Pictures Entertainment, we had the pleasure of designing and animating web games for big production movie titles such as, Cloudy With A Chance Of Meatballs 2, Grown Ups 2, and White House Down, just to name a few.

Hello Everyone,My name is T.J. and I am from the St. Louis Metro-Area. ŒæI have always had a deep passion for art. An Elegy for Sivar will be the next campaign for the WCRPG system - and I'm hoping to fund an Origin Systems legend to do the artwork for it.The Wing Commander Role-Playing Game (also known as WCRPG for short) is a tabletop pencil-and-paper role-playing game system set in the Wing Commander universe. For those of you who are too young to remember or may have forgotten,ŒæWing Commander is an award-winning and ground-breaking series of space combat flight simulators, originally created by Chris Roberts and Origin Systems, Inc., and was one of the most popular video game series of the 1990s. Starting with the original game in 1990 and ending with Wing Commander: Secret Ops in 1998 (later followed in 2007 with Wing Commander: Arena), the series was known for a number of firsts in the video game industry, including some of the first examples of voice acting, one of the world's first full-fledged "interactive movie", one of the first games that could be played over a network, and one of the first "episodic" video games ever created.WCRPG's development began in earnest in 2011, with the Core Rules completed in 2013. The system was designedŒæto be as flexible as possible, so that players could be as detailed or as carefree as they chose to be. It also was designed as a compendium and primer to the series - players without any prior knowledge of the game universe could pick any era within the whole of the universe's continuity with which to play and have enough information available to them to be able to pick up on the general overarching story-line quickly. Information on how to build home-brew craft for use the engine was also included.ŒæThree adventure modules have been released for the system in addition to the Core Rules - Prelude to Goddard, Enyo and VespusŒæ- the last two of which were created as "miniature campaigns".For the duration of its history, WCRPG has been a completely non-profit project. The individual modules and Core Rules are completely free to download to the general public. In the past, hard-copies were also available, with costs there just covering the manufacturing.An Elegy for Sivar, also known as "Elegy" for short, is the latest WCRPG module currently under development. It is intended to be the WCRPG system's first full-fledged campaign setting, set in the year 2680 in a region of space known as Epsilon Sector. In addition to the campaign setting, a pre-published full-sized campaign will be included. The campaign tells the story of Krahtagh "Bloodeye" N'Ryllis, a Kilrathi pirate whose demise is chronicled in the documentation of Wing Commander: Prophecy. The main plot-line of the campaign will chronicle the activities of N'Ryllis's group, the Demon's Eye Pack, as they attempt to re-build Kilrathi society. The main campaign will has a total of 44 individual adventures planned, though it is structured such that only 16 of these missions comprise the main plot. The module will include enough additional data that player groups will be able to develop their own adventures within the setting. One final and unique feature of the guide will be a Kilrathi lexicon.That's a good question with a simple answer: the purpose of the Kickstarter project is not to fund the development of the campaign guide itself. Rather, the goal of the campaign is to fund the artwork that will appear in it. The artist I hope to hire to do the cover art for the project is none other than Denis Loubet.Denis Loubet is a renowned artist best known for his work on several pen & paper role-playing games and video games. His resume includes work with companies such as KingsIsle Entertainment, Hero Games and Steve Jackson Games, and his work has appeared in titles such as GURPSŒæand Ashen Empires.ŒæHe is also one of the co-founders of Iron Will Games and Pixelmine Games.ŒæHe was the first artist hired at Origin Systems, and was responsible for the design of many box cover paintings, manual illustrations, in-game art and animation, and cinematics for the company. This includes a good portion of the art for the company's two most successful series: Ultima and Wing Commander. His name appears at the top of the credits for Artwork inŒæWing Commander and his name is featured prominently in the Art credits forŒæWing Commander II: Vengeance of the Kilrathi.Recently, Denis has decided to move from working exclusively with companies to working directly for his fans. To that end, he's begun a Patreon project (at https://www.patreon.com/denisloubet) with a goal in part so that he can make his work for his Drawmycharacter site economically feasible. He visited the Wing Commander CIC forums (at http://wcnews.com/chatzone) in February to talk with some of the fans directly - a group that happened to include myself. He indicated that he would be interested in putting together a cover image for Elegy. And that's where all y'all come in:The initial goal of the project is $1,650 - that's $1,500 to pay Denis for his work on the cover, plus an extra 10% to cover all of Kickstarter's fees. At that level, Denis's work will appear on the front cover (and will no doubt be an awesome sight to behold...).The first stretch goal after that is $4,000. At that level of fundraising, the completed campaign will not only have Denis's work on the cover, but will also include portraits of the campaign's major characters in the guide's section on Characters. This would include portraits of Bloodeye, all of the main members of his Demon's Eye Pack, the campaign's major antagonists and a few more important characters. I would give priority to the members of the Demon's Eye Pack in the event that the project raises more than the minimum but less than the $4000 level.The second stretch goal is at $9,000. At that level, the guide will have a full array of art - including the cover and the characters, it will include a portrait in each of the campaign's planned 44 adventures.Should the project raise funding beyond that level, I would investigate the possibility of a vanity printing of hard-copies of the final Elegy guide.As mentioned, the WCRPG Project has always been a non-profit effort, whose finished products are available as free downloads. One unfortunate side effect of this is (in this case anyways) a relative lack of incentives I can give y'all to donate to the project. There are a few things I can offer y'all, however:For donations of $100 or more, I'll add a character to the campaign in your honor. If have any specific requests to go along with your character (like how they look, what their job is, etc.), by all means let me know. You'd have your choice of species and affiliation for that character - be they a Confederate Pilot, a Border Worlds mercenary, a Firekkan Merchantman, a Kilrathi politician...you name it, it's yours.Those giving at least $25 to the project will get their names added to the game's credits, as my way of saying "Thanks for helping this guide be as awesome as I can imagine it being."ŒæAny donation is greatly appreciated; those who can contribute less than $25 will still be mentioned in the credits, though as a "generous contributor" rather than by name.

I have been brainstorming this Idea after I was divorced. I did not want to be separated from my beautiful daughter. The separation left a huge whole in my heart and, I would imagine it was the same feeling for my daughter. I wanted to let her know that she was not alone in her loneliness, So I thought I could bridge that gap of separation. I believe this will be a great way to show other children separated from their fathers or mothers that the love is still there. I have made painting my passion and the pursuit of children's books; My mother says everything happens for a reason and I am inclined to believe her. I am excited for a chane to to shine in children's hearts with vi vivid and healing illustrations that can strengthen relationships. I am beyond honored if your reading this and ask you to say a prayer or meditate towards my dream. My heartfelt hope is that this book will touch the life of children's and parents around this world.Sincerely Jon J. lambertBlessings!!!!

ŒæA Little About The Creator:Hi, my name is Al aka "Al Viino" (Yes... That's two I's...lol). I am an artist, illustrator, painter and the creator of Leo Finito & The Concrete Safari.ŒæI created Leo Finito & The Concrete Safari to be unlike any of the many other iconic "cute and adorable" characters that seem to be the standard, which most people have grown to love, and to aim to entertain adult audiences.When I created these characters I immediately began to share them in my posts online via social media by photobombing friends, celebrities, movies, you name it. After such a short amount of time sharing my posts, I have been able to create a new channel of getting a good amount of traffic, awesome followers and Œæsupporters.Now I am reaching out to the Kickstarter community to share my goal of taking Leo Finito & The Concrete Safari further.About Leo Finito & The Concrete Safari:Leo Finito is the main character out of his obnoxious small crew of stuffed friends from the "Concrete Safari". Each character represents a different set of subliminal emotional barriers that people may find themselves facing throughout life and love.Leo Finito is a stuffed lion with loose stitching and stuffing protruding through his appendages, which signifies that he patched himself up from all the painful experiences he has faced throughout life and love. Due to his past experiences and relationships, Leo Finito has no filter andŒæ carries a nonchalant, obnoxious, care-free, and over-flirtatious demeanor. ŒæLeo Finito & The Concrete Safari was created as a way to creatively express the feelings and emotions that can or might have been taken granted within past or current relationships by adding a sense of what I call "innocent reckless humor". Each character has their own story that I'm confident many others may be able to relate to.About This Project:Iäó»ve been a fan of Kickstarter for quite some time, and after seeing success after success from other awesome projects, I decided to give it a shot.ŒæI have taken each of the nine characters from pencil and paper sketches to completely digitizing each one by myself, and now I would like to be able to take Leo Finito & The Concrete Safari and create a new line of awesome collectible products, and merchandise. By reaching this funding goal, I will be given the opportunity to create prints, stickers, greeting cards and posters. If this project can exceed beyond this campaign with your help, then that would grant the ability to finally produce actual plush and vinyl toys of each character!Follow Leo Finito X The Concrete Safari:

The plan is to offer my co-working space as a studio and place of work for selected individuals from Indonesia and around the globe creating a hub of artists. We would like to assist the array of local talent here by representing them and providing a platform for exposure as well as housing established western artists to work alongside them in a unique collaboration of potential mammoth proportion!ŒæWe will start with Illustration Agency and build from there.ŒæHere is aŒæbreakdownŒæof how funds will be spent.$15-$500 Œæwill be used to purchase art utensils and equipment for Indonesian artists$500-$5,000 will be spent on developing Illustration Agency/ branding to represent emerging talents in Indonesia and sourcing potential artists as well as hosting several promotional events. We will also use these funds for company registration.$5000-$10,000 will be spent developing website and formalise gallery with in Salty Volt.$10,000-$15,000 will be spent on acquiring a location specific for creative studio space. A separate location to Salty Volt where artists can paint, draw and create. A wet space/ creative space/ community studio.We would like to create a mecca of artists that can live and work in paradise, developing their projects while feeding other like minded talents in a range of creative fields while assisting and giving exposure to Indonesian artists.A Western meets Asian art explosion developed from the new, trending capital for hipster /creatives with a surf/ travel fusion. ŒæArt being created alongside the entrepreneur community that visits our island home! Watch artists transform their projects into life, while working from the idyllic surrounds of the perfect office-ŒæSalty Volt.ŒæThe creative juice is flowing like a volcano here already but no one has brought everyone together in unity under one roof andŒæharnessedŒæits potential. It would be the most exciting project Bali has seen in a long time and would send ripples through the arts community, finally cementing Indonesia as a world leader in the arts fields.In short, the concept is to create a data base of leading artists within Indonesia, then scout for Western talents that would consider travelling to Bali to share their knowledge and experience. We would arrange workshops and talks and open the space for events. It would be open to the public and all works developed would be showcased in the space.We will then offer representation by the way of an agency and source work globally using our already established network so the artists can develop their careers and spread their wings, hopefully giving them huge exposure.

As I graduate this May from my BFA program in Illustration, I seek to follow my passion of capturing our natural world through my artwork. This will be my first chance to dive into the world of scientific illustration and work one on one with artists and scientists to expand my knowledge and further improve my artistic skills. The Desert Life Program that I have been accepted into offersŒæa one-of-a-kind, art and nature immersion experience in the Chihuahuan Desert that spreads throughout the southwestern parts of Texas and New Mexico. For generations this desert has been home to a diverse community of unique wildlife and stunning landscapes. During this intense week long program I will be camping on site in order to fully immerse myself into the environment. During the trip I will be studying animal behaviors, analyzing the native plants and hiking various terrains in order to explore the desert. With your generous donations I will be able to fund the flight, my trip in the program and pay for supplies in order to illustrate my discoveries.ŒæI am so excited to have received the chance to follow my passion and with your generosity I hope to make this chance a reality.

Hello to everyone that takes the time to read this. I formerly attended two years of college, one year at an art college, but due to funding issues I could not continue my education as I would have liked. I am currently an independently contracted illustrator and use traditional media but I am lacking the clientele to make a living at it. My art is one of the few things I have ever been passionate about in my life and I hope to make a career out of it. 	What I am starting this campaign to do is to help me follow my dream by helping fund starting an online shop to sell my art. I am creating a shop on ETSY to help me hopefully get my work out into the world and get people to see it. I have designed several small cards that I intend to get prints made and sell as greeting cards, birthday cards, or postcards along with my other work.	This is something I have wanted for years and never possible. What the donations I receive from this campaign is going towards is funding having the prints professionally done. I have found a professional print shop in my city that works with local artist to make high quality prints of there work. 	In order to Pay for the set of prints and supplies to get started I am hoping to raise around $600. Along with the prints the money will be used to pay the fee to have the cards up online to sell them. I donäó»t have much to offer in the way of perks, the set of cards in my pitch image are actually mini cards and not the ones I am intending to get prints made of, anyone that donates will get a hand drawn mini card similar to those shown. Even if I cant reach my goal any funds I do receive will go towards getting whatever prints I can. 	I understand I am relying on the generosity of others to achieve my goal and I donäó»t expect to get rich off of this and understand there is a risk to starting my own shop, it will take time and effort that I intend to put forth to succeed. Over the years I have taken on custom commissions work and done illustrations for people but with help I can expand and get my work out into the world. 	While it will take time for my work to be seen and/or sold I am determined to see it through and help it grow. Because my shop is online I will be using social media to help spread the word about my shop and the work I am doing. 	Even if you cant help I thank you for taking the time to read this and ask that you share this with others and help me to get the word out and bring attention to what I am trying to do, it all helps me. So please help me get the word out and bring attention to my shop. 	So once more, Thank you for anything you can do.

RPG games are my girlfriend's favorite hobby. But I know nothing about it. I'm not a nerd or into geek things by any stretch, but I think it's a really fascinating hobby. D&D, WarHammer, Star Wars, World of Darkness (Geist).... these are the ones she tends to play. The project image is her current RPG character, a tiefling. She asked me to draw her and so I did a quick sketch.ŒæIt got me thinking that this could be a great way for me to learn more about her hobby, and to practice drawing again.ŒæI love to draw, it's the one thing that makes me forget to eat for a whole day while I'm doing it. There's a manga comic I've been working on for years and have a complete script for that I've dropped in the past year due to getting side tracked by life. Admittedly I need to get back into practice. Drawing is my real passion in life, the one thing I cant not do, and I really want to make it my career and focus in life. I'm hoping that this kickstarter will help me raise enough money to make my life stable and give me the practice I need to pursue my dream.So, back to my girlfriend. I want to get my life in order for her, as she's been with me through so much and has always been a source of hope in my life. A few years ago I left school, during another rough patch in my life, and Ive been left with the debt from my student loans. All the proceeds from this kickstarter will go towards paying that down, so that my credit will improve enough for me to get an apartment for my girlfriend instead of always renting rooms. Being able to support her would mean the world to me, and if I can do it while still pursuing my dreams I would be the luckiest person in the world. :)What the funds from this kickstarter will pay for:Thank you for your time, if you have any questions feel free to ask!

AbstractThe basic concept of this project is coating a car in white, matte wrap and use it as a canvas to create a modern mixture of art and design. By backing this project, you are helping me to reach my dream of owning a car that was entirely drawn over by myself and thus creating a piece of art.ŒæAbout MeMy name is Alen Peric and I am a 20 year old guy. I was born in Slovenia where I spent the majority of my childhood. Once I turned 13 I moved next door to Austria, where I attended an art and design school. I also did an exchange year in Vermont, USA where I took some art and photography classes. Last October I decided to pack my bags and move to Canada to live on my own. I have loved art since I was a kid and spent countless hours drawing pictures on paper. It has always been my dream to own a car that was entirely painted by myself and I am hopping that you will help me accomplish my dream.The ProjectI always loved the idea of individualism and since I think owning a car is a part of making a statement about yourself, I have always strived to find a way to show that trough art. What better way is there than taking an object and modifying it to suit your own traits and character?ŒæThat is why I have decided to start this project. I would like to take a car which I consider as an amazing feat of modern design and add my own touch to it. Due to lack of personal funds I would like to turn towards Kickstarter and the amazing people out there to help me fund my project and help me achieve my dreams.Basically the more money we can raise, the better car I can afford to cover in art. For the project I will use sharpies. Most of drawings will be sketched first but I will add some spontaneous art to fill the blank spots. The goal is to cover at least 85% of the car in drawings. I am planning on making several bigger drawings (20x20inch) and several smaller drawings(<15x15inch). I am planning on spending around 60-90 hours on drawing. Furthermore there will be a central topic of the artwork that will get voted on by the community group on Facebook.ŒæOnce done I will make a photoshoot of the car and every backer will receive an email with a couple shots that will make for a nice wallpaper. Furthermore every backer will receive a personalized thank you note from me. If we can reach 10,000$ I will also record a small documentary and upload it on youtube on the making of the art and also every backer will be mentioned in the credits.TimetableCarsDue to the price fluctuation I cannot post exact years of the cars that I would like to purchased but most of these would be purchased used as I am trying to keep the cost of the project down while upgrading the vehicle.CostThe cost will be spread as following:A minimum of 400$ will be spent on a camera that will be used to document the project, about 100-150$ will be spent on Sharpie pens while the rest of the money will go towards the car and the vinyl wrap.ŒæFinal WordsI just wanted to take another few lines to tell you how excited I am about this project and how grateful I am to anyone who decides to support me in pursuing my dream. I have wanted to do a project like this for as long as I can remember as art has been a very big part of my life. Thank you for your consideration and I am really looking forward Œæ to sharing my art with the world.
To putThe piecesŒæ.... together.

Shaun RemeleI have grown to recognize and appreciate the commercial application of art in today's society. For that reason, I became attracted to the field of Graphic Design. Previously, art for art's sake always seemed to be a waste of time to me. Then, I realized: art for art's sake is where the challenge is - and that is where I want to be.ŒæWhile there is a lot of value in my education as a graphic designer, I have begun to venture further with my artistic education. Now, I am closer than ever to achieving a long-time dream of mine: working in the field of Animation Media. And that vision grows clearer everyday.Some of the vision has yet to be realized; there are many things that just can't be learned in a classroom. And that, my dear Kickstarterites (proper noun, fictitious: one who is of Kickstarter),Œæis where you come in.ŒæExperience is hard to come by for a newcomer like myself. Even though I have experience illustrating as a hobby, my graphic design experience does not translate fluently into a more focused, fine-art industry. Animation and Illustration is a whole different beast with its own artistic challenges. And in that regard, I don't carry a reputation as an illustrator or have work experience in media animation. So what is one to do as a student fighting to get to the top of the creative food-chain?The answer is simple: share work, gain exposure, and create a relationships with you: the avid backer.ŒæMy objective can be split into three parts. Primarily, it is my aim to gain measurable experience. Secondly, I seek to achieve a large volume of work to challenge my skills and push me beyond my creative limits. Finally, I seek to achieve a few extra bucks in the proccess as a means to help ease the cost of my continuing education.ŒæPath to success has ever been carved without some hard work; and that is exactly what I am seeking here on Kickstarter. Without the hard work, my successful animated future is nothing more than pipe-dream.Well, besides my affection - which, if you've read this far you've already long-past earned - you can get one of a the many awesome rewards. To stay true to my campaign objective, I have made it a point to obtain as much experience as possible. To do that, I have plenty of rewards that will be completely unique in which that no two people will receive the same end-product.And no, that does NOT mean that the same illustration will be reproduced by hand to seem unique. My aim is to achieve a large volume of work to expand my creative insight. Every. Single. Illustration. Is. Unique.While you may not know what kind of illustration you earned until you receive it, every Illustration is guaranteed to be one-of-a-kind. My aim is to explore numerous medias and work in different styles. This, for me, is an opportunity to grow. For you, it is an opportunity to get a really awesome, unique piece of art.You can check out the reward tiers to the right to explore your options for media sizing, shipping, and quantity. Everything offered is layed out there. Questions about any of the rewards (or anything at all) are welcomed in the FAQs.While I really hope you'll make the decision to support my campaign, I hope that you'll pass it along in the instance that you've chosen to take a pass this time 'round.ŒæAny individual that is interested in supporting a growing artist like myself will be welcomed with open arms!With the community of interested backers, whether it beŒæsupporting artists or a collection of the average Joes, I am confident I can produce the results that I need to compete in the fine-art's game. By allowing me the opportunity to expand upon my current skills as an illustrator, this campaign - with the help of it's backers - will thrust me forward in my journey in having my animated future realized.ŒæThank you so much for your time and support.

My plan for this project is to prpduce a space where artists who can not afford to do so can display and sell their art work. I would like to inspire people who believe that there is no true success in art. They should have a space where they can learn that if there is a will there is a way. I have taken many art classes and know quite a few artists who would love to participate and contribute to the fruition of such a space. This small art venue is only the beginning of a vision. This studio will eventually be pioneered into not only a place to display art work but also to create it. A work studio would be started next where people can get work done in a comfortable environment, either bringing their own supplies or purchasing supplies bought in bulk by myself and discounted to remain affordable. Building an art empire, going both online and global would be the perfect end result of this small scale project. For now I would just like to give people a head start in creating a life they've always dreamt of, a life they can be proud of.

My name is Robert Gant and I have been an illustrator and graphic designer for 10 years now.  Even before that i was dooding and drawing all sorts of things.  Superheroes, aliens, monsters, robots, zombies.In 2014 i felt that i had gotten a bit rusty in my sketching quality.  i made the decision to draw a sketch a day for an entire year.  by the end of the year as you can guess i had (a little more than) 365 sketches.  At first they were rough, not bad but also not too impressive however as the year progressed They got more fun and adventurus.  This 150 page sketchbook is a collection of the best from these.I would like to get these sketchbooks printed to sell at conventions and online as well.  The Kickstarter will if funded allow me to pay for the printing of the book.

"Tale of Null" was written by unpublished author, and my late husband, Dan T. Shaw who passed away in 2014. The book was originally written for our children when they were younger.Œæ After his passing this story was found in his belongings.Œæ It is a rhyming narrative about a little whale named Null who swims with the other whales at sea.Œæ Something amazing happens to Little Null and he teaches everyone a lesson in friendship and kindness.Œæ A talented writer and musician, Mr. Shaw always wanted to see his work published but never got the chance. In memory of him and our first grandchild whom he never got to meet, I have illustrated the book and want to self-publish it in honor of the two. This is my way of bringing the two together.Funds for this project will go toward the publication and marketing of the book.

IYBIŒæis a creative digital agency based in Sydney. We're aŒæweb design companyŒæwith a strong focus on digital strategy and content that encourages interaction. We believe that the key to creating innovative and world class design solutions for our clients is keeping ourselves constantly inspired and learning. To this end, we've developed a series of internal studio projects which we've dubbed 'love projects'.ŒæOur love projects give us an opportunity to see how far we can push ourselves creatively by allowing us to try new things, experiment and explore different areas of our craft - all without the restraints of a client brief.ŒæIt also makes us hold ourselves to our industry's perfectionist standards, which makes us better designers in the process.The most prolific of these projects is our series of illustrated first edition book spines. It all started when we discovered the beautiful cover art that Vanessa Bell created for the first editions ofŒæher sister Virginia Wolf's novels. We took a particular liking to the spines, which are usually overlooked, but in this case stand tall on their own merit.These sweet and quirky spines seemed under appreciated to us, so we decided to do something about it. Our illustrative re-creations shine a spotlight on Bell's original artwork, giving them a new life.If you're interested we also work in areas such asŒælogo design,Œædigital strategy,ŒæbrandingŒæand web development.Œæ

How well do you know Columbus, Ohio? Sure, the winters may be as long and as gray as a wizard's beard,but the beauty and magic of this realm are only as far away as your imagination. Tom and I believe that fantasy and enchantment are all in the way you look at things.So two years ago we put together A Map of Silidor Valley, otherwise known as Silicon Valley or the San Francisco Bay Area, showing the hidden nature of the urbanrealm we live in. One of our fabulous backers and a native son of Columbus, commissioned me to do a map of his home town in the same fantasy style. Our backer is enjoying the original, so now weäó»d like your help getting this map printed and out to the masses. Our Columbourne map will be printed in four colors on high quality vellum paper. The matte finish gives it that old world feel. The 24-by-18 inch size fits in standard frames. Get it through Kickstarter and it will be hand signed by, well, me. We plan on retailing the map for $29.00, so by going through Kickstarter you'll also get a great deal.We've set up a website where we're currently selling our Silicon Valley map and plan to sell this map(and hopefully many others) after the Kickstarter project ends. We have the domain, www.urbanrealms.com andweäó»re not only selling or previous maps, but also a variety of D&D items that I designed. Check it out!Starting with the Bay Area was a no-brainer since we live there. But I'm a Midwestern gal, born in Wisconsin, so it was a pleasure learning about Columbus. From the Horseshoe at Ohio State, to the brewery area, to Big Walnut Creek, Columbus is full of variety and charm. And I now even know what a buckeye looks like! (How could you draw a map of Columbus without buckeyes?)Œæ I'd like to bring Columbourne to you in delicious four color mythicness. We're asking you to help us spread the magic of the äóìrealäó world. We are currently deciding between two different printers for the printing end of the project. Both are reputable businesses with long and successful track records. Our first proofs looks great. Just a few more tweaks and the artwork will be ready togo! All we need is a little financial backing. You can help us make it happen!Together we can bring a little bit of the other world to ours.BookmarksThe bookmarks are hand-antiqued (by me) in a process called tea dying. (As is the background for the original map.) That makes each a one-of-a-kind work of art. After printing and tea dying the bookmarks are laminated and decorated with a ribbon. You'll receive a set of four different bookmarks.T-shirtsWe know you love your city, so why not wear it on your chest? For the T-shirts we enlarged the downtown/ Ohio State area.The shirts are printed by Cafepress. They are available in either black or brown and in sizes from small to 3XL tall.JournalsOur journals also sport a close-up of the downtown/Ohio State area. It's the perfect size to bring with you to jot notes or draw sketches while on an adventure. ŒæSupplied through Cafepress, the journal comes in your choice of blank or lined pages. Tote BagsWe love this realm and we don't want to mess it up, so reuse those bags, people!ŒæCafepress supplies this great bag:MousepadWho doesn't want to see their favorite city attacked by a giant mouse? Bring a little enchantment to your office...Again, Cafepress is doing the heavy lifting, but we got to do the fun part, the great design!Our Original, Silidor Valley MapDo you have a connection to the Bay Area? Get the map that started it all.Framed MapWant artwork that can go straight up on the wall? We offer a simple wood frame in a beautiful deep red-brown that brings out the warm tones of the map. Please be aware that shipping the framed map is expensive. We'll need to add $70 to your pledge for packing and shipping to make sure the frame and glass reach you in tip-top condition.Custom Artwork!For the last two rewards I will hand-draw and antique a fantasy map of the township of your choice! I will work with you personally to make sure you get the township or city done the way you want. Choose either the 18-by-24inch size or a smaller 16-by-20 size. You'll get the original, although we reserve the right to photograph them for reproduction before we send them off to you.A couple people have asked if they could add an itemŒæ to their pledge. Of course you can! The following should cover the costs to get the items made and shipped. Just add the amount below to your pledge and please let me know in a message which item or items you would like to add. Or, if you just want one item, put in the amount of the pledge you'd like to make and let me know which item you want.BookmarksŒæ add $10.00Journal lined or unlined add $12.00Mousepad add $13.00 Tote bag add $15.00T-shirt add $21.00Columbourne Map add $25.00Silidor Valley Map add $25.00Thanks!

IntroHello Kickstarters! ŒæMy name is Rebecca, and I am launching this project to gather support and keep my work absolutely, 100% free. ŒæI make character coloring pages and try to focus on themes that are hard to find. ŒæParents can download and print the images and use for rainy days, travel activities, birthday parties, or whatever other uses they can think of. ŒæYou can view my current work here:becscoloringpages.blogspot.comPages on PinterestHistoryI first started making these pages for my own kids. ŒæThey would inevitably become obsessed with different characters and themes (I'm sure every parent can relate!), so I would continue making new illustrations that we could print and/or color in digitally on the iPad.In 2012, I began uploading my creations on Blogger and making them freely available to the public. ŒæI also created a board on Pinterest to share my work. ŒæSince then, the blog has reached over 200,000 viewers worldwide, and the Pinterest board is also taking off with over 80 followers and 500+ cumulative re-pins.The ProblemI create coloring pages just as a hobby, but creating them and maintaining them takes time and resources. ŒæAfter seeing how many people have enjoyed my work, I would like to be able to expand my collection.I typically create the drawings in one of two ways: digitizing hand-drawn sketches and original line drawings on an iPad. ŒæThese methods have worked in the past but can be difficult to work with and sometimes create low-quality images.Fund UsagesI am turning to Kickstarter to help earn funds to put towards a drawing tablet, creating new drawings, and updating the website. ŒæAll funds raised for this project will go 100% to supporting these three endeavors.RewardsIn return for financial support, I am happy to offer custom drawings to my backers. ŒæIn addition, I welcome feedback and suggestions from anyone backing the project.

The World Wide Wave.Years ago as a child, I had the idea that it would be a funand interesting calling to spend my life travelling the globe with thechallenge of shaking hands with every person alive on the planet. The purpose?It was to be my symbolic bid to promote world peace and friendship from allreaches and corners of earth. Of course, this is not a realistic thing to do äóñit was a mere fantasy and a bizarre one at thatäó_just imagine, as soon as I hadleft one town or village, someone would be born, so Iäó»d have to return to shakethe new born babyäó»s little hand, and can you envisage managing a list of whoyouäó»d shaken and who you had yet to shake? It just wouldnäó»t be a sane challenge, and Iäó»d probablydevelop arthritis of the wrist after a few years from constant hand shaking. Isuppose heads of state and members of royal families get as close to fulfillingthis task as can be expected, and humble little me is not going to out-do themin this respect.However, good and crazy ideas refuse to go away, and Iäó»mstill trying to develop my global handshake. With your help, this is how we cando it:1. I begin in Margate, Kent, UK, where I presently live.2. As a cartoonist/illustrator, I will draw 24 randomcharacters that I meet, waving äóìhelloäó. The drawings will include landmarksthat show the town Iäó»m drawing from and a postcode (area code) where thecharacter was äóÖcapturedäó». I will attempt to shake their hand and get a name ifthey will allow me to do so.3. You might like to buy a reward, which will be a signedand original colour illustration, at Œ£25.00 per illustration of one of theserandom characters. Itäó»s a bit like having a pen friendäó_an image of someonecaptured from the other side of the world äóñ someone youäó»ll probably never meetwhoäó»s waving greetings and good tidings to you.4. There will be smaller rewards of limited editionpostcards, 6 characters per pack at Œ£5.00 per pack.5. The funds that I raise from this project will go towardsgetting my campervan back on the road, and then I can continue the project bytravelling further afield and drawing more people from different backgroundsand cultures. The project will snowball and the number of drawings willincrease over time.6. The project will be self-funding, and The World Wide Wavewill travel from Albania to Mexico to Zambia.7. I will keep the copyright, and you will have a one offoriginal piece of art, which will increase in value as the project develops andgains international recognition. 8. Eventually, the collection of character drawings will bemade into a book. But that bit comes later.Please check out my website to see my characters style ofdrawing. https://www.clarepattinsonillustration.comI will create a Facebook page called The World Wide Wave where you can follow the progressof the travels and characters.

The 48 original constellations were described by Ptolemy in the Almagest, and they were based on Greek myths and legends. Œæ80 more constellations were added over the years, mostly by 17th-Century European astronomers and cartographers, based on travels to the southern hemisphere. ŒæHeroes and monsters were relevant to the ancients, but why couldn't we give the night sky a facelift? ŒæWho says we're not due for Constellations 2.0? ŒæWhen you look up into the night sky, what do you see?My designs will be based upon Johann Bayer's 1603 prints of the constellations. ŒæI want to do modern images, but in that stylized, etching style. ŒæI would like the final images to be color images.Backers are encouraged to submit ideas to me through my Twitter account (@matsallehmanker) and be sure to include #skyupdate in your message. List the original constellation, your idea for the upgrade, and a brief reason why.

I am creating custom T-shirts printed with Destiny fan-art created by me. I originally began drawing these pictures as a way to kind of "get my feet wet" so to speak after having not drawn anything in years, but having the desire to get back into it again. And since I had been playing (and loving) the video game Destiny, I decided to start by drawing creatures and characters from the game.I began posting those drawings on the Bungie.net message boards to gauge the reactions of other Destiny players. The response was overwhelmingly positive, with some forum users even requesting to purchase some of my work!After kicking ideas around a little, I decided to create this KickStarter page to see if anyone out there would be interested in these T-shirts featuring some of my Destiny drawings. I think they're pretty cool, and would look amazing on clothing, and I hope you do too!Oh, and anyone who donates between $30 and $49.99 to me will receive a high-quality art print of an image of their choosing! In addition, donate between $50 and $99.99 and receive one of these awesome T-shirts I'm working on, with a drawing or design of your choosing, in the color/style of your choice. And if you donate $100 or more, not only will I love you forever, but you'll receive both the T-shirt as well as the custom high-quality art print!! Thanks for stopping by!

Receive, add, pass it on.So it's someone's birthday in the office and a card is going around for everyone to sign, a small comment of their own as their link to the birthday..person. They open it, and they see all varieties and personalities, they treasure it.Introduce a sketchbook, and amplify the scale...a lot.The aim here is to collect images, drawings,paintings,prints from all over the world, in one book then publish those results to show how we all connected.Receive: We will send you the pad / sketchbook / paper in an envelope / package suitable for you to re-use.Add: Draw, paint, print out a picture, a photograph, stamp the page - do whatever you want to add to the collage, the only rule is you can't go over someone else's image. Leave your name or nickname and rough location along side your creationPass it on: Get your friends to do it, get your family, heck, get your dog to walk through paint and stamp a foot print or four. Then send it back to us, address provided on request after successful funding.We want to get all sorts of creations from all sorts of people in all sorts of places. Each time the media is sent back to us, we will scan in the results as back ups then send it on to the next person. At the end, we will create a website, a gallery of the results, and publish a hardback book too.The funding limit is low for this project - why? We want to get as many people as we can, should more people want a book for example, that is not a problem, there is no limit to our rewards.Let's draw the globe, and see what the globe draws us.Any questions just give us a shout and we will get back to you before you even know it.

When you have passion for something, anything, the product of that energy will always come through. I have been capturing photos for over 25 years and each time the shutter releases, I am intrigued by the possible outcome. Life is an amazing canvas and I enjoy bringing the nuances of it through my imagery. Its this same focus that helped me developŒæwhat I call "Photo Art".ŒæMany times I would see a photo and envision what it would look like in a different format. Depth and layering, I felt, added another element to a picture. This was the foundation for many fun hours of creative designŒæ&ŒæI was able to bring the images to life in a wayŒæthat IŒæwas'ntŒæable toŒæoriginally.ŒæUltimately, a photo can stand on its own, its message unique and genuine already. My vision is to add an element beyond the reference point, outside the frame, and tell another story within the photo.ŒæCustomized PrintsIf you have a photo you would like me to work on, I would be happy to review the image and let you know if it is possible to create a rendering. Meaning, not all digital images are created equally, it most be large enough in size and resolution.

I have written the first book in a children's series, The Walk a Mile in My Shoes Club. ŒæI would like to update the illustrations in the first book and retain an illustrator for the rest of the series. ŒæI also would like to offer a hardback version of the books.The series is about bullies who learn what it's like to have to deal with the problems that their victims deal with every day. For example, the first book is called MIke and the Deaf Student. Mike, the bully, learns about what deaf people go through every day.I truly believe in the series and I know that it can teach children why bullying is wrong in a new and creative way. They look different, livedifferent, think different, yet share so many of the emotions that we do... anddisplay them so genuinely. TheyŒælive in the moment.They are themselves. They donäó»t pretend to be someone or something other thanwhat they are. They do what they want and donäó»t hold themselves back. They are who we are when we aren'ttrying.Asfar as we, humans, think we have come from being äóìanimaläó äóñ its still there.Next time you sit a bus stop or stand in line, watch that rowdy group ofteenagers, or the mother with her children. Pay attention to their behavior,look past their talk and their attempts at social niceties... watch theirgestures and general expressions. See what they try to hide and what they dowhen they think no one is looking. You will see that animal nature is stillapparent in all of us. Soon at family dinners and happy hours youäó»ll seeŒæobvious animal tendencies in almost everyone you know.Do this with animals you see as well, and you will start will start seeing AuntGladys or your friend Mikeäó»s tendencies in the neighbors cat or a scavengingpigeon. This is what Ugly Animal Cards play on -Œæthe animal in us all.Historically, äóìfineäó pieces of art were placedin ornate, often gilded, frames to show that they deserved respect or possessedmore than what met the eye äóñ ugly monarchs, images of tulips, drips of paint. Inthese frames, they transcended what they physically were and became somethingof worth and contemplation. Animals in these frames were the high-bred steeds,well-groomed lap pets of royalty... never an old crippled goat.Œæ ŒæŒæYetan old goat, when examined, has an established personality, feelings,tendencies - a story - theyäó»reŒæmore than meets the eye.Why not put a gimp goat in a frame - the less than ideal is much moreinteresting than expected perfection. Animals are every bit as individualizedas humans.Anotherinspiration that added to the äóìuglyäó in Ugly Animal Cards, is how ourrelationship with animals or things we love changes ourŒæperceptionŒæof the physical. In reality, our oldone-eyed, obese pug probably smells and annoys others with its mouth breathing.But to us, the owners, theyäó»re nearly perfect - ever worthy of a gilded frame.UglyAnimal Cards are a refreshing twiston the long-loved, card-giving tradition. BesidesŒæenvironmental responsibility, their accessibility tothe public will help encourage curiosity and spread knowledge of the diverseanimal kingdom with little known facts, fascinating species and a gentleintroduction toŒæanimal issues. The fun, playfulcreature on the front invites further examination, while the message insert andfact on the back delivers easily and enjoyably absorbedŒæknowledge. We aim to include only the most interestingand engagingŒæfacts and messages so that reading eachcard is engaging and enjoyable. And in this way, enough interest is gained thateven usually bland or difficult issues can be mentioned without causingdisconnection... broadening the mind.CardFeaturesŒ‡Eco-Happy(Recycled paper, biodegradable)Œ‡Messagesleeve saves time while reducing pressures and stressŒ‡EducationalŒ‡Fascinating,inspires curiosity Œ‡OccasionFlexibilityŒæŒ‡High-qualityprint and feelŒ‡Frame-ableas art!Œ‡Engagingwebsite broadens uses and educatesŒ‡The Animal äóñ Each species is sketched, inked,watercolored, digitally drawn, color-layered and formatted for just the right"ugly" look.Œ‡The Frame äóñFollowing research, eachisŒædesigned to reflect an aspect of the animaläó»s life, use,ŒæhistoryorŒæbehavior. The same creative process as the previous step ensues.ŒæŒ‡äóìPersonal Touchäó Message Sleeve äóñŒæContinuingŒæintensiveresearch, eachŒæanimal'sŒæmostŒæfascinating or unusualŒæfactsand qualities are collected and applied to human occasions, situations, andpersonalities. Only the MOST interesting and little known facts make the cut äóñCreating a clever andŒæinteresting card message sleeve to be used by you!Œ‡Fact on the Back äóñ Selected from the most intriguing oftheŒædiscoveriesŒæduringŒæintense research stage, the fact iscarefully chosen to enhance the experience of the card and inspire curiosity.Œ‡Website äóñThe fruits of research are added to thewebsite in an engaging way to encourage learning andŒæabsorption. Animalissues related to the species are approached from an objective view after thereader has becomeŒæinvolvedŒæwith the species from learning aboutthem.ŒæAdditional message sleeve content is also found here, along with anonline store, animal discussion forums, and [someday] games.Œ‡Construction äóñEach design is made in small batches ina mom-and-pop printing shop, on high-quality, environmentally friendly paper,and carefully inspected. Each "Personal Touch" message sleeve is cut,glued and added by hand. ŒæŒ‡To the People äóñFollowing a successful campaign (withthe AMAZING help of people like you), we will finally be able to make theselittle guys available to the public, to make people smile and inspirecuriosity. A few businesses and zoos have already been approached, but we wereunable to provide the volume they needed. Thanks to you, that can change!!Upon successful funding, we plan to fillzoo and aquarium gift shops, businesses and natural history museums with UglyAnimal Cards. Our website will offer direct orders and shipping, requests forfeatured species, facts on each creature, issues facing animals today and additionalmessage content for each card. I've always had a passion for history, especially that of World War 2. It was a daring, innovative time that changed the world. Some amazing engineering feats were accomplished - from the swift Spitfire to the fearsome Tiger tank. With my passion for realistic technical drawings, I'd love to put the two together to create a photobook collection of 30 of the most amazing weapon systems of the war - as selected by my backers.Œæ Each drawing will be printed in high resolution, accompanied by a short write-up detailing the innovation and impact of the weapon. I'm estimating this project to take 8-10 weeks. And the funding will cover my costs of living and supplies used during this time. All the drawings will be done on 11"x14" paper with graphite pencils. Throughout the project I'll be posting work in progress photos to keep you up to date! Here's a recent sample of my work - a car as much of my previous work is of cars and planes.I look forward to hearing your input and thank you in advance for your support!

Hello,This is an art project. I plan on creating at least 2,000 portraits over the course of the next few months. This is not an easy task, so your patience will be needed. I am going to try and finish 2,000 portraits by July of 2015. In the event that this project becomes larger than expected, and I have more than 2,000 inquiries, the time of delivery will be a bit longer for those signing up after 2,000. Here are some details about the project/how to sign up:- Pay $1 to have a black and white portrait made using any picture you send me with one face in it ( I can also do a pet or baby portrait, as long as there is only one subject in the photo! ). I will use Faber-Castell markers/pens to create your drawing by hand on a high grade 9 x 12 inch paper. When I complete your drawing, I will send you a high quality digital copy.- Pay $3 to have a full colored portrait using any picture you send me with up to two faces in it. Same digital delivery rules apply as listed above.- Pay $10 to have your art shipped to you anywhere in the world.IMPORTANT NOTE: I will open a website where I will host all 2,000 portraits ( including more if I have more inquiries ) for the public to see. The website name will be updated in the future as I have yet to create it. All digital copies of your portrait will be both sent to you via email or message, and uploaded to the website.Below are some pieces I made showcasing the styles you can expect.Special shout out to my friends over at www.tagpro.ggŒæand www.reddit.com/r/tagproŒæfor inspiring me to go about doing this project.A little bit about me:I am a college student studying biology, pre-med, and biomedical engineering at NJIT. I play college level D2 ice hockey. I've been drawing ever since middle school, and have progressively gotten better. I'm good at playing guitar, and a few other instruments. I'm also a fantasy author working on a long novel._Why am I doing this?I have two main reasons for doing such a ridiculous project.1. I want to improve my art skills by forcing myself to work on as many different types of faces as possible, and this is one of the best ways.2. I would like to have money on the side to spend on more art materials such as acrylic paints, canvases, brushes, new mediums etc.

Controversial Cartoons aims to be risky, conversational illustrations designed to make viewers think, laugh or cry. Essentially taking any excuse to draw and reflect the insanity of the world in not so professionally skilled designs. The idea was first concocted when i found myself recently graduated yet still unable to find myself a job better than minimum wage on a zero hour contract. So I thought i would turn my angst into art(?) since my jam business was not successful, nor my beer business as I know not how to make either of these products. So instead of using my degree to mop up my tears and broken dreams, I am redefining my limits and abilities. Here are but a few of the examples of how I have been entertaining myself and hopefully yourselves:ŒæŒæIdeas may be as dumb as stupid word play that I find amusing (simple things, simple minds).ŒæOr a little more real-life based risque and touchy subjects.ŒæŒæOr a little of both.ŒæOr sometimes (a lot of the time) just completely off the bat, feel good images. But each should attempt to start a debate, no matter how trivial or seemingly unnecessary, (and yes it is a true fact that hummingbirds can eat eight times their own body weight a day).ŒæBut hopefully you will enjoy and support this project.ŒæAnd now new and improved styles and concept. If the old fashioned pencil and paper isn't for you, then maybe these vibrant pieces will be, introducing Kimpotamus Kardashian. Other saucy semi aquatic mammals to follow!
I need help getting to the Pacific Crest Trail, where I will be hiking for five months this summer, so I can sketch and write and figure out what to do with my life. Thank you.Œæ

My projects requires the purchase of colored pencils, inks, dry and oil pastels, paint, erasers and brushes for tools.My project also requires the purchase of various sizes of paper, matting and frames starting at 4"x6" on up.Extra funding goes towards packaging, pamphlets on causes, promotion and distribution.Subject: Life experience, anatomy, cognitive research, family, self imagery, health issues, causes/organizations (Autism, Heart Disease, various cancers, MADD, DARE etc..) and of course custom requests from clients.Thank you,~SjM

Having had years of experience with the tarot, I am more than capable of conceptualizing a deck. Only trouble is... I can't draw. So, I need to hire an artist. And then find a publisher.Since the card designs I envision are relatively simple, I should be able to pay an artist to create a deck (according to my conceptual specifications) within a year's time.The four suits of the minor arcana will consist of Matches, Bowls, Doobies, and Bags.The twenty-three (as opposed to the traditional twenty-two) cards of the major arcana will be classified with names like Stoned, Visionary, and Secret Stash (to name but three).This should be a fun, lighthearted collectible of a deck that will still serve as an effective oracular device.In addition to the cards themselves, the deck will consist of a paperback guide outlining the unique interpretations of all seventy-nine cards, which I will write myself.

Introducing Ich bin ein Berliner! A radical new zine on various themes including all things German, American popular culture, donuts and political graphic art from around the world. This 32 page mini zine hopes to embrace all things German much as the U.S President John F. Kennedy aimed to do in his 1963 speech "Ich bin ein Berliner", which roughly translates as I am a jelly doughnut. The zine will feature in a visually graphic way, some of the rich culture and feel of Germany which charms so many and at the same time offering a witty perspective. This is the first issue of of an ongoing zine which I hope you will all enjoy.It is completely hand made and printed by myself and hope to be able to distribute them across the UK and ROTW. In need of funding for the production of future issues.

ŒæI am Mark Lovett.ŒæI have been blessed with the enormous responsibility of managing the portfolio of my father Paul Lovett and his nostalgic and historical artwork of Atlantic City and the Jersey Shore.Those that knew him were conscious not only his tremendous artistic talent, but also of his kindness good nature, excellent character and wit.ŒæIts been critical of me to assemble his portfolio and to preserve it for posterity. I have contracted with a fine art and graphic studio in Philadelphia called Silicon Gallery to work on the important project of digitizing his portfolio and making sure the quality and integrity of his work is maintained to the highest standards.This has been a painstaking and difficult process which has been very labor intensive and expensive.The digitizing has been very successful. It will still take resources to get it done so hence I am here looking at you for help in this laudable and purpose project preserving the history of Atlantic City and the Jersey Shore.

Project Voice is a humanitarian non-profit pilot projectthat aims to bring a voice to the voiceless and underprivileged community ofLos Angeles. In spring 2014 Project Voice partnered with Maryvale,a local group home for underprivileged girls, and the oldest orphanage in LosAngeles.ŒæThe objective of Project Voice is to bring a äóìvoice to thevoicelessäó by having the girls of Maryvale create a book which will be acompilation of the written works that they wish to share with the world.Since these girls are wards of the state, this project iscollaborating with college students majoring in fields such as Fine Art,Graphic Art, and Animation in order to help create ghost writer characters, oralter egos, that the girls of Maryvale created themselves. These ghost writercharacters will allow both the girls to identify with the book and give themany contributing students an opportunity to expand their portfolios.This Kickstarter is designed as a call for support from theLos Angeles community. Project Voice is seeking to collect funding in order topublish a diverse collection of written works authored by the girls of MaryvaleOrphanage in Los Angeles County. Donationswill help with: äó¢ Writing & Editing Process äó¢ Illustrators and their artwork äó¢ Printing and Processing äó¢ Delivery to those whom have contributed compassionately. ŒæWhile thinking of names for the book, as a joke I said thatI feel like Charlie and that they were my Angels. Jaredäó»s Angeläó»s ended upbeing the title of the first edition of Project Voice.YourDonations will help bring a voice to the voicelessand allowthese girls voices to be heard. This piecewill greatly benefit those involved.

This project is simple and straightforward. It is no surprise that something so simple as your mail has become a boring daily task.Lets change that.... We are doing this just for fun and giggles.All our cards and envelopes are made of environmental friendly paper.Thank you!Andre and Peter.
