I am an over-the-road truck driver, and I earn a goodliving.My wife has ridden with me for10 years or so.When we would come homeabout once every six weeks or so, we enjoyed our daughters, sons in law, andgranddaughters.The situation at homehas changed, and now my wife needs to home, and I now spend entirely too muchtime away from her.I would like tostart a home based business, that I might afford the cut in pay required to geta new job where I can be home a lot more often.I suppose I would need a computer, some software, a website,and probably a printer as basic equipment to start a little postcardbusiness.As a truck driver, I try to sendmy four granddaughters postcards from the various States I drive through.I have discovered that some States are verydifficult to get postcards in, and a proper selection doesnäó»t seem to beavailable on the internet.I think I canremedy that problem as well.I guess Iäó»m looking for a little kick start, for a littledream.Thanks.

IYBIŒæis a creative digital agency based in Sydney. We're aŒæweb design companyŒæwith a strong focus on digital strategy and content that encourages interaction. We believe that the key to creating innovative and world class design solutions for our clients is keeping ourselves constantly inspired and learning. To this end, we've developed a series of internal studio projects which we've dubbed 'love projects'.ŒæOur love projects give us an opportunity to see how far we can push ourselves creatively by allowing us to try new things, experiment and explore different areas of our craft - all without the restraints of a client brief.ŒæIt also makes us hold ourselves to our industry's perfectionist standards, which makes us better designers in the process.The most prolific of these projects is our series of illustrated first edition book spines. It all started when we discovered the beautiful cover art that Vanessa Bell created for the first editions ofŒæher sister Virginia Wolf's novels. We took a particular liking to the spines, which are usually overlooked, but in this case stand tall on their own merit.These sweet and quirky spines seemed under appreciated to us, so we decided to do something about it. Our illustrative re-creations shine a spotlight on Bell's original artwork, giving them a new life.If you're interested we also work in areas such asŒælogo design,Œædigital strategy,ŒæbrandingŒæand web development.Œæ

Hello Sunshine Lunchbox/Backpack Notes make people feel special - giver and receiver. ŒæA sweet little note worth its weight in gold.What needs to be done is to spread the cheer. ŒæSo, my goal is have these printed. My quote for 1500 notepads is $4000 from a great printshop outside Boston- USA. ŒæExcellent Quality. The notes are on disc and we're ready to go! ŒæA larger order would supply lots for donations.

I work in the film business as a union member in the scenic department. You meet a lot of interesting people...most of them are former or, current practicing artists. The problem of course with attempting to practice your art form while maintaining employment is you inevitably are forced to make some sacrifice in either your art form or, your main source of income. We have the flexibility of being able to choose the jobs we work on in theory. We are freelance after all but, that choice comes with consequences regardless of the choice being made. Either you work more and have less time to focus on the passion that drives you or, you work less and sacrifice the capital required to fund that passion. The days of the starving artist are almost over...we work now - we have to. The struggle is still there though.I think everyone has some creative passion that drives them...I think you have to in order to thrive in our world, 'fit in' in our country, and be capable of appreciating and accepting the film, television, video games, vine videos, and endless sources of creative and innovative entertainment that we've all come to expect from our world. Even if we don't have the means of creating ourselves, all of us certainly find appreciation in the creation. It's a responsibility I believe, for us all to support that creativity. Whether we do so by enjoying the entertainment provided to us or, in this case investing in an artist who just wants to share something with another and create something worth mentioning. The reason I am looking for funding is so I can simply continue to create and hopefully inspire others to do the same with the success that comes from it. But, I NEED YOUR HELP! Your investment is fundamental to the success of this experiment.ŒæTo be totally clear in regards to what you'll be receiving...If you decide to pledge, after the funding period has closed, you then will have to send me a photo of a person of your choosing. After I verify your pledge, I will then take that photo and use it as a reference to draw a monster. It wont necessarily look like the photo or have all the elements in the photo but, I will try to capture your essence from the photo provided best I can and incorporate that into a monster/creepy thing. Thank you!

What is Icons of the 20th Century?For some time I have been sketching rock stars, actors, writers, and various images of the people who made up the entertainment industry in the 20th Century. Sometimes it was someone who influenced me, or they were in a movie or two that I really was captivated by their performance and stage persona. I am going to create illustration of high quality roughly 11 x 17 in charcoal, watercolor or acrylic. I will create various icons or you can select one you have in mind if you help me out!Why do we need your help?Unfortunately, Dave Dockery of RockStar Art's illustrations came to a halt in 2010. Like many people in America the last five years have been rough. We lost a lot including all my art supplies and every piece of art I ever created was burned up in a fire. It was tragic, but thankfully nobody was harmed. I had just photographed all my work just weeks before so I can show some early sketches of this idea.ŒæWhat type of art are we creating?The illustrations will be roughly 11 x 17 or a size similar to that so that it would be suitable for framing and large enough to adorn a wall nicely. The mediums I work in are: pencil, charcoal, ink, pastel, chalk, acrylic, and watercolors. I would either choose an icon to create and do it in the medium of my choosing, or if you are a rewards winner you may pick it.ŒæI have some names and if you have any ideas for an icon I would love to hear them. The names will be from the various decades of the 20th Century to include as many decades as I can and really could be an almost endless list of icons of the 20th Century such as Charlie Chaplin, Tex Ritter, Clark Cable, Judy Garland, James Dean, James Cagney, Johnny Carson, Marlon Brando, Elvis Presley, John Lennon, Marilyn Monroe, John F. Kennedy, Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Jim Morrison, The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Neil Young, A Hank Williams, James Stewart, Madonna, Clint Eastwood, Elizabeth Taylor, and Kurt Cobain are just some of the ideas that I've come up with off the top of my head. I would be happy to take any orders from you and I am offering rewards for certain size donations.ŒæFriends, I need your help and support to create more art. It's what I do. I also am writing a few e-books, but this is so important to my creative life and to keep me active. My health is not very good, but I plan to keep fighting for as long as I can. I do have some drawbacks, but I hope that you will continue to support me and if for some reason you order something and there's any problems my wife will be happy to work out something to return the favor. We don't anticipate any such problems.ŒæThank You for your support and I look forward to sharing with you my creations, my babies, my world...the world of RockStar ART!For more information or to request certain illustrations, please contact Dave Dockery at Rock Star Art: rockstarinart@gmail.com

Artist Liam Alexander is transitioning from illustrator to graphic designer, and the money will be used to buy a graphic computer, software, art supplies and a web designer. My Story:"I have always had a love for art and design. Whether I was producing it myself or it was produced by someone else. I've been drawing since I was little, one day my older brother, age 6 at the time, was finishing drawings from school. I, 2 years old at the time, asked if I could draw too. My brother said I was just a baby and babies canäó»t draw yet.ŒæI wasŒælittle upset, my Mom, my best supporter, said for him to humor me, she handed me a pencil and paper and to everyoneäó»s surprise my brother and I could draw very well. She knew I had skills when I won, at the age of 3, the Sir Galahad coloring contest. I had to color in front of the Judges for them to believe it first. When I was young, I saw myself having an art collection. I attempted to start an art dealer partnership, with two girls from my street and my brother. We cut out magazine pages and glued them to construction paper to sell them for 25 cents. My Mom still chuckles about that story, she was our biggest supporter, buyer, and backer. The human face fascinates me and I am obsessed with detail, but I was no prodigy, However, I did win 3 scholastic art awardsŒæall wer 9untitled0 one a pastel on colored paper bull head the other flowersŒæstill life. I also recall another charcoal on colored paper still-lifeŒæand one of them hung in the Library of Congress, in D.C, an untitled graphite on paper, self-portrait. I got distracted working as a carpenter, but one day I picked the pencil back up and my friends loved it. They encouraged me to share this and give back to the world. My cousin introduced me to commercial art and I hand painted a business sign for a car shop.But I really honed my skills in the last 9 yrs. I was pretty much self taught through workshops and tutorials until I got with a great Art Instructor, Lynnmarie Fye, with Hope Valley School SystemsŒæin Central Ohio. My story continues:This Art Instructor honed my talent in my Photorealism art techniques, they are in graphite, as you can see my artwork in this field in the opening video also,Œæthat is a form of altering the original which was in print, butŒæI made sure that when working on them that they mostly explode as my own work, because it was my techniques thatŒæI wanted to be seen. It is called Photorealism, yes that is a real category, it takes great time, focus and concentration to reproduce as realistic as possible the artwork I work on fo those who will pledge for their personal Graphite Portrait for Special Edition Pledgers.ŒæAlsoŒæto reproduce a special portrait or picture that was damaged and this is what people love about my work, it is extraordinary, and rare to master. I was toldŒæI have a unique talent to give as seen in my graphite artwork in the video. Yes even your tattered picture you have been carrying in your wallet of you and your grandfather's car (even encluding signsŒæof dating, such as creases, as seen below orŒætheŒætear drop of joy Great-Grandma shed on Grandma's and Grandpa's Wedding Photo)Œæfor years can be reproduced withŒæmy Photorealism art techniques (one person only, head &Œæbust shot only) SpecialŒæEdition pledgers will receive. Because of the time, once again, focus and concentration needed for this syle of art there is a limited number I can reproduce for you (one person photos only, head & bust drawings onlyŒæduring this project campaign)ŒæAny others will have my special attention after this Kickstarter ProjectŒæChampaign, for Graphite and other medium Photorealism Portraits, restoration projects, also the enlargement ofŒæ "that first date at the Fair" poto booth picture for Mom and Dad's 50th Wedding Anniversary.I wanted to share my art with you and my communities around the world. All can be arranged after this campaignŒæhas ended. 71 More Hours to go.ŒæNow I tutor an adult art class and volunteer designing T-shirts for an anti-bullying campaign. I even landed a shoe deal that willŒæput prints of my ArtŒæwork on shoesŒæwithŒæBucketFeetŒæ and sells them at Nordstrom and many other stores also in 25 countries.To Liam AlexanderŒæJul 10Thanks for joining the BucketFeet family!ŒæŒæGet involved!Thank you for supporting artists!The BucketFeet TeamFrom here, you can create a new submission, review and edit previous submissions, and update your artist profile.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Now here is where I am, just landed a shoe deal that will print my art work on shoes that will be sold at Nordstrom, and many other stores around the world. Because there will be a high demand for my work, and with the transition from an illustrator to a graphic designer, Iäó»m working on launching a Kickstarter campaign to raise money for a new graphic computer, software, art supplies and a web designer, and I could use all your help. ŒæRaising children, funding Business adventures and other ventures, now retired, my backer is still my biggest supporter and buyer. However, we still need your support.I and many other Artists can agree with BUCKETFEET OVERVIEW: Today, Bucketfeet exists to celebrate self-expression and connect people through art. Hi! I'm Jay and I have spent my life as a commercial artist, illustrator, sign painter, and other stuff to pay the bills. I'm excited about this project because it combines my love of books and art. It will include the traditional looking bookplates, some very detailed and some simple designs like old woodcuts. There will be animals, bookplates suitable for kids, themes for scholarly types and themes for those who love mysteries, detective stories, weird monster zombie stuff, and history. I have about 50% of the drawings already done and I will add updates with peeks of new ones as the work progresses. The originals are mostly done with micron archival pens and brushes on acid-free paper. I paint commercial signs for a living, but this kind of work is fun and satisfying, and much nicer in the winter than working outside in the cold.Some of the reward levels include color bookplates. These designs are of my choice since color isn't always appropriate for every design. I feel confident Œæyou will be happy with the art pieces! ŒæIf the funding exceeds the minimum, I will add extra surprise goodies to each of the mailed rewards!I've experimented with different adhesion methods. My favorite is the glue sticks you can find at any office supply store. it's clean, quick, and cheap. The pre-gummed bookplates from the old days were messy, tended to curl, and frequently stuck together in humid weather. Some people will want to use these for art projects or even framing, so they come with no adhesive.Œæ

I don't have a story except I want the world to be covered in these awesome prints.ŒæWouldn't your life be a little happier with one of these?The $800 basically covers my printer and some paper.

I am a big admirer of anything creative and want the chance to bring two of my passions together film and art. I have been buying independently made film posters for over a decade and I love collecting illustrations/art from upcoming artists. After working with Paul Jackson on my latest clothing release I had the idea to use Paul's amazing talent to help visualise and create the unique film posters that I have longed for.What better way to start this beautiful and (hopefully) long relationship with the film of the year 'Interstellar'. Paul's incredible detail has brought this fantastic film poster to life and created not only a poster but a piece of art.We have plans to make this an ongoing partnership and want to give you film lovers, something to remember your favourite film by or to simply have a cool piece of art adorning your wall.

You can include important dates, names, adjectives and phrases to personalize the letter of your choice. I'll take care of the rest.ŒæI hope to exceed my financial goal with this project and deliver as manyŒæpersonalized initials as possible. We never tell the ones we love how we feel, much less show them how we feel. This project was born to change that!

Using the limited resources in prison, Carole Alden has created magical characters and beings. ŒæEach drawing takes thousands of minute strokes, and weeks, to create. Limited edition prints of these drawings will be numbered and signed by the artist, to finance a studio to replace all that Carole lost when she was incarcerated after killing her violent, abusive husband.We are offering limited edition prints of three of her amazing colored pencil drawings. ŒæThe editions will be approximately as large as the number of pledges we receive for each piece (allowing a few extra in case of damage / mail problems, etc.). ŒæThe three pieces are as follows:

Your Environmental FootprintŒæThis may sound overly ambitious. Quite frankly it may come off as absurd, but we are looking to change the approach to environmental responsibility. Whether you believe in global warming or not, it is undeniable that in our commercial world, each one of us consumes resources and generates carbon emissions. Be that by driving, buying products, eating food, heating our homes, showering, or wiping our bums.ŒæThe reality is, that there ARE many legitimate challenges to being environmentally conscious. We can't all afford the latest large impact green tech like electric cars, LED lighting overhauls, new appliances, etc., and lifestyle changes like public transportation or carpooling may also be impractical given ourŒæschedulesŒæand families.ŒæThat said, we should all be responsibleŒæand make efforts to reduce, re-use, and recycle. But what happens when this isn't enough?ŒæOur solution on its surface is simple. We've all been taught to recycle, re-use, and reduce, but the reality is that we should also REPLENISH! It takes time and lots of innovation to cut back on our behaviors, but we can offset our environmental impact by replenishing everyday! We want to help make that rewarding as well! Here's how:1) We design awesome wearablesŒæand greeting cards;2) We plant trees for each reward;3) You are helping the environment! ŒæThe overarching concept is "offset what you can't reduce", and we want to make that as painless and routine as possible. Imagine if a majority of your existing purchasing needs, habits, and passions, could also contribute to offsetting emissions and supporting a healthy planet!ŒæWe pondered long and hard about how we can fulfill the equation of you doing something, getting something, and helping the planet. It just so happens that the holidays are around the corner and it also just so happens that greeting cards are still a mainstay of sharing our joy and thoughts with others! It's a given that we all also like swag!For each of the reward tiers we'll be planting trees. We plan on planting sugar maples and white spruce trees and these will be planted in partnership with conservation authorities across Canada. The planting will take place in Spring, 2015 and we will keep track of all trees planted and provide updates and pictures on our website as well as including a map of planting site!Each 5 trees over the course of their mature lifetime are able to offset approximately 1 tonne of carbon emissions, and it is estimated that in North America we each generate about 5 tonnes every year directly! There are also hundreds of thousands of acres of trees disappearing annually! Help make a difference! Replenish what you can't offset!To help entice you into planting trees, we are developing custom greeting cards that include artistic re-creations of some memorable and culturally iconic moments.ŒæThe digital cards will all be provided in high resolution suitable for a variety of sharing methods either as ecards, wallpapers, etc.ŒæJUMBO PRINTED CARDS: The jumbo greeting cards will be printed on 100% recycled matte finish paper. The inside/reverse will include a certificate of the trees planted with our ecocadet logo!Conceptually, we've been able to find manufacturers that produce some of the types of recycled wood swag we're looking to provide. We will need to submit our own designs and ensure that the products are all made from recycled wood.ŒæTHE BASE DESIGNS: We'll be providing you custom design USB, Shades, and aŒæWatch with our stains and engravings!ETCHINGS - We will be provided a custom engraving on the pieces which includes the EcoCadet badge and indication of the number of trees that you helped to plant! This will be engraved on various parts of the swag. On the watch this will likely be on the band, on the frames of the glasses near the temple, and on the face of the USB!CUSTOM DESIGN STAINS: We invented two new colors...which already exist as colors...but that wouldn't be as unique! Deep Woods Red & Pine Haven Green! We will incorporate these colours in each piece of swag. BTW we're from Canada Eh! So its colours not colors!Our grandiose ambitions have humble beginnings. We are professionals living in a metropolis, with Œæa passion for nature. Our story is about helping you make a positive environmental impact without the traditional challenges that you may encounter:1) Transparency: Knowing that your contributions, when you make them, are actually being applied toward the cause. We want to make that clear. First by planting trees on your behalf and reporting on where and when we planted them. Long term, this may involve developing specific habitats, planting crops to later harvest for communities/social services, and supporting key projects.2) Share-ability: Being able to share your contributions on behalf of others to encourage a greater change and awareness. We want you to be able to gift your support to others. To help spread the mentality and responsibility of environmental responsibility.Œæ3) Tokenism: As much as we may all want to donate, we all also work very hard for our money, so an exchange that leaves both parties with a gain is preferred. You could argue that this is the fundamental cultural challenge, but again we are looking to making environment responsibility a more transnational process, which requires some mutual exchange. So, we want you to feel that you are getting some really nifty items including wearables and tech, for your efforts while still offsetting your impact.4) Complexity: It shouldn't be difficult to offset your environmental impact or to support an environmental cause. In fact, it should be silly simple. We want to establish a simple yet comprehensive platform.5) Efficiency: Each year thousands of companies and charities spend millions if not collective billions on eco projects. Their efforts are treasured, though arguably fragmented which by its very virtue results in a loss of efficiency. We aspire to develop a more cohesive and collaborative space for environmental initiatives.So to be clear, our story isn't about advocating living off the grid, or constantly upgrading your home to more efficient lighting, or developing carpooling plans that don't fit your schedule. If you can do those things, we encourage it! But our approach is more about 'offsetting' your impact.Œæ

Hello, my name is Jeff and Im an artist, designer and all-around maker from Duluth, Minnesota. I have a love of vintage advertising and design. I especially enjoy fruit crate labels and a while back I started to dabble with an idea that uses these labels as inspiration for a line of illustrations I call The Duluth Crate Co. Duluth, Minnesota and the north shore of Lake Superior is a special place. There are many things to see and do and the region also has a grand history that spans over a century in the building of America. Being an inland port, Duluth welcomes ships from all over via the Great Lakes where it takes iron ore, grain and other raw materials to places all around the world. Duluth is a major tourist destination as people love the history, arts scene and overall beauty of the region. Because there are so many things to see, learn about and do, these places in and around Duluth became subject matter for my line of illustrations that make these places into a äóìbrandäó on the side of a fruit crate. What started with a handful of experiments has grown into a current line of 35 prints of Duluth and North Shore inspired prints.ŒæThe Duluth Crate Co. has been in local gift shops, galleries and art fairs offering different sized prints, framed prints, mugs and other types of dí©cor and products. Currently, they are only being sold online at duluthcrateco.com.Where you and Kickstarter comes in.After local success and much learning, dreaming and more dreaming, it is time to branch out and start offering these prints in the likeness of special places from all over the United States. The American Collection will eventually have many places from each state and will be continually added to the offering as they are finished. As of right now, there are 20+ new prints of places from around the USA (Some states have more than one right now). This initial offering will be at least one print from each state and more to be added over time. What I need is help with printing the initial offering of my 8x10, 11x14 and notecards for each place. Right now Im basing my offering off a printing of 50 each of the print sizes and notecards per place which equates to over 7500 pieces!Below is a list of the planned places for this initial line. As I finish up the remaining illustrations to round out the initial line, I will announce the new images on the Duluth Crate Co. blog, the email newsletter and shared on social media.--------------------------------------FacebookŒæ| Twitter | Instagram---------------------------------------Alabama äóñ Russel Cave National MonumentAlaska äóñ Mt McKinley, Denali National ParkArizona äóñ Grand CanyonArkansas äóñ Ozark Folk CenterCalifornia äóñ Golden Gate BridgeColorado äóñ Mesa VerdeConnecticut äóñ Mystic SeaportDelaware äóñ Brandywine ValleyFlorida äóñ Kennedy Space CenterGeorgia äóñ Okefenokee SwampHawaii äóñ Pearl HarborIdaho äóñ Sun ValleyIllinois äóñ Willis TowerIndiana äóñ Indianapolis Motor SpeedwayIowa äóñ Lake OkobojiKansas äóñ Dodge CityKentucky äóñ Kentucky DerbyLouisiana äóñ Natchez SteamboatMaine äóñ Acadia National ParkMaryland äóñ Fort McHenryMassachusetts äóñ Plymouth RockMichigan äóñ Mackinac IslandMinnesota äóñ Split Rock LighthouseMississippi äóñ Vicksburg National Military ParkMissouri äóñ Gateway ArchMontana äóñ Glacier National ParkNebraska äóñ Chimney RockNevada äóñ Hoover DamNew Hampshire äóñ Mt. As long as there has been Rock N' Roll music, there have been outrageous antics perpetrated by larger than life rock stars. From Keith Moon blowing up hotel toilets with fireworks to Ozzy Osbourne biting the head off a live bat on stage, the material is endless... and hilarious! I'd like to create a coloring book which depicts 25 of the greatest scenes of Rock N' Roll excess and drug-induced shenanigans. The coloring book will be roughly 60 pages long, with 25 original black & white illustrations depicting scenes of rock star antics, such as: Ozzy bites the head off a bat, Keith Moon blows up toilets, moments of Phil Spector craziness and lots more. The pages opposite of the illustrations will feature the story behind these infamous moments. There will be a "Thank You" page, Table Of Contents, and other standard pages. Like the project image above, the book will be somewhat adult-themed, so you may want to reserve it for your friends and keep it away from the young kids.The money being raised for this book will be going toward the legal and publishing costs, getting an ISBN, the first printing costs, and other various costs related to publishing the book. I have done two other coloring books on Kickstarter, so I am using the budgets from the previous projects as a guideline for this one. The only difference is this time I will be using an artist to create the illustrations instead of myself, so the budget is a little higher, but the quality should be better as well.If you'd like to see examples of my other coloring book projects you can check them out by clicking on the below image or link to my website.http://www.clecoloringbook.com/Thanks for looking! Help me make this thing happen!

Where it all beganMy Visionarium was born from many nights of trying to help our little people get to sleep when they couldn't settle their mind. Sometimes active imaginations, troubles of the day or a busy lifestyle can make it hard for children to relax. Gone are the lazy days where children are free to daydream and pretend. Let's bring back the magic of childhood with this beautiful and unique product. Suitable for all ages, abilities and interests. My Visionarium will take you wherever you want it to.What is My VisionariumA pack of 21 circular cards, approx 19cm in diameter. Each card portrays a different scene...some realistic and some fantasy. The scenes are created with beautiful illustrations, designed to help children explore their imaginations. The reverse of each card explains activities that parents or caregivers may like to use to prompt their child to create their own version of the scene. Included within each scene are hidden treasures to be found. Some are easy and some are hard, but each one appears just once on every card.ŒæSuitable for use when its bedtime, waiting for appointments, stays in hospital or during quiet time.ŒæCards will come beautifully packaged for easy travel and will include an information card to explain their different uses.Œæ

As a group of avid basketball fans, we are embarking on a mission to illustrate the complete history of every single professional basketball team. Since we are a group of loyal Chicagoans, we are starting (day 1) with The Chicago Bulls Tree and will continue to release a new design concept from a different team each day. We are looking to appeal to all basketball fans. We know you love your team, your city and have fond memories of the stars of your childhood. Now, you can relive every moment with a Burton History Tree of your favorite basketball team.Our very first basketball tree will be for the Chicago Bulls. It is a striking visual collage of the legendary NBA franchise and a beautiful piece of art doubling as a chronology of the Chicago Bulls organization. Depicting over 250 players, 44 Hall of Famers, 6 world championships, and countless elements of Bulls lore, this tree provides a comprehensive display of the Chicago Bulls entire history. Each player and achievement in the tree, from Jerry Sloan and his fellow team pioneers to Air Jordan and the äóÖ90äó»s Bulls dynasty, is arranged in chronological order and sized by significance, with multiple fonts by position. Relevant historical images are included to bring your team to life. ŒæEach tree has a corresponding 'key', allowing you to easily understand the science behind this artistic revelation.Burton History Trees are one-page history books. They are beautiful, engrossing, easy-to-grasp illustrations that encapsulate the history of an entire sports franchise or musical genre in single vibrant images.Burton History Trees bring the history of your favorite sports team or musical era to life. The content of each tree is uniquely arranged in chronological order and sized by significance.The the story is told from the beginning to end, without turning pages.By combining names, images, and sketches, Burton creates a one of a kind piece of art that is the ideal conversation piece.A Burton History Tree is the perfect gift for any sports or music enthusiast.ŒæViewing The TreesRoots: City skylines, stadiums and other architectural elements that make up the franchise. ŒæTrunk: The individuals or teams that proceeded the current franchise chronologically or geographically and would influence the future of that team.Foliage:ŒæEvery player that ever played for the team. ŒæThe size is the number of games played and the font is their position with the team.In 1978, when Bruce Burton wasfrustrated by the lack of information available on British rock, he had a suddenflash of genius: use the traditional family tree format to create the historyof his favorite musical genre. Bruce was obsessed with musical history and howbands influenced each other. He typographically coalesced the names of hundredsof British bands, along with a wealth of drawings and icons into onepicturesque illustration of a tree. Popping with different sizes and fonts, theband names moved chronologically from older bands at the the bottom of the treeto newer bands near the top. Through considerable research, he found a way tochronologically link the musicians who gave birth to the genre and ultimately led to some of Britain's greatest rock music. The treeexpressed the legacy of British rock in dazzling visual form. This was 1978 andno one had seen anything like it before. Everyone Bruce showed it to lovedit. He found a way to reproduce his tree onto lithographic prints and a newart form was created - The Burton History Tree.For the next thirty years,Bruce was driven by his insatiable love for music and sports and he continued toconstruct his trees entirely by hand, spending a painstaking 6-18 months pertitle. In 2007, Eric Fine - a fan of Bruceäó»s art sincechildhood - approached Bruce with the idea of digitally producing a tree usingmodern technology. Bruce loved the idea. In 2008, Eric and Bruce alongwith fellow graphical artist Drew Wasserman, founded the new BurtonHistory Trees, LLC.The Chicago Bulls History Tree is the first product of our Kickstarter. Each day we will update you with designs of a new franchise from the rest of the 29 professional teams.Œæ Your pledge will help provide the resources we need to invest in production, distribution, and licensing of this line from NBA Properties, the intellectual property holder for the National Basketball Association, their Player's Association and their retired player's association, Legends of Basketball.Shortly after this Kickstarter ends, we will be exhibiting in the Sports Licensing and Tailgate Show in Las Vegas. We hope to connect with other leagues, franchises and universities to create Burton History Trees of their own while we are there.Œæ Our goal is to bring this artform into the limelight and partner with bodies like the NBA in what should become long-lasting and mutually beneficial relationships.Œæ Effective 12/30/2014, we will offer any of the music trees currently in print and offered for sale on our website, BurtonHistoryTrees.com.Œæ Assuming we prevail with our funding goal, all backers will receive a survey through Kickstarter to get more information on the specific titles you would like and the format (shirt size, etc.) -- at this time you can select any of the 30 Pro Basketball Teams or anything else in our portfolio.ŒæUpon successful funding of this project, and assuming continued, safe growth for our company and pending design studio we plan on being able to complete the rest of the major professional sports leagues and division I universities by end of year 2016. ŒæIn the meantime, if you would like for us to create your team's tree sooner, that is what the $2500 custom tree option is for. ŒæThe $2500 reward provides a great gift for your university or a great fundraiser for your non-profit or civic organization. ŒæWe are happy to make those for teams near and far, but in the event a mass market exists (i.e., Manchester United, Dallas Cowboys) we are able to produce one for the $2500 -- prints and reprints, etc. may require time while our legal team secures the proper licensing for all involved such that we can work together to bring those products to light.

Hi,I'm Rik Pattenden and I am a pen and ink artist from Hampshire, England. All of my work is hand drawn and you can see some more on my website, chaosworks.co.ukI am looking for funding to produce and distribute a 13 page calendar for 2015, using the first twelve of my 'single line' pen and ink drawings (see below). I feel that crowd funding is ideal for producing calendars as they have a sell by and use by date. This way, only as many as are required would be printed.Limited edition, signed calendars will be exclusive to this Kickstarter project and not available anywhere else! The calendar would be A3 size (300mm x 420mm) and printed on 200gsm gloss stock. Each one to be signed by me on the front cover and delivered in time for Christmas. I began this series last Summer and it took me a little over 6 months to complete this first twelve. Each original drawing measures 48cm x 48cm.Each picture is a single line with a beginning and end. At no point does the line cross itself. Hours of fun can be had trying to find all the ends and my initials, R.A.P, which also appear within each picture!Some things you may not notice right away but you'll have a month to study each one!This first twelve in the series are all based around ideas of contrast and relationships.Full size, signed lithographic prints are available as Kickstarter rewards or through my website.ŒæOriginally this was just going to be a set of twelve but has now become an ongoing series, the next instalments to be released later this year. Please do not hesitate to contact me, should you have any questions.Thank you for your interest.

My name is Leigha Jenkins and I am a portrait artist based in Washington, DC. Art, specifically portraits have been my primary subject...Thereäó»s something amazing about creating a personality, a moment, and most importantly an emotion, bringing character, expression, and emotion to life in a drawing has always been a delightful and learning process for me.ŒæI work with graphite, and sometimes mixed media.ŒæI feel I've been blessed with a special gift and it's incredibly satisfying to know that I can use my talent to bring joy into the lives of others. I strive to achieve the physical, spiritual and emotional characteristics of each person I draw. Women have been the most intriguing subject to put on paper. I've always enjoyed and have been fascinated by the female form."My Daily Portrait Drawing 31" is a project where I create a daily graphite portrait for a whole month. ( 31 days ) I plan to start the project on December 17, 2014 until January 17, 2015, before the start of the spring semester of myŒæsophomoreŒæyear inŒæcollege. ( if the project reaches it's goal before or on December 12th, it will allow me to start early. Œæ:) )I'd like to bring this project to light in a huge series of portrait drawings, to travel outside of my comfort zone, to push my limits and develop my skills as a portrait artist in a fun and enjoyable way.ŒæPlease help spread the word by sharing this page with others!ŒæYou can view more of my work and updates here:Instagram: @LMJCreationswww.facebook.com/LMJCreationsTHANK YOU!!! ^_^Solely inspired by portrait artist Michael Shapcott.Michael-shapcott.com

Frank's Adventures tells the tall tales of a short dog as he gets lost in the woods and, in the process, finds his place in the world. It's a heart-warming story of adventure, family and home, perfect for adults and children alike.Meet Frank. He's a two year old Chihuahua mix. He likes long walks, treats, napping, and a rousing game of tug-of-war. Frank is also an experienced adventurer.I was fostering Frank for Sugar Mutts RescueŒæwhen he ran off one day on a road trip into the woodsy Catskills area of upstate New York. Frank was lost in those woods, which are filled with deer and wild turkeys and foxes for an entire week. We searched everywhere for him, combing the woods, putting up signs in local towns, and enlisting the help of internet communities. After a very long week, I received a call saying Frank had been found! He'd wandered up to someone's porch and sat down, a little fatter and none the worse for wear, ready to go home. As soon as I saw him again and watched him wiggle his way into my arms, I knew I was keeping him forever.ŒæSince then, I've been listening to Frank tell his stories about adventuring and exploration. I don't know how much of it is true and how much is embellished, but he tells a pretty good story so you're sure to enjoy it. That's why I decided to write it down for him and illustrate it. The underlying message of the story is about finding your place in the world. Through the story of Frank's adventures, the ideas of foster care and adoption (applicable to both dogs and children) are handled with a gentle sense of humor. Directed primarily at children aged 4-7, it's a fun read accompanied by beautiful images and a heartwarming message for kids and adults of all ages.ŒæThank you for your help in bringing Frank's Adventures to life!https://www.facebook.com/FranksAdventuresBookFor your generous donations, you will get one or more of the following:

The colour restricts the print size, so the cupcakes will be 47cm tall x 37cm wide.ŒæI am a passionate young local artistŒæstriving to become a successful graphicsdesigner, and about to commence my third year at Massey University with the aimof graduating with a Bachelor of Arts Degree, withŒæHonours in VisualCommunication Design.I am motivated to have my hand craftedŒæillustrations transformed into printed teatowels because I feel they will be theŒæperfect gift for any occasion, moreover,this project has allowed me to truly flex my wings as an artist.Although I have had some difficulty inŒæreducing the printing costs of the teatowels, theirŒæmulticolouredŒæappearance will be a visually pleasing addition toany kitchen.Thank you for your much appreciated support.Kaylie Preller :)Œæ

Help Mano start her own creative digital studio so that she can save third party costs associated with digitizing & printing her artwork. Even though I retired from pastoral ministry 16 years ago to become a family therapist (click here), my 23 years of parish work as an ordained clergy person left an indelible appreciation in me for what pastors do. During my time as a pastor I sold hundreds of gag cartoons to Leadership Journal, Christianity Today, Youth Worker Journal, and dozens of other publications. This 84 page book contains over 300 of the best of the lot.My goal is to raise funds to print this item and give copies to the 60 pastors I know in Whatcom County, Washington. As Blanche Dubois said in A Streetcar Named Desire, "I have always depended on the kindness of strangers," This book will be my (our!) gift to them for the often thankless work they do in offering emotional and spiritual support for strangers, both churched and unchurched alike. My comic art gets rave reviews and here for the first time we'll have the best of the best gag cartoons between two covers.My incentive to recruit large donors ($100) will be a hand drawn caricature of you using photos that you provide. My work can be seen at www.artbyerik.com. After leaving pastoral work I took up caricature art and drew thousands of faces at fairs, corporate events, and festivals.ŒæPlease help me fund this freebie to clergy persons. If you're a person of faith I guarantee your pastor will love this item. He or she needs a dose of humor! And if you're a person of no faith this will still be a boon to society at large. Pastors are hard working men and women who provide valuable services and this booklet will be my (our!) way of cheering them on.I have self published over ten eBooks which are for sale on Amazon. This project will allow me to print a hard copy book which is a preferred way to appreciate cartoon art. There are quarterly gatherings of pastors in our county where I will eagerly distribute this gift from "the kindness of strangers."ŒæThanks for your help! Pastors are going to love this book!

I-MICE 7 uses original art and literature as tools to make good character and moral principle culturally relevant and culturally understood.  I-MICE 7 involves the creation of 7 new books and 105 new pieces of art that are stimulating, provoking and geared to build good character.  The youth will be intimately involved in this creative process.Good Day to All of You,We are TripGear Character Navigation.  We work with a broad spectrum of learners teaching and encouraging them to be of good moral and principle, and we do it through original art & literature.We're not satisfied with our kids being intelligent and JERKS!  We want our students to makes those äóìAäó»säó while also at the same time understanding that those Aäó»s wonäó»t give them hugs at the end of a lonely night.  What about those äóìCäó students?  We believe that if it comes to the choice of either being an A student or an upstanding person of character, well, good character wins the day.  Without good character, a smart and sophisticated man or woman (in the traditional sense) is a smart and sophisticated criminal.This is why we're asking you to partner with us in this spectacular exhibit of both art and literature that we call I-MICE 7.  Help us help others become emotionally and morally intelligent.What is I-MICE? I-MICE (Image, Metaphoric, Inspirational, Character, Encourager.)In short, I-MICE is the name given to all the art we create.  Every piece has the express purpose of imparting some lesson or commentary about society, people, violence and a host of other topics.  These symbolic illustrations (I-M.I.C.E.) are geared to evoke a visceral response from the viewer. This all-original art contains subject matter that is both culturally familiar and thought provoking, pushing viewers to contemplate just how they relate to the scene while exercising their mind to find the deeper meaning in the art. It provides learners an opportunity to reassess their own character flaws and build the character traits needed to resist negative influences.  I-MICE themes include: community, domestic abuse, anger, bullying,education, relationships, gang indoctrination, drugs and more. About the äóÖ7äó» in the name, I-MICE 7: The äóÖsevenäó» refers to the seven new illustrated books we are assembling during the course of this project. The stories are already written.  It is now a matter of editing and publishing them in physical and digital formats; this is the portion we need your help in.Every book we create is illustrated (with I-MICE) and teaches a lesson in building moral character and resisting the forces that seek to keep us in bondage.  The 105 I-MICE pieces created through this KickStarter will be divided across these 7 new books as story illustrations.The literature and the Art both work off each other.  We find that even learners that abhor reading are drawn into the literature by the I-MICE art.  The art poses a question, äóìWhat does this mean?äó  The literature provides a more concise answer.  The art compels students to read for that answer!Students as Creators! Though TripGear will bring I-MICE to life, our students will be the concept creators, establishing the concepts for 50% of the art.  Now, not only will students derive value from observing I-MICE art, but they will place a more personal stake into the art as they create concepts for other people to be enriched by. It makes a difference when the learner creates something.  It is magic to see the look on their faces when their imagination comes to life as a physical product. Thereäó»s a sense of pride they gain.  Theyäó»ve become more than consumers that take.  Now, they give.With I-MICE 7, our youth will exercise giving value to the world äóñ quite literally.The Product äóñ Whoäó»s it For? The 7 new books and the 105 I-MICE are for everyone.  Up until now, we have spoken to the use of these materials with school students, but these product donäó»t only appeal to the young; it appeals to the full-grown adult as well.  It is our experience that I-MICE art causes the same curiosity and awe in adults that it does in young peoples. One of the main end-goals of this KickStarter is to place I-MICE art and stories into more classrooms while making it all available to the open public as well.  Weäó»re looking to change lives both inside and outside the classroom.  Upon project completion, I-MICE art and literature will be made available for sale online at: http://tripgear.org/index.php/m-storeWhy TripGear is Capable of Accomplishing This Task Weäó»ve done this all before but on a much smaller scale and at a much slower pace.  As a small committed staff, over the past 4 years, weäó»ve created over a 100 pieces of I-MICE Art and have self-published 7 books (Art of the Close, Jack Gun, Night before Xmas, Leo the Lion, Blackenstein, Trip volume I and II).  Weäó»ve been implementing I-MICE to great success in learning intuitions for just as long, so this is not an experiment. I-MICE works and compels some of the most distracted of youth to pause and reassess their life choices. Financing has been our chiefest obstacle in making the books and I-MICE Art widely available to students and the public.  We already have the stories; theyäó»re complete. We already have the capable people in place to make I-MICE art a reality.  We need your support to kick this operation into overdrive. Letäó»s make life-changing, perception altering art and books available to more people and at an even higher quality and polish than it already possesses.The Breakdown: ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ  I-MICE 7 äóñ Over 100 pieces of I-M.I.C.E. art spread across 7 new books.		1) We are assembling 7 new books.			äó¢ The stories comprising these books are already written.			äó¢ The books need to be edited.			äó¢ Books will be formatted as paperbacks and eBooks.Œæ			äó¢ (scroll down to view the book titles and book synopses)2) The creation of 105 new I-M.I.C.E. illustrations.			äó¢ The 105 I-MICE will be divided evenly across the 7 books (Roughly 15 I-MICE 					per book) serving as story illustrations.			äó¢ The 105 I-MICE also serve as stand-alone images to be used in a variety of 					ways including exhibitions. 3) Students as Concept Creators.äó¢ Our students will be the Concept Creators, establishing the concepts for 50% 					of the art.			äó¢ Now, not only will students derive value from observing I-MICE, but they will 					place a more personal stake into the art as they create concepts for 					other people to be enriched by. 4) Availability to the world.			äó¢ All of this effort will make both I-MICE and the 7 new books available to the 					open public.  Our ultimate goal is to positively and powerfully affect 					people - whether young or adult - inside and outside the learning 					institution.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------1. Our team will create an average of 9 I-MICE illustrations per month over the course of 12 months. Each book will spend approximately 2 months being edited and formatted into physical and digital books. Along the entire 18 month course, we'll make select pieces of I-MICE art and literature publicly available for sale upon their completion.Œæ That way, you can see the project actually progressing.The first batch of I-MICE and the first book (Trip: Volume 3) is set for release in March 2015. The "Phoenix" was my first complete drawing in this style. It resembles my revival as an artist. I created it during a huge transition in my life and hope it makes a positive impact on others. Some view it as a peacock, some a phoenix. Either way, it is what YOU feel it is. It's the same with all my art in this style. It is designed to be interpreted by the viewer.ŒæBy pledging to this project you are helping an artist start her career.ŒæThe goal with this project is to help cover the cost of printing art, as well as to get this unique style of art out into the world. All money earned beyond the printing costs will go toward the time involved in creating the art, as well as living expenses. This project is the first step toward my goal of returning to school for a Master's Degree in Psychology for Art Therapy.ŒæThe "Seahorse" was my second drawing in this style. It was an experimental drawing that allowed me to try entirely new drawing techniques, as well as various styles within the same drawing.ŒæThe "Prehistoric Squid" was another experimental drawing as well as a meditation drawing. The repeating shapes and stipples allowed me to reflect on life while I focused on the drawing. It allowed my brain to wander and think about the world we live in. I was inspired by fossils, marine life, and spirals, so I combined them into this abstract creature.Œæ"Bird of Flowers" was my first attempt with detailed, stylized branches. I hope to use this style in later drawings within this series. This drawing is another that is difficult to decide what type of bird it is. I started with a crow in mind, but it morphed into this final image.Œæ"Sea Turtles" was my fifth drawing in the series. I started using some new shading techniques and blur affects within the stipples of this one. I also added a combination of coral, kelp, and bubbles to create movement and depth within the drawing."Paisley Fish" is the latest drawing within this series. I was inspired by paisley patterns, beta fish, and a balance of male/female shapes. This drawing is still in progress, but will be complete by the end of this project's funding duration. This one has been, by far, the most complicated and time consuming of the series, but I feel the time has been worth it. It has been a very therapeutic drawing with all the repetitive shapes, added depth, and patterns.REWARD INFORMATION:Kickstarter edition prints: 11" x 17" prints on 80lb cardstock with a kickstarter edition watermark on the bottom left along with the print number, artist signature, and date.Special edition print sets: 11" x 17" prints on a custom, tinted paper to create a vintage ink look (will post an example soon!). Each print will have a watermark on the bottom left along with the print number, artist signature, and date.Only three of the original are still available and are being offered as rewards for pledging to this project.ŒæI have plans for more drawings within this series. Future drawings will include dolphins, an octopus, monarch butterflies, and any others that come to mind along the way. Feel free to follow my website, facebook, or twitter account for more information throughout the length of this project.If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

My name is Ken Handley and Iäó»m a freelance graphic design artworker by trade with over 20 years in the industry. My job entails using the Adobe graphic software - Indesign, Photoshop and Illustrator of which Iäó»ve used since my university days.ŒæMy mastering of this software has helped me develop a style to create highly detailed illustrations using Adobe Illustrator. This software is vector based, what this means is that when you draw a shape, no matter how large you scale it up, unlike a photograph or Photoshop produced work, it retains itäó»s edge, so what you see in my samples given would look exactly the same if blown up the size of a football pitch- this to me is what my style is about- my canvas if you like is my Apple Mac and Adobe Illustrator is my brush.What I do is take photographs - in this case- vintage Vespas and Lambrettas. They have to be crisp photographs in which I may only find a few out of several taken as the right photos to use. I then reproduce those photos in illustrator often painstakingly tracing over individual pixels and using my judgement to re-create the light reflecting off these surfaces so that chrome looks like chrome, plastic looks like plastic and glass looks like glass.I have recently finished illustrating a Vespa-The time taken to do this was equivalent to working 3 months full time hours. The detail was quite pain-staking, please see the following images to get an idea of the detail.-ŒæThe next illustration I'm working on is a Lambretta that is covered in lots of head lamps, this is the photo-ŒæAs you can see there's lots of lamps to illustrate! This is my progress so far-ŒæHere's the lamps up close, you can see the detail in them. I estimate 3 months solid hard work to complete them.

Hi, John is my husband he is an awesome artist. He works a full time job as a bricklayer for 25 years. For now he works 10 hours a day 6 days a week. When he comes home he draws for about 2 hours a day. He has hundreds of different kinds of drawings. He has a unique type of drawing almost like Picasso. I think many people would like this type of art. I showed him this site today and he said sure put me on. This is all he would love to do. As a child he wanted to be an architect but we all know how life gets away from us. I wanted to do this for him as a gift of his great talent. I also gave him water colors and what he did with them was quite amazing. I am not sure he knows how truly amazing the water colors turned out. I think he has a real place in art with a type people desire. The funds will be used for paper, pencils, envelopes, stamps, frames, and of course his time. He can pull it off because this is ALL he does that part will be simple. I named it John's World because you are about to enter the mind of Johns world. Enjoy.

As a tattooist and fine artist based in Austin Tx, I spend much of my free time working in other mediums outside of tattooing. Through this exploration, my Chameleon came to life a little over two years ago and has since become my branding image scene on my portfolio, business cards, and other outlets. The follow up to this series is a sugar glider named "Luna". A creative interpretation on my nocturnal companion who often spends time with me at the drawing table.I am frequently approached by art enthusiasts wanting to own these for themselves. As a very personal project, I haven't felt quite comfortable letting the originals of these go. Many people, especially in the tattoo community, often ask for prints which is what led me to Kickstarter. I simply wanted a way to affordably supply anyone with an interest, the option to have a very high quality print to frame, hang, and call their own.ŒæI have spent a lot of time preparing the digital files, and working with a local company in bringing forth something enjoyable, possibly more so than the originals themselves. I'm hoping the outcome may surpass expectations.ŒæThank you for your support in the art community and backing my project!

The purpose of my project is to help share my art with the world. My passion is drawing and more specifically drawing today's most influential media to me such as Movie/ TV Character's and also music album cover's. I had the drive to draw when I was younger, however over the years I became busy with work, school, and other life plans, that I lost my passion to draw. However over the past year I have rediscovered that old dream and have decided that I want to make a career out of it. Therefore my project is to create a better established website, gain a better knowledge and more skills in the art field, as well as share my art with the world by branching out in the art community. I plan to achieve this through taking art courses at the University of Missouri starting Spring of 2015, practicing, and also contributing my hard work and dedication. Although there may be some times that I fail, I want to strive for my absolute best in making this dream become a reality.

The calendar features an extensivecollection of artwork depicting the most infamous serial killers in the world.Œæ Deemed too controversial for retail sales, the arresting images were created by some ofthe worldäó»s most talented true crime artists.In addition to the evocativeart, the calendar includes extensive information about the human monsters that are depicted within.Œæ It is the kind of gruesome stuff that the BAU from"Criminal Minds" would dissect.ŒæThe artists featured include: Chad O'Connell, Chuck Hodi, Erick Diaz, Gerald Torbitt, Jack Malebranche, Johnny Machine, Nate Milliner, Nicholas Raimo, Nicolas Castelaux, Pete Berg, Rowan Andrews and Uriel A. Duran.The concept for a serialkiller calendar was born from our collaborative friendship,when we were students at the University of Maine at Orono. ŒæWe decided to secure the rights to paintingsdone by Nico Claux.Œæ Dubbed The Vampire of Paris, Claux was notoriousin Paris for his appetite for human flesh.ŒæŒæClaux began painting in aParisian prison while serving time for murder.ŒæArt was his vehicle for rehabilitation and personal growth.TheSon of Sam laws, designed to keep criminals from profiting from the publicity oftheir crimes, prevented Claux from selling his art in the U.S.Œæ We decided to bring his artwork to thepublic. After much debate, we agreed that a calendar would be the best formatto curate the art. We created the original calendar in 2007.ŒæŒæDespite receiving great fanfare for the calendar on the Internet, we were turned down by every major retailer because the content was deemed too controversial.ŒæŒæThe calendar was covered by Reuters and the AP and the producers of Law and Order SVU invited us on set.ŒæBased on the fan reception to the first calendar, we decided to create a much more ambitious calendar for 2008.ŒæŒæWe were fortunate to have renowned authors and artists contribute their work.ŒæŒæWe made a deal with Hot Topic and they ordered calendars for 300 of their locations. We expanded by creating The Serial Killer Magazine.ŒæŒæWe were able to secure an agent in Los Angeles who got us a distribution deal with Borders and Barnes and Noble.ŒæJust when it appeared that we had finally made it, everything fell apart.ŒæŒæHot Topic rescinded their order, claiming that it was still too controversial.ŒæŒæOur agentäó»s deal required that we front all of money for printing costs and would only be repaid nine plus months later once all of the merchandise was sold.ŒæŒæBeing two college students (in the pre-crowdfunding era) we couldnäó»t make this work financially and were forced to set aside our dream get äóìreal jobsäó.ŒæTheŒæemergenceŒæof crowdfundingmakes it possible for us to revisit the Serial KillerŒæCalendar.Œæ No longer are creators beholden to theeditorial whims and price margins of massive retail corporations.Œæ The 2015 calendar is our best work to dateand we cannot wait to bring it directly to you!ŒæWith the support of the Kickstarter community, we are looking to raise enoughmoney to meet the printing companyäó»s minimum order quantity.Œæ We can then bring the calendar directly tofans without any gatekeepers censoring the art and driving up the price.If the project issuccessful, we will continue to create original content and hope to create acommunity on our website www.SerialKillerCalendar.com.ŒæŒæThe Rewards:

However, the unknown painter has a name and he is found on kickstater: We are a group of independant software and game designers with an obsession into all things undead, paranormal and techonlolgy. My great uncle owned this Expedition. He and I were very close and he recently passed away. Many days as he was close to the end, he and I would sit in his house and watch The Simpsons. I want to adequately honor his memory in a way that he would love. He was a light-hearted man and would love to see his daily driver used to commemorate him. Help me honor him in a way that will be fun for the whole community!

Hello :) Thank you for stopping by!This KickStarter project is aimed at helping me begin selling prints of original ink drawings(original size: A4) of landscapes from my homeland of Goa on the west coast of India. I would also draw and sell original work on request.The ultimate aim of a (hopefully!:))successful project is to raise funds to set up a self-financing reforestation programme and a general clean-up of polluted and biologically significant areas of urban and rural Goa. It will involve anyone who wishes to preserve what is left of the natural environment of this planet and living in or travelling to, Goa.ŒæThe first step will begin with guided bicycle rides and walks into the non-built up areas around the heavily populated coastal region of Goa. This aims to highlight 'urban' non-human biological life, including many migratory species of birds, endemic primates and other animals and plant life that face extinction.ŒæProgressive steps will involve 6-12 hour expeditions further inland and later, 2-3 day long camping trips. Eventually I hope to have established a self-sustaining programme of activities that are sensitive to the environment and sales of which will actively help preserve the biological diversity of the region. These wouldŒæinclude mountain biking, trail running, kayaking/canoeing, hiking and even tree and rock climbing:) )Here are some more examples of my art work that is the focus of this KickStarter project :)Here is a link to the Google Maps satellite image of Goa. Even a little bit of zooming in shows the devastation cause by decades of open-cast strip-mining and logging and the devastating effect on water bodies :(ŒæŒæhttps://www.google.de/maps/place/Goa,+India/@15.3472129,74.0149304,144165m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x3bbfba106336b741:0xeaf887ff62f34092?hl=enHere is a link to the 'Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund' (CEPF)Œædocument from 2007 that profiles the 'Biodiversity Hotspot' of the Western Ghats of which Goa forms a part :Œæhttp://www.cepf.net/Documents/final.westernghatssrilanka_westernghats.ep.pdfExcerpts from the document :Œæ"Biodiversity in the Western Ghats is threatened by a variety of human pressures. Of theŒæapproximately 180,000-square-kilometer area in the Western Ghats region, only one-thirdŒæis under natural vegetation. Moreover, the existing forests are highly fragmented andŒæfacing the prospect of increasing degradation."Œæ"The Western Ghats comprises the major portion of theŒæWestern Ghats and Sri Lanka Hotspot, one of 34 global biodiversity hotspots forŒæconservation and one of the two on the Indian subcontinent. The area is extraordinarilyŒærich in biodiversity. Although the total area is less than 6 percent of the land area of India,Œæthe Western Ghats contains more than 30 percent of all plant, fish, herpetofauna, bird,Œæand mammal species found in India. Like other hotspots, the Western Ghats has a highŒæproportion of endemic species.""In addition to rich biodiversity, the Western Ghats is home to diverse social, religious,Œæand linguistic groups. The high cultural diversity of rituals, customs, and lifestyles has ledŒæto the establishment of several religious institutions that strongly influence public opinionŒæand the political decision-making process.ŒæConservation challenges lie in engaging theseŒæheterogeneous social groups and involving them in community efforts aimed atŒæbiodiversity conservation and consolidation of fragmented habitats in the hotspot."
