A lot of us water-lovers bond together to enjoy and identify with the pleasures that are found near the water...much like others who are enthusiastic about what THEY like to do, I proudlly declare that WE are " Lake Tramps ".All the characters are fictional but in the end, it's me...and my family...oops. Sorry kids. But now, the lucky observer can look in and find something familiar in these activities that make us all smile just a bit.The artwork is hand drawn and painted by the artist. My style was nurtured by years of Mad Magazine and a deep appreciation for the talent of Norman Rockwell...I can best discribe it as " Looking at America thru the Bushes" Today, there's a growing pile of paintings, of which any or all of them could end up as prints, cards, calendars, shirts, water bottles and even a board game (what?!! )Floating the Boat....Funds go towards a high quality production of all the Happy Trampy Times that I can create: Inventories must be maintained, on-time shipping, good customer service and new product development keeps everyone happy. ŒæAND the "studio" must be supported, so it's a new canopy for the camper, propane gas for the winter heat and a clean shirt and haircut for the appearance on the "Today Show".....mercy....

I have created a silent story book aimed at both children and adults called take me where the wind blows, It tells an emotional tale of a character who is born in a wood workshop and takes part in a curious journey to discover the wilderness and escape the dull greys of the city. The book has been illustrated using a rather experimental and unique method, taking a wooden articulating character that I completely hand carved from the edible gum tree and decorated myself. I then took him out into the real world to photograph and illustrate my story.

This project has no commercial background but is purely cultural.We are heading to print a book ( art-catalogue ) on the lifes work of german artist Uwe Groíô who died in 2013 at only age 50. The paintings he left behind are worthy to be shown and more visible to the publicŒæ and we are strongly hoping that one day a Museum will take them on .Read his lifes story and artists biography below Please consider that even a small pledge will help and maybe one day his works will be shown in your country too.His art remains...This is the touching life story of a brave and talented man, the German painter Uwe Groíô. As a child Uwe Groíô (born in 1963) already felt that he was born to draw and paint. After high school he gave in to his fathers' wishes that he learn a 'real' profession and joined the school for industrial design (www.hfg-offenbach.de). However, it felt wrong to him and he was unhappy. He quit industrial design and applied to study at the international famous University of Art Stí_delschule in Frankfurt am Main, Germany (www.staedelschule.de). The first time he applied to the Stí_delschule, he was rejected, so he took on a job as a taxi driver. During his time as a taxi driver he continued to work on improving his painting style. One year later, he attempted his second application to the Stí_delschule and was rejected once again. Nevertheless he was determined to study there and while continuing his taxi job, applied for entry a third time one year later. This time, Jí_rg Immendorff (de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jí_rg_Immendorf)was a new professor at the Stí_delschule and recognized his talent and accepted him into his class. Uwe studied with Immendorff from 1989 until 1995 and graduated from the academy as Immendorffs' first master student.To offset the age old problem of making a living as a young artist, Uwe took an odd job as what he called a 'waterman'; delivering the giant communal water bottles to high-rise office buildings in Frankfurts commercial district. He worked all day, then drove his bicycle to a shared studio and painted till late at night. Surviving on very little sleep, he followed this schedule for almost 20 years. During these years he created hundreds of wonderful and stunning pieces of art and had many exhibitions, but never quit his job as 'waterman'. Most of the people for whom he delivered water never knew who this kind, gentle and hardworking man was in reality.Uwe joined me on a short trip to the Biennale of Art in Venice, Italy on his 50th birthday in fall 2013. He collapsed with an extremely high fever the day we arrived and had to be taken back to Frankfurt and straight into hospital. There he was examined repeatedly, but the fever did not go away and the doctors did not find the cause. They sent him home in a weak condition after 4 weeks. Two days later, his physician send him back to the hospital. This time to the university hospital with the best modern facilities. After another 2 weeks of often very painful examinations and in a very bad condition they found out that he was suffering from lymphomic cancer, which had already weakened his immune system to a dangerous level. The doctors allowed him home for 2 days to settle a few things before he returned for a planned chemo therapy treatment. I took him to the ward, and that was the last time I saw him. The doctors told him, that he probably had a severe infection which they could not locate and they were going to put him into an artifical coma and wake him up after about 6 days when his body would be stronger again. A few days later, still in coma, he died of multiple organ failure, exactly 2 months after his 50th birthday.Uwe left behind a huge heritage of art to the world. We, a group of close friends, want to fulfill his life goal to give his art to the world. The paintings and sculptures should be exhibited and made visible to as many people as possible to give them joy and inspiration. We are going to exhibit the life work of Uwe Groíô on a larger scale. The first exhibition in 2015 will take place in Frankfurt am Main, Germany at the new location 'Honselbridge' at Kunstverein Familie Montez ( look for pictures and informations on Kunstverein Familie Montez on google ). Everybody involved with this project; photographer, graphic designer, handymen, ect. has agreed to work free of charge. However, we still need to cover the printing costs of approximate USD $12.500 for a hardcover catalogue on Uwes' complete body of artwork. Kunstverein Familie Montez has agreed to sell those catalogues during and after the exhibition which should help to cover part of their expenses. Please consider supporting our work and making this very important project possible !If you wish to get a small glimpse of Uwe Groíô at work in his studio in 2010, follow this link ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NfTjfZciiFw )Many thanks in advance to all for your generous contributions.KrisArtists biography1963 born in Frankfurt am Main, Germany1981-1984 study of industrial design at the HfG Offenbach1989-1995 study of fine arts , painting, at the University of Art Stí_delschule, Frankfurt, Prof. Jí_rg Immendorf1995 first master student of Jí_rg Immendorff2003 assistant professor at the Kunstakademie Hohenaschau2013 died in FrankfurtExhibitions ( selected ) :1990 first group exhibition at Stí_delschule1992 cooperation work on stage background for WDR -TV ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ studio on the ART COLOGNE1993 solo exhibition ' Cafe Cult' Frankfurt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition gallery 'Experiment Kunst', Frankfurt1994 group exhibition Mc Cann Erickson,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition gallery 'Experiment Kunst', Frankfurt,1995 cooperation work on interiors of the C+L by students Stí_del1996 solo exhibition gallery 'Experiment Kunst', Frankfurt,1997 group exhibition of studio 3. Etage,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ wallpainting for Prof. Dr. Dr. Brost ( Stí_del ), Frankfurt1998 permanent installation at studio Hasslinger, Sobernheim,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition 'Preview' of the master students ofŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Prof.Jí_rg Immendorff, museum Kunsthaus Wiesbaden2000 solo exhibition ' Wandelnd in der bleiernen Zeit' gallery ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ KunstWerk, FrankfurtŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition 'Aktuelle Positionen in der Kunst', galleryŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ KunstWerk, Holzhausenschlí_sschen Frankfurt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition gallery 'Esplanade' Bad Dí_rkheim2001Œæ solo exhibition gallery 'Esplanade' Bad Dí_rkheim Œæ2002Œæ group exhibition gallery Maria Kreutzer, Amorbach 2003Œæ solo exhibition 'couch potatoes' gallery kunst-raum, Essen,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ exhibition Kunstverein Hohenaschau,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition 'weniger ist zuviel' gallery VG, Frankfurt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition studio 3. Etage, Frankfurt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition 'Wandelnd in der bleiernen Zeit' atŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ CopierPresse, CologneŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition íëNDEX 03' gallery kunst-raum, Essen2004Œæ solo exhibition 'Begegnung', Zeche Zollverein, Essen,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition 'Tanzen lernen' Kunstraum Hanau,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition íëNDEX 04' gallery kunst-raum, Essen2005Œæ solo exhibition 'Die neue Serie' gallery kunst-raum, Essen,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition 'Der goldene Topf' town museum, HattingenŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition íëNDEX 05' gallery kunst-raum, Essen2006Œæ group exhibition íëNDEX 06' gallery kunst-raum, Essen2007Œæ solo exhibition 'Uwe Groíô' Kunst im Hause Brita GmbH, ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Taunusstein,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition`' Von Scherben und Pflanztí_pfen', regional ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ gallery Sí_dhessen at Kunsthalle + Regierungsprí_sidium ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Darmstadt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition 'pick of the best' Zeche Zollverein, EssenŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ group exhibition íëNDEX 07' gallery kunst-raum, Essen,2008Œæ solo exhibition 'Der zerbrochene Krug' gallery kunst-raum,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Essen,2010Œæ solo exhibition ' Affe und Wesen' gallery 'planet vivid art',ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Frankfurt2012 solo exhibition 'Edda und die Wiederauferstehung des ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ Himbí_rs' gallery Haasch, Darmstadt,ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ solo exhibition 'Uwe Groíô, Himbí_r' Trianon-Haus , Frankfurt

We are a group of people sharing deep attachment to creating comics. Hence our interest in drawing people and our specialized background in art have led us to come up with our own style of portrait drawings. Although you can find lots of pop art styled portraits all around the web, you will see that our style is definitely one of its kind.Our portraits are stylish mixtures of simplified facial figures and yet detailed facial expressions. Often we'd like to emphasize or even exaggerate a person's eye color and hair. For a background of a portrait, we always select a theme that would further characterize the person we draw.1. Print and display. It is definitely an ice breaker! You can even print it on a canvas and display it like this.2. You can use it as your online profile picture. Check out the profile of one of us (James Yun) at Kickstarter.3. For the reasons 1 & 2, it is a great gift for your loving ones. We found that young girls love it.Until now, we have been just drawing this type of portraits for our friends as gifts, but we've always wanted to do something more with it. So as a humble beginning of this dream, we decided to make a calendar for the year 2015.But, of course, it wouldn't be just a calendar.It will be a calendar filled with pop art portraits of you and your loved ones!!!Don't have many friends? No need to worry. We have some historical icons for you. :)$15 - 2015 Pop art portrait calendar (one-page calendar) with predetermined 12 historical icons.$25 or $30 - Your very own pop art portrait in image files (300 dpi and 72 dpi). No shipping of print-outs.$40 - Your very own pop art portrait in a one-page calendar (11" x 17") with 11 other historical icons. Yes, we ship you the calendar, and, yes, we also give you the files (300 dpi and 72 dpi) of your portraits.$50 -ŒæYour very own pop art portrait in a 14-page calendar (8.5" x 11") with 11 other historical icons. You will represent your birth month. Yes, we ship you the calendar, and, yes, we also give you the files (300 dpi and 72 dpi) of your portraits.$80 - HALF DOZEN SUPER SAVING! Up to SIX people (you and your family & friends) in a 14-page calendar (8.5" x 11"). We do ship the calendar, and, yes, we also give you all the filesŒæ(300 dpi and 72 dpi) of all portraits (up to six).$120 - DOZEN SUPER SAVING!! Up to TWELVE people (you and your family & friends) in a 14-page calendar (8.5" x 11"). We do ship the calendar, and, yes, we also give you all the filesŒæ(300 dpi and 72 dpi) of all portraits (up to twelve).You can also add more of your loved one(s) into the same portrait or as a separate portrait. For these options, please read the 'reward' section more thoroughly.These are the tentative design of the one-page and 14-page calendars, but you can tell us your preference such as font, font color, background color for the calendar, and etc. We will try to accommodate your requests.With the help of Kiskstarter backers, we wish to upgrade our printer in order to enhance our in-house printing capabilities.So please support our campaign and get your rewards!This is the ultimate reminder of your AWESOMENESS to your family and friends.Leave your mark in history with our 2015 POP ART PORTRAIT CALENDAR.Or you can simply enjoy the benefits of our POP ART PORTRAIT without the calendar.

The Story so Far:For as long as I can remember, my father has always been an amazing artist. He has always been involved in some sort of creative project and his influence inspired me to study ceramics and later go on to be an art teacher. My father supported and helped me through high school and TAFE (technical college) but the sad truth is that he has always been a labourer, I have only ever known him to be employed in jobs that are physically demanding with little room for his creative talents.ŒæHe is now in his mid 60's and still working but time is catching up with him. His knees are shot from his time as a carpet layer, he has torn ligaments in his shoulder from manually moving steel, he has ruptured disks in his spine from a slow and steady life of lifting heavy objects, and still he is a labourer. Yet through it all he has always found the time to create art, sometimes at ridiculous times in the morning before he drives to work, on Friday nights after a few beers or on the weekend when he is not patching up the home that he has lived in for over 30 years.With your assistance I want to bring his amazing pencil work to the world and give him the opportunity to leave behind his life as a labourer and turn a new page in his life doing the thing that he loves the most, creating beautiful, thought-provoking art. I intend to release a series of high quality reproductions of some of his most amazing drawings on 320gsm Elite Rag Paper in a variety of sizes. The scale of some of these drawings is immense, the largest being 245 centimeters high by 110 centimeters wide and as a result most reproductions will come in full size, three quarter size, half size and quarter size. We are using the services of "Art House Reproductions" to execute the scanning and printing. They have been in business for over 12 years and come highly recommended. They use a 1200 megapixle camera to obtain highly detailed images and create Giclee Inkjet Print reproductions. With the right care these prints should last a lifetime. To start with I am offering reproductions of two of his works, "Last Journey of Cicada" and "Scout: Astrogator of Inner Space" but I would like to offer another three of his works as stretch goals should there be enough support (and I promise that these drawings are even more amazing!). Shipping. This has been one of the things that I have spent a large amount of time attempting to find a suitable balance. In Australia we do not have a large amount of flexibility with international post and I am not prepared to send literally hundreds of dollars of artwork overseas without some form of tracking. As a result I can post to a number of countries at a reasonable price, some others at double the postage price and everywhere else not mentioned in the chart below at triple the postage price. $4000: We will release a third (larger) work.$6000: All printed work will come with an explanation about the inspiration and meaning behind the work. $8000: We release the fourth piece (larger again). $10000: We will release the fifth (and largest completed) of Tom's drawings. This is, in my humble opinion Dad's best work yet. It will also be the hardest one to get to the printers because it has been drawn on board (and is too jolly big to fit in the car). As a result, if we make it to this goal we will need to hire a ute.$12000: If we make it to this point I will release certificates of authenticity to all people who bought drawings at three quarter size or larger.

This project is simple.Œæ I am an artist.Œæ I may not be a good artist by any way of measuring artistic skill, but I am an artist.Œæ I want to share my art with the world.Œæ This project is to fund a startup business similar to what backers of this project will receive.Œæ For providing money and an idea of what they want drawn, I will provide a drawing.Œæ I will give it my best shot.Œæ As you'll see with the backer awards, backers get a special chance to receive the same benefits, but as part of this fantastic Kickstarter campaign.Œæ These backer awards make for great gifts, particularly with Christmas coming up.Œæ My kids are better artists than I am, so at times I may include them in the coloring or even drawing aspects of that piece of art.ŒæŒæ The funds will ultimately go towards establishing the business and website that will promote my art to the world. This venture is designed to bring happy where there is sad.

I am a self-taughtartist/illustrator livingŒæand working inŒæOklahoma City,Oklahoma.ŒæŒæI am wanting to turn my hobby into a business, but I lackthe equipment to do so.Œæ IŒæam planning on purchasing a laser printerand necessary supplies to create my own line of note cards and greeting cardsat home.Œæ If I have the necessary equipment at home, I can work from mygarage and control the quality of what I'm producing rather than rely on aprint shop.I can work my own hourstoo.That's a huge plus.For my projectlaunch, I am wanting to produce Sugar Skull Note Cards.Sugar skulls are part of the Mexican holiday"Day of the Dead", which is actually a 2 day festival right afterHalloween commemorating loved ones gone before us.Sugar skulls are traditionally verydecorative and colorful, and were originally made from sugar.I love drawing them, and there are so manypatterns and colors that can be incorporated into the design.They are very vibrant, and I think they wouldlook great on note cards.With a laserprinter, I would be able to print them on heavy cardstock with colorfast inksthat would be fade and moisture resistant making a great quality product.The initial packagewould be 16 note cards with colored envelopes, most likely packaged incellophane sleeves.Boxes are apossibility, I haven't decided for sure on that part yet.There will be four designs, four cards ofeach design.

Best Friends Forever. Portraits of best friends.Do you have a best friend? If so, you are a fortunate person. Celebrate that amazing relationship.ŒæWant to give them an amazing gift that will have their jaw drop on the floor? This is it.This is a unique, one of kind project. The artist, Dan Burke, is an accomplished illustrator with an amazing skill at drawing people. He has drawn comic books, children's books, magazine and book covers and more, for over 40 years. ŒæHe is now producing a fully illustrated book on the theme of "best friends", and you can be in the book!The book will contain over 50 illustrations of "best friends". The fund raised for this project will be used for book production costs and shipping.You can have Dan draw you, or someone you know, or choose, and have that illustration appear in the book and receive a 5 foot (by 3 foot) copy of your original one of kind poster. ŒæIf you want, a custom, 5 foot wide portrait of two people, of your choice, will be created for you. It's a bargain for this amazing experience.He has drawn portraits daily for over 44 years. The style is bold, accurate and very pop art. The portraits that appear in this book are all custom made, especially for this book, at this time. Most of the portraits will be drawn in October, November of 2014. The book will feature illustrations of best friends from history, fiction and real life, both living and dead.The "Best Friends Forever"Œæbook will be proofed and published within the USA ŒæduringŒæthe last week of November 2014, and mailed out first class the first week of December 2014. The book will have a color cover, black and white interior, and be soft bound. The book will arrive around December 12 to the 16, 2014. Out of USA arrival will take several weeks longer.Some of you might choose to have your own "best friend" portrait included in this book. You have the option. Some of you may choose to back the project just for the book. Either way I thank you in advance. Let me tell you about the art. The portrait makes an amazing gift no one will ever forget. You can choose to have Dan (that's me) draw two people anyway you want! A fantastic wedding or anniversary gift. They won't believe it when they see it! When I unroll one of these for a client, they are always very excited. Friends and others can't stop commenting on it. Seeing a large print of yourself, drawn like this, is a thrilling one of a kind experience. I know from 40 years of experience how great the reaction is for something like this.All Custom "Best Friends" Portraits will be delivered via email December 1, 2014. These portraits are in PDF high resolution format and will be sent to your email in two sizes. Some emails do not accept large files, make sure yours does! The first PDF of your art will be is 5 feet by 3 (244 megabytes). The second PDF of your art will be 11 by 17 inches (44 megabytes). This is for smaller prints. There is no shipping of portraits as we do not print posters and ship them. You can have the portrait printed locally cost effectively. A 5 foot poster prints (on canvas) for about $40 to $60 depending on where you live. If you use a 20% coupon at the local Office type store you can print the artwork very cheaply.ŒæThe portrait can be of any two people you want illustrated. Someone you know getting married? Want to give them an amazing gift? This is something they will never forget. Better than a toaster.ŒæDrawing accurate likeness is a skill. One of the fun things about this project is the drawings, though stylized, offer a very accurate likeness of the subject. Can you tell who the people are?Thank you for reading and considering this project.ŒæDan has bold "pop art" style. If you like this graphic style of art, you will love your portrait. Please have a wonderful day and thank you again.ŒæA recreation of the "Last Supper" for monster fans.

Being a printmaker, I always had interest in applying printmaking techniques to other disciplines. Creating sticker designe is something I always wanted to try, and since I had some ideas from a wood cut i created, I decided to turn it into a sticker.The deer skull design is originally printed by hand, multiple color reduction relief print. Edition of 10. Then I've scanned in the main layer (the black outlines) and the 2nd layer which had some interesting carved marks, and put these together on photoshop. I'm hoping that people will like the design as well as I do.

Over the next twelve months I have the chance to apprentice with a talented tattoo artist in Kutztown PA, who has a great reputation.Art is an important part of my life. I'm excited that I could be able to use my artistic ability to make a living as a tattoo artist.Unfortunately my parents don't have the money I need to do this. So, it's a little weird, but I'm asking for help here. There are rewards for helping me (be sure to check those out).Because this apprenticeship starts this fall and the money is needed up front, I don't have time to get a job and save the money...so I'm trying this.At the end of the apprenticeship I am guaranteed a job and the tools I need to be a tattoo artist.My first six months will be training. At the end of those six months and if I'm approved I will begin actually putting ink to skin.I appreciate that you've taken the time to stop and look!

We are raising this money to bring two artists one pen to life. It is my sister in law Jessica Darling and myself Devin Scott weve been artist for years but we'd like to go farther than freelance artist so were creating this art/sketchbook to get our foot in the door! As I drifted back to Kickstarter each week or so to look at the projects, coupled with the osmosis of press and social network activity surrounding the site, it got me wondering, who are you all?ŒæPeople from all sorts of walks of live, differing countries, economies and levels of wealth contribute daily andŒægenerateŒæhuge sums of money to help ideas bloom.I wondered how I might document this community and decided that the little illustrations I do might be a fun way to show the faces of the crowd sourced economy. By recording this way, an abstract view of us all can be exhibited without breaking the anonymity our pledges provide us to the wider public.As part of the process, I will scan each portrait and print it off in postcard format and then exhibit them here in London and online. If it goes well, maybe we'll have the funds to take this to another city, but we'll cross that bridge if it looms on the horizon.

Listen!Œæ Tis wonderful!)All of the art has been done so all that is left to do is to ship them out.Œæ All mailings will be done by November 2014 so they can be there before gift giving season arrives!Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope you find something beautiful here for your home or as gifts for someone else.Œæ Your support is helping bring more music and art into the world.Œæ THANK YOU!

Hi! My name is Jessica Bastidas. I grew up in Bethlehem, PA but currently go to school in Baltimore, MD where I am pursuing a career in Fine Arts, Illustration, and Teaching. I have just reached my 21rst year and think it is about time to make my dream of owning and operating my own printing press a reality.ŒæI have experimented in copper and zinc etching and engraving as well as drypoint techniques, monoprinting, woodcuts, and linocuts. A printing press is essential to continuing to produce and expand my lexicon of imagery after my graduation from school. With your pledges, you will receive completely original artworks signed by myself with subjects that include landscapes, cityscapes, abstractions, and portraits as well as preserving an often under appreciated art form. Please see the video for examples of these works.I take inspiration from the unique people I meet and the stories they share. Music and literature is another inspiration for my works which often blend aspects of fantasy and magic with harsh realism and factual narratives.Despite my youth, I have worked as a freelance artist for over eight years and am experienced at producing, packaging, and shipping artwork within the U.S. and across the globe.ŒæThe printmaking process has helped to improve all facets of my art even changing the manner in which I approach painting, illustration, and drawing.
I want to further my skills as an artist /illustrator. I want to raise this money so I am able to attend a one week illustration course at a London university in illustration.

I am raising money in order to pay for several things. ŒæI would like to make some high resolution scans of several pieces of my art, which costs about 200$ a piece. ŒæIn order to be able to continue developing them as pieces in the digital format as well as getting them printed in bulk, so that I may sell them and share them with more people. ŒæI would also like to purchase a few pieces of equipment. ŒæAn extendable light with a lighted magnifine glass, in order to create more detail without continuosly squinting. ŒæAnd a large easel so that I may begin to work with larger formats, ie; 4x10 feet.

( I'm quite excited about exploring with this)REWARDS!!!ŒæThe $986 will cover printing and production of the rewards. I also picture these illustrations as animations and will be experimenting with that too.Please Please Donate, let's make this HAPPEN!!!Thank you

Sasser and I am a freelance artist with a passion for Art Nouveau, especially the beautiful work of Alphonse Mucha.I adore Art Nouveau and believe the world would be a more beautiful place with more of it in our lives!Œæ I've begun my own series of paintings directly inspired by Mucha's "Precious Stones" series which explores the unique flowers and birthstones for each month of the year, starting with "Lady of January", who represents the birthstone of Garnet and the birthflowers of Carnations and Snowdrops.With Kickstarter's help, I hope to fund a run of open edition and Kickstarter-only prints of my paintings for fans of Art Nouveau everywhere, starting with this first Lady in the series! Almost as long as I have been alive, I have read science fiction and fantasy. My father died tragically when I was only 6 years old, but left an extensive library of sci-fi books among his belongings.These I began reading in grammar school. I have never stopped.ŒæDuring those same formative years, I was slowly developing the chops to become a professional artist, with sf and fantasy frequently the subject matter. I realized my dream to some extent, becoming a freelance illustrator in the pre-digital age. But the fantasy art genre was a difficult field to break into. I had to take work that wasn't exactly my ideal.Enter the computer age, and now fantasy art is even more competitive. I have about as much chance of making my living this way as I have of becoming an "A-List" film star. Even if you're good, you can be overlooked.ŒæI've made a living in related fields, graphic design, web design, etc. And now that I am too old for most companies to hire me full time, I eek out a living as a self-employed designer/illustrator.ŒæI figured, when no one else wants to hire me, why not hire myself? The digital age has spawned some amazing digital artists. But the Internet can cut both ways. Because KickStarter exists, I hope to assign myself work, and make a living at it.ŒæThe plan is to do the work I love, and offer work that shows my skill in its best light, because this WILL be my ideal. My fantasy art calendar will be for science fiction and fantasy fans like myself. I will sell the 2016 calendar on Amazon beginning in 2015, for $19.99. In July, drop the price to $15.99, and September, to $9.99.ŒæFantasy Calendars do exist, but most either feature one of the few artists who have achieved star status, or they rely solely on barely-clad female figures (or both). I am not opposed to the beauty of women in art, I often include the feminine form myself, but can quality fantasy art exist without resorting to borderline pornography? I believe so. Great art is more than titillation.ŒæThe goal amount will cover printing, shipping & handling, distribution & order fulfillment, shipping of rewards, and incidentals. The purchase price will allow me to continue doing the work I choose.

I plan on traveling to Morocco and visiting as many cities as possible in a couple weeks to experience as much of the culture as I can. Students these days are always choosing the typical places, when equally cultural places like Morocco are passed over. I want to share its beauty with the younger generation and show them how great of an experience you can have there.The final portfolio/ scrapbook will be created for localŒæcolleges study abroad offices to promote students to travel to this country, which is oftenŒæpassed over for the more popular travels.

Our kids have been cranking out greeting card after greeting card lately, each ruder than the last. Family and friends have all been exposed to these cards, and we would like to spread the infection to the rest of you. We are also pruning our kids' entrepreneurial spirit: if they want something, they need to find their own way to make it happen.How we will use the funds:1. Supplies. We want to supply the kids with something other than computer paper and newsprint. Kids would love to use actual cardstock.2. ŒæRewards. Part of the funds will be used to reward our Kickstarter funders through customized greeting cards for our largest supporters.3. ŒæBabysitting. ŒæI will use $20 of the funds (and no more) to hire a babysitter and get away from my three kids for two hours. I refuse to take Œæmy terrors to Target one more time; they are seriously ruining the place for me.ŒæThe rest of the funds will be used to promote our home based business; we hope the kids will be able to sell their cards at Spencer's one day.

Put Your Best Foot Forward!The Bigfoot Patrol is now accepting applications to join the elite ranks of our Cryptid Tracker Trail Team. With a directive to seek out incontrovertible evidence of Bigfoot in a world full of skeptics, we need YOU to explore new wilderness, capture sightings, debunk hoaxes, educate the masses, as well as the occasional light errand around HQ. No heavy lifting required.The chosen few will receive as part of their initiation into the mysterious "Order of the Foot" the following members-only accessories, identification and insignia to confirm their position to any questioning naysayers, authority figures, and other random weirdos.ŒæThe mainŒæBigfoot Patrol Membership KitŒæ($25 level) includes:ŒæAs an incentive to backers to help us meet the goal, there are 50 8.5" x 11", 2-color, screen-printed prints, signed and numbered in a limited edition of 100. You also get all the items in the main kit as well.There are alsoŒæ25 slots to get an original Bigfoot-themed sketch, custom drawn for you! If you order the sketch reward, you also get a signed and numbered print and it will be numbered in the first 25! And of course all the main items in the kit!Each reward level includes one each of ALL of the items in the reward levels below it, and all rewards include shipping in the domestic U.S.!ŒæThere are lower-priced reward levels offering just the email updates ($1), a membership card only ($5), or the patch/button/sticker/card combo ($10).All the artwork has been created, designed and is ready to go to the various printers and manufacturers to get all of this cool stuff into production. The only thing we need to know is how much to order! That's where your funding comes in.In addition to regular updates on the production process for all backers, I'll be posting exclusive first-look original sketches for Kickstarter backers only. I have the rough sketches for 9 more Bigfoot-type characters from around the world (like the Sasquatch, the Yeti, the Skunk Ape and more) and I'd love to be able to at least get some of the items created äóî like stickers and embroidered patches äóî for all of those other Bigfoot relatives.ŒæI will be working on finalizing those sketches as this fundraiser is in effect, posting those sketches exclusively to the Kickstarter updates section accessible only by backers äóî er, I mean official Bigfoot Patrol Founding Members!

Since the beginning of this venture, I have wanted to create images that work beautifully together as sets, but that also work individually each with its own personal touch that can speak to it's audience.ŒæSo why not have both? Maybe in January you need comfort, in February - inspiration. This illustrated animal calendar is the answer. Let these happy little creatures into your home to brighten up your walls and look after your schedule!So far, Pawprint has a total of 6 illustrations. The next 6 will be completed in the duration of this project.This is the initial calendar design:The specs will remain the same, however the design may be changed and improved throughout this project.OutcomeThe aim of this project is to get the calendar finalised, printed and ready for sale. The goal will fund 100 calendars, and cover the rewards and fees.ŒæThis project succeeding would mean that Pawprint Illustration can continue and grow, and that would be amazing! So grab a calendar for yourself or a friend, ready for the new year! Or if you want to support the project in another way, other rewards are available :)Other Items AvailablePostcardsThe postcards that will be printed for this project are unlimited. You can choose any designs you like out of the final 12 illustrations. If you go 12 postcards, you will receive the full set of 12 designs - but if you want 12 of the same design just say the word! It's up to you!The postcards areŒæ4.13" x 5.82", printed on luxuriousŒæheavy paper, gloss laminated on one side.Giclí©eŒæPrintsEach illustration will also be available as a Giclí©e print on museum archival quality paper.ŒæDimensions:ŒæA4 (210 x 297mm)Paper:ŒæMuseum archival qualityŒæfine art paper 310gsmŒæInnova soft texture with aŒæfaint cream colourThe artwork so far:ŒæThese are also currently available on the ŒæPawprint Illustration Etsy store

I am an artist living in New York. ŒæI have been at this for a couple of years and know that I have something that people like. Sometimes finances get in the way of making pieces that I would like to. ŒæThe rising costs of supplies an studio space is a constant deterrent from the experimentation that I need to further my art. ŒæI want to break out of my shell that has been built out of financial constraints!!ŒæWith that said, I have my third RAW show coming up on September 18th, 2014 in Hoboken, NJ. ŒæThe costs of setup, supplies and transportation limits my imagination at times. ŒæI would love to see what could happen with a little bit of support from artists and people who appreciate the struggle and craft.ŒæThe funds raised would go to purchasing canvases, frames and art supplies to complete works of art for the upcoming show. I will be creating jewelry with tiny works of art inside so that everyone has a chance to have a piece of my artwork even if you are not ready to commit to a larger painting/illustration. ŒæIt would also help to cover the price of a car service to transport my work from Brooklyn to New Jersey. ŒæIt would mean so much to me if you helped! The "starving artist" could just be a saying from the past if we can make this happen!

The objective is to find funds for an exhibition. All 25 drawings will be printed, 60 x 60 cm and pasted on dibond. Technique 'Clear Line' (Dutch: Klare Lijn) in black with solid colours.Main image is titled 'Escape' and shows The Atomium in Brussels (and a Hi-Speed tractor) discovered in a different age. Other subjects: Pyramids in Egypt, the Eiffel Tower, Samarra minaret in Irak, Clifton Suspension Bridge in Bristol (UK), La Grande Arche in Paris, Radio Kootwijk and Erasmus Bridge in the Netherlands and many more...SEE ATTACHED UPDATES AND A VIDEO

Dead Ted is a character my son Sam Degen has been drawing for many years. He is a cute little Teddy Bear who Sam destroys in so many ways I feel sorry for the poor little fella.ŒæSam is an amazing artist who has a rather dark sense of humor. His other artworks are online on ourŒæFacebookŒæpage.Hi my name is Julie Hazell we would really like to get T Shirts and Soft Toys made so we can share Dead Ted with his fans.ŒæSam inflicts various injuries on Dead Ted, but Ted always lives to fight another day. Dead Ted has the saddest eyes that make you just want to hug him and the sweetest personality.ŒæA little over a year ago I talked with Sam about Dead Ted and where we could take him. I saw distinct possibilities for marketing this little teddy. Endless opportunities are out there for us to chase and running my successful bookkeeping business for over 5 years I could see the enormous potential.ŒæI had a couple of T Shirts printed with Dead Ted on and they looked great, then I decided to see what Dead Ted would look like on other things I had a cup, cap and key ring made. I showed these to all our friends and family and had really positive feedback, so I decided to go online with Ted and see what other people thought of him.ŒæOur Dead Ted Facebook page facebook/deadted1 has over 2000 likes since we started promoting it in late June 2014. We have found that our audience is between 1 to 24 year olds with at last count 53% Male & 47% Female. The girls seem to like the Cute Teddy and I'm pretty sure the guys like his unfortunate 'accidents'.Seeing Dead Tedäó»s popularity I thought it was time to take the next step and started our Kickstarter project.ŒæI got quotes for T Shirts, Soft Toys, Tote Bags and Key Rings and then created a spreadsheet to work out the cost of our rewards and postage, I consider if we have the items made we can really make Dead Ted as successful as other character based phenomenon such as äóÖEmily The Strangeäó», äóÖMarvel Comicsäó» and äóÖSouth Parkäó».ŒæSam & I are constantly coming up with things we can do with Dead Ted including a possible cartoon series down the track. We will share this project will everyone who loves Ted through Facebook and also encourage our family, friends and colleagues to back us and share the details.Our awesome backers can expect great rewards from Postcards, T Shirts, Tote Bags and Soft Toys to a one off drawing suggested by the backer, this drawing will be signed, framed and guaranteed never to be used by us.....and our undying devotion.ŒæWe have to reach our target or we get nothing,ŒæWe would love everyone to join us and share this project around to your friends, family and colleagues so we can ALL be part of THE BIRTH OF DEAD TED!!!!ŒæThank You :)PS: Apologies about the quality of the video, Spielberg I'm not!

Hi there. My name is Jasmyne Butz. I live in Fairbanks, Alaska. I work full time for a janitorial company. I Œæalso write and illustrate my own children's books. I didn't have what you'd call a Normal upbringing. I dealt with a lot of things growing up that no child should have to face. But I wouldn't change my past for the world. It is in this terrible past that I found my passion. I feel that out of tragedy comes great beauty. During my childhood when times were hard I would make books. Books with hidden positive messages in them for myself. I would read these books when times were hard and they always made me feel better. It was when I got older that I realized how many children could benefit from these books with such valuable lessons. I started to make more and more. Each one geared towards a different situation with a lesson to be learned or a problem to overcome. I feel like I can be the voice for our youth today. With these books I can teach them valuable life lessons that let them know that they are not alone. I will and can reach this goal through Dorrance Publishing company when I can come up with the 6,700.00 its going to take to produce and market my book. But by backing me you have the opportunity to get in on the ground floor and get your pick of a vast array of benefits. I will reach my goal one way or another.But this way you get something out of it as well.

Noah just turned 5! Up until about a month ago Noah refused to pick up a crayon, pencil, whatever.... It was a struggle to get him to do his Pre-School homework. He is a smart, funny child with a HUGE vocabulary. But it concerned his parents when he wouldn't even color in a coloring book. His mother attended art school at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn NY and his father just graduated college with a teaching degree.ŒæIn June the family was shocked to see Noah sitting at the table for hours with the entire reem of printer paper drawing the cutest stick figures, houses, scenes of the family camping, on a boat, a rocket in space etc.He would not stop and his skill was amazing! He is obsessed. He draws from morning till night. We would like to encourage him to draw the world as him sees it and express himself. This project will show him how much art means to the world and allow him to purchase a great deal of different art supplies. I would love to see he use cray pa! Thank you!

column2: ŒæŒæŒæŒæ Over the lastseven years I have lived in a secluded log cabin in the Adirondack Mountains. During that time I have learned much about nature and myself. Most good, some bad but all memorable. ŒæI also do a lot of reading from Hemingway andThoreau to Carl Sagan and Christopher Hitchens and many of these successful andbrilliant minds offer the same spooky advice for the rest of us. ŒæMany of them say in one way or another thesame thingäó_do what you love to do and then figure out a way to make a livingdoing it.Œæ Great advice.Œæ Everyone is happy and making an income doingsomething they love to do.Œæ Wow, what agreat utopian world.Œæ I know it soundsreally äóìKumbayaäó, but itäó»s true.Œæ As Thoreaueloquently put it, äóìThe world is but a canvas to our imagination.äó ŒæŒæŒæŒæ Well, thatäó»s whatIäó»m trying to do.Œæ I love to draw and Ilove to spend time in nature so I want to combine the two and make a livingdoing it.Œæ Kickstarter might be howŒæto make that happen. We will see.ŒæŒæŒæŒæ So I really hopeyou can support this project and help make my dream come true of being afull-time artist but if not please support any creative thinkeräó»s projectout there because as a collective entity we can help bring each otheräó»s dreamsto life and thatäó»s the beginning of something truly amazing.

I would like to draw a circle. This would have to be a neat and tidy circle with no sharp corners or edges. The perfect outcome would be a circle what god would be proud of. I will use the money to buy paper (enough to draw the perfect circle on a clean piece of paper) also a pencil and a rubber. I would also like to buy a good black pen so i can then draw over the perfect circle, to make it a permanent perfect circle.

It will also contain depictions of consensual bondage and BDSM situations. This will not contain images of non-consensual anything, graphic violence, or overt pornography of any kind.Œæ

The English word "zombie" was first used in the 1838 short story "The Unknown Painter", as zombi. The additional "e" was not added until the 1900s.  176 years later, these mindless, reanimated corpses, are still searching for flesh. However, the unknown painter has a name and he is found on kickstater: We are a group of independant software and game designers with an obsession into all things undead, paranormal and techonlolgy.  We want to share with you our inspiration and hopefully gain your backing into turning our digital prints into physical posters that can be enjoyed by others. We have a number of rewards to help get us to our goal and a number of epic strech goals to make this kickstater truely amazing. To design and bring to physical print and hopefully expand (if stretch goals are reached) the zombie based apocalypse print line. I've set the goal at Œ£1,000 (to cover Amazon and KS fees) and hope to at least produce the first initial prints. The dream would be to produce more artwork and t-shirts and hopfully get our studio into 3d printing and better enhance our eqipment, thatäó»s the dream! We have done a number of commsions in the past but as a independant studio our resources are limited and we do struggle to keep afloat. This is a passion of ours and hopfully one day our determation will pay off.The posters have different sytles to show how diverse we are as a independant studio. We have included Digital Zombies in our pledges, these pdf and image filesare perfect for printing from home or 3rd party poster printers, atthe end of the day we want you to enjoy our work.The physical Prints range from 12" x 16" - 24" x 36" and are printed in High colour on a Epson Stylus Pro 7900, the paper is Epson Enhanced Matte Paper Heavyweight stock (10.3 mil thick)We also offer A4 posters printed on 150gsm silk art paper, size 210mm x 297mm.Feel free to leave a comment about our artwork we love to hear what people have to say and if you love it why not share our link.
