MelJane Watercolors was born out of my love for watercolors and my desire to pursue a career that allows me to push my creativity to its fullest. I was driven to find something I enjoyed that allowed me to share my creativity with others while providing them with practical products. After careful consideration I settled on transferring my watercolor paintings into everyday products. It seems that nowadays we use our phones and ipads for everything and it doesn't look like that will change anytime soon. I find that I use my phone for almost everything. However, I still believe in the old standbys. Remember notebooks, sticky notes, desk calendars? All of these and more are products that I want to bring to you! And in the spirit of moving forward I will also be making products such as phone and Ipad cases. I feel very confident in my ability to create a brand which appeals to the masses. Any support you are willing to extend would be greatly appreciated. Based on my years of experience in sales and customer service I hope to run a company that people feel they can trust.

We are two young designers from Germany with a passion for fine artWe are Blexr and MxgikŒæOur aim is too create an illustration book filled with many different abstract drawings which we create blindly.We need you to be part of it and become part of our book, which you can do by joining us in our mission.ŒæThe money we hope to raise will go towards production costs and supplies.ŒæWe want to make a book to collect all of our work together and create a portfolio for ourselves which we can take with us to further our outreach.ŒæWith a book you see the progression in the work.The working process is an adventure, you set the rules, the frame and the outcome is always uncertain and surprising. The final piece is the result of yourŒæsubconscious.Œæ

I am going to enlarge pictures from a series of paintings inspired by historical Manga and Renaissance figures. I will need large wood panels and oil paint to complete this project. There is a big space to be filled and enlarging some of the pictures to eight by eight feet, eight by four feet, would work. There are also some works on paper that need to be framed.I am painting a series of bright, zappy images. This group of figures uses pure color, pattern and anatomy to unite tradition with the contemporary. I try to give them titles that poke at a universal truth here and there. If I meet the goal I will enlarge the painting "Everything Changes" and others to eight by eight feet. The work will be shown later this year in Portland, Maine. I am painting invented heroes or Contemporary Bodhisattvas, in the traditional mediums of oil paint and gouache and also in Photoshop. I like giving titles that point out a truism reworked from historical quotes, zen stories and my own take on things.Œæ These pictures are inspired by the figures in Michelangelo's Sistine ceiling called ignudi, super heroes and historical Manga.Michelangeloäó»s Ignudi, the twenty elegant seated nudes painted in the Sistine Chapel ceiling frescoes are some of the most beautiful images in the history of Western Art and their fabulous-ness ( art history term) has remained unmatched in history, Their simplicity and grace is something I reach for to rework in a way that reflects the twenty-first century.The figures I paint sometimes look a bit like super heroes but I am also thinking aboutŒæ Bodhisattva, those wonderful, beautifully adorned figures in temples and museums that are described as beings that have delayed their own nirvana to save others. In history they are often seen as deities and today we might think of them as guardian angels. In paintings and in sculpture they are the most amazing creations and I find them a rich starting point. I love the puzzle of the human body - anatomy. Michelangelo used anatomy as a design tool. Anatomy didn'tŒæ justŒæ tell him where the parts of the body belonged, he used it to determine where a line or form would look the most beautiful. Artists today, mostly illustrators and animators,Œæ still deal with the body as a design form. Are they our Michelangelos?Artwork is enormously expensive to ship so although the paintings are not part of the rewards, I thought people might be interested in how the paintings are made. I am using oil paint with a very fat medium so that it dries very shiny. Linseed oil, pure gum spirits of turpentine and Damar varnish (one part each) makes the paint quite fat or oil rich because of the lack of turpentine and consequently it takes longer to dry but when does it remains as shiny as a wet lollypop.I also paint some in an opaque watercolor paint called gouache. Gouache has more pigment than watercolor and a very rich deep velvety quality. Last but not least I am using a drawing tablet and Photoshop to draw and paint some of the images. Some of the images below were created specifically as rewards for pledges.I am a painter, instructor and lover of art history and illustration. I drew constantly when I was young and spent hours inventing drawing games with my siblings. I study art history and anatomy and I teach drawing and painting. This is the series as it begins and reaching the goal will help add to these images. Some of these are offered as Prints in the rewards section. The black borders do not appear on the prints offered in the rewards section. Two of the pictures I will enlarge are Everything Changes ", eight by eight, feet and the horizontal version of "If you wish really hard...," to eight by four feet. The works on paper will be framed.If I get enough sponsors Nickelson Editions based in beautiful Camden, Maine will begin printing the selected images. Printer, photographer and entrepreneur Jim Nickelson collaborates with artists all over the world, works with them individually and performs all processing and printing to create true fine quality digital prints.All prints are 8 1/2 x 11 inch digital prints except the laughing head group "Everything Changes" which are 8 1/2 x 81/2 inches. All are printed on heavy archival paper. ŒæAbove: Sell Your Cleverness And BuyŒæ Bewilderment.Above: Everyone Gets So Much Information All Day Long That They Lose Their Common Sense.Below: These images,Œæ titled Everything Changes are 8 1/2 inches square.

This story is intended to be of entertainment to children and bring forth valuable and important life lessons. I hope that the book shall also teach children something about insects, which most children seem to grow a fascination with at some point, and shed new light on the value of life and connection with oneself.I'm hoping to raise some money for supplies to get the project underway, and hopefully a small aid in publishing costs when the book is complete.

I moved to Asheville, NC in 2012 on my birthday in the middle of a hurricane to pursue a Master's in Chinese Herbal Medicine and Acupuncture.ŒæDespite having plenty to do for school, I have found myself time and time again returning to my illustration projects. The drawing helps me keep focused but also offers needed respite from the intensity of my studies. The next couple of years will entail a substantial amount of clinical work and I will no longer be able to work a part-time job to provide many of the basic necessities that entail being a Master's student.Recently, an opportunity came up to potentially be a part of a community of local artists in downtown Asheville. The company is called ZaPow (http://www.zapow.com/) and it is run by a really rad woman named Lauren J. Patton. The space gets a lot of foot traffic, and provides tons of really unique opportunities for their artists and the greater Asheville community. It occurred to me that I could potentially use my love for illustrating to support me while I am in grad school, while all the while finding a specific outlet for decompressing, as well as a way to remain connected to the incredible community that is down here.This Kickstarter will therefore serve to lessen the start-up costs as a new artist in the space. The funds will go to buying and/or building frames, making prints and cards, and for the bulk, paying rent for the space for the required commitment of six months in the gallery. After a while, the hope is to be able to sell enough pieces and prints monthly to be able to at least pay for the space, and hopefully provide a humble, yet so gratefully welcome income while I devote most of my focus to studying Chinese Medicine.All in all, by supporting this project you would be supporting local artists and economy, supporting the creation and dissemination of art made with love, supporting the potential alleviation of some daunting student debt, and last but not least, supporting the future generation of medicine and healing.ŒæThank you for reading and even more for the support!P.s. Here are some examples of an Astrological Sign series I'm presently working on!

I have a really simple goal, spread love and caring. My project started from that simple goal and a passion for creating. I want to combine those two things and give art and love to those who may need it in the moment or those who no longer receive that blessing from those around them.My art style is fairly unique, a metamorphosis of tribal art and doodling in the margins of textbooks on philosophy and religion during college. Over time it came to simply represent whatever I was feeling at the time, being often up to interpretation of the viewer. With these pictures I will enclose a letter of support and encouragement, a message of love and hope for someone who may need it. Hopefully I can make a difference in at least one person's life just by letting them know they're not alone and somebody really does care.

I am a mother of three young children, formerly employed in the corporate world. I took a leap of faith when my second child was born to stay at home and raise my children while my husband has continued doing the daily grind.In the process, I discovered I have a large entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for graphic design as well as a great talent for painting and drawing. More importantly, I found a way to combine my desire to be at home for my children with my passion for art and graphic design. During the past three years, I have built my own ecommerce store selling specialty toys while working freelance jobs as a graphic designer,Œæ designing logos, brochures, posters, websites etc. In my spare time, whenever I have it, I love sketching and painting people and pets. As a pet lover myself, I understand the love, care and compassion it takes to care for one and the allure of having your personal pet within the pages of a book dedicated to them and their owners.Staying true to the notion of following my heart, I decided to try this platform out after hearing about it on the news. Essentially, when exploring this site, it led me to the idea of creating a unique book pet portrait book of my work that I would like to call "Paws United." It will be a compilation of various watercolor pet portraits that I will designing based on your pets. I would like to ultimately sell it locally and perhaps even online to pet lovers and offer it as a gift to my children.Please bear in mind that I am completely new to this idea and this is my first project on kickstarter so I will work respectfully with you if you promise to do the same in return. I hope you engage in my project and help me make the book a success!

I am raising funds to teach my kids the joys of macaroni art! I plan to use any funds raised to accumulate as many different types of art supplies possible. I will use the strongest glue I can find to make as many amazing projects as possible!

I am Benjamin Mason i have just graduated from an illustration course in the UK with a large debt and and an education that doesn't quite match (not saying i am not a skilled illustrator just my course and tutors left a lot to be desired) and now i am back home with my parents. now i know this isn't anything new or amazing pretty much every student has to move back home and pretty much every student comes out of uni feeling they have been part of an elaborate scam. anyway il get to the point i want to set up a studio to produce illustrations, comics and just overall to get my work out there....simple as that....well saying it is simple, doing it on the other hand might prove tricky. thats where you peeps could step in (if you fancy it) any pledges from one shilling to two drachma would be super helpful, i suppose the best way to decide if you want to pledge would be to have a mosey through my website, check it out and see if anything takes your fancy. you are probably wondering what the plan of attack is so here it is, basically i am aiming to convert a large storage shed in my parents yard into a fully functioning illustration studio for screen printing and other creative endeavours, this is going to be quite a task since it has been used to hold all kinds of junk since the 80's, once i have it cleared out and fixed up the next step would be making it liveable in by insulating it and putting down lino flooring and then finally fitting it out with all the hardware for screen printing and image making, my aim is to have it converted from run down old shed to active illustration studio before the year is out. the reason whyŒæi decided i wanted to set up my own studio was to have a place where i can work away from my parents house since they both work from home and there is constantly people coming and going which makes it quite busy and noisy and not the place you want to be doing any creative work in.my website http://benbryanmason.wix.com/benmasonillustrationthanksBenjaminŒæ

I have a lot of talent in creating all sorts of things.ŒæI draw digitally and on paper, I crochet, I design and so on.My head bursts from creativity, but I have no idea how to spread this to the world. I often have ideas which cannot be created due to the fact that I do not have the tools up for grabs.With this kickstarter project I want to fund the tooling I need in order to create the best things possible. Taking extra classes & Studies to improve my skills and connections. The funds will also be used to buy the tools to make this all possible, for example; crochet hooks, paint and pencils, canvas etc. everything goes solely to this project. Most of the cost will be the classes I want to take to improve advanced skills in drawing and illustrating.ŒæMy biggest wish is to be a successful illustrator/designer! The talent is there, but now the tools and extra skills! Will you help me forward? What is better to fund in knowledge then fund potatosalade? Knowledge is for a lifetime!Let's make my dream come true!

Featuring every kick-off and location details for every game and every team in the tournament. Remember your teams progress through the tournament and display it with pride in this beautifully crafted information graphic print. All the results including the record breaking 7-1 thrashing of the hosts Brazil by Germany, all the awards and all the vital numbers to help us remember one of the most exciting World Cups in living memory.This special edition champions version of the graphic features German team colours celebrating their superiority in the tournament.The prints are currently in English but the design will be translated in to german for those purchasing german prints.DetailOrder a digital version or pre-order the printed limited edition german or english language poster.ŒæEach poster will be expertly printed onto A1 satin 170gsm stock and delivered in high quality protective poster tubes.Thankyou,LeighRileigh Design

Amanda is a 9 year-old home school student who loves to draw and color. Her preferred medium is crayon and computer paper. She recently set up a free website hosted through WeeblyŒæcalled Artist AmandaŒæ- She is looking to fund the purchase of more art supplies including but not limited to:Œæ

The main objective of this project is to provide funding for my endeavor to create a concertina book.This book will be investigating Parrots that are native to areas in and around my region in Canberra, Australia. I will be exploring this concept through vibrant intricate illustrations that will involve various collage, screenprint and also lithographic techniques. As a bookbinder, printmaker, illustrator and artist I will be producing the book through traditional means with no outside assistance in construction. However I do need assistance in the purchase of correct materials including papers, card and other necessary art suppliesFunding to this project will also provide me the means to put my artist book up for several print prize awards:The Bernie Print Prize Awardhttp://www.burniearts.net/The Hornsby Art Prizehttp://www.hornsby.nsw.gov.au/my-lifestyle/arts-and-culture/hornsby-art-prize-2014Linden Postcard Show http://www.lindenarts.org/exhibitions/linden-postcard-show.aspx

I have always wanted to make a living with my art and share my art with the world. I have BFA- in fine arts and work as an Art Director for a catalog company. Using my skills as an illustrator and my connections within the company along with outside printers, i feel like given the time and money I could put together my dream project.The concept of Kara's Kostumes came from starting a family and watching my daughter play dress up. Having the story really come to life as she tries different costumes on and playing out the story. Each story would feature a different costume and each story would have a different learning aspect in the end. The different costumes would have many different jobs and duties, not just gender stereotyped costumes. My hope is that young girls get inspired to be anything that she wants to be when she grows up.I have included a small project I did in college to show my illustration skills.

There, I said it. Now on with the show!Really? Then why are you looking at this cheap junk?Sometimes the world is a mean mean place. Only things that are important and huge are considered important. Wrong! Bzzt!The world deserves small things. Overlooked things. Things that will never matter to John Q. Citizen and his 2.5 kids. Things that don't sell on Ebay for more money than Elvis's left kidney. Like the hand made, home baked Muffin Madness! Stamp Collection of kooky and neurotic 100% one of a kind Muffin Friends.One day I said to myself, "Self, why not engage in a cheap laugh by doing something that is completely random and obnoxious to the average John Q. Citizen? Why? WHY? HUH? ANSWER ME!" And then I remembered to take my little blue pill.But it's too late! The fools! I'll show them all! Muffin Friends are here to stay.Each Muffin Friend is planned out by me and then drawn and colored on a nice piece of paper, just like the kind used by your printer.Names are also chosen by me to reflect each pastry's unique joys and views in life. My unique naming process ensures a one of a kind pastry which is an essential piece of the Muffin Madness! world of wonder and surprise.I suppose if everyone is really nice to me and stuff I might let you pick your own Muffin Friend as long as it's not something disturbing.Only in the land of Muffonia can you mail things with a large cartoon stamp.You so funny, grasshopper! Ha ha ha!In the extreme event that a stretch goal is needed, I will play a happy tune on a Muffin-o-phone and then think of something kool.In Muffonia all pastries are created equal.

We can't all have powerful earth-shattering automobiles. We can dream however and apply those dreams to paper.ŒæI have been drawing/sketching since the days of the floppy disk. In my youth i was especially interested in drawing machines with powerful engines. This hobby helped me stay out of trouble, and the interest has stayed with me ever since.Recently, while eating my potato salad and contemplating my next project, i noticed my art drawer had been opened. Upon further investigation i discovered that my sketch pencils, erasers, and pads were all missing. I frantically searched for them in every crack and crevice but to no avail.Being a broke/in-debt college student, i'm relying on you guys to help me acquire the best art supplies money can buy. A lock for the cabinet wouldn't hurt either.Here are some of the unfinished projects collecting dust

Family and friends have finally pushed me to sharing my hilarious stories I have thought up for this series of books locked away in my head. It's a funny but insightful look in to the life of a little girl who lost her mother and befriended one of her father's failed toy designs as her confidant.I have 2 illustrators and an animator working along side me to get this off the ground. Story boards and rough draft are all most finalized, just need to get the materials and get what I hope to be the first of many books all put together.Those who contribute will receive a free copy of the finished project autographed by all those involved. Please help my dream become a reality, and help get these books to the world.This funding will go to the finalizing of the book and promoting. We already have art work lined up for sale, as we hope to build a following on our artwork alone. So far so good, just need to get more done and get on the road promoting.

Over the past year, i've picked up pen and pencil having never been taught art and tried to improve my skills, always trying to make my next piece more and more challenging.ŒæI'd love to continue drawing, but art supplies don't come cheap. Having just graduated, i'm not in any financial situation to keep on drawing.ŒæSo, i thought let the people decide. If you like my work feel free to donate, and check my work out on facebook too!ŒæIf I do reach my Œ£100 goal, I plan to do something really amazing and intricate, definitely happy to take ideas from anyone about what I could do if my goal is reached.https://www.facebook.com/thornyART
This is simple folks.We have tens of thousands of troops that have been injured fighting for

column1: light on their stories and give them some healing by enabling them to cover
some of their scars or prosthetics with art.We will pay for their artwork in exchange for them telling their story
and allowing us to publish the pictures and stories in a high quality book.Come be a part of helping heal these fellow American heroes.

column2: Allow me, if you will, a few moments of your time to introduce myself and to briefly tell you about my unique pen and ink drawings and an exciting new children's book I am writing and illustrating.  My name is C.M. Spraggin and my background mainly consists of working in advertising or a related field as an illustrator / designer.  While working in advertising I also did a few murals here and there and even managed to do a little teaching part time.  I have recently retired to doing my own art work and plan to market my limited edition giclee prints online through my website that is now up and running.  Each and every pen and ink drawing is done solely by hand and comes from my imagination.  One drawing takes hundreds of thousands of lines and dots to create and at least three to four months to complete.  Time consuming and tedious, yes, but the finished piece is well worth the effort.As for the children's book I am unable to divulge very much regarding the story itself other than it's about a young boy with an overly active imagination that stumbles across an old abandoned tree house in the forest near his home and the life altering adventures he discovers within.The book is based upon actual events that took place  during an extremely difficult time for a young boy who finds a way to cope with the harsh realities of his life simply by using his imagination.    The name of the book is ,"A Castle in the Trees" and the young boy was me.My reason for putting this together is to try and raise funds to purchase a giclee printer and all the accessories that are needed to do the prints myself. Once the children's book is completed I will need to employ a ghost writer and take the book to print.ŒæThis is a project I have dreamed of doing for years but couldn't afford it. Your contributions and understanding will beŒægreatly appreciated, more than I could ever express.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ

I'm about to launch a website called the artist menu in the next week or so. Its a site that has a maximum of 3,000 artist. It gives artist who don't know how to promote themselves the opportunity to do so. Many times artist sign up for art sites to promote their work with no luck because there are so many other artist on the site to compete with. At my siteŒæwww.theartistmenu.com we create a mini webpage for anyone who signs up. Prices rang anywhere from $1 to $5 a month. There's a total of 20 art categories and 150 Artist per category.Œæ

Funding of this project will allow me to focus on producing The Illustrated Diary of an Ordinary Ghost as well as purchase necessary supplies. Funding will buy me two months of uninterrupted writing time by covering my rent and utility expenses.ŒæI will write and draw this work from the perspective of my character/ghost as journal entries. Therefore, there will be a journal entry for each day. When the journal is complete it will be published on Amazon Createspace or marketed to a traditional publisher. Project completion, including editing time, is expected December 2014. If a traditional publisher is used the actual date of publication would be later, of course.My ghost doesn't have a name and at the center of this journal is her search for that missing part of her identity, as well as answers to the circumstances surrounding her death.I can't predict what the ghost might say or do, but some days she will observe quiet things. Other days will be far from quiet.

Hello, my name is Lily Hernandez and I'm a Caricature Artist. I have been doing caricatures for about a year now at parties and events. I enjoy seeing new faces to draw and hope with this project expand my business."Caricatures by Lily Hernandez" is an entertainment service for parties and events. It started as a hobby of just drawing portraits at college football games and is now a full business. I provide both single caricatures and party/event services for 2 hour minimum.Also Available a print of the final product of my Fairytale Series in the style of Art Nouveau. This is a project I have been working on for a long time.If you pledge $100 or more, will receive one or more random print(s) (up to 4) and is not exclusive to any location. This is a Kickstarter Exclusive print.Different pledges provide different rewards, heres the breakdown:My goal with this project is expand my business across the Central Coast Area and eventually across California. By achieving this goal, I will also expand as an artist.

Hello!  Welcome to the Champaign Paper Kickstarter page, weäó»re so happy you dropped by! Check everything out and let us know what you think! We LOVE feedback!My name is Elisabeth and Iäó»ve been creating things for as long as I can remember. Drawing and calligraphy are a passion of mine and I have been working diligently to create designs and prints to share with others.  My fiance, Shaun, and I have started up a little side project to see how far we can go!  We wanted to begin with a simple idea and thought "thank you" cards were perfect!"Champaign:" an expanse of level open country.  The feeling you encompass when you capture nature's spirit is the feeling I want people to have when they think of my art.  Free, wide-open, no boundaries!  I have tons of "thank you" cards; classic, modern, hipster, vintage, art deco or a combination of these styles.  Iäó»m also working on "thank you" tags and prints.Not only do I produce "thank you" cards, I can do just about anything! I can create custom orders and illustrate any type of greeting card or print imaginable...my boundaries are limitless!ŒæAll of my designs are done by hand with pens, pencils, paint, markers, etc.  We then scan them into a computer, print and cut them ourselves.  Weäó»re working out the details with a local print shop that can produce larger orders that adhere to our quality and sustainability standards; weäó»ll keep you posted in the blog section!  All of our creations are printed on paper that is 80# or thicker, we want it to feel as awesome as it looks!  I launched an Etsy page (which can be found HERE) nearly simultaneously with this one to try to get the word out on my project!ŒæWe chose Kickstarter because our trial run project fits perfectly with the Kickstarter format.  It allows us to thank our supporters in a way that will leave them with a little piece of art they can share with others!  Plus, paper and supplies are expensive; weäó»ve got our eye on a high quality printer and paper stock that has to be bought in bulk.  Weäó»re 99% sure we found our paper supplier, but our goal is to have products that are recycled or FSC certified and eventually use organic or soy based inks.  Weäó»ll keep you posted anytime we have an update!Once the project is funded weäó»ll send out a comprehensive list of the designs (there will be loads!) and the color options we have available.  We know not everyone finds "thank you" cards as exciting as we do, but weäó»d LOVE your support and weäó»ll keep all of you in the loop with updates and new designs before they hit ourŒæEtsy page!Let us know what you think!  Weäó»d love your feedback and questions, especially on designs you love or color options you want to choose from. Thanks!

Hello Internet! Welcome to my Kickstarter project and heres the lowdown on what I do! I'm a closet artist, I draw, I paint, I snap a decent shot and I sing...sort of... but I dont subject you to that! I am disabled and art is going from a hobby to a lifestyle and I'm branching into artist exposure and small scale proprietorship through local island community agricultural and craft fairs and next year I'll be aiming for the anime conventions in the pacific north west.Tables are $345 for the weekend and I'm in need of a banner, supplies, and printing costs! Now if you havn't looked at the rewards yet here is what I'm offering to you. My work! And limited edition at that. Prints range from 4x6 inch standard photo size, to 8x10's. I'm even offering a couple custom commissions, hand drawn or painted, and a limited edition art book. These wont be for sale anywhere, I'm offering them only to you! I'm going door to door, I'm drawing my pencils off and running my paints dry. And I'm eager to share my works with anyone thats willing to take a gander. A special page will be going up on my permanent website http://ambland.org with prints that will be available to backers and honorable mentions for all backers and it ain't going anywhere. You are going to be immortalized right along side my artwork. How does that sound? :D Hello Internet!

WindowSport Team Decals  were inspired by Japanese brush painting and pen & ink. Each character is designed to look good on a Lexus QX or Ford Flex. Fluid movement and teamwork is reflected in each design. They are drawn by Mike Browne cartoonist / inventor in the Long Beach, CA USA. Special World Cup 2014 Memorabilia edition window sticker set. 8 decals combine to make a spectacular goal shot past a diving goalie. Arrange them to fit your specific vehicle. They fit on an SUV or on a smaller car like a Fiat 500. WindowSport decals are easy to install! äó¢ Clean window with Windexäó¢ Wet againäó¢ Place decaläó¢ Squeegee out air bubbles with credit cardSingle DecalsWorld Cup 2014 has had some iconic moments starting with MatsŒæ Hummel's header, Suarez taking a bite of Giorgio Chiellini's shoulder and Neymar's spine breaking back injury.Œæ Sets available:Wear the images on a high quality 100% Cotton World Cup 2014 Memorabilia T-Shirt (available in S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXX) It is customized with the score, Germany 1, Argentina 0.I have added "World Cup 2014" wallpapers for PC's, iPads and mobile phones as a reward, plus Mac desktop icons. It is digital memorabilia. You'll be the first on the block to have one.What made me think of WindowSport?The idea for WindowSport was developed over time. When I was 16 I had a horrible car. I cut decals and put the name on the window. It didnäó»t make my car faster, it was more of a visual distraction so that you didnäó»t notice the dent in the door. That was a long time ago. In between drawings I played about 2500 baseball games. This is a mix of sports, cars and art.Late last year I designed car wraps for food trucks, race cars, and plumber trucks. I did a little evaluation. I broke the car down to degrees of decoratability. Actually, donäó»t think that is a word but you get where Iäó»m coming from. A full wrap is the highest degree. It is a major commitment. On the other end, the first thing people will decorate is the back window. The reason I found is that you know you can take it off with a razor blade. Here is the breakdown.A) Full Wrap B) Partial Wrap C) Doors D) Bumper E) WindowsI did some A and C with plans on D but I decided to skip to E. If you are still reading I commend you, this is actually a pretty goofy story.I started to do automotive window research. In general, the stick-figure family is pretty popular. That is followed by college pride, Calvin pissing and the ever confusing äóìRIPäó decal. It transforms your car into a rolling grave stone. äóìRIPäó Uncle Edward 1925-1996. I wondered if he is actually still in the trunk or possibly his ashes are in the glove compartment. This is the problem of the active mind. Being a sports guy and a car enthusiast I looked at the back window as a canvas. Instead of haphazardly placing stickers on the glass or bumperäó_from an animation perspective I wanted to complete a äóìgreat playäó. Pitcher on the right, batter on the left. QB and and wide out laid out. The next criteria is that the designs had to work on a Lexus QX or a Ford F-150.I have been getting the thumbs-up, people like the look. Iäó»m trying to creatively blend in while still making a point.The KickStarter Rewards are baseball and soccer related. The line is quickly expanding to: äó¢ Rowing äó¢ Martial Arts äó¢ Race Cars äó¢ Golf äó¢ Football äó¢ Diving äó¢ Bowling äó¢ Basketball äó¢ Volleyball äó¢ Zombies äó¢ Cycling äó¢ Faith äó¢ Pets äó¢ CelebritiesThe Unfortunate Stick-Figure Family Line pokes fun at what now is a craze. Check out GIF animations at: http://windowsport.com

I would love to be able to open a booth at ComicCon some day. I love drawing, and I love creating. Hopefully we can make this happen!If I can reach my goal (or more), I would like to have (at my merch booth) T-shirts, Hats/Beanies, Tote bags, Buttons, Dice bags, and so much more! I'd like to capture some nerd culture, with a little twist, plus, some of my own original art work.

Hello! My name is Benoit Falardeau, I am a graphic designer from Montrí©al, Quí©bec.ŒæLast october I did a series of 3 illustrations (photo-montage) about the theme "apocalypse". I won 2 awards for this: an Applied Arts Award and a Graphex Gold Award.The text following the project was :Humans knows that their actions are harmful to the Earth, but they persist because they are blinded by power and money. One day they will understand. One day it will be too late.I am very proud of this project and I want them printed on high-quality canvas and have them framed. For this, I need you help and I have cool rewards for you if you help me.ŒæNote you can see more details about the process of creation on my website.

Of Cryptids & Presidentswill feature full-page illustrations of terrifying moments from the secret history of U.S. Presidents. The book will depict all forty-four presidents in their concealed Cryptid forms or interacting with those denizens of darkened lore. Facing pages will offer thrilling and educational descriptions for each image containing an entertaining mixture of fact and fiction.What are Cryptids? They are beings that have been whispered about in the night, spoken of in hushed voices, but never exposed by science. They come to us from mythology and local legend alike. They are known by names like äóìBigfoot,äó äóìChupacabra,äó and äóìKraken.äó Others resemble ghosts, ghasts, yokai, djinn, and dybbuks. The book will be 8"x11" full color, and around 100 pages long.äóÂäóÂThe print run will include a limited number of Hardback editions and a larger number of paperbacks. All editions will be signed and numbered. There will only be one printing of the book. For cost reasons I may have to buy a few extra to sell to local bookstores or on ebay, but once itäó»s gone, itäó»s gone.äóÂ

Joseph Foster published his first book "Hobbs Goblin in The Treasure Adventure" in May 2014 to success and happiness of his readers. The first week it released it hit the Top 10 Amazon Large Print Children's Books and remains in the Top 5% of all books on Amazon.ŒæThe inspiration for Hobbs Goblin, the feisty and adventurous little goblin, cam from his son Gabriel. Gabriel (who will be 4 in August) is enamored with fantasy and goblins. Joe started this book originally as an art project and it struck a chord with Gabriel so Joe decided to take the step to self publish. Reviews have been great and Joe wants to continue on with his series.He is currently working on the next book "Hobbs Goblin on The Open Seas", a continuation of the first book. As the author an illustrator, Joe does it all. He writes the stories, draws the pictures by hand, and formats them on the computer. He is seeking financial support through this process so he can hopefully get Hobbs Goblin's newest adventure on the shelves by July 2014!Œæhttp://www.amazon.com/Hobbs-Goblin-The-Treasure-Adventure/dp/1499299982/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1400200748&sr=8-1&keywords=hobbs+goblinPhotos of Hobbs Goblin in The Treasure Adventure

What's a zine?A zine is a DIYŒæself-published work of original text and/or images usually produced via photocopier.What's #OOTD mean?OOTD is an acronym used on social media sites and apps meaning "outfit of the day" and is accompanied by a hashtag in front and a full-body selfie of what the person is wearing that day.About the Project#OOTD is going to be a collaborative zine made with the help of backers, who will submit a photo of themselves in their favorite outfit, which will then be illustrated by artist Allison Ranieri and collected in a bound book and PDF document.Where the Funds GoThe funds go to a) the effort of illustrating a full body portrait and b) to the making and shipping of the physical copies of the zines!ŒæWhat You Get in ReturnWhat the Zine will look likeŒæWhy I'm Doing ThisSeveral reasons:Overall, this project is about taking our selfie culture and turning it into a unique and interesting collection of all different kinds of people, cultures, ways of dressing and attitudes.ŒæWhat submitting involvesAfter you back the project and the goal is met, I will contact you with instructions on where to submit your photo.I will need a full-body photo of your outfit (yes, I said outfit, not your bare flesh, this is not an X-rated zine, sorry) in a full-length mirror with you holding the camera, or alternatively have a friend take your picture. Please also send your first name/nickname/username - just some sort of moniker that I can put under your illustrated portrait. (If your username is B0n3rM4n69 please just submit your first name because I'm not going to print that)Optional information you can include:The Project TimelineWhen the project ends in 30 days, I will send out instructions for submitting your photo. Once I collect even one submission, I will start drawing, and then on to the next one. I am expecting to do two to three drawings per day. After all the drawings are done, I will collect them all into a PDF document, and then print the zines myself on computer paper on my personal printer. The covers will be high quality 80 lb paper.Things to Know

"NOT FUNNY HA-HA" is a very special illustrated book. ŒæIt is a bold, slightly wry, graphic novel illustrating the lives of two young women who go through two different abortions.Following the lives of the girls (both coming from different cultural, family, and financial backgrounds), the novel begins at the moment that they decide to have abortions, then follows them through the process of choosing a clinic, reaching out to friends, partners, and/or family....and eventually the procedure(s) itself.ŒæWe watch as one of the girls decides to have a medical abortion, while the other decides on a surgical procedure. ŒæNOT FUNNY HA-HA does not address the events leading up to the pregnancy, or even the decision-making before choosing abortion as an option. ŒæIt simply shows (with an understanding wink) what happens when a woman GOES THROUGH IT, no questions asked. ŒæIt takes the viewer through the process from the waiting room to the bathroom to the weeks after, when the girls have gone "back to real life". ŒæIt shows how each other them relates what happened to their world again, how they see their bodies change, and what that means to them.ŒæThe book is meant to be a non-judgmental, comforting, even humorous look at what a woman can go through after she decides to have an abortion.NOT FUNNY HA-HA is a little bit technical, a little bit moving, and often funny.  Although the subject matter is heavy, the illustration are light (drawn in simple pencil on paper), and the text is hand-drawn.  The author takes a step back from putting forth any personal opinion whatsoever:  simply laying out the events and possibly emotional repercussions that could, and often do occur.  This is a book that a friend might buy for her girlfriend to read either before, during, or after going through an abortion.  This is a frank, but touching look at something many, many women go through, in a format that has not been done before.for more images from the book, please visit the NOT FUNNU HA-HA Twitter account:https://twitter.com/NOTFUNNYBOOKŒæ

I am trying to raise money to travel to Brazil. My major is Ethnic, Gender, and Labor Studies, and going to Brazil to focus on this art project would really help go towards my major.I want to focus on the graffiti art that is mainly located in the slums of Brazil, and the messages they share specifically on the FIFA World Cup, 2014. Brazilians live and breathe football, but hosting this event in their country? ŒæThis raises a lot of emotion, such as anger and concern for many Brazilians in regards to the World Cup. ŒæThe people who live in the favelas orŒæ"slums," are overlooked and ignored by society and their government. The Brazilian government is spending millions, even billions, of dollars towards the World Cup, 2014 as well as the summer Olympics that will be hosted in Rio de Janeiro in 2016.  The last time Brazil hosted the World Cup was back in 1950, but now in 2014, they host it again, and more people have been speaking out towards it.  It is sad because the government is spending so much money on the World Cup, but they cannot use any of that money to help their own citizens do so much as eat and be clothed. The only way they can share their opinions and have their voices be heard is through the art of graffiti. Graffiti in Brazil is different to graffiti in the United States. Graffiti in Brazil is bigger, bolder, and has a deeper message behind it. You can see the message of the art as well as understand the artist. Brazilians are even standing directly outside of the capitol Brasí_lia and protesting with signs written in English so that they can capture the attention of the whole world.My goal is to raise money so that I can travel to Brazil and participate in these protests and graffiti artwork. As much as I love soccer and watching the World Cup, the Brazilian government is in the wrong for letting their own citizens suffer. I will be traveling to Brazil to work with a popular graffiti street artist named Dinas, and other graffiti artists to help spread the word of the poverty and despair that the Brazilian citizens are facing.  It is important to understand and realize a different point of view on the reactions and feelings of Brazilians towards the World Cup.Brazilian graffiti is important to me because it is so detailed and just beautiful. It is an ignored art with a message that must be heard!The video shows graffiti artist Dinas who I interviewed last year when I went to Brazil. This year I want to go to Brazil because Dinas will be doing a mural in the streets of Rio de Janeiro which is an area with a lot of tourists, so it will be seen during the World Cup and surely be seen after.  Dinas showed me the basics of graffiti art while I went last year, but he will be teaching me a lot more when I visit him again. I will also be meeting up with graffiti artist Paulo Ito to participate in another mural of his. ŒæHere is a mural he just recently completed in response to the World Cup called, "Need Food, Not Football":"The Brazilian taxpayersäó» fear of being stuck with the World Cupäó»s $11 billion price tag has been realized most noticeably with an increase in the cost of living since winning the hosting bid in 2007."I want to be a participant in this future mural because I want to be the voice from an international perspective and slowly be a part of helping out Brazil. ŒæWorking on the mural during and even after the World Cup will allow the world to see the reactions of many Brazilians towards this event.So join me with this mural that is will be the voice of the people. Although I am only one person trying to get this idea out there and share the voices of people who are not heard, I know I can do it especially with the help of this awesome Kickstarter community!  This mural is for people who live in the slums of Brazil and who are ignored. I know this graffiti art project will be a great success.Here is an example of a video of some popular graffiti street art pieces that forever remain on the walls, buildings, trains, cars, and planes, of Brazil:With your help and contributions, I would be able to use it on travel expenses (plane ticket, hotel, food) and materials such as spray paint and other necessary tools to help with this graffiti mural and graffiti art and help spread the word. ŒæI want to give tools mainly for these artists because they are doing more than just graffiti, they are creating a lasting piece of art with an important and powerful message for all to see, and I am all about supporting a good cause.äóìThe world cup takes our schools and hospitals and leaves us its äóÖballsäó».äó

I will go to E3 July 11 to 12, take pics, and draw Nintendo/Microsoft/Sony exhibits + people using graphite pencil/pen and drawing paper. EX) Drawing the Nintendo booth, Smash Bros exhibit, people trying out games, roundtables. Once finished, I will post the drawings online and send the physical drawing to the backers.Sample drawings from the past 2 weeks:I can go to E3 because I am an approved Wii U developer, but I need $995 to buy an expo pass, so I am doing Draw E3 2014.Qualifications: Taken Basic Drawing I and just finished Basic Drawing II in college.random = I randomly send.you pick = You pick from the ones I show you.

I'm starting this kickstarter because recently I was accepted into CalArts summer Animation Program and there is currently no financial aid available for Extended Studies. Iäó»m extremely excited  and blessed to have this opportunity but, unfortunatelyŒæI donäó»t have enough money to pay for tuition..For those who don't know me, CalArts means a lot to me. Probably more than a University should mean to a student but I like that about myself. Everyday I am constantly striving to better my art work! When The Heart Betrays The Blood is a 120 page art book and I'm launching this page to raise money to print a first edition.When The Heart Betrays The Blood is the story of a young Jewish girläó»s escape from sexual abuse at the hands of her uncle via her strange relationship with the son of a white supremacist. Within this lurid Gothic romance the book asks complex ethical questions about personal conduct and group identity. It contrasts evil actions with evil ideology and asks you the reader to evaluate if an otherwise harmless man carrying a banner for an evil cause is worse than a man who portrays himself as decent and upright while quietly being monstrous in his private life. I think issues like this get muddled in a lot of contemporary discourse, wherein we assume so much about individuals, judging them by superficial things like what religion they profess or what party they support. Things that don't indicate much when it comes to how much integrity an individual has.When The Heart Betrays The Blood is a story told in drawings and writing; a sort of image and text dialectic. The images aren't there to bolster the text and the text isn't there to elucidate the images; they're both telling the story directly, but with different voices. My thesis with this project was always that image and text exist in a continuum of graphic communication and they could be engaged in a sort of "duet" format whereby they are separate and equal. This not only appeals to me for aesthetic reasons, but also for the varied interpretations it welcomes the reader to imagine. By segregating the images and the text on separate pages I left open space; space to picture images when reading the text, and space to imagine dialogue while looking at the images.The images are scratchboard. Conceptually, I wanted them to look like wood engravings, but sort of glitched; like you're looking at a wire frame rendering on a magnet-damaged monitor. They have a distinct sort of "vibrating" optical illusion quality that I'm really proud of. I formatted the text like a screenplay because that's how comic books are initially written. In its early stages I thought of this project as a sort of abstraction of what a comic book is. The longer I worked on it the more it developed an identity beyond that sort of conceptual gimmick. The culmination of over four years of labor, When The Heart Betrays The Blood stands as a massive milestone in my personal artistic development and I think, given a chance to be seen, it will find an appreciative audience. I hope you will be a member of that first audience!If you're on the fence and would like to read a sample send me a message and I'll respond with a short PDF.Thanks for checking the project out!

A sample of our illustrations:Have a favorite story you think should be in the collection? Let us know here: http://bookses.com/rBookses is a project to illustrate stories. It's a place and a process where artists at all levels can contribute small improvements at a time to an illustration, making it just a little bit better, until the whole story is illustrated by a team of potentially thousands of artists. To give an analogy, it's like Wikipedia, but instead of writing factual articles on a topic, we create original illustrations for a story.It's the illustrator's version of jamming. The idea is not to do everything by yourself, but to have a conversation with one another, to leave room for the next person to be creative. That's why it's so important that everyone contributes just a little bit at a time to a drawing, to make it just a little bit better, or different. Then someone else can add their own take, and so on. I believe it's this element of back-and-forth that makes an experience fun and engaging. If everyone did a complete illustration on their own, it wouldn't be a game. It'd just be an art exhibition.Each artist is not only encouraged but urged to add their own ideas and personality to the work. Ideas that wouldn't occur to one person working alone would eventually occur to someone else, and they'll make it happen. Think you can render more convincing water? Just get a copy and go for it. Don't like how cartoony a guy's face turned out? Grab the previous version and branch your own. Is there a better way to draw this whole scene? Why not do it all over from scratch? Like someone's idea from another illustration? Why not adapt and extend it? The best reason I can give for myself is that there are some stories I really love---Harry Potter, Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell, Wizard of Earthsea, Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones---that I'd love to illustrate for fun. You'd want to contribute because the book means something to you, and you want to connect with other people who feel the same way.On the other hand, if you're really good, we'll pay you to do what you love! See our hiring notice below.Since this is our pilot book, it's likely there won't be enough casual contributors to complete the book. However, we've assembled a core and guest team of talented young illustrators to make sure you get a quality book  on time regardless of fan contribution. Our ongoing hiring process and flexible collaboration schedule also means we'll have a constant flow and mix of new talent, making the art that much more interesting.In the Project timeline below I'll work out how long it would take 7 artists working full time to complete this particular book.If you can color inside the lines, you can help. If you go outside the lines once in a while, you can still help. Someone else will improve your work. If you keep coloring outside the lines, you're probably an artist!In fact, an unexpected upshot is that beginning art students can learn how to draw, by watching more experienced artists at work and by participating in the process. There's no better way to learn than doing.In an effort to keep production costs manageable, in this first iteration of the project we've decided to illustrate a collection of 20 short stories, over a period of 2 months. You still get to vote on the titles, in any genre, provided that they are public domain and approximately 5 pages. Grimms' and Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tales are great examples, or we could go with an international selection from Project Gutenberg: http://www.gutenberg.org/wiki/Short_Stories_%28Bookshelf%29Want more artists and stories? We've got you covered! Please check out our stretch goals below.You have a choice of a soft or a hard cover edition, or both. (You can also send one of the artists a similar set to show your appreciation. See the rewards section to the right.) The book will be somewhere around 100 pages,  printed  8 x 10 in portrait full color pages on 100 lb glossy paper. BONUS! Since this pilot project is mostly a proof of concept to demonstrate the new collaborative process and not strictly a traditional illustrated book, in cases of spectacular collaboration there'll be a work in progress reel showing the evolution of a work.We'll be illustrating 20 short stories spread out over 2 months. That works out to about 2 and a half stories every week, or one story every 2 days.Assuming each story has 5 pages, and on average one illustration per page, we'll be doing 5 drawings over two days. On each of the two days, 7 or more artists will collaborate in a 3-hour sprint, broken down into 15-minute sessions of incremental improvement.Of course, casual contributors won't be subject to the same schedule! They can chip in whenever they feel like it.And that's a good thing! Your money will not only fund the book production, it'll also help us keep on improving Bookses as a platform to meet the needs of readers and illustrators. Every expense has been rigorously budgeted and accounted for, which is why it only costs $40,000 to develop a unique and innovative technology, help supporting young artists both financially and artistically, and at the same time paying for the book. You get 3 for the price of one!These rising young talents represent the best of the best from Toronto's top art schools, including OCAD and the University of Toronto. Some are also friends of mine when we studied together at UfT Art. A few are professional illustrators.If you're an artist and you like the whole idea, we would love to get you on the team. As long as there are sprint sessions available, we'll be glad to have you on board. (Please see the Project timeline above for more details on the format of the 2-day slots.) If not, the next book is only 3 months away.We've already finished half the book. Read the stories here: http://bookses.com

I have an addiction. An addiction that takes up a large portion of my life and I can not control it any longer. I was ridiculed in school for my hobby and have only recently been open about it because of the stigma this addiction faces. I am addicted to drawing dicks.ŒæIn my spare time (or any time, really) I draw dicks. Dicks as ships, dicks as planes, dicks as sharks, dicks with dicks who also have dicks, my friends as dicks, or douches, and everything in between. This book is dedicated to my love of dicks, drawing and the love of fine-ish art paired with snarky remarks and sassy comments. Because Life is about laughing and Dicks create life, so why not pair them together? The funds raised depends on how many books will be printed. The more we raise, the more books there will be! Also, incentives ... Like your very own dick drawing, or a shout out in my book! Heck, why not your dick drawing in my book!ŒæLets all band together for our love of crude and rude coffee books as well as dicks and raise some dollars!

It has always been my dream to fill people's lives with beautiful, treasured things.  And I still dream, everyday of having a space to use as my creative outpouring, a little store perhaps. One filled with vintage inspired illustrations, upcycled furniture and the most delightful objects that have once been unwanted and now get a new life. I love recycling unwanted wooden boards, old paintings and old furniture, giving each piece my fullest attention and love in the process of transforming it into a shabby chic piece or a high fashion illustration. This project is my means of introducing people to a new way of capturing fashion, such as bridal. You send me a photo of say, your friend's dress and I do a high fashion take on it, still keeping the dress as the focus, and what an interesting gift to give, capturing the one special dress and having something to hang on the wall other than a photograph! Please note I will require the date you need the illustration ready by, taking into account the delivery  times, as well as an email with the photo of the dress and the colour scheme

Lissa Loo Stationery has met a new goal- we have been accepted to exhibit at the National Stationery Show in May 2015! Itäó»s been a dream of mine to not only own a business that showcases my artistic ability, but grow it in such a way that people start to notice what weäó»re doing, and know us by name.ŒæWhile we have been reaching goals left and right very quickly, the stationery show is a HUGE endeavor for us as we are still a relatively small company. Instead of putting the show off for another year, we decided to take the plunge & get ready for next yearäó»s show and DO IT!Soäó_what exactly is Lissa Loo Stationery about?ŒæWe stand for the beauty of the handwritten note. We believe that stationery should have meaning. We also believe in the unconventional greeting. How many times have you been at a big box store to pick out a card, only to find that you canäó»t find one that really says what you want? Itäó»s difficult to find cards with a cheeky edge- and itäó»s also difficult to find cards that are LGBT-specific. This is where we want to break the mold. We create every card from start to finish at our in-home office/studio.ŒæŒæWe would also like to debut new items at the National Stationery Show also, since the show is 11 months away. The Show is the next step in growing the business, especially when it comes to wholesale, and we would forever appreciate your donation to the expansion of Lissa Loo Stationery.ŒæWHAT WILL THIS KICKSTARTER FUND?Œæ-Booth rental fees and cost of designing a kick-ass eye-catching boothŒæ-Printing of mailers, press kits, postcards, stickers, buttons, promotional material and order formsŒæ-Travel expenses to and from the show. We will be driving since we around ~5 hours away, but will need to rent equipment once in the city.We are hoping that, by setting our goal on the lower side, we will exceed the goal and be able to add extras to our already growing list, to make our first experience at the show absolutely amazing!ŒæYou pledge NOW and pay LATER. I don't get a penny unless I reach my goal. All cards are charged after funding for this project closes, which is a month from now.WHAT YOUäó»LL GET:ŒæNo matter how much you donate, your name will be displayed on a board in my booth at the National Stationery show as huge thanks!$10 - One card of your choice$15 - Two cards of your choice$20 - One card plus one journal of your choice$30 - One set of 6 cards of your choice$50 - One set of 10 cards and a journal of your choice$100 - Set of 10 cards with custom illustration, plus a voucher for a set of 10 holiday cards of your choice$200 - Two sets of 10 cards with custom illustration, plus a voucher for a set of 10 holiday cards of your choice$500 - Three sets of 10 cards with custom illustration, plus a voucher for a set of 10 holidays cards of your choice$1000 - FREE CARDS FOREVER. No seriously, I'll pretty much give you whatever you want.Œæ

The original drawing was on lined paper, which was scanned into the computer and then painstakingly edited to remove all lines of the paper.ŒæHere is the original drawing:and here are the two prints as they will be printed on high quality 90lb gloss 27" x 39" paper:Original Coloring:Negative Version:This is one of my personal favorite drawings of mine, I would love to be able to get it printed in a large format like this.

About Me:ŒæMy name is Olivia Cox, but you may know me better as The Living Wiccan, a popular Pagan tumblr blog.Sigils are a big part of my craft work and as such, I've accumulated a large number of sigils -- each of them personally designed -- that span a large array of themes and ideas. I use them primarily in spell work; in warding, in altar decorations, at the front of books, above beds and doorframes. If you can name it, I've got a sigil there.Sigils are symbols, drawings, or designs that have specific meaning to their creator, in order to achieve a certain purpose. Sigils can be used for protection, love, money, cleansing, sacred spaces, confidence, courage.... the possibilities are endless.ŒæThey're an integral part of my witchcraft, and as such the level of detail and love that goes into each and every sigil design is unparalleled.About the Project:ŒæThe Sigilic Tarot is aŒæproject that I've had in mind for years now, but never figured out exactly how to make it work. Now that the vision is clear and the resources are available to produce such a unique deck, I'm asking for your help to get it started.The Sigilic Tarot is unique in its design, with 50 cards made up of 5 suits of 10 instead of the traditional 78 of major and minor arcana. Each suit represents a different aspect of our lives: ŒæThe deck also has a feature that not many other decks have - images laid right in the designs to tell you if the card's topic affects you, or those around you. This makes for extremely easy tarot reading. ŒæThe abstract art of the cards leads to readings that are full of interpretation, giving the tarot reader so much more independence to use their intuition. The cards aren't as rigidŒæas traditional decksŒæin their meanings vs. their art, causing a great sense of freedom for the user.The cards are designed in another spectacular way: not only do the images themselves make a beautiful divination experience, but the corners of the cards - the quarter-circles which indicate the suits - Œæalso line up to create unique sigils in between the cards, for a different mesmerizing read each time (see picture below!)ŒæŒæThis deck aims to have  an incomparable look to them that will be a must-have for any tarot enthusiast, reader, or collector. With your help, we can make that a reality!ŒæThe deck will, of course, also come with a book of meanings, instructions, and sample spreads for the new reader!ŒæŒæFor this project the 50-card deck will have  a limited print of 500. Once the 500 decks are sold out, they'll be gone forever (a long time!). All decks will come in a custom made cloth bag.About the Costs: The majority of the funds raised for this project will be put toward printing costs. Finding a reliable printing company for tarot decks is an expensive process! As this deck is also hand-designed, some funds will also go toward lino (for the original prints) and other art supplies. Other costs include shipping costs, shipping boxes, deck packaging, and Kickstarter fees.ŒæA very rough breakdown:Rewards!  The rewards portion of this KickstarterŒæis pretty fantastic, and offers something for everyone who wants to back this project.  IMPORTANT NOTE: All rewards can be shipped anywhere in the world outside Canada, so long as a $5 shipping fee is added.ŒæAll rewards are posted on the right side of the page and feature something for everyone. Anything from tarot readings to altar cloths, from garden banners to jewelry, there's definitely something that'll whet your apetite.ŒæStretch Goals:  Should the Kickstarter fund more than the original $12,000 goal, it benefits everyone!ŒæThe Art:Some selections of the artwork for your viewing pleasure, spanning all five suits!Œæ

YOU can be a part of WORLD CUP 2014!Œæ  Pledge this project and I will DRAW YOU in full, intricate detail as one of 500 fans representing the 32 countries competing at World Cup 2014!Soccer.Œæ Futbol.Œæ Football.Œæ Whatever you call it, you love this game!Œæ We all grew up with this sport.Œæ In it's in your blood.Œæ You wait impatiently for four long years for your team's opportunity to once again compete for world supremacy!Œæ Most of us won't make it to Brazil this year to watch the games in person, but wherever youŒæare, I know you'll beŒæproudly donning yourŒæteam's colours, singing and chanting andŒæshouting and cheering your team on!Œæ Here is your opportunity to represent your country and your team at World Cup!Œæ I want to create a work of art that not only celebrates the game and the many, talented players and exciting moments that unfold at World Cup, but also the FANS!Œæ I want to capture the beauty and emotion of the fans and how that emotion will engulf the whole world this June and July. I want to show the beautiful diversityŒæof 32 fanbases from around the world coming together in one stadium.ŒæŒæAnd they won't just be faceless background noise or blurred colours behind the action.Œæ I will draw each of YOU in full detail, down to the smallest, most intricate design on your clothing.Œæ YOU will be fully recognizable to your friends and family; and of course yourself!Œæ I will draw your unique expression of your love for your team and add your colours to the crowd so that fans everywhere know that your teamŒæis represented and supported by YOU!The conceptŒæphoto for this piece is just that; a concept.Œæ The actual players I draw will be chosen based on their performance at World Cup 2014.Œæ They will beŒæwearing their actual country's uniforms.Œæ This willŒæNOTŒæbe a piece celebrating the winning team.Œæ This piece will celebrate the sport itself, the coming together of countriesŒæand the competition that is World Cup.Œæ If I receive over 500 fan faces, I will add a secondŒæpiece to this project (a mate for this one) that will include the other 16 teams and a left goal.Œæ The second print would be included as a free bonus and packaged alongsideŒæeach print in the pledge rewards to the right of this page.TO SEE A LARGER VIEW OF THE ARTWORK CONCEPT, CLICK HERE!For a pledge of only $25,ŒæYOUR NAME WILL BE WRITTEN IN THE GRASS! ŒæFor a pledge of only $99, I WILL DRAW YOUR FACE in full, intricate detail in the stands at World Cup!Once you have pledged, please send me asŒæmany photos of yourself as you'd like me to consider when drawing you in the artwork.Œæ It doesn't matter when or where your photo was taken.ŒæŒæThe background in your photo does not matter either.  I will be drawing YOU with other fans behind you so the background of your photo will not be used.  Cheering photos are better than non-cheering photos, but at the very least, you must be smiling! =)  Wear your team coloursŒæand SHOW YOURŒæWORLD CUP EXCITEMENT!!Œæ Shoot your photo today with your phone and e-mail to me at Jeremy@jeremybresciani.comHere are some close-up photosŒæof aŒæ500-fan piece I drewŒælast year so you can see the detail you can expect in this piece.Œæ The main difference is that I will be drawingŒæWorld Cup fans in FULL COLOUR!Œæ (If their are enough supporters, I may offer a black and white option to those fans who prefer it).Here are just a few examples of my other pencil works of art:

Where the Wild Things Are is a children's book written by Maurice Sendak in 1963.ŒæI have always been a fan of "Where the Wild Things Are."Œæ The illustrations, especially, are interesting, slightly scary, and beautiful works of art.Œæ When I moved to Philadelphia eight months ago I visited a museum called The Rosenbach Museum and Library, which happens to have the largest collection of art and writings by Maurice Sendak, the visionary behind the popular children's book.Œæ Seeing a lot of his ideas, sketches, and final watercolors in person inspired me a great deal, and I have been interested ever since to re-create some of his iconic images.The project is just that: re-creating most (if not all) of the imagery from Where the Wild Things Are, though as silkscreens.Œæ I wish to do this initially to better acquaint myself with the art of silk screening and better hone my skills as a professional printmaker.Œæ Secondly, I wish to pay homage to Sendak by re-creating his artworks.Œæ Being that they will be silkscreens, they will be slightly different than the originals by Maurice Sendak, but will still have the same playful and beautiful imagery.Thirdly, the final images will be made into a hand-bound artists book with a strictly limited edition of 5 pieces.Œæ One of these books is for myself (of course), one is being donated to the Franklin Furnace Foundation in New York, a third is being donated into the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art in New York.Œæ The remaining two will be available here.Great question. ŒæMaurice Sendak created the "Where the Wild Things Are" book in 1963. ŒæIt was and is to this day a classic. ŒæHis illustrations are incredible and even more powerful in person. ŒæSo why even re-make them? ŒæFor me, it's much more about a personal exploration of the characters and images. ŒæI enjoy them and during the process and creating the silkscreens, not only will I learn more about the characters and the book, but I will increase my skills as a professional artist and become a better silk screener. ŒæBeing that Sendak's original illustrations were pen & ink and watercolor, it is difficult to retain that amount of detail when transferring the medium over to silkscreen. ŒæHowever, as much attention to the incredible details is retained as possible. ŒæThe image below, for example, shows Max and some of the Wild Things in a march. ŒæThe close-up shot shows some of the details that were kept of the characters (from left to right) Ira, Douglas and Kw. ŒæDouglas, especially, has a great deal of details in his plumage and feathers. ŒæNow, lets be honest, this is the part most of you are here for: the rewards!Œæ There are several reward levels set up that include original silk screens from some of your favorite illustrations of the beloved children's classic. ŒæFor Twenty dollars, you will receive one 5" x 7" silkscreen of one of the following images from "Where the Wild Things Are." ŒæImage options include:"Max in his Wolf Suit""Max Howling at the Moon""The Sea Dragon"ForŒæthirty dollars, you will receive one 8" x 10" silkscreen. ŒæAn early bird special of this also allows the first ten people getting this reward to have it for only $25!Images options include:ŒæŒæ"Title page with Bull and text""Max on his boat""Carol""Max and Carol with Balloon Heart" (inspired by the movie, not the book)"Max Scaring Judith and Alexander"ForŒæsixty dollars, you will receive one of the large prints from the series. ŒæThese will be about 12" x 20" and will be any of the iconic "double page" illustrations featured in the book.Image options include:"Wild Rumpus""Howling at the Moon""Max sailing away on his boat"For two-hundred and fifty dollars, you will receive ALL of the 8" x 10" silkscreens. ŒæThese will come in a custom, hand-made portfolio which will be hand-signed and numbered. ŒæPlus, as a bonus, you will also receive an "Kickstarter Exclusive" print: a print of Max in his wolf suit, with a large "K" in the bottom left corner. ŒæThese are available only here through Kickstarter! Œæ(Only twenty of these complete sets are available!)Also, for $225 you can get all of the 12" x 20" pieces.Œæ These will not be in a portfolio, however, due to their odd size.Interested in the final product of the hand made book? ŒæTwo of these will be made available here, the other three are already gone. ŒæWhy $300 for a hand made book? ŒæFirstly, as mentioned the entire edition size is only 5 pieces. ŒæOne of these will stay in my collection. ŒæThe other two are already going to museum collections. ŒæOne of the books will be housed in the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art, New Yorkäó_ so technically, you have the same artwork they have in their permanent collection.In a few of my latest projects here on Kickstarter, I have offered artwork world wide, without realize that shipping to Australia, Germany, etc is incredibly expensive. ŒæIf not living in the United States and you are interested, let me know and I will get a direct shipping quote for you. ŒæI wish shipping was cheaper, but it definitely isn't.Also, if there is an image that you are interested in and it is not available, just send me a message and we can work out a custom-created silk screen for you.ŒæI will also be adding additional rewards and perks as the fusing level increases. ŒæSome of these will include free prints to whomever donates a certain amount of money, etc.Since I launched this project I've gotten this question about a dozen times already.Œæ Yes, this is legal and I am not breaking any copyright laws.Œæ The images are not being stolen and re-copied, but altered into a different style, different kind of artwork and looks quite different (notice all of the backgrounds are not in my images).Œæ These changes on their own make this project not breaking any laws and copyrights.

I recently had the idea to put my art on trading cards, so Flex Borin Collectible Trading Cards are traditional 2.5'' x 3.5'' Trading Cards depicting some of my paintings. You can get a better view of these on my website www.FlexBorin.comŒæIŒæestimate the cost of printing, production, packaging, marketing and distribution should be around $25,000.
