My goal is to have my trading cards in every store and all other venues where trading cards of all kinds are bough, sold and traded. Be it specialty hobby stores or any of the big box chain stores.  I have all that is needed set in place and ready to go, minus the money to pay for it all.  All printing, distributors, and marketing is just waiting for me to pull the trigger on this project. I have most of the cards printed, but the packaging and marketing will take more money then I have at my disposal, so that is why I'm here to ask for your help and contributions. Œæ

Food allergies are very prevalent with about 6% of children having them.Œæ However, many of these children don't realize that others alsoŒæhave food allergies.Œæ This children's book, intended for all children will help raise awareness.Œæ It will also hopefully decrease anxiety from children who think they are 'different', and also decrease any teasing or bullying from others.As you can tell, I am not an artist and therefore sent the book to an illustrator and the money raised here will provide the funding for this.

The media often portrays Detroit with negative images of poverty and urban blight. Our goal is to express a positive image of Detroit and show the world how great the city really is today. The funds raised will cover the cost of an artist, the printing of thousands of posters and a dedicated landing page with the artwork. We have done two posters of Detroit in the late eighties and still see them framed on walls today. The content of this new illustration will be different in that it will not include the suburbs, just downtown and midtown Detroit. We are working with many local businesses and organizations to create a classic piece of art that will put Detroit in the best possible light. With the printed poster distribution, online exposure and social media strategy, we will help Detroit continue to thrive, one positive image at a time. Join the cause!

The Art of Weightlifting is an illustrated book discussing and celebrating the beauty and complexity of Olympic-style Weightlifting as explained and performed by renowned expert Diane FuŒæ(http://www.fubarbell.com) and Produced and Art Directed by Animation Producer / Photographer / Comic book writer Eric Calderon.Depicted with colorful original illustrations, the Art of Weightlifting will detail theories behind the seemingly simple, but deeply mysterious two moves that lifters around the world and in every culture have been perfecting since the late 19th century - the 'clean and jerk' and the 'snatch.'Equally at home on a coffee table or in a gym bag, the Art of Weightlifting seeks to be an object of discussion for those very familiar with the sport and to those who have never lifted weights in their life.The production of the Art of Weightlifting will be a unique combination of photography, graphics, illustrations, and color that will be a visual collaboration of Diane Fu, Eric Calderon, and many talented artists and illustrators.Help us reach our stretch goal so we can also produce a unique'rotoscoped' animation so you can see all the beauty of our book in actual motion as well!Finally, see yourself illustrated as well! ŒæWe're offering a limited exclusive chance for 50 lifters to have their likeness drawn in one of the style of our book!Thanks for your support! We hope you're as excited about this idea as we are!~ Diane and Eric

Hello. I am a sixteen year old girl from Oakland, California. I love art, and I am always looking for new opportunities to share my passion with the rest of the world. I have found that street fairs and art shows are the most effective ways for me to get my illustrations out there. Unfortunately, the expenses for these activities are aŒætad pricey for a teen on a budget.Your donations would go towards paying for the various booth fees, table and chair rentals, and necessary matting and framing expenses.A bit about my process and creations:The history of the brounie can be traced to the folklore of ancient northern England and Scotland. Back then, brounies were unseen imps that helped around the house, and of course, they also had a mischievous side. They ate porridge and honey and were likely to disappear if given anything else as payment.In my creative mind,ŒæbrouniesŒæhave taken on the modern world and adapted to some of the odd customs of our time. Sometimes brounies look identical to their master -- or they may have physical attributes in common -- but most often they take on one or two of the character traits their person possesses. For example, a human who enjoys omelets may have a brounie with chicken-like qualities. My favorite medium is pen and ink. My art markers are my babies. I take care of them as such. I draw my inspiration for my artwork from colorful children's shows and current Japanese culture.Your donations would be greatly appreciated!

- Awesome Lithographic Quality Posters in A2 or 18X24- Hand Numbered, UV Satin Sealed on Thick Paper- $10 each when you buy 10, global delivery includedŒæŒæHey internet.Here's the situation. I work for an traditional poster printing company.We do lots of great work, but the sad reality is that the printing industry as a whole works like an airplane with two types of passengers,If you're printing lots and lots of posters and can commit to a big dollar payment, your stuff is printed on top of the line 2 million dollar presses, using fancy paper, top shelf operators and quickly. The downside is that you need to buy 200 to 500 of 1 design.If you're a small designer with a short run and a modest budget, all you get is access to the type of machines at Kinkos, Officeworks which aren't on lithographic paper, have no protective coatings and have no collector or resale value.In china and taiwan where an electronics plants can cost up to $60 million, the workers run a special weekend shift totally by themselves for small orders. It's good for the factory since the workers take responsibility for the small orders and the factory gets a bit of extra volume without jeopardising it's core clients..Everytime you spend money, you're casting a vote for the kind of world you want. ŒæSo far,Œæ$400,000 has been raised on Kickstarter to print other people's kickass designs, but this project is the only one of it's kind that enables you, Mr Awesome Kickstarterererer,Œæto create your own destiny and profitably sell hand-numbered, collectable posters in your own community without having to spend $3 million on a printing plant and a team of people to run it.ŒæThe money raised through kickstarter helps us get started in offering this useful service to the world. Sell your art - Œæand helpŒæliberate lithographic prints from restrictive minimum orders.We think you're awesome.

The Isis series is one of the most popular series in the SJS DIRECT catalog. Featuring a positive Black female heroine, these contemporary fantasy stories based on Egyptian mythology have built a small following of readers of all ages in paperback and eBook over the past year and a half all over the world.While most customers have enjoyed the stories in the Isis series, some have complained about the art on the covers. Due to financial reasons Iäó»ve been drawing the covers myself over the past year.  Being out of work these past five years, I just donäó»t have the money to hire a professional artist.I know many readers judge books by their covers. And to leave that powerful first impression on them so they will give the Isis series a try, Iäó»d like to hire a professional artist to draw, ink and color the cover for the next book in the Isis series: Isis: Wrath of the Cybergoddess.The concept cover Iäó»ve drawn up features two figures and a I want to feature a minimal background. I estimate the cost to be around $500 to hire a professional artist to draw up and color the cover for the paperback and eBook editions. If I can move past the $500 benchmark I can see about trying to put an insert or two in between the pages of the paperback and the digital editions.Help me take the Isis series to the next level. In a sci-fi/fantasy world of mostly White heroines such as Wonder Woman, Batgirl, Supergirl, She-Ra, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Xena: Warrior Princess, I created Isis so little Black girls would have their own heroine featured in fantasy adventures they could identify and relate to. With a quality cover designed by a professional artist I know I could reach a lot more readers all over the world. With your support Isis could be the next Monster High or Harry Potter.

THE WHYI have had this dream of creating a journal with illustrations reflecting the mood spectrum for some time. ŒæThere may be days when I don't feel like writing, but if I can circle or mark an illustration that reflects my mood, I will have achieved something. ŒæIn the Mood...a journal for those whose moods swing! has illustrations on each page showing the range of moods, from the deepest, darkest depression to the most ecstatic-on-the-verge-of-psychotic, manic. ŒæEven the mixed mood - I'm sad but my thoughts are racing a mile a minute - has a spot. ŒæAnd for additional interest, illustrations which tie in with quotations by poets and writers which reflect our experience are sprinkled throughout, on a ratio of two illustrations to one quote. ŒæNaturally, we're leaving lots of room to write!Recently, the World Health Organization suggested we keep track of our moods in its video: Œæ"I had a black dog, his name was Depression." Œæwww.youtube.com/watch?v=XiCrniLQGYcŒæ While this video speaks to depression only, Sarah's illustrations encompass the entire span.The illustrator, my daughter Sarah, is not only a gifted artist but is uniquely qualified to illustrate these moods as she has witnessed them firsthand. ŒæIf you have read my bio, you'll know I have Bipolar Disorder. Just check out Wikipedia's List of People with Bipolar Disorder -en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_people_with_bipolar_disorder - and you'll see I'm in good company!THE HOWThis is where you come in. ŒæThe finances will be used to publish the journal and market it worldwide. ŒæI feel anyone can use this journal and have fun doing so. ŒæIt will take within 90 - 120 days from the time the publisher receives the manuscript to having printed copies available.WHAT HAPPENS IF WE'RE OVERFUNDED?We want this journal to be an international success. ŒæThere will be time and effort put into reaching out to as many people as possible worldwide.

Œæ ŒæI thought it would be awesome to make a traditional playing card deck with a Steampunk theme in a tin case. For over two years now I have had the idea of making a deck of playing cards based in the world of steampunk. As a licensed K-12 Visual Art teacher, I have spent the last two years primarily focused on my students and curriculum.Œæ Now, it is time I invest in my art.Œæ While I frequently draw, paint, and work with fibers, my greatest passion is for printmaking processes.Œæ This project is designed to begin approaching printmaking as my primary medium for art production.Before I can begin printing, I need to establish a setup with the proper equipment.Œæ The funds raised through this project will fund the initial cost to acquire necessary equipment.Œæ This equipment will serve a purpose far greater than this one project.Œæ It will be the foundation for years of printing and editions to come.Œæ Once the tools have been acquired, the space will be setup.Œæ Then the real fun begins!I have already developed a range of images to create as printed artworks.Œæ Two have been selected as the initial editions to create with the new printing press.The first, Balloon Ride, will be a linoleum cut edition.Œæ It will be created as a suicide print with two colors.Œæ This means after the first color has been printed, I will carve away from the same block to print the second color.Œæ It will be a limited edition of 15 prints and can never be reprinted.Œæ With an estimated image size of 9" x 12", this will be the smaller of my two editions.The second edition, Seeking Wisdom, will be a woodcut printed edition. At approximately 12" x 18", the scale of this piece will land on the larger end of my printmaking spectrum.Œæ It will be another suicide print edition, this time in three colors.Œæ This limited edition of 15 prints can never be reprinted.The reality is that prints inherently appear different from drawings.Œæ They vary stylistically, based upon the process through which the image is created.Œæ For a better understanding of how the completed editions may appear, take a look at my 2011 prints Mismatched Socks and Just Your Puppet.Other examples of my work can be viewed at my Facebook page or on Etsy.

The immediate goal of this project is to create a tarot deck that is based on the unique underlying structure that I have created with the philosophy described on my web site: www.palmprints.com. The larger, more ambitious goal is to create a deck that will surpass the extremely popular Rider/Waite/Smith deck in popularity and cause my underlying structure, and template of intended meanings, to become the de facto standard, or new paradigm, that every future artist of tarot uses as a guide for drawing future decks. This will require hiring a really amazing artist/illustrator who will collaborate with me to incorporate the best features of decks that I have drawn myself in the past, as well as anything that might be useful from traditional tarot decks, to create a master hybrid deck that says everything I need it to say. Lots of people buy tarot decks just for the artwork. I need to hire someone with some real talent who can create a really amazing deck; a deck so amazing that mainstream publishers of tarot decks will want to publish it, rather than me having to publish it myselfäó_ a deck so amazing that people devoted to tradition will buy it just for the art, and thenäó_ maybeäó_ some dayäó_ take the time one day to examine it further for what it has to offer the world of tarot as a new paradigm and better operating system.With a really amazing deck in hand, I can then promote my new paradigm in ways that gets attention from tarot traditionalists who might be open to exploring a new way of looking at tarot. I have some of my decks available on a print-on-demand web site. But I really need a super amazing deck that is professionally printed and for general sale through a popular publisher of tarot decks to give me some credibility as an alternative and allow people to use my system.If I can't get a traditional publisher of tarot to publish my deck even after being drawn by an amazing artist, I can self publishing using the on-demand options. There is not much profit to be made this way, but it is an option that would at least get the artwork out there for people to use.The even longer term goal of this project is to get the entire contents of my web site published as a book, so that all the ideas held within don't die with me, but can live on, on someone's bookshelf, long after I've croaked and stopped paying Yahoo! to host my site. Until then, I give away all my ideas online. It would be great to meet an artist who would want to make this deck just for the fun of it and for the exposure that would result from people using it, and thereby be able to give it away for free. But finding artists willing to work for fun or even speculated profits is not easy. I need to have something to offer them as incentive.I've consulted with a few artist in order to get estimates of cost. Some say they would do it for $100 per image. Others estimate much higher, like $400 or $700 or more! There are 74 cards in my deck (plus designing some title cards and a box). If I can get someone to do this for $300 per image that would be $22,200. So, as instructed, I've included a bit more in my proposal to cover the costs of rewards. I'm keeping this total low, so that I might reach the goal and have *something* to offer *someone*. But at a low rate, it might be hard to attract the best of the best. So, if you find this project compelling and want me to be able to hire the very best, pledge a lot, because if more funding comes in, I might be able to attract an even better artist.I've figured that having an artist on board already might be better. They could certainly help in soliciting funds. And people might want to know who the artist is before backing the project. But I am hoping that the proposal itself will attract someone. If not, I will be out looking myself and let you know if I find anyone interested in doing this for this amount. Otherwise, this is about funding my ability to hire any artist I can, whether my choice is popular with the people funding the project or not. Help me hire *someone*!

I think every artist hits a point where they feel stuck on a plateau development-wise äóñ or worse yet, feel like theyäó»re backsliding and losing some of what theyäó»ve learned previously. Thatäó»s where I find myself. The pressures and frustrations with my day job have long been keeping me from sketching.  I end up with little drive to draw and feel that if I am going to draw, it has to be something great.  Fear of it not being so has kept me from sketching at all.  Itäó»s a vicious cycle to be in, and this project is meant to put an end to it.  Iäó»m giving myself permission to draw badly. A multitude of great artists of the past are credited with the concept, but it bears repeating and the original source appears to be Walt Stanchfield.  I know I heard it from at least one teacher at college and Iäó»m sure every art student has heard some variation of it: Everybody has 10,000 bad drawings in them.  The best way to handle all those bad drawings is to get them out as soon as possible. So - I am resetting the count and starting over from zero.  My goal is to do ten thousand sketches in as short a time as possible.  Hopefully by the end of 2014 Iäó»ll be done, but it may take longer.  Ultimately, it will help me relearn that thereäó»s nothing shameful about äóìdrawing badlyäó.  Every sketch from a 30 second gesture to a polished drawing is a learning opportunity.  And all those sketches will be put on display on my blog, Dare to Draw Badly (WARNING: contains life drawing, which means artistic nudity.Œæ It's flagged as NSFW to be on the safe side, but if that kind of thing bothers you, don't visit!). My progress can be viewed at http://daretodrawbadly.tumblr.comŒæ What kind of sketches am I doing?This is going to be a long, work-intensive project and Iäó»m sure that the nature of what I draw is going to shift over time as I feel more confident in certain subject matter and move on to new, less familiar territory.  Iäó»m starting with the basics äóñ drawing from life, using online tools to do figure drawing for both humans and animals.Later on, I may be sketching from memory or using my more solid knowledge of anatomy to create images of strange fantasy creatures.Œæ Generally, the sketches will fall under these categories:Gestures (30 second to two minute sketches).  The goal is to capture the essence of the pose, with little in terms of detail.  Generally done on newsprint pads. Human gesture example: http://www.dragonfyredawn.com/kickstarter/jan5figures2.jpgAnimal gesture example: http://www.dragonfyredawn.com/kickstarter/jan9cats2.jpgSketches (5-10 minutes).  Quick sketches where shading and form is paid more attention if the lighting source of the subject allows it.  If the lighting source isnäó»t conductive to blocking in shading, focus is primarily on proportions and foreshortening.  Generally done on newsprint pads. Sketch example: http://www.dragonfyredawn.com/kickstarter/jan8figures6.jpgDrawings (longer studies).  More attention is paid to detail, or the drawings is of more complicated subject matter.  Can be done on newsprint, in a sketchbook or on higher quality paper.Drawing example: http://www.dragonfyredawn.com/kickstarter/jan7skulls1.jpgSo why the Kickstarter? The goal amount is modest, intended to cover the supplies Iäó»ll inevitably need when I run through the sketchbooks and pencils I have stashed away.Œæ I'll be burning through dozens of newsprint pads, roughly one per week - at $3 apiece, the cost will be adding up quickly.Œæ At nearly 200 sketches in, I'm also putting a noticeable dent in my pencil supply, so I may have to get a new set every 1000 drawings or so.Œæ The remainder of the goal amount takes into consideration Kickstarter and Amazon fees, taxes and shipping for any physical rewards due to backers.Anything above the goal amount will help give me opportunity to sketch things I canäó»t find on-hand at home or through free venues.Œæ When the weather gets warmer, I can take trips to zoos, aquariums and museums to sketch.  Additionally, anything over the goal amount will also help compensate me for the time it's taking to tackle this project.Œæ Nobody likes being a starving artist, after all!How this will work There are no true stretch goals.  Each dollar backed is its own mini stretch goal äóñ think of each dollar as äóìI dare you to do a sketchäó.  While I will attempt to do all ten thousand, each cumulative dollar will guarantee Iäó»ll get at least that many sketches done, up to the full ten thousand.  If the amount goes over that, it just means Iäó»ll start getting more than $1 per sketch done and have more opportunity to expand my horizons with field trips.Œæ If this project really gets a ton of support, I may even be able to quit that day job and take this on as a full-time project until it's done. About the RewardsThe GO ON, I DARE YOU TO SKETCH, I DARE YOU TO SKETCH A PAGE and DOUBLE DOG DARE backer levels don't have a physical component that goes to the backer.Œæ These levels just give support to the project and result in a guaranteed number of sketches toward the goal of 10,000.Œæ ADOPT A SKETCH - Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches the backer will be getting one of my more polished sketches sent to them through the mail.Œæ These will be small-scale pieces and range in subject matter depending on whatever I'm doing at the time.PORTRAIT CHALLENGE - Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches the backer will get a sketch based on a photo of themselves or a loved one, the finished product sent to them through the mail.Œæ I fully admit that human likenesses are one of my weak points, so I will not fulfill this one until I get a little general practice in so I know I'll provide something relatively decent to each backer.PET PORTRAIT CHALLENGE -  Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches the backer will get a sketch based on a photo of one of their pets, the finished product sent to them through the mail.Œæ Dog, cat, budgie, rat, snake...any and all species welcome!ŒæŒæSPONSOR A DAY - Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches, a whole day of sketching will be done in the backer's name, with a shout-out on the Dare to Draw Badly blog accompanying all the sketches drawn on that day.  One of the more polished pieces from that day will be mailed to the backer.  Size and subject matter of the piece will vary, but will be small-scale.Œæ ADOPT A SKETCH BUNDLE -Œæ Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches - same as adopting a single sketch, but in a multiple of six!ADOPT A SKETCHBOOK -  Along with their pledge counting toward the 10,000 sketches...For backers who either really want to push me to draw a lot, really like my stuff, or think they'll cash in if I somehow get famous...at least a week's worth of life drawing sketches will fit in one 50-page newsprint sketchpad/drawing pad of white paper.Œæ The pads I get sometimes vary in number of sheets, but regardless - you get at least 150 sketches that will range from 30 second gestures onŒæ up to 10+ minute studies.Œæ Everything I post from the backer's sketchbook will have a shout-out to go along with it.Œæ Once filled, it'll be sent to the backer.If anybody has any questions, I'll be more than happy to answer them!

Before you read about my project, take a look at some of my artwork on the video (above). If you think this project might interest you read on and enjoy!About the project"Alphadoodle" will be a children's book which incorporates alphabetical doodles that are chosen by you. Children will love looking at each letter of the alphabet and finding intricately drawn items, each beginning with the letter which contains it (see below for more information). My hope is that children will have fun exploring the drawings while learning about the alphabet. I will also add fun rhyming words on each page, to keep the interest of early readers and pre-school children.YOU get to choose the title of each drawing and I will draw it, each drawing will be the size of the square you purchased, but could be intermingled with other drawings such as in the one below.ŒæCheck out the progress on the updatesŒælink or catch a closer look on Instagram.How can you contribute?With your help, I will self-publish the "Alphadoodle" book, once I have the whole alphabet done. The funds you provide will cover expenses for publishing to Amazon in print and in eBook format, various marketing expenses and the Kickstarter and Amazon fees that come with using this website. We will begin with the letter 'A' and once the squares in that letter are filled with artwork I'll continue through the alphabet.ŒæYou can be a backer by purchasing a 1" square section of the grid or purchaseŒæseveral sections if you prefer.ŒæThen you can nominate a topic for me to draw into the square in the appropriate part of the alphabet.ŒæRequests will be collated, interpreted and added to the 'letter' and included in the book.Œæeg: If you purchase 4 squares and say 'cat', the drawing will take up 4 squares and will be enclosed in the letter 'C'.ŒæNOTE: You can fund several squares and just nominate one word (the drawing will be as large as the squares you purchase) or nominate a word for each square that you purchase.Tip: This is a children's book so simplicity is good and offensive suggestions will not be included.How will you follow progress?I am a great project managerso I'll keep you up to date with progress by uploading progress shots so you can see what you have purchased.What's in it for you?If you pledge $20 or over I will give you a high resolution copy of the letter you chose to contribute to OR a letter of your choice.Why am I doing this book?I'm an avid artist who has illustrated 3 children's books (and written one of them too). As a child I was inspired by the 'Coles funny picture book/s' and spent hours looking at the intricate drawings and illustrations. From this I have become obsessed with highly detailed pen and ink drawings. Video animations of my other Children's books (available in hard copy from Amazon etc)Maggie Magee and the giant sneeze George and the problem of food (by Rosemary Pattison, illustrated by me) George went to see the Prime Minister (by Rosemary Pattison, illustrated by me)ŒæThank you for taking the time to review my project! I appreciate your support at whichever level you choose to give.

I LOVE CHICKENS! I hope you do too.Œæ This project has really been years in the making. I have been drawing chickens of one sort or another for the past 12 years. I even had two backyard chickens of my own for a while when I lived in Austin. It was a sweet, comical, and complicated relationship. They didn't behave like pets, and everything wanted to eat them...So my job of keeping them safe was difficult.They were both red, and so I named them Lucy #1 and #2. I eventually had to give them up, but I'll never forget theŒæexperience of caring for theseŒæurban chickens. Here's a little video with some other chickens, and more examples of my artwork. And the Lucy's are in there too.The Chicken Scratchin' book is a continuation of my scratchboard drawing education (and what I like to call "Linda's Scratchboard Empire"). I'm an art school drop-out-- by allowing me to draw your birds and tell your stories I get to be a better artist/author. And by sharing your stories, the world can appreciate and understand more about these wonderful creatures. Don't worry if you have more than one, I can squeeze at leastŒæthree on the 5"x7" board. Don't have chickens? You can 'sponsor' your family, friends and neighbors chickens. See how easy that is?This isn't going to be a book about the different breeds and how to raise them--there are plenty of those out there already. Simply, it will be full of my fun, colorful drawings and your stories about your birds.Here's an example of what the cover may look like:ŒæHere's an example of two page layout: ŒæThe finished soft-cover book will be 6"x9" and printed in the USA. I'm working with a professional book designer; she and I worked on the Dog and Cat books, and we just get better and faster at this. It takes about 9 months to collect theŒæstories, photos, drawŒæand edit. ActualŒædelivery will be around October 2014.ŒæBig Thanks to: Teresa Turk who put these videos together; Liz Lester who designed the cover and page mock-ups; Dick Bennett who let his little black chickens star in the videos; And Cindy Jo Parry and Jan VanSchuyver who sang (and clucked) and played with meŒæon the "Chickens In The Yard" song. Cindy Jo and I wrote the song together and it was great, big, fun! Thanks for the 'ear worm' Cindy Jo!And oh yeah, Scratchboard is a ridgid panel with a layer of white clay that is then sprayed with black ink. I use sharp tools to 'cut' into the surface to expose the white clayŒæto create the drawing. I then use inks to add color.ŒæThe finished product is something like an etching or woodcut in appearance. It is sealed, acid-free, and archival...ready for you to frame.

Introducing a set of original art images that showcases the traditional as well as the alternative sides of the female form. THE ART...My goal was to create a distinctive set of images that would stand out. A body of work with an Arc. The pieces are rendered with a combination of traditional and computer art tools. Using a realistic style to depict something both alluring and provocative, even mysterious. I tried to avoid the standard clichí©s in effort to produce something genuine, a little challenging, that hopes to widen the range of what is gets depicted (particularly in regards to the female form) in visual art by offering a spectrum from the traditional to the alternative representations. Note: some images do depict nudity, so please be aware.Why Kickstarter?I've turned to Kickstarter to ask for support in bringing this series to life largely due to its directness with an audience. I've found that my work does not fit neatly into the predefined structures of the present art world. The images and subject matter don't fall in line with modern or commercial Art environments easily. So I'm trying a new method for bringing art out to the public. Attempting a new paradigm that's built around new ideas and new technology. I believe in this new era and its ability to help realize goals, fund projects, and help find new audiences. The best way to achieve all that I think begins here...The Project...The goal is simple. To get the funding needed to produce such large size formatted prints of this collection of art work by offering rewards in the form of normal-to-small sized formatted prints and clothing. THE REWARDS!I've tried to keep the Rewards for backing this project hopefully very simple and straight forward. There could be something that I might have forgotten or a detail that I've overlooked, if I find an error or mistake I will make a comment or correction in the update section. The rewards offered for funding my project are Art Prints that will be printed with archival ink on paper ranging in size from the smallest 8.5" by 11", next size up 14" by 20" and then the largest size offered 30" by 40". Note: depending on the monitor settings for the device used in viewing the images there might be a slight color differential from the actual art work.Here are the images offered...Note: the black borders are for presentation only and NOT part of the actual art work.Here are the two T-shirts offered, colors are black and white, and this is the image that will be used plus the proposed mock ups...THANK YOU!Thanks for your interest! Thanks so much to all of you who've pledged to support this project and help me get my work out into the world. If you like what you see here please feel free to share the project with anyone you think might be interested.

For all of you $1000 backers, send me an email at thecuisinefactory@gmail.com and i'll respond to you with next steps.

The East Idaho Aquarium is a non-profit organization. We are currently working on acquiring our tax exempt status from the IRS. Once we get our tax exemptstatus, will go all out trying to find grants in order to bring this aquarium to Eastern Idaho. Many people have called us asking if this project is forreal, if this is something that is actually going to happen. They wanted to makesure we are not a bunch of teenagers just making a joke and gettingpeoples hopes up. Well the East Idaho Aquarium is a real thing and it isactually going to happen. Arron Faires, the president of the aquarium, has beeneagerly working on this project since February 2013. His desire to operate apublic aquarium dates all the way back to his early years in high school. As I was growing up, my family had fish. It was something I would help my mom with when I was little. I was too young to remember, but she told me I used to love watching our Angelfish. My first memory of my family having fish was our community fish tank.My familywent to the store and bought a bunch of fish for our little ten gallon tank. My three brothers and I each got to pick a different kind of fish to add to the tank. I remember picking the Neon Tetras. However, they did not live very long because we made a few mistakes. Our next twofish to go into the tank were a Betta and a Goldfish. When the Betta died, we gavethe Goldfish away and bought Guppies. The Guppies were very fun to watch and werealways having babies. This is the tank I remember helping my mom clean from time totime. I did not get seriously into fish though until much later. When I was a Junior in High School I earned my Eagle Scout, and as a reward my parents bought me a 29 gallonfish tank. A couple of years before I was given the 29 gallon tank, I had really wanted some Oscars. When I was told how large Oscars grew to be, I was not able to getthem. So once I got that bigger tank, I went and picked out two Oscars for my tank. Igot a Red Oscar and a Tiger Oscar, which were my pride and joy at the time. Whenmy friends would come over we would feed them Goldfish; we thought they were socool. My grandma later gave me a fish book and on the cover of the book was a beautiful Turquoise Discus. I really wanted to get one, but after a little bit ofresearch I realized they were very hard to take care of. It then became my goal toone day own a Discus. I wanted to be good enough at fish keeping to beable to care for the "king of fish" in the freshwater fish world. I would goto the library and check out fish books. I soon fell in love with planted tanks. Thethings people could do with live plants in an aquarium was amazing. I set it asone of my goals to have a beautiful planted tank. I tried for years to growlive plants with no real success. People would always tell me how cool the Denver aquarium was. They told me it was like a zoo, but all it had was fish. My dream job then became to own a public aquarium, but I dismissed it as just adream. I figured you needed lots of money to open something like that. Iknew I wanted to do something with fish though; I wanted to either study them, breed them, or sellthem.. After a few years I accumulated several tanks. At one time I had two 55 gallons, a 28 gallon bow front, a 29gallon, two 10 gallons, and a few bowls with various fish. I think everyoneshould own a least two big tanks; a tank with large fish and a communitytank. There is nothing like either. When I got married I thought my wife wasgoing to make me get rid of all my tanks. The opposite of what I thought actually occurred. She ended up liking fish too, just not as much as me. Although,not verymany people like fish as much as I do. One of the best things that happened tome was when I got hired at Petsmart. When I was first hired I thought forsure I would get to work in the fish department, but instead they made me a supplystocker. I long waited for the day when they would put me in the fish department. Itseemed like whenever an employee would quit from that part of the store, the position would be filled with someone who knew nothing about fish. It wasfunny because the new people would always ask me why I was not working with thefish, but I never could give them a good answer. Anytime a customer asked them aquestion they could not answer, they would come find me and ask me if Iknew the answer. I always did. During the time I was a stocker, there was anemployee who owned his own fish cleaning business. He recognized my passion forfish and hired me on to help him. During this time I learned how to grow liveplants. He taught me about certain types of water and water chemistry. Hehelped me start my path to reaching my goals of owning a Discus and having a beautifullyplanted tank. I now own Discus and have been told by many that I have beautifully plantedtanks. After a year of stocking, I finally got my chance to work in the fishdepartment. Customers always told me how it was a relief to have somebody thatactually knew what they were talking about. There were times that people wouldline up waiting to talk to me. Other associates would try to help those customers, but theywould decline the associates help and tell them they were waiting for me. When I wouldnot work,people would come into the store to see if I was there and upon finding outI was not they would turn around and leave. Not only did I help lots of people,but many people that would come in taught me new things.Œæ I learned way more from other peoples experiences, than I did in all the years of reading and studying fish on my own. One of my best qualities is that I am never afraid to learn new things. I havenever been one to think that I know it all. The person that hired me to helphim clean tanks came to me one day and said we should open an aquarium. Hetold me how the Boise aquarium had been set up and how we could set one up too. I thought,"Awesome we can do this!". More importantly, however; I can do this without needing millionsof dollars. We started a non-profit organization called the East Idaho Aquarium in Marchof 2013. I found out in August that he no longer wanted to be part of the East Idaho Aquarium. Afterhis quitting, I found a team to help me. Since getting my team together, more work was done for the Aquarium in one month than in the first five months with my original partner. Other than fish I like frisbee, soccer, football, basketball, and spending time with my wife and twolittle girls. The East Idaho Aquarium is hoping to secure the locationwhere the old Game World was. We like this location because of the heavy foottraffic that it receives. The location would allow for people to catch a movie,go to the aquarium, and eat lunch/dinner. If we do get this location then thecity of Ammon has told us they could waive our utility bill. Floor plans to theaquarium are being put together for this location. There is a high probabilitythis will be the location of the aquarium, but nothing is set in stone. The person that is building our aquariums says he will needaround six months to build all of the aquariums that we are wanting. Wereally want to be opened in the summer of 2014. The rough price estimate of theseaquariums is $88,000. Many large companies will only donate to non-profit organizations thatare tax exempt. We are waiting for the IRS to give us our tax exempt status, but have been told the soonest we could get it is January. So insteadof waiting, we are pursuing our goal to be opened by the summer. To do this weneed your help. To raise some of these funds we decided to make shirts. We drew up some cool designs. These designs will only be available to our early kickstarter supporters.ŒæTo show our appreciation of your early support, when you buy a shirt, and wear  it to the aquarium you will receive 50% off the entrance price. Anytime you come in with your shirt on you will receive 50% off, so buy one for each member of your family. The shirts are $20. Once we open up shirts like these will sell for $25 and no discount will be given. All proceeds of the shirts will go to the building of the aquarium. The only shirts that will have the 50% off discount will be the shirts with the shark, stingray, and jellyfish pictured on them. The plain EIA shirt will not come with the 50% off discount. When you purchase a shirt please tell us the size you would like. If you do not we will send you a largeŒæ The East Idaho Aquarium needs yourhelp! If we do not reach our goal, then we will not be able to bring theseawesome shirts to you, and we will have to put off opening the aquarium a fewmore months. This offer will only be available once. So tell everybody you know,and get one for all your family members.

AlphaFresh was born out of a frustration with the greetings card market and the lack of fun, cool or super-awesome cards available. ŒæUsing simple line drawings of crazy b-boy style characters I made cards that appealed to people who were passionate about urban/hiphop/rap music and the culture that surrounds them.The video shows some examples of the characters on the cards, each with their own unique style! ŒæSome are cool, some are showy, some are tough and some are just plain crazy...The full colour versions of the cards include a dynamic background of light and stars:The cards are professionally printed to the highest quality and are blank inside for your message.ŒæIf the project is successful, the cards will be printed asap and I will start to distribute them to all the wonderful supporters. ŒæI have set a delivery date of February 2014, but smaller orders should be received much sooner than this (I wanted to make sure I wasn't late!)I have received some great support for the cards in the past - one article, from Egotripland.comŒæis hereŒæ- this also includes photos of all the black and white cards.AlphaFresh was created, is run and will forever be, just me, Tom Sparke. ŒæI am a designer and cartoonist from Cambridge, UK and am looking forward to getting the cards out to people all over the world. From the limited number of sales I have had the feedback has been great and I hope to extend the range in the future. ŒæIf you would like to get in touch, I'd love to hear from you.
ORIGINALS for 1500 dollar funding option:ŒæYOUR OWN CHARACTER IN AN ORIGINAL WORK! Oh, and a pair of shoes with a hand painted design of your choice. Now thats too cool for school!TruthŒæ

Our Goal is simple -- raise $4,949.00Reaching this goal will allow us to create the SF Championship Rag illustration (final rough + pre-print copy), buy one thousand 15" x 18" velour towels (9'ers red), create the silk-screen and then (the fun part :) finalize one thousand SF Championship rally rags by laying textured, white ink to set the Official 'STICK-IT! image (refer to image + Kickstarter video).The Championship Rag (aka 'STICK-IT!) is inspired by the football team that is, and has been, one of the strongest heart beats in the the city of San Francisco. With 5 Championship Trophies and the last season playing in SF upon us, only one thing left to do -- 'STICK-IT!this rags for the fans . . .

Everyone has a dream job, working towards something that makes you happy while making a positive difference in the world. Massive Mail Out is a massive mailing of packets comprised of postcards, posters and samples of my illustration. I'll be sending these packets all over the world to 50 Art Directors that are responsible for constantly commissioning and distributing amazing artwork, always pushing the boundaries of Illustration -- my dream clients.ŒæThe projected funding will go towards the printing, creating and mailing of my Illustration sample packets. My only goal is to get my work out there, from then on it is out of my hands. If my projected funding is exceeded all remaining funds will go towards sending rewards and thank you cards. I'm a 23 year old Illustrator who's grown up admiring the beautiful, ground breaking and accessible art of Illustration and now it's time have my art recognized as such. The successful completion of Massive Mail Out brings me one step closer to being a full time Illustrator, putting out work that I enjoy and being commissioned by people who have the means and expertise to show my art world wide.

Is it possible to convey all the elements of life intoŒæaŒæsimplistic and practical equation? Is there a formula that can be used toŒæcalculate meaning or happiness? ...probably not, but thisŒæproject gives the viewer a sense of what it mightŒælook like ifŒæput downŒæon paper. EachŒæobject in the equationŒæsymbolizes a part of life. Some representŒætheŒægood, others theŒæbad. Categories range from personalŒæhobbies, to work, toŒælife-changing events. Similar toŒæa mathematical equation, certainŒævalues are more heavily weighedŒæthan others, just as some aspects are more important to us in our own lives.Each symbol has the ability toŒærepresentŒæsomethingŒæunique toŒæeach person and possiblyŒæevenŒæevoke a certain emotionŒæor memory.ŒæIt is up toŒæthe viewerŒæto interpret the formula in their own way and derive their own solution. Whenever you plug different numbersŒæinto an equationŒæyou usually end up withŒæaŒædifferent answer. We have all faced different challenges and encountered differentŒæexperiences throughout our lives. We are all different in our own way.ŒæAll analysis and deep metaphors aside, it could simply make for an interesting and eye-catchingŒævisual on the wall at home.

INTO MYSTERY began on December 12, 2012 (12:12 and 12 sec to be precise) and since our first project launch we have scoured the Kickstarter pages for talented people we hoped would collaborate with us to form a larger INTO MYSTERY creative team beyond our own office. We hoped they might help deliver the second half of our project clues.  Of course, it never is as simple as just asking people to participate; believe me, we have, and it doesn't quite work the way one might imagine.  Instead, we backed and supported each one of their projects - one, because we loved what they were doing, but two, Kickstarter is a wonderful way to meet creative people; to grow a potential working relationship through the intersection of so many creative disciplines. We are proud to be able to continue our work with the full talents of artists that we have found solely through or on Kickstarter. Our KickArtists are contributing INTO MYSTERY in their own incredible way and again, we turn to you for assistance in helping this grow, both creatively and in the number of opportunities we have for the next set of nine project clues. PLEASE help us support three parts of Clue 09:Please help us to expand our minds and to take this for a single ride in the upmost, creative, inspiring way that just might set a MONUMENTAL example for generations to come; please help us kick this Gumguzzler (as Abigail Howard might say) INTO MYSTERY.Your support rewards you with all of the current clues, access to Clue 09 Chamber and some of the most imaginative work from the following artists that will lead you straight through the back door and INTO MYSTERY.Hal and Marilyn Weiner make incredible documentaries and films. Last summer, they were raising money for their Extreme Realities television series on Kickstarter while I was simultaneously looking for someone to guide us through our own INTO MYSTERY documentary for Clue 10. It took some convincing, but after backing their project, sorting through some logistics, a few intro phone calls, some wonderful meals together and after many, many cryptic conversations, Hal and Marilyn agreed to help us. We couldn't be more excited and honored to be working with such kind and distinguished filmmakers.I found Neil Dvorak (aka KeyMaster) and his super creative, comic and animation, Kickstarter campaign, Easy Pieces,Œæback in August of 2013. ŒæI so enjoyed his style and witty sensibility (especially his head popping off) that I backed his project (I am receiving a two hour animation class - wahoo), left aŒæcommentŒæand emailed him to set up a call to see if he was interested in collaborating on Clue 12. ŒæThe rest has mainly been Neil's intensive work on concept design, storyboards, filming, audio, animating, editing, etc. and we can't wait for you to see our collaborative efforts in the introductory INTO MYSTERY: Clue 12 airport video. Beatboxin', flashmob, and maybe some celebrity dancing . . . that's all I can say, other than, I hope we knock your heads off (like Neil's head in his video)! ŒæGreg Tull and Monica Tull of Monitogo Studios LLC are crazy impressive. An ambitious full feature, animated LEGO brick film, Bound, completed on Kickstarter, led me to our collaboration. Their compulsion to detail, obsessive scheduling and their self-taught, amazing talent which lends itself perfectly to their craft of animating meticulously constructed LEGO sets, scenery and action of their own invention is a perfect match to our love of LEGO. I wish for oh-so-many collaborations in the years to come with these fine folks, but for now, Clue 11 is blessed with their brickmaster talent.ŒæThe ever talented Alex Marvar was found launching her new film project, When in Belen, where she followed hundreds of clowns into the amazon! I am no stranger to her multi-talented gifts of writing, photography, music, journalism and connector of all things amazing; she was part of our 212box team from 2010 to 2012 and though she won't admit it, she has been pivotal in shaping INTO MYSTERY from the fledgling days of its existence. Regardless, her Kickstarter project allowed us to collaborate on our new INTO MYSTERY website which we are looking forward to showing you. Alex is also, by trade, a KeyMaster - be sure to look closely at her Kickstarter page.Three thousand, three hundred and twenty-four Kickstarter Backers fell in love with Abigail Howard for her Last Halloween comic strip and I was no exception. Granted, I cheated a bit when I forced a collaboration with Abby by backing at a reward tier level that included "a 4-page comic based on something you find terrifying or disturbing". In a unique style that only Abigail has mastered, I received a perfect email request for my worst possible terror and my reply was simple: if, and only if, Clue 18 was not successfully backed, that is my only worst fear and horror. Now, I know you won't let that happen, but if it did, Abigail will describe the horrific series of events that may occur. Please jump INTO MYSTERY and discover her talents, they are terrifically terrible and amazing.More "Outside Kickstarter" Artists need to get kicked INTO MYSTERY and we kindly ask for your help again. Clue 09: KickArt is all about kickstarting INTO MYSTERY KickArtists; support our support of artists and unique individuals on and off Kickstarter; through the duration of this project (and the following +/- 7 - 10 years). Hello Kickstarter! My name is Adrian Giacoletto.Iam an industrial engine mechanic here in beautiful Western Colorado. TheI'd Rather Be Motorboatin' design was born almost four years ago! My friendsTom and Jesse came up with this idea and made vinyl decals for their toolboxes.Ifirst saw their decal two years ago, and at first it was just another sticker. However, after they explained it to me...I realized just how funny it is! They created something truly amazing.ŒæSoI made a deal with them and it is my job to help take this idea to market (keep in mind I made this deal over two years ago).Whathas taken soooo long? Well honestly I didn't know where to start.ŒæI'd like totake second to say thanks to my virtual mentors. Dave Ramesy and Dan Miller. IfI never would have found these guys, this would still be just another"good idea". Thisis where we need your help! Our goal is to take this design to Country JamColorado this year. We are looking to sell the same items posted here, but weneed the funding for the booth and our supplies.Thisproject is very personal to me. I made a commitment to my pals a long time ago.It's not just about a design. It's about me being able to follow through. I've had manychallenges during the last two years that has made it easy for me to make excuses not to start. WellI'm through with excuses! Thankyou Kickstarter for the opportunity to help us share smiles! And thank you forallowing a guy to find a way to keep his promises to his friends!Thankyou to everybody who will help to lauch this project!

I guess you can call me a starving artist... STARVING FOR SUPPLIES!! I am struggling to build my portfolio of my artwork to establish an online business. I'm a recent college grad and I was robbed of my big bag of goodies during my last semester (HUGE colored pencil set, permanent markers, charcoals, etc).Œæ I'm not sure if the thief knew what they were getting, but I hope they cherish the creative tools as I did!My career search has been dragging, so I've been brainstorming and trying not to stress it by enjoying my creative therapy plan.Œæ I've always been artistic and love going with whatever my heart desires to put on paper.Œæ My family and friends love my work and have been telling me for years to share it with the world so others can enjoy it too!Œæ So here I am, looking to rebuild my art supplies so I can fulfill the desires of others to have original artwork. Besides, I don't have space in my make-shift bedroom to store the results of my creative juices!Well... let's get started and make a win-win situation.Œæ I get to enjoy my passion and creative therapy, while you get original pieces of art! If all goes well, my goal is to open an online venue.ŒæThanks for caring and sharing :-)Below are samples of my work (finished and in process items):Supply list: Prismacolor Compressed Charcoal - $16; Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils (set of 150) - $127; Copic Sketch Marker Set (basic set of 12) - $63; Sakura Pigma Micron Pens Zentangle (set of 11) - $14; Prismacolor Premier Illustration Marker Set (set of 8) - $16; Canson Art Boards - $15; Strathmore Drawing Pads - $30; Dahle Vantage 18" Paper Trimmer - $76; Frames and mattes - $150; Shipping supplies - $40

Our Galaxy.Œæ Hello Kickstarters! ŒæWe operate a small business in the heart of Sonoma Valley wine country (Vineyard Custom Art & Engraving). ŒæOur mission is to innovate creative laser-engraved products for local wine businesses. We engrave wine bottles, glasses and barrelhead "Lazy Susan Cheeseboards" for local wineries, and other items for weddings and events, including placemats, coasters, invitations, "Save-the-Date" cards, event marquees, and an assortment of party favors.The Tribute! ŒæŒæA while ago, I began thinking about what might be the quintessential laser creation that would capture the beauty of the hills, valleys, and vineyards of Sonoma and Napa counties, and, at the same time, illustrate our wine regions with a collection of iconic and detailed artistic imprints. ŒæI asked my wine country savvy wife and kids to help me noodle on a laser-engraved "Sonoma-Napa Wine Country Tribute" project.Eureka - The Project! Œæ What surfaced from our thinking was a limited edition collection of cartographically engraved "coaster maps", "dinner place maps", "wine glassŒæmaps", and "wine barrelhead maps"; each depicting the Sonoma and Napa wine appellations as well as the specific American Viticultural Areas (AVAs) within the appellations. It so happens that Sonoma and Napa wine appellations each contain 16 distinct AVAs, a numerical balance of AVAs within the two counties.With functionality and art in mind, we developed plans to source the 32 AVAs to artists who could render cartographic maps with unique regional images that project and encompass the Sonoma and Napa county appellations. We named the project the:Œæ LimitedEdition Sonoma & Napa Appellations "Wine Map Series".This Project Takes Talent and Technology! ŒæWe operate a new 50-watt commercial quality laser engraver that can reliably and quickly produce the volume of items in each collection. We also have local artists and graphic designersŒæwho are committed to creating the images and icons representing the various Sonomaand Napa appellations and viticultural areas.With talent and technology in hand,Œæwe have started to engrave initial drawings on leather, glass, and wood. We've sized the coasters and placemats, and considered different shapes (square,round, and oval) for the Series components. We've shared our Limited EditionŒæconcepts with family members, friends, and neighbors from the local wine industry to get their feedback, and we're enthused by the encouragement we received for the project - everyone wants a part of the Series!Let's Map Out the Series. ŒæOur Limited Edition Sonoma-Napa Appellations "Wine Map Series"Œæblends art and functionto create a collectable Series that serves as a conversation piece aboutCalifornia viticulture, highlighting two of theŒæmost visited wine destinations inthe world.A full set of either theSonoma or NapaŒæSeries consists of sixteen (16) cartographically laser engraved leather Coaster Mapsä‹¢Œæ(square or round-shaped); an oak barrel stave Coaster Holder with aleather engraved Marquee Appellation Map; four leather Dinner Place Mapsä‹¢Œæengraved with either the Sonoma Appellation Map or the Napa Appellation MapŒæ(eitherrectangular or oval-shaped), and; four 20 oz. Wine Glass Mapsä‹¢, again engraved with eitherthe Sonoma Appellation Map or the Napa Appellation Map,depending on the Series you select. ŒæA Limited Edition of Barrelhead Mapsä‹¢Œæ(Lazy Susan Cheeseboards) is also available in the "Wine Map Series". And, finally, for your fury friends,Œæwe are adding a Limited Edition of the Canine-Cat Maps with collars that show either the Sonoma or Napa Appellation Maps. The Canine-Cat map will generate comment after comment as you walk your pets or dress them for special events and competitions. Watch for a prototype in the next update.Your guests, wine aficionados or novices, will quickly recognize or learn the Sonoma and Napa appellations and AVAs when they see them on our Series maps at your dinner table.The Designs and Colors!Œæ The designs for each appellation and the viticultural areas within each appellation start with the physical cartography of the area and then areenhanced through the artwork of local artists commissioned to generate an indigenousand unique image, logo or icon representing the AVA.ŒæEach AVA map will have a unique imprimatur that comes from the individual artist, and while we have an overall cartographic theme, the art will transcend from one artist's brush to another, adding a variety of compositions and styles. We anticipate all artwork to be completed by January 2014.Leather items in the Series come in a choice of four colors reflecting the terroir and vineyard landscapes of rural Northern California wine country: natural (tan), sage, butter-gold, and lavender.Here's the Universe of our Limited Edition "Wine Map Series".Œæ Each Sonoma and Napa Appellation Wine Map Series is a limited edition and will be numbered and signed with a production number on a Series Certificate, which is included with each Series set or item.We'll be making 2,000 copies ofthe limited edition Coaster Map Series (1,000 of the LimitedEdition Sonoma Appellation Wine Map Series and 1,000 of Limited Edition Napa Appellation Wine Map Series); 3,000 copies of the individual Dinner Place Maps (approximately 1,000 with the SonomaAppellation Map, 1,000 with the Napa Appellation Map, and 1,000 with both Maps); 30,000 copies (total) of the 32 individual AVA Coaster Maps (approximately 1,000 for each AVA); 30,000 copies of the AVA Wine Glass Maps(approximately 1,000 for each AVA); 5,000 of the Appellation Wine Glass Maps (2,500 of the Sonoma Appellation Map and 2,500 of the Napa Appellation Map); 3,000 of the Lazy Susan Barrelhead Maps (approximately 1,000 with theŒæSonoma Appellation Map, 1,000 with the Napa Appellation Map, and 1,000 with both Maps), and: 2,000 of the Canine & Cat Maps 1,000 with the Sonoma Appellation Map and 1,000 with the Napa Appellation Map).Approximately 25% of the Limited Editions will be offered to the Kickstarter Backers as Rewards, some which will ship in time for the 2013 Holidays.The Digital Production Process.Œæ The laser produces beautiful and precise engravings,ideal for both artwork and maps. Afterdoing a number of laser projects, here's what you can anticipate from our production process.The maps and artwork for the appellations and AVAs are laser engraved onto the glasses, coasters, and place maps and, in the case of the leather items, they are vector cut by the laser into their square, oval or rectangular shapes.How we select the hides and oak. ŒæOur leather supplier has a cornucopia of hide selections andis located in Napa, California so I can personally inspect the materials firsthand. I'm looking for blemish-free hidesfor the best laser-ability. I examineand select each hide by hand. The oak barrel staves that form the coaster holders come fromquality used oak barrels from Sonoma and Napa county wineries. They are wine stained on one side, hand sanded and treated withvegetable oil to preserve the luster of the wood. I want the collections we create for you to be built to last, providing a lifetimeof use and memories. Digital Art Laser Engraving.Œæ Today's commercial laser engravers are the work-horse of most contemporaryŒæengravingbusinesses. They require minimalmaintenance and can operate non-stop, producing consistent, quality resultstime after time. The leather coasters, placemaps and marquees in the Series are "raster" engraved and"vector" cut to precision, oftentimes in batches to reduce productionand laser time. Glasses are rasterengraved and produced one at a time.ŒæTo give you some insight to the production process, it takes about six minutes to laser engrave one of our appellation Wine Glass Maps, 30 minutes to laser one Barrelhead Map, 50 minutes to laser two Dinner Place Maps and 50 minutes to laser 24 Coaster Maps.The laser burns leather and wood when it engraves and cuts.ŒæGlass is actually fractured when engraved by the laser. All residue from the laser-cutting process is captured through a built-in exhaust system and a environmental protective debris bag. Laser cut leather leavesŒæsome charred carbon onthe edges of the coasters and place maps. We remove most of the carbon, but somemay remain. Overtime anduse, the carbon particles will dissipate from the edges. Whether you like the burnt look or wish itaway, all items will be cleaned, but the burned appearance will remain more orless. All items go through a finalquality inspection before being released for packing and shipment.Use of Pledges.Œæ I heard about Kickstarter online and learned about its novel funding approach for creative projects. My son talked to our neighbors who had successfully funded their "camera-backpack project" through Kickstarter. With this new avenue to fund the Series and with the positive support we received from family, friends and artists, we crafted this Kickstarter project submission.ŒæThe funds requested for our project will be used to create the complete Limited Edition Sonoma-Napa Appellations Wine Map Series (one for Sonoma Appellation and one of Napa Appellation) which will include: purchasing quality leather hides for the Coaster Maps and Dinner Place Maps, oak barrel staves and barrelheads, and wine glasses. We will also use the Kickstarter funds to pay commissions to the artists that render the artwork for the Series as well as production costs for the Rewards to our Backers (including Rewards for the Sonoma-Napa Series, the Coaster Map Set, the Dinner Place Map Set, the Wine Glass Map Set, and the Barrelhead Maps).ŒæOur Toast! ŒæWe believe our Sonoma-Napa Appellation Limited Editions will be attractive to wine lovers around the globe and hope you think so too! ŒæIf so, please help us reach our Kickstarter goal of $11,500 by pre-ordering the Rewards in our Limited Edition "Wine Map Series".ŒæAlong with our investments in this project, these funds will put us on the Map! ŒæAnd, your family and colleagues will love these unique Sonoma-Napa appellation maps as holiday, birthday, and anniversary gifts!Thank You!Œæ Thanks in advance for supporting our Campaign! ŒæPlease notice that four of the Limited Edition "Wine Map Series" Rewards will be shipped in time for the upcoming Holidays. Cheers!Packing and Shipping.Œæ Your items are packed and shipped to you via UPS or US mail. We carefully pack the items so that theyarrive to you without damage and we will replace any items that are damaged intransit.Product Materials and Dimensions.Œæ Thecoasters are 3.75" x 3.75" squares cut from 7 oz. to 8 oz. high-quality leatherhides: laser engraved and cut. The place maps are 15" x 11"rectangles or ovals cut from 9 oz. to 10 oz. high-quality leather hides. The oak-stave coaster holders are approximately3.5" x 7" x 10" including the coaster holder MarqueeAppellation Map 5"x 5". The wine glassesare 20 oz. stemmed glasses that are large enough to laser the Seriesappellations and AVA maps and will serve as both white and red wine glasses.ŒæReady, Set, Go!Œæ When we have each collection or the individual coaster, glass, place map, or barrelhead Rewards ready toship to our Backers, I will list it on this page.Quality and Maintenance.Œæ Our leather products come from one of the highest quality and bio-friendly wholesalers in the country (Hides; Napa, California). However, leather coasters and place mats can stain with water or wine, so we advocate turning the coaster right-side up for show and use the under-side when you're serving drinks and food. This preserves the collection and still serves its practical duty; the under-side actually absorbs very well and has a cool furry texture.ŒæLast Thing.Œæ Please note if you back a Kickstarter project, you will receive a "Survey" when the project is funded where you can select your options for your Rewards (Sonoma or Napa Series, Coaster and Place Maps, and Colors).Stay in Touch.Œæ Itäó»s optional, but after you back our project, you can send me an emailwith your name and choices and I can put you in the production queue. I would like to get your Reward to you assoon as it's ready!

https://www.facebook.com/events/1413554455542226/[Textos en sus versiones en espaí±ol]WernerHerzog (kickass filmmaker and well recognized son of a gun) once said: äóìTheworld reveals itself for those who travel on footäó.We tend to agree.NearbyWonder is our little homage to travel and migration (real travelling by theway, not the type which involves tiki-drinks, all-access wristbands and German-speakingtour guides). NearbyWonder is a series made out of words and illustrations put together to describethe peaks and free-falls of a journey started a few years ago. If you prefer,you can call it äóìthe exposition of the misadventures of two friends living awayfrom Chileäó, but we think that äóìNearby Wonderäó is, hopefully, a bit catchier. We aim to transport people through the experience of being far from home. Forthat, we have: one manifesto, twelve illustrations and four parts of a wholepoem distributed strategically to make your experience complete in English,Spanish and Portuguese. ŒæAnimation including the short version of our statement (which is also, part of the exposition), [Thank you, Ryan! / www.ryancherewaty.com]ŒæBelow, the opening piece of the 'Nearby Wonder' poem [one out of four parts, all available in print]Below, the pieces [3 out of 12] All of them, available in Glicí©e prints of 14x19'' and Rag Photographique museum longevity grade prints of 32x42'', 100% Cotton and acid-free]ŒæAbsent Oblivion, third extract of the Nearby Wonder poem.ŒæBeacause Karma sometimes takes too long to compensate good humans like you, we developed a wide range of rewards along with your pledge, have a look and become a backer and an owner at the same time. :)ŒæESTIMATED DELIVERY, JAN 2014.

The VelociPrint Show 2013 is a collision of bicycle and art/design cultures.  Held inside Tucson's Borderlands Brewery in the heart of downtown, this event will be an evening full of bike folks, quality beer, exclusive yet affordable art, hanging with Tucson's established and emerging artists, and general bike/art revelry!At the heart of this show is a series of 15 print designs, each in an edition of 20, created by area artists.  Because the show is free to attend, and each print costs only $40, every show-goer can afford to take at least one print home, or even outfit an entire house or office.  It is our goal to ensure that everyone can afford at least one print, but still be able to pay the artists what they deserve for their hard work, so we must turn to Kickstarter backers to help with production costs. Each artist is responsible for creating his or her own print, so this Kickstarter Project is designed to help cover all the costs involved in producing the actual show itself. Borealis Arts, Zocalo Magazine, Borderlands Brewery, Tucson's Loop Bicycle Shop, and Cirrus Visual have all contributed to making this show happen, and you can join these local businesses in making this show a reality.  As you might imagine, the costs to produce, promote, and staff an event like this are rather large.  But, we're hell-bent on making this show happen, and with your help, we can prove that Tucson is a premiere bicycling and art community!

The project is to have a 2 week 'pop-up' shop, to give me a platform through which to introduce my greeting cards to the marketplace. And I would welcome the chance to have this retail opportunity.The funds for the shop project will be used in several ways including: printing stock of greeting cards, rent for the shop, PDQ portable card payment terminal, advertising including posters & business stationery and items for displaying my cards.I think my greeting cards would rank well amongst the competition in the greeting cards industry. You can see which designs I would have on sale, in my catalogue, which you can dowload from my website...www.unityart.co.uk.

This not anŒæindictment on alcohol consumption or theŒæregularity of itsŒæuse. Believe meŒæI like going toŒæthe local watering hole andŒætipping a few backŒæas much as theŒænext guy. Especially if there is a Denver Bronco game on.ŒæŒæBut almost everybody has been a stupid monkey at some point in their lives. Some more than others of course. Some with other "vices".Œæ ŒæI know IŒæhave. ŒæStupid Monkey is basically autobiographical in natureŒæand is a physicalŒæreminder toŒæmyself not to be one(again).ŒæAfterŒæhaving a extraordinary amount of stupidity one particular football SundayŒæand still feeling horrible two days later, I sat down to draw. STUPID MONKEY was the result. I framed him and hung him on my bedroom wall as an inspiration to think about the consequences ofŒæmy actions and the limits of my wallet. Now, while I'mŒædefinitelyŒæno saint,ŒæMONKEY has helped me onŒænumerousŒæoccasions when I was thinking about being stupid. I have sinceŒæhad dozens upon dozensŒæof requests to purchase him. People just seem to relate to him on different levels whether for themselves or someone they know or care about. He's a bit of a guardian angel for me. And who can't use an extra one of those?I want to print STUPID MONKEYŒæfor two reasons. 1:ŒæTo get him out in public view and available to those who might need a gentle reminder too. From this studio I will have the freedom to continue work on myŒæpaintings as well as design and produce my original art t- shirts.With your help, STUPID MONKEY will get me started down that road to a little artistic freedom and independence. Thanks for taking time to look atŒæmy project. And I always welcome your comments and suggestions.EXAMPLES OF MY WORKŒæREWARD #3ŒæT- shirt design for reward #3. It is alsoŒæincluded with reward #4 and #5.Contact Meemail: bumperlips@live.comPhone: (970)215-2958

Beer. It is the nectar of the gods. Ben Franklin once said "Beer is proof God wants us to be happy". The best times are just sipping on a couple cold ones with your buddies!ŒæWith your help I would like to print some awesome posters that you and your friends can admire while enjoying beer!This poster will be 18 x 24 inches and 4 colors and screen printed on gorgeous French Paper. This poster has a retro design, evoking simpler and happier times and includes 10 awesome and little known facts about beer!Œæ*This print is an original piece of art and each poster will be hand numbered by yours truly! The posters will be rolled in protective craft paper and shipped in sturdy craft tubes. These posters will make aŒægreat addition to any mancave, bar, office, garage, studio, or anywhere you and your friends enjoy drinking beer!ŒæIt also makes an awesome gift for the holiday season!*Once funding of the project is complete, the edition will be hand numbered. It may run anywhere from 100-250 prints depending on how many contributions we get.ŒæWHY AM I DOING THIS?Like many of you i enjoy a nice cold beer on occasion, well, a few cold beers sometimes : ). ŒæI wanted to make a cool poster that celebrated the awesomeness of beer! Beer is much more than a drink! Its an experience! A bonding experience between a couple friends, a father and son, or meeting someone new. It's an icebreaker, a conversation starter, and a sign of a good time ahead!ŒæSo, heres how i want to make it! I figured if I'm going to do it, I'm going to do it right. I want to make it a screen-print in order to give it a high quality, Œæartistic look and feel as opposed to a digital print. I also want to give it a retro design, that would evoke the feeling of simpler and happier times. Times where the world just ran a little slower and life just seemed easier. I also decided to add some cool, little known facts about beer for something me and my buddies to chuckle at while having a drink. Like, did you know there are clouds of beer in space?! Or that James Madison tried to start a federal brewery? I feel this poster will be an awesome conversation starter at parties and look beautiful wherever you put it!ŒæThanks so much and cheers!

This book is a culmination of real adventures experienced while vacationing at Lake Powell in Southern Utah.  For this reason, I have taken an authoräó»s prerogative of using the real names of my children and their real-life adventures.  With their help, I have written the fictional adaptations while playing on and accentuating their personality traits.I need to express thanks äóñ first and foremost to my wife Barbie who lets me to take our children on trips (sometimes even without her) and who lets me write.  Next, thanks to my children who have made this book possible through the many memorable experiences weäó»ve had.  And thanks to many friends and associates, whose suggestions, proofreading and critiquing, not only made this book better, but fun to write.My intent in writing this book is threefold.  First; a fictional suspense mystery.  Secondly; educational äóñ with real places, interesting facts, new vocabulary words, and fascinating history behind each place visited (see the end of this book).  Thirdly, provide lifeäó»s lessons and values written in a humorous way.For lifeäó»s values, I must thank my parents.  Such values were instilled young and lived old.  For lifeäó»s lesson, I thank my children who continue to teach me with each new experience.Lastly, I wish to acknowledge a special thanks to Mel Schetselaar for his illustrations throughout this book.  His drawings give the reader an appreciation for the natural beauty of Lake Powell and an insight of its magnificence.James K. Patterson

Hello Kickstarter!My name is Ulysses and I live with my wife and 3 year old son in Southern California. I have been producing art in my own style--what I like to call "paper engravings" or "inkings"--for over ten years now. Around 2002, I began making prints of my art (they were decent quality for the time) to sell on Ebay and at craft fairs on Maui and in San Francisco. I also had a licensing deal with a line of fairy art. . .but the timing, my style--whatever--was not meant to be, and I had to stop activley producing my art and get a "real" job. And now, please let me explain something:I have learned a lot over the past month. Please pledge with the reward levels I have revised below. Do not worry if it does not match up with the reward tiers to the right. You can easily just hit "manage my pledge" after you select the closest pledge level to your reward. After funding I will send a survey and then you will let me know which rewards you pledged for. International shipping will be as follows: Pledge under $50 and add $10. ŒæThe Making of an explicit Gay-Erotic-Fantasy Tale (unlike any other)The first Chapter of The DARK WORLD Chronicles is complete@Œæhttps://www.thedwchronicles.com/- By this I mean, The story is told in 10 installments - Chapter One (10 books in series) - Written in (prose style)Œæeach book has 10 original pieces of art work.
