We signed a binding contract and her credentials and work ethics are quit impressive. Mrs.Donovan's description of my book was " unusual & elusive", She edited - 5,024 words of my soul's desire.ŒæThe DARK WORLD Chronicles synopsisImagine your sibling was a pop culture icon known throughout the world for her role on a wildly popular television show. What would it be like to grow up in the invisible shadow of a celebrity? How would this affect your sanity? Thackery Warner is the fictional younger brother of Blair Warner from äóìThe Facts of Lifeäó television show, which ran on NBC from 1979 through 1988. Thackery has a secret proclivity for writing excessively in his journals while seeking answers from the äóìDARK WORLDäó of his dreams. The DARK WORLD Chronicles is a graphic novel that documents the daily shenanigans of Thackery Warner and his personal odyssey of the mind.Young Thackeryäó»s fantastic dreams propel him into a wondrous landscape known as the DARK WORLD. Dreams vary from night-to-night and each results in an original illustration created by Thackery's split persona, Tonyboy69, the artist (each book will contain 10 pieces of original artwork). Written in journal entry form, this tale is narrated by Thackeryäó»s subconscious and split persona. Combining history, science-fiction, explicit hardcore sexual content and countless references to pop culture in and beyond the LGBT community (from 1972 through the present day), The DARK WORLD Chronicles is an intriguing, sexy, and visually stimulating piece of fiction.

Hi there! My name is Victoria Gannon, although I am more commonly known as "Leptailurus." I'm a self-taught artist with big dreams and a love for animals.I've toyed with the idea of doing a tarot deck for almost a decade now. Eventually those idle thoughts turned into sketches, which turned into little paintings, which turned into the card designs you see here. I've always loved the imagery and meaning behind tarot and it only seemed appropriate to combine the symbolism with that of animals.With the Savage Divination tarotŒæI plan to explore the similarities between animals and human personality, drawing from myths, legends, folk lore, and general animal personality. For example, the ace of wands is perfectly represented by crafty Coyote, who stole fire from the spirits and gave it to man. The Empress is exemplified by the powerful lioness, determined mother and pride provider.I have completed a number of cards, which you can see a sampling of below, but there are dozens left to do. In addition to funding the printing of the decks, your pledges will let me dedicate my time to this project.This is a very large undertaking, but together we can achieve it!Hey folks! This is Lief again (the husband). Victoria is currently in the middle of a 17-day marathon at her day job, which is why there haven't been any updates or message replies in the past week. This project is her baby and for the most part it's best if the statements here are in her words, but I think this is an important enough milestone to warrant me stepping back in for a moment.I won't mince words. Right now, we're pessimistic about funding. Speaking in terms of dollars per day, we're at about a third of what we need... and to make it up, we'll need to average five times the daily pledge volume we've had so far. Now, this isn't impossible. Lots of projects pick up steam in the second half; and though pledges have been slow, they've been steady. Most importantly, it's clear that at this point we're not just floating on the initial rush of people who knew about this project beforehand: new people are finding it, and liking what they see. Because of that, I think there's still hope.The key is simple: we need to get more new people to find it. So, here's my plea: if you've already pledged, or even if you haven't but still want to support the project, tell everyone! Share the link. Tell your friends offline (for convenience, savagedivination.com redirects straight to the Kickstarter page). Ask them to tell their friends. Going straight-up viral would be nice, but really, all we need is a word-of-mouth campaign about five times stronger than what we've got. And let's face it: we came into this with no idea of how to manage a Kickstarter campaign, and we're still pretty much clueless. We've done a terrible job of marketing the project. So the way I see it, five times better is not a tall order!_The music in the project video is Divider by Chris Zabriskie, used under the Creative Commons Attribution License 3.0.

Re-defined for Life was developed out of the need to do meaningful work.ŒæFor my initial Kickstarter project, I would like to be able to spread inspiration for the holiday season, so  I have the immediate need to replace my professional series printer (which died) and buy supplies.ŒæYour investment will let me know that you like what I have created and for believing in me, I will make for you many reward gifts of gratitude! Your pledges are important to see if there is a larger market for my work. Someday, I would like the opportunity to expand and have my work printed commercially. I have many more definitions to illustrate and I have so many ideas for using these designs.ŒæI like hearing why certain definitions resonate with viewers. Many have told me of physical challenges they are struggling with and need positive affirmations. Sometimes, it's about the emotional turmoil that a loved one is facing, and they need a way to communicate their support. It's very gratifying to be able to help in even a small way.ŒæHowever, it isn't all about struggles. I have devoted most of my designs to the celebration of life, laughter, connecting, and caring. They are designed to express the love we share, the friends we value, and the support we give: everything that makes life worth living.ŒæThe äóìRäó is a butterfly representing transformation. This line is surely a labor of love and transformation for me.ŒæI am grateful to be able to share art that has special meaning for people. As a kid I used to read Mad Magazine and drool over the art created by the geniuses known as "the usual gang of idiots." Guys like Mort Drucker, Jack Davis, Paul Coker, Sergio Aragones, Al Jaffee, and the rest. After art school I was all geared up to make a name for myself in comics. I had a series of short comic stories published in a now-defunct comics anthology called Negative Burn, and I impressed the editor at Caliber Press at that time enough to offer me a one-shot comic book which was called Grumble.This was in the late nineties, and I found I had decided to get into the alternative comics field just in time for it to take a nose-dive in popularity. Even the biggest names in the industry were having a hard time making a living doing comics. Having to find work doing something else other than comics wasn't easy for me to do, but I had to eat. Fast forward many years... I've never lost my love of weird comics and artwork, and now sites like Facebook, Tumblr, and Instagram have provided artists like myself with a great arena for self-promotion, and sites like this one have made it possible for them to self-publish. This is something that just wasn't financially feasible in the past, so I think it's a great time for artists right now. Because that's what art is all about: the joy of creating and sharing it with other people, right?That's why I wanted to make this book. My hunger to draw and make comics is still alive and well, and has even increased over the past few years. I've been drawing tons of stuff and posting bits and pieces of it on various sites, but then most of it just goes into the closet to live with all my other filled up sketchbooks. So I wanted to take all of my favorite pieces from all of that and put them into one book and make it available to whomever might find it interesting.So that's what this is: A big book of my art. Complete pieces of art, not cropped or filtered, in full-color and all in one place. Now I just need a bit of help getting this thing printed, so I'm hoping other people are at least half as excited about it as I am.I'm not a drooling kid anymore, but the spark ignited by those Mad geniuses and my never-ending quest for the perfect line is stronger than ever. With your support, I'm hoping this book will be a proper tribute to those artists who paved the way for reckless dreamers like me. Thank you. Below are a few samples of some of the pages I've put together so far. Some of them have close-up detail view, just to give you a better idea of how it will look when it's printed.

This is my second Kickstarter project proposing a book featuring 100 of my single panel cartoons. ŒæMy original idea was to work with a self-publishing company to produce a high quality book for distribution to bookstores: color cover, 'perfect' binding, quality interior paper, etc. ŒæThat project fell well short of its funding goal. ŒæThis time I am proposing a much more modest publication one which I can do myself at our local print shop and fold and staple. ŒæThis new proposal is not the fancy full color publication I had in mind, but even this scaled-down version is too expensive for my retirement budget. ŒæThe resulting publication will be similar to self-published (and self-assembled) books I have done in the past and, based on those experiences, the modest publication should do well in local and regional markets. ŒæI will load the books in the car and take them with me as I travel the West: photographing, fishing, hiking, and teaching. ŒæI am a traveling teaching artist and I drive all over the Four Corners Region of the Western U.S. teaching cartooning and illustration to children--kindergarten through eighth grades--in schools and libraries. ŒæI enjoy teaching and working with children because it provides me with a constantly changing perspective on my art and allows me to experiment with new techniques and formats. ŒæWho knows, as I distribute the less ambitious books envisioned in this project, a big investor or an existing publisher or a princess or a pixie with loads of cash and too much time on her hands might yet agree to fund a more elaborate full color second printing of Short Stories: 100 % Organic Cartoons.Œæ

The deck features impressionist-style oil paintings and research into the science and mythology for each sacred site, as well as an intuitive interpretation for the oracle.This will be the first of three Oracle of Gaia decks! Each deck will have 48 cards (for a total of 144 in this 3-part series) and an illustrated book. The collections are meant to be both teaching and mystical. The oracle aspect is meant to enliven your intuition and awaken your alignment with the earth (Gaia). The Oracle of Gaia is written and illustrated by Susan Tower.AnŒæOracleŒæis defined as 'a priest or priestess acting as a medium through whom advice or prophecy was sought from the gods in classical Greece'. The term has come to mean the voice of intuition or a story, sometimes coded, of the answer you seek.ŒæGaiaŒæis the Greek name for 'Goddess of the Earth'. In modern times, the term has expanded to a concept which considers the earth to be a living being. TheŒæOracle of GaiaŒæis like the 'Voice of the Earth'. Here, Her story is told through fact, mythology and intuition.The impressionist-style paintings of sacred sites of Gaia are meant to trigger your own remembering. The oracle deck can be used as a spiritual tool, much like a tarot deck, as easily as asking a question and drawing a card for an answer. This principle of divination is age-old and it works from the idea that All is in Divine Order, and the card you chose is the right one for this moment. Many ways to use the cards are suggested in the book.Sacred Sites are places on the earth that hold unseen energy vortexes that can help amplify and expand one's consciousness. Around the planet, hundreds of places are distinguished by large stone structures, stone circles or earthen mounds and are places of ancient spiritual ceremonies, often found where the earth's ley lines (energetic alignments between sites) meet or cross, or where the larger, earth-grid lines intersect. By their exact geomancy (auspicious placement), the sites expand the natural vibrational energy to a higher frequency and are like earth's 'hot spots'.ŒæAn understanding of Earth's natural energy grids can be a basis of spiritual practice and meditation.ŒæMythology indicates a vast, worldwide grid that was deactivated long ago to protect the planet from usurpers, and that now, with the rise in consciousness, the grid is being reactivated.ŒæThe way to benefit from the wisdom of the Oracle is to use it in your spiritual practice to strengthen the earth's energy-grid, as well as your own! This can be accomplished by working with the Oracle of Gaia cards to access these ancient and powerful energies.ŒæThere are many reasons. All are meant to trigger expansion and reconsideration of what we 'know'.ŒæThey provide empirical evidence of technologies we cannot explain; the precision with which these sites are placed on the planet is only now being discovered and the enormous stones used goes beyond our understanding of what is possible. Historically, this evidence belies what we have been taught about ancient people. Primitive cave dwellers or even slave-owning kings, could not have created these sites even with technology we have today. The proof of an advanced ancient culture will have to claim its place in our accounting of the past, and each piece of truth helps us know more about who we are. It is also valuable to know the mythologies around these sites, as the stories hold many hints as to what may have actually happened or how the sites were made. On more than one occasion, a myth taken seriously led to a significant archeological find such as the discovery of the ancient Greek city of Troy in the 1870's.ŒæStudying the treasure trove of tales is like planting seeds in your mind from the field of all possibilities."The Oracle of Gaia deck is a profound collection of images for an oracle deck.ŒæEach of these cards evokes a sense of discovery.ŒæIt is a combination of energy lifting off each card, the beauty äóñ everything here is compelling, and the feeling of gravity äóñ in each scene there is a feeling of being at that place. Œæ"To embark on the invitation that these cards give is a gift to oneself, to go back into history, to draw on this spectacular human achievement of incredible mysteries and potential. Who knows how they did it? We still have a possibility to revive that potential, to engender a better world. That information is in our DNA memory. This is going to awaken people to their place in history.Œæ These paintings are so richly observed and rendered and I can taste that water and I can climb that tree, I can feel those birds flying. I can access a deeper part of myself." ŒæŒæSteve MacDonald, professional psychic, Kansas City, MOSusan Tower is a professional illustrator and designer, with a long held a passion for both plein air painting (painting outdoors, on-site) and exploring ancient sites around the world. She combines the two whenever possible. The picture below shows her painting plein air at Machu Picchu, Peru.ŒæSusan has been to many of the places represented in this collection and has painted plein air whenever possible.Œæ"My spiritual direction and intention is to offer my paintings as a doorway for others to the activations and blessings of each location."Susan grew up in Michigan and was invited to the Kansas City area to work at Hallmark Cards, Inc. when she graduated from college. She worked there as a designer for seven years and left to be a work-at-home mom when her daughter, Sierra was born. In 1990 she also began to work as an intuitive, doing spiritual art which she called 'Soul Paintings'. Over the years, she has done over a 1,000 of these intuitive readings. The feedback and popularity of this endeavor has given her the confidence and experience to include a thought-provoking intuitive voice for the Oracle of Gaia."This project is a culmination of over 20 years of study and focus. It is a dream of mine to complete this deck and offer my talents with full focus to the greater good. Your support for this project will allow me to share what has been inside of me to illustrate for a long time."ŒæHere is what it will take to finish the project and produce the 1st edition of 48 cards with an illustrated book and box. The graph below shows how the money will be spent. Kickstarter is an an all-or-nothing funding site. Either this project is funded or it is not. When you pledge to buy a product, your account will only be charged if the funding goal is met at the end of 30 days.The full project of The Oracle of Gaia deck will be complete and ready for shipping in June of 2014. Many of the other products will be ready for the 2013 holidays. Your favorite sacred site image can brighten your altar, desk or book shelf right away, and the Desk Art Prints will be available for the 2013 holiday season.ŒæYou will also receive a signed first edition of the Oracle of Gaia deck, the digital book, project updates and a thank you in the credits.Œæ$53.Gicleí© Prints + DeckŒæäóñ The best quality reproduction available, these gicleí© prints are printed onto stretched canvas and look remarkably like original paintings. ŒæThey are signed, limited editions, and are hand-touched with original brush strokes and texture added by the artist and available in two sizes: (small) 9"x12" $125,Œæand (large)Œæ16"x20", $195.Œæ(Look for early bird prices).ŒæThis offer includes a signed first edition of the Oracle of Gaia deck, the digital book, project updates and a thank you in the credits.Original Paintings äóñ For Kickstarter backers only, I will recreate any of the sacred site Oracle paintings, at the 16"x20" size for only $1,250 each. (Look for early bird prices).Below are a few samples of finished Oracle of Gaia cards, followed by a short summary of the location and meaning. 28 cards are done now, and 20 need to be painted to complete the set.ŒæMany types of ancient sites existŒæsuch as stone circles, mounds, labyrinths, navel sites, temples, oracle sites and pyramids.ŒæStonehenge äóñ Wiltshire, England ŒæŒæThe most famous of the megalithic sites, Stonehenge is also part of a larger network of sites and is well established to accurately track both lunar and solar time cycles. Not so well known, is that Stonehenge is aligned with several other significant sites through great circles and a world grid. The book will have maps and diagrams to illustrate these connections. As an oracle card, this would indicate a very central, very ancient spot within you, one that is aligned to other locations äóñ on the earth and in the cosmos.The Stone Rows of Carnac äóñ Carnac, France Œæ(below left)ŒæUnique in all the world, this site is on the western coast of France. These stone rows are part of a set of stone rows that go on for almost a mile, and when viewed from Google Earth, one can see elaborate structures and staircases underwater, just off shore. As an oracle, it indicates an alignment with sacred geometry and proper proportion as well as accessible, previously hidden knowledge just below the surface.Notre Dame Cathedral äóñ Paris, France Œæ(below right)ŒæA famous example of Gothic architecture, it is also an ancient Goddess location, as even now, its name reflects. Notre Dame means, 'Our Lady'; the site is now dedicated to the Virgin Mary. As an oracle, it indicates an alignment with the sacred feminine and its ancient roots in a matriarchal society.Chartres Cathedral, FranceŒæ Another magnificent example of Templar Gothic architecture, its art and carvings have long been examined for their esoteric symbology and hidden meanings. Deeper into history, this location was an ancient Goddess site and even today it is dedicated to the Virgin Mother and holds a remnant of cloth supposedly from Her, which has curiously survived several fires and destructive forces against the building throughout history. As an oracle, the labyrinth reminds us that the spiritual path in any journey goes back and forth as it meanders toward its completion. The cathedral itself represents hidden codes of sacred geometry and the perseverance of the feminine spirit, despite outer circumstance and persecution.Angor Wat äóñ CambodiaŒæŒæOriginally attributed to Hindus, it was later adopted for use by Buddhists. Measurements of lunar and solar time cycles can be found within its architecture that was overgrown with trees and vines. An unusual site, it is built with sacred geometric proportions, uses an unknown adhesive for the rocks, and notably, is oriented to the west (most sites are oriented to the east) and all rituals take place in reverse order. Experts postulate that this may have symbolized a funerary passage or the honoring of the Hindu God, Vishnu, who is associated with the west. As an oracle card, this location would indicate a reversal, a passage to another realm, perhaps seemingly not intended, and the benefits of meditation to transcend earthly issues.

THE BIG CARTOON PROJECTHello Kickstarter community. My name is Khalil and i am part of a graphic design/illustration studio based in London, U.K. We are called Innov8seven Design and have been freelancing projects and illustrations for the past two years.This will be my second cartoon project as the first was completed successfully and i really enjoyed doing it..My Kickstarter project is very simple...ŒæI love cartoons, not just watching them but drawing them too and i love to turn my friends and celebrities into cartoons, what i would like to try and do is turn as many members of the kickstarter community into cartoons too, starting with you! all you have to do is make a pledge of your choice and wait to receive a information pack from me which will ask you to submit a photo of yourself and a few other details such as what you would like to be wearing in your cartoon portrait etc. I will then begin to turn you into a cartoon, by first hand sketching a number of ideas on paper, once i have generated a sketch that i think best resembles yourself i will computer illustrate the sketch until it looks something like the samples on this page. You will receive a computer file of the image.. what you choose to do with it is entirely up to you, many of my friends have printed their portraits onto t-shirts, mugs, bumper stickers and all sorts of other things...

FOR MORE INFO: FACEBOOK.COM/COSPLAYCALENDARFLPROJECT DESCRIPTIONThe goal of this campaign is to fund The Cosplay Cosplay. Through Kickstarter, we hope to materialize this project and immortalize, through print, some of the sexiest and most talented cosplayers in Florida. We want to ensure that all our efforts and passion are successful and with your help, milestone a victory in the cosplay community.ABOUT THE COSPLAY CALENDARThe Cosplay Calendar began as an idea in July 2013. The concept involved uniting some of the sexiest and most talented cosplayers in the state of Florida and immortalizing them in a calendar. Initially, it was planned to have both male and female cosplayers, but due to the lack of submissions from male cosplayers, only female cosplayers were casted. All the photoshoots took place over a one month period throughout the South Florida area. Three of the photoshoots took place in the Orlando area where girls from Gainesville, Orlando, and Ft. Meyers participated. With a total of 12 enchanting photos, the 2014 Cosplay Calendar will surely make your year a very eventful one.WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?All the money raised through this campaign will go towards making the calendar happen! This includes production costs for calendar prints, copyrights, props, and other miscellaneous  expenses like gas and food. An immense amount of effort went into putting this calendar together and we want to ensure that the efforts of everyone involved are successful and come to light. We desperately need the help of the much supportive geek community on this! We canäó»t do it without you! All donations will have their reward and weäó»re sure the outcome will be one to be proud of.AN UNDERDOG STORYAs the project got closer to completion, we realized that a lot of our cosplayers were relatively new to the geek community. We embraced this. We want to ensure that this journey will be a successful underdog story, where the äóìless-popularäó costumers will feel proud about this project succeeding. We want to show the WORLD that those lesser known cosplayers CAN succeed in selling their image and are just as talented as the big names. Please help us ensure our underdog story is funded; from a group of äóìunderdogsäó ourselves, we thank you in advance!GET IT! ŒæFor only $25 you can purchase The Cosplay Calendar. Many cosplayers sell individual prints ranging from $10 to $20; The Cosplay Calendar includes 12 individual images and showcases 25 of Floridaäó»s sexiest and most talented female cosplayers. Also, all of our content is original and was shot by passionate äóìgeekestersäó who devoted a great amount of time to bring this project to light. So, youäó»re not only getting an amazing piece of work containing amazing artists, but youäó»d also be making a dream come true! Help us make this happen!REWARDS!Rewards include The Cosplay Calendar itself, have your name listed in the calendar, prints, digital copies of The Cosplay Calendar, t-shirts, and even sponsorships! Check out the side bar for details.

One day while daydreaming in high school, the dreamy ducks appeared to me. I've since dreamed about putting them on a stamp (aka block printing art) to create fun and cute works! Once I have the supplies, it should be pretty fun and simple to dream together!

Yoga at an early age encourages self-esteem andbody awareness with a physical activity that's noncompetitive. Fosteringcooperation and compassionäóîinstead of oppositionäóîis a great gift to give ourchildren. Yoga, when presented in a child's language,Œæcan help counter thestress experienced by young people living in a hurry-up world. We have created Yoga Flash Cards that are fun, teaches the alphabet, demonstratesthe pose, the name of the pose (in English) and we have added positiveaffirmations along with a character quality which supports the pose. How fun isthat?Now, what about Christians who are not comfortable with the"Sanskrit" used in regular Yoga? Well..... we have that covered too! TheChristian approach to yoga simply allows us to combineŒætwo essentialgoals: Becoming physically healthyand spiritually healthy. We becomemore spiritually healthy through the yoga practice by calming our minds andquieting ourselves to the point that we can tune out the world's frequency andtune into God's frequency.ŒæŒæSo we have created Yoga Flash Cards forChristians. Instead of the positive affirmations, we have replaced it with asupportive scripture verse for that character quality! Way too cool!

The working title for this graphic novel is äóìCloudbustingäó, it is written and illustrated by Helen Dearnley BA (hons) Fine Art & Illustration University of Lincoln.The full synopsis and first pages are uploaded on this blogThe concept occurred in a dream after going to sleep reading Eric Drookeräó»s "Flood".ŒæEntirely conceived during the 2012 UK floods. The story is based on real events that occurred to the illustrator and single parent, graduating at the time of the 2008 recession, conflated with actual dreams, following on from previous research interests. It is a wordless graphic novel.ŒæThe starting point of the graphic novel begins with a dream in which the female protagonist was working with a male colleague. Re-appropriated imagery (ref: Cindy Sherman and Candice Breitz) from Kate Bush's Cloudbusting video depicts a female "professor" and a male colleague working together, heaving a large, heavy, covered object up a hill. They appear as small silhouettes.ŒæThe characters in Kate Bushäó»s original video have been re-appropriated to place the female protagonist as the äóìProfessoräó, and her male colleague working together. This is because the story is being told from a female perspective. The pair are torn apart from each other at the point after the government come to destroy the research at the end of Kate Bushäó»s video. The style of the illustrations at this point change specifically with reference made to Andrzej Klimowskiäó»s The Depository; the female protagonist finds herself trapped in a vitrine in The Depository. The storyline then conflates numerous sources, including Florence And The Machineäó»s "Cosmic Love" and Lowelläó»s "The Birds", blackbirds in place of the book angels fly across the city skyline to communicate in dreams.ŒæThe female heroine's adventures through grief, homelessness, false accusations, and DWP jobkill depict scenarios that Eric Drooker knows all too well, and eventual reunion with the male protagonist lead to a very different ending, and located in a different city. Although illustrated from a female perspective, this aims to be read by a broad readership, to share challenges faced by single parents so that others may learn from those experiences. It follows a similar narrative as Jane Austen's "Persuasion", but it isn't meant to appeal only to women.ŒæAnne Elliott said "Men have every advantage of us in telling their own story. Education has been theirs in so much higher a degree; the pen has been in their hands."ŒæThe aim is for this to be completed and published - I will require a publisher that perhaps specialises in graphic novels, and it's of interest to Eric Drooker himself when it's completed.Cloudbusting Flood remix by Helen AThe music for the video samples Pxl's remix of Kate Bush's original Cloudbusting song, edited with vocals courtesy of Apparatjik and "Everybody Is One Bar". Vocals by Jonas Bjerre and Guy Berryman. Original Cloudbusting music and video remain the intellectual property of Kate Bush.ŒæAbout the production costsŒæThis Kickstarter pitch aims to raise some of the costs of producing the graphic novel. As a considerable amount has been illustrated already, the goal is set low in the hope to raise more, and / or follow this up with another funding pitch. The full costs of labour would be impossible to raise via Kickstarter in one month alone.All funding covers labour, printing / publishing costs, shipping and Kickstarter fees. If funding goes over the limit, further additional rewards will be added in, such as Dearnley's Tea-O-Meter etc.ŒæAbout the authorŒæHelen Dearnley aka "Blackbird" is an artist and illustrator based in Lincoln, UK.Her first self-published comic "The Unreal God And Aspects Of His Non-Existent Universe" documented real and imaginary adventures with iconic comic book band A-ha.Œæ"I want one! Great job Helen! congrats!  I think you're VERY talented. Congrats again! xx " Carlos MaciaŒæHelen always thought it would be quite funny if she met Morten Harket and illustrated a photo with him.ŒæIn 2010 she was awarded funding to go to Oslo as a delegate at the conference "Living A Boy's Adventure Tale: Musical Interactions In The Decades Of Postmodernism" and exhibition "Hunting High And Low: 25 Years With A-ha" at the National Library Of Norway, where she saw original illustrations from A-ha's Take On Me and The Sun Always Shines On TV videos. Her Nobel Peace Centre wish came true a couple of months later in Sheffield, where Helen met Morten Harket, and gave him one of the original copies of the comic as a retirement present. The resulting illustration is the pride of her portfolio. Helen has been commissioned to illustrate "Move To Oslo", a book about an A-ha fan's adventures written by Lina Nordmeer and Ildiko Karpati. "I have written the novel äó_Move To Osloäó not just by mere accidentäó_ everything that I have experienced through this book was driven by fate. This is how I met Helen by a lucky chance äóñ first I was thinking about asking Stian Andersen to sell me a nice photograph of Morten, which he was more than willing to do, even for a quite reasonable price. But then I saw the lovely drawings of Helen on Facebook and I decided rather to take that for my book äóñ a portrait of Morten and myself. Helen made two sketches and I instantly fell in love with one of them. I am very grateful for the lovely artwork of Morten and me and would like to thank Helen for the great cooperation. She is a true artist, indeed, and I wish her enduring success !" Lina Nordmeer, author "Move To Oslo".Helen also works with Magne Furuholmen as a fine artist, and in 2012 returned to Oslo to see him perform with Apparatjik for the opening of the new Astrup Fearnley Museet. Whilst there, Helen discovered the graphic novel work of Norwegian illustrator Hariton Pushwagner, and his graphic novel "Soft City". Helen's work with Apparatjik contributes to the music for the promotional video here.You can follow Helen on twitter or her Illustration facebook page.Risks and challengesŒæ"Cloudbusting" is my first self-directed graphic novel, the synopsis is finished, initial visuals for the cover design have been designed, and so far over 50 pages have already been illustrated without any additional financial support. I have set a low budget to raise some costs to cover overheads, but this is only a proportion of the full costs, considering how much work goes into producing a graphic novel. As such, the amount I'm raising for this month is only the first installment. From April 2014 there is also the very real risk of being forced into government workfare programmes. Of course, I have no intention of becoming homeless, or the government trying to destroy my research!I've applied for the AA2A scheme this year, so that I can access and use facilities at University, especially the mac suite in Illustration, and the print room. The use of the print room will enable me to create mini zines and prints, perhaps to sell to support the project and raise more funds. However, I won't know if I'm successful with this until October. Once the project is funded, I may require further support, and I will still need to finish it. I've illustrated approximately 50 pages already, which I estimate to be about half the book, but I don't expect to finish it within a year. I'm allowing 2-3 years for this to be completed. An estimated completion date is offered of 2016. Of course, I'm aware that finding a publisher isn't going to be easy, and I expect to send my manuscript to as many as possible in the hope that it will be published. Once it's published, the real fun will begin!

What I want to create is an exciting softcover book filled with 70 pages of illustrated stories about how human life began. It will be an interesting and educational read with beautiful sequential illustrations exploring each story.The book will contain a diverse collection of stories from many different religions (Christianity, Hinduism, Shintoism, Scientology, etc), scientific research (Evolution, Panspermia) and ancient civilizations (Babylonian). It will explore these legendary stories through visualization, allowing comparison and exploration.It'll be a limited edition, first run and each backer will have their name included in the Thank You section in the finished product.This book is important as I donäó»t believe all of these legendary stories have been collected into such an accessible and enjoyable format like this before. I'm asking for your help to make it happen, to get this book printed and out into the world.This book does not parody any religious beliefs, it portrays everything with a completely neutral view, with the intent of allowing the reader to decide which story they want to believe, if any at all. After months of investigation I narrowed my research down to 15 stories that I think are the most important, entertaining and visually exciting. I then began the process of converting these stories into illustrations, a massive task this is almost complete. Right now I am currently putting the book together and doing some preliminary printing planning.It looks like this project will go immediately to print if I reach my goal. If by some crazy chance I exceed my goal I intend to upgrade the book, possibly to a hardcover, higher quality printing techniques and maybe even take an extra week to illustrate a few more stories that didnäó»t make the cut.I have tried to make sure every donation is rewarded, either with a digital copy, a physical copy or a mounted print of one theory.Below are some images of the proposed final book:Reward 1:Reward 2:Reward 3:

WeŒæwant to create maps--beautiful artistic illustrated maps. Lots of maps thatŒæ show an iconic road or highway that has buildings, signs and structures of historic significance. And we want these renderings to beŒæŒæŒæ framed and hung in a place of honor in homes, schools, offices and public buildings.Œæ For the creation "54 miles for the right to vote" we will look at the Selma to Montgomery Voting Rights Trail. Our intention is to create a map that gives an historic look at the 54 miles between Selma and Montgomery Alabama, in 1965, when African Americans fought for the freedom to vote.The voting rights movement in Selma started when local African-Americans formed the Dallas County Voters League. The addition of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee created an assertive alliance. In 1963, the coalition initiated voter-registration efforts but progress was slowed by the attempts of others to limit the creation of an inclusive voting system. A march to the Alabama Capital was planned to gain more support for their effort.On March 7, 1965, "Bloody Sunday" unfolded before the nation, and attention was drawn to Selma and the plight of many as they fought to exercise their right to vote.Œæ Two days later, when Martin Luther King, Jr. joined the marchers they crossed the Edmund Pettus Bridge in a symbolic effort to gain protection from state and federal law enforcement.By March 21, 1965, about 3,200 marchers set out on historic U.S. Route 80 on the way to Montgomery, the capital of Alabama. This was the 3rd and most successful attempt. Walking 10-12 miles a day, they slept at farms or in fields as momentum started to grow. The world was now watching closely as they--now 25,000 strong reached the Alabama State Capitol building on March 25, 1965Ideas come first. In June, 2012 we started to create maps with our new business, Historic Maps. The first maps were of locations we knew well and visited many times. We joined the National Registry of Historic Places and began to do more research. We came across the Selma to Montgomery Voting Rights Trail and decided this would make a great map. We adopted it as our new challenge. The historic "Voting Rights Trail" fit the model for our map creations: An iconic road or highway that contains buildings or structures that offer an artistic attraction to be presented in a illustrated map.ŒæIn February of 2013, we visited Alabama and traveled U. S. Route 80 from Selma to Montgomery. We walked on the Edmund Pettus Bridge. We visited the museums, markers, churches, state buildings, monuments and farms. We took pictures and recorded GPS locations.Œæ We have made contact with several historians. One in particular, Joanne Bland of Selma, was present at the Edmund Pettus Bridge on "Bloody Sunday" in 1965 and knows first hand what went on the day. She has been and will continue to be a source of information and verification of accurate content.Œæ ŒæŒæŒæŒæAn historical rendering of the road, bridges, buildings and other iconic features is the key to our effort when remembering what happened in 1965. We have pictures and words. We have maps of roads and labels. All are parts of history.An illustrated map of original art will give us another opportunity to share the "big picture" to those you want to understand what happened in 1965. It is not only a piece to hang on the wall and remember but is to also an opportunity to share the story and educate the young. We need to remember and not repeat the examples of an exclusive society.This map will take $5,600 to launch by December of 2013.We need to...After developing four maps in 2013, we have used up our original investment capital. We currently have four maps for sale. Although launch and initial reaction have gone well, sales continue to be slow. Consistent but slow. "54 miles for the right to vote" may become our best selling map but launching it will only come from an infusion of new investment capital. After using our original investment from a retirement account, we no longer intend to borrow more money, taking on additional debt. Our business will survive by becoming self-financed from this point onward.

WHAT IS A PANTONE'D PORTRAIT?Pantone'd portraits are created from individual colour swatches. Each piece of art is created from 1,600 individual colour swatches. Every swatch is the average colour hue of that particular square section of the image.Zoomed in, the art is just a series of abstract block swatch colours. Only when you step back or squint do you actually see the full image in all its glory and detail.I am hoping to gain funding to have the opportunity to create custom, high quality Pantone'd prints from your favourite photographs. My prints are not just a great wall art, they're also a great gift for anyone who is into art, design, interiors or anything else creative. HOW DID YOU GET THE IDEA?Bizarrely the idea for Pantone'd portraits evolved from my passion of gaming, specifically retro gaming. I was creating some simple retro pixel art images for my wall and required somethingŒæ I could use for my pixels. With my design background, colour swatches seemed like the perfect solution. The whole thing snowballed from there. I then created a series of comic book swatch art and then some based on starwars characters.... and now here I am.WHAT IS A PANTONE COLOUR SWATCH ANYWAY?The Pantone solid colour system has over 1100 individually named and numbered colours. The Pantone matching system was devised for the graphics, printing and publishing industries as a way of specifying and controlling colours for print output. WHO DOES THE ARTIST THINK HE IS?That's me in the main banner. I'm just a humble, creative type from Newcastle who loves art, design and beautiful colourful things. I have always created, but never had the confidence to promote anything I have done. It's only in the last year or so that I have revealed anything I have made to be viewed. Check out my blog page for more info about me, my history, and to see some of the stuff i've been up to:http://frigopie76.wordpress.com/Creating colour swatch art is massively rewarding. Taking a photo and converting it into simple colour swatch art is time consuming, fun... and the end result, to me, is almost always beautiful......... even Newcastle :)OK, CUT TO THE CHASE! WHAT REWARDS WILL I GET?This has been ridiculously difficult to decide upon. I wanted everyone who funded me to get something of value (Not just a basic boring thankyou).If succesfully funded, everyone who pledges Œ£5 or more will recieve a 40+ page pdf digi book of my pantone'd works and a few more interesting works by myself. Also everyone who funds me will be mentioned and thanked in the pdf book and on my web blog. The Pdf digibook will be of high quality ... but won't be print quality at large sizes.For funding of Œ£10 or more you will be sent signed artist prints. Printed onto paper, canvas or acrylic each one will be checked and signed by myself. Every piece will be unique.Fund Œ£30 or more and I will personally create your own piece of pantone'd art from any photo of your choice.See rewards for details.... and below for product descriptions.- Paper giclee art prints are printed onto photographic grade 250gsm paper. All paper prints are coated for durability and sent out securely rolled up. - Canvas giclee art prints are stretched onto 38mm deep gallery frames. (Printed with a matte finish.) - High end acrylic prints are beautiful and vibrant. The crystal clear 5mm thick diamond polished acryic sits 25mm from the wall attached with 4 stainless steel fixings. All prints signed by myself and marked to show that they are original limited edition of 1 single unique print. If I ever get famous, they could be worth thousands.... you never know.I can create your Pantone'd art in 2 options (See image above):1. Adobe Illustrator Pantone Swatch colour picker style.2. Traditional Pantone'd swatch art with customised name.Note - Smaller prints can only be created in illustrator style swatches as text on the traditional style is just too small and illegible. Unfortunately I cannot deliver larger prints outside of the UK. (The costs for shipping art overseas are crazy expensive.) If money is not an issue, send me a message and I will find out shipping costs for you or sort something.I'VE PAID MY MONEY, WHERE'S MY ART?My Goal is for just Œ£1,500 of backing but I calculate I could cope with upwards of Œ£7,500 (May be some delay if more than that.)If there are any delays, all affected parties will be informed as soon as is humanly possible. My Goal is for just Œ£1,500 of backing but I calculate I could cope with upwards of Œ£7,500 (May be some delay if more than that.) If I raise my goal target, (once I recover from the elation), I will contact everyone who donated and give details on what to do next. Most likely I will email an order form so I can get full details and keep everything organised. I will also, need to be emailed a photo so I can create your art.I will work through my rewards in the order in which people pledged. The sooner you pledge... the quicker you will get your reward.SHOW ME SOME PANTONE'D EXAMPLES!OK Here you go!WHAT ARE YOU GONNA DO IF YOU GET FUNDED?Hopefully I will raise funds to be able to create and complete this project and spread the colourful joy of Pantone'd art. Any funds remaining after fulfillment may just allow me to produce a few extra art prints. I hope to display these in local galleries, coffee shops, bars etc.My long term goal is to break free from the day to day grind and produce my art projects full time. Not an easy task but you have to start your dreaming somewhere. Please help me fund this project. There's no reason not to. (If there is, let me know). The art is top quality, the concept is stunning and the rewards are amazing.All my art is created digitally - No original Colour swatches will be harmed in the making of this project.Any questions? - pantoned@monowaveart.co.uk

ŒæA coloring book of tattoo designs!Œæ My plan is to create one new design each day for 365 days, and then collect them in a book that can be used to give you ideas for your next tattoo, kill some time while waiting on a friend to get there tattoo in studio, relieve some stress by coloring at home, or simply to be a great collection of quirky and eclectic art!Œæ Included will be information about tattoo design; what to look for, what to consider, even how to create your own!Œæ ŒæThis book will not be your typical tattoo design book.Œæ Inside you will find strange and unusual designs meant to humor and impress!Œæ Your pledge will help get a unique collection of art out to the public!

I'm Mark and I need your help making this teaching poster come to life!My idea for äóÖThe Elephant Lessonäó» springs from reading 19thcentury American poet John Saxeäó»s re-tellingof the Indian parable "The Blind men and the Elephantäó. As the story goes,a group of blind men never having seen an elephant, touch it to learn what itäó»slike. Each one feels a different part such as the tail, trunk or tusk. Aftercomparing their findings, they discover they are in complete disagreement andstart to argue. One man thinks itäó»s a snake, another a tree and then anotherman a brush; each man steadfastly sure what he thinks is truth. After much debate, the blind menstop arguing, start listening and collaborate to "see" the fullelephant. The moral is while one's experience is subjectively true, it may notalways be correct.I instantly recognized this poem's value in helping my 7 year old understand the necessity of listening to ideas from his friends, his teachers and even his parents. The message takes a little bit longer to get through to adults but they're fair game as well.For short attention spans,Iäó»ve abbreviated and modernized Saxeäó»s prose along with creating a unique elephant character to engage young learners. I've chosen Century Gothic as the typeface after learning it's recommended by the British Dyslexia Association as a dyslexia-friendly font.I've made 3 versions for different tastes and audiences. Each option below will be available as your choice for reward. All prints will be finished on 13" x 19" Premium Matte with border for framing. Not too big, not too small, just right.Hung up in the home, office orclassroom, äóÖThe Elephant Lessonäó» serves dual purpose as a delightful work ofart and an invitation to discuss the value of peacefuldiscourse and shared perspective.

Weäó»ve been collecting prints of various sizes of Troll Shaman, as well as many others, so that we can distribute them throughout numerous galleries, and for a planned sketchbook of some of Michaeläó»s similarly-themed art, coming soon! Michael is in a rare category of artists, whose work with fine line and form is so precise, it can be enlarged to any size, while most artistsäó» work deteriorates after enlarging. Michael sketches with black and white, pen & ink, using exquisite detail to bring his works to life, using faces of everyday street people, family, or friends as models, and then adding his own fantasy twist so that the life in Troll Shamanäó»s eyes can be unmistakably felt by the viewer.Hereäó»s Michaeläó»s own description of his process with äóìTroll Shaman:äó -äóìThe initial seed of the idea was planted when more and more of my friends were getting these large "ear gauges" or "plugs," and I thought that they looked so exotic and visually striking, and simply stored it in my brain for future use. After deciding to incorporate this, and sprinkling in some other trinkets, I thought that the initial stages of "Troll Shaman" had a cool indigenous feel to him, like he existed in the wild somewhere, but he hadnäó»t come to life yet, not really. He needed an especially visually striking element, something that set him apart from everything else, and I did not know what that was at the time. So again, I shelved him for further fermentation, and did some sketching on him from time to time, but always felt like I struck out. Eventually I had a breakthrough with an idea to elongate his head and pull it upwards, so that he had this striking element on the top of his head, but something natural: Hence, the horns protruding straight from the top of his skull. And after that, the big bully drew himself with my hands. My final copy of "Troll Shaman" began with the eyes as the first thing I drew, because I knew that the whole piece would hinge on whether one could feel the vitality emanating from him. He needed to look like heäó»d experienced fantasies and horrors akin to living a long life in HIS world, he needed to look world-warn from HIS environment, and with primitive ornaments and decorations dangling from him. After that, it was a simple matter of refining the sketch, and tightening things up. Every piece of art has 2 stages, planning and execution. The planning was complete, now was actually the easier stage of the two, now it was time to focus on the technical aspects of physically rendering a subject. Usually this I do on autopilot. A night or two and he was done, one of my most iconic and powerful characters. The Troll Shaman." Œæ-Michael Scott Fairchild

It all started while I was volunteering at a local animal shelter. ŒæThey had recently acquired a tiny black and white feral kitten, and he wasn't coming around socially. Of course, I immediately fell in love and knew I had to foster him to prevent his otherwise untimely death. No kitten should be without hope...especially when it's only 3 weeks old.A little over a month has passed, and Oswin Castiel (or just Cass) has been my impossible angel. He's shown me that love can overcome brutal beginnings, and hope can be found in the most unlikely places. In short, he has inspired this campaign.I want to create an illustrated ebook full of adoption and rescue stories using Lulu.com. ŒæI already have collected several stories for the book, but I want to include more. I want to tell as many stories as possible, and I want them to be yourŒæstories. I know you have them. In addition to including the stories of your own impossible angels, I want to capture your furry loved ones in original works of art, which are the rewards for this campaign.ŒæThis book is going to be a celebration of love, survival, and hope. Please, join me on this creative journey.

Surface Pattern has been something that I have been inspired by for years. A Calendar is something every household relies on for those day-to-day reminders. Here I combine the two, using my many years as a Surface Pattern Designer, to bring you a selection of bright and bold 2014 Calendars, perfect for any home.ŒæBy supporting my project, you are not only helping invest in someone who has dreamed of seeing their patterns on products for years, but actively encouraging independent creatives to achieve their goals.ŒæI have several Calendar templates ready for printing, using a selection of designs designed by myself as part of a #365patternchallenge, which you can follow on my blog, using the link here.ŒæThe PatternsThere is already a print company lined up for printing these calendars, and all I need now is the backing of the general public, to help me get these printed.ŒæThe CalendarsThe calendars I will have printed are as follows:ŒæA2 Wall Planner (Double sided and ideal for students)A slimline wall calendar (Perfect for those with little wall space)A standard A4 Calendar (With lots of space to write important dates)An A3 Family Planner (With space for up to 5 family members and an extra column for birthdays and Appointments)I also have a digital calendar available for download with ALL pledge options. Sexual assault and abuse impact people in deeply profound ways. The trauma of the event itself is often exacerbated by shame that our culture still perpetuates and that shame can often manifest as feelings of ugliness as if the trauma has been etched on the face itself. Long after the physical body heals the emotional and spiritual body can still suffer. My intention is to transform that shame through art and show victims/survivors that they are as beautiful as they ever were and often even more so.I plan to make this happen using my drawing skills with 30 survivors. ŒæI have the equipment to set up photo shoots to ensure clear images which speed the process of drawing rather than relying on snapshots or cell phone pictures.I have 2 years experience organizing an annual art show so I am experienced with marketing these events as well as setting up the physical displays. ŒæThe only difference here is that I am the sole exhibitor and have a more specific focus for my subjects.

I love the personal touch when ordering from small businesses, and I'm sure you do too.The Designs/Rewards :The A3 and A4 artwork will be printed onto lovely 220gsm paper, and the A5 art cards onto 300gsm card. When you choose your rewards, you can choose from any design that relates to the reward. For example, if you pledge Œ£10 or more, you can choose from any of the A5 prints, or one of the Kickstarter exclusive ones if you prefer.Here's some more detailed previews of the patterns, so you can see what you're getting!KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVES!As well as these alternate colourways that won't be available anywhere else . The first 2 are available in A3 and A4, and the last is A5:Other Info :The prints and cards will take around 2 weeks after funding of the project to be delivered to domestic addresses, please add 1-2 weeks on top of this time for delivery to international addresses.HELP SPREAD THE WORD:äó¢ Get tweeting! you can say whatever you want, but here's some suggestions if you're lost for words:- Help @cardboardcities make her dream to produce prints and cards a reality and support her @kickstarter project!- Want to make your walls happy? @cardboardcities needs your help to make that a reality on @kickstarter.äó¢ Post about it on Facebook- You can use the same messages as above or write your own. If you like my page on Facebook and I write about this, you can also just share it!

-------------------------------------Heres a video for you guys about copyright:Œæhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKBsTUjd910---------------------------------------Hey guys,We're still a long way from reaching our goal and we really need your help to make this website. Without this money we wont be able to get the high quality website you all deserve. We already have some exciting prospects for the future lined up if we reach our goal:So please, please help us by donating and spreading the word so we can bring this unique Pokemon fan site to life.Thank you--------------------------------------------Hey Guys,We want to welcome some people to 'The World of Pokemon' team.Biological and Zoological Studies:Lucy Rose- Wyatt - Got a first in biology from Queen Mary (it's in the Russell group), and starting a masters in ecology & evolutionary biology at the same university this autumn. She works part time as a research assistant to a professor of genetics. Emma Hernejí_rvi - AŒæbiology student (5th year)Bradon Burgess -ŒæHas a degree in zoology with marine zoology3D modelling and rendering:Matt Williams äóñ 3D Artist, studied at the Arts institute in San Francisco (Is also building a team of artists from the sameŒæInstitute) www.mattwilliams3d.comEric Twelkemeyer- 3D Artist, studied at SAE institute in Hamburg, GermanyBen Pierson äóñ 3D Artist - www.benjaminpierson.comMusic and Sound:Gabriel Ryfer Cohen - IsŒæa Film Scoring student at Berklee College of Music in Boston and is assembling a team of talented composers and sound designers (for Pokemon sounds) from the same Institute.Thank youŒæ-----------------------If you have any worries or queries about copyright or any other question, please check our FAQ at the bottom of our page. If that doesn't suffice, please dontŒæhesitateŒæto send us a private message and I'll be happy to answer any of your questions.Thank you------------------------My plan is to build a fully interactive site with huge amounts of artwork and detailed information on the Pokemon world.'The World of Pokemon' is a non profit website that shows Pokemon in a realistic way.The website includes:The World in which the Pokemon live in. Looking at the Cities, Towns, forests and wilds, each with detailed maps and histories surrounding them. Also looking at Gyms etc.A long and detailed look at the History of their world such as lost civilisations, world wars and religion. Plus a look into the natural evolution of Pokemon.The Technology of the their world and how it works, such as Pokeball's, Pokemon storage etc.The League and the different tournaments it provides like Pokemon Battles, Beauty contests, Breeding contests etc. The website will also be full of fun extras, such as online comics, fan fiction, areas for fans to talk and share their ideas (which will help shape the website) and possibly even mini games and videos!Thankfully through the help of my team and Liberty Tech we've already begun to work on it but sadly, we dont have the funding to truly make it happen. Everything costs money these days and without it we can't make this a reality.ŒæSo this is where you come in. If you fund the project you will not only be kept up to date as it goes on, you will even get to help shape what we create. The more funding we receive, the more time we can spend on it as a team, making it as in depth as possible using all the resources at our disposal.I have been working on this as aŒæpersonalŒæproject now for almost 3-4 years. I have a large mount of writing and artwork already done. Through out the project I will work as the websites Editor, Art Director / creature designer and head story writer. I will proof andŒæapproveŒæeverything and anything that goes up on the site. This is my dream, my baby, so I will be there to help it grow until the end.Joshua DunlopGraphic Artist/ Illustrator and writer living in London.ŒæRole: Editor and Artistic DirectorHe's worked in game and television for nearly 6 years now doing freelance work and also studied BA Hons acting for stage and media at the University of West London.ŒæRobbie TarrantProducer, Locations Manager, Unit ManagerRole: Director and Business administratorRobbie has worked in the film and television industry for the last 4 years working on films such as TimŒæBurton'sŒæ'Dark Shadows'.'IŒæfirstŒægot involved on this project after seeing Josh's art on Deviant Art. With my Film background I could see a huge cinematic potential in the market for reinventing Pokemon and bringing it back to its original fans. Imagine a Transformers meets Jurassic park concept that could be explored in so many avenues, the website is just theŒæbeginning...'.Roman O'Toole-HowesDirector, Cinematographer, Film editor, StuntmanRole: Filming behind the scenes, Video Blogs, Film EditorRoman Oäó»Toole-Howes is a freelance filmmaker / cinematographer and trainee stuntman from southwest London .Œæ'I remember when the first red and blue games came out and the impact it had in the late 90äó»s on our generation. I feel that this project has huge potential to reignite the sense of adventure Pokí©mon gave us as kids. I will be providing video content updating you with the development of the World of Pokí©mon and keeping you involved in the shaping of the world.'Mark UnderwoodWriter / ActorRole: Writer / ResearcherŒæMark Underwood studied a degree in Acting for stage and media and is currently writing plays for Concatenate Theatre Company.'I'm looking forward to the chance to learn more about the Pokemon World. Creating a rich, vibrant and adult version to match Josh's artwork.'Henry CollieWriter / ActorRole: Writer / ResearcherHenry Collie is an Acting student from Dublin, Ireland. Having a strong educational grounding in Classical history, Chemistry and Biology mixed with his passion for writing and literature he will bring a number of assets to the äóìWorld of Pokemonäó team. Studying in the third year of his degree he is also writing a play set around World War 1 due to tour in February 2014. As a child Henry was obsessed with the Pokemon world, often writing stories set within it. As he grew however, he also found the Pokemon world became less and less relatable. With your support he hopes to help create a Pokemon world which is still relevant to those who grew up with it by expanding upon the little explored notions of the current Pokemon universe. He will be specialising in the Pokemon worldäó»s history.Richard ElderfieldEngineer forŒæBritishŒæAirwaysRole: Technical Artist / Technology advisorŒæRichard works as a mechatronic engineer at Heathrow Airport. He has experience in technical drawing and experience in CAD.'I'm excited to be the tech geek in the World of Pokí©mon!'Michael Dent and Liberty Tech (http://www.libertytech.com)Founder of Liberty Tech, Website designer, EntrepreneurRole: Website design, Business AdvisorŒæMichael established Liberty Tech in July 2011 after studying Economics & Management at Merton College, University of Oxford.ŒæHis aim is to create a web development firm with a totally business-centric approach and outstanding communication.ŒæOn a day-to-day basis Michael oversees all client relationships, as well as technical architecture and design implementation. He became interested in the project early on when it was still in designs as a book and still has faith in the project to this day.The Œ£30'000 will allow me to:All the money raised will be put towards future work on the website, after all we have 6 regions to get through and over 600 Pokemon to write about. We will also have targets as the kickstarter goes on.Whats your plan for the future?Well I'm anŒæambitious guy :)The website wont charge itsŒæmembersŒæaŒæmembershipŒæfee and will be purely funded by advertisements and donations.ŒæThere will be no 'official' artwork from Pokemon displayed on the website, onlyŒæoriginal artwork and writing. This would be similar to how many fan or art websites work. We will also happilyŒædirectŒæpeople to the Official Pokemon site to see the latest on game, tv and film news.In theŒæmonthlyŒænewsletter you will be shown behind the scenes content and videos talking to the people who make the site.ŒæIt will have a polling station on certain things when we need your help, for example: Is Psyduck a Bird or a Platypus? Your answers help build the world.Sneaky peeks at work in progress artwork etc.And any other exciting news.If you donate over Œ£100 you will be sent this very special care package which includes:An A3 Poster of 'Day of Reckoning- Regigigas Awakens' (SubjectŒæto change)A selection of Pokemon themed badges:A Pokemon Academy graduationŒæcertificate:A Pokemon Academy Bookmark:Acceptance letter to the Pokemon League:If we receive the full amount of funding (or more) we will move forward as a team, getting the information ready for the first release.ŒæWithin a year of receiving the funding we will have a screening of the website to which only the 'Beta Testers' will all be allowed to see. We will have a message board open for one week where you can state your likes and dislikes about the site.ŒæWe will then go away and fix any bugs and change anything that you guys didn't like.ŒæThe site will then launch to the general public with the first lot of content. This will probably include a large amount of Pokemon, a detailed look at Pallet and much much more.Finally we will begin to give monthly updates with new and exciting things like new Pokemon, Gyms, Tech etc Also possible videos with presenters giving you all the latest news on everything Pokemon (if budget allows).We will work on a region at a time, very much how you work your way through the games but including information from every source, up until the latest release. This means you will get content out faster and you will be constantly updated with new and exciting things!Eventually I want to be able to invite artists and writers from all over the world toŒæcontributeŒæand offer areas for fans to post fan art and fan fiction. I also have ideas in the far future to involve 3D artists from around the world to create a 'National Geographic' style web series, but this can only be done with backing and community support.So in conclusion without your help and support to fund this ambitious, but exciting project, it will never happen. It is in no interest of Pokemon to do this as they make so much money on the current franchise.So lets take it into our own hands and prove to the world that Pokemon still holds a flame in the hearts of those who grew up with it.Please, help me turn this dream into a reality.Thank you,Joshua Dunlop

I plan to create three coloring books, two of which have sprung into being while I was trying out Kickstarter for the first time with Dance of the Unicorns.Dance of the UnicornsOnce upon a time, a little girl had a dream. She dreamed she could dance with unicorns. As time went on, she realized that this would be a difficult thing to do, unless she could create the unicorns herself.Putting her imagination to work, she began creating a story about meeting a unicorn prince. She refined the idea for many years, growing up and learning how to illustrate along the way. She never forgot that story.The time has come to share this tale, and share the images that have grown along with it. The images are still being created in the modern style of its creator.Fanci CatsCats are beloved world-wide, and the cuter the cats the more loved they become. The Fanci Cats of Cat Osborne's imagination are cute, indeed.The images in this publication are based on the Fanci Cats series of ACEO cards produced by the artist. With over 100 Fanci Cats decorating art cards in the first year of their creation, they have been loved by people of all ages around the world.Horse Breeds from Around the WorldHorses are a beloved part of man's history and appear in nearly every culture around the world. Through selective breeding for specific traits, out landscape is decorated with many breeds of horses, in all colors and sizes.Given the artist's love for equines, it is only fitting that this animal be among the first of her coloring books.A coloring book is a timeless, innocent entertainment, allowing children and adults alike to express themselves. It is the artist's hope that it is also the perfect way to share her childhood dream to be part of the Dance of the Unicorns.This Kickstarter project is to produce three coloring books in both PDF and print formats. Each book is slated to contain 24 plates. Sadly, there is no video equipment available to the artist at this time, but she's working on it to be better able to share with you all.
