INDEX of TERMS:The 100!äóñZak Jones, fantasy artist, will draw 100 originalcharacters (black and white drawings) that will be in an color illustration depicting the Final Epic Battle.Final Epic BattleäóñAt the end of this BookOne willbe the illustration of two factions of 50unique characters each going to battle against the other 50.Co-CreatoräóñThe first 100 backers toinvest $100 (or more) will be given a character generation sheet to define the characteristics of their avatar. The artist will use those choices to create his interpretationof those characters.Zak Jonesäóñ A graphic artist who has designed book covers,game avatars, fantasyfigures, and been a successful artist in acrylics and colored pencil. Zak has exhibited and sold many paintingsat severalgalleriesin Wisconsin.RPG ART Project: The100! - Book One äóñ A book (approximately 120 pages) that will include The 100! character creations, andthe full color Final Epic Battle illustration.How The RPG ARTProject works.ŒæMY DREAM: For years I have worked up to this point, to beable to create a fantasy masterpiece that reflects the gaming experience! My dream has been to really show my talent at first, creating, and secondly, publishing, a tour de force book oforiginal avatars äóñ characters.ŒæMy plan is to draw The 100!Œæfantasy-basedrole-playing game characters with your creative input. I just need the time andbackers who believe in me to bring these characters to life and get thempublished for all to enjoy.The characteristics of The 100! will be selected by the first one hundred backers! The first one hundred donors at the $100 (or higher) level will receive a character generation sheet that will allow them to choose the features of their avatar.ŒæI will begin drawing them in order of nomination.Your choices will guide me in my drawings and make you co-designers. Co-creators will be given credit (unless they wish to remainanonymous) on the characteräó»s page they helped design. I will draw each character by my own interpretation of the completed character generation sheet selected by the co-creators/backers.The Products: A book with each of theThe100!characters co-designed by you and me in addition to prints and originals.Help me design The 100! You build one characterby selecting its traits and abilities on a character generation sheet. Each will have equal chance to be victorious in The Final Epic Battle. Which 50 characters arein which faction, and which faction wins, will not be revealed until the book is published. The lasttwo pages of the book will be a drawing of all hundredŒæThe 100! in the final battle action scene.Through a roll of the dice characters will be divided into two factions of 50 each, who will fight The Final Epic Battle of The 100!I need your help - your backing - to make this magic happen. What will happen with the money? The book will be completed - it takes me about 6-8 hours to design, draw, correct and reach that point that every artist knows well--where you finally feel good about that drawing--one drawing at a time! Then the cover will be designed and all 100 characters (that some of you will help me design)Œæwill be printed into a gorgeous book.ŒæThe first hundred who back at the $100 level (or higher) will be given a character generation sheet to design and co-create a character with me! These are brand new, original, never seen before, quality drawings. Then there will be the final battle scene drawing with all of The 100! in the battle with the winning faction being revealed only in the book upon publishing.I will work 8 hours a day for 100Œædays to getŒæThe 100! RPGŒæoriginal characters completed for printing in the RPG ART Project: The Hundred! - Book One.I am looking towards aŒæBook Two where theŒæcharacters do battle in new drawings, but let's not get ahead of ourselves. I just want to work on these characters. It is my dream...please beŒæpart of it with me!Œæ

"Experiencing The Divine Comedyäó - a ten (10) year project - retells Danteäó»s story as a graphic novel and fantasy art collection. It not only promises a more vivid and more comprehensive retelling than ever before, it promises to take its viewers along a terrifying trip through hell, a fiery tour through purgatory, and a hypnotically beautiful journey through heaven. In this version of Dante Alighieriäó»s story, the readers experience the horrific and beauteous sights as they were described almost 700 years ago.ŒæThe reasons are simple.Œæ1. To date, The Divine Comedy has been fully illustrated by only a handful of well-known artists --  partially illustrated by a little over a dozen. This project will illustrate the entire book.Œæ2. This project will also illustrate everything in the book as described, and more. Dante once wrote in a letter to Cangrande, Danteäó»s host during his exile from Florence, "äó_ at the beginning the subject matter is horrible and frightening because it deals with Hell, at the end happy desirable and pleasant because it deals with Paradise. And the style is low and humble, because it is written in the vulgar language, which is the language used [by all] including women of humble conditions" (xiii, 31).ŒæJust as Dante wanted everyone to understand and appreciate his story, this promises to spare nothing, and portray Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in their vulgar glory.I first discovered The Divine Comedy in my plight to understand angels. My first experience with angels was in 1990-1991 äóñ and to make a long story short, I was pretty convinced that I actually saw the things. But I still wanted to know if I had a simple hallucination or if I had a real experience. And it was through a spirituality catalog that I found a description of Danteäó»s book. So I borrowed the book from my local library to see if what I experienced was described somewhere (anywhere), and in the process of reading it, I fell in love with the story, and decided to illustrate its entirety.Fast forward 10 years or so and a portfolio full of angels later... I stopped drawing around 2005 due to a premature death of a close family member (and a consequential long battle with depression). It wasnäó»t until about 7 years later, or, as Dante would say, äóìIn the Midway upon the journey of our life...äó did I pick up a pencil and pad of paper after my teens challenged me to start drawing again. This was my response to that challenge äóñ a drawing derived from Gustave Doreäó»s Death angel. Gustave not only played a huge role in my love for drawing, he illustrated Danteäó»s Divine Comedy, and upon re-discovering his artwork, my yearning for drawing the story returned. The Divine Comedy is divided into three major parts: Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven. Each part is divided into 33 cantos, or chapters. My intention is to illustrate each canto with its own scene, making the entire project a collection of about 99 scenes (approximately 33 scenes per part). ŒæTo date, I've completed 31 rough sketches of the 1st part of the book (Hell).ŒæAt this point, the project has literally just begun with the bookäó»s 1st illustration. And due to the amount of detail I put into each drawing, it takes me about a month to complete just one illustration, placing this projectäó»s completion date somewhere around 9 years, or, 3 years per part (Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven).There are a few reasons why this project is so important and why it needs your support.ŒæFirst, the story on its own is a timeless masterpiece that makes this project worth the time, money, and effort. It provides a hard-core and sometimes frightening insight into man's own acceptance of what he cannot change (Hell), what he can change (Purgatory), and ultimately, what he could own (Heaven). The entire experience is a vivid adventure of valuable life lessons that beg for visual depiction.ŒæSecond, Iäó»m most certain that illustrating this book on such a grand and graphic scale will generate a deserved re-interest in not only Danteäó»s work, but more importantly, the bookäó»s meaning(s). Reworking the story in a pure, visual manner, and then sharing the results with a generation that might not know this classic poem will help grow and preserve Danteäó»s audience for years to come.ŒæThird, this project makes Danteäó»s story, the vieweräó»s story. Past illustrations of Danteäó»s book almost always portray images of Dante and his guide, Virgil, in every scene. In this project, these two characters are completely removed to emphasize the storyäó»s horrific and beautiful environments along with their events. In doing this, the viewer becomes a visual participant of the story, rather than a simple observer of Danteäó»s story, and ultimately travels along a series of thought processes destined to enlighten judgement of oneäó»s own self and life. Without sufficient support, the project may not be completed. And even if by some miracle it is completed without that support, it wouldn't be finished in the time frame required to circulate within the right circles, generate the right interest, and ultimately, communicate with the right audience. That requires funding for materials, labor, and promotion that I simply donäó»t have at the moment.Funding will pay for art supplies, labor, and advertising over a span of 10 years. It will also pay for web hosting appropriately fitted to provide the projectäó»s video, picture, and textual documentary. For more info, please see this project's FAQ.

Hello, my name is Alex Wakefield and I am a fine artist out of Joliet, IL. My passion and inspiration for my work has been so directly linked with motorsports that it's hard to know which started first. Did my love for fast moving machinery inspire me to create, or did my love for drawing and painting inspire me to make art based on motorsports? Either way, this is what I love, and I hope to make it a larger part of my career. With your help, this is where my Kickstarter campaign can make that a possibility. After a successful show at the Chicago D|Store, I have been invited by the two California D|Stores to show my work in a touring exhibition this August.At each D|Store location, the art exhibit will coincide with that weekends televised MotoGP race. The exhibit dates are as follows: D|Store Orange County - August 16-18 Indianapolis MotoGP D|Store San Francisco - August 23-25 Czech MotoGPŒæ It is up to me to come up with the funding to get me and my art to these locations.I will produce 15 works of art. They will consist of both paintings and illustrated pieces. I have already completed 7 pieces, more than half of the work to achieve this goal, and I will continue to work diligently.I know I have the ability and tenacity to reach my goal. The biggest obstacle will be the financial. The cost of materials, meaning everything from paint and canvas to scanning and print creation, as well as the support costs, such as living expenses and transportation for myself and my work, is going to amount to $5000. Your contribution can help make my goal a reality.I have spent the last year taking the needed steps to build notoriety for my work. I am full of optimism that, with your help, I can build on that investment in my career. My family and I thank you for taking the time to look at my work and listen to my vision.

Greetings And Quick Back StoryHello and thanks for checking out this Kickstarter Campaign for the launch of Vlad's Undead Angels 2014 calendar, holiday cards, posters, stickers, and T-shirts.My name is Jeff Mason and I came up with a line of products centering around great artwork, by myself and/or commissioned for me from great artists I am working with to specifications from my ideas. These designs center around vampires, zombies and other monsters. I want to represent good quality products, that are well detailed, sexy and/or graphically eerie, depending on the main subject. I am releasing these designs under the banner of Enforcer Designs. The name Enforcer Designs is derived from my drumming stage name, Vlad The Enforcer, which led to my services company name Enforcer Webdesign, Video, & Graphics LLC, and ultimately to Enforcer Designs.While working with different artists for Enforcer Designs a style was developed that has became a subdivision called Vlad's Undead Angels. Imagine very attractive zombie girls dressed in different outfits that common fantasies arise from and drawn in a manga/anime style, and you have Vlad's Undead Angels.I actually have the base drawings ofŒæ more than 15 designs, as well as a bunch in my head that I can't wait to bring to life. I then realized as I started to research, that I didn't have the capitol to go to print. I originally thought for the shirts I could go with the type sites that you put the shirt on and if someone bought it they print it and you get a (very) small cut. But when I ordered a few "prototypes" for myself the images were so small on the shirt I felt the designs were not given justice.I started researching and started crunching numbers on what I would need to order as a minimum to make it worth while to go to print with each design, in each print format, while still keeping the numbers low enough for a feasible and obtainable goal. Obviously the more you order the less expensive the products get to print.Vlad's Undead Angels 2014 CalendarI always wanted to do an artistic calendar, and once Vlad's Undead Angels were born I realised they would be the perfect theme for one. There are currently 6 Undead Angels already drawn for upcoming shirts and posters, which I figured would be the starting point for the calender, but as I started researching and planning what would be the featured Undead Angel each month, I decided that we should draw almost entirely new drawings centering more around the months they will be representing. So in the video and images you will see the current finished Undead Angels, and rest assured all Undead Angels in production will look just as good! 6 of the months are currently already in early production, and should be able to at least give you an idea of the main subjects by the end of the campaign. Backgrounds will be added later.That brings us to the costs associated with making a calender. I need to pay the other artists helping out with the project, and the printing costs. This is where the biggest chunk of the money will go as the place I currently am looking to go with will be charging me just over $3000 for the printing and delivery of the calenders. While I could have set this Kickstarter a little lower and just launched the calenders, I figured thereŒæisn'tŒæmuch in the way of Rewards if I only do the calender. So I decided to offer Stickers of each months Undead Angel, and also Christmas, Halloween, Valentines Day, and Birthday cards. All the card and postcard printing, while adding more diversity in rewards, adds another $2056 in printing costs.ŒæSo by going through the costs I pretty much also went through the rewards. The calendars, postcards, and greeting cards, but I also would like to add something limited edition that will only be available for the duration of the Kickstarter campaign. So I am offering 12x12 Stretched Canvas Prints Wrapped on Thick 1.5" Wood Frame, with Protective, Satin Finish Coating of each calender girl. There will be a limit of only 30 per design/month, and once this campaign ends, no matter how many were sold over 0 they will never be offered again. (If none sell at all, I reserve the right to offer it again, if one sells, then that's all there will ever be.)A quick rundown of what I am planning for each month. January, I could have went with New Years, but what costume really signifies that? I decided to use the only currently drawn Undead Angel that will be used in the calendar, which was also the very first one drawn. Kind of a new beginning to represent January. Drum roll.... that being the Cheerleader. ŒæI thought of her for February as that's when the Superbowl is played, but I had another idea for February.February will be an Undead Angel dressed as Cupid for Valentines Day.March will be an Undead Angel in a bunny costume for Easter.April will be an Undead Angel as a Secretary, or to be politically correct, Administrative Assistant for Secretary's Day / Administrative Assistant's Day.May will be an Undead Angel as a Teacher for National Teachers Day.June will most likely be a Graduating Undead Angel as Graduations normally take place in June.July will represent Independence Day / 4th Of July with an Undead Angel wearing Red, White, and Blue and an Uncle Sam style top hat.August will be a Lifeguard Undead Angel representing summer since I didn't see much holiday wise going on in August. I mean what am I gonna do to demonstrate August 13, Left Hander's Day???September will be a School Girl Undead Angel to represent the beginning of the school year.October will represent Halloween with a Undead Angel dressed for Halloween. I really would like to have her dressed as a known Super Hero, but think that would be a copy write issue, so most likely she will be dressed as a devil. Lets face it what other opportunity would you have to see an attractive zombie devil anyway?November will be a Native American Undead Angel, most likely feasting on a Pilgrim, to represent Thanksgiving.December will obviously represent Christmas with an Undead Angel either as a Santa's Helper, or as Mrs. Claus herself, nibbling on Santa. "I Won't Bite" & "You Have The Right" T-Shirts Posters & StickersI am very excited about the first two shirts in the Undead Angels line, "I Won't Bite" and "You Have The Right".Œæ "I Won't Bite"Œæ features the only Vamp Undead Angel so far, but if well received expect to see more! "You Have The Right" features the first Zombie Undead Angel that is ready to go right to print!The money you pledge will go towards the mass printing of probably about 50 shirts, 500 posters and 500Œæ 4"x6" stickers of each "I Won't Bite" and "You Have The Right", and any custom printed canvas' ordered. The money will also go towards packing materials;Œæ cardboard rolls for the posters and bags for the shirts. These too cost money and had to be factored in to what I need. Aside from that the actual shipping costs. Side note even if ordering a shirt and a poster they will be shipped separate to protect the poster.ŒæI am making 4 shirt styles available; men's/unisex t-shirt, woman's jersey, men's long sleeve, and woman's long sleeve. The posters will be 18" x 24" 100lb Paper Glossy Poster. And lastly the special reward that will never be offered again. A numbered 18" X 24" Canvas Print Limited to NO MORE than 100.This limited edition offer is only going to be available during this Kick Starter Campaign, and limited to the number sold during this Kick Starter campaign, and not to exceed 100. So if 5 sell they will say 1/5 through 5/5 respectively on the side or back. If 1 sells then you will be the sole owner of 1/1. Ect.This is the only time this will be offered, so it is very limited and special.I have made most rewards available to be shipped outside the USA as well. Not only is worldwide recognition good, but some of my artists are also out of country. I hope the out of country shipping fees are reasonable to us both as these things are hard to figure. Stretch Goals & Unlockable Rewards!As I already mentioned, I have many designs ready to go that I cannot afford to print. And I have more designs planned which I can't go forward with until I get the others printed. So I have compiled the remaining Vlad's Undead Angels that are currently complete into some Stretch Goals. I hope to get to them but if not now, then later and hopefully we were at least able to get the calendar made.Stretch Goal #1 äóñ Vlad's Undead Angels Street Sign Shirt Shirts (40), Stickers (1000) - $11,000Stretch Goal #2 äóñ Horror Doll Womens Shirts (40), Stickers (1000) - $12,000Stretch Goal #3 äóñ Postcards of the 12 Calender Designs, "I Won't Bite", "You Have The Right", & "Horror Doll" (1000 Each)Œæ - $13,000Stretch Goal #4 äóñ Cowgirl & Nurse Shirts, Stickers, Post Cards, & Posters - $16,000Stretch Goal #5 - $18,000 äóñ Zombie Twins Shirts, Stickers, Post Cards & Posters - $18,000Stretch Goal #6 äóñ 12 Calender Girl Shirt Designs (40 Each) Black Male or Ladies T-Shirts - $24,000Stretch Goal #7 - Remaining 8 Completed Enforcer Designs Shirts & Stickers: "Witches Gathering", "Vamps Feed", "Zombie Girls UnEarth", "Drunken Pirate Captain", "Skeletal Guitarist", "Vamp Calls To You", "BloodŒæBy Torchlight", "The Zombie And The Raven" - $30,000Thanks again for checking this Kickstarter out and I hope you like and find it in yourself to support my vision.

Hello Everyone,Thank you for taking the time to view my page!I am trying to raise money in order to get my story off the ground.So far the story is going along pretty slow, moving at a snails pace. My goal is to raise funds to hire someone that can help me out a bit with the story line and someone who can create the art work.My InspirationI was inspired to come up with a story when my son was born. I thought what kind of adventures will he go on? Will he have imaginary friends that he will play with? As I pondered on those questions, I came up with an idea to create a book, starring, my son, Nathan.The story.The story is about a young boy named Nathan, who has imaginary friends and they go on all these wild imaginary adventures out in the forest. One day Nathan, loses his favorite item while on his adventure and does not realize it until he is already back home. He sets out to find this item, when he becomes mysteriously ill and fall into a deep sleep.His imaginary friends embark on an adventure of their own in order to save Nathan from this mysterious sickness. Along the way they encounter obstacles that test their courage and love for Nathan and finally encounter their mysterious foe.Sound interesting?I think that this book will be awesome. So I ask, please, help me fund my project. I set my goal at a reasonable amount that will help get this story started.This is a labor of Love. A little Something to give to my Son, and hopefully something he can pass on to his children.I'll be posting my rough draft of the story soon on my flikr account. it will be bits and pieces of the story.Thank You for your time,Adam Y.

This Summer, mac birmingham is hosting a special exhibition celebrating the work of Birminghamäó»s best-loved cartoonist Bert Hackett, or Gemini as he was so well-known to readers of the Birmingham Post newspaper. For generations of Brummies, the day didnäó»t begin until theyäó»d had a glimpse of the front page of the Post and enjoyed his clever, cartoon take on the news of the day, along with their cornflakes. Over 40 years, Bert, born and bred in Birmingham, produced more than 10,000 of those cartoons. The show will include around 70 of Bertäó»s works, capturing key moments of political life and popular culture, regionally, nationally and internationally, across the decades. We are asking for a contribution towards the costs of staging the exhibition (printing/ framing/ gallery lighting etc). ŒæIn return, mac birmingham is hosting an event to launch the exhibition and celebrate Bert's 80th birthday on the eve of the show, and all donors are invited. ŒæThere are three levels of rewards: Œ£15 and above buys you an invitation to the launch/80th birthday event and a slice of birthday cake. Œ£100 and above buys you your name listed on the walls of the gallery as an Exhibition Supporter for the duration of the show, a launch/ 80th birthday celebration invitation and a piece of birthday cake. Œ£500 or more buys you sponsorship of a cartoon in the show, and your name will be listed on the walls of the gallery as a Key Sponsor of the exhibition for its duration, and, of course, youäó»ll be invited to Bertäó»s launch celebration and have a slice of birthday cake. The exhibition is going to take place from 29 June to 1 September this year, in the Arena Gallery at mac birmingham in Cannon Hill Park. The launch event will be held on Bert's 80th birthday, 28th June. We need your help now! Please make a contribution and come and join us in celebrating one of Birminghamäó»s best-loved artists. Support us today and please help to spread the word about our show by sharing our project with your friends and family. Letäó»s give Bert a birthday to remember! Thank you for your support.

Classically trained artist, father, husband, friend, longtime geek.Originally from California, I grew up on a steady diet of Nintendo Power Magazine, Schwarzenegger flicks, and comic books. But I'm not just your average geek, I also enjoy Star Wars.I'm still trying to get a straight answer from my mom, but I'm pretty sure I was born with a pencil in one hand and drawing pad in the other. In fact, the worst thing schools ever did was make homework out of paper. Most assignments quickly turned into scenes from a game or comic book.ŒæAfter years of my wife struggling with pregnancy issues, it looks as though we may actually pull through this time! Our little girl is expected in October and we're excited to upgrade so she can have her own room. For this reason, I'm unable to fund this project, as every dime is under close scrutiny!This is where my day dreams went as a child. This is where those dreams run wild still. And this is where I get to find myself lost in my own imagination all over again. Pursuing art.

We're using the art of illustration, screen printing and black light reactive inks to further explore the themes of duality and transformation in the Alice books by Lewis Carroll.ŒæThe goal of this series is to produce sixteen art prints as a collaboration between eight different artists. Each artist is illustrating two prints. One based on a character from the books, and another from a passage of their choosing or one of the original John Tenniel illustrations.ŒæThrough screen printing and the wonder of black light reactive inks, we're developing each illustration into an object with two states: one state in daylight and another, altered state under black light. The end result is a truly unique and curious narrative distilled into each print.Each of the eight contributing artists are excited to see this project happen with help from the kickstarter community. We've spent a lot of time working on these images and this concept to bring it to where it is today.ŒæSee our progress so far and find out more about each of us below.Rebecca Sugar -ŒæAnimator: Cartoon Networkäó»s Adventure Time and creator of Steven Universemore details on "Alice"more details on the "What is the Use of a Book?"Frans Boukas -ŒæIllustratormore details on "The White Rabbit"more details on "The Garden of Live Flowers"Noah Scalin - Artist/Author/Designer creator of Skull-A-Daymore details on "Tea Party Costume"more details on "Drink Me"James Callahan -ŒæIllustratormore details on "The Slaying of The Jabberwock"more details on "The Gryphon and the Mock Turtle"Meg Gandy -ŒæComics Artistmore details on "The Red Queen"more details on "The White Queen"Barry BrunerŒæ-ŒæEditorial Illustratormore details on "The King"more details on "The Walrus and the Carpenter"Matt Deans -ŒæIllustrator, Animatormore details on "The Caterpillar"more details on "Pig and Pepper"Spencer HansenŒæ-ŒæIllustrator, Designermore details on "I Growl When I'm Pleased"details on "Queen Kitty" coming soonAs screen printers and illustrators, we started incorporating UV reactive and glow in the dark inks into our show posters and artwork a few years ago. Instead of emulating the traditional black light poster art of the sixties and seventies, we found ourselves experimenting with more subtle, balanced uses. We remained focused on creating images that were effective in regular lighting conditions, but also featured hidden details that would appear under a black light.ŒæFrans Boukas had been itching to further explore the themes of duality and transformation that are so central to Aliceäó»s experiences in Lewis Carroll's books. When we shared ourŒæexperiments with black light inks and presented the concept of the two states of an image, he realized this was the perfect fit. Straightaway he began pairing fellow illustrators with characters he wanted to see them take on, convincing us what a weird match this alternative style of image making would be for the characters and scenes in the books.Screen printing is a traditional printing method that gives the artist the ability to lay down individual areas of precise colors in a specific order. It has a long, rich history.ŒæThe classic black light posters of the sixties and seventies were screen printed because itäó»s the perfect way to work with these custom fluorescent and UV reactive inks.ŒæWithout screen printing these images don't work. It's the only effective way to create live, tangible versions of these dual images that can be really experienced in person instead of previewed on a computer screen.ŒæOur personal adventures with screen printing have led us to a close partnership with Triple Stamp Press, a skilled and experienced screen printing shop. They share our passion and have poured it into their process. They have the attention to detail, level of control, and taste for experimentation that will be required to take onŒæthe technical challenges of printing this very unique project.ŒæAlso, we share a building with Triple Stamp's shop allowing us to remain intimately involved at every step of the printing process.With your help, we'll finish the illustration, color, and printing of this series of sixteen, limited edition art prints. With a healthy dose of gratitude, we've made the completed prints available as rewards for your support. Many of these reward levels allow you to choose your favorite prints. You'll be able to make this choice shortly after July 15th when we send out the order survey.Pledge $8 -ŒæBLACK LIGHT POSTCARDPledge $15 -ŒæBLACK ALICE BLACK LIGHT BULBTHE COMPLETE BLACK ALICE BLACK LIGHT PRINT SERIESWe feel that together these sixteen prints will provide a full, collaborative dialogue around Carroll's original themes. The series will be offered in custom printed packaging complete with a black light bulb to provide the full experience. For pledging $400 or more you will receive the complete series packaged with the official black light bulb and postcard.ORIGINAL ARTWORKSome of the original artwork is available exclusively to backers. Some originals for the 8 1/2 x 11" prints are available for a pledge of $600. Some of the originals for the 18 x 24" prints are availableŒæfor a pledge of $800. Each original comes with the complete Black Alice print series, postcard and bulb.James Callahan's "The Slaying of the Jabberwock" original artSpencer Hansen's "I Growl When I'm Pleased" original artMatt Deans' "The Caterpillar" original artJames Callahan's "The Gryphon and the Mock Turtle" original artMatt Deans' "The Duchess" original artPledge $1200 - YOUR FAVORITE PASSAGE ILLUSTRATED BY USYou'll receive the complete set, postcard and bulb and discuss directly with one of the following artists which passage, character or related idea from the books you want to see illustrated.Œæ

I like to draw. I've illustrated throughout my life, and I've spent the last decade teaching others creative skills. Kickstarter is a perfect way for me to earn a little money for producing creative work, that I'd otherwise not realistically have resources to produce.This is a simple project which will have baring on some larger scale projects I want to work up to on kickstarter. This is simply illustration that would look good in your home, and a chance to own something not commercially available.I'm looking for just a small amount, as I have no production costs other than my time. If one person ends up funding me, then i'm happy to draw out these illustrations just for them, but if i get a lot more, then obviously this will give me a good start on doing something more adventurous, and it will give me a chance to bring value added rewards to backers of this project.Likewise, if you back me on higher tiers, then you're also covering the costs of materials. But the real thing you're buying is the personal touch, and the care I'll take in crafting something for you.You can see the quality of my digital artwork from my English Rose Digital Artwork project - and whilst this is a traditional illustration set, you can see some of my varied styles and media on my Facebook page.I do hope you find room in your pocket to give a small donation to this project and get rewards well worth the funds you pledge.Thanks very much for having a read through.-MS

I am creating the Portland Tarot deck at a rate of a card per week, with the aim of completing all 78 cards by October 10, 2014, but I need your help to get there.Each card is a stand-alone work of art, created through a process of blending original photography with digital collage to create crisp yet surreal images that visually and tonally evoke my adopted home town of Portland, Oregon.While Portland is the inspiration for this quirky, character-drivenand symbol-rich deck, you donäó»t have to live here to resonate with theenergy of this place or to appreciate it as a backdrop for Tarot. In addition to the unique visual slant of the art, my goal is to create a final deck package that is beautiful and well-designed. I'm KEEPING IT LOCAL and printing the deck in Portland, Oregon.The key design elements of the finished deck I will be printing next year:The cards will be a bit larger than average (3" x 4.75"), allowing for more image while being easy to shuffleThe card stock will be thick enough for lasting use and has a nice smooth texture with a matte coating to prevent glareThe deck will come with a 100 page bookletThe deck and booklet will come packaged in a beautifully-constructed box with a velvety-soft finishThe whole thing will be printed locally in Portland, Oregon where I can personally assure the high standards of the finished product Making a deck is a massive undertaking, but Iäó»m ready! Iäó»vecompleted 10 cards to date, collected a large repository of landmark and accentphotos, and have finished studio shoots for subjects from 16 cards. But I havea lot of work ahead of me to complete the remaining 68 cards that comprise astandard 78 card Tarot deck. Priority One: Print a minimum of 2,500 decks locally and sustainably (including interpretation booklet and box)Priority Two: Get the funds I need for incidental expenses that I come across in creating the art and getting the deck out into the world (equipment, props, costumes, promotion, etc.)With your backing I canget at least 2,500 of the finished decks printed and can have a fund at theready for all the costs I will incur during the creation of the artwork. Each piece takes an average of 40 hours to complete (includingphotographing my subjects, collecting backgroundphotography, and putting together the final illustration) and costs me an average of $50 in various photo shoot expenses. I'm running a Kickstarter now because I need funding to finish making the art (overhead only, NOT for my own time) and I'd rather spend my time making art instead of later running a second Kickstarter to fund the printing. Efficiency!If you want to learn more about my approach, check out The Lovers card process.To get more info about the project and see all theart Iäó»ve completed so far, go to the official web site for The Portland Tarot. DeathDeath represents rebirth, regeneration, and shedding of the old. The subject, Brooke, had a strong connection with the Death card and suggested the day of the dead candy skull makeup. (It's a pretty popular costume choice in Portland for Halloween.) Behind her is the Vista Bridge. I chose to take a colorful, hopeful take on the card in effort to buck the trend of seeing this card as dark and frightening. The ChariotThis is The Chariot, starring my good friend, Tarot muse, and frequent collaborator Cynthia Lopez. (She made my Kickstarter video!) This is the illustration that started this whole project. If you're curious to know more, it's a great story, and you can read it on The Portland Tarot web site.The MagicianThis in-progress card stars my good friend and mentor Lee Moyer. He is a powerhouse of creativity and manifestation in his own right, and it seems even more fitting to have him in the Magician card with a deck of the Portland Tarot within the image, since he is part of the mojo helping bring this deck into the 3D world.The StarThis card features derby player Juvie Hall, with a dual scene incorporating the Hollywood Theatre and the Japanese Gardens, showing the tension between the energy of reaching to express our true self and passion in a world where we are expected to perform.The WorldIn a Portland Tarot deck, well, the World is actually Portland itself. And since Portlandia (the statue) had so many similarities with The World card, I thought it fitting for this card to be an homage to the statue. Springtime is the period in our city when everything seems right with the world, and so I chose a wreath of cherry blossoms instead of the usual laurel.Here are some questions I'd ask if I were in your shoes...78 pieces of artwork? Is she going to actually finish it?There is nothing Iäó»ve wanted more thanto create a Tarot deck. Iäó»ve had a blast so far, and with all the support Iäó»vereceived, thereäó»s no way I will back down!!! I am 100% committed.So, the answer to that question is a resounding, äóìYes.äó The bigger question is, are you going to join me on my journey? I hope so.Do I need to know or care about Portland to enjoy the finaldeck?No! In fact, I am doing my utmost to make sure the deckappeals to a general audience. The city is my muse, but you donäó»t have toknow it to find meaning and enjoyment from the deck itself. The symbols andimagery within will be universal, if more quirky and subversive than a more traditional deck.I've funded other deck projects on Kickstarter. Isn't your target budget a bit high?I realize that I have a higher-than-average target compared to most other card decks funded on Kickstarter, but my parameters are also different than many of them. Between the magnitude of the project (including up-front costs to completing the artwork), the added cost of printing locally (instead of overseas, where most deck companies go), and choosing a printing route of a higher quality, it will take a chunk of change to pull it off. After researching more affordable routes in printing, I strongly believe that taking the high road is the way to go. There is currently no extra room in my budget to put money in my own pocket. Every dollar in my target goal goes straight back into the project.The Made in Portlandia äóìArtsäó»näó»Craftsäó Upgraded DeckThis Kickstarter-only limited editiondeck will be custom-printed on a nicer stock, at a slightly larger size thanthe standard deck. The box will be decorated by myself or another local Portland artist andfinished by me. These decks will be numbered and each one is going to be a totally unique piece of art.Posing as a Card SubjectMany of the people who have posed forcards so far have revealed that their participation proved to be a powerfulexperience, during and after. I am very deliberate about who I collaborate with as a subject for each card,and the person I cast must fit the cardäó»s meaning in some way, either in theirpersonal story, or in the person they are actively working to become. For someof my models the card they posed for served as a totem for them, setting thetone for their chosen inner and outer journeys at the time.If you are feeling called to partake of this reward, then I know in my bones you are meant to be in this deck. I am eagerly anticipating getting to know you!If you choose to claim this reward level, we willschedule a call or meeting so I can get to know your story and more about your current inner and outer journey. Iäó»ll get a sense of your likes and dislikes, working to understand you and yourpersonal style. (This is something I am highly regarded for in my business, asclients often claim I have a special knack for deeply listening and äóìgettingäówho they truly are and what they are reaching for.) From there, I will choose a potentialcard or two for you from those that I have yet to illustrate, on which youwill have an opportunity to give approval. Iäó»ll pitch my suggested design directionto you, but you will also have the opportunity to contribute your own input and insights.Every card I create is a collaborative process between me and my subject.Whatever meditations you bring to the table about the chosen card will flavorwhat I create.Then weäó»ll make plans for the photoshoot, including makeup and hair. Youäó»ll have a luxurious and fun half day of art play in mystudio, from which youäó»ll get a couple of outtake images that youäó»ll be free touse however you like, within a couple of days after the shoot.When the illustration is completed,youäó»ll get a framed and signed 14" x 20" metallic print of the artwork that you canhang up at home, as well as twenty 5" x 7"s of your finished piece to hand out tofriends and family.The entire process is guided byintuition and creative play, and your presence will forever be enjoyed inreadings worldwide. Plus youäó»ll have the beautiful satisfaction of knowing yousupported an artist in creating something truly special that will live on for futuregenerations.High-End Fine Art Deck and Carved BoxThis is a special offering forhigh-level äóìpatron saintäó contributors for this project. This one-of-a-kind offering includes higher-quality print, large art cards äóî each hand-signed by me. I will workclosely with the local marionette artist Geahk Burchill of CastIron Carouselto design a unique wooden box that he will then hand carve. You may also opt toinclude a symbol in the carving that is of personal significance to you. Inaddition to the custom deck and box, you will receive a framed and signed 14" x20" metallic print of your choosing.Rewards That May Require TravelFor folks taking advantage of the Tarot Night or Posing as Deck Subject rewards, it is not out of the question to request that I travel to you. However, in most cases I will not be able to cover this cost out of my own pocket, and we will have to discuss arrangements before you make your pledge. Contact me to discuss your particular circumstances, and we can go from there.  (In the case of the Posing reward, I request that you come to my studio so we can make use of my equipment there, but if you are passionate about being a participant and travel is not possible for you, I am willing to find a way to accommodate.)I am a self-employed graphic designer,web developer, and business consultant, and have been managing my ownsuccessful designand development business for nearly seven years. I moved from Mississippi to Portland in2002. Since I started reading Tarot in 2008, Iäó»ve wanted to makemy own Tarot deck, with ideas for styles, imagery, and specific card slantsthat could meet the needs I had begun to crave in a deck for myself.I bring a huge reservoir of experienceto this project, between my own design and Tarot experience and the incredible support ofmy various team members. If you want to know more about my Kickstarter video or the other people who made this Kickstarter possible, I posted credits on The Portland Tarot website.

Hello People!We are 3 professional artists, united by our passion for caricature drawing.This subtle art embraces our curiosity about human nature and the continuous discoveryof how each personäó»s character becomes visible in his/her features. We believeevery day should begin and end with a smile, so we want to share our positiveattitude by drawing you, your friends and any situation you can imagine. Let theinspiration spread!We want to hand-draw 3 cute, funny and inspiring caricatures each monthfor the whole year (36 in total)These would be sent out to all supporters and published online so they couldspread to generate joy and inspiration to as many people as possible.We enjoy hand-drawing in cute, inspiring and non-insulting style, so thesecaricatures are perfect to share with friends, colleagues and family.Every month we will draw:One Inspiring Caricature that will make wise words come to life!One Horoscope Caricature with a fun horoscope advice and a vivid image forthe sign of that month.One Caricature for the celebration/holiday of that month, which can be usedas a greeting card.In order to produce these we would like to receive your support and for thatwe are willing to do what we do best: draw caricatures for you!WE WOULD LIKE TO RECEIVE PLENTY OF SUPPORTERS, SO OUR ART CAN BE ENJOYED, SHAREDAND REACH PEOPLE OUTSIDE KICKSTARTER!All those who pledge will receive all 36 caricatures throughout the yearIn addition, we will reward you in one of the three ways: For pledges from $1 you can choose to receive our Monthly caricaturescustomized for you and delivered in print quality.From $25 you can choose a caricature to be drawn from your photo äóñ make sureyou find the number of people, types, color or black & white option thatsuits you best. All you need to do is send us your photos, a little descriptionof the people and your suggestion for the caricature. Please check examples of our works below.From $85 you can receive Inspiring, Horoscope or Holiday Caricature of yourchoice which could be featured as one of our Monthly CaricaturesFor bigger rewards we offer caricature book of your life, unique caricaturedrawn with oils, caricature postcard series.Thank you for your support in creating this fun and inspiring project!Examples of our caricatures from your photos:

I want to show the beauty of real everyday people.ŒæMy work has a realistic tone, however I tend to focus and emphasize what äóÖspeaksäó» to me- a glint in the eyes, a crooked grin, or the interplay of light and shadow. I work primarily in graphite but have been known to combine graphite washes with watercolor pencils when the mood fits or the need arises. I want to explore real people right now, and I plan to display this work in a series of shows as well as at a gallery here in Brooksville, Fl.My work could focus on an entire face, head and shoulders, profile, or just a portion of a face. Whatever I feel tells the story best.ŒæI love using graphite pencil because of the timelessness it can add to a story.I want your involvement and input and to give you the opportunity to submit photos (of you, people you know, even a pet!).ŒæSubjects can be any age and the picture should be clear and detailed- profiles, 3/4 profiles, no flash works best. Full on pics do not make for the most interesting drawings.The culmination of this project will be a poster- including 50 of the most interesting portraits from the project- all rewards including posters will be mailed out in November, 2013.Progress will be recorded on my blog. www.bigsillydogstudio.com

Hello, my name is Turrel. I am the Creative Director at Dzxtinkt Originals LLC. Dzxtinkt has partnered with Dave Williams of DaveWill Design to create an unofficialŒæalternative poster for The Help.The duration of this Kickstarter project is 25 days. 25 to honor the 1925 birth of Medgar Evers. He was the first field secretary of the NAACP in Mississippi.After admiring the artwork of Dave Williams from afar for the last 2 years and watching him evolve as an artist, I was deeply honored to hire him for this project. Dave has spent numerous hours illustrating, designing, perfecting and researching this poster.ŒæDave Williams Artist Statement"Illustrating a new poster for The Help was a brilliant experience which I really enjoyed. Here is a little bit of background info on the design of the print. I knew I had to stick to 3 or 4 colours so the poster could be easily screen printed and after watching the movie again a couple of times I settled on the yellow, turquoise, green and white palette that you see above. The inspiration for this came right out of the movie itself, with these colours being repeatedly seen throughout the film. I also wanted to get some stark contrast in the design through the use of black and white as a reference to the themes of race which are central to the story.I noticed upon watching the film that the use of telephones was a recurring theme. Often, news was spread via the central characters calling family or friends as news of Skeeter's book spread across Jackson. This idea formed the outer layer of my design, with a character sitting in each corner of the print based on scenes taken from the movie. I also wanted to ensure that the infamous pie Minnie baked was at the centre of the design, along with Skeeter's typewriter that caused so much controversy. The line 'You is kind, you is smart, you is important' had a big impact on me as I watched the movie so I knew I had to fit that in there somewhere too. Overall the poster aims to display some of the most iconic moments of the film, acting as a lasting reminder to this great movie."Project DetailsThe Help was Kathryn Stockett's first novel. It took her five years to complete the novel. Did you know that it was rejected by 60 literary agents before Susan Ramer agreed to represent Stockett? The novel was later adapted into an Award winning motion picture starring Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Octavia Spencer, Jessica Chastain, Bryce Dallas Howard, Sissy Spacek and Cicely Tyson.In, The Help a young, aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the early 1960s decides to write a controversial book detailing the struggles of African-American maids living in Jackson Mississippi. In the novel, black maids talk about what its like to work for white households and take care of white children.You are probably wondering why we chose to do a poster for The Help. Our mission at Dzxtinkt is to create art that is inspired by under served and overlooked films, books, games, etc. We have become frustrated with the status quo of the alternative poster industry so we made this poster to start diversifying an industry that we are now a part of and we want to shake things up a bit.ThisŒæ24x36 inch posterŒæcaptures the incredible emotion and inspiration ŒæofŒæThe Help. The posters will be beautifully screen printed on thick paper and each print will be hand numbered.ŒæOne poster is $35 and includes shipping anywhere in the US; $45 for anywhere else in the world.Dzxtinkt Originals has attempted to use KickstarterŒæonceŒæin the past. Our first project was not successful so lets make this project a success. I would love for you to be a part of this funding campaign!ŒæA lot of progress has been made to bring poster illustration, a dying art form, back to life, but there is still a lot more work to do. It all starts right here right now with you, with your support. So, come join us. Be distinct. Be original.

My project is all about fun. I have been a freelance illustrator for approximately twenty years, creating images for clients to the specifications that are given to me. The one area of creativity that I thoroughly enjoy is caricature and story book style illustration. Within my project I will illustrate an original portrait image in a crazy caricature style that over emphasizes the subjectäó»s features, while still retaining a likeness of that person or pet. A caricature is very different from a photo, in that it highlights the person in a comedic facial pose. It is not meant to be a realistic portrayal of every detail of that individual. It is meant to make someone smile.ŒæWe will share mutual enjoyment äóñ I will be able to create and share my unique illustrations with you, while you will receive an original hand signed piece of artwork with any pledge of $30.00 or more. For all pledges less than $30.00, one of the unique caricatures created throughout this project will be provided as your reward for pledging for my project.Œæ The images may also be used by me for portfolio purposes and posted to my website.I have paper, pencils and watercolors waiting to illustrate your people and pets. In order to illustrate effectively, please provide hi-resolution (minimum dimensions of 640x480 px), quality photos of the subjects along with any details of the individuals that might be utilized in the final illustration.Illustration sizes of 5" x 7", 10" x 14", and 16" x 20" are all image size. Paper size will be slightly larger. Many thanks to my dog, Mochi, for her commentary.

VintageNblack is a greeting card company I started that for people of color, but has been embraced by all. These cards are a unique expression of the African American experience in America throughout history. I have been selling them at festivals and street fairs the last few summers in Los Angeles. I now want to reach a larger audience and take it to the next level. This is where Kickstarter comes in. I have the opportunity to showcase my cards at The LA mart show coming up in June. The money raised will allow me to set up the booth and produce all the marketing for this show.

Everyone loves a good story. This simple game uses bright, whimsical illustrations as storytelling prompts. Draw a few cards and see if you can "connect the dots" to construct a compelling narrative. It's fun for any age or any number of people."Creativity is just connecting things." äóñ Steve JobsAs a graphic designer, I love to draw äóñ especially wacky, funny cartoons for my kids. I still have a project from second grade when my teacher asked us to draw what we wanted to be when we grew up. Mine was "I want to be a cartoonist." Although I chose a slightly different path in the art business, the passion is still there.ŒæKids love to imitate, so mine make their own humorous drawings. What I began to notice is that every picture included a detailed and pretty entertaining explanation äóñ a full story of what was happening, no matter how random the elements.ŒæThis product idea was born, and I recently made a prototype. My kids have been playing with it ever since and sharing it with their friends. I've been blown away by how much they enjoy it.ŒæAlso recently, I backed a project on Kickstarter and it was a great experience. I thought this would be the perfect platform to share my idea.ŒæA 50- or 60-card "deck" featuring hand-drawn original cartoons of characters, scenic locations, random objects and plot devices. Everything you need to tell a great story. Professionally printed on quality, rigid stock.ŒæMy desire is to create a quality product that you'll love and use. Based on the response I've received so far, I think we're getting there! At this point we're finalizing the "deck" art and packaging plans. Thanks so much for reading about the project. Œæ Œæ

Hi everybody, i'm simply trying to get prints made out of illustrations i've recently been posting on my website and facebook.These illustrations started out as a mirror of my currant relationship with aŒævery dear friend of mine. They represent the many adventures we've been sharing so i feel they can speak to all sorts of people's thoughts and feelings about love and life in this wild world. These illustrations are just a sampling of what i've worked out with my friend but you can bet the Universe that more are on the way!I am represented as Red and he is represented as Yellow.They are the Flower Catchers.Together, the two of these boys explore anotherside of existence, traveling from fiendish meadow to loftus airways, becomingmore connected and disconnected from one another as each of them discoverunique perspectives to strange circumstances.Obviously Iäó»ve grown a sort of obsession with the inner workings of eachday that has remained within my mind of Red and Yellowäó»s relationship, and so Iäó»dsuppose it has grown into a Musing of a relationship.One good day can churn me out a lovely sceneof Red and Yellow dancing in the flowers, and another, maybe moody odd day, candismantle my love and curve thoughts into darker infestations.This project has been ongoing for almost a year now and Iäó»venever been happier.I went to New Yorkand Los Angeles for college but neither worked out, so Iäó»ve been in this slowspiraling decline of äóÖWhat do I do with my art and lifeäó» but now I think Iäó»ve realizedmy passion, and itäó»s pretty much this: to illustrate my life and the Muse Iäó»vecome to adore and sometimes loath.Thesepassed months have been a huge learning experience with living on my own and thensharing my life with another person.Hopefullyyou will see and cherish the fun that can be had in being alive and just doingsomething special with another human being that Iäó»ve been lucky enough toencounter.As the end goal, Iäó»m hoping to get my illustrations allcanvased and put up in a local gallery and make prints forfriends and family and You!This is acontinuing project so of course there will be more illustrations coming withinthe weeks and months and yearŒæthat follow, so Iäó»ll be busy getting those workedout.Also as aŒæanother project, Iäó»ll beillustrating a short story for a childrenäó»s book i've been developing.This is sort of sidebar-ish, but itäó»s going to be an origin story for Trees called the EctoplasmicTree.Haha but thatäó»s a story foranother time, so once I get this project in a gallery, thatäó»ll be my next stepand hopefully get self-published or with a publishing house!!! So life ismoving forward nowadays and I canäó»t wait to see what comes next.Oh, an All the Rewards will be using the ArtWork from "The Adventures of D/P!?!?!?" Tab on my main Website, just so there's no confusion!!!Œæ Thanks for stopping by and hope you can help contribute tomy ongoing adventures of Flower Catching Fun!Oh and for more examples, feel free to head to my website and view the whole of my work at dimasaurusrex.weebly.com Enjoy!

How This All StartedLast year I got cancer and had to under go 7 weeks of radiation and chemotherapy. I am cancer free now but during that time my karate students really stepped up and helped me out.I wanted to send them a thank you card and discovered that there really were not any good options for a card with a martial arts theme. They had silly ones, they had ones with stereotypical sayings (Glad you kicked it!) and very few with kanji. The ones with kanji were very poorly made. The kanji was terrible. It was obviously not done by a real person.It was then that I decided to create a line of greeting cards specifically for martial artists from the perspective of a martial artist. I have been studying karate, kobudo and judo for over 25 years and have the rank of Rokudan (6th degree black belt). So I thought the best place to start was from what I know, Japanese martial arts.The Original SetI created my first set of cards using some the most common sayings, words, and maxims in martial arts. I used things like:I found someone expert in shodo (Japanese calligraphy) to create the kanji (Chinese character set) for each card.ŒæThen I had to find a way to transfer the kanji from paper to computer without losing the brush strokes and the qualities that display kanji as a true work of art. This required a scanner that could do very high resolution scans.Why I Chose This MediaI run my own dojo and am always sending notes to my students. I send welcome notes, congratulations on rank promotions, thank you cards, and various other cards and notes to them all the time.I thought the best way to make these cards available to the pubic was to have them as PDF files that you can download and then print as often as you want. That way you can send a birthday card to very student just by printing it out at home and sending it.Adding PostersThen I thought it would be nice to have the kanji on posters that I could hang at the dojo. But I needed a way to convert the kanji from the scan into a scalable image. This requires special software.You can see by the photo that the character of the strokes is maintained even at 300% zoom.Because the kanji is so flexible and can be created at any size I created 5 poster sizes:I also created international paper sizes in the A series. Each card, and each poster, also has 4 configuration options as explained in the opening video.Where I Am NowThey turned out great and now I want to expand the line with 15 new cards. That's the focus of this project. I want to have the shodo master create all new kanji, transfer them to the computer and build the cards.I need your help to do this. It costs time and money to create the template for each card. As a reward you will get a complete PDF package of one card or more, depending on your support level, as well as other rewards.The New CardsI've decided on the cards I will be producing for this project. There are 15 cards as mentioned above. Here are the titles for them.The 7 Virtues of BushidoHajime - BeginningYudansha - Black BeltToukon - Fighting SpiritIppon - Full PointBujutsu - Martial ArtsBudo - Martial WayBushido - Warrior WayOsu - I will do my bestHayku ren jitoku - Practice makes perfectZanshin - Focused readinessKarate ne sente nashi - There is no first strike in karateDo mu gen - There is no end to learning the wayMushin - no mindSensei - TeacherThese have some great meaning behind them and I have begun creating the write ups for each card. Every card has a paragraph or two describing the card's word, saying or maxim.An example from the card "nana korobi ya oki" or "seven times down eight times up" is shown below:Because the image is small I have written the text below.The literal translation of this proverb makes no sense. You can not get up more times than you go down. But, as is often the case, you must look beyond the obvious to discover the hidden meaning.What we are being told is to persevere. When life knocks you down - get up. When life knocks you down again - get up again.Your martial arts training will give you the fortitude to overcome adversity. As you train, you are told over and over to do it better, do it stronger. Apply this to life and you have the courage and the ability to stand back up again.Backer ChoiceAs backers you will be able to choose which card(s) you want from this list. Please share this project with your friends so we can get the word out about it. I would love be able to offer these cards to all martial artists.Arigato!Thank you for taking time to review and support my project. With your support I can advance this project and offer more cards to more martial artists around the world.Please tell your friends about this and share it with them. As martial artists we are all family.

The Drok Days Anthology started as an outlet for my suburban frustration, and as a way of coping with nightmares.Œæ The anthology will consist of a professionally printed book of paintings of twisted characters, narrative text, and Hip Hop Poetry.Œæ All telling the story of a tormented young man interacting with a world of demons, aliens, living graffiti, and a city hellbent on self destruction.I am raising funds to self publish the Anthology.Œæ The funds raised will go directly to printing the books as well as creating promotional materials to send to publishers.Œæ I face the challenge that all self publishing authors and artists face, chiefly funding.Œæ Without the help of Kickstarter funding the Anthology will likely not receive a wider audience.After funding is secured, a limited run of prints will be created to send to investors as well as publishing houses.Œæ Funding will also be used to secure protection for the legal rights to the Drok Days properties including character images, text, and names.
This project probably started because i haven't been watching my

column1: fair share of cartoons. i heart drawing and
playing with ideas like food. i am raising money to fund this project so
there isŒæ public awareness that contrary to popular opinion butter is
tough. Don't not be fooled by 'common sense'. Enjoy the Absurd. and i
would like to contribute reminders approx. the size of postcards. i will
post the cards as they are done.

column2: This project is to have these strange and adorable illustrations printed as stickers on clear vinyl. I've been making them by hand for the past few years and they sell well, it's time to have them professionally screenprinted and die cut. I'm going to get 500 stickers made of each image.ŒæYou can and will want to stick these vinyl stickers on every surface:Stick them all over everything!You can take a look at some of my handmade stickers on lilseamonster.etsy.comThank you for checking out my project!

Hi, I'm James LaVigne. Being one of Spokane's more successful, well-known fine artists for the past 40 years, you're probably familiar with my work, although you may not be aware of that fact, unless you live in the area.I've had a fascination with the incredible architecture of Gonzaga University since my early childhood, and the beautiful, enormous landscapes with the powerful Spokane River cutting through them.To capture the dynamic campus, students and beautiful landscapes, and with Gonzaga celebrating 125 Years, it seemed fitting to commemorate this historical moment with an Art Show of exceptional quality art images for April 2014, which I will create over the next 12 months.ŒæThese 12 intaglio etchings will look as they were created three centuries ago by a master's lyrical, free-flowing hand.ŒæIntaglio printing is an art form dating back to the Old World Masters and is practiced today by only a very few true craftsmen with the talent, skills and specialized equipment necessary for the process.ŒæThis will be a rare and exclusive opportunity, making this limited edition run of intaglio prints extremely valuable.ŒæJoin the venture and own part of this commemorative project celebrating Gonzaga University's rich legacy.Cut off date will be April 30th, so that I have the time necessary to produce this exceptional show.Investors at the $900 level or more will receive a personal tour of the James Franics LaVigne's Studio and an etching demonstration when they take delivery of their etchings (air fare, food and lodging not included).Link to KSPS TV (Public TV Station) video on Northwest Profiles. http://video.ksps.org/video/1954364222/ This 7 minute video has Charlie Hinton from the Wm Grant Gallery & Framing and has Karen Mobley, 15 years as Spokane City Arts Director on it commenting about my work and me. (This link works fine on my laptop, but no so well on my iPhone. KSPS TV video is also viewable on my website).Museum Quality Framing is also available:  $75.00 per 8"x10" frame: Museum glass, spacers to keep the etching away from the glass and acid free backing. You may choose from either a 1" Burl wood from Italy or a 1" black beaded Hogarth frame. Framing of the posters is not available. Add $15 for shipping per frame inside contiguous US and $25 for overseas delivery. These orders will be filled by Wm Grant Gallery Œæand Framing.FundsŒæŒæSome of the funds will be used to bring my etching press and other related equipment up to premier level, so the etchings will be of the finest quality possible. I'll also need to purchase the Arches 100% rag paper, which is considered to be among the finest papers in the world, especially crafted for fine art production of etchings. The balance of the funds will cover the cost of a printing assistant to help me with the printing process.ŒæThe ProcessŒæ For those wishing to be bored out of their minds; you might want to grab a cup of coffee to stay awake during this.ŒæWell, if you'd like to know how the process works, the etchings will be created from very detailed & delicate drawings, drawn backwards, with a stylus, through beeswax on a zinc plate in the manner of the Old World Masters (and on top of that, the lines are not black but shiny silver (fresh, shiny zinc) with unlined areas dark brown (wax) which makes it even harder as it is  with the image flopped (image is backwards) and in reverse (black is shiny silver and white is dark brown). Intaglio etching lines can be very sublime, subtle and subdued, carrying emotion & feeling, and also record the sometimes heavy lines, which in combination with the light lines reflect the artist's perception of people, landscapes in the distance, structures and air (very delicate and faint)- atmospheric conditions, clouds, etc in which etching lends itself, together with the plate tone. This is achieved by the length of time each of the lines is bathed in the acid. Stronger, more powerful lines are bitten (etched) longer. After each intaglio etching plate is drawn and bathed in acid, it is then heated on a plate warmer, rubbed with ink using a dabber to force the ink into the grooved lines, then wiped with tarlatan lightly, leaving a plate tone on the unbitten portion of the plate. The plate is one of the reasons each etching is considered an original print, as each is slightly different. Then the wet heavy etching paper, which has soaked in a water bath for sixteen hours, is blotted to remove excess water and placed over the warm plate on the press bed. It is then covered with three felt blankets and run through the press. The blankets are removed and then the paper (8"x10") is "torn" from the plate (it actually sounds like it is tearing). This is done slowly as it needs time to release, and wallah (or Voila) - you have an etching! However, we're not done yet. It takes three or four days to dry the etchings, rotating the blotter paper every twelve hours, to prevent foxing later (mildew or fungi spotting), and carefully replacing the weights which prevent the etchings from curling. You must not be too heavy with the weights, as you want to see the emboss from the plate. The "plate mark"  is one of the ways to determine whether an etching is truly an authentic or original work of art.  Now you now the facts behind true "etchings", so when someone invites you up to see their etchings, you'll know your stuff.Thank you for considering my project. James LaVigneStudioEvery artist needs space to work and I found one this one 22 years ago that meets most of my needs- big enough (2,750 sq ft), centrally heated with air conditioning in the heart of Downtown Spokane, WA.SEVERAL OF MANY SUCCESSFULLY PRODUCED ART PROJECTSThe Spokane GrandfatherThe original sold for $30,000 and I located five Sponsors at $22,500.Courthouse Tower PrintCourthouse In BlueBFA show at Avant Guarde Gallery Fort Wright College 1980Spokane City Hall Show in conjunction with The National Trust for Historic Preservation. It ran October though December 2012. This picture is about half the show.Fox Theatre Show in Founders Gallery and lobby March 4, 2013 with the Gonzaga Symphony Orchestra and piano soloist Caroline Hong.

I have the ideas, and the hand, but not the tools, and little funds, so this funding would help me to put in place all theŒæpractical ground work necessary to see this project through.If I do attract the necessary funding I intend to produce several eBooks within the first twelve months, and establish an online presence to promote them. I will keep all backers notified with regular updates.Thanks for your time.Simon

Georgia And Nathan will be a graphic novel which explores one AmericanŒæsouthern family's challenge and denial in dealing with a hidden truth about one senior family member's involvement in the Holocaust as a collaborator with the Nazis in the Warsaw Ghetto. It is told through the eyes of that family's twenty year old daughter, Georgia, who has to confront the fact that her hero, her grandfather, who she has worshipped all of her life, is not whom she thinks he is. This is a story about casting off the demons of one's past and learning to let go of one's prejudices and being open to change, in your heart and in your mind. And, it is also about learning to forgive.ŒæI have already written the script for the graphic novel. I am raising funds so that I can hire a team of comic book / graphic novel illustrators to create the art illustrations for the book. Than I intend to approach publishers or to self publish the work myself.I have also written a screenplay for "Georgia And Nathan" and my intention is to develop that into a feature film which I plan to direct.When one examines the available content in the graphic novel or comic book industry these days, there is a limit to the availability of work that examines significant historical events. It is my hope that this graphic novel, which focuses on denial of the Holocaust, might be embraced by children, young adults and beyond so that it's readers may learn about denial and forgiveness, especially when the stakes are so high as to threaten the very existence of a family's structure.

About the bookAs a caricature artist I'm often asked the question 'Can I learn to do that or is it a natural born talent?'. Truth is, I couldn't draw them when I was born so I guess it must have been what I like to call 'The 4 P's'.When I was a kid there weren't too many books on the subject of caricature, and there certainly wasn't any internet to try and find the information I needed on the subject. It was only after years of practise and hard work that I started to feel I had begun to figure out some of the techniques for drawing people in an amusing way. If I had access to the amount of information we have now back then, I certainly would've improved a heck of a lot faster. So why make this book? Well, firstly I love to teach, and I love to draw. Secondly, I totally appreciate how frustrating it can be to try and learn something on your own, so with this book I'm hoping that budding caricaturists can learn the techniques quicker and easier.The FormatThe format of this book is very simple. The beginning chapters deal with the basics needed to start caricaturing. Starting with simple shapes and learning to see facial features in a simplified form, we can take out some of the complexity and confusion of drawing faces and approach each new picture with confidence. And have fun at the same time! I thought a great idea would be to have some lucky readers have their very own caricature of themselves drawn in the book, along with tips on how I drew them. What a great way to learn and have a memento of your personal pledge to this book! In general, the book will contain a wide variety of subjects to study from and learn the art of caricature.It's my hope to make this book as detailed and informative as possible, and the best way to do that is to have as many demonstrations as possible for you to study from.Digital caricaturesThe book will also include a section on digital caricatures. I will show you to sketch, ink and colour your caricature work in popular design software.So much content!!!As well as learning the art of caricature and how to create digital caricatures, I will also include a section on taking a caricature portrait into Toon Boom's 'Animate Pro' software and show you how to animate it with lip syncing to an audio track. How many other caricature 'how to' books offer this many techniques! ŒæThis is a technique that is useful for advertising, email greeting cards and personal animation projects!RewardsThere are many reward schemes available for this project. You can be in the book as one of the featured caricatures and there are various options available. A great Œægift for a budding caricature artist might be to give them this digital book as a gift. Imagine their surprise when they flick through and find themselves on their very own page!ŒæEither way, it's a great way to support this project and become such a huge part of it at the same time.Where does the funding go?For any creative project the main issue is time. With your support I can put this project ahead of everything I have to do and deliver the best quality product possible and earlier! I have already made a start on this book and I would love to give it my undivided attention so this is where the funding will go!
