The Death of Small TownsSlowly and methodically the American small town is being eliminated, from our hearts and minds and our everyday reality. The types of stores, the types of goods and services are being erased from our collective conscience. Because of this the occupations that those business's supported are also disappearing. Food and food stores have changed, the small Ma & Pa groceries are few and far between, hanging on by a thread.the family hardware stores are all but gone. Shoemakers (cobblers) coppers, travel agents just to name a few are all but gone. So many occupations and trades are gone.Œæ With this project I intend to keep these occupations, trades and business' remembered. We should realize what has been and is being lost.The project will be a collection of approximately 35 paintings depicting the various business/occupations that have and are being lost. Made into a book, then original works will be exhibited as a traveling show. It is my hope that you will support this project help stop the destruction of small town USA.

Are you a Jazz junkie? Are you a fan of Billie Holiday, Charlie Parker and Chet Baker? Junkies?Œæ Collectible art prints? Cool French absinthe drinking cats?Œæ I love them all and have spent countless hours producing what I hope is the first in a series of limited edition prints.Œæ On certain Jazz discussion boards the title of my prints has become controversial, so please allow me to explain my intentions: Œæ I am not trying to glorify addiction---I'm lamenting it... These prints bear testament to my intentions and are a protest not for, but against junk addiction.These 3 prints were designed as a triptych (see image below), but look great alone and are available for individual purchase.ŒæŒæWhat is a triptych and why as a triptych?Œæ According to Wikipedia,"The triptych form arises from early Christian art" and the why is that my prints are clearly meant to have religious significance.Œæ A traditional triptych might look like this:In my prints, Charlie Parker is compared to the Buddha and the text extracted from "Mexico City Blues" is quite obviously a prayer to Charlie Parker--A prayer for forgiveness.ŒæŒæI also put a halo behind his head to make my intentions clear.ŒæŒæSo, we have Charlie as god--Buddha-- as the center panel, flanked by the other parts of what forms a holy trinity.Notice that both the heads of Chet Baker and Billie Holiday are at the same level, which is significantly lower than Charlie Parker's as traditionally triptychs had a larger center panel.My intention was to take culturally iconic images and give them back, or give them, their proper iconic significance(in the true religious sense of that word), ..by framing them as strictly religious pieces.These prints were designed to be issued as a collectible hand-signed and numbered limited edition.Œæ Only a maximum of 100 of each print will ever be printed and only 99 will be available for sale, as I really would like to keep 1 set for myself.Why these three Jazz greats?Œæ Frankly, they are among my favorite Jazz vocalists and innovators. Each of whom eventually was to succumb to the very same demons which perhaps allowed them to reach new pinnacles in their respective forms.Œæ By carefully selecting fragments of lyrics from some of my favorite songs of theirs, and in the case of Charlie Parker, letting Jack Kerouac's famous elegy (Charlie Parker died on Kerouac's 33rd birthday), referenced here, tell the story, I think I've succeeded in visualizing the beauty and tragic dichotomy of their lives.Œæ My goal was to make the prints as musical as possible, with text and images that swirl and swing, telling the tales of their too brief lives.Œæ Look closely and listen.See larger view HERE:See larger view HERE:See larger view HERE:After an extensive and exhaustive search for the ideal printer, I chose Continental ID out of Sparta, MI.Œæ For over 75 years, this incredible company has provided excellence and is world renowned for having printed Stephen Frykholm's Herman Miller picnic posters from the 70äó»s, 80äó»s and 90äó»s. As a company, their printing services are in high demand.Œæ Happily, they have agreed to produce these prints for me and will make their services available to get the prints out as promised.Œæ I live in California and the shipping costs alone are considerable, but I've elected to go with the best.Excalibur, the cat, 6"x 4" postcard:Should the funding exceed the goal by 10% or more, all backers will also receive a 'so cool' 3D lenticular postcard as my personal thank you.Lenticular postcard link:I already have my next series in mind--It will be called, "The Father, Son and Holy Goof" and will be another triptych of 3 of my favorite Beats: Jack Kerouac(father), Allen Ginsberg(son) and of course Neal Cassady as the holy goof.Œæ I can't wait to get started on that project, so implore everyone you know to get this funded asap.Love and kisses,Excalibur and Kamiblue

Hi, my name is Tim Flanagan, I'm a simple story teller. I have written two Sci-Fi / Fantasy / Adventure books for Teens and Young Adults in a series called The Moon Stealers. The third is due to be released in April, followed by the fourth in December 2013 and an Omnibus edition in 2014. I am looking for support in funding some unique artwork for the covers of the books by an incredibly talented artist (selection of his artwork is on this page).But first, I'm sure you want to know a bit more about the books.The idea for The Moon Stealers arrived unexpectedly one morning in the bathroom. My son, who enjoys sharing the only peaceful time I get to truly be on my own, randomly asked me to tell him a story. James has a great imagination so I knew that only a wild and exciting story would amuse him (plus there had to be some form of death and destruction in it.) So I randomly said, äóÖHave you heard the one about the Moon Stealers?äó» and the seed of imagination began. During our time in the bathroom, we threw loads of ideas at each other and concocted a sort of story for the Moon Stealers. I decided to start writing it down, not really knowing where it was going, but as I started to write I found that the ideas seemed to organically grow by themselves and the story grew into something much bigger than we first thought. The Moon Stealers series tells the story of an alien bacteria that lands on the Earth inside a meteor. As it evolves and grows it becomes a serious threat to civilisation. At the same time, a group of children unknowingly hold the key to saving the planet, whilst attempting to rescue one of their friends from an ancient portal that leads to another world.If you follow this link it will take you to my blog which contains an interactive book shelf where you will be able to read sample chapters of the first two books. The first book was released in June 2012, followed by the second in September 2012. To date over 4,000 copies have been sold. With the release of the third book imminent, I wanted to create a new branding for the series that would be more appealing to a younger audience. Having such a strong visual image on the cover is instantly appealing for children who, more often than not, do actually 'judge a book by its cover.' Eye catching cover art will help drive sales as well as provide a visual aid when presenting it to script writers and movie studios. The books would also be great to turn into graphic novels (but that's another project!)Please donate what you can so that this project can get off the ground. The funds will buy 4 pieces of artwork that will be produced based on a scene from each of the books. A 5th will also be created for the Omnibus edition of all four books. Everyone who kindly donates, no matter whether it is Œ£2 or Œ£2500, will have their name forever immortalized in print as a 'Kickstarter Supporter' within the acknowledgements section of all four books, as well as the omnibus edition.Please join me on this adventure and be part of something special from the very beginning. Thank you.Note : If the goal is exceeded then the additional money will be put towards getting another cover done for a new book due for release in 2014 called - 'Doctor Gabriel Grey, the finest Dragon Slayer in Westminster.' It's a book about Dragons in London in the 1600's

Most of us work jobs we hate to buy crap we donäó»t need. Why do we need to buy something to feel happy? Because we feel incomplete, or because society told us we need this or that piece of crap.ŒæIäó»m not saying things are crap äóñ but our need to buy things in order to feel good is stupid. What advertising does is make you feel like shit just because you donäó»t have what theyäó»re selling äóñ so you buy it. They just brainwash you. This doesnäó»t mean you shouldnäó»t buy anything, it just means you should buy things just because they told you so. Buy thing that you really need and love, think before you spend your money on bullshit.ŒæŒæSo many people are in debt and canäó»t get out of it äóñ why? Because they were stupid enough to spend money they donäó»t have. Buying things wonäó»t save us, it wonäó»t solve your problems in life. You have to look inside and understand that you can have a great life, that you can enjoy every single day. You just have to make a choice.Each and every one of us has 24 hours every day, itäó»s upon you what you will do with it. Life can be so much better, if only you set yourself free and deleted all those limiting beliefs you have.ŒæThis is the first step of a bigger project , which will combine products of mass consumption, objects and human being in a unique and ironic way.Screen print will be available for free from my website, signed and numbered .Thanks for time and consideration.

What are nice notes? They are a customized card that I will mail anonymously to your friends, co-workers or family members who you think needs something to simply cheer them up. I guarantee that the cards I send out will look great, and the person on the receiving end will know that someone cares for them. Everyone could use an extra smile or two throughout the day :)How does it work?After backing my project, I will email you a brochure of all the different styles of cards to chose from (three examples shown below - we will have at least 10). All you need to do is send me the name, address and the awesome compliment, or letter of gratitude that you want to send, and I do the rest. I print the cards, stamp and address the envelope and send it off! Want to have an inspirational quote as well? I will send ideas or you submit your own! Guaranteed to make someones day THAT much better.Where did this idea come from?It all started when my roommate received an anonymous note one day simply stating: "Hey, you are awesome!" My friend then proceeded to carry a huge smile on his face the rest of his day. I thought to myself: "Why can't everyone have the chance to receive a nice, anonymous note?" Hence, Nice Notes.Why Anonymous???When you receive a plate of cookies from the Jones family, you think: "oh that was nice." You eat the cookies, and forget about it. When someone doorbell ditches a plate of cookies, the thoughts and gratitude last days longer, because you are stuck dwelling on the situation: Someone out there cares for you. Who could it be? Send an anonymous Nice Note!Three (of the ten!) examples of how your 100% customized Nice Note can look!There are two things that I love about these Nice Notes.Œæ1. They work!Œæ2. You feel good, and they feel better.ŒæThere is no easier way to serve your neighbor, than by sending a simple, yet beautiful Nice Note to a friend in need.ŒæThanks for making this idea a reality!

The goal of this campaign is to complete the 50+ images needed to expand The Stolen Child Tarot into a complete 78 card tarot deck, create a companion guide ebook and produce an independent print run of decks comparable in price and quality to current commercial decks.**As little as a $5 pledge gets you a copy of the companion E-book!**The Stolen Child Tarot is a project conceived by illustrator Monica Knighton (me!) and was inspired by the William Butler Yeats poem of the same name. ŒæThe key inspiration came from the refrain:äóìCome away, O human child!To the waters and the wildWith a faery, hand in hand,For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.äóInitially, the deck began on a smaller scale, as a Major Arcana deck to be produced as a limited edition artist portfolio.  A previous Kickstarter project accomplished this goal, even allowing extra funding for upgrades in paper and a unique woodgrain and leaf paper portfolio.  You can visit the original funded campaign here:I was completely blown away by the response to the artwork for this project!  Lots of people have asked me about expanding the deck, and lots and lots of people on message boards, forums, etc have said they love the art, but they want/need a full deck at the price of the commercial ones out there.Œæ...But here's the rub...Publishers don't pay an advance on tarot art.  The other tarots I've done, Tarot of the Dead, published by Llewellyn and the art for The Healing Tarot, coming out this year with Schiffer was all produced on spec.  What's spec?  It means you make the art and then you get paid months, even years later, if there's enough in royalties.  ...Or as I like to put it, if you want to  live, you'll need a time machine to buy your groceries.  To give you an idea of the upfront workload, if it takes you about a week to research, rough, pencil and paint a card, you can multiply that times 80 (78 cards + titles/cardback) and then there's the guidebook... um, let's just say it's A LOT of work to do on spec!  A little more on that later...Currently, with the Major Arcana complete, what remains to expand this deck into a full tarot are the 50+ remaining Minor Arcana cards, and 4-5 new paintings for the card back design, title cards and box design äóñ all of which I hope to complete in the same quality and detail as the Majors äóñ and the writing and formatting of an expanded guide book.Very much like the Majors!  As with the original images, this deck is still a return to nature with no man made objects included and many traditional symbols re-envisioned with natural objects.  I've provided some samples of completed Minors in the video and some inks below.The suits would be:Oak (Pentacles) represented by the acornZephyrs (Swords) represented by the feather blown on the windBrine (Cups) represented by the shellsFlame (Wands) represented by the tongues of fireI also have some conceptual themes that would cross suits of the Minors, for example, the two's will explore balance in nature by featuring animals that have become extinct.Unlike the Major arcana edition, each image will include titles and numbers on the standard tall tarot-size coated stock with rounded corners.The final product would be a full 78 card deck and 2 title cards in a matching tuck box and a downloadable PDF guide book that includes thumbnails of each card for easy identification.  I've researched printers and found a reputable one whose product I feel is equal in quality to the decks produced by commercial publishers.  Does the funding goal seem like a lot?  I won't lie äóñ it feels like a moonshot to me...  But the budget is also pared down to the minimum.  And honestly, I don't have the resources to do this project on spec.  This project is truly a test to see if there's audience out there for this work and a chance for you to employ an artist!  (At fast food wages I might add!) ŒæI want this to be my job for 2013. ŒæWill you hire me?March äóñ November 2013: complete artwork and rough draft of guideDecember 2013: pre press work/prepare images for printerJanuary 2014:Œædeliver images and proof approvalFeb -March 2014: complete ebook guide while decks are at printersMarch 2014: schedule completion party and begin shipping rewards.This campaign will cover a 2000 deck print run, and ALL of those decks will need to be spoken for in order for the project to hit it's goal. ŒæWhat does that mean? ŒæIt means if you want one, you need to support the campaign! ŒæIn addition to completed copies of the deck, I'm offering a lot of one of kind and unique rewards for this project too! ŒæI'm in the process of designing a laser cut 2-3 inch lapel pin with imagery from the deck and text from the poem -- This will only be available through the campaign!Œæ Œæ There's also an opportunity to place your own totem animal within the deck and many pieces of original art available. ŒæOn a budget? ŒæThe ebook will have all images from the deck and expanded meanings and interpretation notes!Kickstarter is an "all or nothing" funding platform -- if a project doesn't reach its goal before the campaign ends, no money changes hands. The payment goes through Amazon and your card does not get charged until the campaign reaches its funding deadline. Œæ(March 16th.)If you pledge, during the campaign you can edit that pledge at any time - increase it, decrease it, cancel it. ŒæIt's very flexible. ŒæThere are all sorts of different pledge levels where you can receive different rewards - so you can think of it as a sort of pre-sale, however if the funding goal isn't met, just as no money changes hands, no rewards are sent.Short answer? No.The object of this campaign is to see if there's enough interest to bring a complete Stolen Child Tarot into the world. ŒæI wish I could say that I have some extra resource that would allow me to do it anyway, or do it in my free time, but I don't. ŒæMy first priority is to do whatever work I can to pay the bills. As an artist, I have a lot of different ideas I'd like to develop, so I feel testing ideas on Kickstarter is a good way to make an informed choice of where to put my energy. ŒæUm, so that's my roundabout way of saying, nope, if the goal isn't met, I'll need to move on to another project.I would love to increase the print run! ŒæRight now the goal covers just production for Kickstarter rewards. ŒæWe would need to raise $3000 beyond the current goal to increase the print run, which would allow me to offer the deck at shows, in my etsy shop, and some other online outlets.Pretty dang cool.  Seriously, you will hear your coats fighting in the closet over whose lapel it goes on.  They will be made by my friends at Ink It Labs.Whew!Did I miss something? ŒæPlease, drop me a line and I'll add it to the FAQ!Thank you so much for viewing my project, supporting my art and helping to spread the word!Check out below to see some of the art and pledge rewards!

The "Rise of the Animals" is a showcase of some of Mario's most recent works and to help raise public awareness about Autism and Aspergers.ŒæOriginal framed artworks and limited high-quality prints will be available for purchase.

After reading Execute by Drew Wilson and Josh Long, I have started a project:ŒæIn one weekend (this weekend) I will go from not even knowing how to use the pen tool to being a master of Adobe Illustrator. Starting on 1 April 2013, I will use those new-found skills to release two illustrated posters every monthäóî$20 each, and $30 for a print & digital download.ŒæThis is my first time ever using Adobe Illustrator.ŒæFrom zero to hero. That's the plan.You can view some of my progress on my Dribbble feed atŒæhttp://dribbble.com/nivedred.Thank you for viewing my project!

Our goal at Secret Sauce is twofold, to produce a line of high quality clothing, screen printed with a range of unique illustrations and along with that to produce and sell works on behalf of other aspiring illustrators along with creatingŒæa thriving online art community. Basically Œæwe want to make exciting and unique clothing for you to wear and to provide a place for the more artisticŒæamongŒæyou to get yourselves out there and doing what you love.ŒæUnless we meet our funding goal, unfortunately we will not be able to produce our clothing or create an online art community so please support our project.We are offering a set of t-shirts that are unique, fresh and hosting high quality illustration designs along with a host of other creative bits 'n' bobs for you to enjoy. Not only are they 100% organicŒæcottonŒæ they come packaged in a box hosting further illustrations along with a funky label. We even offer a choice of female or male fits to ensure that your t-shirt fits you in the best way possible.We have at least five designs available for our t-shirts, however should we exceed our goal we will produce further designs for you to choose from as a thank you.ŒæCurrently we have the following designs available as rewards!Every detail is important and this shows through the attention given to the packaging and overall finish of the products we hope to deliver.Our collection of six funky pin badges!Our high quality prints come in two sizes for you to choose from, hosting the designs from our t-shirts on our smaller A5 prints and three unique gouache paintings which will features as A4 prints.ŒæOur unique mug is a tribute to the gaming influence in some of our works, hosting a designŒæinspiredŒæby blocky builders, we hope it will appeal to gamers and fans alike!Alfie Phillips is an artist and illustrator, growing up in rural Devon Alfie derived most of his influence from his childhoodŒæexperiencesŒæfrom video gaming to spending time outside in the garden playing around with insects but also reading nature books and day dreaming.Steven Bailey sprouted in rival Dorset. A talentedŒæmathematicianŒæstudyingŒæat University, he handles all the number crunching with a breeze! Day to day tasks include drinking tea and occasionally browsing spreadsheets.ŒæBilly Grant also grew up in Devon. Having always had a keen eye for opportunities he likes to think he knows a good deal when he sees it. Currently reading politics atŒæuniversity he often sees himself as the diplomat of the team.We all attended the same secondary school down to the same class, and have remained friends ever since. This has graced us with a team Œæthat has a unique understanding of each others strengths and weaknesses.Alfie has always wanted to get his work out in the open for people to see and enjoy and what better a platform than t shirts and clothing in general. As long as he has owned t-shirts he has wanted to produce his own and so after talking to a friend one evening that had business experience the seed for secret sauce clothing was sown. A few more friends and skill sets later here we are, the secret sauce clothing team headed by Alfie Philips, Steven Bailey and Billy Grant. To get to this stage hasn't been easy and as with all projects as complex as this we had to overcome challenges, if it was not for the group effort and mix of skills this would have been even more challenging.ŒæSo as part of our future goal we will create a way we can help other aspiring illustrators sell their work. We hope that through our clothing we can help create and grow an online art community that will organise and promote a whole host of community art projects helping aspiring artists to promote their work.Note: Your specific choice of designs will be handled in the order survey, which we'll send after the campaign ends.Œæ(If you should wish for a custom package of rewards, please just message us and we will be happy to arrange this for you)We do ship some of our rewards to the United States, should you have any queries about this then please message us.We aim to ship your rewards a month after our project ends, and we will keep you up to date with all developments in this area. Steven and Billy haveŒæexperienceŒæin running a business before and so producing, packaging and shipping your rewards should be made that bit easier!

Our StoryŒæMy little "big" Brother Cristian is a freshmen in High School, enjoys journalism, and he is interested in going to college. He is in the process of getting a better grasp of journalism and understanding exactly what it is. I am a Architecture Major at the University of Oklahoma and will be studying in Rome for the 2013 Spring Semester. I feel the best way to learn is through experience and seeing something with your own two eyes.My ProjectŒæMy younger brother was inŒæamazementŒæabout my stories andŒæexperiences I had on my recent study abroad trip to Europe this past summer and shows much desire to do the same. He is a Freshmen in High School and hasŒæambition to become aŒæjournalist. SoŒæMy ProjectŒæon his behalf is to get him to visit me when I am in Rome next Semester studying and help him write a journal about hisŒæexperiences in Rome, about culture and newŒæenvironments. He is a very smart kid and I feel that this would help him see the world in a different light and capture this imagination. At the moment heŒæbelievesŒæjournalism only consist of Sport Center, so my goal is to open his mind to the world through first handŒæexperiences. This journal is a great way for him to see that the world is full of many unique people and stories. He will talk toŒæstrangers, ask them questions Œæabout their lives, and not to mention in another language. This project will capture his mind at a young age and guide him for the rest of his life.Your FundingYour Funding will help with the airfareŒætransportation to Rome for my younger Brother, a journal, small notepads, and other supplies for him. Your funding is key to the opportunityŒæhappening for my younger brother. I will already be in Rome due to student loans, when he is to come visit me during his spring break. Then we will both travel in Rome and around the area so he gets the fullŒæexperiences given he has never been on a plane orŒæabroad. So this will be for sure a eye openingŒæexperienceŒæfor him and is future. He needs these funding and anything extra because other wise this project will not take place. ŒæŒæ

Cartoons Of You :ŒæA 5 day tour creating illustration for people on the beaches of Miami beach, Florida and Los Angeles, California. The goal is to create 125 Characters in 5 days.ŒæWe are requesting donations to fund our tour and cover the cost to make the tour possible in every way. We humbly accept any offering you can make and GREATLY appreciate your consideration, knowing that your help will make this project successful.The Scope:Illustration can be more then just a quick drawing of a person.It can be used for birthday cakes or a happy birthday e-card.It can also be a great commercial tool or promo for an event!I've found a great deal of excitement in the idea of a Family Portrait but "Cartooned".This tour is an opportunity to share a fun yet different way of customized art with the world and bring out lots of laughs and smiles. On this tour, people can get a chance to experience a more exciting and flexible way of being made into characters. They will also enjoy the great possibilities that come along with getting their illustration done digitally.The Resources that will be used on this tour: (Where's the money going?)Making this digital art for people provides a great outcome that isn't just limited to paper and prints. With this approach there is flexibility that "just paper'" does not have. For example, these can be used online for a Facebook picture or even an email avatar. Being able to share your artwork with the world is just part of the fun.ŒæDigital illustration adds room for changes like hair color, skin, eye color and clothing. These things would be unchangeable in most cases with paper drawings.With all your amazing help, this fun art may start a trend amongŒæbeaches and boardwalks everywhere.Thank you so much for your consideration in backing our project!If you find it interesting or think someone else will like it, please share this online with your friends!

Greetings, Gelflings. It is my intention to use this Kickstarter campaign to fund the printing of limited edition (25) run of my autobiographical, OD&D/AD&D- inspired Map of Western Refractoria. Five of these maps will be given to the five donors who each give $250. The rest will be sold via my website.A brief list of other donor gifts:Œæ$10ŒæDONATIONŒæ(unlimited, above) will get you a slick 8.5" x 6" black and white postcard of aŒæNest Burglar (front) and Mondegreene (back) inscribed with a hand-written note of appreciation.$25 DONATIONŒæ(unlimited, above) will get you a 8" x 10, 4-color giclee archival print of Phacops Attaboise.$100 DONATIONŒæI will create a small (5" x 7") dungeon map for you--black ink on archival watercolor paper--using three names you suggest (The Chasm of Hopelessness, the Tunnels of Larry, etc.) See photo above for the style in which these maps will be created. To be delivered via USPS.$250 DONATION (limit 25) will get you a small (5" x 7"), highly-detailed hand-drawn map which I will customize specifically for you. I will use pen and ink (with perhaps an ink wash) and these maps will be created in the style of the Refractorian Map I am seeking to get printed. (See example above.) You submit three names (ex: The Choking Forest, the Plain of Sad Malonda, whatever) and three geographical features (ex: ocean, island, city, mountain, whatever.) This will be created entirely by hand by ME in my effete NYC studio.$500 DONATION (limit 5) will get you one giclee, archival quality (30" x 40") signed, limited-edition (1-5 of 25) print of the Map of Western Refractoria (see top of this entry for the image.)$2000 DONATION (limit 2) will get you one of two framed, original watercolor drawings, The Tintinnabulist (left) or Distemper Chamber (right). Both of the drawings are approximately 24" x 36", framed under UV-resistant plexiglass.So that's about it. Thanks for your interest. Please write me if you have any questions or concerns.

Street Knight Squad is a novel about a video game with a vendetta. Zelda is your standard anti-social basement-dweller, more concerned with her level than her grades in school. Except the game she plays, Street Knight Squad IV, is not your normal butt-in-the-chair game. Using holographic technology, the game takes place in the real world, with players fighting monsters in the streets. It's the hottest nerd-fad around.That is, until people start dying. Weird accidents, mysteriousŒæmaulings, and etherealŒæeviscerationsŒæstart plaguing the players. ŒæIt's up to Zelda and her motley crew of gamers to find out what force is behind these attacks and put a stop to it. And they should probably do it before her parents are convinced once and for all that video games are evil.I am raising funding so that I can have the novel illustrated. Because it revolves around a video game, the monsters are fantastical freaks that deserve to be brought to life. My goal is to raise $500 so I can commission a black-and-white sketch for every chapter.ŒæIf you want to find out more about the novel, read the first chapter on my blog.

Hello everyone, my name is Ian Walker and I am the founder of Obsidian Studios, and writer and creator of my newest project, The Swaggernauts.The Swaggernauts is a comedy adventure comic book project following two aliens that are marooned on Earth after an accident landed them here. J.J. and Kristie Swagg are the Swaggernauts. Everything that Earth knows as cool from fashion to music to art to current pop culture, is something that the Swaggernauts are responsible for. They have visited Earth multiple times since the dawn of man, and is considered a vacation planet on their homeworld.ŒæAlong the way during their quest to get home, J.J. and Kristie meet new and interesting people and even find out that there may be some of their kind still on our planet that have made Earth their home unbeknownst to humankind. This comic covers adventure and many pop culture references, and homages to things we are familiar with today.This project is currently in production right now and at it's early stages of drafting, and I have big big plans for this book. But right now, I simply want to get the images out there, and let people know that 'we are not alone', and that the Swaggernauts have landed here on Earth. The best way to do that is to introduce them to you. I want to do 6 color prints for the comic conventions I will be attending in 2013 to help me get the word out about the Swaggernauts. There are some great rewards here to thank you for your support, and for spreading the word about it. These range in the form of the prints themselves, original artwork, posters, and t-shirts. This is a dream to get this project off the ground so I would really appreciate any and all help to get this to WonderCon in March and introduce the Swaggernauts to the world!

The work is all done.A Midsummer Nights Dream, Romeo and Juliet, Macbeth, Hamlet, King Lear, Henry v, Anthony and Cleopatra, Twelfth Night, ŒæThe Tempest, Julius Caesar and Richard 3rd.ŒæThe feedback has been lovely and really positive and I am hoping to exhibit the images next year. I need the funds to buy the frames and mounts for these 12 A3 images and any extra promotional costs for the exhibition.ŒæAny help is gratefully accepted.Please check out my new website for more work and also to keep updated.http://www.gavindobson.comThanksHere are some of the images:

During the period of 1880-1910 known as the Gilded Age, New York City had become the city of the future. ŒæIndustry,Œæcommerce, architectureŒæand entertainment were just a few of the strongholds that Manhattan could boast about. ŒæThere had never been a city like New York. Dreams were born and created here and anything was possible.My main focus is on a small stretch of streets between 34th and 23rd, South of Broadway. ŒæIt's an epic location. Vaudeville, Edison, Tesla, Mark Twain, Oscar Wilde, Houdini, Tin Pan Alley, the birth of film and Madison Square Garden is just a brief list of the significance of the area. ŒæI'm really drawn to the history of New York City, I find NYC such a unique location and the cross over city towards the modern world.There's a big shift in the appreciation of old New York, sadly we've lost some major structures but many businesses today are renovating the gloriousŒæbuildingsŒæthat still stand tall. ŒæFolks are curious about the past more then ever and I have always found people so curious about the stories behind my art. ŒæI really enjoy telling my tales and hearing what others have to say. it's quite a joy to have an occupation that can engage fans and supporters soŒæpassionately. ŒæMy three-step plan in becoming a emerging New York ArtistŒæFirst of all, I need to get my work noticed more and get it seen by the masses. ŒæI love feedback and finding out what works and what doesn't. ŒæSecondIy, I plan on selling my works to moreŒæprominent venues and customers. ŒæThere has never been so many opportunities as today to be seen by not only local or national but an international market of fans and buyers. ŒæIt's truly unheard of. ŒæAndŒæfinallyŒæmy dream is selling my works around the world and opening my own gallery in New York to showcase large pieces of my art. ŒæI love big and bold art works.ŒæŒæNew York is a iconic city of power and might. I want to parade that sentiment with my illustrations that remind those of a past of towering structures. ŒæThe dream is more possible today then ever before. With modern technologicalŒæinnovations I can independently sell my work around the world. ŒæIt's such a thrilling prospect and too exciting not to try and see where the journey takes me. I have already had quite a bit of success. Although I have been illustrating for well over 20 years, I've only recentlyŒæpursuedŒæit professionally. The response was so overwhelmingly great that I sometimes find it hard to believe. ŒæMy art is very well received. ŒæI have sold my art pieces at CB2, BoConcept, FAB.com and in April 2013 I will be selling at the MoMA Store. ŒæI can't tell you theŒæexuberantŒæfeeling I have when I ponder theŒæpossibilityŒæof doing what I love as a career. Œæwww.erosner.com

This project is about one thing; capturing the artistic imagery of an amazingly beautiful mustache. ŒæIt's fairly obvious that everyone loves Movember and all the great, awkward mustaches that are grown for a great cause. ŒæWhy not continue this and support the legendary Ford H. and his quest toŒæcinematicallyŒæcapture the greatest mustache in the world. ŒæOk, greatest mustache in the world might be a stretch, but believe me when I tell you that this mustache will be...wait for it...legendary.Before we get into the details of the mustache, I wanted to give everyone a better understand of who Ford is as a person. ŒæSome people are probably thinking they can't trust a guy with a name that is really two last names, but trust me when I tell you this, you can.Ford grew up in the sleepy suburbs of Seattle, Washington where he now resides with his lovely girlfriend of 10 years who is in no way concerned about getting married. ŒæAs a young boy Ford developed a strong hatred for hair and eventually ended up shaving his head. ŒæHe still hates hair andŒæhas managed to keep the same hair style for over 20 years!Œæ Ford was also quite the athlete inŒæhigh schoolŒæand eventually earned a full athleticŒæscholarshipŒæto North Central Eastern Washington University Campus of theŒæCommonwealthŒæCollege. ŒæFord now works as a business development manager (fancy term for sales) but his real passions are working out andŒæcheerleading PAC-12 sports teams.Now that you understand a little more about Ford as a person, it's time to get back to more details on the project. ŒæAs you now know, the main purpose of this project is to capture beautiful images of Ford and his mustache. ŒæYour various contributions will help in the cultivation and capture of Ford's mustache and will provide you with enjoyment for years to come.Œæ We have not settled on a final mustache type and will likely be polling our backers to pick the winning type.Œæ Ford believes that it will take 30 days to grow his mustache so please be patient with him while this happens. ŒæWe will keep people up to date on the progress and share several preliminaryŒæpictures so that all of our contributors can see how things are coming along.Thank you for your support and contributions!

I am currently in the process of writing a combination steam punk/fantasy novel.Œæ I have been coordinating with the artist for the cover illustration and she and I have decided to do a collaborative effort as far as funding goes.Œæ Her artwork speaks for itself and anyone who enjoys this genre would be more than happy to have a print of her work on their wall. The image shown here is a piece she has done previously and is meant to serve as an example of her skill.Œæ The illustration will be a scene from the illustration depicting the post apocalyptic world and one or more of the major characters.

If you ever pondered the speed and agility of Frederick Douglass verses the Pizza Prowess of Herman Cain then this is the game for you!!!The game is a collectable trading card game that highlights the antics of black Republicans. The game has 15 total cards. There are  10 modern Black Republicans and 5 rare signed and numbered  limited edition silk screened cards of O.G (Original GOP) Historical Black Republicans.  The game showcases their views by pitting each Republican against each other in a race to win a (minor) speaking engagement at The RNC.This Kickstarter will fund printing of trading cards and packages, game pieces, die,  game boxes and posters of the board. It will also fund a portion of the silk screen printing cost.Forget process tin foil or silly stickers each pack comes with 10 standard trading cards cards and 1 limited edition signed and numbered silk screen card. That's right, Œæhand pulled by me in a sweat shop in NH. ŒæEach card (15 total) has a little token (no pun intended) on the back (ok just a little pun) . The tokens are the Republican Jesus: the Fish, a Wingnut: speaks for itself, Establishment GOP: --~cough~ GOP Symbol, Tea Bags er....Tea Party and an Elephant OG's Orignal GOP seen top right corner of the Douglass Card. ŒæFun Facts include biographical details, historical information, some information detailing what offices he or she held, causes they believe in or stupidity they have aspired to. For Instance did you know that Clarence Thomas may or may not watch porn? ŒæSee Below for more information on Character Tokens.Each Game Box will contain a complete game set including everything needed for 4 players to get started. The Game is for two to four players ( I guess a lonely person could play by themselves). ŒæIt is a race to a minor (~not-in-primetime~) speaking engagement at the Republican National Convention. Each Token (again no pun) corresponds to places on the board. For Instance if you are a Wingnut and land on Obama's Birth Certificate you have to go back 3 spaces . The OG's (Original GOP) have little to no contradictions so they are unaffected by the board. Herman Cain is the only card that can win the game automatically by landing on Free Pizza.ŒæOn the back of the board is a Black GOP game logo (seen above) . Each pack will also include one special silk-screened, limited edition card of one of the Five OG's: Malcolm X, Harriet Tubman, Frederick Douglass, Booker T Washington and Blanche Bruce. Rewards for this project include original art and additional limited addition silkscreen posters of the gameboard, the GOP Pick Poster and complete silk screen sets of all the cards. ŒæWith your support I will be able to create a complete and hilarious game that will delight and enjoy anyone with a passing interest in history and politics. Thank you in advance for your support.Œæ

My name is Andrew Nicholls and I am an artist living in the UK. I am 49, married with two boys and an elderly springer spaniel dog. As an artist I paint mainly miniature art for dolls house enthusiasts - check out my web site - however I started out many years ago drawing cartoons. Doodling over Christmas I eventually drew a cartoon self-portrait and thought "why not take this a little bit further?My sons have a 'Where's Wally' book and this got me thinking. Why not draw a 'Where's wally' style poster but with using REAL people. After a bit of thinking I came up with the 'Find Yourself' project and looking around the Internet Kickstarter seemed a good place to pitch the idea.If you are not sure about 'Where's Wally' check him out here http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Where%27s_Wally%3FI will draw your cartoon portrait - you get sent the original (this is a 7 x 5 inch cartoon portrait, all coloured in and ready to frame) if you pledge Œ£12 or more - and then I will use this portrait as the basis for your character in the 'Find Yourself' poster. This poster by the way, will be drawn in black and white and at the present time it will be an A3 size poster with the characters face being around an inch in size. You will appear in the poster along with everyone else and if you want me to have your character doing something specific, a hobby, a particular job, an ambition etc. then I can do this as well. I will not however draw anything that is offensive or that others may find offensive.All I need you to do is to send through a digital image of yourself - and family/friends if going for the larger rewards - and I will draw, ink in, and then paint your cartoon portrait. The finished cartoon will hopefully bear some resemblance to the person and to this end it can often take ten or more attempts until I am happy, but hey, thats my problem. Ideally I need at least 120 people to take part, this will make an A3 sized poster which will be very busy and give you a challenge to try and find yourself.Please note. If you are reading this for the second time you will notice that I have changed the 'poster' size from A4 to A3. After speaking to a number of friends and asking and taking advice, A4 was decided to be too small, and too mean. For this reason I have upped the size of the poster to A3. The reason A4 was chosen initially was to allow the 'poster' to be busy and full. however on reflection this size was a little mean and so the main poster will now be A3 size. I have changed the size in most of the copy, however in the Œ£18 reward I am unable to change the size due to having a backer, but be assured that the finished 'Find Yourself' poster will be A3 size, of course if I get 100's of backers then this may well increase. A3 size is approximately 298 x 410 mm or just under 12 x 16 inches.For certain rewards you will also get a 'Class of Find Yourself' 2013, this is where the coloured in portraits of people taking part are composed in a school style picture as shown below. The 'Class of Find Yourself 2013' will be A4 size unless the take up is so large that a bigger size is required.If you are pledging money for the Œ£18 reward and above, where more than one cartoon is offered, this is for two (or more) SEPERATE cartoon portraits. Ideal for family or friends. If I reach and exceed my target funding then I have some great extra rewards in mind, including publishing a book about the project, new posters with diiferent settings and other items that have your cartoon portrait on. More deatails to follow if and when the funding gets there.Answers to some questions you may have.What if I don't like my cartoon?I am not out to offend anyone, but it is a cartoon, so certain features may be exaggerated, however if want to make sure that the cartoon is acceptable then you can opt to have a preview of the portrait.What will happen to the image that I send you?The image that you send will only be used to produce a cartoon and as the basis for your character, once the project is completed these will be deleted from my pc.What should the image be like?Ideally the image should show your body as well as your face, I would need to get an approximation of your body shape for your character.What do you mean when you say the character can be doing anything?Well if you have always wanted to be a lumberjack, for example, I can draw your character doing some lumberjacking, always wanted to hold a snake, I can draw you holding snake etc.A4 is quite small, I am paying out a lot of money for basically an A4 size bit of paper. Please note that A3 is now the basic size of the 'Find Yourself' poster. See the note above in bold.A4 is quite small, however to make the 'Find Yourself' poster work the poster needs to be 'busy' in order to give you a challenge.

The Art by Lew project is for a Kindle book for the Amazon marketplace. This digital book will be packed with over two hundred pages of works of art by my late father, Lewis E. Wilgus Jr. This will be a way to say thank you to my parents for their hard work in raising us three boys. We were never wealthy but dad could always sell artwork to keep us ahead of the bills. This is not a feel sorry for me project but a chance to be part of giving the world a look at an artist that never received the spotlight he deserved, it just wasn't his way.The book will allow users to copy and or save the pictures with its pages to use as wall papers or any thing they would like to use the artwork for. If this is allowable through Amazons terms. A special thanks page will be listed to all those who help me fund the project with their names, and those who fund with the large amount will include a link to the offer or book of there choice. When this book hits the market this will be a valuable feature that can drive a lot of traffic to the links inside. A sample of just a few works that will be included are on my fan page I set up for some of his art. Dads Art check out the kind of work you will be helping get in front of the world. The funding will be used for getting the book professionally set up and marketing to get the book a jump start in the marketplace. So if you are able to help thank you in advance and thanks to all just for stopping by.Chad A. Wilgus

All images are the sole property of Christine Anderson and may not be reproduced in any manner.MY PLUSH ALPHABET WALL ART CARDSThank you so much for checking out my project. I am hoping with your support to have each beautiful illustration of the 26 letters of the alphabet made intoŒæ 8"x10" heavy stock cards with rounded edges. The set of 26 cards will then be packaged in a decorative box to protect the cards when they are not being played with or displayed. I have worked very long and hard to make each letter an individual piece of art suitable for displaying either on a shelf, strung by a cord or even framed for decorative purposes as well as learning.Please help me bring these to life. AND they will be ready just in time for the holidays!I have been an artist my whole life. While receiving my degree in Graphic Design and minor in Illustration you would find me drawing still life's of stuffed animals and old toys while others were drawing skulls and other "dark" imagery.I have always been "drawn" to all things stuffed, happy and warm. Because I have an intense love of fabric (which I believe I inherited from my grandmother) , but dislike of sewing, I find the greatest pleasure in rendering it. These illustrations were all made using colored pencils on clayboard. I particularly like the hard lead pencils so I can get very detailed and capture the textures and movement of the fabric.The images created for each letter are meant to feel soft and cuddly and the patterns and textures to feel happy and warm. I hope that you will agree.REWARDSThe right side of the page lists the awesome rewards you will receive by supporting me get this project to the printer .Please find the one that is best for you. ANY support is truly appreciated. The set of cards are at a special Kickstarter price for my supporters here and include shipping right to your door (in the U.S, extra for international). They will arrive in a beautiful box for storing when you aren't playing with or displaying them to be saved and shared with future generations. Keep in mind, too, that the price is less than $1.50 per card, or PER PIECE OF ART! You can't beat that. They should also arrive just in time for the holidays so please consider them as a gift for someone else as well.The following are a few images of the original pieces that are available at the $375 level. Every letter is available , these are just a few examples. They are the letter and image drawings without the border design.MOST IMPORTANT !!I need to raise ALL $7,500. Kickstarter is an all or nothing funding platform. If I don't reach my funding goal, the cards don't get made and everyone will be sad. So, PLEASE spread the word, share with friends and let's get these cards into your hands!MOST MOST IMPORTANT !!!Thank you! Thank you! Thank you in advance for your support. I literally can't do this with out you and the wonderful community of Kickstarter.A very special thank you to Lesley Roman, and to my mother, my biggest supporter of all!PLEASE feel free to contact me with any and all questions. You can check out my website, www.freshpaintstudioinc.com, to see more examples of my work. I also have a facebook page called Fresh Paint Studio you can visit.

Whatäó»s the Big Idea?Wouldnäó»t it be great to look at your calendar and realise 3 years ago today Lisa Simpson was supposed to marry Hugh Parkfield (The Simpsons)? Or 14 years from now the youngest person on Earth is murdered at the age of 18 (Children of Men)? It may even be useful to know that in 539 years from now the Pillar of Autumn crash lands on Halo (Halo: Combat Evolved)?We think it would be great, which is why we would like your help in making the äóìThis Day in Fictionäó calendar a reality.Who are you?We are three friends who used to work together and bonded over a shared love of video games, anime and how much our job sucked.With the economy the way it is, we decided to start our own company called StYoGo as a way to let out some of the creativity which wasn't being used at work.StYoGo comprises of Stephen, Yohanseh and Gopi (see what we did there? OK, the creativityŒædidn'tŒæstart flowing until after we decided on a company name).What have you done so far, and why do you need funding?Out of our own pockets we have already completed the research to find interesting events from fiction, designed the calendar and printed a test run.However, we lack the funds to print a sizeable batch, so we are looking for support to help publish the first run of the äóìThis Day in Fictionäó calendar.To help generate interest in this project we have also setup Twitter and Facebook accounts which are updated regularly with samples of the kind of thing you'd expect to see on the calendar:https://twitter.com/2dayinfictionhttps://www.facebook.com/ThisDayInFictionSo what do I get out of it?In addition to having our eternal gratitude for helping us take this first step, depending on the tier you can also receive a special Kickstarter Backer edition of the calendar and a mention on a special thank you page.If you really, really love us (ie. donate a lot of money to this cause) then you can choose a special event from your life to go on the Kickstarter Backer edition of the calendar!The pledge amount is more than you would normally expect to pay for a normal calendar; the reason for this amount is that your pledge helps cover the costs of not only producing your calendar but also the VAT, Kickstarter fees and shipping costs.What's left over we intend to use to fulfill our dreams of getting the calendar into a retail store.ApparentlyŒæyou can't put a price on dreams, but we're willing to give it a go and price ours atŒ£10a pop.So tell me more about the calendar.For each month we have scoured various sources to find accurate and interesting events that happened in fiction which correspond to real dates.From the day Jake Sully first arrives on Pandora (Avatar) to the day Oceanic flight 815 starts it's ill fated journey (Lost), we have many fictional events from films, novels, comics and video games.The calendar will include events from Red Dwarf (TV), Watchmen (comic),ŒæThe ŒæMote in God's Eye (novel), Clerks 2 (film), Alias (TV),ŒæShenmue (video game),ŒæThe Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy (novel) and many more!Finally we'd really like to thank you for taking the time to read this and hope you'll love this idea as much as we do to consider backing us.- Stephen, Yohanseh and Gopi

To find the bestillustrator or illustration company:The fund raising campaign alsoserves as an advertising campaign to find the talented person or a talented company whocan create the images for the book. Illustrators andillustration companies will be able to submit one piece of art work and a linkto their website that will be posted on http://www.elizabethmccrawnovels.com.The public will vote on their favorite artist and help decide who gets hired for theposition because it is their money we are using.The artist that is offered the contract from thechallenge must agree to do a video blog of their work and keep the onlinepublic in on the process of creating the characters, creatures, and worlds.We may end up having to offer the contract to more than one artist. When artist post their work it will serve as a free advertising campaign to show the public what they can do and helps that person or company get more business from the exposure. A submission page will beavailable on November 19, 2012. All submissions must be posted no later than December 14th. The voting poll opens on December15th and closes on January 4th. To create the look andfeel of the natural and paranormal elements of this futuristic world with allof its characters, mythological creatures, and scientific gadgets:Anyone who has watched a futuristicmovie or seen any of the latest video games knows that imaginary characters nolonger look animated. "The Chosen: Angelic Warrior" is a futuristicbook with mythological creatures, paranormal content, futuristic environments,multiple worlds, magic, and compelling characters. I am inviting all people who lovescience fiction to speak up and post your view on what scenes from the book you wouldlike to see illustrated on http://www.elizabethmccrawnovels.com.Œæ We appreciate your donations and help in getting our characters created. We will use the artwork to create posters, t-shirts, pc wallpapers, and tote bags.

This project is all about exploring the iPhone 5 in a way most people haven't seen it: from the inside.Typically we will see a photographic arrangement of a disassembled iPhone lying flat on a table, with its components properly aligned but revealing little about their interrelationship with the whole assembly, while the exploded view illustration is a graceful, eloquent, and elegant way of revealing those relationships in a three-dimensional, isometric point of view.The goal of this project is to raise enoughŒæfunding to commision a technical illustrator to complete the iPhone 5 exploded view illustration and finance a minimum production run of (500) 18" X 24" prints.ŒæTo obtain the quality of work that this projectdeserves, I will commission Dan Futoran, owner of DFI Graphics (dfigraphics.com), whose iPhone 4illustration was featured on ifixit.com, the premiere online do-it-yourselfrepair community. Dan is a veteran graphic designer and illustrator, who specializesin medical illustration, and has also provided promotional and engineeringillustrations for a variety of technology sectors ŒæPrint Specs:18" X 24" - 100 lb. paper, premium matte finish.6" X 9" - 14 pt. cardstock, matte finish.

A few years ago I started collecting old illustrated books because the pictures were so awesome. Most of them were published during the era of Sherlock Holmes and Alice in Wonderland, when the world was a very different place -- an amazing medieval Steampunk fantasy kind of place, if you can imagine that.ŒæThe more time I spent looking at the pictures, the more I wanted to write new stories and collaborate with artists who worked long ago -- artists like L Leslie Brooks, William Makepeace Thackeray, JM Conde, Howard Pyle, and John Tenniel.ŒæModern technology actually makes that possible. Last winter I started making digital collages using scans of those antique illustrations. The result is a collection of new characters -- characters in peril, characters search of love, characters ready for new stories -- stories you can tell, stories you can write.ŒæThis is a design phase project, not a mass-production project. The original idea was to do 100 designs for 3 x 5 cards for theŒæPERILS GALORE!ŒæBard Versus BardŒægame. Designs for 30 characters have been completed. ŒæThe first 30 designs took three months working full time, plus an investment of over $2500 in paper and ink, external drives for file storage, and book purchases.ŒæThe Kickstarter project goal will produce rewards for supporters and help fund creation of the next 30 designs by making it possible to get more cool old books and supplies for printing proofs and prototypes, upgrade equipment, get space 'on the cloud' for file backup. Additional $$ will make more equipment upgrades possible and pay for my time.ALSO -- feedback by Kickstarter supporters will help clarify priorities for the future development -- what kinds of stuff do Writers & Storytellers need? Little bitty trading cards? Biggish cards? Greeting cards? A game?  Impressive prints to put on the wall? Booklets with blank / lined pages for handwritten stories? Coffee mugs? iPad and iPhone apps?What is digital collage? Here is a simplified overview of the process, starting with an illustration from a history book published in the 1890s.ŒæStep 1. Make a high resolution full color scan of a figure with a cool costume.Step 2. Separate the character from the background and convert from color to black & white.Step 3. Adjust the limbs and posture, and start work on the new face.Step 4. Complete the new face and costume adjustments.Step 5. Add new props and colors.ŒæPrint it small [2.5 x 3.5 inches] and big [9 x 15 inches] to make sure the collage always looks great. Make adjustments and print again until all is good.Step 6. Add a new backdrop, and voila! -- this fabulous character is ready to star in a new story! Your story!Can you imagine the life and perils of this character? What brought him to this situation? Where is he going? What happens next? Will he ever achieve his goal?This is the first edition of the PERILS GALORE! images. It will only be available via Kickstarter.ŒæMy current fabrication process for trading cards and game cards = sheets of 10 cards are printed one side at a time, at 600 dpi on an Epson digital printer. It takes half an hour to print each side. The sheets are then individually cut and trimmed by me using a guillotine paper cutter. Then I snip the corners of each card with a Fiskars hand punch. It's a slow process.ŒæWhy scan your own books when you can just grab some images off the web or get one of those disks with a thousand pictures on it?The quality of images on the web and on disks are not adequate for this project. Those image are generally encumbered with copyright issues.ŒæBy scanning books of my own, I can maximize the image quality and resolution. Plus, I only use illustrations that were published before 1923, soŒæthe only copyrights are mine.Will these characters & images appear in other formats and future editions? ŒæEventually if all goes well, yes. Kickstarter supporters will be the first to know the details of that. They might also be offered the chance to play with and evaluate prototypes.ŒæHow will everyone know Kickstarter supporters have the FIRST edition and not a later one?ŒæBy a combination of the colors, the paper, the numbers and dates on signed items, the thank you postcard, plus you will be listed as a supporter on the Kickstarter PERILS GALORE!Œæproject page.Œæ

How sweet is that?All backers will get the chance to review our first audio book track, Knife Jack. We are looking forward to hearing your feedback.

It is an exploration in something Matt has been doing for years; making illustrations and prints from original drawings and then processing them in different materials.Each large drawing will be made into a limited edition of 35 screen prints for collectors.They will be presented in a foam-core "portfolio".

In the past few months, Iäó»ve been working on a collection of digital art self-portraitsäóîall based on my own photographs and composed in Photoshop.ŒæNow Iäó»m looking to exhibit and sell this work in printäóîand Iäó»d love your support in making that happen.Creating the digital artwork is no problemäóîI already have the tools I need.But printing and framing fifteen 40x30" pieces is another storyäóîthis requires investments from a community of backers, like you!All pledges come with a reward. In other words, you get something in return for giving. They are listed on this page in the column to the right >>For this project, the main rewards are reproductions of the digital images on postcards or canvas-wrapped frames.Youäó»ll be pre-purchasing my artwork at Kickstarter prices before the art shows up at gallery prices.With Kickstarter, as some of you know, your credit card gets charged only after I reach my goal of $5,500 by October 28, 2012.After Iäó»ve reached my goal, your payment will be processed and youäó»ll receive the reward you chose (more about this in FAQäó»s below).I also need your help in letting people know about this project.Kickstarter works best through word of mouth.So if you're moved by what I'm doing.... after you choose a reward for yourself or as a gift for someone else, please consider sharing my work with others.To those of you who know me and to those I havenäó»t yet met...Thank you in advance for your support!Iäó»ve connected with a great local vendor, Maxwell Dickson, who produces amazing museum-quality canvas-wrapped frames on demand.Theyäó»re stunning in person.You can see more about why these reproductions are so special in the text below.*COLOR RANGE + QUALITY OF PRINT: The 12-color pigment ink set they use yields the widest color spectrum of any graphic arts printer currently on the market, allowing them to print digital on canvas to achieve the highest color gamut to cover more than 90% of Pantone colors.Their canvas printmaking process improves scratch resistance of prints while resulting in consistent and ultrahigh quality print output with both sharper and deeper black tones and less graininess.SAFE:Œæ100% water-based ink with no odors or chemical compounds that are harmful to the environment or to humans.LONG-LASTING: 100% archival museum quality canvas, meaning the longevity of the artwork will last more than 150+ years without fading.GALLERY WRAPPED: There's a 1.5 inch wrap that covers the frame, giving the viewer an experience of the image from different angles, without being hidden by a bulky external frame.MOUNTING HARDWARE INCLUDED: A wire hanging mount is already attached to the frame, so all you need to do is decide where you want it, and hang it on a nail or other weight bearing wall-mount.BUILT BY HAND: After machines print the ink on the canvas, they complete the frame-wrapping process by hand, ensuring a high-standard of quality for the piece's construction.PRODUCED LOCALLY: The Maxwell Dickson staff will print and build the pieces in-house at their downtown, Los Angeles facility.If you havenäó»t already, go ahead and peek at the rewards to the right. Many thanks!

Kinda Sketchy will feature my sketch work from over the years. It's a tribute to both the start of my artistic endeavors and the rocky path I've traveled to get to this point in my life. And, while a lot of it, will be sketch work, I also plan to include some of my general art. My Art, in general? I'm new, can you tell? I also consider myself something of a lyricist. No one's ever told me I was. I have never been published or credited with a track, Nor have I collaborated on the engineering of a song or, even sat-in on a recording... But, I will.I've emptied pens into notebooks over the years and have always considered myself something of a poet. I looked up the definition of a lyricist one day and said "WERD, I guess [I'm] also something of a lyricist".I'm not waiting around for the world to say I'm an Artist, a Lyricist or a Poet. I open my eyes in the morning and I get busy living, like today was the last. And as such, I draw, I write, I tap out beats and hum out lyrics, on an almost constant basis, purely cause I enjoy it.That being said; I should be making my first song before "Kinda Sketchy" is sent to the printer and if completed, I plan to include a link to a digital download as part of the book as well. The song's title is "Jenny" and if I had to describe the style, I'd say it will be something along the lines of Punk/Ska and Heavy Rock.I'll be including some of my photography too. So the book won't just be sketches, but as I stated, some of my general art will be in the pages as well.With the funds collected, I'll use the proceeds to obtain the copyrights to the book, get the book produced and deliver the copies I've promised to my backers. Beyond producing the book and fulfilling my obligations to the backers, I don't really see myself trying to commercialize this work. I mainly would like to work on establishing a name for myself as a credible Artist. Some of my art pours out, while others are mapped or planned, but they all are INDEED originals and my own. It's also always been a dream of mine to be published and with your help, I could make it a reality.

The Project:I plan on working on some designs throughout Chicago of city-based public art and sculptures, as well as Chicago architecture. ŒæUpon returning home to my studio in Michigan I will continue to work on the artworks and develop them into printmaking projects.The money raised through this project will be used to help create the artworks, purchasing high quality paper(s), ink, supplies dealing with printmaking and engraving(s), as well as costs ensued from shipping and handling to and from potential benefactors.As a contributor, you are entitled to rewards. ŒæI have set-up a range of rewards for varying levels of donations. ŒæRewards range from hand-signed photographs, to actual works of art, to entire portfolios of artwork/photographs, as well as sculptural works of art. ŒæMore on each of these rewards is outlined below:* ŒæFor $5 you receive a hand-signed photograph taken by me while in Chicago.Œæ The photograph can vary in content.Œæ Have an idea of what you want photographed?Œæ Just ask and I'll try to do it.*Œæ For $10 you will receive a small sculpture from one of my on-going portfolios.Œæ Currently, these include small flower(s), lego men, lego blocks as well as guns, all of which are made from clay.Œæ The lego figures were made from a previous Kickstarter project called "A Thousand Strong Terracotta Army," though they will be made completely different from that project:*Œæ For just $15, you will receive an original work of art created by me.Œæ This artwork will be somehow based around Chicago (buildings, architecture, abstraction, etc).Œæ Each of the styles will have a short print run (no more then 10 pieces, that is after 10 is printed it will never be printed again).Œæ Unfortunately, I have no artwork I have created previously dealing with these themes, though I have attached an image of a goldfish I made earlier in the year to show as an example:*Œæ For $20 you receive the same reward as above, but a larger 8" x 10" piece*Œæ For $25 you will receive, in my opinion, the best reward I'm offering: a re-creation of any artwork within the Art Institute of Chicago.Œæ Pick any artist or artwork (within some limits) and I will re-make it in my own style as an engraving.Œæ Want a nice Picasso-style artwork but something nicer then a poster?Œæ This is your chance!Œæ These will vary in size slightly according to the artwork you select, but should be around 8" x 10".Œæ I'm limiting this reward to only 15 pieces for two reasons: to add more rarity to the pieces and because they will take me a long time and I can't make a lot of them.Œæ These usually retail for $150+.Œæ Below is an image of a Picasso artwork I re-created as an etchign back in 2010:* For $50 you will receive 15 hand-signed photographs I take while in Chicago.Œæ The photographs will be selected random and will be limited to only 20 sets total (and will also come in its own, custom made and designed portfolio!)*Œæ The $100 reward is the same as the $25 reward, but much larger.Œæ This piece will be made on an 18" x 24" piece of paper, though the actual image could vary slightly, depending on which image you select/choose.Œæ Only 10 of these reward levels are being offered.Œæ *Œæ The final and most expensive reward level is set at $250 and is a personal meet-and-greet with me at my favorite place in Chicago, Cosi's, right across from the Art Institute of Chicago.Œæ I can bring my art portfoliios and discuss art, my works and processes, etc.Œæ Most importantly, you can choose an artwork from the portfolios to take with you!As a final reward, the higher amount of conributions that are brought in the more additional rewards everyone will automatically receive!Œæ This will start with anyone who has contributed at least at the $20 level and could range from free hand-signed photographs, etchings, sculptures or other additional artworks.Œæ More information about this will be posted later on.Printmaking is a complicated process involving a matrix (such as a piece of wood, linoleum, copper, zinc, etc) that is used to carve or scratch to an image into, usually with a sharp needle point tool, gouge or even chemicals such as acids.  Once the image is carved or scratched into the matrix, the top is covered with an ink and then transferred to another source, usually paper or canvas ŒæŒæFor those who do not frequent Kickstarter, it works on an all-or-nothing basis, so if all the funds are not raised, the entire project must be scrapped. ŒæI would love to avoid this at all costs, so if anyone has an idea for a different reward, just let me know.

The skeletons in tutus are a reaction to themedia's ridiculous expectations that can never be met. The story of a primaballerina that "ate one too many sugar plums" hit home. Thesedrawings are asking the media if my ballerina is in fact thin enough.ŒæI,like the ballerina, have struggled with eating disorders in the past. I amhoping to bring awareness to our society and stand up to the media that holdsus accountable to this perfectionism. We are beautiful for who we are in our"own skin". ŒæThe skeletons and I are trying to tell you we need your help and support!Why? I am GIVING (yes out of my pocket) 25% of the net profits to an organization listed on my website that is all about empowering young women/ladies. I want my art to make a difference by helping others :)After this, I will do the next project but I need your support to continue this paying forward program.My hope is that art can help impact the mindsetof society from thin to healthy and help others overcome their struggles witheating disorders.How can I/you make a difference?Your pledge is a message to the media that wehave had it with all the false ads and criticisms that we are exposed to on adaily basis. By supporting this program, it will allow me to help fund otherprograms that that are near and dear to my heart like bullying and breastcancer. One artist can make a difference if others have a say in it! My goal isto have all items produced and at your door prior to the holidays.Œæ

My children's book is called "The Miraculous Adventures of Lexi-Lu". The main character in my story is a little girl named Lexi-Lu who enjoys day-dreaming in her hospital bed, and imagining a world unlike any another as she heads on a sub conscience journey to find out why bad things happen to good people. In the fantastical realm known to Lexi-Lu as "Azer", she meets several quirky and unique characters, (such as Benjie the Bunny) that help to guide her on a quest to find the wisdom of the great King Asran located in the castle in the sky.It's an idea I've had for a very long time, but my book is in a scatter state where the illustrations are separate from the words. If I can get the funding to buy the editing software needed to put it all together, it would make publishing a lot easier as well. Thanks for your support! +Lexi

The Art LabŒæInteractive art studio on wheelsŒæTHE PROJECTI will load an old moving van with equipment to bring printing to the public through demostrations, lectures and hands-on participation. I will share my knowledgs of letterpress, screen and relief printing through this mobile art studio. The public will be invited to enter the Art Lab and create and print their own letterpress poster, card, or screen print a t-shirt. I love to teach and have always had a desire to share letterpress, screen, and other forms of printmaking with others. Living in a rural area it is difficult for people to come to me, so I put together the idea of taking the Art Lab to the people. I plan on participating in community event and setting up events with local collages and high schools to introduce people to world of printmaking.To make things easier I will put together handouts so people can save the time and hassle of sourcing resources to get their projects started. I will share the tips and trick that took me years to learn on my own like:1. Where to find leads on equipment and where to buy supplies2. How the equipment works and what their capabilities are3. How to print4. How to create your own exposure light source for letterpress plate creation and screen burningŒæ5. How to make your own screens for screen printing and exposed them yourself with the light boxŒæ6. How to transfer art and carve linoleum blocksŒæThe mobile studio will include:äó¢ A flatbed table top letterpress or twoäó¢ A table top platen letterpressäó¢ Wood Type for type setting and printingŒæäó¢ Linoleum block carving and printing stationŒæäó¢ Screen printing equipment for paper and textilesŒæäó¢ Examples and demonstration of photopolymer platemaking for letterpressŒæäó¢ Examples of screen cration for screen printingŒæTHE VEHICLETo add visual impact the Art Lab will be housed in a 1954 Fageol moving van. This is a roomy art-deco vehicle that has a large open interior similar to a modern box van. The streamlined styling of the vehicle plays into the vintage 1950s design aesthetics that I use throughout my printed art. They are also large enough to house the variety of equipment that will be part of the mobile studio. I have found a Fageol that is already road worth and just need a bit more help to bring it home and get it outfit with counter space to put my equipment into. I already have the majority of the printing equipment and supplies I need to outfit the van I just need help with the final step of getting the vehicle.ŒæTHE EQUIPMENTThe van will be equipped with a table-top flat-bed press for letterpress printing. The press would be set up to utilize mostly photopolymer plates, wood type, and linoleum blocks. The mobile studio will have a select amount of wood type and lock-up materials for doing hands on, type setting demonstration for cards and posters. Demonstration of printing invitations, business cards and posters would be the main focus on this machine. ŒæA standard 4 color screen printing station would be deconstructed and welded into the van so that shirts and posters could still be printed in proper registration. A 110V flash dryer would be the heat set unit for t-shirts and a drying rack for posters would be incorporated into the van also. Everything from multi-colored 11äó x 17äó poster to t-shirts would be possible in the mobile studio.A standard 110 and 30amp RV hookup would be incorporated into the studios design to run machines, lights, possible RV air conditioner and single shirt flash dryer.ŒæTHE MONEYThe money raised through Kickstarter will go to the purchase of the 1954 Fageol van, and some of it's modifications and repairs. Modifications would include wall mounting the screen printing equipment and building cabinets. Any additional items needed for the van will come out of my pocket, unless there is an overage of funding, which would make me ridiculously overjoyed, to get The Art Lab on the road sooner.THE OUTLOOKOnce the Art Lab is complete I plan on doing demos and workshops at colleges, art fairs and community events in my immediate location of Southwest Missouri and then branching out to cities within a six to eight hour radius like Kansas City, St. Louis, Tulsa, Oklahoma City, Little Rock, Memphis, Wichita and everywhere inbetween. From there I would like to take things National and bring the Art Lab to cities across the United States.THE REWARDSCheck the right side. I am going to be cutting a bunch of linoleum to do some sweet posters and also designing up t-shirts too!
