Thank you for your interest in this project. It means the world to me, and I am hopeful that it will find the support it needs here on Kickstarter.

OK this project is a lifetime dream that I'm trying to make happen. ŒæI've always been interested in drawing in the Japanese anime/manga style and have always wanted to create my own manga (even though I'm clearly not Japanese). ŒæFor those of you who don't know, a manga is a Japanese-styled comic book that is characterized by pretty artwork and characters drawn in a sort of caricatured form, typically with over-exaggerated eyes. ŒæIn comparison to American comics (ie- DC and Marvel), they tend to be far less detailed but still maintain the appearance of the character. ŒæNow I know you're wondering why I'm trying to raise $800, right? Well self-publishing for @ least 10 books is not cheap, plus I need to get some new supplies for actually drawing out my manga and my characters. ŒæI intend, for my first book, to make it a collection of 3 or 4 one-shots (or short stories) and then I'll take a poll on myŒæDeviantArt:Œæidraw91.deviantart.comŒæon which one the readers like best; the one with the most votes is the one I will continue working with.I plan to do all this by using on online publishing website to create 10 copies of my book. ŒæThen, I'll contact bigger publishers like Oni Press and DC and try to sell them on my book. ŒæWith their help, I'll finally be able to produce my manga and continue working with my art!! ŒæHowever.... If I am not successful in raising funds by the end of the 60 days, I will just have to resort to uploading pages online and will probably never be able to get it published...

Hello. My name is Mark, and I'm a graphic designer. This project is all about fun andŒæ capturing the hilarity of bears. Yep, bears. Ever since visiting Yellowstone National Park as a little boy, I've loved their majesty and playfulness. Now I'm all grown up and love seeing my 6 year old son laugh uncontrollably at my drawings. He critiques my work and gives me lots of ideas that have jelled into these bearious illustrations (that's supposed to be punny).About Bear Posters.Although I can easily create these prints in 8x10 format on my color printer, they would look awesome in the professional 24 x 36" poster format. I want to kickstart this project so that I can use the best materials and printing processes around. My intention is to create large poster prints that will add life to your room or office walls.These large poster prints will feature my original bear illustrations in funny situations and a lot of bear puns, of course.Got a funny bear pun? Send me a note and I'll add it to the mix. Bears are both funny and beautiful and my art spans the range.Pledge $79 or more and you'll get a T-shirt with the bear print of your choice!Why I Need Your SupportI really need about $12,000 to set up a print shop, but that sounded like a bit much äóñ I know itäó»s tough times out there. But I hope with the support of smart, animal-friendly people like you, we can scrap together enough to cover printing and illustration costs. Any additional funds will help me prepare to debut Bear Posters at Art Galleries in DC and NYC.Hereäó»s how you can help: Make a pledge. Any amount helps äóñ thank you! And you can be one of the first to own an original Bear Poster.Tell a friend. Everyone does (or at least they should) love animals and love to laugh. If Bear Posters makes you laugh, chances are your friends have similar sophisticated taste. Please send them to our Kickstarter campaign!Like us on Facebook. Social media is the easiest way to spread the word.Suggest your own posters. Can you 'bearly' contain your enthusiasm? Share your funny ideas and I could end up naming a collection in your honorOn behalf of BearPosters.com, thank you!Giving BackAt BearPosters.com, we hope our posters not only make people smile, but also help give back to our forest friends. So with each poster purchase, weäó»ll be donating to forest-friendly charities. Check out our website BearPosters.com for more info or to suggest a worthy animal charity.~Mark

Day in and day out, John and Kathleen anxiously waited tohear from their caseworker to see if they were going to be granted the adoptionof Imani.Œæ The call finally came and theywere both excited to find out they were approved and the adoption wasfinalized. They could hardly wait to pick her up from the airport and welcomedher with opened arms and kisses. No time was wasted as they enrolled her intoschool.ŒæŒæImani took a while gettingadjusted to her new life, but slowly started making friends.Œæ Everything seemed great until the day Imaniinvited her friends to her house after school.ŒæJohn met them at the door angrily and told her friends they were notallowed into the house and to leave.ŒæThis is where everything changes and moves very fast.Œæ No one knew what was going behind closeddoors.Œæ Imani went through high schooland entered into flight attendant school as ordered by John.Œæ He was putting all of his pieces in place andImani was the main piece.Œæ An ex-CIAagent for the United States Government, John was ready to turn on hiscountry.Œæ Imani had been trainedunknowingly from the day she arrived at John and Kathleenäó»s house to be aweapon.Œæ John approached her to carry outher first mission but she declined to do it, they figured she would so theyinformed Imani that some of family members were killed by some Americas.Œæ This was almost enough to push her over thetop but she still opted not to carry out the mission.Œæ John released the voice double of Imani heäó»dbeen grooming for years.Œæ Imaniapproached the second mission but backed down at the last minute, unaware shewas about to be set up for murder by her parents, she became on the run.Œæ She was also engaged to her high schoolsweetheart who worked for the FBI and to his surprise, he was in charge oftracking his fiancí©.Œæ Imani now is atrained and highly intelligent weapon, but is at a point where she does notknow who to trust. Her goal now is to find a way to prove her parents arebehind everything. They adopted her to hunt her, turn her into a terrorist andturn her in for the reward money. Will they be able to capture what theycreated? ŒæŒæŒæŒæ

The 'Out of the Nest' project started out in january of 2012, as a group of paintings for cards, at the request of a local bookstore. I soon realized that I had no cost effective way of getting them printed but that didn't stop me, I just kept going-posting the progression of each painting to my friends. They literally watched the paintings come alive, offering me encouragement and suggestions every step of the way (and they hated when I recycled a painting I thought was not good enough) I am so grateful to them allI included some of that progression in the video as well as on the blog for this project so you folks too can see some of the paintings from start to finishhttp://outofthenestcardproject.blogspot.com/2012/08/the-beginnings.htmlI also included some glimpses into my studio, as well as a few other things i'm working on.ŒæŒæIn august I  discovered kickstarter,  and realized that with help from other people, I could get my cards printed!WHY 'out of the nest' ?I named this project out of the nest because on so many levels this has meaning for me -Œæobviously it's nests and birds. ŒæŒæBut in addition it is the first really large scale project I have ever done by myself.To me it is so exciting to know that with your help, my birds and their nests will be going out into the world. That one person will perhaps send a card to another person, and in a way my images will have a life of their own. Truly out of their nestSo what is this project?ŒæŒæ It is  12 of my finished paintings that will become card sets with envelopes, 6 are birds, 6 are birds nests with eggs.They will be professionally scanned, which takes 3 days, then printed on 5'' x 7'' mat card stock, ... you can use them as greeting cards or frame them as small printsThe scanning alone is very expensive as it is being done by drum scanner, I've tried to scan them myself but the color is not as nice as the originals. BeingŒæProfessionallyŒæscanned insures that the quality of the finished cards as well as any fine art prints will be the best that technology can offer today, and the color will match the originals exactly.The cards, 500 of each of the 12 paintings, are being printed in four color offset prints which takes 3 weeks as plates are made of each of the four colors used for a total of 48 plates. Each color is printed separately, then when printed and dried, the cardstock is cut and scored. Why 500 of each image? The 500 amount is the most cost effective way of getting this project done, allowing me to offer these cards at a good price.If this project goes over my funding goal, there is a 13th painting of a fledgling bird about to leave the nest (that's it at the end of the video) Œæthat can also be printed as cards, and depending on how much funding this project gets,  the other paintings can also be printed as fine art museum quality prints ready to mat and frame, these will be larger then the original 5x7 paintings. Another possibility is tote bags.Now kickstarter only works if a project is fully funded, you can go OVER your goal but nothing happens if you don't reach your goal - so i am hoping that you folks will join me in getting these paintings out into the world. Just launching this project was a project in itself,  first, i was determined to use a local printer, to hopefully do my part in helping american jobs. it took a while but i did finally find one willing to take this onŒæ i had  16 paintings all together which i narrowed down to 12, as i felt that would be a good number. I also found a local company that was able to do the fine art scanning! THAT was a  miracle as every other time i had looked for one, the closest one was 150 miles away!ŒæThe making of the 'video' was interesting, as I don't have access to a camcorder, so I just used the photos that I posted to my friends as the paintings were being done. I used the mic on the laptop, and some really simple editing equipment. ŒæIt took me a while to figure it all out too. I can laugh about it now.Œæ Now about the rewards, äó_.well the rewards for backing this project are the cards themselves!ŒæI have them listed on the right there. Every level of backing gets cards!ŒæI expect to ship mid november, just in time for the holidays!ŒæIf you like this project but for whatever reason, are unable to back this, please spread the word about it.ŒæThank you so much for taking the time to look this project over with me. And I hope together we can make this happenMUSIC 'Haunting' by Jamie Evans - Thank you so much Mr Evans for permission to use this beautiful music. Œæ Œæ Œæhttp://jamieevansmusic.com/Œæ

This project will consist of a small limited edition of 100 prints made from my original graphite drawing. If it is well received, there are plans to do more drawings in this genre - sporting art. The ultimate goal is to be picked up by a known publishing house, or contract with a conservation group for their fundraisers (supporting these groups is also important to me, and I have donated several carvings over the years to their causes), but for now, in order to get my work out there, I must self-publish. Hopefully, the edition will sell out, and establish a client base (including hopefully you, dear reader) and track record for my work. The subject matter is an extension of my primary art form - that of carving and painting highly realistic birds, including waterfowl.ŒæThis piece and the prints have an image size of 8"x10" and the overall size of the print is 9"x12". As stated earlier, it is limited to a small run of 100 prints. The subject matter is a antique-style longtail duck decoy, and is done in graphite.The prints will be made on archival quality, acid-free heavy watercolor paper, and will be printed using the black and white digital giclee' method.My current marketing plan is to sell from my website, Whispering Eagle Studio , Facebook, word-of-mouth (utilizing my existing collector and fan-base), and in galleries.ŒæThank you so much for taking the time to look at my project, and hopefully, help to build a foundation for my work.

Sport In Art Series - Baseball & Football. I created a poster project in order to promote sport worldwide through the visual arts - to make a poster using an image from history - at least one hundred years old, and use at least five different languages within the design. My first poster was for the sport of WRESTLING - my own sport. The image comes from a book printed in the 16th century with the Latin word for wrestling in the lower left corner - LUCTATORES. Using four different colors I used four languages in different fonts for the word "WRESTLING - Lutte (French), Lucha (Spanish) and Ringen (German). The printing is high quality only - I used two coats of black ink for a solid background, brilliant silver ink for the image in the center, solid blue, red, green and yellow for the languages. The image here cannot compare to the poster in a frame on your wall. This series will cover every sport you can imagine - the posters do not promote a specific team or country - just the sport itself because sport is universal. There are over 60 posters planned for the series but next on the agenda are BASEBALL and FOOTBALL (the American game). So help get this project funded and pick one of the two posters as your reward. Thanks for your help! Merci beaucoup - vielen dank - gracias - grazie - spaceba.

I was on a FIRST Robotics Team for four years. Then, I graduated.Since the beginning, FIRST has been about innovation. It was about finding new ways to solve problems, to achieve more than others. Achieving this is a feat in itself, but how do we make it permanent? As a graduate, I was looking for a way I could remember these four years, a way I could show others, now and in the future, the great innovations that mere high school students made. The answer? An FRC Card Deck, featuring the greatest robots of 2012. Whether for distribution to sponsors, event judges, or team members, or merely a piece of personal memorabilia more permanent and more useful than a button, a card deck can help spread the word of FIRST, and can help you remember the best years of your life.I can ship these decks, once produced, to justŒæabout anywhere in the world. However, if you're outside the United States, you may have to pay more for shipping.

Blending together two of my life long loves - surfing and classical art - created such a wonderfully silly contradiction, that I couldn't pass up the desire to further explore these incongruous images. ŒæThus was born the idea for classic surfing. And what better way to insure that these images be seen and enjoyed by millions, than to put them on T-Shirts.Hi, this is Grace's Dad, Steve (and believe me she's way cuter than I am) . ŒæIt is our hope that through a website, we can distribute about 500 of each of these 5 designs.All of these images will have the "Classic Surfing Logo" near them. ŒæSo all of them will be both funny and stylish.ŒæWhile working on these designs over the last few years, we have delved into the world of silk screening, and we've found that to really do it right can be very costly.ŒæThis brings us to the last two premiums, which include the two limited edition prints. ŒæAlthough they are in the video, we wanted you to see them here as well.There are only 20 of these.There really is only one of these (we do have one that we keep in a frame). ŒæIf there is more than one person who sends in over a thousand dollars, it will have to go to the 1st person giving the largest amount, but anyone else would certainly get a print of "Autumn's Angel" and the rest of the stuff. ŒæPlease see the pledge section, and Œæif you would prefer the "Autumn's Angel" print instead, just let us know.Although I am an introvert by nature (as my Facebook page will attest), if you are interested in this project, then I am interested in you. ŒæFeel free to get in touch, and stay in touch.(By the way, our website will note that surfing, although ancient, was invented by the native peoples of the Hawaiian Islands.)

100. It's a large number. And when you add "illustrations" behind it, it's a significant commitment. That is what I'm planning to do. I'm going to travel around Ireland and Northern Ireland for six weeks and capture the essence of it and the people through illustrations. One hundred of them. I will also be journaling/blogging/documenting the entire process and working on a memoir (possibly a future Kickstarter project) while I make my way around, seeing the sites, engaging the locals, and experiencing the culture...one illustration at a time.THE PROCESS:As I travel I will be taking a lot of photographs. Those photographs will eventually be the basis for the fully developed illustrations. I will post some of them to various social networking sites as I travel so that everyone can see all the best bits of my journey. I usually first work out my preliminary sketches on vellum or tracing paper (like the photo above). I find it more forgiving when I start erasing things and experimenting with what I might want the end result to be. I can be quite a perfectionist and it helps me have a more pristine original piece. Once I have something I feel will make a good illustration, I move over to a higher quality paper (unless I'm doing a digital illustration, then I take a photo or scan and get started on tracing it into the computer). I am expecting the originals to be 11"x14" or 11"x17" (depending on which paper I decide on) to more easily accommodate a flatbed scanner for image capturing the final pieces and so that postage costs to send pieces as rewards is reduced. These are the pieces that will be included in the official 100 illustrations. Some will be simple line drawings, some with full contrast showing a lot of elaborate detail through shading, stipple or crosshatching. I might even do some digital illustrations or scratchboard. I can't say for sure. I'm guessing that most will be graphite or pen + ink, but I don't want to limit myself for this since this will be an ongoing project eventually covering many places and I want to keep it exciting.I'll also be using Field Notes memo books to write notes in, doodle in, and collect various collage type goodness (like paper coasters, or brochures, or business cards, or napkins or...anything I can get my hands on to document every bit of this adventure). They're pocket friendly and will be easy to use walking through parks and such. Some of these will be up for grabs as rewards. The sketching and doodling I do in this manner will be casual and likely silly. I find it to be a good warm up exercise before jumping into the bigger pieces.Prints will be limited edition runs of 100 for each illustration. They will be printed by me on 11"x14" 64lb. Aurora Fine Art Natural paper with archival ink in my studio, hand numbered and autographed.A note about delivery dates: I have no actual idea how long they will take me. It will depend largely on the ratio of simple line drawings to elaborate stipple illustrations. I don't want to rush them so for anyone expecting originals or things like that...I will keep everyone posted on the process and update timelines as things develop.Thank you for supporting this project. It means the world to me. If you're able, please pass it along to your circle of friends that love art and travel. Like it. Follow it. Tweet it. Shout it from rooftops. I'll need all the help I can get to not only accomplish this goal, but to move forward with future destinations.ŒæWhat's the money being used for?What if you make more than you need?I'll put the money toward the next project...100 Illustrations: Portland.ŒæWhere can we see more of your work?My website. Kelly Anderson Studio. You can see my portfolio, find me on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, read my blog, see artists and designers I love. You'll find out tons about me and my work...probably more than you want to.

The event is Surtex and it lasts an entire week. Œæ Œæ Œæ Œæ ŒæYour gracious support will provide for so manyŒænecessary andŒæcrucialŒæthings, including booth space and attendance fees, equipment and rentals, layout design and licensing consultation, presentation and printing costs, publicity and advertising expenses, production of collateral materials, prototypes and fabric samples; basic travel, expenses and accommodations for trade-show week. Œæ If any of you wish to use your well-flexed social networking skills to spread word of this project, I would be stoked. ŒæYou know it! Œæ Œæ ŒæPlease feel free to contact me with any questions, queries or requests. ŒæŒæ

My pseudonym is ScorpLion, I have been an artist for 17 years, my primary media is pen & ink. The main concept for this collection started in 2006 with a 1 page drawing (see reward section D). Four years later while I was serving in the military I thought it was time to complete what I had started and began to draw illustrations daily. I completed 157 of them while I was in the service and after the military I added 8 more drawings to this collection. This project ended with a total of 166 illustrations. All of the drawings are inked in Black and White  and the subject is a relationship between the same Boy and Girl. This was a love story which started with lots of excitement and happiness and ended years later in huge heart break. Some drawings show how happy they were, and others show how depressed and desperate the Male character was. Several of the drawings are based on daily actions between Lovers. The depressing illustrations show how love can be ridiculous, painful, and can leave you feeling like you are bleeding to death.Love For SALE is an illustrated window into a relationship with its ups and downs, bright and dark sides, pain and love that needs to open its curtain for You!Œæäó¢	If you have ever fallen in love,äó¢	If you have ever felt happiest while in love,äó¢	If you have ever felt special,äó¢	If you have ever been hurt,äó¢	If you have ever felt all aloneŒæIf you can relate to any of these then please keep readingäó_.ŒæThis project will be a mirror in your hand. While I donäó»t know you personally and there will be no personalized illustrations of YOU in Love For SALE! I still assure you that you will see yourself in it!!! Gender does not matter! Itäó»s love and love has no gender. Itäó»s not magic, I am not illusionist. I am just an illustrationist who wants to share his intimate feelings with you. If you want to see Love from my view or if you want to feel it yourself once again you should consider Love For SALE project and HELP bring it to life!***Shipping INCLUDED!***Before I started my project I reviewed a lot of other projects, what I had noticed was the complications with shipping. Tell your friends, tell your family, tell everyone! Share the project everywhere possibleäó_ŒæYour pledge on the project does NOT mean the project will come alive if we can not reach our goal! You and I will be in need of more people who are interested in these kind of LOVE based illustrations. Just my effort will not be enough to reach to the audience, so at this point I will need your SUPPORT!!!I will appreciate it more than you imagine!!!HOW THIS KICKSTARTER THING WORKSYou pledge an amount towards our goal by clicking either the "Back This Project" button in the upper right of the page, or one of the Pledge levels in the column on the right.  All pledges are processed via Amazon.com, making it very easy.  If we reach our goal by project's deadline, then you will be charged your pledge amount - and receive the reward you selected. This project is to capture the essence visually of the modern world that we live in and the people and places that fill it in North and South America. I feel it is very important in these times of change to visually capture the world as it is now in this era. The world is changing vastly and soon there may not be some of the natural landscapes or even people that fill it. Fortunately, as a Visual Artist I have the opportunity to create the images of North and South America and do it with a dramatic work of art that will inspire more people to see and explore the world and cherish the natural wonders and people with-in it. I would truly like to thank each of you personally who become involved in this project. Upon completion of this project I will begin work on another project to create tutorial drawing videos and if it becomes popular I will create more tutorial videos on other elements of drawing as well as painting and digital art.I have a true passion for art and I hope my drawings will reflect this for the world to see.What this funding will cover is the cost of a passport, travel expenses to and back from South America, transportation in North and South America, room and board/food, a local guide in South America, art supplies such as high quality paper, pencils and storage for transportation to South America of my art supplies, easels,  packaging and shipping for all of the "bonus" items for those who pledge.Here are a few more examples of my work.

Hi there! Thanks for checking out my Printing project! My name is Lauren, but most people around here call me "JerZy" because of where I grew up before I moved to Tennessee. I live in Princeton, New Jersey for about 10 years before traveling with my parents to the beautiful foothills of Northeastern Tennessee. I love the setting I live in and it lets meŒæviewŒænature in a different respect than I could in "the big city".I have always loved art since a little girl. I would draw EVERYTHING I could, but my main focus was on ANIMALS. I love them and I am very passionate about animals and animal rescue. I started drawing horses, my pets, basically anything I had around me.ŒæWhen I moved away from my parents (not too far mind you, right down the road so to say) I decided to adopt a rescue English Bulldog. After much research into the breed to make sure it was a match, I decided to be a foster home for "dog aggressive" bulldogs, since I did not have any current dogs. We fostered a few, and I found a perfect match to me through my local rescue club "Smokey Mountain Bulldog Rescue" and decided to become a permanent home for a wonderful 2 year old dog named Lucy. She came to us with a few medical issues which we are treating right now. That lead me to discover that SO MANY rescue organizations are in desperate need of funds for animals that require surgery and medical attention. So many come in with horrendous problems like mange, parvo, hip issues, eye problems, skin problems and so much more. So I decided I would help as much as I could through my art! It's my way of giving back to the animals in need. I donate pet portraits which 100% of the proceeds go to these rescues. This is part of the reason I would like to make prints. I would like to be able to make copies of my work to sell andŒædonateŒæfor these rescue organizations.ŒæI also started making zombies in 2008, then in 2009 I branched out to doing custom zombie plushies as well as custom zombie artwork for all. I have been requested to make art prints of my work so that everyone can enjoy them! I work in quite a few different medias and would love to be able to share my paper and canvas works with everyone! I truly enjoy what I do and love being able to make people smile and giggle with my work. I really want this chance to share my work with everyone all over the globe and be able to help animals in need.Here are a few more examples of what I do!Here are a few of the jewelry designs I offer through my store that you will be able to choose from for rewards:Please check out my shop for more offers!!http://www.etsy.com/shop/ChewsBrainsThank you so much for considering me. I reallyŒæappreciateŒæyou taking the time to look!! <3-Lauren

The Goddess Coloring book is phase 1 of my Surcadian Oracle Project. ŒæThe book features the 26 goddess which will later be found in my Surcadian Oracle Deck. I'm excited to be working with another artist in my family Talzhemir,Œæhttp://talzhemir1.deviantart.com/Œæ,who will be taking my concept drawings and inking them.The Goddess has played a big part in my life. For years I have been wanting to help bring her back out into the world in a relevant way. I feel that She is needed now more than ever and it's time this project idea becomes a reality.The Goddesses in the Coloring Book will ultimately be made into paintings, that's the second phase of my project. From there I will create the oracle deck and an entire divination system.As I have been studying Her, working with Her and drawing Her, I realize she has a life of her own. And Her stories are our stories. I am in need of some feedback. I want to hear how She plays a part in your life, I want to see what you do with the pages of the coloring book. How do you see Her? Who is she to You? All of these things are important to me in the creation of the paintings and in the divination system. She is bigger than me. I don't feel that I could possibly paint her before I have a better understanding of how she is seen and felt through others not just myself.All of these Goddess are depicted as real women, all different types, shapes, ages, cultures, colors...in hopes of making them relatable to us mere mortals.I want others to have fun and connect to Her in their own way. Color, paint, embellish, be creative!The funds raised from this Kickstarter will go to my supplies to begin my second phase and the 26 large scale paintings...My 13 Moon Challenge!ŒæFrom there, I will create the deck...and who knows what else?The Goddess:

So a quick bit about me, ever since I can remember I have been fascinated and consumed by art, pop culture, cartoons, video games, and comics.I knew early on I wanted to be an artist, and for the last 15 years of my professional career to date, I am doing just that. I love doing vector basedillustrations on subject matter that is fun to me, and I have always wanted to be able to create archival prints of my art, as well as do professional qualityt-shirts and stickers of my art myself. I love a great looking decal, always tons of great places to put them, cars, laptops, skateboards, you name it!Awhile back I started doing research and found a solution that lets me do all of these things.I am looking to purchase a Roland Printer/Cutter and Hotronix Digital Heat press. With these 2 pieces of equipment I can offer professional qualityvinyl stickers, shirts, archival prints, canvas prints, banners and more. This printer cutter is pretty amazing. It uses Eco-Sol inks, which are are UVand water resistant for up to 3 years outdoors. This is an entry level professional piece of equipment, not a $100 desktop printer. I'll be ableto print decals that can go on cars, storefront windows and more that will be able to withstand the elements. This machine also contour cuts artwork.For example the stickers and shirts won't just be designs on square stickers, the blades in this machine will contour cut around the design offering a veryprofessional product.The machine will also print full color on professional grade heat transfer material, and the hottronix press will allow me to offer professional quality heat transferred shirts.Here is where I am reaching out to the kickstarter community. The good news is I have raised over half of the amount needed, but the rest is just very slow going.I am only asking for help on the rest of what I need, not the full amount. I hope I can make this a reality.Please visit my pages for more about my artwork:Please visit my pages for more about my artwork:http://www.facebook.com/CorroseDesignshttp://corrose.deviantart.com/The designs:A few close ups of the style/detail of artwork I producePlease check back as I may be adding additional illustrations that can be included in incentive choices.

Want to send a special note? These are some special cards!I write icons based on Byzantine tradition. Each icon is created according to a pattern handed down through the centuries. The emphasis is not on innovation, but adherence to a spiritual tradition meant to draw the viewer closer toŒæChrist. Yet each hand painted piece is an original bathed in prayer and carrying the whisper of the one who painted it.ŒæThe process of writing an icon is slow and meditative and involves many steps. I work in egg tempera and 24K gold on natural gesso. It takes 3-4 weeks for me to create each one.ŒæMy goal is to create a series of five icons from the life of Christ. I will then have them printed onto high quality vellum note cards (envelopes included). I will include a short description of the imagery on the back. The card can easily be kept in a Bible to enhance devotional time, or sent with a personal note to someone else. Everybody needs Jesus!ŒæTo be included:The Holy FamilyChrist PantocratorJesus Casts Out the DemonsMan of SorrowsChristŒæEnthronedŒæin GloryI am asking for enough to fund my first small print run and buy needed art supplies. If I raise more than my goal, I would like to make a sixth image to add to the series that will of course be added to the complete collection sent to my $25+ backers. Cards will be delivered in plenty of time to send out for Christmas.I would be delighted to have you be a part of my work!

Ever since I heard Dream Theater's "Scenes From A Memory" I've wanted to draw a graphic novel adaptation.Œæ The adaptation would be different enough to avoid copyright infringement but would still be a fan work and hopefully preserve the original feel of the album and story.I've been drawing for many years, mostly comics, and have wanted to work on a full-scale graphic novel for a very long time.Œæ However, I do my art digitally and the software I'm using barely cuts it for simplistic, cell-shaded comic pages.Œæ In the trial period that I was able to use Adobe Photoshop CS5, I've been able to draw in a way that looks much, much cleaner.Œæ Since CS6 is coming out soon, I want to jump on the ball and purchase a copy but I need a little help.I don't want to make any profit off of the graphic novels; this is a fan work dedicated to the incredible artists in the band.Œæ Therefore, the software component of my project is budgeted at $50 over the cost of the Higher Education version of CS6 Design Premium, which is $400 from Academic Superstore, including tax.Œæ I am an eligible college student, so I'm trying to get the lowest price on this software that I can without breaking the law by torrenting it.Œæ The additional $50 is to cover transaction fees and shipping for incentives.For the actual drawing, I have an HP tablet PC with good pressure sensitivity that I've been using so far in my art.Œæ It works ok now, but during the trial of CS5, the art that I made with it was phenomenally better.Œæ Again, because I feel that getting high quality, expensive, and copyright software for free is wrong, I want to try to raise money so that I can legally and properly buy the software that I need to make this graphic novel look the best that I possibly can.

Any image is possible. I just need to have a picture ofŒæthe imageŒæand then I recreate it on the Etch-A-Sketch.I'd like to get better at doing portraits. That's where the Kickstarter community comes into play. You'll be sending me pictures of people to etch. Your pledges and donations will help me get better with my art which will allow me to move to other mediums for larger Kickstarter projects in the future.

I am trying to create a suite print. A suite print is when many artists come together and they each create an edition of prints. In this case we'll say 25 artists each making a print of 30 identical copies.One print from each artist goes into the collection. ŒæAll the same size, and all based on a theme, but each widely interpreted by many artists in their own unique styles and designs. In the end each of the artists get's their own copy of the collection, samples of their own and 24 other of their peers. The remaining five or however many collections are for display and Reward contributors.I will buy a used lithograph press, and table top rolling press for linocut, photoplate, and intaglio. I will find a suitable studio space. Then that press will be used by 25 different artists to each create a series of prints. I will buy paper and inks, drying racks, all plate and litho pencils, and will provide these materials for all artists involved to complete the work. Once the prints are completed, those lithographs are then collated, so that each of the sets of art have one piece from each artist.ŒæA full set of prints will have 25 pieces of unique and original art based upon a theme, from 25 unique emerging artists carefully selected for their differences, and for their similarities. ŒæThe theme for this series will be "Half Empty, Half Full". ŒæEach artist will create a print on 24x36" archival rives BFK. However they decide to interpret the theme is up to the artist. It could be anything. It could be a literal interpretation, or a surrealist drama. It might be a political statement or a cartoon. It all depends on the artist. I will personally assure that all prints are well drawn, properly printed and consistent for each print. I will encourage color printing.At the end of the year of creating work, we will exhibit the entire collection, divide the suite print among the artists, and patrons. ŒæWe will publish a magazine which will be self printed in small batches and sold to anyone who would like to have the images, if they can't have the work itself. This will help emerging artists get exposure, publication, and interaction in a big way.This studio for one year will not only be a press. It will be a melting pot of ideas. This will be a place where creativity is born. We'll use it to make great art, and bad art, and in the end create a collection which may be a joint exhibit of some of tomorrow's greatest artists while they are young. A collection like this could even be of profound importance in the future. Bringing great artists together to suit one purpose has often yielded some of our greatest breakthroughs. The collaborations of creativity bear the sweetest fruit.

The author/illustrator Tammy King never knew she would one day become an accomplished artist. ŒæIn fact, until she reached her 40's she never even tried to draw anything. ŒæHer life changed dramatically when her husband was diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease. While spending countless hours in waiting rooms of a seemingly endless array of doctors' offices, she began to doodle to relieve stress and pass the time. ŒæShe immediately received a compliment on her drawing and before long, the entire waiting room gathered around her to see her creations.After much prodding from family, friends and total strangers, Tammy has agreed to publish her illustrations. ŒæAs demonstrated in the photos above, her drawings are very simple but each one manages to convey its own unique personality. ŒæSomehow, without any artistic training whatsoever, she has been able to create these works of art that are appreciated by all ages. ŒæThe book is designed to make people laugh and scratch their head as the characters seem to come to life.ŒæInkies -- ŒæSimple Drawings of Complicated People will surely be found on coffee tables, in briefcases and not so coincidentally -- doctors' waiting rooms.

Last quarter in biochem I made myself a diagram of the chemicals, enzymes andŒæco-factorsŒæinvolved in Glycolysis, Gluconeogenesis, Lactic Acid Fermentation, the TCA Cycle and the Electron Transport Chain. Feel free to contact me with requests for other parts of metabolism you might like to see included in the poster. If this gets funding and enough people ask I will happily add the changes. Hope you all enjoy!

Do you have an appreciation for beauty that showcases strength, independenceŒæand the American spirit? How about girls with guns? I want your help to capture the look, feel and attitude from the glory years of the classic pinup & mix that with some modern technique and style. Fan of Pinup artists like Elvgen, Petty & Vargas? How about a modern master like Adam Hughes? If you know these names, then you know where I'm headed. I've started some preliminary sketches, with more ideas coming. but the basis is pinups is centered woman and guns. I'm leaningŒætowardsŒæa rifle, with maybe some back up shots of handguns.I have anŒæextensiveŒæbackground in traditional illustration, with a career spanning over 25 years - but in all those years, my real passion was the classic pinup. And, now I want to jump in feet first, and do it right. I've dabbled in this style off and on for the past few years - but I always run into the same issues, minimal access to; lighting, make-up, hair, wardrobe & a knock out model. This is where you all can come in. Funding will cover photo studio rental, a make up artist & hair dresser. A wardrobe stylist and of course, the model. As well as covering costs for printed reward material, and of course my time.I'm looking to get this rolling by mid June, to early July. I will be updating the project progress as I solidify key resources inŒæpreparationŒæfor the photo shoot, and then beyond as the illustration progress.

Hi, My name is Bill Murray (yes, just like the actor!) and for the past 20 years I've been drawing poster-size fantasy illustrations for my family, friends, children and grandchildren to color.Œæ My idea is to have 20 different 11"x17" illustrations printed up on high-quality, thick art paper and pad-bound (no staples, no fold, posters printed on 1 side of each sheet only) to make a decently priced 20-page FANTASY POSTER COLORING BOOK for coloring enthusiasts of all ages.All of the artwork is finished and ready to be incorporated into the book. Most of the art is hand-drawn and physically inked before it is scanned in and touched up in Photoshop, including adding some effects and gray areas. Some of the posters employ very intricate and challenging ink line work, while others only use very tight pencil work and gray shading.Œæ It was not my intent to make your usual, every-day style of coloring book, and this is certainly not that.Œæ This coloring book is for colorists who want something much, much more interesting, challenging and rewarding to apply their skill to. I consider super-heroes to be a kind of fantasy, so there are a couple of super-heroish posters in the book.Œæ All of the illustrations are G or PG rated feature heroic men, women and many different creatures and exotic locations, some with detailed landscapes & backgrounds and others that leave the background more open to your coloring & artistic desire.Œæ The poster art is similar to what one might expect in comic books or in video games, with some violent themes but nothing explicit. The book will be 11"x17" with all coloring pages printed on 67 lb vellum-bristol, which is a good commercial grade art paper that holds up to different coloring mediums. There will be a full-color cover (you see part of it as the project image at the top of this column) of an illustration found in the book.Œæ It will be pad bound at the top for easy poster removal, with a chip board back to give the book some support.Œæ To help maintain the integrity of the book when in transit they will all be shipped flat in a box, not curled up in a tube or easily bent in an envelope.Since I've worked in the printing industry for 17 years and also work freelance as a print designer & broker, I know exactly how to get this done and what it will cost in order to make it inexpensive enough to sell at my price point of $20 (which includes shipping & handling), and I already have estimates from the printers & bindery, and have a shipping box supplier.Œæ My price-break print run is 100, so I need to raise $2000 for this project.For those receiving the e-file versions, as soon as I receive your contact information at the end of the successful funding run, I will send you an email with links to all 20 coloring poster images on my website. Since each grayscale jpg is @ 5-8mb, this will be easier and more efficient than emailing the files to you or fumbling around with ftp protocols. You'll just click the link provided, wait until the image loads on your screen, right-click and save the image to your hard drive.I've found that colorists of all ages also enjoy inventing stories to go along with the art - they really stimulate the imagination.Œæ It is my desire to promote and inspire creativity in as many people as possible of all ages with these coloring books.My family & friends have really enjoyed coloring these imaginative & fun posters, and I'm hoping that enough others will feel the same way to make this project a reality! In fact, if you've read this far, then here's a free coloring poster sample everyone can download of the following image from the book...... just to try out my delivery mechanism for the e-files. Enjoy coloring it! I can easily adjust my hosting service parameters to accommodate the necessary bandwidth transfer. It is indicative of the resolution and detail you will find in all my fantasy coloring posters, and is one of the final posters for any $10, $20, or $100 pledge.Œæ Here's a picture of the signed poster print (colored by the artist - me) you get if you pledge at the $100 level - it's also in the book (not colored, of course):Thank you so much for your interest, and thanks to the developers of Kickstarter for this amazing opportunity and the fantastic community!!William J. Murray, Design249

HeyKickstarter!Let's Get Started:My name isBrett Warden and I am a photographer/painter who graduated from the Universityof Iowa. Iäó»m 23 and constantly coming up with projects to keep me busy,especially being fresh out of college and relocating down to Texas soon. Thisproject, äóìCustom Portrait for Every Backer!äó is something that I have wanted to doever since Iäó»ve heard of Kickstarter. My last project, äóìWarBing Magazineäó wassuccessful thanks to everyone who donated, and that gave me some inspiration tocreate more for all of YOU!This is agreat opportunity for an artist to study individuals, and for those individualsto receive one-of-a-kind portraits, be it for a gift to someone special, orjust to keep! The human face has always fascinated me and I have always wantedto create a large body of portrait work. With your help, Iäó»ll be able to dothat.A Note on Postage Outside of the U.S. (International):Please message me directly and I'll give you a quote!Custom Portrait for Every Backer! is a project that I plan on starting in September after I have settled into a new apartment in Houston, Texas.If funding makes it to halfway ($375), I will make an e-book accessible to everyone who has donated, and if the deadline is met successfully, you will receive it!What's In It For Me?:You get a bunch of incentives! Here's the list for you to choose from:Portrait Privacy:Eventually, I would like to publish these portraits into a book for everyone to enjoy. The only way for these not to be seen by anyone else but you or I, is your choice of privacy. I respect your choice to keep your face private, I will gladly oblige. Please keep in mindthat whether you opt for privacy or are open to sharing your portrait withothers, the copyright to these images belong to me as the artist.Tutorial Video:For those who pledge the amount that includes the Tutorial Video, you are in for a treat! I plan to make a full-length, in-depth, music-filled, tricks-revealed, fun-enhanced, tutorial on how I go about create portraits, from laying down the sketch, to preparing the canvas and applying beautiful oil colors to pretty faces!Not only can you draw inspiration from this video, but it's a way to learn about the process that I go through and how I create what I do!Share!:If you are as excited as I am about this project, please share it with your family, friends, coworkers, animals, the ocean, the carpet, a sandwich, or ANYONE else you can think of!I want to make the pages of this book pretty swollen with beautiful people, so please if you cannot donate, share it with everyone you know!What Will the Funds Be Used For?:Well, besides material and shipping costs, the portraits that are pledged for will be mailed directly if chosen. The e-book will be FREE for those who donated, but the softback and hardback are extra if anyone is interested. Funding will also go towards a new production station (iMac) for myself to create high-resolution drawing and paintings, as well as a way to edit/render the wonderful videos that are included in your rewards!

It's the comfortable kind of shirt you will like to wear.ŒæThis project, with your help, will provide funding for the first print run, with hopefully many more to come. Obama is a cinch in 2012 and will continue to bat for corporate profits and empire over the best interests of the 99%. Is there any way to stop his sellout to the 1%? Or, you can choose any one of among over 100 of my poster artworks located at my website poster page: http://www.bluejayway.net/PoliticalArts.html#Anchor-Poster-4709Thanks for your support!

Hello there! Thanks for taking some time to check out my project. My characters were a part of a short animated series on a local news station WBKO and samples of that can be see here:Œæhttp://tiny.cc/akn39ŒæThese were animated by my brother Craig Dehut.Though the Folks were widely popular on Instagram it is limited to the amount of people I can draw at once, and the audience is also limited to only those people on Instagram. Also, I can't make any kind of profit or living by giving away free digital portraits.I want to reach more people and I want to give them something tangible. My dream is to use this style of illustration to spread encouragement to as many people as possible. (:This initial run will cover the cost of the web development, printing, shipping, marketing and design.I can't do this alone! Feel free to check out more of my work at www.explosivelimes.comŒæor email me at jeff.dehut@gmail.comThank you all *so* much!~ Jeff Dehut

Looking and seeing = the soul of the visual artist. ŒæRegardless of the medium ~ Œæit is in the time spent in understanding what one is actually seeing that allows for that information to be translated into some other form. ŒæOver the past several years, I have worked as a graphic designer, a photographer, a knitwear designer, and goldsmith. ŒæI have created ikebana installations, painted murals in restaurants, and produced entire fashion collections that have been shown in NYC. ŒæWhenever I look at a potential job opportunity, the employer inevitably asks for my credentials and whether or not I have performed these tasks before. ŒæThe heart of my answer is always the same. ŒæRegardless of whether I have done something before or not, I believe that can do it! ŒæIf it involves design, I can design it - or - ŒæI can creatively find a place to offer new perspective. ŒæThe root of this confidence stems from my deep understanding of design and aesthetics. ŒæWhether or not I have designed a shoe does not matter, the fact that I understand what a shoe is, what the function of a shoe is, and how a shoe can make one feel gives me the basis for designing something like a shoe. ŒæThen, because I understand design, I have that knowledge I bring to the project as well. ŒæFinally, understanding the human form gives me that final edge that makes my designs not just something that look good, but something that makes sense to the body, the mind, and tangible reality. Œæ..For the next 52 weeks, it is my goal to focus on that looking. ŒæTo hone my skills as an artist and my perception of life. ŒæTo really see the line, the contour, the shadows and depth of the human form. ŒæI believe that through doing this exercise, what I can offer to clients in the form of design will only be improved and heightened. ŒæBy the end of this 52 week in depth study, it is my intention to create one final folio of my work. ŒæIt will contain 52 drawings, be hand-bound in a traditional manner with ribbon tie, and organized in a chronological progression so that the development of my skill is evident in every line and shape on the paper. ŒæIt will include drawings taken from a variety of different timed poses along with some that will be hand colored in the rendering process.The funds raised through Kickstarter will offset the cost of sessions with a live model along with some minor supply requirements of paper and drawing tools...In short, whether it is the design for a chair that we sit on, the couch that we lounge in, the lighting in a dining room, the plate we eat off of.... Œæwhether it is the robe we wear, or the sheet we lie on.... Œæthe necklace that cascades over our collar bone or the earrings that dangle with each turn of the head... Œæregardless of what I am designing, the heart of that design is the human form. ŒæOur bodies inspire design, dictate design and can transform design. ŒæI hope that you will allow me to continue this journey into looking and really seeing. ŒæI thank you in advance for your kind support and generosity!Œæ.

art+cause has teamed up with R.Black to create both an open-edition and limited-edition print. This is the first of a series of editions designed to present a visual representation of äóìchange you wish to see in the world.äóTitle: "May First, The Mighty Ninety-Nine"R.Black has been a professional poster artist for over ten years. Getting his start doing underground club fliers, pin-up art and rock posters in San Diego for such acts as Elvis Costello, Souisxie and the Banshees, The Black Keys, My Morning Jacket, The Misfits, Billy Idol, Ministry, My Life With The Thrill Kill Kult, The Cramps, DeVotchka and many, many more. All of which have culminated in the publishing of his first book thru Dark Horse Comics. Since moving to the Bay Area R.Black has been involved with many club acts, music promotions and ad campaigns such as The Fillmore, DNA lounge, Hubba Hubba Revue, Death Guild and Original Sin Hard Cider to name a few. Currently he is the artist in residence at Shotgun Players Theatre Company in Berkeley following his dream of creating theatre posters and mural work. At the moment R's work can been seen largely, virally, and globally with the poster art he has been creating for the Occupy Movement.Œæ

Iäó»m Sue Senden and I amcreating a Tarot deck with an unusual twist that I believe harkens back to itsorigins.Œæ When I first learned to read theTarot I felt that there was a connection between the Tarot and the Bible, especiallyin the Major Arcana.Œæ It was an idea thatresurfaced in my life many times.Œæ THE QUESTION: What if Tarotwas an early teaching tool of the Christian faith?Œæ Other examples of teachingdecks have survived from the 1400äó»s, so I looked into the idea a little deeper,and kept finding connections. ŒæŒæ Whenever I talk about a BiblicalTarot people ask me to say more, to show them some of the cards I have sketchedout, and to my surprise, they want to know how to get a set.Œæ Sadly, it has been an incomplete project onhold until I have enough time to devote to its completion.So we come to today andthe journey that I embark upon right here and now.Œæ If I do not do this now, I may never haveanother chance.Œæ I have given up my job, sothat I can delve into this project and devote my full time attentions to it insteadof stealing a few hours here and there inching closer to that goal. ŒæMuch like the journey of the Fool I am at thebeginning.Œæ The funding goal willinclude the printing of the initial set of limited edition decks, the bookletwith explanations, art prints, canvas, paints and the supplies needed to createthe original artwork for each card.Œæ Noneof these will be insubstantial costs.Œæ Iwill be pushing myself to complete these cards within the next six months, butbelieve it can be done. ŒæI begin this project fullof excitement mixed with the fear of stepping out on my own journey through thecreation of this deck.Œæ I invite you tojoin me to see where the Bible and the Tarot intersect.ŒæŒæŒæ Webegin today, right now, with you and your generous support.Œæ Thank you for being a part of this journeyand for making it happen.Œæ THE PREMISE:ŒæŒæŒæ The origins of the Tarot have been lost inthe shadows of the medieval world.Œæ Atthat time, the center of life was the church.ŒæMost people could not read or write. One of the best teaching methodsfor the church was through story, pictures and miracle plays.Œæ That is how I believe the Tarot came intobeing as a teaching tool to the masses.Œæ Thecards were created as a portable means of telling the story of faith, simplewood cuts printed on cloth since paper had not yet come to Europe.ŒæŒæ THE CARDS:ŒæŒæŒæŒæ Some of the oldest decks were commissionedby the Sforza family of Milan, Italy in the1400äó»s.Œæ They are beautifullyillustrated, painted in tempera and gilded on gold and silver.Œæ The Major Arcana cards have a hole in the topwhere they may have been hung on a nail so the image could be studied and themeaning meditated upon.Œæ It is from these earliestexamples that I base the creation of my deck.ŒæThere are differences in these early decks in the illustrations as wellas the cards that have been preserved.ŒæIt is interesting to see that a few of the Major Arcana Tarot cardschanged very little over the centuries while others have changed drasticallyand their original meaning muddled.Œæ For some of the changesthere are more easily referenced reasons for the changes.Œæ In the 1700äó»s the Tarot underwent the mostdrastic alterations when occultists wanted to tie the Major Arcana to the 22letters in the Hebrew alphabet and to hidden truths of the occult world.Œæ At that time some cards were eliminated.ŒæŒæŒæ THE FOOL:ŒæŒæŒæŒæ The fool is destitutebitten by dogs as he moves through a ruined landscape with broken buildings anddead vegetation.Œæ In his hair are sevenfeathers symbolizing ignorance.Œæ It isbleak.Œæ The Fool is impoverished materiallyand spiritually.Œæ This card is theseeker.Œæ It locates the hearer in thestory, and shows them their spiritual poverty at the beginning of thestory.Œæ The listener is takenthrough the stories depicted on the cards to at last reach the World, theculmination of what is available to them if they follow the Christian path inlife.ŒæŒæ The World card depicts the Kingdom of Heaven and it is theirs for followingthe path in life that the cards illustrate.ŒæŒæŒæŒæTHE DEVIL:ŒæŒæŒæŒæ This card has changed theleast down through the centuries.Œæ Themeaning is what has shifted drastically.ŒæAs the Church grew across Europe and the British Isles the Pagan beliefs were difficult to overcome.Œæ One in particular was the Cernunnos, thePagan god of fertility and the Forest.Œæ The gods of one religion become the demons ofthe next, and Cernunnos became the image of the devil.Œæ Cernunnos had antlers; the lower part of hisbody was goat-like in furry hair with cloven feet.ŒæŒæŒæ The seeker is challengedto give up the old Pagan ways, to take the chain that is about their necks andtoss it aside.ŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæŒæ THE HERMITIn the modern decks the Hermit has a lantern that he holds high for all to see.Œæ In the oldest cards he stands with an hour glass. He is the keeper of time.Œæ THANK YOUI hope you will join me on this journey into the place where the Tarot and Faith intersect.Œæ And thank you for your time and your generous support.

Think of one coloring book centered around a puffy-haired character of a darker hue. ŒæCan you think of any? ŒæI sure could not. ŒæWhen I was a little girl, all that were presented to me were the complete opposite. ŒæI was raised being exposed to infamous, lovable characters like Belle of Beauty and the Beast, Cinderalla, Snow White, Tinkerbelle and a countless amount of other characters that I looked nothing like. These characters were all over television and graced various products in stores.Although I still love those classic characters to this very day, there was a phase that I went through as a child where I felt ashamed of my appearance, thanks to the various media that was always presented to me. I do not want my daughter to end up with the same identity issues that I did as a child. ŒæI want her to feel free to be herself inside and out.ŒæI first resorted to only buying her books that contained non-human characters, but thanks to family members, she would still received books with human characters that she did not relate to. ŒæRather than having her throw those books away, I taught her how to alter the lines into something that she could relate to.I then realized that there should already be a coloring book with a character that she did not have to alter. ŒæSo to combat this issue, I created a puffy-haired character named "Miss Zee." ŒæMiss Zee represents my daughter and all the other little girls who are often left out.After I finished the first two pages of my daughter's custom coloring book, I shared the files on the internet free of charge and received an overwhelming amount of positive responses and a request for a line of coloring books that could be purchased.Like me, they all shared the same frustration with not having coloring books geared towards little girls of color. ŒæThis reinforced the fact that simple media like this is greatly desired.Your pledge will help supply this demand. ŒæIt is my hopes to have these coloring books distributed all over the world. ŒæPlease choose the amount that you would like to pledge by clicking on an amount on the right side of the screen.ŒæThank you!WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED ON:The money for this project will go towards printing and shipping. ŒæAlso, although these coloring books will be made for purchase, it is in my plan for some of these books to be set aside to donate and ship to organizations across the world.WHERE YOU CAN FIND US:www.misszee.netwww.facebook.com/misszeedoll

I will be producing a set of note cards from my unique artwork.I create surrealistic, highly rendered organic images, often incorporatingelements of trompe-läó»oeil (images thatappear three dimensional). For this project I am working in black andwhite, using pen and artistäó»s pencil.When I start my work, I start with loose, scribbling linesnot trying to create any particular image. As I continue to work and look atthe initial strokes I start seeing form emerge in what Iäó»ve done and I startdelineating more and the form becomes more well-defined. As I look at mydrawing more images and forms appear and I say äóìOh, THATäó»S what that is!äó and Icontinue to articulate the new form. As I work the form the trompe-läó»oeileffect can emerge for me to build on. For example, the image appears to floatoff the page in the vicinity of the lizard and the snakeäó»s head in Flower Pod.The title of Winding Snake and Eggs reminds me of Green Eggsand Ham. The Winding Snake and Eggs image is, to me, very feminine. I see Fallopianforms in the flowers. And I really like the quality of the (two-headed) snake.Œæ He almost disappears. I was going to addcolor to it and decided to leave it as a kind of ghost.What I love most about my artwork is that itäó»s a process ofdiscovery for me as the images more or less create themselves. The initiallines indicate what the form needs to be. Here are some additional examples of my work.If you like my artwork and want to support it, pleaseconsider pledging to my project. The funds will be used for materials,printing, matting, framing, shipping (international backers please addappropriate shipping costs to your pledge), time and energy. Any excess fundswill be used to purchase art materials and to continue promoting my artwork.

Welcome to my FANTAZIES Hard Cover Book Project. This is literally 7 years in the making. My goal is to produce a high quality illustration book, of varying Fantasy images. For the last few years, Iäó»ve had a dream to create this book, and now it is within my reach to, as the title states, make my FANTAZIES come true.The Goal: The funding for this project will go to having the books printed, and shipped to me, help fund the pledge rewards, as well as repay my very understanding colorists, and reward them for their extreme patience. The funding will also go towards funding the limited rewards.The Book: Will be 48 pages of full color images, contained within a 9x12 Hard Bound Book.The Images: Although some may perceive the images to be risque - there is no nudity within the book. Only perceived. It is a pinup book of women in different fantasy realms, whether that be mermaids, angels, pixies, vampire girl, or even sci-fi girls. Having books printed, and then shipped from overseas is a lot more than I was anticipating, hence the reason I am here. I've looked into doing a less expensive soft cover book, but I feel that for the type of book that I want to put out, and be proud of, it needs to be a hard cover. Just a much better product, and a better representation of me, and my artwork. Hopefully you will feel the same.Reward: Below is a couple of the $200 rewards for an original, which measures 8-1/2 x 11 on card stock. Each of the Originals will be protected in a Hard Sleeve Top Loader - similar to a baseball card...only for artwork :)PRIZES:For the Second pledge, this is what you will receive:INCENTIVE ALERT!: GOAL REACHED! And yet another Cool item - After some thought, and some major brainstorming with a close friend, I do believe, that I have this NEXT INCENTIVE figured out...See the 3rd update for more info :)YET ANOTHER INCENTIVE ALERT! And another Cool item (that has yet to be determined) to be added to all those that make a pledge should we reach THIS goal.

Whether by order, oath, or honor, many have made the ultimate sacrifice fighting and dying for our country. But some carry an especially heavy share of deathäó»s burden when they are able to return from combat. Amidst lavish patriotic praise showered upon them by modern American culture for their devotion and bravery, they privately struggle to piece their lives back together while a dark war still rages in their minds. Inspired by our brave friends and family members returning from war, my brother, Alex, and I are motivated to create an exclusive illustrated tribute. It will express our awareness of the unique physical and emotional battles fought by todayäó»s service men and women coping with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder.ABOUTŒæOUR PROJECTBrother and sister, tattoo artist and mortician, are teaming up to create an illustrated design that incorporates steadfast bravery, patriotic sense of duty, and the extreme emotional burden of combat survival, loss, and guilt. This illustration, rendered in modern graphic design, will acknowledge the sacrifices made by those who fought for our country.Depicting a combat-hardened soldier and the dead weight of the emotion he carries, this project will produce an exclusive graphic design which will ultimately serve as the cover art for our original graphic novel, A Few Good Dead Men.INSPIRATION FROM EVERYDAY LIFE (äó_and death)Iäó»m the one in the back dressed in black, directing everything. With a quick nod of my head, they move in trained precision. All eyes are on the two uniformed men, stooping sharply to retrieve the flag draping the casket. They snap their arms wide open and they stand as still and serious as statues securing the red, white, and blue tabletop over the box containing what remains of our neighborhood hero. All attention secretly turns to the young widow out front clutching a tissue in one hand and her son in the other. Their lives will never be the same. An unsettling crack physically jolts everyone in attendance, and although the orders are roared out in advance, we still jump at the next two volleys of the gun salute. Then the mournful triad of TAPS echoes through the cemetery. It resonates deep enough to shatter the soul of a young man in the front row. Heäó»s armored in pristine dress blues, but the uniform canäó»t protect him from his bereavement and the symptoms of his disorder. My name is Lacyn, and I am the mortician inspired by this young veteranäó»s emotional battle.My brother is the one with a needle in his hand. With a special gun and a puddle of ink, he can provide a unique remedy to help the young veteran. Memorial tattoos do more than just commemorate the loss of a combat comrade. They can immortalize the personal, emotional, and very harrowing experiences of war. My brother can deliver those eternal decorations in skillful quality. His name is Alex, and he is a tattoo artist.These experiences in our lives äóñ and many more like them äóñ have inspired us.For this project, Alex and I will combine our unique knowledge, skills, and encounters with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. We will pay tribute to the emotional conflict between patriotism, devotion, and absolute sacrifice for freedom.HOW KICKSTARTER CAN HELPSome of you may already know that Kickstarter offers artists a very unique opportunity to fund creative projects. Itäó»s a platform where an inspired idea can become a reality when backers pledge money in return for unique rewards from the project and its creators. When a project is launched, it remains on Kickstarteräó»s platform for a number of days to gain the interest of potential backers. When folks like you back, or pledge funds to, a project, running totals are kept. If the project reaches 100% pledged funding by the end of itäó»s run, the project comes to life. If it does not gain 100% pledged funding by the time the clock runs out, the project gets absolutely NO money. Itäó»s called äóìAll or Nothingäó Funding. So, in order to make this tribute happen and ensure that you get your unique backer rewards, our funding goals need to be reached 100%!Looking at the Rewards information on the right side of the screen, you can see that there are different rewards for various pledge amounts. In keeping with the theme of our tribute, we have separated the pledge levels into military-like ranks. But if you have any questions or ideas about MIXING-N-MATCHING backer rewards, please contact us! We are eager to please.*International Backers: Please contact us about the reward options available to you in case additional shipping costs need to be considered. Thanks!USE OF PROJECT FUNDSThe funds generated for this project through the Kickstarter platform will help us acquire much needed technology. Because Alex and I will be collaborating on this project long-distance, we need a quality scanner so he can send his sketches (for both the tribute itself and the backer rewards). Any additional funds will go toward the purchase of digital inking and colorization technology. We are looking into the technical capabilities of the Bamboo Create tablet by Wacom to help complete the final project tasks.ABOUT THE CREATORSLacyn may be an undertaker, but this blonde embalmer is not defined by her profession alone. She enjoys writing as a creative outlet, using her journal of work experiences as inspiration äóñ and you can bet that 10 years as a mortician adds up to a great many wacky and macabre tales! Lacyn is also a rodeo queen turned Vespa enthusiast that adores the rugged Arizona territory she calls home. At 6äó»4äó, Alex is Lacynäó»s younger äóñ but much taller äóñ brother. Heäó»s an artist with a spectacular knack for tattoos. Alex is also a new father! He has recently taken a job as an electricianäó»s apprentice to support his growing family. Although 360 miles of southwestern desert separates him from his sister, Alex is motivated to overcome the barriers of distance to bring his artistic talent to this inspired project.To learn more about Lacyn, Alex, and their project, please visit http://gooddeadmen.weebly.com thank you, Thank You, THANK YOU for learning more about this project!

I am trying to build my portfolio & print collection for March 2012's MidSouthCon. I have been slowly building my small freelance illustration/design business over the last few years & have 150+ books with my illustrations, cover art, & designs on/in them, but not many are in the genre of my preference, scifi/fantasy (which is why I majored in fine art to begin with, to become a cover artist for scifi/fantasy books). The video shows what I can do in the genre and where my work is leading.I am scheduled to be a guest artist at the local convention in March & will also have three full panel wall displays and a table in the art room for both presenting and selling my work. I have the honor of speaking as panelist to attendees at the convention. This means I will have direct contact with, and the attention of, hundreds of authors and publishers that are also interested in my genre of choice. It also means I will have to fill those walls and table with my scifi/fantasy art in hopes of one or more of the attending authors or publishers 'discovering' me & my work. I already have about half a dozen pieces ready for printing and framing but I need to prepare those for show while creating more works. I will need $1000 per print for the event. This would cover supplies for the creation of each, plus the printing, matting, and framing of each piece and te purchase of novelties, such as mouse pads, calendars, etc. Since Kickstarter has an all or nothing policy (meaning no contributions are released for the project unless I reach my project goal), I am only shooting to complete one print at $1000. Since I have to create some fresh art for this show (anything fewer than 20 works will look inadequate), I would love to re-create backers or their ideas as digital characters/scenes and place them in my portfolio, scenes of which they are welcome to make requests, such as 'make me an elf feeding a unicorn' or 'can you make my daughter a fairy frolicking with a bunch of butterflies'. Or, if you prefer, I could create a scene or cover for your book, website, or business (preferably fantasy in theme since that is the work I need to build and other themes would take from the time and materials I need for this project).Backers would be granted limited usage rights (such as just for your book or website - each case would be different according to the initial request) and you'd have a high rez file, that you could either print or display, that is custom to your wants or needs at a fraction of the true value, or in some cases, a signed 2012 calendar featuring the collection of works.Backers also receive free publicity for their book, website, or business via my website, blog, and other social networks.

Please be invited to co-fund a vision map about the water future of the South Platte River in Colorado. The map will be informed by keynote speeches and community dialogue during a symposium titled "The Downstream Neighbor"Œæon January 27-29, 2012.ŒæI will draw the map in real time during the different sessions of the three-day symposium. The map will creatively express all elements of the vision, in a form that reflects the organic, human, low tech process of community visioning work.This project is not intended as a fundraiser for this specific symposium. The project supports my creative work as a visual reporter and illuminator of strong community visions as they evolve on the spot, and start to shape the future.ŒæMeetings, brainstorming sessions and symposia are essential ingredients for visionary change and community engagement. However, they have a tendency to evaporate after the energy of the moment. I believe that artful listening and visual reporting are an expressive way to harvest both the content and the spirit of the conversations. The resulting visual report becomes a tangible tool for further communication and action.ŒæThis vision map would directly serve the communities that are connected to the South Platte River and would support the communication about projects that emerge from "the Downstream Neighbor". In addition, this map would be an inspiring and educational source of information for similar community water initiatives, both nationally and internationally.ŒæBy supporting the funding of this project you would help me to make a living in what I love most and do best: artful listening, synthesizing, drawing, organizing, sense making, and reporting on insights and information that make a difference. You would also be a part of enriching the field of visual facilitation, strategic illustration and visual journalism with a new creative format: real time 'Sketch Reporting' in pictures and words!Œæ
