This summer, Lorie Hoffman and Charlie Capp will be floating by river from the mountains of Montana, all the way to the Pacific Ocean, a journey of 1,101 miles.  The expedition will take them across the landscape of the contemporary American West, by way of its most pivotal resource:  water.  Along the way, theyäó»ll be exploring how communities have been shaped by their relationship to the rivers, and create a portrait of the people linked from snow to sea.Our route will span four states, and just a little bit of Canada.  We wonäó»t be floating the entire length of the Columbia, which has itäó»s headwaters in the mountains of British Columbia, but weäó»ll be following a series of tributaries leading upstream to our starting point:  my familyäó»s ranch in the Bitterroot Valley.  From there, we will follow the Bitterroot River until it merges with the Clark Fork, which flows into the Pend Oreille, which connects to the Columbia, which ultimately joins the worldäó»s oceans at the Pacific.  Our route may seem like an open road, but there will be many obstacles and challenges along the way.  Dams segment the majority of the routes length, and the rocky rapids of summer present technical challenges of their own.Along the river we will be making an artistäó»s Journal/Sketchbook full of drawings, writings, photographs, and probably a water sample or two.Œæ Weäó»re going to take our time, if we come to a interesting place along the river we might stay a day or two to sketch. The project is about seeing whatäó»s along the way, documenting what we can, and sharing the journey with you. Weäó»re excited to get to the sea, but the process of getting there is whatäó»s important.Œæ When we return weäó»ll find a publisher for The Journal or weäó»ll publish it ourselves. Either way, itäó»s going to be one incredible Journal, and an intimate look into two artistäó»s sketchbook style.The genesis of this project is rooted in Charlie's childhood, in the Bitterroot Valley of Montana.  The river forms the western border of my familyäó»s ranch, and as such was a constant backdrop to my life there.  Itäó»s the river I learned to fish on, and it supported the forested river bottom I explored as a kid.  These explorations cultivated my interest in the natural world, a curiosity that is still with me today in my scientific and artistic pursuits.  As the years passed, I grew curious about where the water ultimately went.  I knew it went at least as far as Missoula, and ultimately ended up in the Pacific Ocean, but what was it like in between?  What sort of places relied on the water that flowed down from the mountains and past our ranch?  Our family depended on the water of the valley to raise cattle and hay, but what about other families, and other communities?  I wanted to one day travel the length of the river to meet the people and see the places that all share the water, and that day is now coming up. ŒæBecome a backer by pledging to the project. Weäó»ll send you rewards based on your pledge level, and youäó»ll gain access to our backers-only blog here on Kickstarter that will allow you to follow along with us during the trip and will keep you updated on the Journal. ŒæAny funds we recive in addition to our goal of $8,500 will be used to help publish the travel Journal/Sketchbook. Check the images below to get a feel for some of the rewards. You can also check out thisŒæblog post about the Zine, and see Charlie's "Flow" images here.You can also help us to Spread the Word!!Œæ This is so important I donäó»t even know where to start! If you like this project and want to see us reach the goal (and then get your rewards) help us get the word out by talking to you friends, posting, tweeting, sharing, and if youäó»re feeling feisty; running through the streets naked with a sandwich board hanging from your neck!Œæ Really, anything that you can do to help get this project in front of people who would be interested helps us enormously.Whether youäó»ve pledged $1 or $1,000 you have our deepest sincerest thanks. Itäó»s always now, at the beginning of any project, that an artist has the most doubts.Œæ In a world that bombards us with positive status updates & Tweets, bombast & self-assured projections, itäó»s easy to forget that everyone feels unsure and worried when theyäó»re doing something big. Each pledge here is more than the simple dollar signs and the ability to move forward... itäó»s an arrow chock-full of äóìweäó»re with you!äó shot straight into our hearts.Thank you for that. Weäó»re with you too, and weäó»re going to make this one great adventure together.Œæ"Golden Riffle" from Charlie Capp's "Flow" Series. The rest of the series can be seen on his site.I won't screenprint these until the project is successful, but here's a mock up of the Thank You Postcard. Final size will be 4.4 x 6.25Sample Zine Page 1:

My name is Peter Wallis.Œæ I am avisual artist from the Green mountains of Vermont.Œæ I am working on a series of Childrenäó»s Booksthat explains the history and origin behind Idioms, Phrases and Metaphors.Œæ Working with both younger students andstudents learning English I came up with an idea for a series of Childrenäó»sBooks that explains the origins of common idioms, phrases and metaphors.ŒæŒæ It is a great educational tool and also is afun book that both adults and children can learn from.For example:In medieval Europe both Cats and Dogs were not allowed indoors.Œæ Often times they would sleep in the hay roofsof homes, when it would rain the hay roofs would loosen up and cats and dogswould fall from the ceiling.Œæ Thus themeaning of äóìRaining Cats and Dogsäó was born.ŒæMy overall goal is to publish this first book and have the funding, studiospace and the time to complete all three books in the series.Œæ This is an informative read for adults andchildren and a great teaching tool for anyone learning English idioms, phrasesand metaphors.Œæ To see the progress of this work visit my blog @http://inventingidioms.wordpress.com/

"Good works are links that form a chain of love." ŒæäóñMother TeresaSelect the image above to watch the video about this project. Then select the green "BACK THIS PROJECT" rectangle to the right to select a pledge level and receive a reward for your support of this inspiring project. If you prefer not to receive a reward you will be given that option and you can just make a pledge. Any pledge is a huge boost to this project. We don't need much to allow a very unique work to be installed that will inspire families for decades.There is a Christmas gift option when you make a pledge. Scroll to the bottom to read how.What we hope to accomplish and how it's been made possibleBy pledging to this project, you have an opportunity to have your work included in a 5-by-7-foot collaboration drawing. Yes, this is an exciting opportunity for a small piece of your work to be included and donated to a nonprofit organization that supports families through their work. Prints are also available and your purchase of a print will help place this image in more locations to expose families to this wonderful work.This artwork is being created to honor the accomplishments of Mother Teresa and to help us continue to be passionate about what we do. Without passion there is no inspiration for our kids and no opportunity to dream. "Someone for a Moment" comes from Mother Teresa's philosophy of doing little things to spread compassion to those who are closest to us. The embrace in this image gave this child life for a moment. That is something we are all capable of and this work will be a reminder.The photograph of Mother Teresa at an orphanage in Calcutta, captured by the photojournalist Raghu Rai in India, has stirred my imagination. This image radiates the compassion Mother Teresa must have felt as she struggled to do her work. It is arguably the single most important image of her life's accomplishments. Our young need our guidance, our strength, and our compassion. This artwork will help remind us of her work and guide us to have responsible, committed, loving families.In 1998 I created a graphite pencil drawing, based on that photo by Raghu Rai, and gave it as a gift to my mother-in-law. Since then, I've been creating larger works and I now want your help and your small drawings, to be able to assemble a 5-by-7-foot version of this drawing. Raghu Rai has generously given us his permission to move ahead with our project. His representative, Magnum Photos, has also graciously cleared the way for this project.My InspirationI've been exposed to the works of many artists. Several have had a lasting impression. Two of those artists, David Mesplí© and Chuck Close, have influenced my work. I was fortunate to meet David Mesplí© in 1993 while I was working towards my Bachelor's Degree at the University of Wisconsin-Green Bay. I'll never forget the detail in his drawings and the scale of his work. Later, I was exposed to the work of Chuck Close at the Art Institute of Chicago. He was a photorealist in the 1970's and continues his work today. These artists are able to pull you into the work in a way that makes you feel the emotion, rather than standing in front, removed from the work. It's a very intimate moment when you approach their work. This is what I want to achieve with this collaboration drawing project.Early SuccessThrough the process of putting together this project, we have already accomplished more than we thought possible. Early interest and print sales have allowed us to donate a few prints to help in several ways. The Children's Hospital and Health Systemä‹¢ Foundation in Milwaukee, WI received a donated framed print from us for their annual "Bids for Kids" fundraiser that was held on November 9th, 2011. The artwork was donated to honor a local 4 year old boy who touched many lives during the short time he had.We were also able to donate a framed work to a local hospital for the national "Paint the Town Pink" silent auction fundraiser that helps create awareness of breast cancer and the importance of mammograms.Two health care professionals have purchased the print and one is already on display in a women's health clinic lobby.I've seen people overcome with emotion when they look at the print. I've heard the compassion in their voice while discussing the importance of this work. I know we will be able to do much more and it's overwhelming to consider what this project can accomplish.Supporting Our ProjectYour pledge will allow us to purchase the raw materials, fabricate and coat the framework, purchase the tempered glass, ship it to the hospital, and install the work. Every pledge is important.Much is Already AccomplishedWe've put a lot of effort into this project already. Raghu Rai has given us his approval, the smaller drawing for the prints has been completed, the image is ready for the archival limited edition prints, and the supporting framework for the large artwork has been designed and rendered. It's been years in the making and now we need your support to make this vision a reality. It's time for you to have these prints, to be a part of the collaboration, and help me put this wonderful work in an organization where it will have the greatest impact.This is a little extra information about a couple of the different support levels we have.$25 & $35 pledge levels. The Collaboration graphite drawing.If you choose to support us with a $25 or $35 pledge you will receive a reward package containing:äó¢ an envelope with a reference image of the drawing divided into the squares that will make up the final image with your square highlighted,äó¢ a 2-by-2-inch reference square mounted alongside a numbered blank 2-by-2-inchŒæsquare for you to use to create your drawing that will resemble the reference square,äó¢ everyone will receive the same type of graphite pencil to help keep the quality of the combined sections consistent,äó¢ and a return envelope for you to send back the square you've completed your drawing on. Remove and keep your sample square and leave the square you've drawn attached to the card it was delivered on. Insert it into the provided envelope and send it back to us. We will do the rest.The Collaboration work is a unique opportunity for you to create a 2-by-2-inch drawing that will be joined with others to complete the 5-by-7-foot Mother Teresa graphite drawing. You can choose the $25 pledge and receive a section of the background that will look similar to one of these samples:or the $35 pledge and receive a section of the foreground image area that will include a section of Mother Teresa or the child. It may look something like one of these samples:No solid white sections will be sent. Everyone has the opportunity to be a part of this collaboration work while sections remain available. Any sections not claimed or returned to us will have the original image showing through that area. If many sections are still available when this project is successfully funded we will have local children complete the remainder.$100 pledge level. A signed limited edition print of Mother Teresa.If you choose the $100 pledge, one of the rewards you will receive is a signed limited edition print of Mother Teresa with a child. You do have the option (excludes international orders) to have us professionally frame the print with a high quality metal frame and double mat. All materials are archival. Several framed print sample images have been included below. If you choose to have it framed, add an additional $150 to your funding total. Shipping is included.If we raise more than our goal, you will help fund a drawing and framework that I will create. It will also be donated to an organization like a hospital, clinic or family support agency. I would like that opportunity but I hope we can at least accomplish the main goal of this project and create your collaboration drawing and find it a good home.Thank you for taking some time to learn about this project. I hope you can find a way to make a pledge and help this project come to life.If you would like to pledge and give the reward as a gift, I will post printable cards, FOR ALL PLEDGE LEVELS, on our website www.lookcreative.com that you can print and give as a Christmas gift to someone. The card will let them know that you are supporting this project in their name and it will explain what they will be receiving. Later, after our funding goal is a success, I'll request names and addresses and that's when you can indicate who and where the reward will go to. This is a very unique gift and in the spirit of Christmas giving. It not only brings someone you love closer to this wonderful work, it helps me, the artist. continue doing the work I love.

The Gray Wolf Graphic Book project is an international artisticcollaboration to produce an illustrated story of the gray wolf in NorthAmerica. The book will tell the story of the gray wolf from its evolution,ecological role,Œæ eradication from western states to its reintroduction in the West.The story of the Gray Wolf is still unfolding today with the species delisting from the Endangered Species Act in 2011 and as debate continuesover wolf management with population increase and expansion of their range into newstates. The book will be illustrated in the style of a graphic novel and will appealacross generations. The book will tell the story like it is, based on true events through quality illustration. The illustrator for the project is Ramí_n Acedo, a free lance illustrator & architect based in Madrid Spain.Œæ Ramí_n has a passion for wolves and his illustrations areinfused with emotion that truly bring wolves and western landscapes to life throughthe use of traditional and digital illustration techniques. The illustrationswill be highly detailed and will allow each page to stand alone as a work ofart. The concept for the book and script was developed and written by Noah Bates, a rangeland ecologistbased in Colorado, United States.The book will be the inaugural publication of EarthIllustrated Press, an independent publisher owned and operated by Noah Bates that creates illustrated books with ecological themes. The book will be printed inhard copy in a limited edition initial press run and will also be made available as ane-book for retail sale. We are working on a tight budgetand our goal is to raise $4,500 in 45 days that will be matched by personal funds and dividedbetween illustrations, first press run and e-book formatting. The book is scheduled to be released in November 2012. We hope you are inspired to contribute to this project andhelp make the book a reality.You may keep abreast of project developments at the websiteof Earth Illustrated Press. Visit the project on Face Book and share it with your friends!Sincerely,Ramí_n Acedo & Noah Bates

I am a wood engraver and illustrator. (If you are not sure what a wood engraving is - please watch the video!) My Kickstarter project is called the Cat of the Month Club. It began with a long time desire to do a series of wood engravings, but life kept getting in the way!Œæ This project will give me the incentive to do the series and will give the sponsor a tangible reward for his/her moneyŒæ - so the sponsor is not merely investing in an idea or concept, but actually receives a valuable piece of artwork.I have always owned cats and we all know that they are incredibly personable and also very popular! Most people who collect cat items are very hard to buy for because they already have so many cat items. This is where my idea for a series and the desire to come up with a unique reward for the sponsor merges.The Cat of the Month Club will consist of one wood engraving a month: I will draw, carve, print, and mail a new cat image at the start of each month. The complete series will have 12 cat engravings and an archival box to store them in (the traditional way to collect fine art prints). I have put a short deadline on this project (Dec 15), so if the project goes through - those that may want to do this as a Christmas gift will be assured that the project has been funded. I will notify all recipients by e-mail and also send a gift card explaining how the series works and to let the gift recipient know to expect their first piece of art in January.To view more of my wood engravings and woodcuts, please go to my website at: www.laughingcrowstudio.com.

Welcome to my Kickstarter page. This is a crowd funding medium to help projects get off the ground. I am asking you to pledge anywhere from $1 and up to help me get this artwork into poster. If I don't meet my goal...your card is not charged.....but also you don't get your goodies... So Please share this with someone you love. Check out my rewards to help inspire you to pledge.Œæ I am offering this art on poster Full Size, or canvas prints, the original drawings, also the OG paintings are in the rewards should you so desire.The concept of this painting is to create an image you see from far away that is made up of something entirely different when you examine it closer. "Two Faces" is just that from far away, however these faces are made up of 100's of people, places and things all compiled into the giant monoliths which guard all it's inhabitants. If you look close you can see some items are in white...these are the final characters I am still working on and will be complete in time for the poster run.  Enjoy endless epic details in this painting titled "TWO FACES" by Chris Elliman. Incredible perspective and depth insures your mind will be blown for years of discovery and conversation discussing," What does it all mean?"Œæ Many items are very obvious and others are not. After working with subliminal imagery for years.... I grew frustrated working hard to hide items in my paintings..... only to have to point them out to people directly in the final piece.....hence my more obvious approach to subtlety! Creating paintings of this magnitude is very challenging both mentally and fiscally. To be able to pay bills for three months while I hammer down on these canvas' with complete focus has created some interesting highs and lows in my financial history. I am so into these pieces I forget to eat, sleep and have a life! Yikes.... but that's how passionate I am about this kind of rendering.Œæ There is no chance for a 9-5 moment when I have one of these on the easel. It's full throttle coffee sipping and depth enhancing debauchery. I have found the way to really get my point across is to make less quantity and more quality. Yes I could paint a painting a day... or five for that matter... but none would sock you in the eye like this. Time and time again I have proven this is how you make an impression..... now its your turn...... bring "Two Faces"Œæ home to your wall. I absolutely need your help to be able to afford the large minimum orders required for long run printing on drum printers. The very costly start up fees are tough to summons from my humble pockets, but the price of each singular piece goes way down. These are not one off prints from a digital printer and not photographed by a buddy with a nice camera. The painting has been photographed by a professional art photographer on a Hasselblad H1! The images are over a half a gig each side! The detail and clarity is unreal and well worth the expense to make sure these posters are stunning!Thank you soo much for your support and please share this kickstarter so we can get this baby in POSTER form."Two Faces" by Chris EllimanRight panel of "Two Faces".......the manLeft panel of "Two Faces"......the womanLeft Panel sketch...coffee stains and all.Right panel sketch of "Two Faces""Blue Agave" by Chris Elliman 25"x12.5""Morning Do" by Chris Elliman 24"x12""Killing Time" by Chris Elliman 27"x18""Wet Dream" by Chris Elliman 18"x24""Time after Time" 24"x18" by Chris Elliman"New Harvest" by Chris Elliman

2011 marks the 70th anniversary of one of films greatest (some say the greatest) monsters; the Wolfman. Immortalized by Lon Chaney Jr., the film remains one of the most watched and highly regarded pieces of cinema ever committed to screen. George Waggner's vision of a man inflicted with a terrible curse has forever changed the way we view the "monster" in movies, as human to inhuman, as conflict with self against the nature of being. A well rounded cast propels the yarn; cemented in history with the fine performance of Bela Lugosi, whom ten years earlier made another monster a household name (I'll let you Google it if you don't already know the answer). Time has shown that this story, although some would consider tame by contemporary standards, still resounds with audiences seven decades after it's release I'll admit that I was not always a fan of this film as it was not a staple of my childhood like many other horror aficionados, but a recent viewing delighted me with how well it has stood up over time. Snappy dialog, an unusually deep plot, and par none special effects (even for today) brought the story to life and made me more or less realize why this work has endured and even flourished with the passing of time. Modern takes have always had to resort to comedy (An American Werewolf in London) or intense gore (the 2010 remake) to even hope to separate itself from the original. This film has done more for the genre of horror than many others since including several personal favorites like The Shining, Alien, or The Evil Dead series, any artist would kill for the staying power this film has had and continues to have.The work in question begins as a rough diagram; an illustrated poster harkening back to the yesteryear of design when pencil hit paper and brush met canvas. But I hope through a dialog with fans alike would blossom into a far more personal reflection of what this film has meant to the legion of folks who admire it today. In the coming days and weeks I wish to update and polish the concept into something worthy of walls, dorm rooms, and collections. Something we as fans can all look at and say "damn, that was a fine film." Originally, I was inspired two fold; first by a revisiting of the work and also by the poster artist Drew Struzan, who recently created a piece inspired by a film he admired as a child; Frankenstein. His work in turn has spurred me in much the same way, to create something beautiful, lasting, and a reflection of what the film meant to him.The final product will be a full format 4-color offset archival print, signed and numbered. Additionally a lobby card will also be created, screen printed on archival paper and packaged along with the poster as an additional bonus for fans who would love to see this project completed. A special edition will also be produced, a screen print enhanced version of the offset print or an entirely screen printed original.I look forward to hearing back from people interested in the project and to see what avenues it leads to. My thanks viewing and reading through my ramblings but most importantly; thank-you for your time and consideration.J. Aaron Hager

Leonardo Da Vinci's masterpiece, the Mona Lisa is perhaps the world's most famous and iconicŒæpainting, and one of its greatist Art treasures. But the Mona Lisa today is badly darkened, yellowed and riddled with cracks.The Restoration project recreates the original brilliant colors, life-like flesh tones, fine details, and the dazzling landscape that so enthralled Leonardo's early admirers.Working from research based on high-tech scans, numerous early copies and manuscripts, David A. Claerr has digitally re-created an amazingly detailed restoration thatŒæprovides the viever with an accurate likeness of the painting as if fresh from Leonardo's easel.Details that were obscured or lost by the ravages of time, such as the gold brocade on her bodice, the transparent veil, eyelashes and eyebrows, and the rosy flesh-tones described by the art historian Vasari, are depicted in vivid color. Intruiging landscape elements, such as the eroded limestone pinnacles, the sapphire mountain lakes and the coursing riverŒæin the backgroundŒæare visible in the Fine Art print.The entire artwork was painstakingly hand-painted, using a digital tablet and brush, and edited pixel-by-pixel in many of the minute details.

*The image is a original illustration done in May of 2011 by myself and has no connection to this project outside of being fantasy.ŒæSorry that the video isn't fancy, I'm learning my way around this and might have something nicer up soon. I also get nervous on the camera...Just what is this?A series of twelve illustrations, high in quality and detail, focused on some of the best fantasy fiction there is out there. And what better way to share a series of twelve images in a way that makes it both collectable and a part of one's daily life then a calendar. They are after all very nifty [at least I think so...I hope you do too.]Just who are you?Hi, I'm Elle, as the video says, EnchantingElle like the account and my wordpress mention. I'm a free lance illustrator as well as being a full time student at the Academy of Art University, BFA Illustration program with a focus on visual development. I'm a self labled dork, I love fairytales, fantasy, art and history and I am hoping to share those passions with you. Please feel free to be a dork/nerd/geek along with me.So what are the books?1. Anne McCaffery - Dragonriders of Pern.2. G. R. R. Martin - A Song of Fire and Ice3. William Goldman - The Princess Bride4. Robert Jordan - The Wheel of Time5. Peter S. Beagle - The Last Unicorn6. Tamora Pierce - Tortal based, series not decided yet.7. Robin McKinely - The Blue Sword or The Hero and the Crown8. Sherwood Smith - Crown Duel9. Anne Bishop - The Black Jewels10. Mercedes Lackey - Vows and Honors trilogy [Valdemar]11. Scott Lynch - The Lies of Locke Lamora12. To be decided...by the patrons! That's you.ŒæWhy such a far off deadline?For several reasons actually. I am planning to hopefully have everything done and shipped out by next November. The reason there's such a lengthy project ahead of me, and my supporters is because I really do mean a high quality illustration for each one, I don't want to do short cuts or fail the brilliance I'm illustrating. That means 60-100 hours or so per illustration, from thumbnails to final piece and mix that in with being a full time student and engaged along with private commissions and otherŒæresponsibilities. However if you chose to become a part of this you will get to see each piece come to life through livestream and at least bi weekly updates for the patrons.ŒæWhy the sum of $5,000?Because its costly to print high quality calendar's and I don't mean the more flimsy ones often bought in stores. And the mini book and other expenses along with shipping, art isn't cheap. And there's paying the artist as well, because hopefully you like me and want to pay me for the work I'm doing. And I will treat this like a job, its a commitment I've made and I will carry it through and happily answer any other questions. $6000 is a rough estimation of what would be needed for everything, honestly the more I raise the better rewards I can give and the more stress it takes off me.ŒæSo....help me make somethingŒæextraordinary.ŒæBelow are a few of my favorite original pieces though none of them has quiet the style I have in mind for this project.Œæ

I love stories. Problem is, myfirst language isnäó»t English, itäó»s images. So I got a Medieval English major atOglethorpe University and became an Artist. ŒæArtists use images to express thoughts andfeelings, explore issues, explain what we believe to others, and so much more.Abstract or realistic, old fashioned or modern, the art that lasts is the artthat grabs you and makes you want to look at it.Iäó»ve specialized in paintingportraits in costume, making costumes and setting the stage (literally) forindividuals to show a different story of themselves than they usually get totell. My work tends to be quiet and personal. People think itäó»s beautiful, butwho wants to hang a picture of someone elseäó»s friend on their wall? What makesthe images in Sargent, Waterhouse, Da Vinci, or Le Brun more universal? Iäó»mready to explore this and capture it in my own art.Specifically, I want to produceworks that capture the feeling of a story and make the viewer want to knowmore. ŒæI want my physical art to engage theviewer as completely as stories engage the listener or reader. To achieve this, each day I willproduce small sketches & thumbnails based on stories, some classical, somemodern, and some my own. Each week I will choose from these the best ideas andproduce one or more finished sketches in dry medium or paint. Each month Iäó»lluse the best of these compositions to create a finished painting. ŒæIn the end, I will have a book of my work to presentto art directors and galleries. The book will include both my art and some ofthe stories behind it. Your funding will go toward supplies, studio space, andproducing the book. In exchange, you will get anywhere from a small sketch to afinished painting - and, of course, my eternal thanks. The way Kickstarterworks, until the goal is met no money changes hands, so please pledge what youcan to help me tell my stories.

Iäó»m Monica and Iäó»m a free lance illustrator. ŒæIf youäó»re into Tarot cards, you might know my work from the Tarot of the Dead, a Day of the Dead themed tarot deck that I created.The project Iäó»m working on now is the Stolen Child Tarot. ŒæThe name and inspiration for this deck came from one of my favorite poems, the Stolen Child, by William Butler YeatsŒæ -- in particular the refrain:  äóìCome away, O human child!To the waters and the wildWith a faery, hand in hand,For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.äóTo create the atmosphere of the poem, Iäó»m designing the imagery without man-made objects like the usual tools you would see in a traditional deck -- for example, a crown could be represented by antlers, or an animal's form could represent the clothing for a human station. Also, there wonäó»t be any adult figures. ŒæThe humans in this deck are all changeling children that have embraced different parts of the natural world.My hope with this campaign is to be able to complete the 22 cards of the major arcana, plus 2 title cards, and produce a small print run of these as a complete entity.Œæ My illustrations are done with colored ink and watercolor and have shading and detail that will not reproduce at good quality with online print on demand services--that's where Kickstarter comes in!Reaching my Kickstarter goal will allow me to finish and produce this project with a local printer utilizing profession 4 color process that will accurately reproduce the color and detail of the originals.Œæ Creating this art edition of the major arcana will hopefully be the first step to developing a full deck in the future -- and I've included some minor arcana artwork in the video.To make these editions special for supporters of the project, each deck will be signed and numbered, a title card will include an area to personalize it to the recipient with a name or small drawing-- you tell me what to include! -- and packaged in a handmade art paper portfolio.Œæ No two will be exactly alike!Œæ About 10-20 of the decks will be hand embellished on the title cards with metallic ink and packaged in a sewn cloth portfolio with ribbon/button enclosure to create a deluxe edition.All pledge rewards include shipping and all pledge levels will be signed up for behind the scenes updates on the project!Along with the cards, I will create a PDF field guide to the deck with thumbnails of each image and interpretations, which will be available for all supporters of the project.If you would like to pledge at the original artwork level, you can see the gallery of available cards here and claim your card!If you would like to pledge at the Pendant level, you can see an example of what the completed pendants will look like here!When will the project complete?I should have all artwork completed by the end of the year and to the printer by early January.Œæ My goal is to have completed decks in supporters hands by Valentine's Day.What is Kickstarter?If you are new to Kickstarter, Kickstarter is an all or nothing funding platform for creative projects. ŒæYou can pledge money at different reward levels, or at any amount you choose. ŒæIf the funding goal is reached, as a supporter, youäó»ll receive a unique personalized piece of art as a thank you from me.Œæ If the funding goal isnäó»t met, the project ends and no money changes hands.

Overview: The ABC's of Oregon flora, fauna and et cetera. These will then be offered for sale both online at an Amazon.com merchant site as well as down at the local artist market. To learn a little more about me, and to see more of my art work, just check out the other stuff on the Flickr links, or you can visit my web site at www.scratchboardfiend.com/.Œæ Thanks for your support!

How many of us give real pleasure with our art to others for free?? I am a childrens illustrator from India. I have been creating these cute personalised cartoons of friends & family & clients for over an year now & have got numerous requests from many known and unknown people for more. Most of these have been used as user profiles on various social networking sites or as web mascots or even as greeting cards etc.. People can personalise these cartoons for anything they want, from personal identification to personalised gifts. The best part is they are ABSOLUTELY FREE! Graphic artists & cartoonists around the world charge a bomb for a small cartoon version of you. I wanted to reach out to many others who don't know me all around the world and give them the joy of owning a specially done cartoon version of themselves absolutely FREE!I have decided to dedicate one full day, that is a full continuous non-stop 24 hours to draw for other's delight. I will be taking in 1000 requests from people all around the world to draw a cartoon of theirs or their friends or family. You just need to send me a photograph of the person whom you want to convert into a cartoon & it will be done right in front of you on a live web camera via skype, with my webcam focussed on my illustration at my desktop and everything I would draw and create while this period will be broadcasted live onŒæhttp://www.livestream.com/thousandliverequestsŒæduring this period. Each cartoon will be personally sent to you via email instantly as soon as it is done and you can see it almost immediately & use wherever you want. NO COPYRIGHT CHARGES!Whats More?You can personalise the cartoon in your own way with a special background for example, for a birthday with cakes & candles or an anniversary with a couple sitting over a moon or congratulations for a new job with any specific setting you have in mind. Everything is welcome! You just have to mention what you want in the background for me to draw in chat or with the photograph. Plus each of these cartoons will be published in one of its kind special book dedicated to this day with special thanks to all who contributed and supported it. This book will be known as "1000 Live Cartoon Requests" as will have the original photographs and names of the people along with the cartoon and where they are from.What would I need the money for?All your money would be used for the printing and publishing of the book and for the creation and promotion of a website where such requests would be taken everyday. This is my life long dream to provide some special touch to my art for everyone around me. So that everyone owns something special or personalised gifting is not so much pain and is readily available.ŒæWhen will this "Request Day" happen?If the funding goes successfully the 1000 Requests Day will start on 2nd December 08:00am IST. All the requests that will be sent to my email id, mukherjee.aiswarya@gmail.com from that moment will be considered valid for the day. I will be taking the first 1000 requests for that day and will be contacting and completing each drawing preferably live for the person who requested via skype. So please send me your Skype id alongwith your request.What should you sent via the email request?Please send a photograph of the person you want us to draw with his/her name and location, alongwith any specific background details you want us to draw or any specific text line you want to add, for example: "Happy Birthday Lisa!". Send everything specifically and clearly mentioned. Also send your Skype id which I will add personally and then you can see what I am drawing for you live!! You can also watch everything live atŒæhttp://www.livestream.com/thousandliverequests

ŒæŒæ Capture your likeness in a bold and interesting way! The Autum season is here and our thoughts turn toward Halloween, horror movies and good old macabre fun. I'm offering up your chance to have your likeness transformed into either a bio-mechanical steampunk creature or a ravenous, blood thirsty zombie. Of course, you can always just get yourself drawn just as you are as well. I'm also offering up some cool artwork featuring classic horror icons Edgar Allan Poe and the original Dracula, Bela Lugosi. I've set their images on paper using the "fumage" technique, which utilizes candle soot to create images.ŒæŒæ*** If you want a portrait, I would like at least three photo's of the person you want drawn. Please make sure there is an equal amount of light and shadow in the pic, especially on the face. Please feel free to make scary faces for the zombie portraits. Portraits include head and partial upper body.***ŒæŒæ I want to put on my first solo show early in 2012. Basically, I want to raise money to make this happen. The majority of it will go toward mounting, framing, space rental, fixtures and hopefully some entertainment and light snacks. The more money I raise, the more impressive I'll be able to make my show. ŒæŒæ I've been painting in oils for only a few years but have been blessed with an artistic gene that has enabled me to hone my skills rather quickly. I prefer to paint finely detailed still life and portraits. Having always had an interest in the macabre, I also love to create images that present a dark and forboding feeling. My paintings usually include a dark background and striking contrasts. I also love to draw and have been doing it for more years than I can recall. Hence the basis for this project. ŒæŒæ Your portrait will de drawn on an 18" x 24" sheet of professional drawing paper. Once completed, it will be sprayed with a few coats of fixative for protection. Then it will be sent off to you in a mailing tube via USPS. ŒæŒæ I'm currently trying to lock in a venue to host my show for mid March. I'll be posting updates throughout this project and will post the exact time and place of the show once I secure it. The show will be free to attend so PLEASE show up if you can.   Thank you very much!

My approach todrawing is simple; it is to try to push it to the brink. I never have remainedsatisfied with just pencil to paper. I have strived to do more and that hasbrought me to my current body of work. The seven drawings I have just completedshowcase the progress of wood, mechanical pencil, stumps, erasers, and havingthe graphite drip. The imagery is pushed as well including subjects such as horses, bighorns, crowns, humans, ships, flags, birds, etc. ŒæSo here is where my kickstarter project comesin. ŒæWith several pieces donealready, I want to evolve these ideas and processes to create five moredrawings, and finish my series. As the project develops I will continue workingon wood, share my thoughts and show in progress photos of all stages of thework.Œæ When all the work is done printsof all works in the series will be available.Œæ ŒæThis will allbe documented in an artist book, which will be available exclusively to mywonderful backers on kickstarter.ŒæAs if that werenäó»t cool enough, the originalworks will also be offered!Œæ I wantall funders to have the opportunity to get their hands on originals.Œæ That means the large panels will be forsale, and for those of you with a little less room on your walls, I am making apiece composed of twenty smaller panels that will all be up for grabs.ŒæŒæIf you would like to check out more of my workfeel free to go to my website at www.jasonanthonyleroy.comŒæThank youfor taking your time and checking out my work.Best,ŒæJason

I will create a series of drawings which document a cross section of the U.S. landscape between Boston, MA and Los Angeles, CA. Traveling by car I will sketch and illustrate cityscapes and landscapes at set points along the way.ŒæDuring the 3,000 mile journey from Boston to LA I will produce about 120 illustrations which visually record the gradual progression between the countyäó»s various natural landscapes and ecosystems as well as the transition between rural, suburban and urban places.ŒæI plan to use lines of latitude as markers for my illustrations. The distance between these lines vary while traveling north to south so the illustrations will be somewhere between 25 and 35 miles apart. This will allow me to capture enough of the country to represent the various and wide ranging landscapes and to convey a sense movement along the road.Being from New England I am very familiar with northeastern landscapes and cities. I have sketchbooks full of illustrations depicting them, some abstract some more detailed. This trip will give me the opportunity to explore other parts of the country in depth. Weekend trips or even week long vacations have given me only a sense of what other parts of the country are like at any given moment. A drive across the country with the purpose of visually documenting the journey, however, will allow me to focus on the transitions and changes, no matter how minor.Most of the drawings will be black pen on paper. For some, however, I'll use other media such as colored ink or acrylics.Œæ

Voila! In a few short weeks they will be ready hit the store shelves!Our team of peeps making this magic happen is Heather and Brandon Taylor, Œæ co-owners of Turtle Monkey Bug, our local community of artists, vendors and all of you kickstarter supporters.Thank you so much for taking the time to review our project!

I am an artist, illustrator, and designer that has been working in this field for the last six years creating original art, prints, stationery, home decor, jewelry,Œæand accessories that bring beauty to everyday living. I sell my work through my site,Œæhadleyhutton.com, in my etsy shop,Œæhadleyhutton.etsy.com, and in shops across theŒæglobe.I have had great success with my products. The project involves working with aŒæprofessional offset printer to create sticky note cubes, and note pads made with 100% recycled paper and soy-based ink. The printer requires a large minimum quantity of piecesŒæprinted per design. Recycled paper increases the expense. Due to these high upfront costs, I need your help to get this project up and running.The funds will purchase printing for 2 sticky note cube design editions made with soy based inks and 100%Œærecycled paper, and 4 notepad design editions (two grocery magnetic, and two office memo) made with recycled paper and soy inks. Yes, you read that correctly äóî you will receive goods that retail for about the same price as your contribution, or less! What a great deal; you get some awesome art, andŒæhelp me out at the same time! ŒæThe best part is you get to choose your favorite pieces from my large collection atŒæhadleyhutton.com. Check out the sidebar on the right forŒæmore specific details about the pledges and rewards. The rewards also make great gifts just in time for holidays!Thank you so much!ŒæIf you know someone else who might be interested in supporting, please share this link.Œæ-Hadley

There is an abundance of subjects around this "Great Lake" and I would like to try to capture the 24 most interesting of them in classic black & white fashion using the meticulous pen & ink process called "pointillism" or "stipple", this is the practice of creating an entire illustration with single points of ink. This technique takes an incredible amount of time for each indivdual illustration, thus requiring a massive committment to complete an entire series. Of the 24 pieces in the series, I plan on doing 8-8"x10"s, 8-11"x14"s, 8-16"x20"s, an 8"x10" piece done using this style of drawing takes approximately 2 weeks, an 11"x14" piece takes approximately 4 weeks and a 16"x20" takes about 8 weeks, thus to complete a project of this scale, I plan on it taking over two years.The first phase of the project would be to tour Lake Superior's entire circumfrance, taking hundreds of photos of all the potential subjects. Then I will pick out the 24 most interesting subjects that best represent all aspects, man made and natural, of Lake Superior.ŒæOnce the subjects are chosen the long process of putting ink on paper begins! People will be able to follow my progress at:RCIllustration.comTo facilitate the entire project, I will need a minimum of approximately $10,000 to cover travel, equipment, supplies, and time. The funds will also go towards publishing a "coffee table" type of book of the entire project, documenting it from sart to finish, including; photos (which weren't used in the project) and various scenes of creating the drawings.

The focus of the artwork is based on Pug dogs, mainly our own pug named Pugsly. We've created a facebook page for the Pugsly Sticker Co. and it has been well received. We do not sell the stickers, we do charge a nominal fee if we have to ship via USPS. Normally we give them out to kids at local skate parks, skaters love adorning their skateboards with interesting stickers. We've gotten artwork for the last two stickers from some very talented artists and are looking for more. We would like funding to pay for the creation of more colorful and larger stickers, currently only small B&W are available.

BLUES, BROKEN HEARTS & CLASSICAL ARTS is a collection of original ink drawings and poetry assembled over time with influence and inspiration drawn from a variety of sources. The final format of this self published collection will be approximately 11" x 14" in dimension and 100% black and white. This body of work has continued to grow and will likely be 85 - 100 pages upon it's completion. The contributions provided will create the means to publish this volume and encourage further linear expression with a pen and pad.

Birds of a Whimsical FeatherŒæby artist and illustrator LEX CovatoThis is a year long project in which I will create quirky Birdie illustrations and share them with kickstarter donors and the general public. ŒæBirdie is a name for a group of bird based characters which I have been illustrating with in the past 6 months to a year. ŒæAs an illustrator I enjoy telling stories through my paintings. ŒæMy paintings are odd, humorous, and often carry deep commentary. ŒæBirdie is a simplistic character yet acts as the perfect vehicle for relating to audiences and expressing ideas. ŒæI would like to do two things with Birdie and this project: 1. let Birdie evolve and explore it's range and potential 2. start a monthly art subscription bringing art into the homes and offices of larger audiences. ŒæAn art subscription would work like a magazine subscription. ŒæPeople would know the basis of the subscription but be surprised with something brand new each month. ŒæThis would allow more people to collect limited edition art, narrow the gap between the "gallery goer" and the general public, and simply give collectors something to look forward to each month.I will paint feverishly each month and select the most interesting of the Birdie creations to turn into an archival print. ŒæThose who support the project can follow it on my blog. ŒæThe images will eventually make their way to my website and to my tent in festivals. ŒæIf a donor subscribes to 6 or 12 months they will receive the 1st edition run of the print of the month. ŒæJust like buying a vinyl toy or trading cards it will be an exciting surprise to open the package you receive in the mail. ŒæAll prints are archival and signed which will give subscribers a start on collecting and investing in art.ŒæThe donated money go to:ŒæMaterials such as watercolors, ink, acrylic, illustration board, watercolor paper, wood, gesso, brushes, etc. ŒæŒæprinting costs- archival prints done by a print vendor with archival pigment and paper. ŒæCellophane print bags and foam-core backing.PackagingNOTE: keep your eye on this page for additional pledge level rewards. ŒæI will have a few that will be released as the donation level rises.

For the past 10+ years I've been studying and depicting native west coast plant life, with the resultant artwork appearing on useful paper stationery items and fabric goods. Two years ago I began incorporating animals in my work and studying & depicting the ecosystems in which they live. I call this series Anima.ŒæWith this Kickstarter campaign, I hope to create my own Anima artist-in-residence program and travel throughout the Pacific Northwest for two months in order to continue my investigation and depiction of the native flora and fauna of our region, without the daily constraints and distractions in my studio!ŒæThe tour will result in a collection of 6 - 8 new Anima posters and notecards, available mid-November exclusively for project supporters. Just in time for holiday gift-giving!As an eco-concious artist and designer, I'm really excited about the idea of Kickstarter - pitching a project that becomes a reality only if there's enough financial support for it - and I'm working to transition all my physical goods-making to this type of pay-before-it's-made model. Already my sewn goods are made-to-order, and now, with this Kickstarter campaign,Œæ I'm investigating ways to do the same with my paper printed goods. The standard "make something and then see if it sells" model we've all been using is such a waste of time, money and resources!Where will you go on your tour?ŒæWell, I have a few ideas about which animals I'd like to learn more about, and the national parks and natural areas I'd like to spend time in. Sponsors above the $100 donation level will have a chance to vote and decide exactly which animals and ecosystems will be a part of the new Anima collection.There will also be frequent updates on my travels and investigations for all project sponsors.What will you use the money for?The money raised here will go towards gas and car maintenance, food & lodging, and the 1st run of new Anima posters and notecards which will be available exclusively to project sponsors for the 2011 holiday season!ŒæTell me more about those posters and notecards!All are printed on post-consumer recycled paper with soy-based inks by my favorite family-owned print shop here in Portland, Oregon.Œæ The shop and I have devised a meticulous 5-color process that ensures accurate reproduction of the vibrant colors I use in my original drawings.Posters are sized to fit in a standard 16" by 20" frame. IKEA's Ribba frame is ideal!Notecards are 4.25" x 5.5", and come with an FSC-certified paper envelope.ŒæYou can see posters and notecards from my existing collection here.

I'm going to create a limited run serigraph of the crucifixion called "Father, into your hands I commend my spirit". It's in chiaroscuro, with red ink representing the nails and spear hole. The run will be on white cotton rag paper approximately 20 by 30 inches. The black aspect of the print will be done at a local printer, and then the red will be individually hand painted on each print by myself (and whomever I can get to help me).Here's a prototype of the image:I'm Catholic, so of course I've grown up around religious art, and have long been fascinated by it. I studied religious art in college as well, which deepened my appreciation for the symbolism and complexity in many pieces. A few years ago I created this image as a Christmas gift for my parents. They had it framed, and I was struck by how beautiful it looked and since then have wanted to do a large print run. I've only been held back by a lack of resources.The major costs are buying and shipping the rag paper and paying for the printing and trimming of the artwork. I look forward to working with you to make this project happen!

You can pre-order the 2012 The Dog Table Poster for $15!Essentially by äóìbackingäó the project, you are pre-ordering The Dog Table Poster (signed by the artist that's me!)äó_ and you will also receive a button, Œæpostcard, business card, sticker, digital ebook of The Dog Table, Breed Group Info Pages and Desktop Wallpaper. You will also be listed on the Thank You page of the website and receive a custom Thank You Notecard.I love to draw dogs ......lots and lots and lots of dogs. And because I'm a small business owner, turning my ideas and dreams into products can be an expensive proposition. I'm asking for your help in getting The Dog Table off the ground, and making one of my dreams a reality so that I can share my dogs with the world.The Dog Table of the EleMUTTs features whimsical illustrations of the 170+ American Kennel Club Dog Breeds and a few of our favorite SoulMUTTs.Œæ"It's eleMUTTary, my dear WOOFson, to find your favorite dog breed."I want to create and print The Dog Table as a 24x36-inch poster that will organize the dogs by breed groupsŒæ(hounds, herding, terriers, working, non-sporting, sporting, toy and soulmutts)Œæin a similar layout and structure to the Periodic Table of the Elements.Did your dog make the list? Here is a list of all of the dog breeds that will be included on The Dog Table of the EleMUTTs.In addition to the printing of the poster, the money raised will also go toward the printing and shipping of buttons, stickers, postcards and trading cards that feature the various dog illustrations and information about the dog breeds, as well as the breed groups.The Dog Table is all about celebrating the whimsical nature of all dogs and supporting and promoting dog adoption. Five percent of sales will go to support dog rescue groups and their missions to save, protect and rehome dogs.You can see all of the 170+ dogs at TheDogTable.com.ŒæAnd once the project has been funded and The Dog Table has been designed and completed, you will see the entire Dog Table and be able to purchase all of the associated products that you helped fund!And you can also join us on the Facebook Fan page to hang out with some other members of the ScoutDog SoulMutts' Pack. Also you can follow us on Twitter, check out The Dog Table on Tumblr and follow us on Pinterest. Oh, and you can sign up for The Dog Table Enewsletter.The money raised will go toward the printing and shipping costs of the following pieces:The Dog Table and Breed Group ButtonsThe Dog Table Sticker and Business CardsIf you take a look at the column on the right, you'll see that your generous contribution and support will be rewarded by gifts based on your level of donation. $15 alone will get you a signed poster of The Dog Table. $1 gets you full access to updates on the illustration, design and creation of The Dog Table through a secret email newsletter and private Facebook Group.If you don't have a bone, or dollar, to spare, you can still help by spreading the woof about The Dog Table. Tell people about The Dog Table by sending them to the The Dog Table Kickstarter Campaign or to The Dog Table Website at www.thedogtable.com.ŒæŒæThank you for any support and love that you can send my way to help my dreams come true. ... I know that The Dog Table and all of the dogs that I create will bring a smile and joy to your life!

Breaking the Chain: Often overlooked and forgotten, weäó»re here to help recognize the unseen victims of crime: the children and families left behind by the individuals incarcerated. Through art, inspiration and donations of prisoners, we help give back to the community.ConsInk offers a promising solution to the often controversial & questionable dilemma posed by the selling of prison art for profit. We recognize that while there are remarkable artists sharing their work from behind bars, the community often sees this as a slap in the face to the victims of crime. Through the creative arts, prisoners often find new ways to develop their ability to express themselves and imagine alternate scenarios.We work with outreach programs to ensure the ongoing creative arts in prisons, while offering a way to give back to the community.Even in the harsh environment of prison, trust and community build. Prisoners can undergo a profound transformation, which helps them make better choices in life, inside and outside of prison. Our goal is to help them help the community from behind bars.Our mission is to offer back to the victims of crime, particularly those who are often forgotten äóñthe families and children of prisoners. By sharing incredible works of art compiled from various sources and contributing to organizations and outreach groups who support the victims of crime, we feel that we are doing our part to help others give a little bit back to the community.We offer T-Shirts, Prints and Printed Canvas of amazing works of art donated or offered to us in the hopes that those less fortunate can in fact benefit from their exposure. A portion of each sale is donated to outreach programs and organizations that focus on giving back to the community and helping the victims of crime.KickstarterWe are raising funds through Kickstarter to cover our initial printing, production, equipment and distribution costs. (A first line of T-Shirts, Canvas Prints, Posters and so much more) We are a start-up in our early stages, developing and evolving day by day. We are accepting art pieces that are currently being transferred to a line intended to raise funds for programs that help those in need. We do focus on prison art programs, however we also accept art from those wishing to help benefit the children and families who are the victims of criminals incarcerated.- Our goal is to give back - so we will keep you posted as to who, what and where our donations go to. We currently donate privately to a number of outreach programs, but are looking to partner up with prison art rehabilitation organizations to better serve the community. If you have suggested programs: LET US KNOW! We are always looking to find new ways to help!*Prisoners do not profit from ConsInk sales.

When I was a child, a neighbor used to send out multi-page Christmas cards that included holiday tales like the story of the three Wise Men. Following in this tradition, I am creating a mailable card that includes the Tolstoi short fable "Three Questions," illustrated with five linocuts.I began planning this project in November of 2009; being short on both time and funds meant the project stayed on the drawing board until now. You can see my original idea here. In addition, you can follow the project's day-to-day progress, see the prototypes that do (and don't!) work, early sketches, prints, and so forth by following my blog.

So Far this has been one heck of a Journey. The artist (MyronChristian) and the rest of our team are trying to do it ALL. So we have created and self- published his first coffee table book of an 8 year spiritual journey. Where every trip always felt like his last. All these experiences and exchanges bear an inexplicable physical, emotional, and spiritual toll. Imagine the difficulty of being so far out there. So far removed from your own material reality, that you are confronted by the Truth of it all. Face to face with the very essence of your own existence- hyper aware of your mortality. Because in those moments there is very little room for trying to evaluate strength and possibly overestimating your personal limitations. But every few months or so, another cryptic dream filled with the quixotic, and MyronChristian would find himself packing equipment bags in preparation for the mystery ahead. www.modernmaninsearchofsoul.comSo here we are in phase 2 - we are raising funds to create a mind blowing exhibition from the collection entitled Modern Man in Search of Soul. By taking select Limited Edition pieces from the work, we are going to create an awe-inspiring, jaw dropping visceral experience. Through this never before seen take on the lives of indigenous tribesmen and women, shamans, elders and warriors, follow the visionary quest of MyronChristian as you journey back to your own true Self. And all that truly is.We would like to create a Cave Labyrinth experience of the journey. But, in this Labyrinth's end you will not encounter the proverbial Minotaur - the end is the beginning. For only when you reach an ending can you truly begin; and it is there that one finds all things are illuminated. The money contributed will be used for the structure, and printing of large format prints (40"x60" and larger- of which approximately 20 will be created), all the whilst mixing passage walls with quotes from his book. So the final hard costs consist of materials needed to create this ethereal presentation which we imagine will bring a sense of hope and levity in these trying times.THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR HELP! We need quite a bit more than our goal, but any help at all is appreciated. Any additional funds will go toward helping this story reach the widest audience possible!!!

The project is for me to draw three things as a single piece of art, that are framed separately. They are individually larger than anything I have done on paper. The center drawing will be square, displayed at an angle like a diamond, flanked by two rectangular drawings. The drawings are to be of a checkerboard like pattern, I have used this on a few drawings in the past, the pattern will have two colors and with in the pattern stars. I hope the three pieces will visit more then a few galleries. Each drawing will have a different pattern and a different star design. I need quality paper and makers. Paper and markers I have used in the past have yellowed and faded. Plus these drawings are huge, the single is 36x36 and the other 2 are 24x48. I have a wall at my place that I will use to tape the paper up and have at it, one by one. Get a pro to take pictures of them so that I can get half size prints and t-shirts of the drawings made. Then have them matted and framed by a pro down the street from a place I used to work. Then display them first at the place I used to work, then at more then a few galleries, I hope as many as possible.

I began working on this pen & ink drawing is 1977. Worked on it on and off for years. Reworked it again earlier this year. Having spent around 300 hours drawing I am now satisfied with the black & white version! The drawing "Castles Made of Sand" was created with black india ink and white ink using a croquille pen on paper. Croquille pens create the finest of lines. For the fine line technique used this is a rather large drawing of 18" x 24".Now I am trying to convert the black and white "Castles Made of Sand" drawing to color using Photoshop.Where I'm at:I have scanned the image in 6 sections at 1800dpi. I now need to assemble the 6 sections to make one flat image. Convert the image to RGB and colorize it. In the past I have made a high contrast film (lithography film) print and colored it by hand using watercolor. Those are mediocre. Much of the line work was either lost or became fatter and thus looked clumped together.It is very difficult to view the fine lines on small internet images. Enlarged sections are located here:http://www.midairstudio.com/privatesale/castles01.jpghttp://www.midairstudio.com/privatesale/castles02.jpgRecent accolades:I was awarded first place for a charcoal drawing titled "Wise Likeness" in the August Art Show at the Dodge Pratt Northam Art and Community Center, 106 Schuyler St., Boonville, NY. I exhibited an original watercolor painting titled "Moment of Seclusion" and this pen and ink drawing "Castles Made of Sand" in the Arts and Home Center at the New York State Fair in Syracuse, NY. "Castles Made of Sand" won 3rd place in Fine Arts Division A - Professional Class / Graphics. "Moment of Seclusion" won Honorable Mention in Fine Arts Division C - Professional Wildlife Art Class / Paintings. To date no business has come out of these efforts.I am requesting for the Kickstarter community support because taking time to create quality art has placed my families well being in jeopardy. Unfortunately for me we cannot survive on praise and award ribbons. For many years business in central New York has been lousy for the arts. With no marketing capital to get my art in front of potential buyers, I have found myself being pulled towards the bankruptcy hole. There is no place to cut my overhead since I don't have payments for cable/dish tv, cell phone, car (I have a 1996 model), healthcare, or "costly" lifestyle.I want the Kickstarter community to decide if this is a worthwhile endeavor and fund my time and efforts on this project or if I need to hang up the art thing and find a "real" job. I thank you for reading this and your generous support.

In what began as a series of harmless doodles at work, the Who's Who project is an ongoing project dedicated to chronicling every villain and foe from the hit TV show Doctor Who. Each character will be lovingly hand drawn, inked, and colored in appropriately. The project will culminate into one final piece - a large group shot of all of the various beasts, robots, henchmen, other ne'er do wells. Encompassing over 40 years of history, this piece will consist of over 100 individual pieces in the end.At this point, the project is more of a personal one to help build my portfolio (as well as spread some Doctor Who love) but I'm interested in putting the finished piece on posters, playing cards, and more as the demand arises. Recently, my six year old iMac has begun to die so the money will be going towards the purchase of a new computer, tablet pad, scanner, and some minor art supplies. Unfortunately, with my current income I have no way of affording any of this so I'm looking for any help I can get, especially from fellow Who fans and those of you looking to support a struggling artist. More of my work can be found at http://jaktheterrible.deviantart.com/Thanks for reading and have a great day!

On November 1, 2010, I started the "Growing On Trees" project, in which I create one tree drawing a day, everyday. Each tree is posted here http://clearvoid.tumblr.com All pieces are unique and completely beautiful. I would like to continue this project for the entire length of next year [Jan1,2011-Dec 31,2011], so I have started this Kickstarter fund to to both raise money as well as allow people to reserve specific dates. Please be a part of this ambitious project and earn some one-of a kind rewards!

äóÖHeartlandäó» will be a four part multimedia exhibition about the awareness and preservation of the human heart.Over two days I had two very powerful yet different experiences. I read an article that said in one year, 1 million Americans will have a heart attack, the population of Dublin is approximately 1 million.Later in conversation, a friend spoke about the food industry in America and how, over 30,000 artificial food products are introduced into supermarkets every year. I felt compelled to say something about these two experiences, the state of our hearts and how delicate we are as human beings. They are after all our engine room. It becomes even more evident to me how mortal we really are and it made me question the quality of our self-preservation.Like the chambers of a heart, Heartland will be a multi-visual art exhibition broken into four elements - photography, mixed media paintings, video installation and scultpture. äóÖHeartlandäó» will also involve my own heart since I am a smoker and a drinker. I will film an Echocardiagram of my own heart in a hospital and document the results for use in video-installation part of äóÖHeartlandäó».Sculpture:4 rows of 10 pigs hearts per row will be set into 2 glass containers. Each heart will be anchored in place. The hearts will be submerged in isopropyl alcohol for lifelong preservation. The toughened glass containers will be hermetically sealed, underlit with a light box and designed to be set into a low lying rosewood coffee table.Photography:4 photographs of a single hearts will be produced in a sepia tone. One will be crowned with thorns. One will have a brass lock embedded in the front wall of the heart with a key protruding from it. Another will have a cigarette lying beside a heart and another photograph of a heart revealing the inner workings of a clock embedded inside the four chambers. Each photograph will be limited to an edition of 25 each.Mixed Media Paintings:a) Three mixed media paintings of two hearts side by side. They will vary in size from A4 - A1. Each painting will be printed onto etching paper and finished adding oil, beeswax, Indian ink, varnish and fine sand.b) A triptych of two hearts together with differing coloring formations. These will also be printed onto etching paper and finished adding oil, beeswax, Indian ink, varnish and fine sand.c) A canvass (4.5ft x 3.5ft) containing thinly cut slivers of a complete pigs heart laid out onto the canvas in a very uniform manner and covered with a thin coat of varnish.Each painting will be limited to an edition of 25 each.Video Installation:2 X looping Hi-definition video projections -Film 1: We see a heart with a key protruding from itäó»s side. A hand winds the key. As we hear the sound of a clock ticking, we see the aorta begin to throb and the insides of the heart become illuminated. Ultimately the sound of the clock eventually slows down, the inner illumination of the heart fades, the pumping aorta slows until eventually everything stops.Film 2: A filmed Echocardiagram of my own heart will be looped into a kind of time-lapse movie. The audio and visual footage of my heartbeat will regulate and alternate intermittently so that the viewers own heart rate will be affected by my own heartbeat as it increases to an insane speed and then slows down to a gradual crawl and eventual stop.Some Important Things To Think About:Every year, more than 1 million Americans have a heart attack äóñ a sudden interruption in the heart's blood supply.Women don't always feel chest pain with a heart attack. Women are more likely than men to have heartburn, loss of appetite, tiredness or weakness, coughing, and heart flutters.Sudden cardiac death (SCD) accounts for half of all heart disease deaths in the U.S., but it's not the same as a heart attack. SCD occurs when the heart's electrical system goes haywire, causing it to beat irregularly and dangerously fast.Men have a higher risk of having a heart attack than women, and at an earlier age. But it's important to note that heart disease is the No. 1 killer of women, too.High cholesterol and high blood pressure are major risk factors for heart disease. Being overweight, obese, or physically inactive all increase your risk. So does diabetes, especially if your glucose levels are not well controlled.Each year in the U.S., more than 135,000 people die from smoking-related heart disease.It is possible to regain your health after a heart attack. By avoiding cigarettes, becoming more active, and watching what you eat, you can give your heart and overall health a big boost.The key to preventing heart disease is a healthy lifestyle. This includes a nutritious diet, at least 30 minutes of exercise most days of the week, not smoking, and controlling high blood pressure, cholesterol, and diabetes. If you drink alcohol, do so in moderation äóñ no more than one drink a day for women, two drinks a day for men.What you eat makes a difference. Be sure you get plenty of whole grains, vegetables, legumes, and fruits to help keep your heart healthy. Plant oils, walnuts, other nuts, and seeds can also help improve cholesterol levels. And don't forget to eat fish at least a couple of times each week for a good source of heart-healthy protein.

For February, the month of love, I presenting the local art community with a special three hour figure drawing session. I'm calling it "Bonds of Love" and for this session, the art models will pose nude while tied in shibari inspired rope bondage.Shibari (literally means "to tie" or "to bind) is the Japanese art of tying a subject that focuses on not only immobilizing them, but doing so in an elegant and beautiful fashion. This creates an intimate and erotic experience for both the subject and the person tying or rigger.I want to be able to bring this unique type of intimacy to the art community in the form of classical figure drawing. This exposes artists to the art of shibari, normally inaccessible, and to capture this artistry in sketches and paintings. Local artists will come together, connect, share, and create as two lovely models in elaborate rope ties pose just inches from their pads & pencils.Hiring a single art model can be quite expensive especially on a young artist's budget. And for this session, I have to pay two models, so each model has time to rest between poses. I also have to hire a professional to come tie the ropes. So I need some help, $300 worth of help to pay the artists involved. The support of your donations goes directly to the lovely models and the professional rigger that is driving down from LA to make this session possible.Thank you in advance for your support of my program, artists, and art models.Konstant <|3

I create lifesize kaji-style wall illustrations/scenery out of fabric, marrying folk art, pop art and environmental design into an interactive story whereas the visitor feels they have stepped into an alternate dimension; a very plush, yet sinister cartoon. For about two years now I have been, piece by piece, handstitching together a fabric world that I call "Broken Velcroe Land". It is essentially a lifesize interpretation of an unseen dimension of archons created by you and I through mantras we unknowingly repeat in our everyday lives. Because I am a songwriter as well as a scene-stress, I think about this much when I am writing. How often do we actually think about the effect words and verses we repeat aloud and their unseen effects on our lives and the world? The 20 inhabitants, or, archons, are cheeky incarnations of my own bad habits, such as "the cowardly rooster" the "bad idea bug" and the "melve of mess" (who has pictures of my messy house printed inside his cape and enjoys standing on top of lost keys in the morning when you are late for work).My goal right now is to complete the two remaining walls of four to complete the 4D environment of fabric backdrops, pillows and plushies for a March hanging and theatrical residency at a popular Los Angeles gallery / community performance space. I have 70% of the environment completed and need funds for fabric, time, and to pay some starving musicians to help me hand-stitch so that I may complete the scenery in time. Because all of the pieces belong to one set, they are not for sale and this will and always has been more or less be a grandois labor of love, so thank you very much for your interest and support!

These days it seems that there is bad news everywhere you turn. Oil spills, war, global warming, and the terrible economy are all enough to squish what little hope a person can have in a day. I've made it my personal mission to get the world to laugh in the face of bad news. For the past year I have been creating Doomsday Survival Kits that are customized to fit an individual or situation. Here are some examples:DIY Build Your Own Bunker! äóÂThis is a video that shows a person digging a hole that is six feet long by three feet wide and two feet deep. When the hole is dug the person is shown getting into a mylar body bag and lying down in the hole. Daisy's have been planted in the same plot of space.Doomsday Device! äóÂThe Doomsday Device is a small black plastic box with metal hinges. When the box is opened there is a toggle switch that reads "ON" and "ON" (no off option) that has been set in a plexiglass sheet. Under the plexiglass sheet there are red, black yellow and green wires running from the toggle switch to the back of the box.How do your pledges help? I have created many survival kits and would like to create more including the construction of a kiosk where these kits can all be sold. Not only will you get your own snarky kit, but you'll be helping to create a permanent space for the Doomsday Project!
